So for example, I’m going to have to erase something to explain that. So the claim is that the limit as x goes to x_0 of x x_0 is equal to 0. That’s what I’m claiming. Okay, does that answer your question? Okay. All right. Ask me other stuff after lecture.

Lec 3 | MIT 18.01 单变量微积分，2007 年秋季

Lec 3 | MIT 18.01 Single Variable Calculus, Fall 2007

16 年前 (2009 年 1 月 17 日) — 49:55 https://youtube.com/watch?v=kCPVBl953eY

16 years ago (Jan 17, 2009) — 49:55 https://youtube.com/watch?v=kCPVBl953eY

简介

Intro

以下内容根据 Creative Commons 许可提供。您的支持将帮助 MIT OpenCourseWare 继续免费提供高质量的教育资源。要捐款或查看数百门 MIT 课程的其他材料，请访问 MIT OpenCourseWare，网址为 ocw.mit.edu。教授：在今天的讲座中，我想开发更多公式，让我们实现区分一切的目标。

The following is provided under a Creative Commons License. Your support will help MIT OpenCourseWare continue to offer high quality educational resources for free. To make a donation or to view additional materials from hundreds of MIT courses, visit MIT OpenCourseWare at ocw.mit.edu. Professor: In today’s lecture I want to develop several more formulas that will allow us to reach our goal of differentiating everything.

公式

Formulas

这些是衍生公式，它们有两种形式。

So these are derivative formulas, and they come in two flavors.

第一种是具体的，也就是我们给出某个具体函数的导数。例如，x^n 或 (1/x) 就是我们在前几节课上讲过的。然后是一般公式，一般公式实际上不会给出某个具体函数的公式，而是告诉你一些事情，比如，如果你把两个函数相加，它们的导数就是导数之和。

The first kind is specific, so some specific function we’re giving the derivative of. And that would be, for example, x^n or (1/x) Those are the ones that we did a couple of lectures ago. And then there are general formulas, and the general ones don’t actually give you a formula for a specific function but tell you something like, if you take two functions and add them together, their derivative is the sum of the derivatives.

或者如果你乘以一个常数，例如 c 乘以 u，它的导数是 c 乘以 u'，其中 c 是常数。好的，所以这些公式非常有用，无论是具体的还是一般的。例如，对于多项式，我们需要两种类型的公式。

Or if you multiply by a constant, for example, so c times u, the derivative of that is c times u’ where c is constant. All right, so these kinds of formulas are very useful, both the specific and the general kind. For example, we need both kinds for polynomials.

更一般地，我们提供的任何一组公式都会为您提供一些初始函数，然后您将能够通过这些通用公式生成更多函数。

And more generally, pretty much any set of formulas that we give you, will give you a few functions to start out with and then you’ll be able to generate lots more by these general formulas.

三角函数

Trig Functions

所以今天，我们要集中讨论三角函数，所以我们会从一些具体的公式开始。这些公式是正弦函数和余弦函数的导数公式。

So today, we wanna concentrate on the trig functions, and so we’ll start out with some specific formulas. And they’re going to be the formulas for the derivative of the sine function and the cosine function.

这就是我们在讲座的第一部分要讲的内容，同时我希望你们能够习惯处理三角函数，尽管你们应该把这看作是一个循序渐进的过程。

So that’s what we’ll spend the first part of the lecture on, and at the same time I hope to get you very used to dealing with trig functions, although that’s something that you should think of as a gradual process.

正弦函数

Sine Function

好吧，为了计算这些，我将从这里开始计算。我们开始吧。让我们检查一下正弦函数会发生什么。

Alright, so in order to calculate these, I’m gonna start over here and just start the calculation. So here we go. Let’s check what happens with the sine function.

因此，我取 sin (x + delta x)，减去 sin x，然后除以 delta x。对，这就是差商，最终我必须在 delta x 趋于 0 时取极限。实际上，我们只能用一件事来简化或改变它，那就是使用正弦函数的求和公式。所以，就是这样。这就是 sin x cos delta x plus。

So, I take sin (x + delta x), I subtract sin x and I divide by delta x. Right, so this is the difference quotient and eventually I’m gonna have to take the limit as delta x goes to 0. And there’s really only one thing we can do with this to simplify or change it, and that is to use the sum formula for the sine function. So, that’s this. That’s sin x cos delta x plus.

哦，不是这个吗？好的，那它是什么？sin x sin delta x。好的，很好。加上余弦。不是吗？哦，好的。那它是什么？好的。好吧，我们来投票。它是正弦，正弦，还是正弦，余弦？观众：教授：好的，那它应该是余弦。好的，你最好记住这些公式，好吗？好的，结果是正弦，余弦。好的。余弦，正弦。

Oh, that’s not what it is? OK, so what is it? sin x sin delta x. OK, good. Plus cosine. No? Oh, OK. So which is it? OK. Alright, let’s take a vote. Is it sine, sine, or is it sine, cosine? Audience: Professor: OK, so is this going to be. cosine. All right, you better remember these formulas, alright? OK, turns out that it’s sine, cosine. All right. Cosine, sine.

所以，这里不需要做 x，而是 sin (delta x)。好了，现在这里有很多地方容易混淆，你需要确保自己做对了。好了，我们在这里把它们放在括号里。sin (a + b) 是 sin a cos b 加 cos a sin b。好了，这就是我在这里做的，除了字母 x 是 a，字母 b 是 delta x。

So here we go, no gotta do x here, sin (delta x). Alright, so now there’s lots of places to get confused here, and you’re gonna need to make sure you get it right. Alright, so we’re gonna put those in parentheses here. sin (a + b) is sin a cos b plus cos a sin b. All right, now that’s what I did over here, except the letter x was a, and the letter b was delta x.

现在这只是第一部分。这只是表达式的这一部分。我还得记住减 sin x。它位于末尾。减 sin x。然后，我必须记住分母，即 delta x。好吗？

Now that’s just the first part. That’s just this part of the expression. I still have to remember the minus sin x. That comes at the end. Minus sin x. And then, I have to remember the denominator, which is delta x. OK?

团体条款

Group Terms

好的，现在我们要做的下一件事是尝试对术语进行分组。

Alright, so now. The next thing we’re gonna do is we’re gonna try to group the terms.

所有这些论证的难点在于：当你将 delta x 设置为 0 时，任何棘手的极限基本上都是 0 / 0。如果我将 delta x 设置为 0，这就是 sin x sin x。所以它是一个 0 / 0 项。这里我们有各种为 0 的东西和各种非零的东西。

And the difficulty with all such arguments is the following one: any tricky limit is basically 0 / 0 when you set delta x equal to 0. If I set delta x equal to 0, this is sin x sin x. So it’s a 0 / 0 term. Here we have various things which are 0 and various things which are non zero.

我们必须对项进行分组，使 0 保持在 0 之上。否则，我们就没有希望了。如果我们得到一些 1 / 0 项，我们将得到一些毫无意义的极限。所以我认为这里正确的做法是注意，我只想指出这一点。

We must group the terms so that a 0 stays over a 0. Otherwise, we’re gonna have no hope. If we get some 1 / 0 term, we’ll get something meaningless in the limit. So I claim that the right thing to do here is to notice, and I’ll just point out this one thing.

当 delta x 趋近于 0 时，0 的余弦为 1。因此，除非我们在这里加入额外的正弦项，否则它不会抵消。因此，我将使用这个公因数，并合并这些项。因此，这实际上是您在这个特定计算中唯一需要检查的内容。因此，我们有 sin x 的公因数，它乘以将抵消的某个值，即 (cos delta x 1) / delta x。

When delta x goes to 0, this cosine of 0 is 1. So it doesn’t cancel unless we throw in this extra sine term here. So I’m going to use this common factor, and combine those terms. So this is really the only thing you’re gonna have to check in this particular calculation. So we have the common factor of sin x, and that multiplies something that will cancel, which is (cos delta x 1) / delta x.

这是第一项，现在剩下的就是 cos x 的因数，然后另一个因数是 (sin delta x) / (delta x)。好，现在有人记得上次这个数字是多少吗？有多少人说是 1？有多少人说是 0？好吧，是 0。这是我最喜欢的数字，好吗？0。这是最容易处理的数字。

That’s the first term, and now what’s left, well there’s a cos x that factors out, and then the other factor is (sin delta x) / (delta x). OK, now does anyone remember from last time what this thing goes to? How many people say 1? How many people say 0? All right, it’s 0. That’s my favorite number, alright? 0. It’s the easiest number to deal with.

所以这个趋向于 0，这就是 delta x 趋向于 0 时发生的情况。这个呢？这个趋向于 1，这是我第二喜欢的数字，几乎和 0 一样容易处理。选择这些数字是有原因的。它们是最容易处理的数字。所以总的来说，当 delta x 趋向于 0 时，这个数字会趋向于什么？我希望一个人来回答，一个勇敢的志愿者。好的，回到那里。

So this goes to 0, and that’s what happens as delta x tends to 0. How about this one? This one goes to 1, my second favorite number, almost as easy to deal with as 0. And these things are picked for a reason. They’re the simplest numbers to deal with. So altogether, this thing as delta x goes to 0 goes to what? I want a single person to answer, a brave volunteer. Alright, back there.

学生：余弦 教授：余弦，因为这个因数是 0。它抵消了，这个因数有一个 1，所以它是余弦。所以它是 cos x。所以我们的结论是，我会用橙​​色表示，正弦的导数是余弦。好的，现在我仍然想在这里标记这些非常重要的极限事实。我们将这个称为 A，我们将这个称为 B，因为我们还没有检查它们。

Student: Cosine Professor: Cosine, because this factor is 0. It cancels and this factor has a 1, so it’s cosine. So it’s cos x. So our conclusion over here and I’ll put it in orange is that the derivative of the sine is the cosine. OK, now I still wanna label these very important limit facts here. This one we’ll call A, and this one we’re going to call B, because we haven’t checked them yet.

我答应过你们我会这么做，这次我也必须这么做。所以我们依赖这些事情是真的。现在我要用余弦函数做同样的事情，但为了做到这一点，我必须记住余弦的求和规则。所以我们在这里要做几乎相同的计算。

I promised you I would do that, and I’ll have to do that this time. So we’re relying on those things being true. Now I’m gonna do the same thing with the cosine function, except in order to do it I’m gonna have to remember the sum rule for cosine. So we’re gonna do almost the same calculation here.

我们将会看到它是否可行，但现在你必须记住 cos (a + b) = cos，不，它不是 cosine^2，​​因为这里有两个不同的量。它是 cos a cos b sin a sin b。好的，所以你必须愿意现在就随意调用它们。现在让我们来计算余弦。这就是 cos (x + delta x) cos x 除以 delta x。

We’re gonna see that will work out, but now you have to remember that cos (a + b) = cos, no it’s not cosine^2, because there are two different quantities here. It’s cos a cos b sin a sin b. All right, so you’ll have to be willing to call those forth at will right now. So let’s do the cosine now. So that’s cos (x + delta x) cos x divided by delta x.

好的，这是余弦函数的差商。现在我要像以前一样做，只不过我要应用第二条规则，即余弦的求和规则。这将得到 cos x cos delta x sin x sin delta x。我必须再次记住减去余弦除以 delta x。

OK, there’s the difference quotient for the cosine function. And now I’m gonna do the same thing I did before except I’m going to apply the second rule, that is the sum rule for cosine. And that’s gonna give me cos x cos delta x sin x sin delta x. And I have to remember again to subtract the cosine divided by this delta x.

现在我要像以前一样重新组合，得到余弦乘以 (cos delta x 1) / delta x 的公因数。这里我得到了 sin x，但实际上它是 sin x。然后我得到了 (sin delta x) / delta x。好吗？唯一的区别是我在其中插入的这个减号。嗯，这不是唯一的区别，但却是一个关键的区别。

And now I’m going to regroup just the way I did before, and I get the common factor of cosine multiplying (cos delta x 1) / delta x. And here I get the sin x but actually it’s sin x. And then I have (sin delta x) / delta x. All right? The only difference is this minus sign which I stuck inside there. Well that’s not the only difference, but it’s a crucial difference.

好的，再次通过 A 我们得到当 delta x 趋向于 0 时，这是 0。这是 1。这些是我称之为 A 和 B 的属性。因此，当 delta x 趋向于 0 时，结果就是我们得到负 sin x。这就是因子。所以这个是负 sin x。我也会在这个周围放一个小框。

OK, again by A we get that this is 0 as delta x tends to 0. And this is 1. Those are the properties I called A and B. And so the result here as delta x tends to 0 is that we get negative sin x. That’s the factor. So this guy is negative sin x. I’ll put a little box around that too.

好吧，现在这些公式需要一点时间来适应，但在此之前，我将向你们解释 A 和 B 的证明。所以我们先从这一点开始。不过，在此之前，我想向你们展示 A 和 B 如何适用于这些定理的证明。所以，让我在这里做些评论。

Alright, now these formulas take a little bit of getting used to, but before I do that I’m gonna explain to you the proofs of A and B. So we’ll get ourselves started by mentioning that. Maybe before I do that though, I want to show you how A and B fit into the proofs of these theorems. So, let me just make some remarks here.

所以这只是一个注释，但它旨在帮助您理解这些证明是如何进行的。所以，首先，我想指出，如果您取 sin x 的变化率，那么让我们从余弦开始，因为它不太明显。

So this is just a remark but it’s meant to help you to frame how these proofs worked. So, first of all, I want to point out that if you take the rate of change of sin x, no let’s start with cosine because a little bit less obvious.

如果我取 cos x 的变化率，换句话说，这个导数在 x = 0 处，那么根据定义，当 delta x 趋向于 0 时，这是一个特定的极限。那么它是哪一个呢？好吧，我必须在 0 + delta x 处求余弦，但那只是 delta x。

If I take the rate of change of cos x, so in other words this derivative at x = 0, then by definition this is a certain limit as delta x goes to 0. So which one is it? Well I have to evaluate cosine at 0 + delta x, but that’s just delta x.

我必须在 0 处减去余弦。这是基点，但只有 1。然后我必须除以 delta x。瞧瞧，你会看到这正是我们那边的极限。这就是我们根据所谓的属性 A 知道为 0 的那个。

And I have to subtract cosine at 0. That’s the base point, but that’s just 1. And then I have to divide by delta x. And lo and behold you can see that this is exactly the limit that we had over there. This is the one that we know is 0 by what we call property A.

类似地，如果我在 x=0 处对 sin x 求导，那么当 delta x 趋近于 0 时，sin delta x / delta x 的极限就是这个。这是因为我应该减去 0 的正弦，但 0 的正弦是 0。对吧？所以根据我们的性质 B，这个极限就是 1。

And similarly, if I take the derivative of sin x at x=0, then that’s going to be the limit as delta x goes to 0 of sin delta x / delta x. And that’s because I should be subtracting sine of 0 but sine of 0 is 0. Right? So this is going to be 1 by our property B.

除此之外，我想说的是这两个证明的结构。即 x = 0 处的正弦和余弦的导数给出 d/dx sin x、d/dx cos x 的所有值。所以，这个论证实际上向我们展示了，我们只需要一个位置的一个变化率，然后我们就可以计算出其余的所有变化率。

And so the remark that I want to make, in addition to this, is something about the structure of these two proofs. Which is the derivatives of sine and cosine at x = 0 give all values of d/dx sin x, d/dx cos x. So that’s really what this argument is showing us, is that we just need one rate of change at one place and then we work out all the rest of them.

这就是这个证明的实质。当然，这实际上表明，它归结为显示这两种情况下的变化率是多少。所以现在有足够的悬念，我们想确保我们知道这些答案是正确的。

So that’s really the substance of this proof. That of course really then shows that it boils down to showing what this rate of change is in these two cases. So now there’s enough suspense that we want to make sure that we know that those answers are correct.

几何证明

Geometric Proof

好的，让我们来演示一下这两个。我将从 B 开始。我需要弄清楚属性 B。

OK, so let’s demonstrate both of them. I’ll start with B. I need to figure out property B.

现在，对于这种结果，我们只有一种证明方式，这是因为我们只有一种描述正弦和余弦函数的方式，那就是几何方式。所以我们必须给出几何证明。要写下几何证明，我们必须画出一幅图。

Now, we only have one alternative as to a type of proof that we can give of this kind of result, and that’s because we only have one way of describing sine and cosine functions, that is geometrically. So we have to give a geometric proof. And to write down a geometric proof we are going to have to draw a picture.

实际上，证明的第一步是将这个将变为 0 的变量 delta x 替换为另一个名称，这个名称暗示了我们要做什么，即表示角度的字母 theta。好的，让我们画一张图来说明我们要做什么。这是圆。这是原点。这是一个小角度，我会把它画大一点，这样它就清晰可见了。

And the first step in the proof, really, is to replace this variable delta x which is going to 0 with another name which is suggestive of what we’re gonna do which is the letter theta for an angle. OK, so let’s draw a picture of what it is that we’re going to do. Here is the circle. And here is the origin. And here’s some little angle, well I’ll draw it a little larger so it’s visible.

这是 theta，好吗？这是单位圆。我不会在这里写下来，但这是单位圆。现在 sin theta 是这里的垂直距离。也许，我会用不同的颜色画出来，这样我们就能看到它了。好的，这是这个距离。这个距离是 sin theta。好吗？

Here’s theta, alright? And this is the unit circle. I won’t write that down on here but that’s the unit circle. And now sin theta is this vertical distance here. Maybe, I’ll draw it in a different color so that we can see it all. OK so here’s this distance. This distance is sin theta. OK?

现在，为了解决这个问题，我们几乎还要在这幅图中写下来的唯一一件事就是，我们必须认识到，当角度为 theta 时，这也是以弧度为单位测量的圆的这部分的弧长。所以这里的这个长度也是弧长 theta。那一小块。所以也许我会用不同的颜色来表示它。

Now almost the only other thing we have to write down in this picture to have it work out is that we have to recognize that when theta is the angle, that’s also the arc length of this piece of the circle when measured in radians. So this length here is also arc length theta. That little piece in there. So maybe I’ll use a different color for that to indicate it.

那是橙色，那是那边的一小块。所以那是两块。现在为了让你相信极限就是它应该的样子，我要把这幅图稍微扩大一点。我要把它翻倍，只是为了我自己的语言，这样我就可以给你讲一个故事。好吧，这样你就能记住这一点了。

So that’s orange and that’s this little chunk there. So those are the two pieces. Now in order to persuade you now that the limit is what it’s supposed to be, I’m going to extend the picture just a little bit. I’m going to double it, just for my own linguistic sake and so that I can tell you a story. Alright, so that you’ll remember this.

所以我要在下面取一个 theta 角，在这里再复制一个 sin theta。现在整个画面就像是一张弓，弓弦在那里。好吗？所以这里的长度是 2 sin theta。所以我可能会这样写，2 sin theta。我刚刚把它翻倍了。下面是，哎呀，我把它弄反了。很抱歉。

So I’m going to take a theta angle below and I’ll have another copy of sin theta down here. And now the total picture is really like a bow and its bow string there. Alright? So what we have here is a length of 2 sin theta. So maybe I’ll write it this way, 2 sin theta. I just doubled it. And here I have underneath, whoops, I got it backwards. Sorry about that.

试着用彩色粉笔画得更漂亮，我在这里把它倒过来了。所以这不是 2 sin theta。2 sin theta 是垂直线。那是绿色。让我们再试一次。这是 2 sin theta，好吗？然后在分母中我有弧长，即 theta 是前半部分，所以将其翻倍就是 2 theta。好吗？

Trying to be fancy with the colored chalk and I have it reversed here. So this is not 2 sin theta. 2 sin theta is the vertical. That’s the green. So let’s try that again. This is 2 sin theta, alright? And then in the denominator I have the arc length which is theta is the first half and so double it is 2 theta. Alright?

如果你愿意的话，这是弓，上面是弓弦。当然，我们可以取消 2。这等于 sin theta / theta。那么现在为什么当 theta 趋向于 0 时，它会趋向于 1？嗯，这是因为当角度 theta 变得非常小的时候，这个弯曲的部分看起来越来越像直线。好吗？

So if you like, this is the bow and up here we have the bow string. And of course we can cancel the 2’s. That’s equal to sin theta / theta. And so now why does this tend to 1 as theta goes to 0? Well, it’s because as the angle theta gets very small, this curved piece looks more and more like a straight one. Alright?

如果你离得非常近，绿色部分和橙色部分就会合并。它们实际上会重叠在一起。它们的长度越来越接近。这就是为什么这是正确的。我想我会这样表达：短曲线几乎是直的。好吧，这就是我们使用的原理。或者，如果你愿意的话，短曲线几乎是直的。

And if you get very, very close here the green segment and the orange segment would just merge. They would be practically on top of each other. And they have closer and closer and closer to the same length. So that’s why this is true. I guess I’ll articulate that by saying that short curves are nearly straight. Alright, so that’s the principle that we’re using. Or short pieces of curves, if you like, are nearly straight.

如果你愿意，这就是原理。所以曲线很短。好吗？现在我还需要给你一个 A 的证明。这与这里的余弦函数有关。这是属性 A。所以我要通过翻转它来做到这一点，因为事实证明这个分子是一个负数。如果我想将其解释为长度，我会想要一个正量。

So if you like, this is the principle. So short pieces of curves. Alright? So now I also need to give you a proof of A. And that has to do with this cosine function here. This is the property A. So I’m going to do this by flipping it around, because it turns out that this numerator is a negative number. If I want to interpret it as a length, I’m gonna want a positive quantity.

所以我要在这里写下 1 乘以 theta，然后我要在那里除以 theta。我又要做出某种解释。这次我要画出同样的弓箭排列，但也许我会稍微夸张一点。所以这是扇形的顶点，但我们可能会把它画得更长一点。好吧，这就是它，这是中间的线，它是单位。哎呀。

So I’m gonna write down 1 cos theta here and then I’m gonna divide by theta there. Again I’m gonna make some kind of interpretation. Now this time I’m going to draw the same sort of bow and arrow arrangement, but maybe I’ll exaggerate it a little bit. So here’s the vertex of the sector, but we’ll maybe make it a little longer. Alright, so here it is, and here was that middle line which was the unit. Whoops.

好的，我想我得把它向上倾斜。好的，让我们从这里开始尝试。好吧，你知道在你的铅笔和纸上它会比在我的黑板上看起来更好。好的，我们就是这样。这是这个形状。现在这个角度应该是 theta，这个角度是另一个 theta。所以这里我们有一个长度，它又是 theta，另一个长度，它是这里的 theta。

OK, I think I’m going to have to tilt it up. OK, let’s try from here. Alright, well you know on your pencil and paper it will look better than it does on my blackboard. OK, so here we are. Here’s this shape. Now this angle is supposed to be theta and this angle is another theta. So here we have a length which is again theta and another length which is theta over here.

这和另一张图片一样，只是我们在这里稍微夸张了一点。现在我们有了一条垂直线，我再次用绿色画出它，即弓弦。但请注意，随着顶点越来越远，曲线越来越接近垂直线。这有点像放大原理的反面。放大时曲线几乎是直线的原理。

That’s the same as in the other picture, except we’ve exaggerated a bit here. And now we have this vertical line, which again I’m gonna draw in green, the bow string. But notice that as the vertex gets farther and farther away, the curved line gets closer and closer to being a vertical line. That’s sort of the flip side, by expansion, of the zoom in principle. The principle that curves are nearly straight when you zoom in.

如果缩小，就意味着将这个顶点发送到很远很远的地方。曲线，圆的一部分，变得越来越直。现在让我告诉你这个分子 1 cos theta 在这张图片上的位置。那么它在哪里？嗯，整个距离是 1。但从顶点到绿色的距离是 theta 的余弦。

If you zoom out that would mean sending this vertex way, way out somewhere. The curved line, the piece of the circle, gets more and more straight. And now let me show you where this numerator 1 cos theta is on this picture. So where is it? Well, this whole distance is 1. But the distance from the vertex to the green is cosine of theta.

没错，因为这是 theta，所以沿着垂线向下移动这段距离回到原点就是 cos theta。所以这里这个很小的、很小的线段基本上就是曲线和垂直线段之间的间隙。所以这个间隙等于 1 cos theta。所以现在你可以看到，随着这个点越来越远，如果把它送到 Stata Center，你几乎无法分辨出区别。

Right, because this is theta, so dropping down the perpendicular this distance back to the origin is cos theta. So this little tiny, bitty segment here is basically the gap between the curve and the vertical segment. So the gap is equal to 1 cos theta. So now you can see that as this point gets farther away, if this got sent off to the Stata Center, you would hardly be able to tell the difference.

弓弦会与弓重合，弓弦与弓之间的小间隙会趋向于 0。这就是当 θ 趋向于 0 时 θ 趋向于 0 的说法。这是它的缩放版本。是的，问题在这里。学生：分母不也趋向于 0 吗？教授：啊，问题是“分母不也趋向于 0 吗？”答案是肯定的。

The bow string would coincide with the bow and this little gap between the bow string and the bow would be tending to 0. And that’s the statement that this tends to 0 as theta tends to 0. The scaled version of that. Yeah, question down here. Student: Doesn’t the denominator also tend to 0 though? Professor: Ah, the question is “doesn’t the denominator also tend to 0?” And the answer is yes.

在我与放大的奇怪类比中，我所做的就是缩小图片。换句话说，如果你想象你正在拍摄这张照片，然后把它放在显微镜下，你正在观察某个东西，其中的θ越来越小。好吗？但现在因为我想要我的图片，我扩大了我的图片。所以比例是保留下来的东西。

In my strange analogy with zooming in, what I did was I zoomed out the picture. So in other words, if you imagine you’re taking this and you’re putting it under a microscope over here and you’re looking at something where theta is getting smaller and smaller and smaller and smaller. Alright? But now because I want my picture, I expanded my picture. So the ratio is the thing that’s preserved.

所以如果我让这个间隙很小。让我再说一遍。恐怕我把事情弄复杂了。如果我只是让这个θ趋向于0，那将与让它越来越接近然后垂直线会接近的效果相同。但我想继续放大图片，这样我就能看到垂直线和曲线之间的差异。

So if I make it so that this gap is tiny. Let me say this one more time. I’m afraid I’ve made life complicated for myself. If I simply let this theta tend in to 0, that would be the same effect as making this closer and closer in and then the vertical would approach. But I want to keep on blowing up the picture so that I can see the difference between the vertical and the curve.

这很像您在视频屏幕上放大、放大、放大、再放大。那么问题是那会是什么样子？这与将该点向左方向越来越远地发送的效果相同。

So that’s very much like if you are on a video screen and you zoom in, zoom in, zoom in, and zoom in. So the question is what would that look like? That has the same effect as sending this point out farther and farther in that direction, to the left.

因此，我只是试图通过让 theta 保持在这个比例来为您形象化，但实际上当我这样做时，图片的比例会发生变化。因此，theta 会变为 0，但我重新缩放它，以便我们可以看到它的大小，然后想象它发生了什么。好的，这回答了你的问题吗？

And so I’m just trying to visualize it for you by leaving the theta at this scale, but actually the scale of the picture is then changing when I do that. So theta is going to 0, but I’m rescaling so that it’s of a size that we can look at it, And then imagine what’s happening to it. OK, does that answer your question?

学生：那么我的问题是，这似乎证明了极限等于 0/0。教授：这证明的不仅仅是它等于 0/0。它是这个短的东西与这个长的东西的比率。而这个比这个总长度要短得多。你说得完全正确，我们在比较两个趋向于 0 的量，但其中一个比另一个小得多。

Student: My question then is that seems to prove that limit is equal to 0/0. Professor: It proves more than it is equal to 0/0. It’s the ratio of this little short thing to this longer thing. And this is getting much, much shorter than this total length. You’re absolutely right that we’re comparing two quantities which are going to 0, but one of them is much smaller than the other.

在另一种情况下，我们比较了两个都趋于 0 的量，它们的长度最终都大致相等。这里前一个是这个绿色的。这里是这个很小的一点，比 2 西塔距离短得多。是的，另一个问题。学生：cos theta 1 除以 cos theta 等于 1 cos theta 除以 theta？教授：cos theta 1 除以。

In the other case we compared two quantities which were both going to 0 and they both end up being about equal in length. Here the previous one was this green one. Here it’s this little tiny bit here and it’s way shorter than the 2 theta distance. Yeah, another question. Student: cos theta 1 over cos theta is the same as 1 cos theta over theta? Professor: cos theta 1 over.

学生：教授：所以这里，我写的是 (cos delta x 1) / delta x，好的，我声称它趋于 0。这里，我写的是减去那个，也就是说我用 theta 替换了 delta x。但后来我写了这个。所以 (cos theta 1) 减 1 是这个的负数。好吗？如果我显示这个趋于 0，则与显示另一个趋于 0 相同。另一个问题？

Student: Professor: So here, what I wrote is (cos delta x 1) / delta x, OK, and I claimed that it goes to 0. Here, I wrote minus that, that is I replaced delta x by theta. But then I wrote this thing. So (cos theta 1) minus 1 is the negative of this. Alright? And if I show that this goes to 0, it’s the same as showing the other one goes to 0. Another question?

学生： 教授：那么问题是，弧长这个概念是怎么回事呢？弧长这个词，那个橙色的形状就是一个弧。我们只是在谈论弧的长度，所以我们称它为弧长。这就是弧长这个词的意思，它只是表示弧的长度。 学生： 教授：为什么这个长度是 theta？

Student: Professor: So the question is, what about this business about arc length. So the word arc length, that orange shape is an arc. And we’re just talking about the length of that arc, and so we’re calling it arc length. That’s what the word arc length means, it just means the length of the arc. Student: Professor: Why is this length theta?

啊，好吧，这是非常重要的一点，事实上，这也是我想说的下一点。也就是说，请注意，在这个计算中，我们使用长度非常重要。这意味着我们测量 theta 的方式是所谓的弧度。对，所以这适用于 B 和 A，它是 A 中的尺度变化，并不重要，但在 B 中它非常重要。

Ah, OK so this is a very important point, and in fact it’s the very next point that I wanted to make. Namely, notice that in this calculation it was very important that we used length. And that means that the way that we’re measuring theta, is in what are known as radians. Right, so that applies to both B and A, it’s a scale change in A and doesn’t really matter but in B it’s very important.

橙色长度与绿色长度、垂直线与弧线的唯一可比性在于，我们用相同的长度概念来测量它们。例如，如果我们用度来测量它们，那就完全错了。我们将角度分为 360 度，这是错误的测量单位。正确的测量是沿单位圆的长度，也就是弧度。

The only way that this orange length is comparable to this green length, the vertical is comparable to the arc, is if we measure them in terms of the same notion of length. If we measure them in degrees, for example, it would be completely wrong. We divide up the angles into 360 degrees, and that’s the wrong unit of measure. The correct measure is the length along the unit circle, which is what radians are.

所以这只有在使用弧度时才成立。所以再次提醒一下，这是以弧度表示的。现在这里的 x 是以弧度表示的。如果使用其他单位，公式就是错误的。是吗？学生：教授：好的，那么第二个问题是为什么这里的长度是 1。原因是上图和下图之间的关系，是我画了一个不同的形状。

And so this is only true if we use radians. So again, a little warning here, that this is in radians. Now here x is in radians. The formulas are just wrong if you use other units. Ah yeah? Student: Professor: OK so the second question is why is this crazy length here 1. And the reason is that the relationship between this picture up here and this picture down here, is that I’m drawing a different shape.

也就是说，我在这里真正想象的是小得多的 theta。好吗？然后我按比例放大它。所以下面这幅图的比例与上面那幅图的比例非常不同。如果角度非常非常小，那么它必须非常非常长才能完成圆。换句话说，这个长度是 1，因为这是我坚持的。

Namely, what I’m really imagining here is a much, much smaller theta. OK? And then I’m blowing that up in scale. So this scale of this picture down here is very different from the scale of the picture up there. And if the angle is very, very, very small then one has to be very, very long in order for me to finish the circle. So, in other words, this length is 1 because that’s what I’m insisting on.

所以，我声称这就是我定义这个圆的方式，半径为单位。还有问题吗？学生：1 cos theta 和 theta 之间的比率将越来越接近 1。我不明白教授：好的，所以问题是很难在这里形象化这个事实。所以让我带你完成几个步骤，因为我认为其他人可能也对这种形象化感到困惑。

So, I’m claiming that’s how I define this circle, to be of unit radius. Another question? Student: the ratio between 1 cos theta and theta will get closer and closer to 1. I don’t understand Professor: OK, so the question is it’s hard to visualize this fact here. So let me, let me take you through a couple of steps, because I think probably other people are also having trouble with this visualization.

我将尝试在上面这张图片上演示可视化的第一部分。可视化的第一部分是，我应该想象鸟喙闭合，变得越来越窄。换句话说，角度 theta 必须越来越小。好的，这是第一步。这就是我们正在讨论的过程。

The first part of the visualization I’m gonna try to demonstrate on this picture up here. The first part of the visualization is that I should think of a beak of a bird closing down, getting narrower and narrower. So in other words, the angle theta has to be getting smaller and smaller and smaller. OK, that’s the first step. So that’s the process that we’re talking about.

现在，为了画出这个，一旦 θ 变得非常狭窄，为了描绘它，我必须把整个画面放大才能看到它。否则它就会消失。事实上，在极限 θ = 0 时，它是没有意义的。它只是一条直线。这就是这些棘手极限的全部问题。它们在零零水平上毫无意义。

Now, in order to draw that, once theta gets incredibly narrow, in order to depict that I have to blow the whole picture back up in order be able to see it. Otherwise it just disappears on me. In fact in the limit theta = 0, it’s meaningless. It’s just a flat line. That’s the whole problem with these tricky limits. They’re meaningless right at the zero zero level.

距离它们只有一点点距离，它们才真正有用，你才能从中获得有用的几何信息。所以我们只差一点点。这就是下面 A 部分的图片所代表的意思。它应该是 theta 开了一条小裂缝，只有一点点。

It’s only just a little away that they’re actually useful, that you get useful geometric information out of them. So we’re just a little away. So that’s what this picture down below in part A is meant to be. It’s supposed to be that theta is open a tiny crack, just a little bit.

为了便于您直观地看到，我在黑板上画的最小尺寸是使用整个黑板的长度。因此，我打开了一点点，当我们到达黑板的另一端时，它当然已经相当宽了。但是这个角度 θ 是一个非常小的角度。好吗？所以我试着想象当它倒塌时会发生什么。

And the smallest I can draw it on the board for you to visualize it is using the whole length of the blackboard here for that. So I’ve opened a little tiny bit and by the time we get to the other end of the blackboard, of course it’s fairly wide. But this angle theta is a very small angle. Alright? So I’m trying to imagine what happens as this collapses.

现在，当我想象时，我必须想象这个量的分子和分母的几何解释。看看会发生什么。现在我声称分子是这里的这个小点，分母实际上是这里整个长度的一半。但是当你看到某个东西是否趋向于 0 时，2 这个因子并不重要。好吗？

Now, when I imagine that I have to imagine a geometric interpretation of both the numerator and the denominator of this quantity here. And just see what happens. Now I claimed the numerator is this little tiny bit over here and the denominator is actually half of this whole length here. But the factor of 2 doesn’t matter when you’re seeing whether something tends to 0 or not. Alright?

我说的是，如果你仔细观察，就会发现它比那条垂直曲线短得多。我说的是，所以你必须想象一下，当它变​​得越来越小，它是否会产生同样的效果，即这个东西越来越远，而垂直曲线越来越靠近果岭。

And I claimed that if you stare at this, it’s clear that this is much shorter than that vertical curve there. And I’m claiming, so this is what you have to imagine, is this as it gets smaller and smaller and smaller still that has the same effect of this thing going way, way, farther away and this vertical curve getting closer and closer and closer to the green.

这样它们之间的差距就变得很小，最后趋于 0。对吧？所以它不仅趋于 0，这对我们来说还不够，而且它趋于 0 的速度也比这个 theta 趋于 0 的速度要快。我希望这里的证据非常有力，因为在这个阶段它已经很小了。好吧。我们将继续前进，你必须在其他时间思考这些事情。

And so that the gap between them gets tiny and goes to 0. Alright? So not only does it go to 0, that’s not enough for us, but it also goes to 0 faster than this theta goes to 0. And I hope the evidence is pretty strong here because it’s so tiny already at this stage. Alright. We are going to move forward and you’ll have to ponder these things some other time.

所以现在我要给你们一个更难想象的东西，所以做好准备。好的，现在，我想做的下一件事是给你们第二个证明。因为我认为，更彻底地理解这个特定的事实，以及对正弦和余弦进行大量的练习，真的很重要。所以我要给你们一个正弦公式的几何证明，也就是正弦的导数。

So I’m gonna give you an even harder thing to visualize now so be prepared. OK, so now, the next thing that I’d like to do is to give you a second proof. Because it really is important, I think, to understand this particular fact more thoroughly and also to get a lot of practice with sines and cosines. So I’m gonna give you a geometric proof of the formula for sine here, for the derivative of sine.

好了，我们开始吧。这是这个事实的几何证明。这适用于所有 theta。到目前为止，我们只对 theta = 0 进行了证明，现在我们要对所有 theta 进行证明。所以这是一个不同的证明，但它使用完全相同的原理。对吧？

So here we go. This is a geometric proof of this fact. This is for all theta. So far we only did it for theta = 0 and now we’re going to do it for all theta. So this is a different proof, but it uses exactly the same principles. Right?

所以，我想通过绘制另一幅图来做到这一点，这幅图将描述 y，即 sin theta，如果你喜欢某些圆周运动的垂直位置。所以我想象有东西在绕着圆圈转。一些粒子在绕着圆圈转。所以这是圆，这是原点。这是单位距离。现在它恰好在这个位置 P。

So, I want do this by drawing another picture, and the picture is going to describe y, which is sin theta, which is if you like the vertical position of some circular motion. So I’m imagining that something is going around in a circle. Some particle is going around in a circle. And so here’s the circle, here the origin. This is the unit distance. And right now it happens to be at this location P.

也许我们可以把 P 放在这里一点。这是角度 theta。现在我们要移动它。我们要改变 theta，我们对 y 的变化率感兴趣。所以 y 是 P 的高度，但我们要把它移到另一个位置。我们会沿着圆将它移动到 Q。对吧？所以它在这里。这就是问题所在。那么我们把它移动了多远？

Maybe we’ll put P a little over here. And here’s the angle theta. And now we’re going to move it. We’re going to vary theta and we’re interested in the rate of change of y. So y is the height of P but we’re gonna move it to another location. We’ll move it along the circle to Q. Right? So here it is. Here’s the thing. So how far did we move it?

我们将其移动了一个角度 delta theta。因此我们开始移动 theta，在这个参数中 theta 将固定，我们将移动一点点 delta theta。现在我们要试着算出物体移动了多远。为了做到这一点，我们必须跟踪这里的高度，即垂直位移。因此我们要在这里画出这个直角，这是位置 R。

Well we moved it by an angle delta theta. So we started theta, theta is going to be fixed in this argument, and we’re going to move a little bit delta theta. And now we’re just gonna try to figure out how far the thing moved. Well, in order to do that we’ve got to keep track of the height, the vertical displacement here. So we’re going to draw this right angle here, this is the position R.

然后这里的距离就是 y 的变化。对吧？所以这幅图就是我们有一个围绕单位圆移动的东西。一个围绕单位圆移动的点。它从 P 开始，移动到 Q。它从角度 theta 移动到角度 theta 加上 delta theta。问题是 y 移动了多少？y 的公式是 sin theta。所以这告诉我们 sin theta 的变化率。

And then this distance here is the change in y. Alright? So the picture is we have something moving around a unit circle. A point moving around a unit circle. It starts at P, it moves to Q. It moves from angle theta to angle theta plus delta theta. And the issue is how much does y move? And the formula for y is sin theta. So that’s telling us the rate of change of sin theta.

好吧，让我们试着想一想这是什么。首先，我已经说过了，现在我要重复一遍。Delta y 是 PR。它从 P 开始，一直到 R。这就是 y 移动的距离。这就是 y 的变化。这就是我在右上角说的。哎呀。我说的是 PR，但我写的是 PQ。好吧，这不是一个好主意。

Alright, well so let’s just try to think a little bit about what this is. So, first of all, I’ve already said this and I’m going to repeat it here. Delta y is PR. It’s going from P and going straight up to R. That’s how far y moves. That’s the change in y That’s what I said up in the right hand corner there. Oops. I said PR but I wrote PQ. Alright, that’s not a good idea.

好的。所以 delta Y 是 PR。现在我想再画一次图。所以这是 Q，这是 R，这是 P，这是我的三角形。现在我想做的是在这里画一条曲线，它是圆弧的一部分。但实际上我想记住的是，我在所有这些其他论点中也做过同样的事情。

Alright. So delta Y is PR. And now I want to draw the diagram again one time. So here’s Q, here’s R, and here’s P, and here’s my triangle. And now what I’d like to do is draw this curve here which is a piece of the arc of the circle. But really what I want to keep in mind is something that I did also in all these other arguments.

也就是说，也许我应该把它称为橙色，我会想到它之间的直线。所以它是我们一直感兴趣的曲线的直线近似。所以直线要简单得多，因为我们这里只有一个三角形。事实上它是一个直角三角形。对，所以我们有一个直角三角形的几何形状，现在我们可以用它来进行所有的计算。

Which is, maybe I should have called this orange, that I’m gonna think of the straight line between. So it’s the straight line approximation to the curve that we’re always interested in. So the straight line is much simpler, because then we just have a triangle here. And in fact it’s a right triangle. Right, so we have the geometry of a right triangle which is going to now let us do all of our calculations.

好的，现在关键的一步是我们已经使用过的相同原理，即短曲线几乎是直线。这意味着从 P 到 Q 的这段圆弧实际上与从 P 到 Q 的直线段相同。所以，这就是这个原理，好吧，让我们在这里说一下，PQ 实际上与从 P 到 Q 的直线段相同。

OK, so now the key step is this same principle that we already used which is that short pieces of curves are nearly straight. So that means that this piece of the circular arc here from P to Q is practically the same as the straight segment from P to Q. So, that’s this principle that well, let’s put it over here Is that PQ is practically the same as the straight segment from P to Q.

那么我们要如何使用它呢？我们想用以下方式定量地使用它。我们要注意的是，从 P 到 Q 的距离大约是 delta theta。对吗？因为沿着该曲线的弧长，曲线的长度是 delta theta。所以绿色的长度，也就是 PQ，几乎是 delta theta。所以这基本上就是 delta theta，这里的距离。

So how are we going to use that? We want to use that quantitatively in the following way. What we want to notice is that the distance from P to Q is approximately delta theta. Right? Because the arc length along that curve, the length of the curve is delta theta. So the length of the green which is PQ is almost delta theta. So this is essentially delta theta, this distance here.

现在第二步，有点棘手，我们必须算出这个角度是多少。所以我们的目标，我将把它放在下一个步骤，因为我将把几何推理放在中间，我需要算出 QPR 的角度是多少。

Now the second step, which is a little trickier, is that we have to work out what this angle is. So our goal, and I’m gonna put it one step below because I’m gonna put the geometric reasoning in between, is I need to figure out what the angle QPR is.

如果我能算出这个角度是多少，那么我就能算出这个垂直距离是多少，因为我知道斜边，也知道角度，所以我就能算出三角形的边是多少。现在让我告诉你为什么这是可能的。为了做到这一点，首先我要交换木板，并向你展示线 PQ 的位置。

If I can figure out what this angle is, then I’ll be able to figure out what this vertical distance is because I’ll know the hypotenuse and I’ll know the angle so I’ll be able to figure out what the side of the triangle is. So now let me show you why that’s possible to do. So in order to do that first of all I’m gonna trade the boards and show you where the line PQ is.

所以线 PQ 就在这里。这就是全部。关于这条线，我需要你们意识到的关键点是它实际上垂直于，几乎垂直于这条射线。对吧？它不完全垂直，因为 P 到 Q 之间的距离不为零。所以它不完全垂直，但在极限情况下它将垂直。完全垂直。圆的切线。

So the line PQ is here. That’s the whole thing. And the key point about this line that I need you to realize is that it’s practically perpendicular, it’s almost perpendicular, to this ray here. Alright? It’s not quite because the distance between P to Q is non zero. So it isn’t quite, but in the limit it’s going to be perpendicular. Exactly perpendicular. The tangent line to the circle.

因此，我要使用的关键点是 PQ 几乎垂直于 OP。好吗？从原点发出的射线基本上垂直于那条绿线。然后，我要使用的第二点是显而易见的，即 PR 是垂直的。好吗？因此，这是我需要看到的两个几何图形。现在请注意右上角图片上发生的事情。

So the key thing that I’m going to use is that PQ is almost perpendicular to OP. Alright? The ray from the origin is basically perpendicular to that green line. And then the second thing I’m going to use is something that’s obvious which is that PR is vertical. OK? So those are the two pieces of geometry that I need to see. And now notice what’s happening upstairs on the picture here in the upper right.

我所知道的角θ是水平线和OP之间的夹角。这就是角θ。如果我把它旋转90度，水平线就变成垂直线。它变成PR，而另一个旋转90度的东西就变成绿线。所以我所说的角度是把这个东西旋转90度得到的。它是相同的角度。所以这意味着这个角度本质上就是θ。

What I have is the angle theta is the angle between the horizontal and OP. That’s angle theta. If I rotate it by ninety degree, the horizontal becomes vertical. It becomes PR and the other thing rotated by 90 degrees becomes the green line. So the angle that I’m talking about I get by taking this guy and rotating it by 90 degrees. It’s the same angle. So that means that this angle here is essentially theta.

这就是这个角度。让我再重复一遍。我们从一个像这样的角度开始，它是水平线。这是水平方向上的原点。这是标为 1 的东西。那是那里的距离。那是我的右臂，在下面。我的左臂指向上方，从原点指向点 P。所以这是水平线，它们之间的角度是 theta。

That’s what this angle is. Let me repeat that one more time. We started out with an angle that looks like this, which is the horizontal. that’s the origin straight out horizontally. That’s the thing labeled 1. That distance there. That’s my right arm which is down here. My left arm is pointing up and it’s going from the origin to the point P. So here’s the horizontal and the angle between them is theta.

现在，我要说的是，如果我像这样向上旋转 90 度，不做任何改变，水平线就会变成垂直线。这就是 PR。这是向上的，PR。如果我将 OP 旋转 90 度，那就是 PQ。好吗？让我在这里画一次。让我们在这里用一些箭头来画。

And now, what I claim is that if I rotate by 90 degrees up, like this, without changing anything so that was what I did the horizontal will become a vertical. That’s PR. That’s going up, PR. And if I rotate OP 90 degrees, that’s exactly PQ. OK? So let me draw it on there one time. Let’s do it with some arrows here.

所以我从这个开始，然后我们将其标记为橙色，好的，红色变成橙色，然后我旋转 90 度，红色从 P 开始变成这个，橙色旋转 90 度变成这个。好吗？所以这个角度与我刚刚绘制的另一个角度相同。角度的顶点不同。好吗？好吧，我并没有说所有论点都应该很容易。

So I started out with this and then, we’ll label this as orange, OK so red to orange, and then I rotate by 90 degrees and the red becomes this starting from P and the orange rotates around 90 degrees and becomes this thing here. Alright? So this angle here is the same as the other one which I’ve just drawn. Different vertices for the angles. OK? Well I didn’t say that all arguments were supposed to be easy.

好吧，所以我断言结论是这个角度近似为 theta。现在我们可以完成计算了，因为我们有斜边是 delta theta 而角度是 theta，所以这里的这个线段 PR 近似为斜边长度乘以角度的余弦。这正是我们想要的。如果我们除以 delta theta，我们得到 (delta y) / (delta theta) 近似为 cos theta。

Alright, so I claim that the conclusion is that this angle is approximately theta. And now we can finish our calculation, because we have something with the hypotenuse being delta theta and the angle being theta and so this segment here PR is approximately the hypotenuse length times the cosine of the angle. And that is exactly what we wanted. If we divide, we divide by delta theta, we get (delta y) / (delta theta) is approximately cos theta.

这与 是一样的。因此，我们在极限中想要的是，(delta y) / (delta theta) 趋近于 0 的 delta theta 等于 cos theta。因此，我们得到了一个可以想象的近似值，并且在极限中，公式是精确的。

And that’s the same thing as. So what we want in the limit is exactly the delta theta going to 0 of (delta y) / (delta theta) is equal to cos theta. So we get an approximation on a scale that we can visualize and in the limit the formula is exact.

一般规则

General Rules

好的，所以这是相同结果的几何论证。即正弦的导数是余弦。是吗？

OK, so that is a geometric argument for the same result. Namely that the derivative of sine is cosine. Yeah?

学生：教授：有时你需要做一些几何证明。你真正需要的时候可能是在 18.02。所以你需要像这样推理。例如，这是你实际发展弧长理论的方式。处理 delta x 和 delta y 是一种常用工具。好吧，我今天还有一件事想谈，那就是一些一般规则。

Student: Professor: You will have to do some kind of geometric proofs sometimes. When you’ll really need this is probably in 18.02. So you’ll need to make reasoning like this. This is, for example, the way that you actually develop the theory of arc length. Dealing with delta x’s and delta y’s is a common tool. Alright, I have one more thing that I want to talk about today, which is some general rules.

我们花了比我预期更多的时间。所以我要做的就是告诉你们规则，我们将在几天后讨论它们。所以让我告诉你们一般规则。这些是具体规则，这里是一些一般规则。第一个规则称为乘积规则。

We took a little bit more time than I expected with this. So what I’m gonna do is just tell you the rules and we’ll discuss them in a few days. So let me tell you the general rules. So these were the specific ones and here are some general ones. So the first one is called the product rule.

它的意思是，如果你取两个函数的乘积并微分，你会得到一个函数的导数乘以另一个函数的导数，再加上另一个函数乘以一个函数的导数。现在你应该记住这一点，我进行证明的方式是，你应该认为你每次改变一个。

And what it says is that if you take the product of two functions and differentiate them, you get the derivative of one times the other plus the other times the derivative of the one. Now the way that you should remember this, and the way that I’ll carry out the proof, is that you should think of it is you change one at a time.

当事物依赖于多个函数时，这是一种非常有用的思考微分的方法。所以这是一个通用程序。我想提到的第二个公式称为商法则，它说明了以下内容。(u / v) 素数也有一个公式。公式是 (u'v uv' ) / v^2。所以这是我们的第二个公式。

And this is a very useful way of thinking about differentiation when you have things which depend on more than one function. So this is a general procedure. The second formula that I wanted to mention is called the quotient rule and that says the following. That (u / v) prime has a formula as well. And the formula is (u’v uv’ ) / v^2. So this is our second formula.

我只想说，这两个公式都极其有用，你会一直用到它们。当然，这个公式只有在 v 不为 0 时才有效。好吧，因为时间不够了，我们今天就不证明这些了，但我们下次再证明，你肯定会对这些证明负责。

Let me just mention, both of them are extremely valuable and you’ll use them all the time. This one of course only works when v is not 0. Alright, so because we’re out of time we’re not gonna prove these today but we’ll prove these next time and you’re definitely going to be responsible for these kinds of proofs.

Lec 4 | MIT 18.01 单变量微积分，2007 年秋季

Lec 4 | MIT 18.01 Single Variable Calculus, Fall 2007

16 years ago (Jan 17, 2009) — 46:03 https://youtube.com/watch?v=4sTKcvYMNxk

简介

Intro

以下内容根据 Creative Commons 许可提供。您的支持将帮助 MIT OpenCourseWare 继续免费提供高质量的教育资源。要捐款或查看数百门 MIT 课程的其他材料，请访问 MIT OpenCourseWare，网址为 ocw.mit.edu。教授：我是 Haynes Miller，今天我代替 David Jerison 上课。所以今天你有一位代课老师。

The following content is provided under a Creative Commons license. Your support will help MIT OpenCourseWare continue to offer high quality educational resources for free. To make a donation, or to view additional materials from hundreds of MIT courses visit MIT OpenCourseWare at ocw.mit.edu. Professor: I am Haynes Miller, I am substituting for David Jerison today. So you have a substitute teacher today.

我没有和你一起上过这门课，所以我不太清楚你现在的情况。我想你刚刚谈到了微分，你举了一些微分的例子，比如这些基本的例子：x^n 的导数是 nx^(n 1)。但我想你最近可能也花了一些时间计算正弦函数的导数。我认为你也有一些扩展这些计算的规则。

So I haven’t been here in this class with you so I’m not completely sure where you are. I think you’ve just been talking about differentiation and you’ve got some examples of differentiation like these basic examples: the derivative of x^n is nx^(n 1). But I think maybe you’ve spent some time computing the derivative of the sine function as well, recently. And I think you have some rules for extending these calculations as well.

例如，我想你知道，如果你对一个常数乘以一个函数进行微分，你会得到什么？学生：教授：。常数像这样出来。或者我可以写 (cu)' = cu'。这是乘以常数的规则，我想你也知道如何对和进行微分。或者我可以把它写成 (u + v)' = u' + v'。

For instance, I think you know that if you differentiate a constant times a function, what do you get? Student: Professor:. The constant comes outside like this. Or I could write (cu)’ = cu’. That’s this rule, multiplying by a constant, and I think you also know about differentiating a sum. Or I could write this as (u + v)’ = u’ + v’.

所以我会用到这些，但今天我将讨论其他一些规则，关于如何处理函数乘积、函数商，以及最重要的函数组合。最后，我将谈谈高阶导数。这就是今天的故事。这就是程序。

So I’m going to be using those but today I’ll talk about a collection of other rules about how to deal with a product of functions, a quotient of functions, and, best of all, composition of functions. And then at the end, I’ll have something to say about higher derivatives. So that’s the story for today. That’s the program.

产品规则

Product Rule

因此我们首先来讨论一下乘积规则。

So let’s begin by talking about the product rule.

因此，乘积规则告诉您如何区分函数的乘积，首先，我给您规则。规则是 u'v + uv'。这有点搞笑。区分乘积会得到一个和。但让我们看看它在特定示例中如何运作。例如，假设我想区分乘积。好吧，我们刚刚讨论的这两个基本示例的乘积。

So the product rule tells you how to differentiate a product of functions, and I’ll just give you the rule, first of all. The rule is it’s u’v + uv’. It’s a little bit funny. Differentiating a product gives you a sum. But let’s see how that works out in a particular example. For example, suppose that I wanted to differentiate the product. Well, the product of these two basic examples that we just talked about.

我将在两种情况下使用相同的变量，而不是像这里一样使用不同的变量。因此，x^n 乘以 sin x 的导数。所以这是一个新事物。如果不使用乘积规则，我们就无法做到这一点。因此，第一个函数是 x^n，第二个函数是 sin x。我们将应用此规则。因此，u 是 x^n。根据规则，u' 是 nx^(n 1)。

I’m going to use the same variable in both cases instead of different ones like I did here. So the derivative of x^n times sin x. So this is a new thing. We couldn’t do this without using the product rule. So the first function is x^n and the second one is sin x. And we’re going to apply this rule. So u is x^n. u’ is, according to the rule, nx^(n 1).

然后我取 v，并按原样写下来，即 x 的正弦。然后我以另一种方式进行。我取 u，即 x^n，并将其乘以 v 的导数 v'。我们刚刚看到 v' 是 x 的余弦。就是这样。显然，您可以通过一次执行一次来区分更长的乘积，更多事物的乘积。让我们看看为什么这是正确的。

And then I take v and write it down the way it is, sine of x. And then I do it the other way. I take u the way it is, that’s x^n, and multiply it by the derivative of v, v’. We just saw v’ is cosine of x. So that’s it. Obviously, you can differentiate longer products, products of more things by doing it one at a time. Let’s see why this is true.

我想试着向你展示乘积规则为什么成立。所以你有一个标准的方法来理解这一点，它涉及查看你感兴趣的微分函数的变化。所以我应该看看当 x 发生一点变化时乘积 uv 的变化有多大。那么，如何计算变化呢？

I want to try to show you why the product rule holds. So you have a standard way of trying to understand this, and it involves looking at the change in the function that you’re interested in differentiating. So I should look at how much the product uv changes when x changes a little bit. Well, so how do compute the change?

好吧，我把函数在某个新的 x 值 x + delta x 处的值写下来。好吧，我最好把函数的整个新值写下来，函数是 uv。所以整个新值看起来是这样的。它是 u(x + delta x) 乘以 v(x + delta x)。这就是新值。但乘积有什么变化呢？好吧，我最好减去旧值，即 u(x) v(x)。

Well, I write down the value of the function at some new value of x, x + delta x. Well, I better write down the whole new value of the function, and the function is uv. So the whole new value looks like this. It’s u(x + delta x) times v(x + delta x). That’s the new value. But what’s the change in the product? Well, I better subtract off what the old value was, which is u(x) v(x).

好的，根据我们要证明的规则，我必须让 u 参与进来。所以我想只让 u 的变化参与进来。我们来试试吧。我看到了 u 变化的部分公式。让我们看看我们能否将其余部分放到位。因此，x 的变化是 (u(x + delta x) u(x)。

Okay, according to the rule we’re trying to prove, I have to get u’ involved. So I want to involve the change in u alone, by itself. Let’s just try that. I see part of the formula for the change in u right there. Let’s see if we can get the rest of it in place. So the change in x is (u(x + delta x) u(x).

这就是 x 的变化。这部分发生在这里，乘以 v(x + delta x)，所以我们也把它放进去。现在这个等式符号不太好。到目前为止，我已经得到了这个乘积，但我引入了一些我不喜欢的东西。我引入了 u 乘以 v(x delta x)，对吧？减去它。所以接下来我要做的是通过添加 u(x) v(x + delta x) 来纠正这个小缺陷。

That’s the change in x This part of it occurs up here, multiplied by v(x + delta x), so let’s put that in too. Now this equality sign isn’t very good right now. I’ve got this product here so far, but I’ve introduced something I don’t like. I’ve introduced u times v(x delta x), right? Minus that. So the next thing I’m gonna do is correct that little defect by adding in u(x) v(x + delta x).

好的，现在我取消了这条线上的错误。但我还没有完全解决，因为我还没有把它放进去。所以我最好减去 uv，然后我就回家了。但我要用一种聪明的方式来做，因为我注意到这里已经有 au 了。所以我要取 u 的这个因子，并使它与这个因子相同。

Okay, now I cancelled off what was wrong with this line. But I’m still not quite there, because I haven’t put this in yet. So I better subtract off uv, and then I’ll be home. But I’m going to do that in a clever way, because I noticed that I already have a u here. So I’m gonna take this factor of u and make it the same as this factor.

所以我得到了 u(x) 乘以这个，减去 u(x) 乘以那个。这和 u 乘以差值是一样的。这有点奇怪，但当你退后一步看它时，你会看到乘以中间项，然后取消。你得到了正确的答案。我喜欢这个，因为它涉及 u 的变化和 v 的变化。

So I get u(x) times this, minus u(x) times that. That’s the same thing as u times the difference. So that was a little bit strange, but when you stand back and look at it, you can see multiplied out, the middle terms cancel. And you get the right answer. Well I like that because it’s involved the change in u and the change in v.

所以这等于 delta u 乘以 v(x + delta x) 减去 u(x) 乘以 v 的变化。好了，我快到了。计算导数的下一步是取差商，然后除以 delta x。所以，(delta (uv)) / (delta x) 就是，我会说 (delta u / delta x) 乘以 v(x + delta x)。我在这里犯了错误吗？

So this is equal to delta u times v(x + delta x) minus u(x) times the change in v. Well, I’m almost there. The next step in computing the derivative is take difference quotient, divide this by delta x. So, (delta (uv)) / (delta x) is well, I’ll say (delta u / delta x) times v(x + delta x). Have I made a mistake here?

这个加号在下降的过程中神奇地变成了减号，所以我最好把它修好。加上 u 乘以 (delta v) / (delta x)。这个 u 就是这里的 u。所以我只需用 delta x 除以这个公式，现在我可以取 x 趋于 0 时的极限，所以这就是 delta x 趋于 0 时的极限。这成为导数的定义，在这边，我得到了 du/dx 乘以。

This plus magically became a minus on the way down here, so I better fix that. Plus u times (delta v) / (delta x). This u is this u over here. So I’ve just divided this formula by delta x, and now I can take the limit as x goes to 0, so this is as delta x goes to 0. This becomes the definition of the derivative, and on this side, I get du/dx times.

那么当 delta x 趋于 0 时，这个量会发生什么变化？所以这个量越来越接近 x。那么 v 的值会发生什么变化？它变为等于 x 除以 v。这利用了 v 的连续性。因此，v(x + delta x) 通过连续性趋于 v(x)。因此，这给了我乘以 v，然后我得到了 u 乘以，delta v / delta x 给了我 dv/dx。这就是公式。

Now what happens to this quantity when delta x goes to 0? So this quantity is getting closer and closer to x. So what happens to the value of v? It becomes equal to x of v. That uses continuity of v. So, v(x + delta x) goes to v(x) by continuity. So this gives me times v, and then I have u times, and delta v / delta x gives me dv/dx. And that’s the formula.

这就是我一开始在这里写下的公式。乘积的导数由这个和给出。是吗？学生：你是怎么从这个长方程的第一行得到第二行的？教授：从这里到这里？学生：是的。教授：所以也许最简单的方法是反向推导并验证我在这里写下的内容是否正确。所以，如果你看，那里有 au 乘以 v(x + delta x)。

That’s the formula as I wrote it down at the beginning over here. The derivative of a product is given by this sum. Yeah? Student: How did you get from the first line to the second of the long equation? Professor: From here to here? Student: Yes. Professor: So maybe it’s easiest to work backwards and verify that what I wrote down is correct here. So, if you look there’s a u times v(x + delta x) there.

这里也有一个。它们以相反的符号出现。所以它们相互抵消。剩下的是 u(x + delta x) v(x + delta x) uv。这就是我开始时的那个。学生：它们相互抵消了，对吧？教授：我把这一项和这一项相消了，剩下的就是两端。还有其他问题吗？

And there’s also one here. And they occur with opposite signs. So they cancel. What’s left is u(x + delta x) v(x + delta x) uv. And that’s just what I started with. Student: They cancel right? Professor: I cancelled out this term and this term, and what’s left is the ends. Any other questions?

学生：教授：好吧，我刚刚计算了 delta uv 是多少，现在我要用 delta x 除以它来计算导数。所以我抄下了右边的公式，并用 delta x 除以它。我决定用 delta u 除以 delta x，用 delta v 除以 delta x。很好。还有其他吗？所以我们这里有乘积规则。区分两个函数乘积的规则。

Student: Professor: Well, I just calculated what delta uv is, and now I’m gonna divide that by delta x on my way to computing the derivative. And so I copied down the right hand side and divided delta x. I just decided to divide the delta u by delta x and delta v by delta x. Good. Anything else? So we have the product rule here. The rule for differentiating a product of two functions.

这让我们变得更强大。现在你可以找到更多函数的导数。商呢？让我们找出如何区分两个函数的商。好吧，我会再次写下答案，然后我们会尝试验证它。所以有一个商。让我把它写下来。有两个函数的商。这是它的规则。

This is making us stronger. There are many more functions you can find derivatives of now. How about quotients? Let’s find out how to differentiate a quotient of two functions. Well again, I’ll write down what the answer is and then we’ll try to verify it. So there’s a quotient. Let me write this down. There’s a quotient of two functions. And here’s the rule for it.

我总是不得不思考这个问题，并希望自己能做对。(u'v uv') / v^2。这可能是你在这门课程中看到的最疯狂的规则，但事实就是如此。我会试着向你展示为什么这是正确的，并看一个例子。是的，有一只手？学生：教授：哪些字母看起来一样？u 和 v 看起来一样？我会试着让它们看起来更不一样。v 的底部有点。

I always have to think about this and hope that I get it right. (u’v uv’) / v^2. This may be the craziest rule you’ll see in this course, but there it is. And I’ll try to show you why that’s true and see an example. Yeah there was a hand? Student: Professor: What letters look the same? u and v look the same? I’ll try to make them look more different. The v’s have points on the bottom.

U 的底部有一些圆形的东西。u 的新值是多少？在 x + delta x 时，u 的值是 u + delta u，对吗？这就是 delta u。它是当 x 被 delta x 替换时 u 的变化，而 v 的变化，即新值 v，是 v + delta v。所以这是 u 的新值除以 v 的新值。这就是开始。

U’s have little round things on the bottom. What’s the new value of u? The value of u at x + delta x is u + delta u, right? That’s what delta u is. It’s the change in u when x gets replaced by delta x And the change in v, the new value v, is v + delta v. So this is the new value of u divided by the new value of v. That’s the beginning.

然后我减去旧值，也就是 u 减 v。这样写出来会更容易计算。现在，我们交叉相乘，正如我所说。所以我得到 uv + (delta u)v 减，现在我这样交叉相乘，得到 uv u(delta v)。然后我将所有这些除以 (v + delta v)u。

And then I subtract off the old values, which are u minus v. This’ll be easier to work out when I write it out this way. So now, we’ll cross multiply, as I said. So I get uv + (delta u)v minus, now I cross multiply this way, you get uv u(delta v). And I divide all this by (v + delta v)u.

好的，现在我喜欢这样做的原因是您会看到这里发生了取消。uv 和 uv 发生两次，所以我可以取消它们。我会的，我马上会回答这些问题。观众：教授：哦，那是 v。好的。很好，还有其他吗？这就是所有人的回答。很好。

Okay, now the reason I like to do it this way is that you see the cancellation happening here. uv and uv occur twice and so I can cancel them. And I will, and I’ll answer these questions in a minute. Audience: Professor: Ooh, that’s a v. All right. Good, anything else? That’s what all hands were. Good.

好的，我把这些相消掉，剩下的就是 delta u 乘以 v 减去 u 乘以 delta v，然后除以 v + delta v 乘以 v。好的，这就是差值。这就是商的变化。这个函数的变化由这个公式给出。现在要计算导数，我要除以 delta x，然后取极限。

All right, so I cancel these and what I’m left with then is delta u times v minus u times delta v and all this is over v + delta v times v. Okay, there’s the difference. There’s the change in the quotient. The change in this function is given by this formula. And now to compute the derivative, I want to divide by delta x, and take the limit.

让我们把它写下来，delta(u/v)/delta x 就是这个公式除以 delta x。再次，我要把 delta x 放在 delta u 和 delta v 之下。好吗？我要把 delta x 放在分母中，但我可以把它看作是除以这个因子和这个因子。所以这是 (delta u/ delta x)vu(delta v/delta x)。

So let’s write that down, delta(u/v)/delta x is this formula here divided by delta x. And again, I’m going to put the delta x under these delta u and delta v. Okay? I’m gonna put delta x in the denominator, but I can think of that as dividing into this factor and this factor. So this is (delta u/ delta x)v u(delta v/delta x).

商法则

Quotient Rule

所有这些都除以同一个分母，(v + delta v)v。对吗？

And all that is divided by the same denominator, (v + delta v)v. Right?

把 delta x 放在分子上。接下来，当 delta x 趋近于 0 时取极限。根据定义，我得到了 (u/v) 的导数。在右边，嗯，这是导数 du/dx 对吧？乘以 v。看，然后乘以 u，这里是导数 dv/dx。那么分母呢？所以当 delta x 趋近于 0 时，v 保持不变，v 保持不变。

Put the delta x up in the numerator there. Next up, take the limit as delta x goes to 0. I get, by definition, the derivative of (u/v). And on the right hand side, well, this is the derivative du/dx right? Times v. See and then u times, and here it’s the derivative dv/dx. Now what about the denominator? So when delta x goes to 0, v stays the same, v stays the same.

这个 delta v 会发生什么？它再次趋向于 0，因为 v 是连续的。因此，delta v 再次趋向于 0 和 delta x，因为它们是连续的，所以你得到的只是 v 乘以 v。我想这就是我写下的公式。(du/dx)vu(dv/dx)。然后全部除以旧分母的平方。好了，就是这样。这就是商法则。奇怪的公式。让我们看一个应用。让我们看一个例子。

What happens to this delta v? It goes to 0, again, because v is continuous. So again, delta v goes to 0 with delta x because they’re continuous and you just get v times v. I think that’s the formula I wrote down over there. (du/dx)v u(dv/dx). And all divided by the square of the old denominator. Well, that’s it. That’s the quotient rule. Weird formula. Let’s see an application. Let’s see an example.

例子

Example

我要举的例子很简单。我将分子设为 1。所以我将取 u = 1。现在我要微分 1 / v，即函数的倒数；1 除以函数。这是我的规则的副本。在这种情况下，du / dx 是多少？u 是一个常数，所以在这个规则中该项为 0。我不必担心这个。我得到一个负数。

So the example I’m going to give is pretty simple. I’m going to take the numerator to be just 1. So I’m gonna take u = 1. So now I’m differentiating 1 / v, the reciprocal of a function; 1 over a function. Here’s a copy of my rule. What’s du/ dx in that case? u is a constant, so that term is 0 in this rule. I don’t have to worry about this. I get a minus.

然后 u 是 1，dv/dx。好吧，v 就是 v 本身。我将 dv/dx 写为 v'。然后我在分母中得到 av^2。这就是规则。我可以将其写为 v^( 2) v'。减去 v' 除以 v^2。这是 1 / v 的导数。那举个例子怎么样？我将再次以 u = 1 为例。v 是 x 的幂。

And then u is 1, and dv/dx. Well, v is whatever v is. I’ll write dv/dx as v’. And then I get a v^2 in the denominator. So that’s the rule. I could write it as v^( 2) v’. Minus v’ divided by v^2. That’s the derivative of 1 / v. How about sub example of that? I’m going to take the special case where u = 1 again. And v is a power of x.

我将使用我们之前开发的关于 x^n 导数的规则。那么我在这里会得到什么？d/dx (1/x^n) 是，我将 v = x^n 代入此公式。因此我得到负数，v^2。如果 v = x^n，则根据指数规则，v^2 是 x^(2n)。然后 v' 是 x^n 的导数，即 nx^(n 1)。好的，让我们将它们放在一起。这里有几个 x 的幂。我可以将它们放在一起。

And I’m gonna use the rule that we developed earlier about the derivative of x^n. So what do I get here? d/dx (1/x^n) is, I’m plugging into this formula here with v = x^n. So I get minus, v^ 2. If v = x^n, v^ 2 is, by the rule of exponents, x^( 2n). And then v’ is the derivative of x^n, which is nx^(n 1). Okay, so let’s put these together. There’s several powers of x here. I can put them together.

我得到 nx 的 2n + n 1。其中一个 n 被取消。剩下的就是 n 1。所以我们计算了 1 / x^n 的导数，我也可以将其写为 x^ n，对吧？所以我计算了 x 的负幂的导数。这是我得到的公式。如果你将这个 n 视为一个单位，视为一个自有的东西，它就会出现在指数中。

I get n x to the 2n + n 1. One of these n’s cancels. And what I’m left with is n 1. So we’ve computed the derivative of 1 / x^n, which I could also write as x^ n, right? So I’ve computed the derivative of negative powers of x. And this is the formula that I get. If you think of this n as a unit, as a thing to itself, it occurs here in the exponent.

它出现在这里，也出现在这里。那么，这与上面的公式相比如何？x 幂的导数是该幂乘以 x 的幂减一。这与我在此处写下的规则完全相同。但这里的幂恰好是负数，而相同的负数以系数的形式出现，并出现在指数中。是吗？

It occurs here, and it occurs here. So how does that compare with the formula that we had up here? The derivative of a power of x is that power times x to one less than that power. That’s exactly the same as the rule that I wrote down here. But the power here happens to be a negative number, and the same negative number shows up as a coefficient and there in the exponent. Yeah?

学生：教授：我是怎么做到的？ 学生：教授：x^(2n) 从哪里来的？所以我应用了这个规则。所以商法则中的分母是 v^2。而 v 是 x^n，所以分母是 x^(2n)。我决定把它写成 x^(2n)。所以那里有绿色注释。他们说的是，我可以扩大这个规则。这个完全相同的规则适用于 n 的负值，也适用于 n 的正值。 

Student: Professor: How did I do this? Student: Professor: Where did that x^( 2n) come from? So I’m applying this rule. So the denominator in the quotient rule is v^2. And v was x^n, so the denominator is x^(2n). And I decided to write it as x^( 2n). So the green comments there. What they say is that I can enlarge this rule. This exact same rule is true for negative values of n, as well as positive values of n. 

因此，在您可以应用的规则列表中，导数值有一些新东西。该标准规则对负指数和正指数都适用。这是商法则的结果。

So there’s something new in your list of rules that you can apply, of values of the derivative. That standard rule is true for negative as well as positive exponents. And that comes out of a quotient rule.

构图规则

Composition Rule

好的，我们已经讲完了两条规则。我讲了乘法规则和商法规则。接下来呢？我们来看看链式法则。这是一条组合规则。

Okay, so we’ve done two rules. I’ve talked about the product rule and the quotient rule. What’s next? Let’s see the chain rule. So this is a composition rule.

所以我想到的函数组合是关于代换的。所以我想到的函数类型是，例如，y = (sin t)^10。这是一个新函数。我想，我们以前还没有见过如何区分它。这种三角函数的幂经常发生。我敢肯定，你也已经见过它们了。人们使用了一个小小的符号转换。他们会写成 sin^10(t)。

So the kind of thing that I have in mind, composition of functions is about substitution. So the kind of function that I have in mind is, for instance, y = (sin t)^10. That’s a new one. We haven’t seen how to differentiate that before, I think. This kind of power of a trig function happens very often. You’ve seen them happen, as well, I’m sure, already. And there’s a little notational switch that people use. They’ll write sin^10(t).

但请记住，当你写 sin^10(t) 时，你的意思是取 t 的正弦，然后取其 10 次方。这就是 sin^10(t) 的含义。因此，处理这种函数组合的方法是使用新的变量名。我的意思是，我可以想到这个 (sin t)^10。我可以将其视为一个两步过程。首先，我计算 t 的正弦。

But remember that when you write sin^10(t), what you mean is take the sine of t, and then take the 10th power of that. It’s the meaning of sin^10(t). So the method of dealing with this kind of composition of functions is to use new variable names. What I mean is, I can think of this (sin t)^10. I can think of it as a two step process. First of all, I compute the sine of t.

我们将结果称为 x。这是新变量的名称。然后，我用 x 来表示 y。所以 y 表示取这个并将其提升到十次方。换句话说，y = x^10。然后你将 x = sin(t) 代入其中，你就会得到 y 关于 t 的公式。

And let’s call the result x. There’s the new variable name. And then, I express y in terms of x. So y says take this and raise it to the tenth power. In other words, y = x^10. And then you plug x = sin(t) into that, and you get the formula for what y is in terms of t.

因此，在方便的时候引入新字母是一种很好的做法，而这是一个非常方便的地方。

So it’s good practice to introduce new letters when they’re convenient, and this is one place where it’s very convenient.

链式法则

Chain Rule

那么让我们找到一个区分组合的规则，一个可以通过执行一个函数然后应用另一个函数来表达的函数。这就是规则。好吧，也许我会先推导出这个规则，然后你会看到它是什么。事实上，这个规则推导起来非常简单。

So let’s find a rule for differentiating a composition, a function that can be expressed by doing one function and then applying another function. And here’s the rule. Well, maybe I’ll actually derive this rule first, and then you’ll see what it is. In fact, the rule is very simple to derive.

所以这首先是一个证明，然后我们再写下规则。我对 delta y / delta t 感兴趣。y 是 x 的函数。x 是 t 的函数。我对 y 如何相对于 t 变化、相对于原始变量 t 变化感兴趣。好吧，由于这个中间变量，我可以将其写为 (delta y / delta x) (delta x / delta t)。它取消了，对吧？delta x 取消了。

So this is a proof first, and then we’ll write down the rule. I’m interested in delta y / delta t. y is a function of x. x is a function of t. And I’m interested in how y changes with respect to t, with respect to the original variable t. Well, because of that intermediate variable, I can write this as (delta y / delta x) (delta x / delta t). It cancels, right? The delta x cancels.

该直接变量的变化会抵消。这只是基本的代数。但是当我让 delta t 变小时会发生什么？这给了我 dy/dt。在右边，我得到 (dy/dx) (dx/dt)。所以学生会经常记住这个规则。这是规则，说你可以抵消 dx。这与事实相差不大。这是一个很好的思考方式。

The change in that immediate variable cancels out. This is just basic algebra. But what happens when I let delta t get small? Well this give me dy/dt. On the right hand side, I get (dy/dx) (dx/dt). So students will often remember this rule. This is the rule, by saying that you can cancel out for the dx’s. And that’s not so far from the truth. That’s a good way to think of it.

换句话说，这就是所谓的链式法则。它说复合函数的微分是一种乘积。它只是两个导数的乘积。这就是你如何区分两个函数的复合函数。我们来举个例子。让我们来做这个例子。让我们看看结果如何。那么让我们来区分一下，我说的是什么？(sin t)^10。好的，有一个内部函数和一个外部函数。

In other words, this is the so called chain rule. And it says that differentiation of a composition is a product. It’s just the product of the two derivatives. So that’s how you differentiate a composite of two functions. And let’s just do an example. Let’s do this example. Let’s see how that comes out. So let’s differentiate, what did I say? (sin t)^10. Okay, there’s an inside function and an outside function.

内部函数是 x 作为 t 的函数。这是内部函数，这是外部函数。因此规则是，首先让我们对外部函数求导。取 dy/dx。对变量 x 求导。外部函数是 10 次方。它的导数是多少？所以我得到 10x^9。在这个帐户中，我使用这个新引入的名为 x 的变量。

The inside function is x as a function of t. This is the inside function, and this is the outside function. So the rule says, first of all let’s differentiate the outside function. Take dy/dx. Differentiate it with respect to that variable x. The outside function is the 10th power. What’s its derivative? So I get 10x^9. In this account, I’m using this newly introduced variable named x.

因此，外部函数的导数是 10x^9。然后这是内部函数，接下来我要做的就是对其进行微分。那么 dx/dt，d/dt (sin t)，sine t 的导数是多少？好吧，这是 cosine t。这就是链式法则给出的结果。这是正确的，但由于我们在这里引入了这个符号 x，所以原始问题中没有给出它。

So the derivative of the outside function is 10x^9. And then here’s the inside function, and the next thing I want to do is differentiate it. So what’s dx/dt, d/dt (sin t), the derivative of sine t? All right, that’s cosine t. That’s what the chain rule gives you. This is correct, but since we were the ones to introduce this notation x here, that wasn’t given to us in the original problem here.

这个过程的最后一步应该是代入 x 相对于 t 的值。所以 x = sin t。这告诉我我得到了 10(sin(t))^9，也就是 x^9 乘以 cos(t)。或者同样的事情是 sin^9​​(t)cos(t)。所以这是链式法则的一个应用。你知道，人们经常想知道链式法则这个名字从何而来。我自己也在想这个问题。

The last step in this process should be to put back, to substitute back in what x is in terms of t. So x = sin t. So that tells me that I get 10(sin(t))^9, that’s x^9, times the cos(t). Or the same thing is sin^9(t)cos(t). So there’s an application of the chain rule. You know, people often wonder where the name chain rule comes from. I was just wondering about that myself.

那么，是因为它把你束缚住了吗？它就像一道铁链篱笆吗？我决定了它是什么。这是因为通过使用它，你可以打破微分链，你可以用它来区分更多的函数。所以当你想思考链式法则时，就想想那条链子。它让你自由地冲破束缚。让我给你另一个链式法则的应用。准备好了吗？

So is it because it chains you down? Is it like a chain fence? I decided what it is. It’s because by using it, you burst the chains of differentiation, and you can differentiate many more functions using it. So when you want to think of the chain rule, just think of that chain there. It lets you burst free. Let me give you another application of the chain rule. Ready for this one?

所以我想对 sin(10t) 求导。同样，这是两个函数的复合函数。内部函数是什么？好的，我想我会介绍这个新符号。x = 10t，外部函数是正弦函数。所以 y = sin x。所以现在链式法则表明 dy/dt 是。好的，让我们看看。我取外部函数的导数，它是什么？正弦素数，我们可以代入，因为我们知道正弦素数是什么。

So I’d like to differentiate the sin(10t). Again, this is the composite of two functions. What’s the inside function? Okay, so I think I’ll introduce this new notation. x = 10t, and the outside function is the sine. So y = sin x. So now the chain rule says dy/dt is. Okay, let’s see. I take the derivative of the outside function, and what’s that? Sine prime and we can substitute because we know what sine prime is.

因此，我得到了 x 的余弦，然后乘以多少？现在我对内部函数求导，它就是 10。因此，我可以将其写为 10cos 什么？10t，x 就是 10t。现在，一旦你习惯了这个中间变量，你就不必给它命名了。你只需在脑海中思考它，而不必真正写下来，d/dt (sin(10t))。

So I get cosine of whatever, x, and then times what? Now I differentiate the inside function, which is just 10. So I could write this as 10cos of what? 10t, x is 10t. Now, once you get used to this, this middle variable, you don’t have to give a name for it. You can just to think about it in your mind without actually writing it down, d/dt (sin(10t)).

我将再次进行此操作，而无需明确引入这个中间变量。想一想。我首先对外部函数进行微分，得到余弦。但我不会改变代入其中的东西。我代入的仍然是 x。x 是 10t。因此，我们只需写 10t，而不必担心该额外变量的名称。如果它让您感到困惑，请引入新变量。并像这样小心而缓慢地进行。

I’ll just do it again without introducing this middle variable explicitly. Think about it. I first of all differentiate the outside function, and I get cosine. But I don’t change the thing that I’m plugging into it. It’s still x that I’m plugging into it. x is 10t. So let’s just write 10t and not worry about the name of that extra variable. If it confuses you, introduce the new variable. And do it carefully and slowly like this.

但是，我想你很快就能记住这个步骤了。我还没说完。我还没有对内部函数，即 10t = 10 的导数进行微分。所以，你还是会得到相同的结果。这是一条你会习惯的小捷径。真的，一旦你掌握了链式法则，世界就任你征服。它让你处于非常非常强大的地位。

But, quite quickly, I think you’ll get to be able to keep that step in your mind. I’m not quite done yet. I haven’t differentiated the inside function, the derivative of 10t = 10. So you get, again, the same result. A little shortcut that you’ll get used to. Really and truly, once you have the chain rule, the world is yours to conquer. It puts you in a very, very powerful position.

高阶导数

Higher Derivatives

好的，让我们看看。

Okay, well let’s see.

今天我讲了什么？我讲了乘法法则、商法则、合成。我还应该告诉你一些关于高阶导数的知识。那就让我们开始吧。这是一个简单的故事。高阶是一个奇怪的词。它只是意味着一遍又一遍地求导。好吧，让我们看看。如果我们有一个函数 u 或 u(x)，请允许我将其简要地写成 u。嗯，这是一种符号。

What have I covered today? I’ve talked about product rule, quotient rule, composition. I should tell you something about higher derivatives, as well. So let’s do that. This is a simple story. Higher is kind of a strange word. It just means differentiate over and over again. All right, so let’s see. If we have a function u or u(x), please allow me to just write it as briefly as u. Well, this is a sort of notational thing.

我可以对它求导并得到 u'。这是一个新函数。就像如果你从正弦开始，它就会变成余弦。一个新函数，所以我可以再次对它求导。而对它再次求导的符号是 u prime。所以 u'' 只是 u' 再次求导。例如，如果 u 是 x 的正弦，那么 u' 就是 x 的余弦。杰里森教授有没有讲过余弦的导数是什么？

I can differentiate it and get u’. That’s a new function. Like if you started with the sine, that’s gonna be the cosine. A new function, so I can differentiate it again. And the notation for the differentiating of it again, is u prime. So u’’ is just u’ differentiated again. For example, if u is the sine of x, so u’ is the cosine of x. Has Professor Jerison talked about what the derivative of cosine is?

它是什么？哈，好吧，u'' 是 sin x。让我继续说。你认为 u''' 是什么意思？我猜它是 u'' 的导数。它被称为三阶导数。u'' 被称为二阶导数。它是 u'' 的再导数。那么，要计算这个例子中的 u'''，我该怎么做？我再次对其进行导数。有一个常数项 1，常数因子。结果出来了。正弦的导数是什么？

What is it? Ha, okay so u’’ is sin x. Let me go on. What do you suppose u’’’ means? I guess it’s the derivative of u’‘. It’s called the third derivative. And u’’ is called the second derivative. And it’s u’’ differentiated again. So to compute u’’’ in this example, what do I do? I differentiate that again. There’s a constant term, 1, constant factor. That comes out. The derivative of sine is what?

好的，所以 u''' = cos x。我们再来一遍。现在过一会儿，你会厌倦写这些东西。所以也许我会使用符号 u^(4)。这是四阶导数。这是 u''''。或者它是 (u''') 再次微分，四阶导数。在这个例子中它是什么？好的，余弦的导数减去正弦，就像你告诉我的那样。那个减号用那个符号取消，总之，我得到了 sin x。

Okay, so u’’’ = cos x. Let’s do it again. Now after a while, you get tired of writing these things. And so maybe I’ll use the notation u^(4). That’s the fourth derivative. That’s u’’’‘. Or it’s (u’’’) differentiated again, the fourth derivative. And what is that in this example? Okay, the cosine has derivative minus the sine, like you told me. And that minus sign cancels with that sign, and all together, I get sin x.

这很奇怪。当我对 x 函数的正弦进行四次微分时，我又回到了 x 的正弦。就是这样的。现在这个符号，素数，以及诸如此类的东西。该符号有不同的变体。例如，这是另一种符号。好吧，你之前使用过 du/dx 符号。u' 也可以表示为 du/dx。我想我们今天已经在这里使用过这种重写 du/dx 的方式。

That’s pretty bizarre. When I differentiate the function sine of x four times, I get back to the sine of x again. That’s the way it is. Now this notation, prime, and things like that. There are different variants of that notation. For example, that’s another notation. Well, you’ve used the notation du/dx before. u’ could also be denoted du/dx. I think we’ve already here, today, used this way of rewriting du/dx.

我想当我谈论 d/dt(uv) 等时，我将 d/dt 拉到外面，并将您要区分的任何函数放在右边。所以这只是一个符号转换。看起来不错。看起来像是很好的代数，不是吗？但它所做的是将此符号视为运算符。您可以将其应用于函数以获得新函数。我将其应用于正弦函数，得到余弦函数。

I think when I was talking about d/dt(uv) and so on, I pulled that d/dt outside and put whatever function you’re differentiating over to the right. So that’s just a notational switch. It looks good. It looks like good algebra doesn’t it? But what it’s doing is regarding this notation as an operator. It’s something you apply to a function to get a new function. I apply it to the sine function, and I get the cosine function.

我把它应用到 x^2 上，得到 2x。这个符号代表一个运算符，可以将其应用到函数上。运算符的作用是取函数并对其进行微分。因此，人们经常使用的进一步符号是给该运算符起一个不同的名字。他们会用大写字母 D 来表示它。所以这只是用大写字母 D 来表示符号 d/dx。所以，就该符号而言，让我们看看。

I apply it to x^2, and I get 2x. This thing here, that symbol, represents an operator, which you apply to a function. And the operator says, take the function and differentiate it. So further notation that people often use, is they give a different name to that operator. And they’ll write capital D for it. So this is just using capital D for the symbol d/dx. So in terms of that notation, let’s see.

让我们写下更高阶的导数是什么样子的。

Let’s write down what higher derivatives look like.

符号

Notation

让我们看看。这就是 u'。那么 u'' 呢？让我们用 d/dx 符号来写。好吧，我应该对 u' 求导数，对吧？这就是 d/dx 应用于函数 du/dx。对导数求导数。这就是我所做的。或者我可以将其写成 d/dx 应用于 d/dx 应用于 u。只需将 u 拉到外面即可。所以我做了两次 d/dx。我做了两次那个运算符。

So let’s see. That’s what u’ is. How about u’‘? Let’s write that in terms of the d/dx notation. Well I’m supposed to differentiate u’ right? So that’s d/dx applied to the function du/dx. Differentiate the derivative. That’s what I’ve done. Or I could write that as d/dx applied to d/dx applied to u. Just pulling that u outside. So I’m doing d/dx twice. I’m doing that operator twice.

我可以把它写成 (d/dx)^2 应用于 u。求两次导数，然后对函数 u 求导。或者，我可以把它写成，现在这个很奇怪。我也可以写成。就像那样。越来越奇怪了，不是吗？这肯定只是一种符号滥用。但人们会走得更远，写成 d 平方 u 除以 dx 平方。所以这是最奇怪的。

I could write that as (d/dx)^2 applied to u. Differentiate twice, and do it to the function u. Or, I can write it as, now this is a strange one. I could also write as. like that. It’s getting stranger and stranger, isn’t it? This is definitely just a kind of abuse of notation. But people will go even further and write d squared u divided by dx squared. So this is the strangest one.

这种恒等性质是最奇怪的，因为你可能认为你取的是 x^2 量的 d。但这并不是你想要的。这不是 d(x^2)。你想要的是 dx 平方量。在这个非常常见的符号中，分母想要的是 dx 平方量。它是这个二阶微分算子的一部分。

This identity quality is the strangest one, because you may think that you’re taking d of the quantity x^2. But that’s not what’s intended. This is not d(x^2). What’s intended is the quantity dx squared. In this notation, which is very common, what’s intended by the denominator is the quantity dx squared. It’s part of this second differentiation operator.

所以我在这里写了很多等式，它们唯一的意义在于，这些都是对同一事物的不同符号。你会经常看到这种符号。例如，三阶导数是 d 立方 u 除以 dx 立方，等等。对不起？学生：教授：是的，完全正确。或者一个同样好的符号是将运算符大写 D 写成 u，重复三次。完全正确。

So I’ve written a bunch of equalities down here, and the only content to them is that these are all different notations for the same thing. You’ll see this notation very commonly. So for instance the third derivative is d cubed u divided by dx cubed, and so on. Sorry? Student: Professor: Yes, absolutely. Or an equally good notation is to write the operator capital D, done three times, to u. Absolutely.

所以我想我也应该在这里写一下，当我谈论 d^2，二阶导数时，另一种表示法是使用大写 D 运算符两次。让我们看一个例子来说明如何应用它。我来回答这个问题。学生：教授：是的，所以问题是四阶导数是否总是返回原始函数，就像这里发生的那样。不是。这对正弦和余弦来说非常非常特殊。好吗？

So I guess I should also write over here when I was talking about d^2, the second derivative, another notation is do the operator capital D twice. Let’s see an example of how this can be applied. I’ll answer this question. Student: Professor: Yeah, so the question is whether the fourth derivative always gives you the original function back, like what happened here. No. That’s very, very special to sines and cosines. All right?

计算

Calculation

事实上，让我们看一个例子。我会做一个计算。让我们计算 x^n 的 n 次导数。好的，n 是一个数字，比如 1、2、3、4。我们开始吧。让我们一点一点地做。x^n 的一阶导数是多少？每个人都知道这一点。我只是使用了一种新的符号，大写的 D 符号。所以它是 nx^(n 1)。

And, in fact, let’s see an example of that. I’ll do a calculation. Let’s calculate the nth derivative of x^n. Okay, n is a number, like 1,2.3,4. Here we go. Let’s do this. So, let’s do this bit by bit. What’s the first derivative of x^n? So everybody knows this. I’m just using a new notation, this capital D notation. So it’s nx^(n 1).

顺便说一下，现在知道 n 可能为负数，但现在，对于此应用程序，我想将 n 取为 1、2.3 等；这些数字之一。好的，我们做了一个导数。让我们计算 x^n 的二阶导数。好吧，出现了这个 n 常数，然后指数下降，并减 1。好吗？我应该再做一次吗？D^3 (x^n) 是 n(n 1)。

Now know, by the way, n could be a negative number for that, but for now, for this application, I wanna take n to be 1,2.3, and so on; one of those numbers. Okay, we did one derivative. Let’s compute the second derivative of x^n. Well there’s this n constant that comes out, and then the exponent comes down, and it gets reduced by 1. All right? Should I do one more? D^3 (x^n) is n(n 1).

这就是这里的常数。乘以该指数，n 2，再乘以 1，n 3 就是新的指数。好吧，我继续下去，直到来到新的黑板。现在，我想我会在得到 n 减一阶导数时停下来，这样我们就能知道会发生什么。所以当我取三阶导数时，我得到了 n 减去 x 的三次方。

That’s the constant from here. Times that exponent, n 2, times 1 less, n 3 is the new exponent. Well, I keep on going until I come to a new blackboard. Now, I think I’m going to stop when I get to the n minus first derivative, so we can see what’s likely to happen. So when I took the third derivative, I had the n minus third power of x.

当我求二阶导数时，我得到了 x 的二次方。所以，我认为当我求出 n 减一阶导数时，我会得到 x 的一次方。x 的幂不断下降。我做了 n 1 次，得到了一次方。

And when I took the second derivative, I had the second power of x. So, I think what’ll happen when I have the n minus first derivative is I’ll have the first power of x left over. The powers of x keep coming down. And what I’ve done it n 1 times, I get the first power.

然后我得到一个很大的常数，它乘以越来越多的越来越小的整数。在得到 x^1 之前，最后一个整数是多少？好吧，让我们看看。它就是 2，因为这个 x^1 是 x^2 的导数。它前面的系数是 2。这就是你得到的。

And then I get a big constant out in front here times more and more and more of these smaller and smaller integers that come down. What’s the last integer that came down before I got x^1 here? Well, let’s see. It’s just 2, because this x^1 occurred as the derivative of x^2. And the coefficient in front of that is 2. So that’s what you get.

数字 n、n 1，等等，直到 2，乘以 x^1。现在我们可以再微分一次，计算出 D^nx^n 是多少。所以我得到相同的数字，n 乘以 n 1，等等，乘以 2。然后我想我会说乘以 1。乘以，x^1.1 的导数是多少，所以乘以 1。乘以 1，乘以 1。这里的意思是常数函数 1。有人知道这个数字叫什么吗？它有一个名字。它被称为 n 阶乘。它写成 n 个感叹号。我们刚刚使用了数学归纳法的一个例子。

The numbers n, n 1, and so on down to 2, times x^1. And now we can differentiate one more time and calculate what D^n x^n is. So I get the same number, n times n 1 and so on and so on, times 2. And then I guess I’ll say times 1. Times, what’s the derivative of x^1.1, so times 1. Time 1, times 1. Where this one means the constant function 1. Does anyone know what this number is called? That has a name. It’s called n factorial. And it’s written n exclamation point. And we just used an example of mathematical induction.

所以最终结果是 D^nx^n 是 n！，常数。好吧，这是一个巧妙的事实。讲座的最后一个问题是 D^(n + 1) 应用于 x^n 是什么？哈。太好了。它是常数的导数。所以它是 0。好的。谢谢。

So the end result is D^n x^n is n!, constant. Okay that’s a neat fact. Final question for the lecture is what’s D^(n + 1) applied to x^n? Ha. Excellent. It’s the derivative of a constant. So it’s 0. Okay. Thank you.

Lec 5 | MIT 18.01 单变量微积分，2007 年秋季

Lec 5 | MIT 18.01 Single Variable Calculus, Fall 2007

16 年前 (2009 年 1 月 17 日) — 49:01 https://youtube.com/watch?v=5q_3FDOkVRQ

16 years ago (Jan 17, 2009) — 49:01 https://youtube.com/watch?v=5q_3FDOkVRQ

以下内容是根据 Creative Commons 许可创建的。您的支持将帮助 MIT OpenCourseWare 继续免费提供高质量的教育资源。要捐款或查看数百门 MIT 课程的其他材料，请访问 MIT OpenCourseWare，网址为 ocw.mit.edu。教授：那么，我们准备开始第五讲了。我很高兴回来。感谢您招待我的同事 Haynes Miller。

The following content was created under a Creative Commons License. Your support will help MIT OpenCourseWare continue to offer high quality educational resources for free. To make a donation or to view additional materials from hundreds of MIT courses, visit MIT OpenCourseWare at ocw.mit.edu. Professor: So, we’re ready to begin the fifth lecture. I’m glad to be back. Thank you for entertaining my colleague, Haynes Miller.
