所以，今天我们将继续他开始讲的内容，也就是他所讲的链式法则，这可能是扩展可微分函数类型的最强大的技术。今天我们将以一些相当巧妙的代数方式使用链式法则。所以今天的主题是所谓的隐式微分。

So, today we’re going to continue where he started, namely what he talked about was the chain rule, which is probably the most powerful technique for extending the kinds of functions that you can differentiate. And we’re going to use the chain rule in some rather clever algebraic ways today. So the topic for today is what’s known as implicit differentiation.

隐式微分是一种技术，它允许你对许多你之前甚至不知道如何求的函数进行微分。这是一种技术，让我们等几个人坐下。物理，嗯？好的，更多的物理。我们休息一下。你可以在课后得到这些。好的，我们现在讨论隐式微分，我将通过几个例子来说明它。

So implicit differentiation is a technique that allows you to differentiate a lot of functions you didn’t even know how to find before. And it’s a technique let’s wait for a few people to sit down here. Physics, huh? Okay, more Physics. Let’s take a break. You can get those after class. All right, so we’re talking about implicit differentiation, and I’m going to illustrate it by several examples.

这是我们已经讲过一部分的最重要和最基本的公式之一。也就是说，x 的幂的导数是 ax^(a 1)。现在，我们目前得到的是指数，0，正负 1，正负 2 等等。你们在第一堂课上讲了正整数幂，然后昨天 Miller 教授告诉了你们负幂。

So this is one of the most important and basic formulas that we’ve already covered part way. Namely, the derivative of x to a power is ax^(a 1). Now, what we’ve got so far is the exponents, 0, plus or minus 1, plus or minus 2, etc. You did the positive integer powers in the first lecture, and then yesterday Professor Miller told you about the negative powers.

今天我们要做的就是考虑指数，也就是有理数，整数的比值。所以 a 是 m/n。m 和 n 是整数。好吧，这就是我们现在的目标，我们将使用这种隐式微分方法。特别是，重要的是要意识到这涵盖了 m = 1 的情况。这些是 n 次方根。

So what we’re going to do right now, today, is we’re going to consider the exponents which are rational numbers, ratios of integers. So a is m/n. m and n are integers. All right, so that’s our goal for right now, and we’re going to use this method of implicit differentiation. In particular, it’s important to realize that this covers the case m = 1. And those are the nth roots.

因此，当我们取 1 的 n 次方时，我们现在将介绍它，以及许多其他示例。因此，这是我们的第一个示例。那么我们如何开始呢？我们只需写下该函数的公式。该函数是 y = x^(m/n)。这就是我们要处理的。现在实际上只有两个步骤。

So when we take the one over n power, we’re going to cover that right now, along with many other examples. So this is our first example. So how do we get started? Well we just write down a formula for the function. The function is y = x^(m/n). That’s what we’re trying to deal with. And now there’s really only two steps.

第一步是将此方程的 n 次方取整，因此将其写为 y^n = x^m。好吧，这只是重写后的相同方程。现在，我们要做的就是求导。因此，我们要将 d/dx 应用于方程。那么，为什么我们可以将它应用于第二个方程，而不是第一个方程呢？

The first step is to take this equation to the nth power, so write it y^n = x^m. Alright, so that’s just the same equation re written. And now, what we’re going to do is we’re going to differentiate. So we’re going to apply d/dx to the equation. Now why is it that we can apply it to the second equation, not the first equation?

所以也许我应该把它们称为方程 1 和方程 2。所以，关键是，我们可以将它应用到方程 2。现在，原因是我们不知道如何区分 x^(m/n)。这是我们还不知道的事情。但我们知道如何区分整数幂。这些是我们之前处理过的事情。所以现在我们能够进行区分了。

So maybe I should call these equation 1 and equation 2. So, the point is, we can apply it to equation 2. Now, the reason is that we don’t know how to differentiate x^(m/n). That’s something we just don’t know yet. But we do know how to differentiate integer powers. Those are the things that we took care of before. So now we’re in shape to be able to do the differentiation.

所以我打算在这里明确地写出来，但暂时不执行。即 d/dx of y^n = d/dx of x^m。现在您看到，这里的表达式要求我们做一些我们昨天之前无法做到的事情。也就是说，这个 y 是 x 的函数。所以我们必须在这里应用链式法则。所以这与链式法则相同，即 d/dy of y^n 乘以 dy/dx。

So I’m going to write it out explicitly over here, without carrying it out just yet. That’s d/dx of y^n = d/dx of x^m. And now you see this expression here requires us to do something we couldn’t do before yesterday. Namely, this y is a function of x. So we have to apply the chain rule here. So this is the same as this is by the chain rule now d/dy of y^n times dy/dx.

然后，在右边，我们可以直接执行它。我们知道公式。它是 mx^(m 1)。好的，现在这是我们的方案。你马上就会明白为什么我们能用这个方案获胜。首先，这里有两个因素。其中一个是未知的。事实上，这正是我们要找的。

And then, on the right hand side, we can just carry it out. We know the formula. It’s mx^(m 1). Right, now this is our scheme. And you’ll see in a minute why we win with this. So, first of all, there are two factors here. One of them is unknown. In fact, it’s what we’re looking for.

但另一个将是已知量，因为我们知道如何对 y 求 n 的导数。这是相同的公式，尽管字母已更改。因此，这与我在下面写下的 ny^(n 1) dy/dx = mx^(m 1) 相同。好的，现在，如果您愿意，可以开始讨论问题的非微积分部分。请记住，问题的非微积分部分始终是问题中最复杂的部分。

But the other one is going to be a known quantity, because we know how to differentiate y to the n with respect to y. That’s the same formula, although the letter has been changed. And so this is the same as I’ll write it underneath here n y^(n 1) dy/dx = m x^(m 1). Okay, now comes, if you like, the non calculus part of the problem. Remember the non calculus part of the problem is always the messier part of the problem.

所以我们想找出这个公式。这个公式，这里的答案，我现在可能把它放在一个框里，表达得更简单，只用 x 来表示。我们现在要做的就是用代数解出 dy/dx，然后一直用 x 来解。所以，首先，我们解出 dy/dx。所以我通过除以左边的因数来做到这一点。

So we want to figure out this formula. This formula, the answer over here, which maybe I’ll put in a box now, has this expressed much more simply, only in terms of x. And what we have to do now is just solve for dy/dx using algebra, and then solve all the way in terms of x. So, first of all, we solve for dy/dx. So I do that by dividing the factor on the left hand side.

所以我得到 mx^(m 1) 除以 ny^(n 1)。现在我要代入。所以我将其写为 m/n。这是 x^(m 1)。现在我要代入 y，x^(m/n) 乘以 n 1。现在我们快完成了，但不幸的是，我们还有一堆指数需要计算。我要再写一遍。所以我已经在前面认出了因子 a。

So I get here mx^(m 1) divided by ny^(n 1). And now I’m going to plug in. so I’ll write this as m/n. This is x^(m 1). Now over here I’m going to put in for y, x^(m/n) times n 1. So now we’re almost done, but unfortunately we have this mess of exponents that we have to work out. I’m going to write it one more time. So I already recognize the factor a out front.

这对我来说不是问题，这就是我在这里的目标。但现在我必须对所有这些幂进行编码，所以我们就直接写下来吧。它是 m 1，然后减去 (n 1) m/n 的数量。好的，这就是指数定律应用于此处的比率。然后我们将在下一个板上进行算术运算。

That’s not going to be a problem for me, and that’s what I’m aiming for here. But now I have to encode all of these powers, so let’s just write it. It’s m 1, and then it’s minus the quantity (n 1) m/n. All right, so that’s the law of exponents applied to this ratio here. And then we’ll do the arithmetic over here on the next board.

因此，我们这里有 m 1 (n 1) m/n = m 1。如果我用 n 乘以这个，我得到 m。如果第二个因数为负，那就是正数。那就是 +m/n。总之，两个 m 相消。我这里有 1 + m/n。瞧，这和 1 是一样的，这正是我们想要的。好吧，所以这等于 ax^(n 1)。好的，这又只是一堆算术。

So we have here m 1 (n 1) m/n = m 1. And if I multiply n by this, I get m. And if the second factor is minus, that’s a plus. And that’s +m/n. Altogether the two m’s cancel. I have here 1 + m/n. And lo and behold that’s the same thing as a 1, just what we wanted. All right, so this equals a x^(n 1). Okay, again just a bunch of arithmetic.

从现在开始，从这个代换开始，它只是指数的算术。好的，我们在这里完成了第一个例子。我想再举几个例子，让我们继续。下一个示例我会保持相对简单。所以我们有第二个示例，它将是函数 x^2 + y^2 = 1。嗯，这不是真正的函数。它是一种将 y 隐式定义为 x 的函数的方法。

From this point forward, from this substitution on, it’s just the arithmetic of exponents. All right, so we’ve done our first example here. I want to give you a couple more examples, so let’s just continue. The next example I’ll keep relatively simple. So we have example two, which is going to be the function x^2 + y^2 = 1. Well, that’s not really a function. It’s a way of defining y as a function of x implicitly.

有一种观点认为，如果我愿意，我可以解出 y。事实上，让我们这样做。所以如果你在这里解出 y，你会得到 y^2 = 1 x^2，y 等于 1 x^2 的平方根加上或减去。所以，如果你愿意的话，这就是隐式定义。这是显式函数 y，它是 x 的函数。

There’s the idea that I could solve for y if I wanted to. And indeed let’s do that. So if you solve for y here, what happens is you get y^2 = 1 x^2, and y is equal to plus or minus the square root of 1 x^2. So this, if you like, is the implicit definition. And here is the explicit function y, which is a function of x.

现在，为了方便起见，我将取正分支。这就是函数。它实际上只是一个伪装的圆。我将取圆的顶部，所以我们将取这里的顶部凸起。好的，这意味着我要擦除这个减号。我取正分支，只是为了方便起见。我可以用负分支来做同样的事情。

And now just for my own convenience, I’m just going to take the positive branch. This is the function. It’s just really a circle in disguise. And I’m just going to take the top part of the circle, so we’ll take that top hump here. All right, so that means I’m erasing this minus sign. I’m just taking the positive branch, just for my convenience. I could do it just as well with the negative branch.

好的，现在我得到了解决方案，我可以用它来区分。因此，我不会在这里使用 dy/dx 符号，而是在这里切换符号，因为这样写起来更简洁。我将写成 y' 并更改符号。好的，我想对它求导。这是一个有点复杂的函数。

Alright, so now I’ve taken the solution, and I can differentiate with this. So rather than using the dy/dx notation over here, I’m going to switch notations over here, because it’s less writing. I’m going to write y’ and change notations. Okay, so I want to take the derivative of this. Well this is a somewhat complicated function here.

它是 1 x^2 的平方根，看待此类函数的正确方法始终是使用分数幂符号重写它们。这是计算平方根导数的第一步。然后第二步是什么？有人想告诉我吗？链式法则，对吧。就是这样。所以我们有两件事。我们从一件事开始，然后对它做其他事情。

It’s the square root of 1 x^2, and the right way always to look at functions like this is to rewrite them using the fractional power notation. That’s the first step in computing a derivative of a square root. And then the second step here is what? Does somebody want to tell me? Chain rule, right. That’s it. So we have two things. We start with one, and then we do something else to it.

所以每当我们对某件事做两件事时，我们都需要应用链式法则。所以 1 x^2，平方根。好吧，那么我们怎么做呢？好吧，我要求的第一个因式是这个东西的导数。所以这是 1/2 的 1/2。所以我现在用高级方法做这个，因为我们已经毕业了。你上次已经做过链式法则了。那么这是什么意思呢？

So whenever we do two things to something, we need to apply the chain rule. So 1 x^2, square root. All right, so how do we do that? Well, the first factor I claim is the derivative of this thing. So this is 1/2 blah to the 1/2. So I’m doing this kind of by the advanced method now, because we’ve already graduated. You already did the chain rule last time. So what does this mean?

这是 blah 的 blah ^ 1/2 的导数的缩写，不管它是什么。好的，这是我们要使用的第一个因子。我不会像之前对 y 和 x 变量所做的那样，实际为它写一个变量并传递，而是直接跳过该步骤，让您将其想象为该变量的占位符。所以这个变量现在是括号。

This is an abbreviation for the derivative with respect to blah of blah ^ 1/2, whatever it is. All right, so that’s the first factor that we’re going to use. Rather than actually write out a variable for it and pass through as I did previously with this y and x variable here, I’m just going to skip that step and let you imagine it as being a placeholder for that variable here. So this variable is now parenthesis.

然后我必须将其乘以内部相对于 x 的变化率。结果就是 2x。1 x^2 的导数是 2x。现在，我们无法在做第一个示例之前做第二个示例，因为我们需要知道幂律不仅适用于整数，也适用于 a = 1/2。我们在这里使用 a = 1/2 的情况。

And then I have to multiply that by the rate of change of what’s inside with respect to x. And that is going to be 2x. The derivative of 1 x^2 is 2x. And now again, we couldn’t have done this example two before example one, because we needed to know that the power rule worked not just for a integer but also for a = 1/2. We’re using the case a = 1/2 right here.

它是 1/2 的倍数，而这里的 1/2 是 1。所以这是 a = 1/2 的情况。a 1 恰好是 1/2。好的，我把所有这些放在一起。你知道在一周内你必须非常自动地完成这件事。所以我们现在要以这个速度完成。你最终想做得更快。是吗？学生：教授：问题是我是否可以在没有平方根的情况下隐式地完成它。

It’s 1/2 times, and this 1/2 here is a 1. So this is the case a = 1/2. a 1 happens to be 1/2. Okay, so I’m putting all those things together. And you know within a week you have to be doing this very automatically. So we’re going to do it at this speed now. You want to do it even faster, ultimately. Yes? Student: Professor:. The question is could I have done it implicitly without the square roots.

答案是肯定的。这就是我要做的。这就是所谓的显式解决方案的一个例子。这个就是所谓的显式解决方案。我想将它与我们今天要使用的方法进行对比。它涉及很多复杂性。它涉及链式法则。正如我们所看到的，它会变得越来越混乱。然后是隐式方法，我认为它更容易。

And the answer is yes. That’s what I’m about to do. So this is an illustration of what’s called the explicit solution. So this guy is what’s called explicit. And I want to contrast it with the method that we’re going to now use today. So it involves a lot of complications. It involves the chain rule. And as we’ll see it can get messier and messier. And then there’s the implicit method, which I claim is easier.

那么让我们看看如果隐式执行会发生什么。隐式方法涉及的不是用这种相对复杂的方式编写函数，而是保留平方根。不要对它做任何事情。在前面的例子中，我们留下了一些复杂的东西，比如 x^(1/3) 或 x^(1/2) 或一些复杂的东西。我们必须简化它。我们有一个方程式一，它更复杂。我们简化了它，然后对其进行了微分。

So let’s see what happens if you do it implicitly. The implicit method involves, instead of writing the function in this relatively complicated way, with the square root, it involves leaving it alone. Don’t do anything to it. In this previous case, we were left with something which was complicated, say x^(1/3) or x^(1/2) or something complicated. We had to simplify it. We had an equation one, which was more complicated. We simplified it then differentiated it.

那是比较简单的情况。好吧，这里，我们最容易区分的就是我们开始的那个，因为平方实际上是在第一次幂或零次幂之后最容易区分的东西。所以我们就不管它了。这是最简单的形式，现在我们要区分。那么会发生什么？那么方法是什么？让我提醒你。你在等式中应用 d/dx。

And so that was a simpler case. Well here, the simplest thing us to differentiate is the one we started with, because squares are practically the easiest thing after first powers, or maybe zeroth powers to differentiate. So we’re leaving it alone. This is the simplest possible form for it, and now we’re going to differentiate. So what happens? So again what’s the method? Let me remind you. You’re applying d/dx to the equation.

所以你必须对等式左边求导，对等式右边求导。所以就是这样，你得到的结果是 2x + 2yy' 等于多少？0。1 0 的导数。所以这又是链式法则。我用了不同的方法。我试图让你一次习惯多种不同的符号。其实只有两种。只有素数符号和 dy/dx 符号。

So you have to differentiate the left side of the equation, and differentiate the right side of the equation. So it’s this, and what you get is 2x + 2yy’ is equal to what? 0. The derivative of 1 0. So this is the chain rule again. I did it a different way. I’m trying to get you used to many different notations at once. Well really just two. Just the prime notation and the dy/dx notation.

这就是我得到的结果。所以现在我要做的就是解出 y'。如果我把 2x 放在另一边，y'就是 2x，然后除以 2y，也就是 x/y。所以让我们比较一下我们的解决方案，抱歉，我必须删除一些东西才能做到这一点。所以让我们比较一下我们的两个解决方案。我要把它放在下面并简化。那么我们的解决方案是什么？

And this is what I get. So now all I have to do is solve for y’. So that y’if I put the 2x on the other side, is 2x, and then divide by 2y, which is x/y. So let’s compare our solutions, and I’ll apologize, I’m going to have to erase something to do that. So let’s compare our two solutions. I’m going to put this underneath and simplify. So what was our solution over here?

结果是 1/2(1 x 2) ( 1/2) ( 2x)。这就是我们在这里得到的。如果我取消 2，将其改回平方根，结果是一样的，这与 x 除以 1 x^2 的平方根是一样的。因此，当我以显式方式执行时，这就是导数的公式。我将比较这两个表达式。请注意，它们是相同的。

It was 1/2(1 x2)( 1/2) ( 2x). That was what we got over here. And that is the same thing, if I cancel the 2’s, and I change it back to looking like a square root, that’s the same thing as x divided by square root of 1 x^2. So this is the formula for the derivative when I do it the explicit way. And I’ll just compare them, these two expressions here. And notice they are the same.

它们是一样的，因为 y 等于 1 的平方根 x^2。是吗？问题？学生：教授：。问题是为什么隐式方法没有给出圆的下半部分？很好的问题。答案是它确实给出了。我只是没有提到它。等一下，我会解释。假设我在这里加了一个减号。我会得到这个差值，所以有一个额外的减号。

They’re the same, because y is equal to square root of 1 x^2. Yeah? Question? Student: Professor:. The question is why did the implicit method not give the bottom half of the circle? Very good question. The answer to that is that it did. I just didn’t mention it. Wait, I’ll explain. So suppose I stuck in a minus sign here. I would have gotten this with the difference, so with an extra minus sign.

但是当我将它与那边的进行比较时，我必须在这里使用另一个不同的减号。所以实际上两个地方都会有一个额外的减号。而且它们仍然会重合。所以实际上隐式方法要好一点。它甚至不会注意到分支之间的差异。它在上半部分和下半部分都完成了这项工作。换句话说，你在这里计算斜率。

But then when I compared it to what was over there, I would have had to have another different minus sign over here. So actually both places would get an extra minus sign. And they would still coincide. So actually the implicit method is a little better. It doesn’t even notice the difference between the branches. It does the job on both the top and bottom half. Another way of saying that is that you’re calculating the slopes here.

让我们看看这张图片。这是斜率。让我们看一下 x 的正值，然后检查一下符号，看看发生了什么。如果你在这里取 x 的正值，x 就是正数。这个分母是正数。斜率是负数。你可以看到它向下倾斜。所以没关系。现在在底部，它将向上倾斜。

So let’s look at this picture. Here’s a slope. Let’s just take a look at a positive value of x and just check the sign to see what’s happening. If you take a positive value of x over here, x is positive. This denominator is positive. The slope is negative. You can see that it’s tilting down. So it’s okay. Now on the bottom side, it’s going to be tilting up.

同样，这里的情况是 x 和 y 都是正数，这个 x 和这个 y 也是正数。斜率为负数。另一方面，在底部，x 仍为正数，但 y 为负数。它向上倾斜是因为分母为负数。分子为正数，这个负号的斜率为正数。因此它在每个类别中都完美匹配。

And similarly what’s happening up here is that both x and y are positive, and this x and this y are positive. And the slope is negative. On the other hand, on the bottom side, x is still positive, but y is negative. And it’s tilting up because the denominator is negative. The numerator is positive, and this minus sign has a positive slope. So it matches perfectly in every category.

然而，这很复杂，即使是在高等数学中，一次跟踪一个分支也更容易。好的，所以我们一次只跟踪一个分支。还有其他问题吗？好的，现在我想给你一个稍微复杂一点的例子。确实有些。所以这是一个稍微复杂一点的例子。它不会是最复杂的例子，但你知道它会有点棘手。

This complicated, however, and it’s easier just to keep track of one branch at a time, even in advanced math. Okay, so we only do it one branch at a time. Other questions? Okay, so now I want to give you a slightly more complicated example here. And indeed some of the. so here’s a little more complicated example. It’s not going to be the most complicated example, but you know it’ll be a little tricky.

这个例子，我给你一个四阶方程。所以 y^4 + xy^2 2 = 0。现在恰巧有一个解这个方程的技巧，所以实际上你可以使用显式方法和非显式方法。所以显式方法会说，好吧，我想解这个方程。

So this example, I’m going to give you a fourth order equation. So y^4 + xy^2 2 = 0. Now it just so happens that there’s a trick to solving this equation, so actually you can do both the explicit method and the non explicit method. So the explicit method would say okay well, I want to solve for this.

所以我将使用二次公式，但针对的是 y^2。这是 y^2 的二次公式，因为有四次方和二次方，而缺少一次方和三次方。所以 y^2 等于 x 加上或减去 x^2 的平方根 4( 2) 除以 2。所以这个 x 是 b。这个 2 是 c，二次公式中的 a = 1。

So I’m going to use the quadratic formula, but on y^2. This is quadratic in y^2, because there’s a fourth power and a second power, and the first and third powers are missing. So this is y^2 is equal to x plus or minus the square root of x^2 4( 2) divided by 2. And so this x is the b. This 2 is the c, and a = 1 in the quadratic formula.

因此，y 的公式是加上或减去 x 的平方根加上或减去 x^2 + 8 的平方根除以 2。现在您可以看到这个分支问题，这实际上在很多情况下都会发生，并以复杂的方式出现。这里有两个符号选择。这里有两个符号选择。

And so the formula for y is plus or minus the square root of x plus or minus the square root x^2 + 8 divided by 2. So now you can see this problem of branches, this happens actually in a lot of cases, coming up in an elaborate way. You have two choices for the sign here. You have two choices for the sign here.

这个方程可能有多达四个根，因为它是一个四次方程。这很乱。你必须分别检查每个分支。这确实是这种复杂程度，一般来说，很难找出四次方程的公式。但幸运的是，我们永远不会使用它们。也就是说，我们永远不需要那些公式。所以隐式方法要容易得多。

Conceivably as many as four roots for this equation, because it’s a fourth degree equation. It’s quite a mess. You should have to check each branch separately. And this really is that level of complexity, and in general it’s very difficult to figure out the formulas for quartic equations. But fortunately we’re never going to use them. That is, we’re never going to need those formulas. So the implicit method is far easier.

隐式方法只是说好吧我将方程保留为最简单的形式。现在进行微分。因此当我进行微分时，我得到 4y^3 y' 加上现在我必须应用乘积规则。因此我分别对 x 和 y^2 进行微分。首先我对 x 进行微分，因此我得到 y^2。然后我对另一个因子 y^2 因子进行微分。然后我得到 x(2 y')。

The implicit method just says okay I’ll leave the equation in its simplest form. And now differentiate. So when I differentiate, I get 4y^3 y’ plus now here I have to apply the product rule. So I differentiate the x and the y^2 separately. First I differentiate with respect to x, so I get y^2. Then I differentiate with respect to the other factor, the y^2 factor. And I get x(2 y’).

然后 0 等于 0。所以减 0 等于 0。所以这是隐式微分步骤。现在我只想解 y'。所以我要分解出 4y^3 + 2xy。这是 y' 的因式。我要把 y^2 放在另一边。y^2 在这里。所以 y' 的公式是 y^2 除以 4y^3 + 2xy。所以这是解的公式。对于斜率。

And then the 0 gives me 0. So minus 0 equals 0. So there’s the implicit differentiation step. And now I just want to solve for y’. So I’m going to factor out 4y^3 + 2xy. That’s the factor on y’. And I’m going to put the y^2 on the other side. y^2 over here. And so the formula for y’ is y^2 divided by 4y^3 + 2xy. So that’s the formula for the solution. For the slope.

你有问题吗？ 学生： 教授： 那么问题是，对于 y，我们必须代入显式方程中解出的数值吗？ 答案是肯定的。 这正是关键所在。 所以这不是问题的完整解决方案。 我们从一个隐式方程开始。 我们进行了区分。 最后我们得到了一个隐式方程。 它没有告诉我们 y 作为 x 的函数是什么。

You have a question? Student: Professor: So the question is for the y would we have to put in what solved for in the explicit equation. And the answer is absolutely yes. That’s exactly the point. So this is not a complete solution to a problem. We started with an implicit equation. We differentiated. And we got in the end, also an implicit equation. It doesn’t tell us what y is as a function of x.

你必须回到这个公式才能得到 x 的公式。例如，让我在这里举个例子。这隐藏了问题的一定程度的复杂性。但这是我们必须忍受的一定程度的复杂性。例如，在 x = 1 时，你可以看到 y = 1 可以解。这恰好是。

You have to go back to this formula to get the formula for x. So for example, let me give you an example here. So this hides a degree of complexity of the problem. But it’s a degree of complexity that we must live with. So for example, at x = 1, you can see that y = 1 solves. That happens to be.

解出 y^4 + xy^2 2 = 0。这就是我选择 2 的原因，所以结果是 1 + 1 2 = 0。我只是想在此时找到一个方便的解决方案。所以我这样做了。所以我们现在知道当 x = 1 时，y = 1。那么在曲线上的 (1,1) 处，斜率等于多少？

Solves y^4 + xy^2 2 = 0. That’s why I picked the 2 actually, so it would be 1 + 1 2 = 0. I just wanted to have a convenient solution there to pull out of my hat at this point. So I did that. And so we now know that when x = 1, y = 1. So at (1,1) along the curve, the slope is equal to what?

好吧，我必须在这里代入 1^2 / (4 1^3 + 2 1*1)。这只是代入那边的公式，结果是 1/6。所以我能得到它。另一方面，假设 x = 2，我们只能使用这里的公式星号来求 y。现在，让我就此提出两点，这对您来说只是哲学观点。

Well, I have to plug in here, 1^2 / (41^3 + 21*1). That’s just plugging in that formula over there, which turns out to be 1/6. So I can get it. On the other hand, at say x = 2, we’re stuck using this formula star here to find y. Now, so let me just make two points about this, which are just philosophical points for you right now.

首先，当我在这门课开始时向你们承诺，我们将能够对任何已知的函数进行微分时，我的意思就是字面意思。我的意思是，如果你知道这个函数，我们就能给出导数的公式。如果你不知道如何求一个函数，那么求导数就会很困难。

The first is, when I promised you at the beginning of this class that we were going to be able to differentiate any function you know, I meant it very literally. What I meant is if you know the function, we’ll be able give a formula for the derivative. If you don’t know how to find a function, you’ll have a lot of trouble finding the derivative.

因此，我们并没有承诺，如果你找不到函数，你就能通过某种魔法找到导数。这永远不会发生。无论函数有多复杂，四次多项式的根可能是系数的相当复杂的函数，我们只能在这个问题中坚持这种复杂程度。

So we didn’t make any promises that if you can’t find the function you will be able to find the derivative by some magic. That will never happen. And however complex the function is, a root of a fourth degree polynomial can be pretty complicated function of the coefficients, we’re stuck with this degree of complexity in the problem.

但请注意，他的方法的最大优点是，尽管我们必须找到星号，但我们必须找到这个公式星号，顺便说一句，还有很多其他方法可以用数字方式完成这些事情，我们稍后会学习，所以有一个很好的方法可以用数字方式完成。尽管我们必须找到星号，但我们永远不需要对其进行微分。我们有一种快速获得斜率的方法。

But the big advantage of his method, notice, is that although we’ve had to find star, we had to find this formula star, and there are many other ways of doing these things numerically, by the way, which we’ll learn later, so there’s a good method for doing it numerically. Although we had to find star, we never had to differentiate it. We had a fast way of getting the slope.

所以我们必须知道 x 和 y 是什么。但是 y' 我们通过代数公式得到，就这里的值而言。所以一旦你知道了点，就忘记斜率了，这样就很快了。是吗？学生：括号里是什么？教授：对不起，是这样的。好吧，让我们看看我是否能搞定。这就是你所说的括号吗？啊，“说”。这表示“说”。好吧，也许我应该在它周围加上逗号。

So we had to know what x and y were. But y’ we got by an algebraic formula, in terms of the values here. So this is very fast, forgetting the slope, once you know the point. yes? Student: What’s in the parentheses? Professor: Sorry, this is. Well let’s see if I can manage this. Is this the parentheses you’re talking about? Ah, “say”. That says “say”. Well, so maybe I should put commas around it.

但是它是 SAY，逗号，好吗？这里是 x = 1。我只是抛出一个值。任何其他值。实际上有一个值，我最喜欢的值。嗯，这很容易评估，对吧？x = 0，我可以在那里做。那可能是唯一的一个。其他的很麻烦。好吧，还有其他问题吗？现在我们必须在这里做更多的事情。

But it was S A Y, comma, okay? Well here was at x = 1. I’m just throwing out a value. Any other value. Actually there is one value, my favorite value. Well this is easy to evaluate right? x = 0, I can do it there. That’s maybe the only one. The others are a nuisance. All right, other questions? Now we have to do something more here.

我曾向你们声称，我们可以对所有已知的函数进行微分。但实际上，我们可以学到很多关于函数的知识，而这些函数很难掌握。因此，这种隐式微分法有一个非常重要的应用，那就是寻找反函数，或者寻找反函数的导数。接下来让我们谈谈这个。首先，我们可能只是举个例子来说明。

So I claimed to you that we could differentiate all the functions we know. But really we can learn a tremendous about functions which are really hard to get at. So this implicit differentiation method has one very, very important application to finding inverse functions, or finding derivatives of inverse functions. So let’s talk about that next. So first, maybe we’ll just illustrate by an example.

如果函数 y 等于 x 的平方根，且 x 为正数，那么当然，我们应该简化这个方程，然后求它的平方，这样我们就可以得到这个稍微简单的方程。然后我们有一个符号。如果我们称 f(x) 等于 x 的平方根，并且 g(y) = x，这就是它的逆。

If you have the function y is equal to square root x, for x positive, then of course this idea is that we should simplify this equation and we should square it so we get this somewhat simpler equation here. And then we have a notation for this. If we call f(x) equal to square root of x, and g(y) = x, this is the reversal of this.

那么 g(y) 的公式应该是 y^2。一般来说，如果我们从任何旧的 y = f(x) 开始，然后写下来，这是函数 g 的定义关系，我们所说的属性是 g(f(x)) 必须将我们带回到 x。我们用几种不同的方式写出它。我们称 g 为 f 的逆。 

Then the formula for g(y) is that it should be y^2. And in general, if we start with any old y = f(x), and we just write down, this is the defining relationship for a function g, the property that we’re saying is that g(f(x)) has got to bring us back to x. And we write that in a couple of different ways. We call g the inverse of f. 

而且我们称 f 为 g 的逆，不过我不会透露我想使用哪个变量，因为人们会把它们混淆，就像我们在画一些图时会做的那样。让我们看看。让我们在同一张图上画出 f 和 f 的逆。首先，我要画出 f(x) = x 的平方根的图。它是这样的形状。

And also we call f the inverse of g, although I’m going to be silent about which variable I want to use, because people mix them up a little bit, as we’ll be doing when we draw some pictures of this. So let’s see. Let’s draw pictures of both f and f inverse on the same graph. So first of all, I’m going to draw the graph of f(x) = square root of x. That’s some shape like this.

现在，为了理解 g(y) 是什么，让我们进行一般分析，然后我们将在这个特定情况下绘制它。如果有 g(y) = x，那实际上只是相同的方程，对吗？这是方程 g(y) = x，即 y^2 = x。这是 y = x 的平方根，它们是相同的方程，是相同的曲线。但现在假设我们想写下 g(x) 是什么。

And now, in order to understand what g(y) is, so let’s do the analysis in general, but then we’ll draw it in this particular case. If you have g(y) = x, that’s really just the same equation right? This is the equation g(y) = x, that’s y^2 = x. This is y = square root of x, those are the same equations, it’s the same curve. But suppose now that we wanted to write down what g(x) is.

换句话说，我们想要交换变量，所以像我说的那样，在同一个图上用相同的 x 轴和 y 轴绘制它们。那么这实际上就是交换 x 和 y 的角色。我们必须重命名图上的每个点，即有序对 (x, y)，并将其交换为相反的点。

In other words, we wanted to switch the variables, so draw them as I said on the same graph with the same x, and the same y axes. Then that would be, in effect, trading the roles of x and y. We have to rename every point on the graph which is the ordered pair (x, y), and trade it for the opposite one.

当你交换 x 和 y 时，要做到这一点，交换 x 和 y，当你这样做时，图形上看起来如下：假设你在这里有一个地方，这是 x，这是 y，然后你想交换它们。所以你想要这里的 y 对吧？而 x 在那里。它有点像那边的相反位置。

And when you exchange x and y, so to do this, exchange x and y, and when you do that, graphically what that looks like is the following: suppose you have a place here, and this is the x and this is the y, then you want to trade them. So you want the y here right? And the x up there. It’s sort of the opposite place over there.

那就是与 x = y 对角线的对面点正对的地方。所以你通过这个反射或者通过那个翻转。你会得到另一个看起来像那样的形状。也许我会用彩色粉笔在这里画出来。所以这个是 y = f^( 1)(x)。事实上，如果你看看这些图，你会发现这个是平方根。

And that is the place which is directly opposite this point across the diagonal line x = y. So you reflect across this or you flip across that. You get this other shape that looks like that. Maybe I’ll draw it with a colored piece of chalk here. So this guy here is y = f^( 1)(x). And indeed, if you look at these graphs, this one is the square root.

这个恰好是 y = x^2。如果你把这个旋转一下，就会反转 x 轴和 y 轴的角色，并将其倾斜到一边。这就是反函数的图景，现在我想向你们展示隐式微分法可以让我们计算反函数的导数。

This one happens to be y = x^2. If you take this one, and you turn it, you reverse the roles of the x axis and the y axis, and tilt it on its side. So that’s the picture of what an inverse function is, and now I want to show you that the method of implicit differentiation allows us to compute the derivatives of inverse functions.

让我先概括地讲一下，然后再具体地讲一下。隐式微分允许我们求出任何反函数的导数，只要我们知道该函数的导数。让我们举个例子，这真的很复杂，也有点微妙。它有一个非常漂亮的答案。所以我们在这里举一个例子，即函数 y 等于反正切。

So let me just say it in general, and then I’ll carry it out in particular. So implicit differentiation allows us to find the derivative of any inverse function, provided we know the derivative of the function. So let’s do that for what is an example, which is truly complicated and a little subtle here. It has a very pretty answer. So we’ll carry out an example here, which is the function y is equal to the inverse tangent.

再次强调，对于反正切，我们要做的所有事情都是基于通过取两边的正切来简化这个方程。顺便提醒一下，反正切也称为反正切。这只是同一事物的另一种表示法。我们将使用方程 tan y = x 来描述这个函数。

So again, for the inverse tangent all of the things that we’re going to do are going to be based on simplifying this equation by taking the tangent of both sides. So, us let me remind you by the way, the inverse tangent is what’s also known as arctangent. That’s just another notation for the same thing. And what we’re going to use to describe this function is the equation tan y = x.

这就是你取这个函数的正切时发生的情况。这就是我们要弄清楚函数的样子的方法。所以首先，我要画出它，然后我们进行计算。所以我们先画出图表。所以我想做一些类似于我在这里用平方根函数做的事情。

That’s what happens when you take the tangent of this function. This is how we’re going to figure out what the function looks like. So first of all, I want to draw it, and then we’ll do the computation. So let’s make the diagram first. So I want to do something which is analogous to what I did over here with the square root function.

首先，我要提醒大家，正切函数是在这里的两个值之间定义的，这两个值是 pi/2 和 pi/2。它从负无穷大开始，然后像这样向上弯曲。这就是函数 tan x。因此，我们要绘制的是通过将其沿轴反射得到的。不是轴，而是对角线。

So first of all, I remind you that the tangent function is defined between two values here, which are pi/2 and pi/2. And it starts out at minus infinity and curves up like this. So that’s the function tan x. And so the one that we have to sketch is this one which we get by reflecting this across the axis. Well not the axis, the diagonal.

顺便说一下，这个斜率应该稍微低一点，这样我们就可以让它上下移动。让我给你展示一下它的样子。从正面看，它看起来很像这个。所以这个向下弯曲，所以对角线上的反射向上弯曲。这里是向上弯曲的，所以反射会向下弯曲。它看起来会像这样。

This slope by the way, should be less a little lower here so that we can have it going down and up. So let me show you what it looks like. On the front, it’s going to look a lot like this one. So this one had curved down, and so the reflection across the diagonal curved up. Here this is curving up, so the reflection is going to curve down. It’s going to look like this.

也许我应该，抱歉，让我们使用不同的颜色，因为它与之前相反。我就叫它绿色吧。现在，第一象限中的原始曲线最终有一个向上的渐近线。所以这个将有一个水平的渐近线。那个水平是什么？最高点是什么？

Maybe I should, sorry, let’s use a different color, because it’s reversed from before. I’ll just call it green. Now, the original curve in the first quadrant eventually had an asymptote which was straight up. So this one is going to have an asymptote which is horizontal. And that level is what? What’s the highest?

它就是 pi/2。现在类似地，我们换一种方式，这样做：这个底层就是 pi/2。所以这是这个函数的图片。它对所有 x 都有定义。所以这个绿色的函数是 y = arctan x。它从负无穷到无穷都有定义。

It is just pi/2. Now similarly, the other way, we’re going to do this: and this bottom level is going to be pi/2. So there’s the picture of this function. It’s defined for all x. So this green guy is y = arctan x. And it’s defined all the way from minus infinity to infinity.

使用我们从极限符号中得到的符号，当 x 趋向无穷大时，假设 x 等于 pi/2。这是除了有限值之外的一个值得关注的值的示例。好的，现在我们需要的第一个要素是正切函数的导数。

And to use a notation that we had from limit notation as x goes to infinity, let’s say, x is equal to pi/2. That’s an example of one value that’s of interest in addition to the finite values. Okay, so now the first ingredient that we’re going to need, is we’re going to need the derivative of the tangent function.

我要提醒一下，也许你们还没有算出来，但我希望你们中的许多人已经算出来了，如果你对 y 取 tan y 的导数。所以这是通过商法则得到的。所以这是 u/v 的形式，对吧？你使用商法则。所以我会得到这个。

So I’m going to recall for you, and maybe you haven’t worked this out yet, but I hope that many of you have, that if you take the derivative with respect to y of tan y. So this you do by the quotient rule. So this is of the form u/v, right? You use the quotient rule. So I’m going to get this.

但最终你得到的是一些奇妙的简化，即 cos^2 y。1 除以余弦平方。你可以从分母中得到 v^2 这一事实来识别余弦平方，而分子不知何故全部取消并简化为 1。这也称为 y 的正割平方。所以如果你还没有做过，你必须把它作为练习来做。

But what you get in the end is some marvelous simplification that comes out to cos^2 y. 1 over cosine squared. You can recognize the cosine squared from the fact that you should get v^2 in the denominator, and somehow the numerators all cancel and simplifies to 1. This is also known as secant squared y. So that something that if you haven’t done yet, you’re going to have to do this as an exercise.

所以我们需要这个要素，现在我们要对方程式进行微分。结果是什么？我们再次得到，(d/dy tan y) 乘以 dy/dx 等于 1。或者，如果你愿意，1 / cos^2 y 乘以，在另一种表示法中，y' 等于 1。所以我刚刚使用了我刚刚写下的公式。现在我要做的就是解 y'。它是 cos^2 y。

So we need that ingredient, and now we’re just going to differentiate our equation. And what do we get? We get, again, (d/dy tan y) times dy/dx is equal to 1. Or, if you like, 1 / cos^2 y times, in the other notation, y’is equal to 1. So I’ve just used the formulas that I just wrote down there. Now all I have to do is solve for y’. It’s cos^2 y.

不幸的是，我们永远不想保留这种形式。这和我们在那个丑陋的平方根表达式或任何其他表达式中遇到的问题是一样的。我们想用 x 来重写。我们最初的问题是 arctan x 的 d/dx 是多少。现在我们对这个问题有了以下答案：它是 cos^2 (arctan x)。现在这是一个正确的答案，但太复杂了。

Unfortunately, this is not the form that we ever want to leave these things in. This is the same problem we had with that ugly square root expression, or with any of the others. We want to rewrite in terms of x. Our original question was what is d/dx of arctan x. Now so far we have the following answer to that question: it’s cos^2 (arctan x). Now this is a correct answer, but way too complicated.

这并不意味着如果你随机选取一组函数，你就不会得到如此复杂的东西。但是这些特定的函数，这些与三角函数有关的漂亮的圆形函数都有非常好的公式。这大大简化了。所以当你处理三角函数时，你需要培养的技能之一就是简化它。现在让我们看看，像这样的表达式都是简化的。让我们开始吧。

Now that doesn’t mean that if you took a random collection of functions, you wouldn’t end up with something this complicated. But these particular functions, these beautiful circular functions involved with trigonometry all have very nice formulas associated with them. And this simplifies tremendously. So one of the skills that you need to develop when you’re dealing with trig functions is to simplify this. And so let’s see now that expressions like this all simplify. So here we go.

只有一个公式，一个要素，我们需要使用它来实现这一点，然后我们将绘制一个图表。因此，要素仍然是原始定义关系 tan y = x。因此，tan y = x 可以按以下方式编码为直角三角形：这是直角三角形，tan y 表示 y 应该表示为一个角度。

There’s only one formula, one ingredient that we need to use to do this, and then we’re going to draw a diagram. So the ingredient again, is the original defining relationship that tan y = x. So tan y = x can be encoded in a right triangle in the following way: here’s the right triangle and tan y means that y should be represented as an angle.

然后，它的正切就是这条垂直边与这条水平边的比值。所以我只选择两个可行的值，即 x 和 1。这是最简单的值。所以我在这张图中编码了这个方程。现在我要做的就是找出这个直角三角形中 y 的余弦值。

And then, its tangent is the ratio of this vertical to this horizontal side. So I’m just going to pick two values that work, namely x and 1. Those are the simplest ones. So I’ve encoded this equation in this picture. And now all I have to do is figure out what the cosine of y is in this right triangle here.

为了做到这一点，我需要算出斜边是多少，但那只是 1 + x^2 的平方根。现在我可以读出 y 的余弦值。所以 y 的余弦值是 1 除以斜边。

In order to do that, I need to figure out what the hypotenuse is, but that’s just square root of 1 + x^2. And now I can read off what the cosine of y is. So the cosine of y is 1 divided by the hypotenuse.

所以它是 1 除以平方根，哎呀，是的，1 + x^2。所以余弦平方就是 1 / 1 + x^2。所以我们这里的答案，首选答案比我上面写的要简单得多，是 tan 逆 x 的 d/dx 等于 1 除以 1 + x^2。也许我会在这里停下来再问一个问题。我还有一个计算，我甚至可以在不到一分钟的时间内完成。

So it’s 1 over square root, whoops, yeah, 1 + x^2. And so cosine squared is just 1 / 1 + x^2. And so our answer over here, the preferred answer which is way simpler than what I wrote up there, is that d/dx of tan inverse x is equal to 1 over 1 + x^2. Maybe I’ll stop here for one more question. I have one more calculation which I can do even in less than a minute.

所以我们有整整一分钟的时间提问。是吗？学生：教授：反正切会怎样？反正切。好的，这个反正切和这里的 y 相同。它们是同一个东西。所以我做的是完全跳过了这一步。我从来没有写下来。但是反正切就是那个 y。问题是，用 x 来表示 cos y 的良好公式是什么？

So we have a whole minute for questions. Yeah? Student: Professor: What happens to the inverse tangent? The inverse tangent. Okay, this inverse tangent is the same as this y here. Those are the same thing. So what I did was I skipped this step here entirely. I never wrote that down. But the inverse tangent was that y. The issue was what’s a good formula for cos y in terms of x?

所以我要计算它，但我用的是字母 y。换句话说，反正切的结果是，我称它为 y，它一直都是这个样子。好的，现在我要计算正弦，即反正弦。如果我不费吹灰之力的话，我会向你们展示这是多么简单。因为这个有一个简单的三角恒等式与之相关。

So I am evaluating that, but I’m doing it using the letter y. So in other words, what happened to the inverse tangent is that I called it y, which is what it’s been all along. Okay, so now I’m going to do the case of the sine, the inverse sine. And I’ll show you how easy this is if I don’t fuss with. because this one has an easy trig identity associated with it.

因此，如果 y = sin^( 1) x，并且 sin y = x，现在看看当我进行微分时它是多么简单。我只需微分。我得到 (cos y) y' = 1。然后，y'这意味着 = 1 / cos y，现在要用 x 重写它，我必须认识到这与这个相同，这与 1 / 1 x^2 的平方根相同。总而言之，反正弦函数关于 x 的导数是 1 / 1 x^2 的平方根。因此这些隐式微分非常方便。

So if y = sin^( 1) x, and sin y = x, and now watch how simple it is when I do the differentiation. I just differentiate. I get (cos y) y’ = 1. And then, y’so that implies that = 1 / cos y, and now to rewrite that in terms of x, I have to just recognize that this is the same as this, which is the same as 1 / square root of 1 x^2. So all told, the derivative with respect to x of the arcsine function is 1 / square root of 1 x^2. So these implicit differentiations are very convenient.

但是，我警告你，你必须小心这些东西的适用范围。你必须画出像这样的图，以确保你知道这在什么地方有意义。换句话说，你必须为正弦函数选择一个分支来解决这个问题，你的问题集上就有类似的东西。这也在你的课文中讨论过。所以我们就到此为止。

However, I warn you that you do have to be careful about the range of applicability of these things. You have to draw a picture like this one to make sure you know where this makes sense. In other words, you have to pick a branch for the sine function to work that out, and there’s something like that on your problem set. And it’s also discussed in your text. So we’ll stop here.

Lec 6 | MIT 18.01 单变量微积分，2007 年秋季

Lec 6 | MIT 18.01 Single Variable Calculus, Fall 2007

16 年前 (2009 年 1 月 17 日) — 47:57 https://youtube.com/watch?v=9v25gg2qJYE

16 years ago (Jan 17, 2009) — 47:57 https://youtube.com/watch?v=9v25gg2qJYE

以下内容根据 Creative Commons 许可提供。您的支持将帮助 MIT OpenCourseWare 继续免费提供高质量的教育资源。要捐款或查看数百门 MIT 课程的其他材料，请访问 MIT OpenCourseWare，网址为 ocw.mit.edu。教授：好的，让我们开始第六讲。我们今天讨论指数和对数。

The following content is provided under a Creative Commons License. Your support will help MIT OpenCourseWare continue to offer high quality educational resources for free. To make a donation, or to view additional materials from hundreds of MIT courses, visit MIT OpenCourseWare at ocw.mit.edu. PROFESSOR: All right, so let’s begin lecture six. We’re talking today about exponentials and logarithms.

这些是我要介绍的最后一个函数，也是我们需要与微积分联系起来的最后一个标准函数，你们已经学过了。它们当然和三角函数一样基本，甚至比三角函数更基本。首先，我们从一个数字 a 开始，它是正数，通常称为基数。然后我们有这些属性，即 a 的 0 次方始终为 1。这就是我们的开始。

And these are the last functions that I need to introduce, the last standard functions that we need to connect with calculus, that you’ve learned about. And they’re certainly as fundamental, if not more so, than trigonometric functions. So first of all, we’ll start out with a number, a, which is positive, which is usually called a base. And then we have these properties that a to the power 0 is always 1. That’s how we get started.

并且 a^1 等于 a。当然，a^2 也毫不奇怪地等于 a 乘以 a，等等。一般规则是 a^(x_1 + x_2) 等于 a^(x_1) 乘以 a^(x_2)。所以这是指数的基本规则，有了这两个初始属性，就定义了指数函数。然后还有一个附加属性，从这些属性推导出来，即指数函数的复合，即取 a 的 x_1 次方，取 x_2 次方。

And a^1 is a. And of course a^2, not surprisingly, is a times a, etc. And the general rule is that a^(x_1 + x_2) is a^(x_1) times a^(x_2). So this is the basic rule of exponents, and with these two initial properties, that defines the exponential function. And then there’s an additional property, which is deduced from these, which is the composition of exponential functions, which is that you take a to the x_1 power, to the x_2 power.

那么结果是 a 到 x_1 乘以 x_2。所以这是我们认为理所当然的附加属性，你在高中就学过。现在，为了理解 a^x 的所有值，我们首先需要记住，如果你取有理数幂，它是两个整数 a 幂的比值。

Then that turns out to be a to the x_1 times x_2. So that’s an additional property that we’ll take for granted, which you learned in high school. Now, in order to understand what all the values of a^x are, we need to first remember that if you’re taking a rational power that it’s the ratio of two integers power of a.

这将是 a^m，然后我们必须取它的 n 次方根。这就是定义。然后，当你定义 a^x 时，a^x 对所有 x 的定义都是通过填充。所以我将使用引号中的表达式，“通过连续性填充”。这实际上是你的计算器在给出 a 的 x 次方时所做的，因为你甚至无法输入 x 的平方根。

That’s going to be a^m, and then we’re going to have to take the nth root of that. So that’s the definition. And then, when you’re defining a^x, so a^x is defined for all x by filling in. So I’m gonna use that expression in quotation marks, “filling in” by continuity. This is really what your calculator does when it gives you a to the power x, because you can’t even punch in the square root of x.

它实际上并不存在于您的计算器上。它有一些小数扩展。因此，它将小数扩展为一定长度，然后输出一个非常接近正确答案的数字。但实际上，理论上，2 的平方根幂有一个 a，即使 2 的平方根是无理数。圆周率也有 a，等等。

It doesn’t really exist on your calculator. There’s some decimal expansion. So it takes the decimal expansion to a certain length and spits out a number which is pretty close to the correct answer. But indeed, in theory, there is an a to the power square root of 2, even though the square root of 2 is irrational. And there’s a to the pi and so forth.

好的，这就是指数函数，我们来画一个图。我们试着假设 y = 2^x。我不会画这么精细的图，我们先画出最重要的点，也就是 (0,1) 点。也就是 2^0，也就是 1。然后我们再回到这里的 1。2 的 1 次方就是这里的这个点。这是 (1,1/2)，倒数。

All right, so that’s the exponential function, and let’s draw a picture of one. So we’ll try, say y = 2^x here. And I’m not going to draw such a careful graph, but let’s just plot the most important point, which is the point (0,1). That’s 2^0, which is 1. And then maybe we’ll go back up here to 1 here. And 2 to the 1 is this point here. This is ( 1,1/2), the reciprocal.

在这里，我们有 1，所以一直到 2。然后指数非常快。所以接下来在 2 时会发生什么就不得而知了。它已经超出了我的范围，但图表看起来像这样。好的。现在我至少在视觉上、图形上填写了所有其余的点。你必须想象所有这些有理数，等等。

And over here, we have 1, and so that goes all the way up to 2. And then exponentials are remarkably fast. So it’s off the board what happens next out at 2. It’s already above my range here, but the graph looks something like this. All right. Now I’ve just visually, at least, graphically filled in all the rest of the points. You have to imagine all these rational numbers, and so forth.

所以这里的这个点应该是 (1,2)。等等。好吗？所以这还不算太远。那么现在我们的目标是什么？显然我们想在这里做微积分。所以我们现在的目标在这里，这需要一段时间。我们必须认真思考。我们必须计算这个导数是多少。好的，我们开始吧。

So this point here would have been (1,2). And so forth. All right? So that’s not too far along. So now what’s our goal? Well, obviously we want to do calculus here. So our goal, here, for now and it’s gonna take a while. We have to think about it pretty hard. We have to calculate what this derivative is. All right, so we’ll get started.

我们开始的方法很简单，代入导数的定义。导数是 x 趋近于 0 时 a 到 x 的极限加上 x 的 delta x 减去 a 到 x 的 delta x，再除以 delta x。这就是导数。

And the way we get started is simply by plugging in the definition of the derivative. The derivative is the limit as delta x goes to 0 of a to the x plus delta x, minus a to the x, divided by delta x. So that’s what it is.

现在，我们真正能做的就是使用这里的第一个规则，让这个变得简单一点。总和的指数是指数的乘积。所以我们这里有 a^x，所以我想使用的只是属性 a^(x + delta x) = a^xa^(delta x)。

And now, the only step that we can really perform here to make this is into something a little bit simpler is to use this very first rule that we have here. That the exponential of the sum is the product of the exponentials. So we have here, a^x So what I want to use is just the property that a^(x + delta x) = a^x a^(delta x).

如果我这样做，我就会发现我可以分解出分子中的一个公因数，即 a^x。因此，我们将其写为当 delta x 趋近于 0 时，a 除以 x 的极限，乘以该比率，现在 a 除以 delta x，减 1，再除以 delta x。到目前为止，一切顺利吗？实际上，我们几乎已经取得了一些重大进展。因此，我们需要理解另一个重要的概念步骤。

And if I do that, I see that I can factor out a common factor in the numerator, which is a^x. So we’ll write this as the limit as delta x goes to 0, of a to the x times this ratio, now a to the delta x, minus 1, divided by delta x. So far, so good? We’re actually almost to some serious progress here. So there’s one other important conceptual step which we need to understand.

这是一个相对简单的问题。顺便说一下，我们以前确实这样做过。我们用正弦和余弦这样做过。接下来我想指出的是，你习惯于将 x 视为变量。事实上，我们已经讨论过 x 是变量，而 a 是固定的。但就这个极限而言，有一个不同的变量在移动。

And this is a relatively simple one. We actually did this before, by the way. We did this with sines and cosines. The next thing I want to point out to you is that you’re used to thinking of x as being the variable. And indeed, already we were discussing x as being the variable and a as being fixed. But for the purposes of this limit, there’s a different variable that’s moving.

X 是固定的，而 delta x 是移动的。所以这意味着这里的这个因子，也就是一个公共因子，是常数。我们可以将它从极限中分解出来。它根本不影响极限。常数乘以极限与我们在取极限之前或之后相乘是一样的。所以我要把它分解出来。所以这是我的下一步。

X is fixed and delta x is the thing that’s moving. So that means that this factor here, which is a common factor, is constant. And we can just factor it out of the limit. It doesn’t affect the limit at all. A constant times a limit is the same as whether we multiply before or after we take the limit. So I’m just going to factor that out. So that’s my next step here.

A^x，然后我有极限 delta x 从 a 的 0 变为 delta x 减 1，除以 delta x。好吗？所以我在这里得到的，根据定义，这是导数。所以这里是 a^x 的 d/dx，它等于这里的这个表达式。

A^x, and then I have the limit delta x goes to 0 of a to the delta x minus 1, divided by delta x. All right? And so what I have here, so this is by definition the derivative. So here is d/dx of a^x, and it’s equal to this expression here.

现在，我想盯着这个表达式，看看它告诉我们什么，因为它告诉了我们目前所能得到的所有信息，没有其他信息。所以首先让我们看看它说了什么。它说的是 a^x 的导数是 a^x 乘以我们还不知道的某个数。我将其称为这个神秘数字 M(a)。

Now, I want to stare at this expression, and see what it’s telling us, because it’s telling us as much as we can get so far, without some. So first let’s just look at what this says. So what it’s saying is that the derivative of a^x is a^x times something that we don’t yet know. And I’m going to call this something, this mystery number, M(a).

所以我要给 M(a) 贴上标签，它等于 delta x 趋近于 0 时的极限，即 delta x 减 1 除以 delta x。好吗？所以这是一个定义。所以这个神秘数字 M(a) 也有一个几何解释。让我来描述一下。它有一个几何解释，而且是一个非常非常重要的数字。让我们来算出它是什么。

So I’m gonna make the label, M(a) is equal to the limit as delta x goes to 0 of a to the delta x minus 1 divided by delta x. All right? So this is a definition. So this mystery number M(a) has a geometric interpretation, as well. So let me describe that. It has a geometric interpretation, and it’s a very, very significant number. So let’s work out what that is.

首先，让我们用这个数字的简写形式重写框中的表达式。如果我重写它，它表示 a^x 的 d/dx 等于这个因子，即 M(a) 乘以 a^x。因此指数的导数是这个神秘数字乘以 a^x。所以我们几乎解决了寻找 a^x 导数的问题。我们只需找出这个数字 M(a)，我们就能得到其余的。

So first of all, let’s rewrite the expression in the box, using the shorthand for this number. So if I just rewrite it, it says d/dx of a^x is equal to this factor, which is M(a), times a^x. So the derivative of the exponential is this mystery number times a^x. So we’ve almost solved the problem of finding the derivative of a^x. We just have to figure out this one number, M(a), and we get the rest.

所以让我再指出关于这个数字 M(a) 的两点。首先，如果我代入 x = 0，那将是 a^x 的 d/dx，在 x = 0 处。根据这个公式，那是 M(a) 乘以 a^0，当然是 M(a)。那么 M(a) 是什么？M(a) 是这个函数在 0 处的导数。所以 M(a) 是图中 x = 0 处 a^x 的斜率。

So let me point out two more things about this number, M(a). So first of all, if I plug in x = 0, that’s going to be d/dx of a^x,at x = 0. According to this formula, that’s M(a) times a^0, which of course M(a). So what is M(a)? M(a) is the derivative of this function at 0. So M(a) is the slope of a^x at x = 0, of the graph.

a^x 在 0 处的图形。如果你再看一下这幅图，我会在这里画一条切线，就是这里的这条。这个东西有斜率，我们称之为 M(2)。所以，如果我画出函数 y = 2^x 的图形，我会得到一个特定的斜率。如果我用不同的底数来画，我可能会得到另一个斜率。

The graph of a^x at 0. So again over here, if you looked at the picture. I’ll draw the one tangent line in here, which is this one here. And this thing has slope, what we’re calling M(2). So, if I graph the function y = 2^x, I’ll get a certain slope here. If I graph it with a different base, I might get another slope.

到目前为止，我们得到的是以下现象：如果我们知道这个数字，如果我们知道这个地方的斜率，我们就能找出其他地方的斜率公式。现在，这实际上和我们对正弦和余弦所做的完全一样。

And what we got so far is the following phenomenon: if we know this one number, if we know the slope at this one place, we will be able to figure out the formula for the slope everywhere else. Now, that’s actually exactly the same thing that we did for sines and cosines.

我们知道正弦函数和余弦函数在 x = 0 处的斜率。正弦函数的斜率为 1。余弦函数的斜率为 0。然后从求和公式，嗯，这正是这里的东西，从求和公式。这个求和公式实际上比正弦和余弦的公式更容易。从求和公式，我们算出了每个地方的斜率。

We knew the slope of the sine and the cosine function at x = 0. The sine function had slope 1. The cosine function had slope 0. And then from the sum formulas, well that’s exactly this kind of thing here, from the sum formulas. This sum formula, in fact is easier than the ones for sines and cosines. From the sum formulas, we worked out what the slope was everywhere.

因此，我们遵循与之前相同的程序。但此时我们陷入了困境。我们陷入了困境，因为当时使用弧度，这是几何学中非常巧妙的弧度概念，我们能够真正算出斜率是多少。而在这里，我们不太确定，例如，M(2) 是多少。我们还不知道。所以，我们现在要处理的基本问题是 M(a) 是多少？这就是我们剩下的问题。

So we’re following the same procedure that we did before. But at this point we’re stuck. We’re stuck, because that time using radians, this very clever idea of radians in geometry, we were able to actually figure out what the slope is. Whereas here, we’re not so sure, what M(2) is, for instance. We just don’t know yet. So, the basic question that we have to deal with right now is what is M(a)? That’s what we’re left with.

奇怪的是，聪明的做法是提出问题。所以我们要走一条非常迂回的路线。是迂回的，不是循环的。循环在数学里是个坏词。意思是一件事依赖于另一件事，另一件事又依赖于另一件事，也许两件事都是错的。迂回的意思是，我们要走一条迂回的路线。

And, the curious fact is that the clever thing to do is to beg the question. So we’re going to go through a very circular route here. That is circuitous, not circular. Circular is a bad word in math. That means that one thing depends on another, and that depends on it, and maybe both are wrong. Circuitous means, we’re going to be taking a roundabout route.

我们会发现，即使我们现在拒绝回答这个问题，我们最终也会成功回答它。好吗？那么我们该如何提出这个问题呢？我们要说的是，我们将定义一个神秘的基数或数字 e 作为唯一数字，这样 M(e) = 1。这就是我们要使用的技巧。

And we’re going to discover that even though we refuse to answer this question right now, we’ll succeed in answering it eventually. All right? So how are we going to beg the question? What we’re going to say instead is we’re going to define a mystery base, or number e, as the unique number, so that M(e) = 1. That’s the trick that we’re going to use.

我们还不知道 e 是什么，但我们假设我们有它。现在，我将向你们展示一系列由此得出的结论，而且我必须让你们相信它确实存在。所以首先，让我解释一下第一个结论是什么。

We don’t yet know what e is, but we’re just going to suppose that we have it. Now, I’m going to show you a bunch of consequences of this, and also I have to persuade you that it actually does exist. So first, let me explain what the first consequence is.

首先，如果 M(e) 为 1，那么如果你看一下这里的公式，并把它写下来表示 e，你就会得到一个非常有用的公式。e^x 的 d/dx 就是 e^x。好吧，这是一个非常重要的公式，也是最基本的公式。这是我们所做的唯一一个你必须记住的公式。所以也许我应该在这里用几种颜色突出显示它。这很重要。

First of all, if M(e) is 1, then if you look at this formula over here and you write it down for e, you have something which is a very usable formula. d/dx of e^x is just e^x. All right, so that’s an incredibly important formula which is the fundamental one. It’s the only one you have to remember from what we’ve done. So maybe I should have highlighted it in several colors here. That’s a big deal.

非常高兴。再次强调，这也是 x = 0 时斜率为 1 的那个。这就是我们定义它的方式，好吗？因此，如果您在右侧代入 x = 0，您将得到 1。x = 0 时的斜率为 1。这很棒。当然，由于我们不知道 e 是什么，所以这有点冒险。因此，在解释 e 是什么之前，接下来是。

Very happy. And again, let me just emphasize, also that this is the one which at x = 0 has slope 1. That’s the way we defined it, alright? So if you plug in x = 0 here on the right hand side, you got 1. Slope 1 at x = 0. So that’s great. Except of course, since we don’t know what e is, this is a little bit dicey. So, next even before explaining what e is.

事实上，直到本讲结束，我们才会知道 e 到底是什么。但我必须说服你们为什么 e 存在。我们必须对为什么我们知道有这样一个数字做出一些解释。好的，首先，让我从我们理应知道的函数 2^x 开始。我们称它为 f(x) 是 2^x。好吗？这是第一件事。

In fact, we won’t get to what e really is until the very end of this lecture. But I have to persuade you why e exists. We have to have some explanation for why we know there is such a number. Okay, so first of all, let me start with the one that we supposedly know, which is the function 2^x. We’ll call it f(x) is 2^x. All right? So that’s the first thing.

请记住，它具有的属性是 f'(0) 等于 M(2)。这是该函数的导数，即图像在 x = 0 处的斜率。也就是切线的斜率。现在，我们要考虑任何类型的拉伸。我们将把该函数拉伸一个因子 k。任何数字 k。所以我们要考虑的是 f(kx)。如果你这样做，它就等于 2^(kx)。对吧？

And remember, that the property that it had, was that f’(0) was M(2). That was the derivative of this function, the slope at x = 0 of the graph. Of the tangent line, that is. So now, what we’re going to consider is any kind of stretching. We’re going to stretch this function by a factor k. Any number k. So what we’re going to consider is f(kx). If you do that, that’s the same as 2^(kx). Right?

但是现在，如果我使用我之前提到的第二指数定律，它就等于 2 的 k 次方 x，也就是某个底数 b^x，其中 b 等于。我们把它写在这里。b 等于 2^k。对。

But now if I use the second law of exponents that I have over there, that’s the same thing as 2 to the k to the power x, which is the same thing as some base b^x, where b is equal to. Let’s write that down over here. b is 2^k. Right.

所以不管是什么，如果我有一个不同的基数，用 2 来表示，形式为 2^k，那么这个新函数就由这个函数 f(kx) 来描述，即拉伸。那么当你拉伸一个函数时会发生什么？这与收缩 x 轴是一样的。所以当 k 变大时，这里的对应点会在这里，所以这个对应点会在这里。

So whatever it is, if I have a different base which is expressed in terms of 2, of the form 2^k, then that new function is described by this function f(kx), the stretch. So what happens when you stretch a function? That’s the same thing as shrinking the x axis. So when k gets larger, this corresponding point over here would be over here, and so this corresponding point would be over here.

所以你把这幅图缩小，这里的斜率就会向上倾斜。所以，随着 k 的增加，斜率会越来越陡。让我们在这里用数字明确地看一下。如果我在这里求导数，那么用数字明确地看一下。所以 b^x 对 x 的导数，这就是链式法则，对吧？这是 f(kx) 对 x 的导数，它是什么？它是 k 乘以 f'(kx)。

So you shrink this picture, and the slope here tilts up. So, as we increase k, the slope gets steeper and steeper. Let’s see that explicitly, numerically, here. Explicitly, numerically, if I take the derivative here. So the derivative with respect to x of b^x, that’s the chain rule, right? That’s the derivative with respect to x of f(kx), which is what? It’s k times f’(kx).

因此，如果我们在 0 处执行此操作，我们只会得到 k 乘以 f'(0)，也就是 k 乘以这个 M(2)。那么我们究竟是如何计算出正确的底数 b 的呢？因此，当 k = 1 除以这个数字时，b = e。换句话说，我们可以选择我们想要的所有可能的斜率。这只是将斜率乘以一个因子。

And so if we do it at 0, we’re just getting k times f’(0), which is k times this M(2). So how is it exactly that we cook up the right base b? So b = e when k = 1 over this number. In other words, we can pick all possible slopes that we want. This just has the effect of multiplying the slope by a factor.

我们可以随意移动 0 处的斜率，我们将这样做，使斜率恰好与 1 匹配，这是我们想要的。我们仍然不知道 k 是多少。我们仍然不知道 e 是多少。但至少我们知道它就在某处。是吗？学生：你怎么知道它是 f(kx)？教授：我怎么知道？嗯，f(x) 是 2^x。

And we can shift the slope at 0 however we want, and we’re going to do it so that the slope exactly matches 1, the one that we want. We still don’t know what k is. We still don’t know what e is. But at least we know that it’s there somewhere. Yes? Student: How do you know it’s f(kx)? PROFESSOR: How do I know? Well, f(x) is 2^x.

如果 f(x) 是 2^x，那么 f(kx) 的公式是这样的。我确定了 f(x) 是什么，因此 f(kx) 有一个公式。此外，根据链式法则，有一个导数公式。它是 f 导数的 k 倍。因此，再次强调，缩放可以实现这一点。顺便说一下，我们对正弦和余弦函数做了完全相同的事情。

If f(x) is 2^x, then the formula for f(kx) is this. I’ve decided what f(x) is, so therefore there’s a formula for f(kx). And furthermore, by the chain rule, there’s a formula for the derivative. And it’s k times the derivative of f. So again, scaling does this. By the way, we did exactly the same thing with the sine and cosine function.

如果你在这里想到正弦函数，让我提醒你一下，链式法则会发生什么，你会得到 k 乘以余弦 kt。事实上，我们用弧度来设置这个东西，但我们可以通过适当的因子 k 将比例更改为任何值，例如度。然后会有这个导数公式的比例因子偏移。

If you think of the sine function here, let me just remind you here, what happens with the chain rule, you get k times cosine k t here. So the fact that we set things up beautifully with radians that this thing is, but we could change the scale to anything, such as degrees, by the appropriate factor k. And then there would be this scale factor shift of the derivative formulas.

当然，弧度的那个比较简单，因为因子是 1。度的那个就很糟糕，因为因子是一个疯狂的数字，比如 180/π，或者类似的数字。好吧，这里发生的事情与那种重新缩放完全相同。所以，到目前为止，我们只有一个公式值得保留。就是这个。

Of course, the one with radians is the easy one, because the factor is 1. The one with degrees is horrible, because the factor is some crazy number like 180 over pi, or something like that. Okay, so there’s something going on here which is exactly the same as that kind of re scaling. So, so far we’ve got only one formula which is a keeper here. This one.

我们有一个初步公式，我们还没有完全解释清楚，它上面有一条小波浪线。我们必须把所有这些放在一起。好的，现在为了把它们放在一起，我需要引入自然对数。自然对数的表示方式是 ln(x)。所以也许我会给它起一个新的字母名，我们在这里称之为 w = ln x。

We have a preliminary formula that we still haven’t completely explained which has a little wavy line there. And we have to fit all these things together. Okay, so now to fit them together, I need to introduce the natural log. So the natural log is denoted this way, ln(x). So maybe I’ll call it a new letter name, we’ll call it w = ln x here.

但是如果我们把事情反过来，如果我们从函数 y = e^x 开始，它所具有的属性就是它是 e^x 的反函数。所以它具有 y 的对数等于 x 的属性。对吗？所以这定义了对数。现在对数具有一系列属性，它们原则上来自指数属性。你们记得这些。我只是要提醒你们它们。

But if we were reversing things, if we started out with a function y = e^x,the property that it would have is that it’s the inverse function of e^x. So it has the property that the log of y is equal to x. Right? So this defines the log. Now the logarithm has a bunch of properties and they come from the exponential properties in principle. You remember these. And I’m just going to remind you of them.

所以我只想提醒你的主要一点是 x_1 * x_2 的对数等于 x_1 的对数加上 x_2 的对数。也许还有几个值得提醒你。一个是 1 的对数是 0。第二个是 e 的对数是 1。好吗？所以这些对应于这里的逆关系。

So the main one that I just want to remind you of is that the logarithm of x_1 * x_2 is equal to the logarithm of x_1 plus the logarithm of x_2. And maybe a few more are worth reminding you of. One is that the logarithm of 1 is 0. A second is that the logarithm of e is 1. All right? So these correspond to the inverse relationships here.

如果我在这里代入，x = 0 和 x = 1。如果我代入 x = 0 和 x = 1，我会得到相应的数字：y = 1 和 y = e。也许值得绘制一次图片来强化这一点。所以在这里我将它们放在同一张图表上。如果你在这里有 e^x。它看起来像这样。

If I plug in here, x = 0 and x = 1. If I plug in x = 0 and x = 1, I get the corresponding numbers here: y = 1 and y = e. And maybe it would be worth it to plot the picture once to reinforce this. So here I’ll put them on the same chart. If you have here e^x over here. It looks like this.

然后是对数，我可能会用不同的颜色表示。所以它与这里非常重要的点 (0,1) 相交。现在为了找出反函数，我必须沿对角线 x = y 翻转。这就是这里的形状，像这样向下。这是点 (1,0)。所以 (1,0) 对应于这里的这个恒等式。

Then the logarithm which I’ll maybe put in a different color. So this crosses at this all important point here, (0,1). And now in order to figure out what the inverse function is, I have to take the flip across the diagonal x = y. So that’s this shape here, going down like this. And here’s the point (1,0). So (1,0) corresponds to this identity here.

但是 1 的对数是 0。注意，这是 ln x，ln x 的图形。注意它只对 x 正数有定义，这对应于 e^x 总是正数。换句话说，这条白色曲线只在这个轴的上方，橙色曲线在右边。它只对 x 正数有定义。

But the log of 1 is 0. And notice, so this is ln x, the graph of ln x. And notice it’s only defined for x positive, which corresponds to the fact that e^x is always positive. So in other words, this white curve is only above this axis, and the orange one is to the right here. It’s only defined for x positive.

哦，还有一件事我要提一下，这里的斜率是 1。所以那里的斜率也将是 1。现在，我们可以相对轻松地计算对数的导数，因为我们有工具可以做到这一点。因此，要找到对数的导数，我们将使用隐式微分。这就是我们找到任何反函数的导数的方法。

Oh, one other thing I should mention is the slope here is 1. And so the slope there is also going to be 1. Now, what we’re allowed to do relatively easily, because we have the tools to do it, is to compute the derivative of the logarithm. So to find the derivative of a log, we’re going to use implicit differentiation. This is how we find the derivative of any inverse function.

所以请记住，工作原理是，如果你知道函数的导数，你就可以找到反函数的导数。机制如下：你在这里写下 w = ln x。这是函数。我们试图找到 w 的导数。但现在我们不知道如何区分这个方程，但如果我们对其进行指数运算，那么这与 e^w = x 是一样的。

So remember the way that works is if you know the derivative of the function, you can find the derivative of the inverse function. And the mechanism is the following: you write down here w = ln x. Here’s the function. We’re trying to find the derivative of w. But now we don’t know how to differentiate this equation, but if we exponentiate it, so that’s the same thing as e^w = x.

因为让我们把它放在这里。e^(ln x) = x。现在我们可以对它进行微分。所以让我们在这里进行微分。我们有 d/dx e^w 等于 d/dx x，也就是 1。然后根据链式法则，这是 d/dw 乘以 e^w 乘以 dw/dx。这两个因数的乘积。等于 1。现在这个家伙，我们实际上知道并可以使用的那个小家伙，就是这里的这个家伙。

Because let’s just stick this in here. e^(ln x) = x. Now we can differentiate this. So let’s do the differentiation here. We have d/dx e^w is equal to d/dx x, which is 1. And then this, by the chain rule, is d/dw of e^w times dw/dx. The product of these two factors. That’s equal to 1. And now this guy, the one little guy that we actually know and can use, that’s this guy here.

所以这是 e^w 乘以 dw/dx，等于 1。最后，dw/dx = 1 / e^w 但那是什么？是 x。所以这是 1/x。我们发现，现在我要在这里放另一个绿色的家伙，它等于 1/x。好吧，现在我们有两个配套公式。ln x 的变化率为 1/x。

So this is e^w times dw/dx, which is 1. And so finally, dw/dx = 1 / e^w But what is that? It’s x. So this is 1/x. So what we discovered is, and now I get to put another green guy around here, is that this is equal to 1/x. So alright, now we have two companion formulas here. The rate of change of ln x is 1/x.

e^x 的变化率本身就是 e^x。现在我们回到之前遇到的那个问题，这个问题有点不明确，就是 M(a) 乘以 x。我们现在要对一般的 a^x 进行微分，而不仅仅是 e^x

And the rate of change of e^x is itself, is e^x. And it’s time to return to the problem that we were having a little bit of trouble with, which is somewhat not explicit, which is this M(a) times x. We want to now differentiate a^x in general, not just e^x

让我们来解决这个问题，我想用几种方法解释一下，所以你必须记住这一点，因为我要把它擦掉。但我希望你做的是，现在我想教你如何区分基本上任何指数。现在要区分任何指数。有两种方法。它们实际上是相同的方法。它们的算术量相同。

So let’s work that out, and I want to explain it in a couple of ways, so you’re going to have to remember this, because I’m going to erase it. But what I’d like you to do is, so now I want to teach you how to differentiate basically any exponential. So now to differentiate any exponential. There are two methods. They’re practically the same method. They have the same amount of arithmetic.

您将看到这两种方法，它们的价值相同。因此我们将仅描述它们。方法一，我将在函数 a^x 上进行说明。因此，我们感兴趣的是区分这个东西，正是我尚未解决的这个问题。好吗？这就是它。这是程序。程序是写入，因此方法是使用 e 进制，或转换为 e 进制。那么如何转换为 e 进制？

You’ll see both of them, and they’re equally valuable. So we’re going to just describe them. Method one I’m going to illustrate on the function a^x. So we’re interested in differentiating this thing, exactly this problem that I still didn’t solve yet. Okay? So here it is. And here’s the procedure. The procedure is to write, so the method is to use base e, or convert to base e. So how do you convert to base e?

好吧，你把 a^x 写成 e 的某个幂。那么它的幂是多少呢？它是 e 的 ln a 次方，即 x 次方。这就是 e^(x ln a)。所以我们现在已将其转换为以 e 为底的数。某个数的指数。所以现在我要进行微分。所以 a^x 的 d/dx 等于 e^(x ln a) 的 d/dx。

Well, you write a^x as e to some power. So what power is it? It’s e to the power ln a, to the power x. And that is just e^(x ln a). So we’ve made our conversion now to base e. The exponential of something. So now I’m going to carry out the differentiation. So d/dx of a^x is equal to d/dx of e^(x ln a).

现在，这是你第一次看到时会引起极大困惑的一个步骤。你必须习惯它，因为它很简单，并不难。好吗？这个相对于 x 的变化率是，让我在这里用类比来做。因为假设我有 e^(3x) 并且我正在对它进行微分。链式法则会说这只是 3，即 3x 相对于 x 乘以 e^(3x) 的变化率。

And now, this is a step which causes great confusion when you first see it. And you must get used to it, because it’s easy, not hard. Okay? The rate of change of this with respect to x is, let me do it by analogy here. Because say I had e^(3x) and I were differentiating it. The chain rule would say that this is just 3, the rate of change of 3x with respect to x times e^(3x).

e 相对于 u 的变化率。所以这是普通的链式法则。我们在这里做的是完全相同的事情，因为 ln a，虽然看起来很吓人，有三个字母，但它只是一个固定的数字。它没有移动。它是一个常数。所以常数只是将变化率加速了那个因子，这就是链式法则的作用。

The rate of change of e to the u with respect to u. So this is the ordinary chain rule. And what we’re doing up here is exactly the same thing, because ln a, as frightening as it looks, with all three letters there, is just a fixed number. It’s not moving. It’s a constant. So the constant just accelerates the rate of change by that factor, which is what the chain rule is doing.

所以这等于 ln a 乘以 e^(x ln a)。这里用 ln a 代替 3 也是一样的。所以你必须在考试前习惯这一点，因为你要做一百万次这样的运算。所以一定要习惯它。这是公式。另一方面，这里的表达式与 a^x 相同。

So this is equal to ln a times e^(x ln a). Same business here with ln a replacing 3. So this is something you’ve got to get used to in time for the exam, for instance, because you’re going to be doing a million of these. So do get used to it. So here’s the formula. On the other hand, this expression here was the same as a^x.

另一种写法是，我会把它放到一个框里，但实际上我从来不记得这一点。我每次都重新推导它，即 a^x 的导数等于 (ln a) a^x 现在我要去掉它下面的内容。所以这是另一个公式。所以这就是我在这里基本上完成的公式。注意，神奇数字是什么？神奇数字是 a 的自然对数。

So another way of writing this, and I’ll put this into a box, but actually I never remember this particularly. I just re derive it every time, is that the derivative of a^x is equal to (ln a) a^x Now I’m going to get rid of what’s underneath it. So this is another formula. So there’s the formula I’ve essentially finished here. And notice, what is the magic number? The magic number is the natural log of a.

就是这样。我们事先不知道它是什么。这就是它。它是 a 的自然对数。让我再次向你强调一下，这里发生的事情与尺度变化有关。例如，2^x 对 x 的导数是 (ln 2.2^x。

That’s what it was. We didn’t know what it was in advance. This is what it is. It’s the natural log of a. Let me emphasize to you again, something about what’s going on here, which has to do with scale change. So, for example, the derivative with respect to x of 2^x is (ln 2.2^x.

关于 x 的导数（这两个是最明显的底数，你可能想要使用）是 ln 10 乘以 10^x。因此，自然对数的一个自然之处是，即使我们坚持必须使用底数 2，或者必须使用底数 10，我们仍然会使用自然对数。它们自然而然地出现。

The derivative with respect to x, these are the two most obvious bases that you might want to use, is ln 10 times 10^x So one of the things that’s natural about the natural logarithm is that even if we insisted that we must use base 2, or that we must use base 10, we’d still be stuck with natural logarithms. They come up naturally.

它们独立于人类对 2 和 10 的基数构造。自然对数是没有参考的。稍后我们将提到其他几种自然对数的方法。我告诉过你们第一种方法，现在我想告诉你们第二种方法。第二种方法称为对数微分。那么它是如何工作的呢？

They’re the ones which are independent of our human construct of base 2 and base 10. The natural logarithm is the one that comes up without reference. And we’ll be mentioning a few other ways in which it’s natural later. So I told you about this first method, now I want to tell you about a second method here. So the second is called logarithmic differentiation. So how does this work?

嗯，有时你很难区分一个函数，而区分它的对数却更容易。这可能看起来很奇怪，但实际上我们会给出几个例子，很明显，对数比函数更容易区分。所以这可能是一个更容易理解的量。所以我们想把它与函数 u 联系起来。所以我要用一种稍微不同的方式来写它。

Well, sometimes you’re having trouble differentiating a function, and it’s easier to differentiate its logarithm. That may seem peculiar, but actually we’ll give several examples where this is clearly the case, that the logarithm is easier to differentiate than the function. So it could be that this is an easier quantity to understand. So we want to relate it back to the function u. So I’m going to write it a slightly different way.

让我们用素数的形式来写。所以基本恒等式又是链式法则，对数的导数，好吧，也许我会先这样写出来。所以这将是 d ln u / du，乘以 d/dx u。这是两个因数。这是同一件事，所以记住对数的导数是什么。这是 1/u。所以这里有 1/u，这里有 du/dx。

Let’s write it in terms of primes here. So the basic identity is the chain rule again, and the derivative of the logarithm, well maybe I’ll write it out this way first. So this would be d ln u / du, times d/dx u. These are the two factors. And that’s the same thing, so remember what the derivative of the logarithm is. This is 1/u. So here I have a 1/u, and here I have a du/dx.

所以我将在下一块板上对此进行编码，这是你始终需要记住的主要公式，即 (ln u)' = u' / u。这是这里要记住的。学生：教授：问题是我如何得到这一步？所以这是链式法则。

So I’m going to encode this on the next board here, which is sort of the main formula you always need to remember, which is that (ln u)’ = u’ / u. That’s the one to remember here. STUDENT: PROFESSOR:. The question is how did I get this step here? So this is the chain rule.

ln u 相对于 x 的变化率是 ln u 相对于 u 的变化率乘以 u 相对于 x 的变化率。这就是链式法则。现在我已经算出了这个恒等式，现在让我们展示它如何处理这种情况，d/dx a^x。让我们来做这个。因此，为了得到这个恒等式，我会取 u = a^x

The rate of change of ln u with respect to x is the rate of change of ln u with respect u, times the rate of change of u with respect to x. That’s the chain rule. So now I’ve worked out this identity here, and now let’s show how it handles this case, d/dx a^x. Let’s do this one. So in order to get that one, I would take u = a^x

现在我们来看看 ln u 是什么。ln u = x ln a。现在我认为这个很容易区分。同样，这看起来很难，但实际上相当容易。所以也许有人可以猜一下。x ln a 的导数是什么？它就是 ln a。

And now let’s just take a look at what ln u is. ln u = x ln a. Now I claim that this is pretty easy to differentiate. Again, it may seem hard, but it’s actually quite easy. So maybe somebody can hazard a guess. What’s the derivative of x ln a? It’s just ln a.

所以这和我之前说的是一样的，如果你有 3x，你在这里对 x 求导，结果就是 3。这就是你得到的结果。再说一次，不要被这堆垃圾吓到。它是一个常数。所以再说一次，记住这一点。它经常出现在这种问题中。所以这就是我们的公式，对数导数是这样的。

So this is the same thing that I was talking about before, which is if you’ve got 3x, and you’re taking its derivative with respect to x here, that’s just 3. That’s the kind of thing you have. Again, don’t be put off by this massive piece of junk here. It’s a constant. So again, keep that in mind. It comes up regularly in this kind of question. So there’s our formula, that the logarithmic derivative is this.

但是让我们重写一下。这与 u' / u 相同，即 (ln u)' = ln a，对吗？这就是我们的微分公式。所以这里我们有 u'。如果我将其乘以 u，u' 等于 u 乘以 ln a。这就是我们想要的。这就是 d/dx a^x 等于 ln a（我将反转两者的顺序，这是惯例）乘以 a^x。

But let’s just rewrite that. That’s the same thing as u’ / u, which is (ln u)’ = ln a, right? So this is our differentiation formula. So here we have u’. u’ is equal to u times ln a, if I just multiply through by u. And that’s what we wanted. That’s d/dx a^x is equal to ln a (I’ll reverse the order of the two, which is customary) times a^x.

这就是对数微分的工作原理。它与前一种方法的算法相同，但我们不必转换为以 e 为底的数。我们只需跟踪指数并对指数进行微分，最后进行乘法。好的，我将举两个更棘手的例子来说明对数微分。同样，使用以 e 为底的数也可以同样好地完成这些操作，但我不会这样做。

So this is the way that logarithmic differentiation works. It’s the same arithmetic as the previous method, but we don’t have to convert to base e. We’re just keeping track of the exponents and doing differentiation on the exponents, and multiplying through at the end. Okay, so I’m going to do two trickier examples, which illustrate logarithmic differentiation. Again, these could be done equally well by using base e, but I won’t do it.

方法一和方法二总是有效的。这是第二个例子：当你有移动指数时，这又是一个问题。但这次，我们将通过移动指数和移动底数来使问题复杂化。所以我们有一个函数 u，好吧，我可能称之为 v，因为我们已经有一个函数 u，它是 x^x。这是一个看起来非常复杂的函数。

Method one and method two always both work. So here’s a second example: again this is a problem when you have moving exponents. But this time, we’re going to complicate matters by having both a moving exponent and a moving base. So we have a function u, which is, well maybe I’ll call it v, since we already had a function u, which is x^x. A really complicated looking function here.

因此，您可以再次通过转换为底数 e 来处理这个问题，这是方法一。但是我们将进行对数微分版本，好吗？所以我取两边的对数。现在我对其进行微分。现在，当我在这里对其进行微分时，我必须使用乘积规则。这一次，我没有使用常数 ln a，而是使用变量。所以我有两个因数。当我对 x 进行微分时，我有 ln x。

So again you can handle this by converting to base e, method one. But we’ll do the logarithmic differentiation version, alright? So I take the logs of both sides. And now I differentiate it. And now when I differentiate this here, I have to use the product rule. This time, instead of having ln a, a constant, I have a variable here. So I have two factors. I have ln x when I differentiate with respect to x.

当我对这里的这个因子求导时，我得到了 x 乘以它的导数，也就是 1/x。所以，这是我的公式。快完成了。所以我这里有 v' / v。我要把这两个数字相乘。我会把它放在另一边，因为我不想把它和 ln(x+1) 这个量混淆。现在我快完成了。

When I differentiate with respect to this factor here, I get that x times the derivative of that, which is 1/x. So, here’s my formula. Almost finished. So I have here v’ / v. I’m going to multiply these two things together. I’ll put it on the other side, because I don’t want to get it mixed up with ln(x+1), the quantity. And now I’m almost done.

我有 v' = v (1 + ln x)，这就是 d/dx x^x = x^x (1 + ln x)。就是这样。因此，这两种方法对于移动指数始终有效。因此，接下来我想做的是另一个相当棘手的例子。严格来说，这个例子并不属于微积分。

I have v’ = v (1 + ln x), and that’s just d/dx x^x = x^x (1 + ln x). That’s it. So these two methods always work for moving exponents. So the next thing that I’d like to do is another fairly tricky example. And this one is not strictly speaking within calculus.

虽然我们将使用刚刚描述的工具来实现它，但实际上最终还是会用到一些微积分。我要做的是，当 n 趋向无穷大时，我将求 (1 + 1/n)^n 的极限。现在，我想讨论这个问题的原因是，它有一个非常有趣的答案。

Although we’re going to use the tools that we just described to carry it out, in fact it will use some calculus in the very end. And what I’m going to do is I’m going to evaluate the limit as n goes to infinity of (1 + 1/n)^n. So now, the reason why I want to discuss this is, is it turns out to have a very interesting answer.

这个问题正是可以用这种方法解决的。原因是它有一个移动指数。这里的指数 n 是变化的。所以如果你想跟踪它，一个好方法是使用对数。

And it’s a problem that you can approach exactly by this method. And the reason is that it has a moving exponent. The exponent n here is changing. And so if you want to keep track of that, a good way to do that is to use logarithms.

因此，为了找出这个极限，我们要对它取对数，然后找出对数的极限，而不是极限的对数。它们是一回事。因此，我们要对这个量取自然对数，即 n ln(1 + 1/n)。

So in order to figure out this limit, we’re going to take the log of it and figure out what the limit of the log is, instead of the log of the limit. Those will be the same thing. So we’re going to take the natural log of this quantity here, and that’s n ln(1 + 1/n).

现在我要以一种更易于识别的形式重写它，所以我想做的是，我要写 n，或者我应该这样说：delta x 等于 1/n。所以如果 n 趋向于无穷大，那么这个 delta x 将趋向于 0。所以无论如何，这对我们这门课的人来说是更熟悉的领域。所以让我们重写它。

And now I’m going to rewrite this in a form which will make it more recognizable, so what I’d like to do is I’m going to write n, or maybe I should say it this way: delta x is equal to 1/n. So if n is going to infinity, then this delta x is going to be going to 0. So this is more familiar territory for us in this class, anyway. So let’s rewrite it.

因此，这里，我们有 1 除以 delta x。然后将其乘以 ln(1 + delta x)。因此，n 是 delta x 的倒数。现在，我想对它进行非常非常小的改变。我要从中减去 0。所以这是相同的。所以我要做的是从中减去 ln 1。

So here, we have 1 over delta x. And then that is multiplied by ln(1 + delta x). So n is the reciprocal of delta x. Now I want to change this in a very, very minor way. I’m going to subtract 0 from it. So that’s the same thing. So what I’m going to do is I’m going to subtract ln 1 from it.

这等于 0。所以这不是问题，我会在它周围加上一些括号。现在你应该突然意识到这符合什么模式。这是我们计算对数函数导数时需要计算的东西。所以，当 delta x 趋于 0 时，这等于 ln x 的导数。在哪里？

That’s just equal to 0. So this is not a problem, and I’ll put some parentheses around it. Now you’re supposed to recognize, all of a sudden, what pattern this fits into. This is the thing which we need to calculate in order to calculate the derivative of the log function. So this is, in the limit as delta x goes to 0, equal to the derivative of ln x. Where?

基点是 x=1。这就是我们要求值的地方。这就是 x_0。这就是基值。所以这是差商。这就是它。所以根据定义，这趋向于这里的极限。但我们知道对数函数的导数是什么。对数函数的导数是 1/x。所以这个极限是 1。所以我们得到了它。我们得到了极限。

Well the base point is x=1. That’s where we’re evaluating it. That’s the x_0. That’s the base value. So this is the difference quotient. That’s exactly what it is. And so this by definition tends to the limit here. But we know what the derivative of the log function is. The derivative of the log function is 1/x. So this limit is 1. So we got it. We got the limit.

现在我们只需反向推导，找出我们在这里得到的极限。让我们这样做。让我们看看这里。对数趋近于 1。因此，当 n 趋近于无穷大时，极限为 (1 + 1/n)^n。抱歉，这个的对数。是的，让我们这样写。这也是同样的事情，我们知道的是这个的对数。

And now we just have to work backwards to figure out what this limit that we’ve got over here is. So let’s do that. So let’s see here. The log approached 1. So the limit as n goes to infinity of (1 + 1/n)^n. So sorry, the log of this. Yeah, let’s write it this way. It’s the same thing, as well, the thing that we know is the log of this.

1 加 1 除以 n，直到无穷大。这是我们刚刚算出来的。但现在这个是它的指数。所以它实际上是 e 的这个幂。所以这个东西和这个东西极限的对数的极限相同，它和极限的对数相同。对数的极限和极限的对数是相同的。

1 plus 1 over n to the n. And goes to infinity. That’s the one that we just figured out. But now this thing is the exponential of that. So it’s really e to this power here. So this guy is the same as the limit of the log of the limit of the thing, which is the same as log of the limit. The limit of the log and the log of the limit are the same.

Log lim 等于 lim log。好的，我取对数，然后取指数。这就取消了我之前所做的。所以这个极限就是 1，所以这是 e^1。所以我们想要的极限等于 e。所以我声称，通过这一步，我们终于完成了闭环。因为我们有一个诚实的数值方法来计算 e。第一个。有很多这样的方法。

Log lim equals lim log. Okay, so I take the logarithm, then I’m going to take the exponential. That just undoes what I did before. And so this limit is just 1, so this is e^1. And so the limit that we want here is equal to e. So I claim that with this step, we’ve actually closed the loop, finally. Because we have an honest numerical way to calculate e. The first. There are many such.

但这是计算 e 的一个非常诚实的数值方法。我们有这个东西。我们不知道它到底是什么。它是这个 M(e)，有 M(a)，对数等等。我们有所有这些东西。但我们真的需要确定这个数字 e 是什么。

But this one is a perfectly honest numerical way to calculate e. We had this thing. We didn’t know exactly what it was. It was this M(e), there was M(a), the logarithm, and so on. We have all that stuff. But we really need to nail down what this number e is.

这告诉我们，如果你取 1 加 1/100 的 100 次方，这将是一个非常好的、非常合适的近似值。所以这是一个数值近似值，这是我们对这种无理数所能做的一切。

And this is telling us, if you take for example 1 plus 1 over 100 to the 100th power, that’s going to be a very good, perfectly decent anyway, approximation to e. So this is a numerical approximation, which is all we can ever do with just this kind of irrational number.

这样就完成了整个循环，我们现在有了一个连贯的函数族，这些函数实际上定义明确，并且我们有实用的计算方法。好的，下次再见。

And so that closes the loop, and we now have a coherent family of functions, which are actually well defined and for which we have practical methods to calculate. Okay, see you next time.

第 7 课：考试 1 复习 | MIT 18.01 单变量微积分，2007 年秋季

Lec 7: Exam 1 review | MIT 18.01 Single Variable Calculus, Fall 2007

16 年前 (2009 年 1 月 17 日) — 50:53 https://youtube.com/watch?v=eHJuAByQf5A

16 years ago (Jan 17, 2009) — 50:53 https://youtube.com/watch?v=eHJuAByQf5A

以下内容根据 Creative Commons 许可提供。您的支持将帮助 MIT OpenCourseWare 继续免费提供高质量的教育资源。要捐款或查看数百门 MIT 课程的其他材料，请访问 MIT OpenCourseWare，网址为 ocw.mit.edu。教授：现在，我们即将结束第一单元，我想继续讲第七讲，最后谈谈指数。

The following content is provided under a Creative Commons license. Your support will help MIT OpenCourseWare continue to offer high quality educational resources for free. To make a donation, or to view additional material from hundreds of MIT courses, visit MIT OpenCourseWare at ocw.mit.edu. PROFESSOR: Right now, we’re finishing up with the first unit, and I’d like to continue in this lecture, lecture seven, with some final remarks about exponents.

所以我想做的只是回顾一下我上次快速做过的事情，并对此发表一些哲学评论。我认为所涉及的步骤可能有点棘手，所以我想再讲一遍。请记住，我们讨论的是这个数字 a_k，即 (1 + 1/k)^k。我们展示的是，当 k 趋向无穷大时，a_k 的极限是 e。

So what I’d like to do is just review something that I did quickly last time, and make a few philosophical remarks about it. I think that the steps involved were maybe a little tricky, and so I’d like to go through it one more time. Remember, that we were talking about this number a_k, which is (1 + 1/k)^k. And what we showed was that the limit as k goes to infinity of a_k was e.

因此，我想做的第一件事就是用更少的符号，或者至少用这里的符号缩写，比上次更清楚地解释一下证明，向你们展示我们实际上做了什么。所以我只是提醒你们我们上次做了什么，第一个观察结果是检查，而不是这个函数的极限，而是先取对数。

So the first thing that I’d like to do is just explain the proof a little bit more clearly than I did last time with fewer symbols, or at least with this abbreviation of the symbol here, to show you what we actually did. So I’ll just remind you of what we did last time, and the first observation was to check, rather than the limit of this function, but to take the log first.

这通常是指数函数的典型做法。我们发现，当 k 趋向无穷大时，这里的极限是 1。所以上次我们就是这么做的。我只是想小心一点，向你们展示下一步到底是什么。如果你对这个事实取幂，你取 e 的这个幂，它会趋向于 e^1，也就是 e。
