To make a donation, or to view additional materials from hundreds of MIT courses, visit MIT OpenCourseWare at ocw.mit.edu. PROFESSOR: OK, we’re ready to start the eleventh lecture. We’re still in the middle of sketching.

事实上，我们没有讨论双曲函数的原因之一是我们有点落后了。我们今天会稍微赶上一点。我希望下周二能赶上。所以，让我从我们上次停下的地方继续讲，画草图。所以这是一个延续。我想再给你们举一个如何画草图的例子。然后我们会系统地讲解。

And, indeed, one of the reasons why we did not talk about hyperbolic functions is this that we’re running just a little bit behind. And we’ll catch up a tiny bit today. And I hope all the way on Tuesday of next week. So let me pick up where we left off, with sketching. So this is a continuation. I want to give you one more example of how to sketch things. And then we’ll go through it systematically.

上次我们举的第二个例子是这样的。函数是 x + 1 / x + 2。我现在要节省你们的时间。这对我来说很典型，特别是如果你在考试时很着急，我会直接告诉你导数是什么。

So the second example that we did as one example last time, is this. The function is x + 1 / x + 2. And I’m going to save you the time right now. This is very typical of me, especially if you’re in a hurry on an exam, I’ll just tell you what the derivative is.

所以在这种情况下，它是 1 / (x + 2)^2。现在，我之所以举这个例子，尽管它会是一个相对简单的示例，是因为这个问题很容易陷入黑洞。所以让我给你展示一下。这不等于 0。它永远不会等于 0。所以这意味着没有临界点。

So in this case, it’s 1 / (x + 2)^2. Now, the reason why I’m bringing this example up, even though it’ll turn out to be a relatively simple one to sketch, is that it’s easy to fall into a black hole with this problem. So let me just show you. This is not equal to 0. It’s never equal to 0. So that means there are no critical points.

到了这个地步，学生们，很多像猴子一样被训练得完全听话的学生，突然就呆住了，放弃了。因为没什么可做的。所以这是我要训练你们的一件事。你不能在这个时候就放弃。那么你有什么建议呢？有人能帮我们摆脱这种困境吗？是的。学生：教授：对。

At this point, students, many students who have been trained like monkeys to do exactly what they’ve been told, suddenly freeze and give up. Because there’s nothing to do. So this is the one thing that I have to train out of you. You can’t just give up at this point. So what would you suggest? Can anybody get us out of this jam? Yeah. STUDENT: PROFESSOR: Right.

所以建议是找到 f (x) 未定义的 x 值。事实上，现在这是一种相当复杂的表达方式，我想说的是，我们想要做的是回到我们的预科微积分技能。然后绘制一些点。所以，你回到预科微积分，然后绘制一些点。这是非常合理的事情。

So the suggestion was to find the x values where f (x) is undefined. In fact, so now that’s a fairly sophisticated way of putting the point that I want to make, which is that what we want to do is go back to our precalculus skills. And just plot points. So instead, you go back to precalculus and you just plot some points. It’s a perfectly reasonable thing.

现在，事实证明，最重要的绘图点是不存在的点。即 x = 2 的值。这正是建议的。即，我们绘制函数未定义的点。那么我们该怎么做呢？好吧，你必须想一想，当我这样做时，我会引入一些新的符号。如果我在这里评估 2，实际上我做不到。

Now, it turns out that the most important point to plot is the one that’s not there. Namely, the value of x = 2. Which is just what was suggested. Namely, we plot the points where the function is not defined. So how do we do that? Well, you have to think about it for a second and I’ll introduce some new notation when I do it. If I evaluate 2 at this place, actually I can’t do it.

我必须从左到右进行计算。因此，如果我从右向右将 2 代入正数，那么它将等于 2 + 1 / 2，比 2 稍大一点，即 +2。也就是 1 除以现在，这个分母是 2，比它稍大一点，即 +2。所以它比 0 稍大一点。好吧，我们马上就把它填上去。每个人都很困惑。是的。学生：教授：不，这就是函数。

I have to do it from the left and the right. So if I plug in 2 on the positive side, from the right, that’s going to be equal to 2 + 1 / 2, a little bit more than 2, +2. Which is 1 divided by now, this denominator is 2, a little more than that, +2. So it’s a little more than 0. And that is, well we’ll fill that in a second. Everybody’s puzzled. Yes. STUDENT: PROFESSOR: No, that’s the function.

我在绘制点，而不是求导。我已经求导了。我已经得到了一些令人费解的东西。现在我把注意力集中在奇怪的地方。是的，另一个问题。学生：它不会比 0 略小一点吗？教授：它不会比 0 略小一点吗？好的，这是一个非常好的观点，这是一个符号问题。也是括号问题。

I’m plotting points, I’m not differentiating. I’ve already differentiated it. I’ve already got something that’s a little puzzling. Now I’m focusing on the weird spot. Yes, another question. STUDENT: Wouldn’t it be a little less than 0? PROFESSOR: Wouldn’t it be a little less than 0? OK, that’s a very good point and this is a matter of notation here. And a matter of parentheses.

那么这个数字是不是比 2 略小一点呢？如果括号是这样的，即 2+，在加上 2+ 之后，它就会小一点。但它是这样的。好的。所以符号是，你有一个数字，然后你取它的一部分。这就是比它稍大一点的部分。这就是我的意思。如果你愿意，我也可以在这里加上那些括号。

So wouldn’t this be a little less than 2. Well, if the parentheses were this way; that is, 2+,with a after I did the 2+,then it would be less. But it’s this way. OK. So the notation is, you have a number and you take the part of it. That’s the part which is a little bit bigger than it. And so this is what I mean. And if you like, here I can put in those parentheses too.

是的，还有一个问题。学生：教授：为什么上面的那个没有加号？上面的那个没有加号的唯一原因是我不需要它来计算这个。当我取极限时，我可以直接代入值。而在这里，我仍然不确定。因为它将是 0。我想知道它在 0 的哪一边。是在正的一边还是负的一边。

Yeah, another question. STUDENT: PROFESSOR: Why doesn’t the top one have a plus? The only reason why the top one doesn’t have a plus is that I don’t need it to evaluate this. And when I take the limit, I can just plug in the value. Whereas here, I’m still uncertain. Because it’s going to be 0. And I want to know which side of 0 it’s on. Whether it’s on the positive side or the negative side.

所以这个，我可以在这里写一个括号 2+，但这样它就会简化为 1。在极限中。所以现在，我得到了一个负数除以一个微小的正数。所以，有人想告诉我那是什么吗？负无穷大。所以，我们只是从一边评估了这个函数。如果你按照另一边来做，那么这个，你会得到非常相似的东西，只不过这应该是

So this one, I could have written here a parentheses 2+, but then it would have just simplified to 1. In the limit. So now, I’ve got a negative number divided by a tiny positive number. And so, somebody want to tell me what that is? Negative infinity. So, we just evaluated this function from one side. And if you follow through the other side, so this one here, you get something very similar, except that this should be

哎呀，我做错了什么？我的意思是这样。我希望它 2 位于相同的基点，但我想从左边开始。所以这将是 2 + 1，相同的分子。然后左边的 2 + 2，结果是 1 / 0，即正无穷。或者只是简单的无穷，我们不必放加号。所以这是问题的第一部分。

Whoops, what did I do wrong? I meant this. I want it 2 the same base point, but I want to go from the left. So that’s going to be 2 + 1, same numerator. And then this 2 on the left + 2, and that’s going to come out to be 1 / 0 , which is plus infinity. Or just plain infinity, we don’t have to put the plus sign. So this is the first part of the problem.

第二部分，为了开始，你可以在任何一点评估这个函数。这是最有趣的一点，对吧？这是评估它的最有趣的地方。现在，我想做的下一件事是关注端点。我还没有真正说过端点是什么。所以端点一直向左，一直向右。

And the second piece, to get ourselves started, you could evaluate this function at any point. This is just the most interesting point, alright? This is just the most interesting place to evaluate it. Now, the next thing that I’d like to do is to pay attention to the ends. And I haven’t really said what the ends are. So the ends are just all the way to the left and all the way to the right.

所以这意味着 x 趋向于正无穷或负无穷。所以这是我要注意的第二件事。同样，这有点像视频屏幕。在这两种情况下，我们都会发现一些真正不在屏幕上的东西。我们在这里关注左边和右边发生的事情。而在上方，我们只关注上面和下面发生的事情。

So that means x going to plus or minus infinity. So that’s the second thing I want to pay attention to. Again, this is a little bit like a video screen here. And we’re about to discover something that’s really off the screen, in both cases. We’re taking care of what’s happening way to the left, way to the right, here. And up above, we just took care what happens way up and way down.

因此，我需要做更多的分析。这与评估极限的预科微积分技能有关。在这里，这样做的方法是将分子和分母除以 x。将其写为 (1 + 1 / x)/ (1 + 2 /x)。然后你可以看到当 x 趋向正无穷或负无穷时会发生什么。它只会趋向 1。所以，无论 x 是正数还是负数。

So on these ends, I need to do some more analysis. Which is related to a precalculus skill which is evaluating limits. And here, the way to do it is to divide by x the numerator and denominator. Write it as (1 + 1 / x)/ (1 + 2 /x). And then you can see what happens as x goes to plus or minus infinity. It just goes to 1. So, no matter whether x is positive or negative.

当它变得很大时，这两个额外的数字会变成 0。所以，它趋向于 1。所以如果你愿意，你可以把它缩写为 f（+ 或无穷大）= 1。现在，我要画出这个。我们用渐近线来画。所以有一个水平，即 y = 1。然后还有另一条线要画。即 x = 2。现在，到目前为止我有什么信息？

When it gets huge, these two extra numbers here go to 0. And so, this tends to 1. So if you like, you could abbreviate this as f (+ or infinity) = 1. So now, I get to draw this. And we draw this using asymptotes. So there’s a level which is y = 1. And then there’s another line to draw. Which is x = 2. And now, what information do I have so far?

嗯，我目前掌握的信息是，当我们从右边进入时，也就是 2，它会下降到负无穷大。所以它像这样下降。我还知道它在渐近线的另一边上升到无穷大。在这里，我知道它会下降到 1 级。这里它也下降到 1 级。现在，有一个问题。我现在几乎可以完成这个图表了。

Well, the information that I have so far is that when we’re coming in from the right, that’s to 2, it plunges down to minus infinity. So that’s down like this. And I also know that it goes up to infinity on the other side of the asymptote. And over here, I know it’s going out to the level 1. And here it’s also going to the level 1. Now, there’s an issue. I can almost finish this graph now.

我几乎掌握了足够的信息来完成它。但有一件事让我有点犹豫。那就是，我不知道，例如，在这里，它是否会下降然后回升。或者不会。那么它在这里做什么？有人能看到吗？是的。学生：教授：它不能下降，因为没有临界点。多么正确的答案。所以这是完全正确的。

I almost have enough information to finish it. But there’s one thing which is making me hesitate a little bit. And that is, I don’t know, for instance, over here, whether it’s going to maybe dip below and come back up. Or not. So what does it do here? Can anybody see? Yeah. STUDENT: PROFESSOR: It can’t dip below because there are no critical points. What a precisely correct answer. So that’s exactly right.

这里的要点是，因为 f' 不为 0，所以它不能折回自身。因为不可能有任何水平切线。它不能折回，所以它不能回溯。很抱歉，如果 f' 不为 0，则 f 不能回溯。这意味着它看起来不是这样的。它只是像这样。所以基本上就是这样。这实际上是问题的结束。就像这样。

The point here is that because f’ is not 0, it can’t double back on itself. Because there can’t be any of these horizontal tangents. It can’t double back, so it can’t backtrack. So sorry, if f’ is not 0, f can’t backtrack. And so that means that it doesn’t look like this. It just goes like this. So that’s basically it. And it’s practically the end of the problem. Goes like this.

现在你可以装饰你的东西了，对吧？你可能会注意到它可能与这里相交，轴，你可以实际评估这些位置。等等。我们现在正在寻找定性行为。事实上，你可以看到这些位置相交的位置。它实际上比我画的要高一点。也许我会准确地画出来。我们马上就会看到。这就是这个函数发生的事情。

Now you can decorate your thing, right? You may notice that maybe it crosses here, the axes, you can actually evaluate these places. And so forth. We’re looking right now for qualitative behavior. In fact, you can see where these places hit. And it’s actually a little higher up than I drew. Maybe I’ll draw it accurately. As we’ll see in a second. So that’s what happens to this function.

现在，让我们通过复查来更详细地看一下。所以我们要复查导数的符号发生了什么变化。与此同时，我将向你们解释什么是导数，并讨论二阶导数。首先，求导数的技巧是代数技巧。我的意思是，显然你可以通过商法则来做到这一点。

Now, let’s just take a look in a little bit more detail, by double checking. So we’re just going to double check what happens to the sign of the derivative. And in the meantime, I’m going to explain to you what the derivative is and also talk about the second derivative. So first of all, the trick for evaluating the derivative is an algebraic one. I mean, obviously you can do this by the quotient rule.

但我只是指出，这和这个是一样的。现在，哎呀，分母应该是 2。所以，现在它的形式是 1 (1 / x + 2)。这样就很容易看出导数是什么。因为常数的导数是 0，对吧？所以，这就是导数，只不过是交换符号。这是我之前写的。

But I just point out that this is the same thing as this. And now it has, whoops, that should be a 2 in the denominator. And so, now this has the form 1 (1 / x + 2). So this makes it easy to see what the derivative is. Because the derivative of a constant is 0, right? So this is, derivative, is just going to be, switch the sign. This is what I wrote before.

这就解释了。但顺便说一句，它还向您展示了这是一条双曲线。这只是双曲线的两条曲线。现在，让我们检查一下符号。对我们来说，这已经很明显了，这只是一个双重检查。我们实际上甚至不必注意这一点。它最好是真的。这只是要检查我们的算术。也就是说，它在这里增加。它在那里增加。这一定是真的。

And that explains it. But incidentally, it also shows you that this is a hyperbola. These are just two curves of a hyperbola. So now, let’s check the sign. It’s already totally obvious to us that this is just a double check. We didn’t actually even have to pay any attention to this. It had better be true. This is just going to check our arithmetic. Namely, it’s increasing here. It’s increasing there. That’s got to be true.

果然，这是正数，正如你所见，它是 1/2。所以它是增加的。所以我们检查了它。但现在，还有一件事我想让你注意。这意味着 f 是增加的。在负无穷 < x < 2 的区间内。并且从 2 一直到无穷大。

And, sure enough, this is positive, as you can see it’s 1 over a square. So it is increasing. So we checked it. But now, there’s one more thing that I want to just have you watch out about. So this means that f is increasing. On the interval minus infinity < x < 2. And also from 2 all the way out to infinity.

所以我只想警告你，你不能说，不要说对于所有的 x，f 在负无穷 < 无穷时是增加的。好吧，这不对。我把它写在黑板上了，但它是错的。我最好把它去掉。它就在那里。把它去掉。原因是，首先这是很明显的。它在这里上升。但后来它又飞速下降了。

So I just want to warn you, you cannot say, don’t say f is increasing on minus infinity < infinity, for all x. OK, this is just not true. I’ve written it on the board, but it’s wrong. I’d better get rid of it. There it is. Get rid of it. And the reason is, so first of all it’s totally obvious. It’s going up here. But then it went zooming back down there.

这里这是真的，但只有当 x 不为 2 时才成立。所以有一个中断。你必须注意这个中断。所以基本上，这里的寓意是，如果你忽略了这个地方，就像忽略了珠穆朗玛峰或大峡谷。你忽略了这个函数最重要的特性。

And here this was true, but only if x is not 2. So there’s a break. And you’ve got to pay attention to the break. So basically, the moral here is that if you ignore this place, it’s like ignoring Mount Everest, or the Grand Canyon. You’re ignoring the most important feature of this function here.

如果你要弄清楚事情的起伏，也就是我们所做的一切，你最好注意这些地方。所以不要忽略它们。这是第一点。现在还有一点修饰。这是二阶导数的作用。所以我们在这里写下了一阶导数。二阶导数现在是 2 / (x + 2)^3，对吗？

If you’re going to be figuring out where things are going up and down, which is basically all we’re doing, you’d better pay attention to these kinds of places. So don’t ignore them. So that’s the first remark. And now there’s just a little bit of decoration as well. Which is the role of the second derivative. So we’ve written down the first derivative here. The second derivative is now 2 / (x + 2)^3, right?

所以我通过对上面的公式进行一阶导数微分，得到了这个结果。当然，这也只适用于 x 不等于 2 的情况。现在，我们可以看到，这个结果是负数，我们来看看，负数在哪里？当这个是正数时，也就是当 2 < x < 无穷大时。它是负数。这就是这个东西凹陷的地方。我们来看看。我说得对吗？是负数，对吧？

So I get that from differentiating this formula up here for the first derivative. And now, of course, that’s also, only works for x not equal to 2. And now, we can see that this is going to be negative, let’s see, where is it negative? When this is a positive quantity, so when 2 < x < infinity. It’s negative. And this is where this thing is concave. Let’s see. Did I say that right? Negative, right?

这是向下凹的。对。同样，如果我看一下这个表达式，分子总是负数，但当 x < 2 时，分母也变为负数。所以它变为正数。所以在这种情况下，它是负数除以正数。在这种情况下，它是负数除以负数。所以这里，这是在无穷大 < x < 2 的范围内。这里它是向上凹的。现在，再次，这与我们已经猜测的一致。

This is concave down. Right. And similarly, if I look at this expression, the numerator is always negative but the denominator becomes negative as well when x < 2. So this becomes positive. So this case, it was negative over positive. In this case it was negative divided by negative. So here, this is in the range infinity < x < 2. And here it’s concave up. Now, again, this is just consistent with what we’re already guessing.

当然，如果我们知道这是一条双曲线，那么我们在这种情况下就已经知道了。它会向垂直线（虚线垂直线）的右侧凹下去。并向左凹下去。那么这给了我们什么额外的信息呢？我说反了吗？没有。没关系。那么这给了我们什么额外的信息呢？看起来它几乎没有给我们任何东西。

Of course we already know it in this case if we know that this is a hyperbola. That it’s going to be concave down to the right of the vertical line, dotted vertical line. And concave up to the left. So what extra piece of information is it that this is giving us? Did I say this backwards? No. That’s OK. So what extra piece of information is this giving us? It looks like it’s giving us hardly anything.

它实际上几乎没有给我们带来什么。但它给了我们一些美感。它排除了摆动的可能性。曲线中没有这样的情况。它不能从这样弯曲转变为那样弯曲再转变为这样弯曲。那是不会发生的。所以这些属性表明图形中没有摆动。好吧。那么。问题。

And it really is giving us hardly anything. But it is giving us something that’s a little aesthetic. It’s ruling out the possibility of a wiggle. There isn’t anything like that in the curve. It can’t shift from curving this way to curving that way to curving this way. That doesn’t happen. So these properties say there’s no wiggle in the graph of that. Alright. So. Question.

学生：我们是否仅根据导数来定义递增和递减基数，还是根据更一般的定义，即选择任意两个点并观察。因为有时这两个定义之间可能存在不一致。 教授：好的，那么问题是，在本课程中，我们是否会将正导数定义为与递增相同。答案是否定的。我们将尝试分别使用这些术语。

STUDENT: Do we define the increasing and decreasing base purely on the derivative, or the sort of more general definition of picking any two points and seeing. Because sometimes there can be an inconsistency between the two definitions. PROFESSOR: OK, so the question is, in this course are we going to define positive derivative as being the same thing as increasing. And the answer is no. We’ll try to use these terms separately.

永远正确的是，如果 f' 为正，则 f 会增加。但反之则不一定。它可能非常平坦，导数可能为 0，但函数仍可能增加。好的，导数可能在几个地方为 0。例如，像一些三次函数。还有其他问题吗？所以这就是我需要说的一般情况。我的意思是，在特定情况下。

What’s always true is that if f’ is positive, then f is increasing. But the reverse is not necessarily true. It could be very flat, the derivative can be 0 and still the function can be increasing. OK, the derivative can be 0 at a few places. For instance, like some cubics. Other questions? So that’s as much as I need to say in general. I mean, in a specific case.

但我想给你一个总体方案，我想通过一个更复杂的例子来了解这种事情的所有特点。所以让我们来谈谈素描的一般策略。如果你愿意的话，让我们看看这个策略的第一部分。我在这里把它全部画出来了。所以我要确保我完全按照我希望你看到的方式画出来。所以我有，它的绘图。

But I want to get you a general scheme and I want to go through a more complicated example that gets all the features of this kind of thing. So let’s talk about a general strategy for sketching. So the first part of this strategy, if you like, let’s see. I have it all plotted out here. So I’m going to make sure I get it exactly the way I wanted you to see. So I have, its plotting.

情节变得复杂起来。我们开始吧。那么，开始绘制吧，你应该先绘制什么呢？在你考虑导数之前，你应该绘制不连续性。特别是无限的不连续性。这是你应该做的第一件事。然后，你应该绘制端点，作为终点。如果问题没有任何有限的终点，那么 x 就趋向于正无穷或负无穷。你可以做的第三件事是绘制任何容易的点。

The plot thickens. Here we go. So plot, what is it that you should plot first? Before you even think about derivatives, you should plot discontinuities. Especially the infinite ones. That’s the first thing you should do. And then, you should plot end points, for ends. For x going to plus or minus infinity if there don’t happen to be any finite ends to the problem. And the third thing you can do is plot any easy points.

这是可选的。由您自行决定。例如，在这个例子中，您可以绘制图形与轴相交的位置。如果您愿意的话。这就是第一部分。再说一遍，这都是微积分预备课程。现在，在第二部分中，我们将求解这个方程，并绘制临界点和临界值。在我们刚刚讨论的问题中，没有任何临界点和临界值。所以这部分是空的。

This is optional. At your discretion. You might, for instance, on this example, plot the places where the graph crosses the axis. If you want to. So that’s the first part. And again, this is all precalculus. So now, in the second part we’re going to solve this equation and we’re going to plot the critical points and values. In the problem which we just discussed, there weren’t any. So this part was empty.

所以第三步是确定 f'对不起，f' 在每个区间是正还是负。在临界点、不连续点之间。符号的方向，在这种情况下不会改变。它在这里上升，在这里也上升。但它可以在这里上升，然后又下降。所以方向可以在每个临界点改变。它可以在每个不连续点改变。而你不知道。

So the third step is to decide whether f’sorry, whether, f’ is positive or negative on each interval. Between critical points, discontinuities. The direction of the sign, in this case it doesn’t change. It goes up here and it also goes up here. But it could go up here and then come back down. So the direction can change at every critical point. It can change at every discontinuity. And you don’t know.

但是，这一步必须与步骤 1 和 2 保持一致。事实上，如果你能成功完成步骤 1 和 2，你就永远不需要步骤 3。它所做的只是双重检查。所以如果你在某个地方犯了算术错误，你就能发现它。所以这也许是最重要的事情。

However, this particular step has to be consistent with 1 and 2, with steps 1 and 2. In fact, it will never, if you can succeed in doing steps 1 and 2, you’ll never need step 3. All it’s doing is double checking. So if you made an arithmetic mistake somewhere, you’ll be able to see it. So that’s maybe the most important thing.

当我看到人们在解决问题时，最让我沮丧的是，他们从第 3 步开始就出错了，然后他们开始尝试绘制图形，但画不出图形。因为图形不一致。原因是导数存在一些算术错误或类似的东西，或者其他误解。然后就一片混乱了。

And it’s actually the most frustrating thing for me when I see people working on problems, is they start step 3, they get it wrong, and then they start trying to draw the graph and it doesn’t work. Because it’s inconsistent. And the reason is some arithmetic error with the derivative or something like that or some other misinterpretation. And then there’s a total mess.

如果你从这两个步骤开始，那么当你走到这一步时，你就会知道自己犯了错误。人们通常不会在前两个步骤中犯那么多错误。无论如何，事实上，如果你愿意，你可以跳过这一步。但这样做的风险是没有仔细检查你的工作。那么第四步是什么呢？好吧，我们来看看 f'' 是正数还是负数。

If you start with these two steps, then you’re going to know when you get to this step that you’re making mistakes. People don’t generally make as many mistakes in the first two steps. Anyway, in fact you can skip this step if you want. But that’s at risk of not double checking your work. So what’s the fourth step? Well, we take a look at whether f’’ is positive or negative.

因此，我们要决定它是向上凹还是向下凹。我们有这些点，f'' ( x ) = 0，它们被称为拐点。最后一步就是把所有东西结合起来。这就是这个方案，一般方案。让我们在特定情况下执行它。下面是我将用作示例的函数。

And so we’re deciding on things like whether it’s concave up or down. And we have these points, f’’ ( x ) = 0, which are called inflection points. And the last step is just to combine everything. So this is this the scheme, the general scheme. And let’s just carry it out in a particular case. So here’s the function that I’m going to use as an example.

我将使用 f ( x ) = x / ln x。因为对数是的，问题。是的。学生：教授：问题是，这是可选的吗？所以这是个好问题。这是可选的吗？学生：教授：好的，问题是这种类型的问题。答案是，不仅仅是这样，在很多情况下，我不会要求你这样做。

I’ll use f ( x ) = x / ln x. And because the logarithm yeah, question. Yeah. STUDENT: PROFESSOR:. The question is, is this optional. So that’s a good question. Is this optional. STUDENT: PROFESSOR: OK, the question is this optional; this kind of question. And the answer is, it’s more than just so, in many instances, I’m not going to ask you to.

我强烈建议，如果我没有要求你这样做，你就不要尝试。因为求二阶导数通常很糟糕。任何时候，只要你不计算二阶导数，你就会过得更好。在很多情况下都是如此。另一方面，如果我要求你这样做，那是因为我希望你有能力去做这件事。

I strongly recommend that if I don’t ask you to do it, that you not try. Because it’s usually awful to find the second derivative. Any time you can get away without computing a second derivative, you’re better off. So in many, many instances. On the other hand, if I ask you to do it’s because I want you to have the, work to do it.

但基本上，如果没有人强迫你这样做，我会说永远不要做第 4 步。其他问题。好吧。因此，在这种情况下，我们将强迫自己执行第 4 步。但也许这只是少数几次之一。所以，我们开始吧，只是为了说明目的。好的，现在。这是我想讨论的函数。范围必须是 x 正数，因为对数没有为负值定义。

But basically, if nobody forces you to, I would say never do step 4. Other questions. Alright. So we’re going to force ourselves to do step 4, however, in this instance. But maybe this will be one of the few times. So here we go, just for illustrative purposes. OK, now. So here’s the function that I want to discuss. And the range has to be x positive, because the logarithm is not defined for negative values.

所以我要做的第一件事是，我想遵循这里的方案。因为如果我不遵循方案，我会有点混乱。所以第一部分是找到奇点。也就是 f 为无穷大的地方。这就是对数（分母）消失的地方。所以这就是 f ( 1 +)，如果你愿意的话。

So the first thing that I’m going to do is, I’d like to follow the scheme here. Because if I don’t follow the scheme, I’m going to get a little mixed up. So the first part is to find the singularities. That is, the places where f is infinite. And that’s when the logarithm, the denominator, vanishes. So that’s f ( 1 +), if you like.

这就是 1 / ln 1 +，也就是 1 / 0，带有一点正数。也就是无穷大。其次，我们换一种方式计算。不出所料，结果是负无穷大。现在，我要做的下一件事是端点。所以我称它们为端点。它们有两个。其中一个是右边的 f ( 0 )。f ( 0+ )。

So that’s 1 / ln 1 +, which is 1 / 0, with a little bit of positiveness to it. Which is infinity. And second, we do it the other way. And not surprisingly, this comes out to be negative infinity. Now, the next thing I want to do is the ends. So I call these the ends. And there are two of them. One of them is f ( 0 ) from the right. f ( 0+).

所以这是 0 + / ln 0 +，也就是 0 加除以，ln 0 + 实际上是负无穷。这就是对数的情况，趋向于负无穷。所以这是 0 除以无穷，这肯定是 0，没有问题。关于会发生什么。另一边，所以这是终点，这是第一端。范围是这样的。我刚刚做了左端点。

So that is 0 + / ln 0 +, which is 0 plus divided by, well, ln 0 + is actually minus infinity. That’s what happens to the logarithm, goes to minus infinity. So this is 0 over infinity, which is definitely 0, there’s no problem. about what happens. The other side, so this is the end, this is the first end. The range is this. And I just did the left endpoint.

所以现在我必须求出正确的端点，我必须让 x 趋向无穷大。所以如果我让 x 趋向无穷大，我只需要通过插入一个非常大的数字来稍微思考一下。我将插入 10 ^ 10，看看会发生什么。

And so now I have to do the right endpoint, I have to let x go to infinity. So if I let x go to infinity, I’m just going to have to think about it a little bit by plugging in a very large number. I’ll plug in 10 ^ 10, just to see what happens.

因此，如果我将 10 ^ 10 代入 x ln x，我会得到 10 ^ 10 / ln 10^10。也就是 10 ^ 10 / 10 ( log 10)。因此，分母，也就是这里的这个数字，大约是 2.23 左右。因此，分母可能是 230，这个数字后面有 10 个 0。因此，它非常非常大。我认为它很大。

So if I plug in 10 ^ 10 into x ln x, I get 10 ^ 10 / ln 10^10. Which is 10 ^ 10 / 10 ( log 10). So the denominator, this number here, is about 2.something. 2.3 or something. So this is maybe 230 in the denominator, and this is a number with ten 0’s after it. So it’s very, very large. I claim it’s big.

这给了我们一个线索，那就是这个东西是无限的。换句话说，我们的结论是无穷大的 f 是无穷大的。那么到目前为止，我们的函数有什么用呢？我们只是试图构建函数的框架。我们通过选取最重要的点来实现这一点。从数学家的角度来看，最重要的点是那些无限明显的点。

And that gives us the clue that what’s happening is that this thing is infinite. So, in other words, our conclusion is that f of infinity is infinity. So what do we have so far for our function? We’re just trying to build the scaffolding of the function. And we’re doing it by taking the most important points. And from a mathematician’s point of view, the most important points are the ones which are sort of infinitely obvious.

问题的两端。这就是我们要去的地方。我们有一个垂直渐近线，位于 x = 1。因此，这给了我们 x = 1。我们有一个值，这里是 0。我们还知道，当我们从左边进来时，也就是 f，从左边进来，我们得到负无穷大。所以它正在向下潜入。它像这样向下。

For the ends of the problem. So that’s where we’re heading. We have a vertical asymptote, which is at x = 1. So this gives us x = 1. And we have a value which is that it’s 0 here. And we also know that when we come in from the sorry, so we come in from the left, that’s f, the one from the left, we get negative infinity. So it’s diving down. It’s going down like this.

此外，我们知道另一边它在向上爬升。所以它像这样上升。从高一点开始。对，所以到目前为止，这就是我们所知道的。哦，还有一件事我们知道。当我们去到正无穷大时，它会回升。所以，到目前为止，我们有这个。现在，这个函数会发生什么应该已经很明显了。所以应该不会有太多的意外。

And, furthermore, on the other side we know it’s climbing up. So it’s going up like this. Just start a little higher. Right, so. So far, this is what we know. Oh, and there’s one other thing that we know. When we go to plus infinity, it’s going back up. So, so far we have this. Now, already it should be pretty obvious what’s going to happen to this function. So there shouldn’t be many surprises.

它会像这样下降。像这样，它会掉头然后上升。这就是我们所期望的。所以我们还不知道，但我们很确定。所以现在，我们可以开始查看关键点。我们可以在这里执行第 2 步，我们需要更多的空间，看看这个函数发生了什么。所以我必须区分它。

It’s going to come down like this. Go like this, it’s going to turn around and go back up. That’s what we expect. So we don’t know that yet, but we’re pretty sure. So at this point, we can start looking at the critical points. We can do our step 2 here we need a little bit more room here and see what’s happening with this function. So I have to differentiate it.

这就是商法则。记住，函数在这里，x / ln x。因此，分母中有一个 ln x^2。我在这里得到 x 的导数是 1，所以我们得到 1 ( ln x ) x ( ln x 的导数，即 1 / x)。总而言之，这就是 (ln x 1) / ln x^2。因此，这是我们的导数。

And it’s, this is the quotient rule. So remember the function is up here, x / ln x. So I have a ln x^2 in the denominator. And I get here the derivative of x is 1, so we get 1 ( ln x) x ( the derivative of ln x, which is 1 /x). So all told, that’s (ln x 1) / ln x^2. So here’s our derivative.

现在，如果我将其设置为 0，至少在分子中，当 x = e 时，分子为 0。ln e = 1。所以这是我们的临界点。我们有一个临界值，即 f(e)。这将是 e / ln e。也就是 e，因为 ln e = 1。所以现在我也可以绘制临界点，它就在这里。

And now, if I set this equal to 0, at least in the numerator, the numerator is 0 when x = e. The ln e = 1. So here’s our critical point. And we have a critical value, which is f(e). And that’s going to be e / ln e. Which is e, again. Because ln e = 1. So now I can also plot the critical point, which is down here.

只有一个，它位于 (e)。这有点不符合比例，因为我的黑板不够高。它应该在这里，然后是斜率 1。但我把它放低了。所以这不是按比例绘制的，事实上，这是我们不会尝试用这些图片做的事情之一，就是让它们按比例绘制。所以比例有点被挤压了。

And there’s only one of them, and it’s at (e). That’s kind of not to scale here, because my blackboard isn’t quite tall enough. It should be over here and then, it’s slope 1. But I dipped it down. So this is not to scale, and indeed that’s one of the things that we’re not going to attempt to do with these pictures, is to make them to scale. So the scale’s a little squashed.

所以，到目前为止，我有了这个临界点。事实上，我会用 c 来标记它。每当我有一个临界点时，我都会确保我记住它是什么。而且由于只有一个临界点，所以这幅图的其余部分现在是正确的。这与我们对双曲线使用的机制相同。

So, so far I have this critical point. And, in fact, I’m going to label it with a c. Whenever I have a critical point I’ll just make sure that I remember that’s what it is. And since there’s only one, the rest of this picture is now correct. That’s the same mechanism that we used for the hyperbola.

也就是说，我们知道只有一个地方导数为 0。这意味着不再有水平线，所以不再有回溯。它必须下降到这里。到达那里。这是它唯一可以掉头的地方。回到上面。它必须从这里开始，然后下降到那里。它不能超过 0。不要超过，不要取正值。它必须从这里下降。

Namely, we know there’s only one place where the derivative is 0. So that means there no more horizontals, so there’s no more backtracking. It has to come down to here. Get to there. This is the only place it can turn around. Goes back up. It has to start here and it has to go down to there. It can’t go above 0. Do not pass go, do not get positive. It has to head down here.

太棒了。这意味着这幅图现在几乎完全正确了。其余部分或多或少只是装饰。我们基本上完成了它的外观，至少在示意图上。但是，我要惩罚你，因为我警告过你。我们将在这里进行第 4 步并修复凹陷。我们还将进行一些复查。

So that’s great. That means that this picture is almost completely correct now. And the rest is more or less decoration. We’re pretty much done with the way it looks, at least schematically. However, I am going to punish you, because I warned you. We are going to go over here and do this step 4 and fix up the concavity. And we’re also going to do a little bit of that double checking.

现在，我们再强调一下。我们要再检查一遍。这是第 3 部分。但根据这张图片，我事先已经知道了什么是正确的。f 从 0 到 1 递减。f 从 1 到 e 也递减。f 从 e 到无穷大递增。

So now, let’s again, just, I want to emphasize. We’re going to do a double check. This is part 3. But in advance, I already have, based on this picture I already know what has to be true. That f is decreasing on 0 to 1. f is also decreasing on 1 to e. And f is increasing on e to infinity.

所以，因为我们已经绘制了一堆点，而且我们知道导数没有任何消失的地方，我们已经知道它会下降、下降、上升。这就是它要做的。现在，我们只需确保我们没有犯任何算术错误。通过实际计算导数，或者无论如何盯着它看。并确保它是正确的。所以首先，我们只需看一下分子。

So, already, because we’ve plot a bunch of points and we know that there aren’t any places where the derivative vanishes, we already know it goes down, down, up. That’s what it’s got to do. Now, we’ll just make sure that we didn’t make any arithmetic mistakes, now. By actually computing the derivative, or staring at it, anyway. And making sure that it’s correct. So first of all, we just take a look at the numerator.

所以记住，f 是 (ln x 1) / ln x^2，即平方数。所以分母是正数。我们来看看这三个范围。我们有 0 < x < 1。在这个范围内，对数是负数，所以这是负数除以正数，结果为负数。这是递减的，很好。事实上，这也适用于下一个范围。1 l< x < e，这是负数除以正数。

So f,’ remember, was (ln x 1) / ln x^2, the quantity squared. So the denominator is positive. So let’s just take a look at the three ranges. So we have 0 < x < 1. And on that range, the logarithm is negative, so this is negative divided by positive, which is negative. That’s decreasing, that’s good. And in fact, that also works on the next range. 1 l< x < e, it’s negative divided by positive.

我们跳过 1 的唯一原因是它在那里没有定义。那里发生了一些戏剧性的事情。然后，在最后一个范围，当 x 大于 e 时，这意味着对数已经大于 1。所以分子现在是正数，分母仍然是正数，所以它在增加。所以我们只是再次检查了我们已经知道的东西。

And the only reason why we skipped 1, again, is that it’s undefined there. And there’s something dramatic happening there. And then, at the last range, when x is bigger than e, that means the logarithm is already bigger than 1. So the numerator is now positive, and the denominator’s still positive, so it’s increasing. So we’ve just double checked something that we already knew.

好了，关于步骤 3 的内容就这么多了。这是检查正性和负性。现在，步骤 4。在我们继续之前，我想指出一个小点。那就是有时你无法很好地评估函数或其导数。所以有时你不能很好地绘制点。

Alright, so that’s pretty much all there is to say about step 3. So this is checking the positivity and negativity. And now, step 4. There is one small point which I want to make before we go on. Which is that sometimes, you can’t evaluate the function or its derivative particularly well. So sometimes you can’t plot the points very well.

如果你不能很好地绘制这些点，那么你可能必须先做 3，弄清楚发生了什么。你可能不得不跳过。现在我们要进行二阶导数。但首先，我想使用代数技巧来重新排列这些项。我想再注意一点。正如我所说，这是图形的装饰。

And if you can’t plot the points very well, then you might have to do 3 first, to figure out what’s going on a little bit. You might have to skip. So now we’re going to go on the second derivative. But first, I want to use an algebraic trick to rearrange the terms. And I want to notice one more little point. Which I, as I say, this is decoration for the graph.

所以我想重写这个公式。也许我会在这里重写。另一种写法是 (1 / ln x) (1 / (ln x)^2)。这是写导数的另一种方法。这让我注意到我之前错过的东西。当我解方程 ln x 1 时，这里等于 0，这个方程在这里。我错过了一个可能性。我错过了分母可以是无穷大的可能性。

So I want to rewrite the formula. Maybe I’ll do it right over here. Another way of writing this is (1 / ln x) (1 / (ln x)^2). So that’s another way of writing the derivative. And that allows me to notice something that I missed, before. When I solved the equation ln x 1 this is equal to 0 here, this equation here. I missed a possibility. I missed the possibility that the denominator could be infinity.

所以实际上，如果分母无穷大，正如你从那里的另一个表达式中看到的那样，导数实际上为 0。所以当 x = 0 + 时，斜率也将为 0。让我再强调一下。如果你用这里的另一个公式来求值，那就是 (1 / ln 0+) (1 / (ln 0+)^2)。如果你愿意的话，这就是 1 / 无穷大 1 / 无穷大的平方。

So actually, if the denominator’s infinity, as you can see from the other expression there, it actually is true that the derivative is 0. So also when x = 0 +, the slope is going to be 0. Let me just emphasize that again. If you evaluate using this other formula over here, this is (1 / ln 0+) (1 / (ln 0+)^2). That’s 1 / infinity 1 / infinity, if you like, squared.

无论如何，它是 0。所以这是 0。斜率在那里是 0。这是我们图表上的一个小装饰。它告诉我们，回到我们的图表，它告诉我们斜率是水平的。所以我们从这里开始。这只是图表的一个小起点。这是一个水平斜率。所以实际上有两个地方的斜率是水平的。

Anyway, it’s 0. So this is 0. The slope is 0 there. That is a little piece of decoration on our graph. It’s telling us, going back to our graph here, it’s telling us this is coming in with slope horizontal. So we’re starting out this way. That’s just a little start here to the graph. It’s a horizontal slope. So there really were two places where the slope was horizontal.

现在，借助第二个公式，我还可以进行第二次微分。如果我对 1 / ln 进行微分，即 ( ln x) ^ 2 ( 1 / x) + 2 (ln x) ^ 3 (1/x)，那么这样做会稍微容易一些。如果我将其放在一个公分母上，就是 x ln x^3 次，让我们看看。我想我必须取 2 ln x。

Now, with the help of this second formula I can also differentiate a second time. So it’s a little bit easier to do that if I differentiate 1 / ln, that’s ( ln x) ^ 2 ( 1 / x) + 2 (ln x) ^ 3 (1/x). And that, if I put it over a common denominator, is x ln x^3 times, let’s see here. I guess I’ll have to take the 2 ln x.

我现在将二阶导数的公式改写为比率。现在，为了确定符号，您会看到有两个符号翻转的地方。当对数为 2 时，分子交叉，即 x = e ^2 时。当 x = 1 时，分母翻转，即对数从正变为负时。所以这里我们有几个范围。

So I’ve now rewritten the formula for the second derivative as a ratio. Now, to decide the sign, you see there are two places where the sign flips. The numerator crosses when the logarithm is 2, that’s going to be when x = e ^2. And the denominator flips when x = 1, that’s when the log flips from positive to negative. So we have a couple of ranges here.

首先，我们的范围是从 0 到 1。然后我们的范围是从 1 到 e^2。然后我们的范围是从 e ^2 一直到无穷大。所以在 0 和 1 之间，分子是负数，所以减去负数就是正数，所以分子是正数。

So, first of all, we have the range from 0 to 1. And then we have the range from 1 to e^2. And then we have the range from e ^2 all the way out to infinity. So between 0 and 1, the numerator is, well this is a negative number in this, so minus a negative number is positive, so the numerator is positive.

分母是负数，因为 ln 是负数，所以取三次方。所以这是负数，所以是正数除以负数，负数小于 0。这意味着它是向下凹的。所以这是向下凹的图。这是件好事，因为这里是向下凹的。所以没有摆动。它是垂直向下的，就像这样。

And the denominator is negative, because the ln is negative it’s taken to the third power. So this is a negative numbers, so it’s positive divided by a negative number, which is less than 0. That means it’s concave down. So this is concave down plot. And that’s a good thing, because over here this is concave down. So there are no wiggles. It goes straight down, like this.

然后其他两个部分是 f'' 等于，嗯，这里会转换。分母变为正数。所以是正数除以正数。所以这是向上凹的。这就是这里。但请注意，它不是在底部转过来，而是在其他地方。所以这里还有另一个转换。这是 e ^2。这是 e。所以最后发生的事情是，符号再次翻转。

And then the other two pieces are f’’ is equal to, well it’s going to switch here. The denominator becomes positive. So it’s positive over positive. So this is concave up. And that’s going over here. But notice that it’s not the bottom where it turns around, it’s somewhere else. So there’s another transition here. This is e ^2. This is e. So what happens at the end is, again, the sign flips again.

因为现在，当 x > e ^2 时，分子变为负数。这是负数除以正数，结果为负数。部分向下凹陷。所以我们没有完全正确地绘制图形。这里有一个拐点，我将用 i 来标记。在那个点向另一个方向转弯。所以有一个摆动。有摆动。仍然向上，仍然向无穷大。但有点像山的坡度，对吧？

Because the numerator, now, when x > e ^2, becomes negative. And this is negative divided by positive, which is negative. And part is concave down. And so we didn’t quite draw the graph right. There’s an inflection point right here, which I’ll label with i. Makes a turn the other way at that point. So there was a wiggle. There’s the wiggle. Still going up, still going to infinity. But kind of the slope of the mountain, right?

它朝另一个方向发展。这个点恰好是 (e^2, e ^2 / 2)。这就是我们所能得到的最详细的信息了。事实上，下一个游戏就是要避免，就是避免这么详细。那么让我介绍下一个主题。即最大值和最小值。好的，现在，最大值和最小值，最大值和最小值问题可以用以下方式以图形方式描述。假设你有一个函数，对，它在这里。好吗？

It’s going the other way. This point happens to be (e^2, e ^2 / 2). So that’s as detailed as we’ll ever get. And indeed, the next game is going to be avoid being, is to avoid being this detailed. So let me introduce the next subject. Which is maxima and minima. OK, now, maxima and minima, maximum and minimum problems can be described graphically in the following ways. Suppose you have a function, right, here it is. OK?

现在，找到最大值。然后找到最小值。好的。所以这个问题解决了。关键在于，使用草图很容易找到最大值和最小值。这很容易。目标，问题是，草图需要大量工作。我们刚刚花了 20 分钟绘制了一些东西。我们不想每次想要找到最大值和最小值时都花那么多时间。

Now, find the maximum. And find the minimum. OK. So this problem is done. The point being, that it is easy to find max and the min with the sketch. It’s very easy. The goal, the problem, is that the sketch is a lot of work. We just spent 20 minutes sketching something. We would not like to spend all that time every single time we want to find a maximum and minimum.

因此，我们的目标是使用捷径。事实上，正如我之前所说，如果可以避免，我们绝对不会使用二阶导数。我们不想装饰图形，也不想做所有这些复杂、微妙的事情，这些事情会让图形看起来更漂亮，或者在审美上更合适。但对于查看图形是向上还是向下，这些完全没有必要。

So the goal is to do it with, so our goal is to use shortcuts. And, indeed, as I said earlier, we certainly never want to use the second derivative if we can avoid it. And we don’t want to decorate the graph and do all of these elaborate, subtle, things which make the graph look nicer and really, or aesthetically appropriate. But are totally unnecessary to see whether the graph is up or down.

所以从本质上讲，整个事情都结束了，这是件好事。不幸的是，人们往往会忽略这些早期的部分。而这些部分通常非常重要。所以让我先告诉你这里的要点。关键思想。找到最大值的关键。关键点是，我们只需要看临界点。嗯，这实际上是在许多微积分课上看起来的那样。但事实并非如此。

So essentially, this whole business is out, which is a good thing. And, unfortunately, those early parts are the parts that people tend to ignore. Which are typically, often, very important. So let me first tell you the main point here. So the key idea. Key to finding maximum. So the key point is, we only need to look at critical points. Well, that’s actually what it seems like to, in many calculus classes. But that’s not true.

这不是句子的结尾。还有终点和不连续点。所以你必须注意这些。如果你看我刚刚画的例子，也就是我执行的那个，你可以看到这张图片上实际上有五个极值点。所以让我们换个角度。我们来看看。有五个地方可能是最大值或最小值。这是重点。

This is not the end of the sentence. And, end points, and points of discontinuity. So you must watch out for those. If you look at the example that I just drew here, which is the one that I carried out, you can see that there are actually five extreme points on this picture. So let’s switch. So we’ll take a look. There are five places where the max or the min might be. There’s this important point.

正如我所说，这是函数的支架。这里有这个点，在负无穷处。这里有这个，这里有这个，还有这个。五个点中只有一个是临界点。因此，在函数上你需要注意更多。你必须始终记住函数的模式，即函数的图像。即使这可能是最有趣的点，也是你将要查看的点。所以下次我们将举几个例子。

This is, as I say, the scaffolding of the function. There’s this point, there down at minus infinity. There’s this, there’s this, and there’s this. Only one out of five is a critical point. So there’s more that you have to pay attention to on the function. And you always have to keep the schema, the picture of the function, in the back of your head. Even though this may be the most interesting point, and the one that you’re going to be looking at. So we’ll do a few examples of that next time.

Lec 12 | MIT 18.01 Single Variable Calculus, Fall 2007

PROFESSOR: In the twelfth lecture, we’re going to talk about maxima and minima. Let’s finish up what we did last time. We really only just started with maxima and minima.

然后我们将讨论相关利率。现在我想给你们举一些最大最小问题的例子。我们将从一个相当基本的问题开始。那么最大最小问题是什么呢？最重要的是我们要求你们对文字问题做更多的解释。许多问题都是用文字来表达的。

And then we’re going to talk about related rates. So, right now I want to give you some examples of max min problems. And we’re going to start with a fairly basic one. So what’s the thing about max min problems? The main thing is that we’re asking you to do a little bit more of the interpretation of word problems. So many of the problems are expressed in terms of words.

因此，在这种情况下，我们有一根长度为 1 的导线。将其切成两段。然后每段都围住一个正方形。抱歉，围住一个正方形。问题是，这就是设置。问题是找到围住的最大面积。所以这就是问题所在。现在，在所有这些情况下，在所有这些情况下，都有一堆文字。你的工作通常是绘制一个图表。

And so, in this case, we have a wire which is length 1. Cut into two pieces. And then each piece encloses a square. Sorry, encloses a square. And the problem so this is the setup. And the problem is to find the largest area enclosed. So here’s the problem. Now, in all of these cases, in all these cases, there’s a bunch of words. And your job is typically to draw a diagram.

所以你要做的第一件事就是画一个图。在这种情况下，它可以相当具有示意性。这是你的单位长度。当你画图时，你必须选择变量。所以这实际上是两个主要任务。设置问题。所以你要画一个图。这就像小学到高中的旧应用题。画一个图并命名变量。

So the first thing you want to do is to draw a diagram. In this case, it can be fairly schematic. Here’s your unit length. And when you draw the diagram, you’re going to have to pick variables. So those are really the two main tasks. To set up the problem. So you’re drawing a diagram. This is like word problems of old, in grade school through high school. Draw a diagram and name the variables.

今天我们要做很多这样的工作。这是我的单位长度。我将选择变量 x 作为其中一段电线的长度。这样另一段电线的长度就是 1 x。这几乎就是整个图表，除了我们在将电线切成两半后还做了一些事情。也就是说，我们用它做了两个小盒子。像这样，这些就是我们的正方形。

So we’ll be doing a lot of that today. So here’s my unit length. And I’m going to choose the variable x to be the length of one of the pieces of wire. And that makes the other piece 1 x. And that’s pretty much the whole diagram, except that there’s something that we did with the wire after we cut it in half. Namely, we built two little boxes out of it. Like this, these are our squares.

它们的边长分别为 x / 4 和 (1 x) / 4。到目前为止，一切都很好。现在我们必须考虑，好吧，我们想要找到最大的面积。所以我需要一个以我描述的变量表示的面积公式。这是最后一件事。我将字母 a 作为面积的标签。那么面积就是 x/4 的平方 + 1 x 的平方。

And their side lengths are x / 4 and (1 x) / 4. So, so far, so good. And now we have to think, well, we want to find the largest area. So I need a formula for area in terms of variables that I’ve described. And so that’s the last thing. I’ll give the letter a as the label for the area. And then the area is just the square of x/4 + the square of 1 x.

哎呀，那个奇怪的 2 进来了。超过 4。到目前为止，一切都很好。现在。你的直觉，我会顺从你的直觉，就是我们应该向前冲，然后进行区分。好吗？没关系。我们会找到关键点。所以我们知道那些是重点。所以我们要找到关键点。

Whoops, that strange 2 got in here. Over 4. So far, so good. Now. The instinct that you’ll have, and I’m going to yield to that instinct, is we should charge ahead and just differentiate. Alright? That’s alright. We’ll find the critical points. So we know that those are important points. So we’re going to find the critical points.

换句话说，我们取我们设定的导数，即 a 对 x = 0 的导数。因此，如果我进行微分，我会得到，嗯，第一个，x^2 / 16，也就是 8。抱歉。那是 x / 8，对吧？这是这个的导数。如果我对这个进行微分，我会得到，1 x ^2 的导数是 2 ( 1 x)( a 1)。

In other words, we take the derivative we set, the derivative of a with respect to x = 0. So if I do that differentiation, I get the, well, so the first one, x^2 / 16, that’s 8. Sorry. That’s x / 8, right? That’s a derivative of this. And if I differentiate this, I get well, the derivative of 1 x ^2 is 2 ( 1 x)( a 1).

所以它是 (1 x) / 8。所以这里面有两个减号，我让你思考一下这个微分，我用链式法则来做。等一下，好吗？等我们做完再说。所以这是导数。有问题吗？ 学生：教授：好的，所以这里有 1/16。这是 x^2 / 16。所以它是 2x / 8，除以 16，对不起。它有一个 8。没问题。

So it’s (1 x) / 8. So there are two minus signs in there, I’ll let you ponder that differentiation, which I did by the chain rule. Hang on a sec, OK? Just wait until we’re done. So here’s the derivative. Is there a problem? STUDENT: PROFESSOR: Right, so there’s a 1/16 here. This is x^2 / 16. And so it’s 2x / 8, over 16, sorry. Which has an 8. That’s OK.

好的，现在，当且仅当 x = 1 x 时，这才等于 0。即 2x = 1，或者换句话说 x = 1/2。好吗？这就是我们的临界点。所以 x = 1/2 是临界点。临界值，也就是在 1/2 处求 a 的值，是 (1/2) / 4，也就是 1/8。所以这就是 (1/8)^2 + (1/8)^2 = 1/32。到目前为止，一切顺利。

Alright, so now, This is equal to 0 if and only if x = 1 x. That’s 2x = 1, or in other words x = 1/2. Alright? So there’s our critical point. So x = 1/2 is the critical point. And the critical value, which is what you get when you evaluate a at 1/2, is (1/2) / 4, that’s 1/8. So that’s (1/8)^2 + (1/8)^2 which = 1/32. So, so far, so good.

但我们还没有完成。我们还没有完成。那么为什么我们还没有完成呢？因为我们还没有检查端点。所以让我们检查端点。现在，在这个问题中，端点实际上被排除了。这里的端点介于 0 和 1 之间。这就是切割的可能长度。

But we’re not done yet. We’re not done. So why aren’t we done? Because we haven’t checked the end points. So let’s check the end points. Now, in this problem, the end points are really sort of excluded. The ends are between 0 and 1 here. That’s the possible lengths of the cut.

因此，我们真正应该做的是求极限，因此当 x 趋近于 0 时，那将是右极限。如果代入 x = 0，则得到的是 0 + (1/4)^2。也就是 1/16。同样，在另一端，也就是左侧的 1 1，我们得到 (1/4)^2 + 0，也是 1/16。因此，您看到的是该函数的示意图，与此处的右图相差不大，它在此处为 1/16，然后下降并上升。对吗​​？

And so what we should really be doing is evaluating in the limit, so that would be the right hand limit as x goes to 0 of a. And if you plug in x = 0, what you get here is 0 + (1/4)^2. Which is 1/16. And similarly, at the other end, that’s 1 1 from the left we get (1/4)^2 + 0, which is also 1/16. So, what you see is that the schematic picture of this function, and isn’t even so far off from being the right picture here, is that it’s level here as 1/16 and then it dips down and goes up. Right?

这是 1/2，这是 1，这里的这个水平是它的一半。这是 1/32。所以我们没有发现，当我们找到临界点时，我们没有找到最大的封闭面积。我们找到了最小的封闭面积。所以如果你不注意函数的样子，你不仅有一半的时间会得到错误的答案，你还会得到绝对最差的答案。

This is 1/2, this is 1, and this level here is a half that. This is 1/32. So we did not find, when we found the critical point we did not find the largest area enclosed. We found the least area enclosed. So if you don’t pay attention to what the function looks like, not only will you about half the time get the wrong answer, you’ll get the absolute worst answer.

你得到的会与你想要的截然相反。所以你必须稍微注意一下你得到的函数。在这种情况下，它只是非常示意性的。它下降然后上升，这几乎适用于大多数函数。它们相当简单。它们可能只有一个临界点。它们只转一次。

You’ll get the one which is the polar opposite from what you want. So you have to pay a little bit of attention to the function that you’ve got. And in this case it’s just very schematic. It dips down and goes up, and that’s true of pretty much most functions. They’re fairly simple. They maybe only have one critical point. They only turn around once.

但是，也许临界点是最大值，或者可能是最小值。或者事实上，两者都不是。所以我们也许会在别的时候讨论这个问题。所以我们在这里发现，封闭的面积最小。封闭的面积是 1/32。当 x = 1/2 时，这是正确的。所以这些是相等的正方形。当只有一个正方形时，它们相等。这或多或少是极限情况。如果其中一个碎片消失了。

But then, maybe the critical point is the maximum or maybe it’s the minimum. Or maybe it’s neither, in fact. So we’ll be discussing that maybe some other time. So what we find here is that we have the least area enclosed. Enclosed is 1/32. And this is true when x = 1/2. So these are equal squares. And most when there’s only one square. Which is more or less the limiting situation. If one of the pieces disappears.

现在，这就是第一种例子。在我们继续之前，我想再对术语做一点评论。我将用以下问题来介绍它。最小值是多少？那么，最小值是多少？是的。学生：教授：对。函数的最小值。所以这个问题的答案是 1/32。现在，这个问题的问题，你会的，所以这指的是最小值。

Now, so that’s the first kind of example. And I just want to make one more comment about terminology before we go on. And I will introduce it with the following question. What is the minimum? So, what is the minimum? Yeah. STUDENT: PROFESSOR: Right. The lowest value of the function. So the answer to that question is 1/32. Now, the problem with this question and you will, so that refers to the minimum value.

但还有另一个问题，即最小值在哪里。答案是 x = 1/2。所以其中一个是最小点，另一个是最小值。所以它们是两个独立的东西。现在，问题是人们很马虎。

But then there’s this other question which is where is the minimum. And the answer to that is x = 1/2. So one of them is the minimum point, and the other one is the minimum value. So they’re two separate things. Now, the problem is that people are sloppy.

尤其是由于你通常先找到临界点，然后再插入第二个值，人们就会停下来，给出错误的答案。现在，回答这两个问题都很重要。你只需要有一个词可以放在那里。所以这有点粗心。当我们说最小值是多少时，有些人会说 1/2。这完全是错误的。

And especially since you usually find the critical point first, and the value that is plugging in for a second, people will stop short and they’ll give the wrong answer to the question, for instance. Now, both questions are important to answer. You just need to have a word to put there. So this is a little bit careless. When we say what is the minimum, some people will say 1/2. And that’s literally wrong.

他们知道自己的意思。但这是错的。当人们问这个问题时，他们很马虎。无论如何。他们可能应该更清楚一点，说出最小值是多少。或者，这个值在哪里实现。它在哪里实现，或者最小值在哪里实现。“最小值在哪里实现？”，是第二个问题的更好表述方式。这样它就有了一个明确的答案。

They know what they mean. But it’s just wrong. And when people ask this question, they’re being sloppy. Anyway. They should maybe be a little clearer and say what’s the minimum value. Or, where is the value achieved. It’s achieved at, or where is the minimum value achieved. “Where is min achieved?”, would be a better way of phrasing this second question. So that it has an unambiguous answer.

当人们问你最小点时，他们也会问，为什么我们称它为最小点？我们有这个词，临界点，也就是 x = 1/2 的临界值。所以我在这里做了同样的区分。但还有另一个最小点的概念，如果你愿意的话，这是一个替代概念。最小点是点 (1/2,1/32)。对，那是图上的一个点。

And when people ask you for the minimum point, they’re also so why is it that we call it the minimum point? We have this word, critical point, which is what x = 1/2 is in critical value. And so I’m making those same distinctions here. But there’s another notion of a minimum point, and this is an alternative if you like. The minimum point is the point (1/2,1/32). Right, that’s a point on the graph.

嗯，这就是要点，所以图表就在那里，但我就把它放在那里。这就是要点。你可能会说那里是最小值。你可能会指向这个点，你可能会说是最大值。同样，这个可能是最大值。换句话说，这意味着人们有点马虎。有时他们的意思是一个意思，有时他们的意思又是另一个意思。

It’s the point well, so that graph is way up there, but I’ll just put it on there. That’s this point. And you might say min there. And you might point to this point, and you might say max. And similarly, this one might be a max. So in other words, what this means is simply that people are a little sloppy. And sometimes they mean one thing and sometimes they mean another.

你只能这样，因为有些作者会说一件事，而有些人会说另一件事，你只能忍受这种令人讨厌的歧义。是吗？学生：教授：好的，这很好。那么我们开始，找出最大的封闭面积。所以这是一个陷阱问题，不是吗？所以有很多问题值得问。这是一个陷阱问题，为什么？

And you’re just stuck with this, because there’ll be some authors who will say one thing and some people will mean another and you just have to live with this little bit of annoying ambiguity. Yeah? STUDENT: PROFESSOR: OK, so that’s a good very good. So here we go, find the largest area enclosed. So that’s sort of a trick question, isn’t it? So there are various that’s a good thing to ask. That’s sort of a trick question, why?

因为根据规则，我们被困在两个最大值之间，并且绝对低于这个最大值。换句话说，这个问题的一个答案是，我可能给出的答案是 1/16。但事实并非如此。因为那只是极限。当 x 趋向于 0 时，或者当 x 趋向于 1 时，如果你愿意，最大值是当你只有一个正方形时。

Because according to the rules, we’re trapped between the two maxima at something which is strictly below. So in other words, one answer to this question would be, and this is the answer that I would probably give, is 1/16. But that’s not really true. Because that’s only in the limit. As x goes to 0, or as x goes to 1 And if you like, the most is when you’ve only got one square.

这违反了问题的规则。所以，本质上，这是一个陷阱问题。但我会这样回答。因为这是答案中最有趣的部分，即它是 1/16，并且它实际上发生在其中一个方块消失为零时。现在，让我们在这里再举一个例子。我只是想说明第二种风格，或者说第二种类型的问题。是的。学生：教授：。

Which breaks the rules of the problem. So, essentially, it’s a trick question. But I would answer it this way. Because that’s the most interesting part of the answer, which is that it’s 1/16 and it occurs really when one of the squares disappears to nothing. So now, let’s do another example here. And I just want to illustrate the second style, or the second type of question. Yeah. STUDENT: PROFESSOR:.

问题是，既然问题是最大的面积是多少，为什么我们会找到最小的面积。原因是，当我们进行寻找最小或最大时，我们会自动找到两者。因为在比较值之前，我们不知道哪个是哪个。实际上，当你回答这样的问题时，找出最大值和最小值对你更有利。

The question is, since the question was, what was the largest area, why did we find the least area. The reason is that when we go about our procedure of looking for the least, or the most, we’ll automatically find both. Because we don’t know which one is which until we compare values. And actually, it’s much more to your advantage to figure out both the maximum and minimum whenever you answer such a question.

因为否则你不会很好地理解函数的行为。所以，问题是。我们从一个问题开始，我们回答了两个问题。我们回答了两个问题。我们回答了最大值和最小值的问题。学生：另外，我想知道你是否可以检查两种最小值方法教授：是的。也可以使用，问题是，我们可以使用二阶导数测试吗？答案是，是的，我们可以。

Because otherwise you won’t understand the behavior of the function very well. So, the question. We started out with one question, we answered both. We answered two questions. We answered the question of what the largest and the smallest value was. STUDENT: Also, I’m wondering if you can check both the minimum approaches PROFESSOR: Yes. One can also use, the question is, can we use the second derivative test. And the answer is, yes we can.

事实上，你也可以盯着它看，它就是平方和。所以它总是向上弯曲。它是具有正二阶系数的抛物线。所以你可以对它进行两次微分。如果你这样做，你会得到 1/8 + 另一个 1/8，然后你会得到 1/16。所以二阶导数是 1/16。是 1/4。这是一种可以接受的计算方法。在第二个例子中，我将再次提到二阶导数测试。

In fact, you can actually also stare at this and see that it’s a sum of squares. So it’s always curving up. It’s a parabola with a positive second coefficient. So you can differentiate this twice. If you do you’ll get 1/8 + another 1/8 and you’ll get 1/16. So the second derivative is 1/16. Is 1/4. And that’s an acceptable way of figuring it out. I’ll mention the second derivative test again, in this second example.

那么让我来谈谈第二个例子。同样，这将是另一个问题。学生：教授：问题是，当我说最小点或最大点时，我指的是哪个。学生：教授：所以我只是重复了这个问题。所以问题是，当我说最小点时，我指的是什么？好吗？答案是，出于这门课的目的，我可能会避免这么说。

我们会用一种标准的方式选择它们，好吗？首先我必须再告诉你一件事。我们可以单独计算，但我要提前告诉你。事实证明，最好的盒子底部是方形的。这将为我们消除一个变量。

And we’ll choose them in a kind of a standard way, alright? So first I have to tell you one more thing. Which is something that we could calculate separately but I’m just going to give it to you in advance. Which is that it turns out that the best box has a square bottom. And that’s going to get rid of one of our variables for us.

所以它有一个方形的底部，让我们画一个它的图。这就是我们的盒子。好吧，它差不多像这样。也许我应该把它画得再低一点。这就是我们的盒子。让我们稍微修正一下。那么现在，这个盒子的尺寸呢？好吧，这将是 x，这是非常缩短的，但它也是 x。底部是 x x，尺寸相同。

So it’s got a square bottom, and so let’s draw a picture of it. So here’s our box. Well, that goes down like this, almost. Maybe I should get it a little farther down. So here’s our box. Let’s correct that just a bit. So now, what about the dimensions of this box? Well, this is going to be x, and this is very foreshortened, but it’s also x. The bottom is x by x, it’s the same dimensions.

然后垂直尺寸是 y。到目前为止，一切顺利。现在，我答应了你再给出两个字母名称。我想计算体积。体积是，底面是 x ^2，高是 y。所以这就是体积。然后是面积，面积是底部的面积，即 x ^2，也就是底部。然后是四条边。四条边是尺寸为 xy 的矩形。

And then the vertical dimension is y. So far, so good. Now, I promised you two more letter names. I want to compute the volume. The volume is, the base is x ^2, and the height is y. So there’s the volume. And then the area, the area is the area of the bottom, which is x ^2, that’s the bottom. And then there are the four sides. And the four sides are rectangles of dimensions xy.

所以是 4xy。这些是边。记住，没有顶部。这就是我们的设置。现在，这个问题和上一个问题的区别在于，有两个变量，即 x 和 y，它们尚未确定。但这里有一个所谓的约束。也就是说，我们已经固定了 x 和 y 之间的关系。这意味着我们可以根据 x 来求解 y。

So it’s 4xy. So these are the sides. And remember, there’s no top. So that’s our setup. So now, the difference between this problem and the last problem is that there are two variables floating around, namely x and y, which are not determined. But there’s what’s called a constraint here. Namely, we’ve fixed the relationship between x and y. And so, that means that we can solve for y in terms of x.

所以 y = v / x ^2。然后，我们可以将其代入公式 a。所以这里我们得到 a，即 x ^2 + 4x ( v / x^2)。问题。学生：教授：问题是，你需要直观地知道这一点吗？不。这是我必须告诉你的。我的意思是，实际上很多事情的正确答案是对称的。

So y = v / x ^2. And then, we can plug that into the formula for a. So here we have a which is x ^2 + 4x ( v / x^2). Question. STUDENT: PROFESSOR:. The question is, will you need to know this intuitively? No. That’s something that I would have to give to you. I mean, it’s actually true that a lot of things, the correct answer is something symmetric.

在最后一个问题中，最小值正好位于两者的中间，因为两边的要求差不多相等。同样，这里的情况是，如果你拉长一边，你得到的边就会变小，这实际上涉及一个双变量问题。也就是说，如果你有一个矩形，并且它有一定长度。你能用它做的最佳事情是什么。

In this last problem, the minimum turned out to be exactly halfway in between because there were sort of equal demands from the two sides. And similarly, here, what happens is if you elongate one side, you get less it actually is involved with a two variable problem. Namely, if you have a rectangle and you have a certain amount of length associated with it. What’s the optimal thing you can do with that.

但我不会，换句话说，最佳矩形，即周长最小的矩形，结果是一个正方形。这就是导致你得到这个正方形底部的小子问题。但那将是一个单独的最大最小问题。我跳过了它，因为我想做这个稍微有趣的问题。所以现在，这是我们的公式，现在我想遵循与之前相同的程序。也就是说，我们寻找临界点。

But I won’t, in other words, the optimal rectangle, the least perimeter rectangle, turns out to be a square. That’s the little sub problem that leads you to this square bottom. But so that would have been a separate max min problem. Which I’m skipping, because I what to do this slightly more interesting one. 或者点。让我们来看看。再说一次，a 是 (x ^2 + 4v) / x。而 A' = 2x (4v / x^2)。所以如果我们将其设置为 0，我们得到 2x = 2v / x ^2。所以 2x^3。它怎么会变成 2？有趣，猜猜那是错的。好的。所以这是 x ^ 3 = 2v。所以 x = (2 ^ 1/3)( v ^1/3)。所以这是临界点。

Or points. So let’s take a look. So again, a is (x ^2 + 4v) / x. And A’ = 2x (4v / x^2). So if we set that equal to 0, we get 2x = 2v / x ^2. So 2x^3. How did that happen to change into 2? Interesting, guess that’s wrong. OK. So this is x ^ 3 = 2v. And so x = (2 ^ 1/3)( v ^1/3). So this is the critical point.

所以我们还没完。对吧？我们还没完，因为从这个角度来看，我们甚至不知道这会给我们带来最差的盒子还是最好的盒子。使用表面积最大的盒子还是最小的盒子。所以让我们马上检查一下两端。看看发生了什么。那么有人能告诉我两端是什么，x 的最终值是什么吗？x 的范围从哪里开始？

So we are not done. Right? We’re not done, because we don’t even know whether this is going to give us the worst box or the best box, from this point of view. The one that uses the most surface area or the least. So let’s check the ends, right away. To see what’s happening. So can somebody tell me what the ends, what the end values of x are? Where does x range from?

学生：教授：是的，那么 x 的最小值是多少？学生：教授：好的，声称最大的 x 可以是根 a，因为不知何故这里有 x ^2，你无法再超过它。但这个问题有一个关键特征。那就是 a 是变量。问题中唯一固定的是 v。那么如果 v 是固定的，你对 x 了解多少？

STUDENT: PROFESSOR: What’s the smallest x can be, yeah. STUDENT: PROFESSOR: OK, the claim was that the largest x could be root a, because somehow there’s this x ^2 here and you can’t get any further past than that. 学生：教授：是的。下端点是安全的。因为这在几何上与我们没有任何负尺寸的盒子有关。邮局肯定会拒绝。此外，空的顶部他们也不会接受。学生：教授：x < v / y 的平方根是正确的。所以这是在利用这种关系。

STUDENT: PROFESSOR: x > 0, yeah. The lower end point, that’s safe. Because that has to do geometrically with the fact that we don’t have any boxes with negative dimensions. That would be refused by the Post Office, definitely. Over and above the empty top, which they wouldn’t accept either. STUDENT: PROFESSOR: It’s true that x < square root of v / y. So that’s using this relationship.

但请注意 y = v / x ^2。因此，0 到无穷大，我只是在这里猜测，没错。这是上限。因此，认识到这一点非常重要。这是大多数问题。大多数问题，如果变量没有限制，通常会趋向无穷大。无穷大是问题的一个非常重要的终点。它通常也是问题的简单终点。

But notice that y = v / x ^2. So 0 to infinity, I just got a guess there over here, that’s right. Here’s the upper limit. So this is really important to realize. This is most problems. Most problems, the variable if it doesn’t have a limitation, usually just goes out to infinity. And infinity is a very important end for the problem. It’s usually an easy end to the problem, too.

因此，如果我们一直向下推到 x = 0，我们可能会得到一个更好的盒子。它将是一个非常奇怪的盒子。有点像我们的消失的围栏。也许是一个无限长的盒子，也是非常不方便的盒子。可能是最好的盒子。我们得拭目以待。让我们看看会发生什么。所以我们看看 0 + 处的 a。

So there’s a possibility that if we push all the way down to x = 0, we’ll get a better box. It would be very strange box. A little bit like our vanishing enclosure. And maybe an infinitely long box, also very inconvenient one. Might be the best box. We’ll have to see. So let’s just take a look at what happens. So we’re looking at a, at 0 +.

这就是 x^2 + 4v / x，其中 x 为 0 +。那么会发生什么呢？请注意这里，这会趋向无穷大。所以这是无限的。所以这是一个坏盒子。让我们看看另一端。所以这是 x ^2 + 4v / x，x 趋向无穷大。同样，这里的这个术语意味着这个东西是无限的。

And that’s x^2 + 4v / x with x at 0 +. So what happens to that? Notice right here, this is going to infinity. So this is infinite. So that turns out to be a bad box. Let’s take a look at the other end. So this is x ^2 + 4v / x, x going to infinity. And again, this term here means that this thing is infinite.

至于这个东西的形状，我会在这里画一个小小的示意图。这个东西的形状是这样的，对吧？所以，当我们找到一个转折点时，它恰好是这个奇怪的点 2/3，(2 ^ 1/3)( v ^ 1/3)，这将是最小值。所以我们刚刚发现它是最小值。这正是我们所希望的。这将是最佳盒子。

So the shape of this thing, I’ll draw this tiny little schematic diagram over here. The shape of this thing is like this, right? And so, when we find that one turnaround point, which happened to be at this strange point 2/3,(2 ^ 1/3)( v ^ 1/3), that is going to be the minimum. So we’ve just discovered that it’s the minimum. Which is just what we were hoping for. This is going to be the optimal box.

现在，既然你之前问过，而且也值得检查一下，我们来检查一下另一种理由。因此，检查端点的另一种方法是二阶导数测试。我不推荐二阶导数测试。当我给你问题时，我尽我所能让你很难应用二阶导数测试。但在这个例子中，函数足够简单，所以完全没问题。

Now, since you asked earlier and since it’s worth checking this as well, let’s also check an alternative justification. So an alternative to checking ends is the second derivative test. I do not recommend the second derivative test. I try my best, when I give you problems, to make it really hard to apply the second derivative test. But in this example, the function is simple enough so that it’s perfectly OK.

如果你在这里求导数，记住，这是 2x (4v / x ^2)。如果我求二阶导数，它是 2 + (8v / x ^3)。这是正数。所以这个东西是向上凹的。这与它的存在一致，临界点是最小值。是最小点。看看我差点说的是，是最小值，而不是最小点。所以要小心。是的。学生：教授：你比我领先一步。

If you take the derivative here, remember, this was whatever it was, 2x (4v / x ^2). If I take the second derivative, it’s 2 + (8v / x ^3). And that’s positive. So this thing is concave up. And that’s consistent with its being, the critical point is a min. Is a minimum point. See how I almost said, is a min, as opposed to minimum point. So watch out. Yes. STUDENT: PROFESSOR: You’re one step ahead of me.

问题是，这就是问题的答案吗？还是我们必须给出 y 和 a 等等。所以，再次强调，这是我现在想强调并花时间讨论的问题。因为这取决于你正在回答什么样的现实问题，什么样的答案是合适的。所以，到目前为止，我们已经找到了临界点。我们还没有找到临界值。

The question is, is this the answer to the question or would we have to give y and a and so on and so forth. So, again, this is something that I want to emphasize and take my time with right now. Because it depends, what kind of real life problem you’re answering, what kind of answer is appropriate. So, so far we’ve found the critical point. We haven’t found the critical value.

我们还没有找到盒子的尺寸。所以我们将花更多的时间来解决这些问题。首先，y 的值。到目前为止，我们有 x = (2 ^ 1/3)( v ^ 1/3)。当然，如果你要构建盒子，你也想知道 y 值是多少。y 值是多少，让我们看看。

We haven’t found the dimensions of the box. So we’re going to spend a little bit more time on this, exactly in order to address these questions. So, first of all. The value of y. So, so far we have x = (2 ^ 1/3)( v ^ 1/3). And certainly if you’re going to build the box, you also want to know what the y value is. The y value is going to be, let’s see.

嗯，它是 v / x ^2，所以是 v / ((2 ^ 1/3)( v ^ 1/3) ^2，结果是 (2 ^ 2/3)( v ^ 1/3)。所以这是 y 值。除此之外，我们还可以计算出 a 的值。所以这也是答案中非常合理的一部分。根据你感兴趣的内容，你可能会关心建造这个盒子要花多少钱。这个最佳盒子。

Well, it’s v / x ^2, so that’s v / ((2 ^ 1/3)( v ^ 1/3) ^2, which comes out to be (2 ^ 2/3)( v ^ 1/3). So there’s the y value. On top of that, we could figure out the value of a. So that’s also a perfectly reasonable part of the answer. Depending on what one is interested in, you might care how much money it’s going to cost you to build this box. This optimal box.

然后代入 a 的值。让我们看看，a 在这里。它是 x ^2 + 4v / x。所以它将是 ((2 ^ 1/3)( v ^ 1/3) ^2 + (4v / (2 ^ 1/3)( v ^ 1/3))。如果你把这些全部算出来，你得到的结果是 3 ( 2 ^ 1/3)( v ^ 2/3)。

And so you plug in the value of a. So a, let’s see, is up here. It’s x ^2 + 4v / x. So that’s going to be ((2 ^ 1/3)( v ^ 1/3) ^2 + (4v / (2 ^ 1/3)( v ^ 1/3)). And if you work that all out, what you get turns out to be 3 ( 2 ^ 1/3)( v ^ 2/3).

所以如果你愿意的话，回答这个问题的一种方式是这三件事。这将是与图表相对应的最小点。这将是这个问题的答案。但我之所以如此详细地进行讨论，是因为我想向你展示，有更多更有意义的方式可以回答这个问题。所以让我解释一下。所以让我在这里讨论一些更有意义的答案。

So if you like, one way of answering this question is these three things. That would be the minimum point corresponding to the graph. That would be the answer to this question. But the reason why I’m carrying it out in such detail is I want to show you that there are much more meaningful ways of answering this question. So let me explain that. So let me go through some more meaningful answers here.

第一个更有意义的答案是以下简单的想法，即所谓的无量纲变量。因此，您注意到的第一件事是缩放定律。a / v ^ 2/3 是无量纲量。它恰好是 3 ( 2 ^ 1/3)。所以这是一件事。如果你想扩大体积，你必须将面积扩大体积的 2/3 次方。

The first more meaningful answer is the following idea simply, what are known as dimensionless variables. So the first thing that you notice is the scaling law. That a / v ^ 2/3 is the thing that’s a dimensionless quantity. That happens to be 3 ( 2 ^ 1/3). So that’s one thing. If you want to expand the volume, you’ll have to expand the area by the 2/3 power of the volume.

如果你认为面积以平方英寸为单位，而盒子的体积以立方英寸为单位，那么你就会发现这是一个无量纲量，这里有一个无量纲数，它是与 a 和 v 无关的特征。另一个无量纲量是 y:x。所以 x : y。同样，这是英寸除以英寸。

And if you think of the area as being in, say, square inches, and the volume of the box as being in cubic inches, then you can see that this is a dimensionless quantity and you have a dimensionless number here, which is a characteristic independent of what a and v were. The other dimensionless quantity is the y:x. So x : y. So, again, that’s inches divided by inches.

而它是 (2 ^ 1/3)( v ^ 1/3) / ( 2 ^ 2/3)( v ^ 1/3)，恰好是 2。所以这实际上是这个问题的最佳答案。它表明这个盒子是一个 2:1 的盒子。如果这是 2，这是 1，那就是好的盒子。如果你愿意的话，这只是形状，而且它是最佳形状。当然，从美学角度来看，这是这个问题最清晰的答案。

And it’s (2 ^ 1/3)( v ^ 1/3) / ( 2 ^ 2/3)( v ^ 1/3), which happens to be 2. So this is actually the best answer to the question. And it shows you that the box is a 2:1 box. If this is 2 and this is 1, that’s the good box. And that is just the shape, if you like, and it’s the optimal shape. And certainly that, aesthetically, that’s the cleanest answer to the question.

这里有一个问题。是的。学生：教授：你能重复一遍吗，我听不清楚。学生：我想知道如果你求平方，你是否能得到这个答案。教授：问题是，如果我们没有被告知底部是正方形，我们能得到答案吗？答案是，在 18.02 中使用多变量时是可以的。如果你愿意的话，这里必须有三个字母，x、ay 和 az。

There was a question right here. Yes. STUDENT: PROFESSOR: Could you repeat that, I couldn’t hear. STUDENT: I’m wondering if you’d be able to get that answer if you square. PROFESSOR:. The question is, could we have gotten the answer if we weren’t told that the bottom was square. The answer is, yes in 18.02 with multivariable. You would have to have three letters here, an x, a y, and a z, if you like.

然后你必须处理所有这三个问题。所以我把它们分成一个，有一个单独的单变量问题，你可以为基数做。然后这是另一个单变量问题。这只是解决多变量问题的两个连续单变量问题。或者，正如我在多变量微积分中所说的那样，你可以一步完成所有操作。是吗？

And then you’d have to work with all three of them. So I separated out into one, there’s a separate one variable problem that you can do for the base. And then this is a second one variable problem for this other thing. And it’s just two consecutive one variable problems that solve the multivariable problem. Or, as I say in multivariable calculus, you can just do it all in one step. Yeah?

学生：教授：为什么我要用 x 除以 y，而不是用 y 除以 x，或者其他什么方法？所以，我的目标是无量纲量。所以 x 和 y 用相同的单位来测量。盒子的比例也是如此。所以，换句话说，就是比例。它是通用的，与体积 v 无关。你可以用它描述任何盒子，任何尺度。

STUDENT: PROFESSOR: Why did I divide x by y, rather than y by x, or in any? So, again, what I was aiming for was dimensionless quantities. So x and y are measured in the same units. And also the proportions of the box. So that’s another word for this is proportions. Are something that’s universal, independent of the volume v. It’s something you can say about any box, at any scale.

无论是克里斯托在公共公园里的作品。也许我们会来这里做一些奇特的事情。学生：教授：。比例通常是几何问题，当问题有规模时。答案在小尺度和大尺度上是相同的。这就是捕捉到这一点的原因。这就是为什么比例就是捕捉到这一点的原因。这就是为什么从美学角度来说，这是最友好的问题。

Whether it be, you know, something by Cristo in the Common. Maybe we’ll get in here to do some fancy STUDENT: PROFESSOR:. The proportions is with geometric problems typically, when there’s a scaling to the problem. Where the answer is the same at small scales and at large scales. This is capturing that. So that’s why, the ratios are what’s capturing that. And that’s why it’s aesthetically the nicest thing to ask.

学生：那么，面积与体积的比率究竟告诉我们什么？ 教授：不幸的是，这个数字真的很难懂。所以问题是它告诉我们什么。我唯一想强调的是左边的内容。也就是说，它是面积的 2/3 次方，所以它是一个无量纲量，恰好是这个。

STUDENT: So, what exactly does the ratio of the area to the volume ratio tell us? PROFESSOR: Unfortunately, this number is a really obscure number. So the question is what does this tell us. The only thing that I want to emphasize is what’s on the left hand side here. Which is, it’s the area to the 2/3 power of the volume, so it’s a dimensionless quantity that happens to be this.

例如，如果你这样做，一般来说，对于平面图来说，周长面积不是一个好的比例。你想要的是周长平方与面积的比值。因为周长平方具有相同的尺寸；也就是说，英寸平方与面积的比值。也就是平方英寸。所以，再说一遍，你想要得到的是这些无量纲量。而这些量将具有普遍的性质。

If you do this, for example, in general with planar diagrams, circumferenced area is a bad ratio to take. What you want to take is the square of circumference to area. Because the square of circumference has the same dimensions; that is, say, inches squared to area. Which is in square inches. So, again, it’s these dimensionless quantities that you want to cook up. And those are the ones that will have universal properties.

其中最著名的是周长所包围面积最大的圆。而且，同样，这只有在你取周长的平方时才成立。你的单位是正确的。不管怎样。所以我们在这里，我们得到了一个形状。我们得到了这个问题的答案。我现在想解决这个问题。好吧，让我们这样说吧。我想用不同的方法来解决这个问题。

The most famous of these is the circle that encloses the most area for its circumference. And, again, that’s only true if you take the square of the circumference. You do the units correctly. Anyway. So we’re here, we’ve got a shape. We’ve got an answer to this question. And I now want to do this problem. Well, let’s put it this way. I wanted to do this problem by a different method.

我想我会花点时间来解决它。我想用一种略有不同的方法来解决这个问题。这是隐式微分法示例 2。同样的例子，但现在我要用隐式微分法来做。好吧，我会在这里告诉你这种方法的优点和缺点。情况是，你必须以同样的方式开始。所以这是问题的起点。

I think I’ll take the time to do it. So I want to do this problem by a slightly different method here. So, here’s Example 2 by implicit differentiation. So the same example, but now I’m going to do it by implicit differentiation. Well, I’ll tell you the advantages and disadvantages to this method here. So the situation is, you have to start the same way. So here is the starting place of the problem.

目标是求出 v 为常数的 a 的最小值。这就是我们所处的情形。现在，我想要做的只是求导。函数 y 隐式地是 x 的函数，因此我可以求第一个表达式的导数。结果为 0 = 2xy + (x ^2 )( y')。因此，这给了我 y' 的隐式公式，所以 y' = 2xy / x ^2。或者换句话说，2y / x。

And the goal was the minimum of a with v constant. So this was the situation that we were in. And now, what I want to do is just differentiate. The function y is implicitly a function of x, so I can differentiate the first expression. And that yields 0 = 2xy + (x ^2 )( y’). So this is giving me my implicit formula for y’So y’ = 2xy / x ^2. Or in other words, 2y / x.

然后我还有 dA/dx。现在，你可能注意到我没有使用那么多素数。因为所有变量都是变化的，所以在这里我强调它是对变量 x 的微分。这变成了 2x + 4y + 4xy'。所以再次，这是使用乘积规则。现在我可以代入 y'，它就在它上面。

And then I also have the dA/dx. Now, you may notice I’m not using primes quite as much. Because all of the variables are varying, and so here I’m emphasizing that it’s a differentiation with respect to the variable x. And this becomes 2x + 4y + 4xy’. So again, this is using the product rule. And now I can plug in for what y’ is, which is right above it.

所以这是 2x + 4y + 4x (2y / x)。等于 0。让我们把它们加在一起。那么我们得到什么？我们有 2x + 4y，然后，总共是 8 8y = 0。所以这和 2x = 4y 是一样的。4y 到了另一边。所以，x / y = 2。所以，我认为，你必须自己决定。

So this is 2x + 4y + 4x ( 2y / x). And that’s equal to 0. And so let’s gather that together. So what do we have? We have 2x + 4y, and then, altogether, this is 8 8y = 0. So that’s the same thing as 2x = 4y. The 4y goes to the other side. And so, x / y = 2. So this, I claim, so you have to decide for yourself.

但我认为这种方法更快。这种方法更快，而且它直指问题的核心，即不同比例的尺度。这种方法基本上也更好。因此，它也能给出更好的答案。这些就是这种方法的优点。这种方法更快，而且它能给出更好的答案。缺点是它没有检查这个临界点是最大值、最小值还是两者都不是。

But I claim that this is faster. It’s faster, and also it gets to the heart of the matter, which is this scale in variant proportions. Which is basically also nicer. So it gets to the nicer answer, also. So those are the advantages that this has. So it’s faster, and it gets to this, I’m going to call it nicer. And the disadvantage is it did not check. Whether this critical point is a max, min, or neither.

所以我们并没有完全解决这个问题。但我们很快就找到了答案。是的，问题。学生：教授：你会如何检查它？学生：教授：好吧，所以它给你一个候选。答案是，问题是，你会如何检查它？答案是，对于这个特定的问题，唯一的方法是做这样的事情。换句话说，它不会为你节省那么多时间。

So we didn’t quite finish the problem. But we got to the answer very fast. Yeah, question. STUDENT: PROFESSOR: How would you check it? STUDENT: PROFESSOR: Well, so it gives you a candidate. The answer is so the question is, how would you check it? The answer is that for this particular problem, the only way to do it is to do something like this. So in other words, it doesn’t save you that much time.

但是，通过很多很多例子，你实际上可以立即看出，如果两端是 0，而内部是正数。诸如此类。所以在很多情况下，这同样适用。现在我要换个话题。但我接下来要讨论的话题几乎非常紧密地联系在一起。也就是说，我谈到了隐式微分。

But with many, many, examples, you actually can tell immediately that if the two ends, the thing is, say, 0, and inside it’s positive. Things like that. So in many, many, cases this is just as good. So now I’m going to change subjects here. But the subject that I’m going to talk about next is almost, is very, very closely linked. Namely, I talked about implicit differentiation.

现在，我们将讨论如何处理大量变量。以及变化率。因此，本质上，我们将讨论同一类事情。因此，我将向你们介绍一个称为相关率的主题。这实际上只是习惯于设置变量和方程式的另一个借口。因此，我们开始吧。相关率。我将今天用一个例子来说明这一点，明天再举一个例子。

Now, we’re going to just talk about dealing with lots of variables. And rates of change. So, essentially, we’re going to talk about the same type of thing. So, I’m going to tell you about a subject which is called related rates. Which is really just another excuse for getting used to setting up variables and equations. So, here we go. Related rates. And I’m going to illustrate this with one example today, one tomorrow.

这就是我今天要举的例子。所以，再说一遍，这将是一个警察问题。但这将是一个文字问题，抱歉，我不想吓到你，没有警察。好吧，故事中有警察，但他们不在场。所以，我会立即用图表画出来，因为我要省去麻烦。虽然，你知道，这里的重点是从文字到图表。

So here’s my example for today. So, again, this is going to be a police problem. But this is going to be a word problem and sorry, I’m don’t want to scare you, no police. Well, there are police in the story but they’re not present. So, but I’m going to draw it immediately with the diagram because I’m going to save us the trouble. Although, you know, the point here is to get from the words to the diagram.

所以警察在距离道路 30 英尺的地方。这是道路。你开着车沿着这条路过来，我们看看，你开着车朝这个方向开。警察有雷达。雷达从你的车上反射回来。他们读到的是你离道路 50 英尺远。他们还知道你正沿着雷达线以每秒 80 英尺的速度接近。

So you have the police, and they’re 30 feet from the road. And here’s the road. And you’re coming along, here, in your, let’s see, in your car going in this direction here. And the police have radar. Which is bouncing off of your car. And what they read off is that you’re 50 feet away. They also know that you’re approaching along the line of the radar at a rate of 80 feet per second.

现在，问题是，你超速了吗？这就是问题所在。顺便说一下，当你超速时，每秒 95 英尺大约相当于每小时 65 英里。这就是这里的阈值。所以我现在要做的是向你展示如何设置这样的问题。这个距离是 50。这是 30，因为这是到直线的距离，所以你知道这是一个直角。

Now, the question is, are you speeding. That’s the question. So when you’re speeding, by the way, up 95 feet per second is about 65 miles per hour. So that’s the threshold here. So what I want to do now is show you how you set up a problem like this. This distance is 50. This is 30, and because it’s the distance to a straight line you know that this is a right angle.

所以我们知道这是一个直角三角形。这是一个直角三角形，很简单，一个 3,4.5 直角三角形，这样我们就可以轻松进行计算。现在的问题是，我们如何输入字母来解决这个问题，找出变化率。现在，让我现在解释一下。

So we know that this is a right triangle. And this is set out to be a right triangle, which is an easy one, a 3,4.5 right triangle just so that we can do the computations easily. So now, the question is, how do we put the letters in to make his problem work, to figure out what the rate of change is. So now, let me explain that right now.

下次我们才会真正进行计算。所以首先，你必须明白什么在变化，什么没有变化。我们将使用 t 表示时间，以秒为单位。现在，这里一个重要的距离是到这个垂线的这一英尺的距离。所以我将其命名为 x。我将给这个字母 x。现在，x 是变化的。

And we will actually do the computation next time. So the first thing is, you have to understand what’s changing and what’s not. And we’re going to use t for time, in seconds. And now, an important distance here is the distance to this foot of this perpendicular. So I’m going to name that x. I’m going to give that letter x. Now, x is varying.

我之所以需要用一个字母来表示它而不是 40，是因为它会相对于 t 有一个变化率。事实上，它与 dx / dt 是否比 95 快或慢有关。所以这就是变化的东西。现在，还有其他东西在变化。这里的距离也在变化。所以我们需要一个字母来表示它。

The reason why I need a letter for it as opposed to this 40 is that it’s going to have a rate of change with respect to t. And, in fact, it’s related to, the question is whether dx / dt is faster or slower than 95. So that’s the thing that’s varying. Now, there’s something else that’s varying. This distance here is also varying. So we need a letter for that.

我们不需要写信来说明这一点。因为它永远不会改变。我们假设警察是停着的。他们还没有准备好冲出来抓你，当他们用雷达枪瞄准你时，他们肯定不会动。所以你需要了解一些关于警察的社会学和作风。所以你需要了解一些关于现实世界的事情。现在，最后一点是，这里的 80 怎么样。

We do not need a letter for this. Because it’s never changing. We’re assuming the police are parked. They’re not ready to roar out and catch you just yet, and they’re certainly not in motion when they’ve got the radar guns aimed at you. So you need to know something about the sociology and style of police. So you need to know things about the real world. Now, the last bit is, what about this 80 here.

这就是你接近的速度。现在，这是沿着雷达枪测量的。我声称这是这个量的 d 乘以 dt。所以这个 d 也在变化。这就是为什么我们也需要一个字母来表示它。所以，下次，我们将把它们放在一起并计算 dx / dt。

So this is how fast you’re approaching. Now, that’s measured along the radar gun. I claim that’s d by dt of this quantity here. So this is d is also changing. That’s why we needed a letter for it, too. So, next time, we’ll just put that all together and compute dx / dt.

Lec 13 | MIT 18.01 单变量微积分，2007 年秋季

Lec 13 | MIT 18.01 Single Variable Calculus, Fall 2007

16 年前 (2009 年 4 月 15 日) — 53:23 https://youtube.com/watch?v=sRIDVAcoG5A

16 years ago (Apr 15, 2009) — 53:23 https://youtube.com/watch?v=sRIDVAcoG5A

以下内容根据 Creative Commons 许可提供。您的支持将帮助 MIT OpenCourseWare 继续免费提供高质量的教育资源。要捐款或查看数百门 MIT 课程的其他材料，请访问 MIT OpenCourseWare，网址为 ocw.mit.edu。教授：今天我们将继续讨论相关费率。您可能还记得，上次我们正在解决这个几何问题。有一个直角三角形。

The following content is provided under a Creative Commons license. Your support will help MIT OpenCourseWare continue to offer high quality educational resources for free. To make a donation or to view additional materials from hundreds of MIT courses, visit MIT OpenCourseWare at ocw.mit.edu. PROFESSOR: Today we’re going to keep on going with related rates. And you may recall that last time we were in the middle of a problem with this geometry. There was a right triangle.

有一条路。从右到左，这条路是这样的。警察在这里监视着情况。距离道路 30 英尺。而你就在这里。你正朝这个方向走。也许这是一条双车道公路，但无论如何它只朝这个方向走。这个距离是 50 英尺。所以，因为你在移动，这个距离是变化的，所以我们给了它一个字母。

There was a road. Which was going this way, from right to left. And the police were up here, monitoring the situation. 30 feet from the road. And you’re here. And you’re heading this way. Maybe it’s a two lane highway, but anyway it’s only going this direction. And this distance was 50 feet. So, because you’re moving, this distance is varying and so we gave it a letter.

同样，你到与道路垂直线的底部的距离也在变化。此时它是 40，因为这是一个 3,4.5 直角三角形。这就是我们上次遇到的情况。我们将从上次停下的地方继续。问题是，如果 D 相对于 t 的变化率为每秒 80 英尺，你是否超速了。

And, similarly, your distance to the foot of the perpendicular with the road is also varying. At this instant it’s 40, because this is a 3,4.5 right triangle. So this was the situation that we were in last time. And we’re going to pick up where we left off. The question is, are you speeding if the rate of change of D with respect to t is 80 feet per second.

现在，从技术上讲，应该是 80 英尺/秒，因为你正朝着警察的方向行驶。好吧，所以 D 以每秒 80 英尺的速度缩小。我提醒你，95 英尺/秒大约是速度限制。也就是每小时 65 英里。所以，再说一次，这是我们上次的情况。这里有一个小问号。让我们来解决这个问题。所以，这是设置。有一个直角三角形。

Now, technically that would be 80, because you’re going towards the policemen. Alright, so D is shrinking at a rate of 80 feet per second. And I remind you that 95 feet per second is approximately the speed limit. Which is 65 miles per hour. So, again, this is where we were last time. And, got a little question mark there. And so let’s solve this problem. So, this is the setup. There’s a right triangle.

所以这些长度之间存在一个关系。这个关系是 x ^2 + 30 ^2 = D ^2。这就是我们得到的第一个关系。第二个关系我们已经记下来了。即 dx / dt 哦，不好意思。dD / dt = -80。现在，这里的想法相对简单。我们只想使用微分。现在，你可以解出 x。好吧，x 是 D^2 30 平方的平方根。

So there’s a relationship between these lengths. And the relationship is that x ^2 + 30 ^2 = D ^2. So that’s the first relationship that we have.
