The next thing I want to prove to you is that e ^ x > 1 + x + (x^2 / 2). So, how do I do that? I introduce a function g (x), which is e^x minus this. And now, I’m just going to do exactly the same thing I did before. Which is, I get started with g ( 0 ).

也就是 1 1。也就是 0。而 g' ( x ) 是 e ^ x 减，看看当我微分它时会发生什么。1 消失了。x 给了我 1，而 x^2 / 2 给了我 a + x。这个对于 x > 0 是正数，因为步骤 1。因为我之前做过一个。所以这个是增加的。g 是增加的。

Which is 1 1. Which is 0. And g’ ( x ) is e ^ x minus now, look at what happens when I differentiate this. The 1 goes away. The x gives me a 1, and the x^2 / 2 gives me a + x. And this one is positive for x > 0, because of step 1. Because of the previous one that I did. So this one is increasing. g is increasing.

这表明 g ( x ) > g ( 0 )。如果你仔细读一下，就会发现它与我们这里的不等式完全相同。e^x > 1 + x + (x^2 / 2)。现在，你可以一直这样下去。让我写下你得到的结果。你得到 e ^ x > 1 + x + (x^2 / 2)。

Which says that g ( x ) > g ( 0 ). And if you just read that off, it’s exactly the same as our inequality here. e^x > 1 + x + (x^2 / 2). Now, you can keep on going with this essentially forever. And let me just write down what you get. You get e ^ x > 1 + x + (x^2 / 2).

下一个结果是 (x^3 / 3 * 2) + (x^4 / 4 * 3 * 2)。您可以做任何您想做的事情。您可以做其他事情。这就像龟兔赛跑。这是乌龟，这是兔子，它总是领先。但最终，如果您走得无限远，它会赶上。所以这在极限中恰好等于 e ^ x。我们可能会在课程结束时讨论这个问题。

The next one turns out to be (x^3 / 3 * 2) + (x^4 / 4 * 3 * 2). And you can do whatever you want. You can do others. And this is like the tortoise and the hare. This is the tortoise, and this is the hare, it’s always ahead. But eventually, if you go infinitely far, it catches up. So this turns out to be exactly equal to e ^ x in the limit. And we’ll talk about that maybe at the end of the course.

Lec 15 | MIT 18.01 单变量微积分，2007 年秋季

Lec 15 | MIT 18.01 Single Variable Calculus, Fall 2007

16 年前 (2009 年 4 月 15 日) — 48:53 https://youtube.com/watch?v=-MI0b4h3rS0

16 years ago (Apr 15, 2009) — 48:53 https://youtube.com/watch?v=-MI0b4h3rS0

以下内容根据 Creative Commons 许可提供。您的支持将帮助 MIT OpenCourseWare 继续免费提供高质量的教育资源。要捐款或查看数百门 MIT 课程的其他材料，请访问 MIT OpenCourseWare，网址为 ocw.mit.edu。教授：今天，我们将从理论内容（中值定理）转到介绍，介绍本课程剩余部分将要讨论的内容，即积分。

The following content is provided under a Creative Commons license. Your support will help MIT OpenCourseWare continue to offer high quality educational resources for free. To make a donation, or to view additional materials from hundreds of MIT courses, visit MIT OpenCourseWare at ocw.mit.edu. PROFESSOR: Today we’re moving on from theoretical things, from the mean value theorem, to the introduction to what’s going to occupy us for the whole rest of the course, which is integration.

因此，为了介绍这个主题，我需要为你们介绍一种新的符号，称为微分。我将告诉你们什么是微分，我们会逐渐习惯使用它。如果你有一个函数 y = f(x)，那么 y 的微分将表示为 dy，根据定义，它是 f'(x) dx。所以这是符号。

So, in order to introduce that subject, I need to introduce for you a new notation, which is called differentials. I’m going to tell you what a differential is, and we’ll get used to using it over time. If you have a function which is y = f(x), then the differential of y is going to be denoted dy, and it’s by definition f’(x) dx. So here’s the notation.

因为 y 实际上等于 f，所以有时我们也称它为 f 的微分。它也被称为 f 的微分。这是符号，它与你正式取这个 dx，把它当作一个数字，然后除以 dy 时发生的事情是一样的。所以它的意思和这里的这个陈述是一样的。这或多或少是莱布尼茨对导数的解释。

And because y is really equal to f, sometimes we also call it the differential of f. It’s also called the differential of f. That’s the notation, and it’s the same thing as what happens if you formally just take this dx, act like it’s a number and divide it into dy. So it means the same thing as this statement here. And this is more or less the Leibniz interpretation of derivatives.

导数是这些所谓的微分的比率。它是所谓的无穷小量的比率。现在，这是一个模糊的概念，这里的这个小点就是无穷小量。它有点像一个无限小的量。莱布尼茨完善了直观处理这些的想法。后来，数学家们一直在使用它们。它们比牛顿使用的符号有效得多。

Of a derivative as a ratio of these so called differentials. It’s a ratio of what are known as infinitesimals. Now, this is kind of a vague notion, this little bit here being an infinitesimal. It’s sort of like an infinitely small quantity. And Leibniz perfected the idea of dealing with these intuitively. And subsequently, mathematicians use them all the time. They’re way more effective than the notation that Newton used.

你可能认为符号是一件小事，但有时它们能让你思考得更快。当你对每件事都有正确的名称和正确的符号时。在这种情况下，它产生了很大的不同。莱布尼茨的符号在欧洲大陆被采用，而牛顿在英国占据主导地位，结果，英国人在微积分的发展上落后了一两百年。这确实是一件严肃的事情。

You might think that notations are a small matter, but they allow you to think much faster, sometimes. When you have the right names and the right symbols for everything. And in this case it made it very big difference. Leibniz’s notation was adopted on the continent and Newton dominated in Britain and, as a result, the British fell behind by one or two hundred years in the development of calculus. It was really a serious matter.

所以，你真的应该花点时间去熟悉比率的概念。它随处可见，既出现在这门课上，也出现在多变量微积分中。它用于许多场合。所以首先，让我们简单一点。我们将通过它在线性近似中的应用来说明它，我们已经做过了。这里的图我们已经画过很多次了，它是某个函数。

So it’s really well worth your while to get used to this idea of ratios. And it comes up all over the place, both in this class and also in multivariable calculus. It’s used in many contexts. So first of all, just to go a little bit easy. We’ll illustrate it by its use in linear approximations, which we’ve already done. The picture here, which we’ve drawn a number of times, is that you have some function.

这是函数的值。它就是这样出现的。这就是我们的函数。我们向前移动一点，到达 dx 的位置。这种符号的思想是 dx 将替换符号 delta x，即 x 的变化。我们不会想太多。

And here’s a value of the function. And it’s coming up like that. So here’s our function. And we go forward a little increment to a place which is dx further along. The idea of this notation is that dx is going to replace the symbol delta x, which is the change in x. And we won’t think too hard about.

嗯，这是一个很小的量，这是一个很小的量，我们不会过多考虑它的含义。现在，同样，如果您看到我们已经上升了多少，这个值有点低，所以这里只有一点点。所以这里的距离，以前我们称之为 delta y。但现在我们只称它为 dy。所以 dy 取代了 delta y。所以这是函数级别的变化。

Well, this is a small quantity, this is a small quantity, we’re not going to think too hard about what that means. Now, similarly, if you see how much we’ve gone up well, this is kind of low, so it’s a small bit here. So this distance here is, previously we called it delta y. But now we’re just going to call it dy. So dy replaces delta y. So this is the change in level of the function.

我们将用这种方式来表示它。通常，这只是为了节省一点符号。为此，我们将做与 delta x 和 delta y 相同的事情，但这是莱布尼茨的想法。他会用这个来画出来。所以这里的距离是 dx，这里的距离是 dy。

And we’ll represent it symbolically this way. Very frequently, this just saves a little bit of notation. For the purposes of this, we’ll be doing the same things we did with delta x and delta y, but this is the way that Leibniz thought of it. And he would just have drawn it with this. So this distance here is dx and this distance here is dy.

举一个线性近似的例子，我们会说 64.1 的 1/3 次方大约等于多少？现在，我将用这个新符号来执行此操作。所涉及的函数是 x^1/3。然后是微分，dy。现在，我想使用这个规则来习惯它。因为这就是我们今天要做的，我们对 y 求微分或微分。

So for an example of linear approximation, we’ll say what’s 64.1, say, to the 1/3 power, approximately equal to? Now, I’m going to carry this out in this new notation here. The function involved is x^1/3. And then it’s a differential, dy. Now, I want to use this rule to get used to it. Because this is what we’re going to be doing all of today is, we’re differentiating, or taking the differential of y.

所以这只是导数。即 1/3 x^( 2/3) dx。现在我要填写它的具体值。在 x = 64 处，这是最接近的自然位置，很容易进行求值，我们有 y = 64^(1/3)，也就是 4。dy 呢？嗯，这有点复杂。把它放在这里。所以 dy = 1/3 64^( 2/3) dx。

So that is going to be just the derivative. That’s 1/3 x^( 2/3) dx. And now I’m just going to fill in exactly what this is. At x = 64, which is the natural place close by where it’s easy to do the evaluations, we have y = 64^(1/3), which is just 4. And how about dy? Well, so this is a little bit more complicated. Put it over here. So dy = 1/3 64^( 2/3) dx.

那就是 1/3 * 1/16 dx，也就是 1/48 dx。现在我要计算 64 除以这个奇怪的分数，不管它是多少。我只是想非常小心地向你们解释另一件事。

And that is 1/3 * 1/16 dx, which is 1/48 dx. And now I’m going to work out what 64 to the, whatever it is here, this strange fraction. I just want to be very careful to explain to you one more thing.

也就是说，我们使用 x = 64，因此我们认为 x + dx 将是 64.1。这意味着 dx 将是 1/10。这就是我们感兴趣的增量。现在我可以进行近似。近似值表明 64.1^(1/3) 大约是我要说的 y + dy。因为实际上，我在这里确定的 dy 是由这个线性关系决定的。

Which is that we’re using x = 64, and so we’re thinking of x + dx is going to be 64.1. So that means that dx is going to be 1/10. So that’s the increment that we’re interested in. And now I can carry out the approximation. The approximation says that 64.1^(1/3) is, well, it’s approximately what I’m going to call y + dy. Because really, the dy that I’m determining here is determined by this linear relation.

Dy = 1/48 dx。所以这只是近似正确。因为实际上它等于 y + delta y。在我们之前的符号中。所以这是伪装的。这等于什么。这是线性近似给出的唯一近似值。

Dy = 1/48 dx. And so this is only approximately true. Because what’s really true is that this is equal to y + delta y. In our previous notation. So this is in disguise. What this is equal to. And that’s the only approximately equal to what the linear approximation would give you.

所以，实际上，尽管我在这里写 dy 是这个增量，但如果 dx 就是这个增量，那么它实际上是沿切线直线上升的量。所以我不会这么做，因为人们不会这么写。他们甚至不会这么想。他们实际上认为 dx 和 dy 都是无穷小的。这里我们要从有限层面来做这件事。

So, really, even though I wrote dy is this increment here, what it really is if dx is exactly that, is it’s the amount it would go up if you went straight up the tangent line. So I’m not going to do that because that’s not what people write. And that’s not even what they think. They’re really thinking of both dx and dy as being infinitesimally small. And here we’re going to the finite level and doing it.

所以你必须接受这个符号的一点歧义。这是近似值。现在我可以在这里计算这些数字。y 的这个值是 4。而 dy，正如我所说，是 1/48 dx。结果是 4 + 1/480，因为 dx 是 1/10。所以大约是 4.002。这是我们的近似值。现在，让我们将它与之前的符号进行比较。

So this is just something you have to live with, is a little ambiguity in this notation. This is the approximation. And now I can just calculate these numbers here. y at this value is 4. And dy, as I said, is 1/48 dx. And that turns out to be 4 + 1/480, because dx is 1/10. So that’s approximately 4.002. And that’s our approximation. Now, let’s just compare it to our previous notation.

如果您愿意，这将作为对线性近似的回顾。但我想强调的是，这些事情应该是相同的。只是它们实际上是同一件事。只是对同一事物的不同表示。我提醒您，线性近似的基本公式是 f(x) 近似于 f(a) + f'(a) (xa)。我们将其应用于 a = 64 和 f(x) = x^(1/3) 的情况。

This will serve as a review of, if you like, of linear approximation. But what I want to emphasize is that these things are supposed to be the same. Just that it’s really the same thing. It’s just a different notation for the same thing. I remind you the basic formula for linear approximation is that f(x) is approximately f(a) + f’(a) (x a). And we’re applying it in the situation that a = 64 and f(x) = x^(1/3).

因此 f(a)，也就是 f(64)，当然是 4。而 f'(a)，也就是 1/3 a^( 2/3)，在我们的例子中是 1/16。不，是 1/48。好的，这与之前的计算相同。然后我们的关系变为 x^(1/3) 约等于 4 加 1/48 乘以 x 减 a，也就是 64。所以你看，我在这里写的每个数字对于另一种方法都有一个对应的数字。

And so f(a), which is f(64), is of course 4. And f’(a), which is 1/3 a^( 2/3), is in our case 1/16. No, 1/48. OK, that’s the same calculation as before. And then our relationship becomes x^(1/3) is approximately equal to 4 plus 1/48 times x minus a, which is 64. So look, every single number that I’ve written over here has a corresponding number for this other method.

现在，如果我代入我们想要的值，也就是 64.1，那么结果就是 4 + 1/4.1/10，这和我们之前得到的一样。所以，答案还是一样。方法还是一样，符号是新的。现在，我可以以一种新颖的方式使用这种符号了。所以，再说一遍，这是符号。这是微分符号。

And now if I plug in the value we happen to want, which is the 64.1, this would be 4 + 1/4.1/10, which is just the same thing we had before. So again, same answer. Same method, new notation. Well, now I get to use this notation in a novel way. So again, here’s the notation. This notation of differential.

我将使用它来讨论所谓的不定积分。同样，这是一个新的符号。但它也是一个新想法。这是我们还没有讨论过的。也就是说，我想在这里描述的符号是所谓的 g(x) dx 的积分。我将用 x 的函数大写 G 来表示它。

The way I’m going to use it is in discussing something called antiderivative Again, this is a new notation now. But it’s also a new idea. It’s one that we haven’t discussed yet. Namely, the notation that I want to describe here is what’s called the integral of g(x) dx. And I’ll denote that by a function capital G of x.

所以，你从一个函数 g(x) 开始，然后你得到一个大写字母 G(x)，它被称为 g 的反导数。注意这里有一个微分。这个符号，这个家伙，被称为积分符号。或者一个积分，或者整个东西被称为积分。g 的反导数的另一个名字是 g 的不定积分。我会在这里向你解释为什么它是不定的。很快。

So it’s, you start with a function g(x) and you produce a function capital G(x), which is called the antiderivative of g. Notice there’s a differential sitting in here. This symbol, this guy here, is called an integral sign. Or an integral, or this whole thing is called an integral. And another name for the antiderivative of g is the indefinite integral of g. And I’ll explain to you why it’s indefinite in just. very shortly here.

好吧，让我们进行一些示例。基本上，我想做的是尽可能多地举例，这些例子与我们在课程开始时得出的所有导数相似。换句话说，原则上你希望能够积分尽可能多的东西。我们将从 sin x dx 的积分开始。这是一个导数为 sin x 的函数。那么它会是什么函数呢？

Well, so let’s carry out some examples. Basically what I’d like to do is as many examples along the lines of all the derivatives that we derived at the beginning of the course. In other words, in principle you want to be able to integrate as many things as possible. We’re going to start out with the integral of sin x dx. That’s a function whose derivative is sin x. So what function would that be?

余弦 x，减，对吧。它是 cos x。所以 cos x 的导数是 sin x。所以它是正弦的反导数。它满足这个性质。所以这个函数 G(x) = cos x 有一个性质，它的导数是 sin x。另一方面，如果你对一个常数求导，你会得到 0。所以这个答案就是所谓的不定式。因为你也可以在这里添加任何常数。同样的事情也会成立。

Cosine x, minus, right. It’s cos x. So cos x differentiated gives you sin x. So that is an antiderivative of sine. And it satisfies this property. So this function, G(x) = cos x, has the property that its derivative is sin x. On the other hand, if you differentiate a constant, you get 0. So this answer is what’s called indefinite. Because you can also add any constant here. And the same thing will be true.

因此，c 是常数。正如我所说，积分被称为不定积分。这就是“积分”前面的修饰语的解释。它是不定积分，因为我们实际上没有指定单个函数。我们没有得到单个答案。每当你取某个东西的反导数时，它在常数之前都是模棱两可的。接下来，让我们从我们的库中做一些其他标准函数。我们有 x^a dx 的积分。一些幂，幂的积分。

So, c is constant. And as I said, the integral is called indefinite. So that’s an explanation for this modifier in front of the “integral”. It’s indefinite because we actually didn’t specify a single function. We don’t get a single answer. Whenever you take the antiderivative of something it’s ambiguous up to a constant. Next, let’s do some other standard functions from our repertoire. We have the integral of x^a dx. Some power, the integral of a power.

如果你仔细想想，你应该微分的是比它大一个幂的数。但为了使微分正确，你必须除以 1/(a+1)。所以这只是 x^(a+1) 的 d/dx，或者我应该这样说。也许我会用微分符号来表示。d(x^(a+1)) = (a+1) x^a dx。所以如果我用 a+1 除以它，我就会得到上面的关系。

And if you think about it, what you should be differentiating is one power larger than that. But then you have to divide by 1/(a+1), in order that the differentiation be correct. So this just is the fact that d/dx of x^(a+1), or maybe I should even say it this way. Maybe I’ll do it in differential notation. d(x^(a+1)) = (a+1) x^a dx. So if I divide that through by a+1, then I get the relation above.

而且由于这个常数不明确，所以它可以是任何添加到该函数的附加常数。现在，我下面写下的恒等式是正确的。但这个恒等式并不总是正确的。有什么例外？是的。a 等于。学生：0。教授：负 1。所以这个恒等式对所有 a 来说都是正确的。

And because this is ambiguous up to a constant, it could be any additional constant added to that function. Now, the identity that I wrote down below is correct. But this one is not always correct. What’s the exception? Yeah. a equals. STUDENT: 0. PROFESSOR: Negative 1. So this one is OK for all a.

但是这个不成立，因为当 a = 1 时我们除以了 0。所以这只在 a 不等于 1 时才成立。事实上，当然，当 a = 0 时，当你对常数求导时，你会得到 0。所以还有第三种情况我们必须执行。这是例外情况，即 dx/x 的积分。这次，如果我们回想一下我们的。

But this one fails because we’ve divided by 0 when a = 1. So this is only true when a is not equal to 1. And in fact, of course, what’s happening when a = 0, you’re getting 0 when you differentiate the constant. So there’s a third case that we have to carry out. Which is the exceptional case, namely the integral of dx/x. And this time, if we just think back to what our.

所以我们在这里做的是逆向思考，这是数学中所有阶段都要做的重要事情。我们得到了所有的公式，现在我们反向阅读它们。所以这个，你可能还记得，是 ln x。我现在要小心而缓慢地做这件事的原因是，现在我还想写出更标准的形式。所以首先，我们必须添加一个常数。

So what we’re doing is thinking backwards here, which a very important thing to do in math at all stages. We got all of our formulas, now we’re reading them backwards. And so this one, you may remember, is ln x. The reason why I want to do this carefully and slowly now, is right now I also want to write the more standard form which is presented. So first of all, first we have to add a constant.

请不要在这里加括号。括号就在那里。但这个公式后面还隐藏着另一个公式。也就是说，当 x 为负数时，你也可以得到正确的公式。结果就是这个公式。所以我把 x 为正数的情况当作你知道的东西。但让我们检查一下 x 为负数的情况。

And please don’t put the parentheses here. The parentheses go there. But there’s another formula hiding in the woodwork here behind this one. Which is that you can also get the correct formula when x is negative. And that turns out to be this one here. So I’m treating the case, x positive, as being something that you know. But let’s check the case, x negative.

为了检验 x 为负的情况，我必须对 x 绝对值的对数进行微分。对于 x 为负的情况，这与对负 x 对数的导数相同。这就是 x 为负时的公式。如果你执行这个公式，你会得到什么，也许我会把它放在这里，嗯，这是链式法则。

In order to check the case x negative, I have to differentiate the logarithm of the absolute value of x in that case. And that’s the same thing, again, for x negative as the derivative of the logarithm of negative x. That’s the formula, when x is negative. And if you carry that out, what you get, maybe I’ll put this over here, is, well, it’s the chain rule.

它是 1/( x) 乘以 x 对 x 的导数。所以看到有两个负号。分母是 ax，分子是 x 的导数。也就是 1。这部分是 1。所以这个 1 除以 x，也就是 1/x。所以负号抵消了。如果你只是用 ln( x) 及其图像来跟踪它，那就是一个看起来像这样的函数。对于 x 负数。

It’s 1/( x) times the derivative with respect to x of x. So see that there are two minus signs. There’s a x in the denominator and then there’s the derivative of x in the numerator. That’s just 1. This part is 1. So this 1 over x, which is 1/x. So the negative signs cancel. If you just keep track of this in terms of ln( x) and its graph, that’s a function that looks like this. For x negative.

它的导数是 1/x，我断言。如果你仔细观察，你会发现斜率总是负的。对吧？所以这里的斜率是负的。所以它会在轴的下面。事实上，当我们向下移动时，它的负值会越来越大。当我们水平移动时，它的负值会越来越小。

And its derivative is 1/x, I claim. And if you just look at it a little bit carefully, you see that the slope is always negative. Right? So here the slope is negative. So it’s going to be below the axis. And, in fact, it’s getting steeper and steeper negative as we go down. And it’s getting less and less negative as we go horizontally.

所以它就像这样，这确实是这个函数的图形，对于 x 为负。同样，x 为负。所以这是另一个标准公式。很快，通常我们不会放绝对值符号。我们只考虑 x 为正的情况。但我只是想让你有工具来做这件事，以防我们想要使用，我们想要处理正 x 和负 x。现在，让我们再举两个例子。

So it’s going like this, which is indeed the graph of this function, for x negative. Again, x negative. So that’s one other standard formula. And very quickly, very often, we won’t put the absolute value signs. We’ll only consider the case x positive here. But I just want you to have the tools to do it in case we want to use, we want to handle, both positive and negative x. Now, let’s do two more examples.

sec^2 x dx 的积分。这些应该能让你记住所有的微分公式，标准的微分公式。那么这个，sec^2 dx 的积分是什么？tan x。这里我们有 + c，好吗？然后最后一个，几个，这种类型，让我们看看。我应该至少做这个，1 x^2 的平方根。顺便说一句，这是另一种符号，完全可以接受。

The integral of sec^2 x dx. These are supposed to get you to remember all of your differentiation formulas, the standard ones. So this one, integral of sec^2 dx is what? tan x. And here we have + c, all right? And then the last one of, a couple of, this type would be, let’s see. I should do at least this one here, square root of 1 x^2. This is another notation, by the way, which is perfectly acceptable.

注意，我把 dx 放在分子中，把函数放在分母中。所以这个结果是 sin^( 1) x。最后，让我们看看。关于 dx / (1 + x^2) 的积分。这个是 tan^( 1) x。有一段时间，因为你在反复阅读这些内容，你会发现这种情况发生在考试中。一段时间后情况会变得更糟。当你想区分时，你会做反区分。

Notice I’ve put the dx in the numerator and the function in the denominator here. So this one turns out to be sin^( 1) x. And, finally, let’s see. About the integral of dx / (1 + x^2). That one is tan^( 1) x. For a little while, because you’re reading these things backwards and forwards, you’ll find this happens to you on exams. It gets slightly worse for a little while. You will antidifferentiate when you meant to differentiate.

当你需要进行反微分时，你就会进行微分。不要为此感到太沮丧。但最终，你会把它们弄明白的。实际上，多练习反微分或积分会有所帮助。因为这会巩固你对所有微分公式的记忆。所以，在我们讨论一些更复杂的例子之前，我想强调的最后一点信息是这个。

And you’ll differentiate when you’re meant to antidifferentiate. Don’t get too frustrated by that. But eventually, you’ll get them squared away. And it actually helps to do a lot of practice with antidifferentiations, or integrations, as they’re sometimes called. Because that will solidify your remembering all of the differentiation formulas. So, last bit of information that I want to emphasize before we go on some more complicated examples is this.

这是显而易见的，因为常数的导数是 0。反导数在常数以下是模糊的。但认识到这是唯一存在的模糊性非常重要。所以我要告诉你们的最后一件事是反导数在常数以下的唯一性。定理如下。定理是如果 F' = G'，那么 F 等于 G。所以 F(x) 等于 G(x) 加一个常数。

It’s obvious because the derivative of a constant is 0. That the antiderivative is ambiguous up to a constant. But it’s very important to realize that this is the only ambiguity that there is. So the last thing that I want to tell you about is uniqueness of antiderivatives up to a constant. The theorem is the following. The theorem is if F’ = G’then F equals G. so F(x) equals G(x) plus a constant.

但这意味着，不仅这些是反导数，所有这些带有加号 c 的东西都是反导数。但这些是唯一的。这非常令人放心。这是一种独特性，尽管它的独特性达到常数，但对我们来说是可以接受的。现在，这个证明非常快。但这是一个基本事实。证明如下。

But that means, not only that these are antiderivatives, all these things with these plus c’s are antiderivatives. But these are the only ones. Which is very reassuring. And that’s a kind of uniqueness, although its uniqueness up to a constant, it’s acceptable to us. Now, the proof of this is very quick. But this is a fundamental fact. The proof is the following.

如果 F' = G'，那么如果取这两个函数之间的差，它的导数，当然是 F'G'，等于 0。因此，F(x) G(x) 是一个常数。现在，这是一个关键事实。非常重要的事实。我们上次从中值定理推导出了它。这不是一件小事。这是一件非常非常重要的事情。这是微积分的基础。这就是微积分有意义的原因。

If F’ = G’then if you take the difference between the two functions, its derivative, which of course is F’G’is equal to 0. Hence, F(x) G(x) is a constant. Now, this is a key fact. Very important fact. We deduced it last time from the mean value theorem. It’s not a small matter. It’s a very, very important thing. It’s the basis for calculus. It’s the reason why calculus make sense.

如果我们没有得到导数为 0 意味着函数为常数这一事实，我们就完了。我们就会这样。微积分对我们来说毫无用处。关键是，变化率应该决定函数直到这个起始值。所以这个结论非常重要。我们上次已经检查过了，这个结论。

If we didn’t have the fact that the derivative is 0 implied that the function was constant, we would be done. We would have. Calculus would be just useless for us. The point is, the rate of change is supposed to determine the function up to this starting value. So this conclusion is very important. And we already checked it last time, this conclusion.

现在，仅通过代数，我可以重新排列它，得出 F(x) 等于 G(x) 加一个常数。现在，也许我应该把微分留在这里。因为我想举例说明。那么让我们继续讨论一些更棘手、稍微棘手的积分。这是一个例子。例如，x^3 (x^4 + 2)^5 dx 的积分。这是一个你实际上知道如何积分的函数，因为我们已经有一个所有幂的公式。

And now just by algebra, I can rearrange this to say that F(x) is equal to G(x) plus a constant. Now, maybe I should leave differentials up here. Because I want to illustrate. So let’s go on to some trickier, slightly trickier, integrals. Here’s an example. The integral of, say, x^3 (x^4 + 2)^5 dx. This is a function which you actually do know how to integrate, because we already have a formula for all powers.

也就是说，x^a 的积分等于这个。即使它是负幂，我们也可以做到。所以没问题。另一方面，在这里展开 5 次方是相当混乱的。这是一个非常非常糟糕的想法。还有另一个技巧可以更有效地评估它。这是我们现在要学习的唯一一种积分方法。

Namely, the integral of x^a is equal to this. And even if it were a negative power, we could do it. So it’s OK. On the other hand, to expand the 5th power here is quite a mess. And this is just a very, very bad idea. There’s another trick for doing this that evaluates this much more efficiently. And it’s the only device that we’re going to learn now for integrating.

从符号上看，积分实际上比微分难得多。积分相当困难。有时甚至是不可能的。所以我们必须小心处理。但就本单元而言，我们只使用一种方法。这种方法非常好。这意味着每当你看到一个积分时，你要么能够立即猜出答案是什么，要么使用这种方法。就是这样。这个技巧被称为代换法。

Integration actually is much harder than differentiation, symbolically. It’s quite difficult. And occasionally impossible. And so we have to go about it gently. But for the purposes of this unit, we’re only going to use one method. Which is very good. That means whenever you see an integral, either you’ll be able to divine immediately what the answer is, or you’ll use this method. So this is it. The trick is called the method of substitution.

它是为微分概念量身定制的。因此，它是为微分符号量身定制的。想法如下。我要定义一个新函数。这是我在这里看到的最混乱的函数。它是 u = x^4 + 2。然后，我要取它的微分，如果我看它的公式和微分规则，就会发现，它就在这里。它的公式是什么？4x^3 dx。

And it is tailor made for notion of differentials. So tailor made for differential notation. The idea is the following. I’m going to define a new function. And it’s the messiest function that I see here. It’s u = x^4 + 2. And then, I’m going to take its differential and what I discover, if I look at its formula, and the rule for differentials, which is right here. Its formula is what? 4x^3 dx.

现在，瞧瞧，有了这两个量，我可以代入这个积分。我会大大简化它。那么这是怎么做到的呢？嗯，这个积分和，嗯，实际上我应该以另一种方式组合它是一样的。所以让我把它移过去。所以这里有两个部分。这个是 u^5。这个是 1/4 du。

Now, lo and behold with these two quantities, I can substitute, I can plug in to this integral. And I will simplify it considerably. So how does that happen? Well, this integral is the same thing as, well, really I should combine it the other way. So let me move this over. So there are two pieces here. And this one is u^5. And this one is 1/4 du.

现在，它就是 u^5 du / 4 的积分。而且它相对容易积分。这只是一个幂。让我们看看。它只是 1/20 u 的乘积。哎呀，不是 1/20。u^5 的反导数是 u^6。加上 1/6，所以它是 1/24 u^6 + c。现在，这不是问题的答案。它几乎就是问题的答案。为什么它不是答案？

Now, that makes it the integral of u^5 du / 4. And that’s relatively easy to integrate. That is just a power. So let’s see. It’s just 1/20 u to the. whoops, not 1/20. The antiderivative of u^5 is u^6. With the 1/6, so it’s 1/24 u^6 + c. Now, that’s not the answer to the question. It’s almost the answer to the question. Why isn’t it the answer?

这不是答案，因为现在答案是用 u 来表示的。而问题是用变量 x 来提出的。所以我们必须换回这里的变量。我们只需将其写入即可。所以它是 1/24 (x^4 + 2)^6 + c。这就是问题的结尾。是的，问题。学生：教授：问题是，你能直接看到它吗？是的。

It isn’t the answer because now the answer’s expressed in terms of u. Whereas the problem was posed in terms of this variable x. So we must change back to our variable here. And we do that just by writing it in. So it’s 1/24 (x^4 + 2)^6 + c. And this is the end of the problem. Yeah, question. STUDENT: PROFESSOR:. The question is, can you see it directly? Yeah.

我们马上就要讨论这个问题了。好的。现在，我将再举一个例子来说明这种方法。这是另一个例子。x dx 对 1 + x^2 的平方根的积分。现在，这是另一个例子。现在，代换法使我们得出 u = 1 + x^2。du = 2x dx，等等。它花费的时间与另一道题差不多。

And we’re going to talk about that in just one second. OK. Now, I’m going to do one more example and illustrate this method. Here’s another example. The integral of x dx over the square root of 1 + x^2. Now, here’s another example. Now, the method of substitution leads us to the idea u = 1 + x^2. du = 2x dx, etc. It takes about as long as this other problem did.

弄清楚发生了什么。这是非常相似的事情。你最终对 u^( 1/2) 进行积分。这会导致 u^( 1/2) du 的积分。每个人都看到了吗？但是，有一种稍微好一点的方法。推荐的方法。我把这种方法称为高级猜测。高级猜测的意思是，你已经做了足够多的这些问题，你可以提前两步看到。你知道会发生什么。

To figure out what’s going on. It’s a very similar sort of thing. You end up integrating u^( 1/2). It leads to the integral of u^( 1/2) du. Is everybody seeing where this.? However, there is a slightly better method. So recommended method. And I call this method advanced guessing. What advanced guessing means is that you’ve done enough of these problems that you can see two steps ahead. And you know what’s going to happen.

因此，高级猜测会让您相信这里您有 1/2 的幂，这里您有该事物的微分。所以它会以某种方式起作用。高级猜测让您猜测答案应该是这样的。（1 + x 2）（1/2）。所以这是您的高级猜测。现在您只需对其进行微分，看看它是否有效。好吧，这就是答案。

So the advanced guessing leads you to believe that here you had a power 1/2, here you have the differential of the thing. So it’s going to work out somehow. And the advanced guessing allows you to guess that the answer should be something like this. (1 + x2)(1/2). So this is your advanced guess. And now you just differentiate it, and see whether it works. Well, here it is.

它是 1/2 (1 + x 2) ( 1/2.2x，这是链式法则。果然，它给出了 x 除以 1 + x^2 的平方根。所以我们完成了。所以答案是 (1 + x^2) + c 的平方根。让我用另一个例子进一步说明这一点。我强烈建议你这样做，但你必须习惯它。所以这是另一个例子。e^(6x) dx。我的高级猜测是 e^(6x)。

It’s 1/2 (1 + x2)( 1/2.2x, that’s the chain rule here. Which, sure enough, gives you x over square root of 1 + x^2. So we’re done. And so the answer is square root of (1 + x^2) + c. Let me illustrate this further with another example. I strongly recommend that you do this, but you have to get used to it. So here’s another example. e^(6x) dx. My advanced guess is e^(6x).

如果我检查，当我对其进行微分时，我会得到 6e^(6x)。这就是导数。所以我知道答案，所以现在我知道答案是什么了。它是 1/6 e^(6x) + c。现在，好的，你可以，也可以，但速度很慢，使用替换，使用 u = 6x。然后你会得到 du = 6dx，点，点，点。它会起作用，只是浪费时间。

And if I check, when I differentiate it, I get 6e^(6x). That’s the derivative. And so I know that the answer, so now I know what the answer is. It’s 1/6 e^(6x) + c. Now, OK, you could, it’s also OK, but slow, to use a substitution, to use u = 6x. Then you’re going to get du = 6dx, dot, dot, dot. It’s going to work, it’s just a waste of time.

好吧，我再举几个例子。那么这个怎么样。xe^( x^2) dx。猜多少？有人猜吗？好吧，你也可以纠正。所以我不想让你费心，是的，继续吧。学生：教授：是的，所以你已经领先我一步了。因为这太简单了。当它们变得更复杂时，你只需要在这里做出这个猜测。

Well, I’m going to give you a couple more examples. So how about this one. x e^( x^2) dx. What’s the guess? Anybody have a guess? Well, you could also correct. So I don’t want you to bother yeah, go ahead. STUDENT: PROFESSOR: Yeah, so you’re already one step ahead of me. Because this is too easy. When they get more complicated, you just want to make this guess here.

很多人说是 1/2，他们知道这里是 1/2。但让我向你展示会发生什么，好吗？如果你做出这个猜测并对其进行微分，你得到的是 e^(x^2) 乘以负 2x 的导数，也就是 2x。x^2，也就是 2x。所以现在你会发现你错了，不是 2，而是 2。所以你们中有很多人都这么说。

So various people have said 1/2, and they understand that there’s 1/2 going here. But let me just show you what happens, OK? If you make this guess and you differentiate it, what you get here is e^( x^2) times the derivative of negative 2x, so that’s 2x. x^2, so it’s 2x. So now you see that you’re off by a factor of not 2, but 2. So a number of you were saying that.

所以答案是 1/2 e^( x^2) + c。我看过很多问题，我可以向你保证，不写出这个公式的人会犯算术错误。换句话说，人们能够提前思考并正确猜测的程度是有限的。顺便说一句，另一种方法是简单地把这个公式写进去，然后在这里做微分来固定系数。这也是完全可以的。

So the answer is 1/2 e^( x^2) + c. And I can guarantee you, having watched this on various problems, that people who don’t write this out make arithmetic mistakes. In other words, there is a limit to how much people can think ahead and guess correctly. Another way of doing it, by the way, is simply to write this thing in and then fix the coefficient by doing the differentiation here. That’s perfectly OK as well.

好，再举一个例子。我们要对 sin x cos x dx 求积分。那么这个公式的正确答案是什么？学生：教授：有人建议用 sin^2 x。那么我们试试看。除以 2，我们马上就能得到系数。所以 sin^2 x，如果我求导，我会得到 2 sin x cos x。所以它相差了 2 倍。所以答案是 1/2 sin^2 x。

All right, one more example. We’re going to integrate sin x cos x dx. So what’s a good guess for this one? STUDENT: PROFESSOR: Someone suggesting sin^2 x. So let’s try that. Over 2 well, we’ll get the coefficient in just a second. So sin^2 x, if I differentiate, I get 2 sin x cos x. So that’s off by a factor of 2. So the answer is 1/2 sin^2 x.

但现在我想指出，还有另一种方法可以解决这个问题。同样，如果你对 cos^2 x 求导，你会得到 2 cos x ( sin x )。所以另一个答案是 sin x cos x dx 的积分等于 1/2 cos^2 x + c。那么这里发生了什么？这有什么问题？学生：教授：请问？学生：教授：积分不是唯一的。这是部分原因。

But now I want to point out to you that there’s another way of doing this problem. It’s also true that if you differentiate cos^2 x, you get 2 cos x ( sin x). So another answer is that the integral of sin x cos x dx is equal to 1/2 cos^2 x + c. So what is going on here? What’s the problem with this? STUDENT: PROFESSOR: Pardon me? STUDENT: PROFESSOR: Integrals aren’t unique. That’s part of the.

但不管怎样，这两个答案仍然必须相同。学生：教授：好的。你怎么看？学生：如果把它们加在一起，你就会得到 c。教授：如果把它们加在一起，你就会得到 c。嗯，实际上，这几乎是对的。但这不是你想要做的。你不想把它们加起来。你想减去它们。那么让我们看看当你减去它们时会发生什么。

But somehow these two answers still have to be the same. STUDENT: PROFESSOR: OK. What do you think? STUDENT: If you add them together, you just get c. PROFESSOR: If you add them together you get c. Well, actually, that’s almost right. That’s not what you want to do, though. You don’t want to add them. You want to subtract them. So let’s see what happens when you subtract them.

我暂时先忽略 c。我得到 sin^2 x, 1/2 sin^2 x ( 1/2 cos^2 x)。所以我们希望它们之间的差值为 0。但实际上它当然不是 0。它是 1/2 正弦平方加余弦平方，也就是 1/2。它不是 0，它是一个常数。所以这里真正发生的是这两个公式是相同的。但你必须理解如何解释它们。

I’m going to ignore the c, for the time being. I get sin^2 x, 1/2 sin^2 x ( 1/2 cos^2 x). So the difference between them, we hope to be 0. But actually of course it’s not 0. What it is, is it’s 1/2 sine squared plus cosine squared, which is 1/2. It’s not 0, it’s a constant. So what’s really going on here is that these two formulas are the same. But you have to understand how to interpret them.

这两个常数，这里是常数。有一个常数 c_1 与这个常数相关联。还有一个不同的常数 c_2 与这个常数相关联。对于所有可能的 c_1 和所有可能的 c_2，这个函数族是同一函数族。那么，c_1 和 c_2 之间的关系是什么？

The two constants, here’s a constant up here. There’s a constant, c_1 associated to this one. There’s a different constant, c_2 associated to this one. And this family of functions for all possible c_1’s and all possible c_2’s, is the same family of functions. Now, what’s the relationship between c_1 and c_2?

嗯，如果你做减法，c_1 c_2 必须等于 1/2。它们都是常数，但相差 1/2。所以这解释了，当你处理事物家族时，它们不必看起来相同。而且有很多三角函数看起来有点不同。所以可能有几个公式实际上是相同的。很难检查它们是否真的相同。你需要一些三角恒等式来做到这一点。

Well, if you do the subtraction, c_1 c_2 has to be equal to 1/2. They’re both constants, but they differ by 1/2. So this explains, when you’re dealing with families of things, they don’t have to look the same. And there are lots of trig functions which look a little different. So there can be several formulas that actually are the same. And it’s hard to check that they’re actually the same. You need some trig identities to do it.

让我们再举一个例子。这是另一个。现在，你可能会想，很多人都在想，呃，它里面有一个 ln。如果你有经验，你实际上可以读出答案，就像我们在做其余这些问题时有几个人大声喊出答案一样。但是，你确实需要放松。

Let’s do one more example here. Here’s another one. Now, you may be thinking, and a lot of people are, thinking ugh, it’s got a ln in it. If you’re experienced, you actually can read off the answer just the way there were several people who were shouting out the answers when we were doing the rest of these problems. But, you do need to relax.

因为在这种情况下，当我们做积分时，这肯定不是一般情况。但是，就目前而言，当我们做积分时，它们都是可控的。而且只有一种方法。那就是代换。在代换法中，你要找到最棘手的部分。然后用它代换。所以我向你提出的代换应该是，u 应该是 ln x。

Because in this case, now this is definitely not true in general when we do integrals. But, for now, when we do integrals, they’ll all be manageable. And there’s only one method. Which is substitution. And in the substitution method, you want to go for the trickiest part. And substitute for that. So the substitution that I proposed to you is that this should be, u should be ln x.

它的优点是它的微分比它本身更简单。所以 du = dx / x。记住，我们在对数微分中也使用它。所以现在我们可以用这个代换来表达它。我们得到的是积分，所以我将这里的两部分分开。它是 1 / ln x，然后是 dx / x。这部分是 1 / u，这部分是 du。

And the advantage that has is that its differential is simpler than itself. So du = dx / x. Remember, we use that in logarithmic differentiation, too. So now we can express this using this substitution. And what we get is, the integral of, so I’ll divide the two parts here. It’s 1 / ln x, and then it’s dx / x. And this part is 1 / u, and this part is du.

所以它是 du / u 的积分。也就是 ln u + c。如果我把 u 代入，那么就是 ln (ln x) + c。现在我们看到一些更丑陋的东西。事实上，从技术上讲，我们可以在这里取绝对值。然后那里就是绝对值。所以这是我真的建议你实际使用替换的例子，至少现在是这样。

So it’s the integral of du / u. And that is ln u + c. Which altogether, if I put back in what u is, is ln (ln x) + c. And now we see some uglier things. In fact, technically speaking, we could take the absolute value here. And then this would be absolute values there. So this is the type of example where I really would recommend that you actually use the substitution, at least for now.

好的，明天我们要进行微分方程。我们要复习考试内容。我会给你们一份讲义，告诉你们考试的具体内容。所以，明天见。

All right, tomorrow we’re going to be doing differential equations. And we’re going to review for the test. I’m going to give you a handout telling you just exactly what’s going to be on the test. So, see you tomorrow.

Lec 16 | MIT 18.01 Single Variable Calculus, Fall 2007

简介

Intro

更正

Correction

教授：最后一点是目前网络上尚未实现的内容。

PROFESSOR: And this last little bit is something which is not yet on the Web.

但是，不管怎样，上次我走出教室的时候，我注意到我把 c_1 c_2 的公式写错了。这是印刷错误，负号也写错了。我上次说 c_1 c_2 是 +1/2。但实际上，它是 1/2。如果你计算一下我们对 sin x cos x 的反导数所做的计算，我们会得到这两个可能的答案。

But, anyway, when I was walking out of the room last time, I noticed that I’d written down the wrong formula for c_1 c_2. There’s a misprint, there’s a minus sign that’s wrong. I claimed last time that c_1 c_2 was +1/2. But, actually, it’s 1/2. If you go through the calculation that we did with the antiderivative of sin x cos x, we get these two possible answers.

如果它们相等，那么我们只需将它们相减，即可得到 c_1 c_2 + 1/2 = 0。所以 c_1 c_2 = 1/2。所以，这些都是修正。再次强调，这里的所有内容都会在网上。但我只是想让你清楚了解这一切。

And if they’re to be equal, then if we just subtract them we get c_1 c_2 + 1/2 = 0. So c_1 c_2 = 1/2. So, those are all of the corrections. Again, everything here will be on the Web. But just wanted to make it all clear to you.

微分方程

Differential Equations

好了，我们到了。这是第二单元“微分的应用”的最后一天。我要向你们介绍一个最有趣的主题。

So here we are. This is our last day of the second unit, Applications of Differentiation. And I have one of the most fun topics to introduce to you.

也就是微分方程。现在，我们有一门关于微分方程的课程，叫做 18.03。所以我们只讲一点点。但我要教你们一种技巧。它和我们已经做过的完全吻合。那就是微分。第一种也是最简单的一种微分方程是 x 相对于 y 的变化率等于某个函数 f(x)。

Which is differential equations. Now, we have a whole course on differential equations, which is called 18.03. And so we’re only going to do just a little bit. But I’m going to teach you one technique. Which fits in precisely with what we’ve been doing already. Which is differentials. The first and simplest kind of differential equation is the rate of change of x with respect to y is equal to some function f(x).

现在，这是一个完美的微分方程。我们上次已经讨论过，解，即函数 y，将是 x 的反导数或积分。现在，就今天的目的而言，我们将考虑解决这个问题。也就是说，你总是可以这样做。你总是可以取反导数。就我们现在的目的而言，目前，我们只有一种技术来寻找反导数。

Now, that’s a perfectly good differential equation. And we already discussed last time that the solution, that is, the function y, is going to be the antiderivative, or the integral, of x. Now, for the purposes of today, we’re going to consider this problem to be solved. That is, you can always do this. You can always take antiderivatives. And for our purposes now, that is for now, we only have one technique to find antiderivatives.

这就是所谓的替换。它有一个非常小的变体，我们称之为高级猜测。它同样有效。这基本上就是你需要做的一切。从实际角度来说，这些是你现在要面对的。你可以真正看到答案是什么，或者你必须进行替换。

And that’s called substitution. It has a very small variant, which we called advanced guessing. And that works just as well. And that’s basically all that you’ll ever need to do. As a practical matter, these are the ones you’ll face for now. Ones that you can actually see what the answer is, or you’ll have to make a substitution.

湮灭者

Annihilation Operator

现在，第一个棘手的例子，或者第一个可能很有趣的微分方程例子，我将其称为示例 2，如下所示。d/dx + x 作用于 y 等于 0。所以这是我们要尝试解决的第一个微分方程。除了这种标准的反导数方法之外。这里的这个运算有一个名字。它实际上有一个名字，它被称为湮灭算子。在量子力学中它就是这么叫的。

Now, the first tricky example, or the first maybe interesting example of a differential equation, which I’ll call Example 2, is going to be the following. d/dx + x acting on y is equal to 0. So that’s our first differential equation that were going to try to solve. Apart from this standard antiderivative approach. This operation here has a name. This actually has a name, it’s called the annihilation operator. And it’s called that in quantum mechanics.

还有一个相应的创建运算符，你可以将符号从正变为负。这是最简单的微分方程之一。它在量子力学中被研究的原因是它有非常简单的解，你可以直接写出来。所以我们要解这个方程。它是控制谐振子基态的方程。

And there’s a corresponding creation operator where you change the sign from plus to minus. And this is one of the simplest differential equations. The reason why it’s studied in quantum mechanics all it that it has very simple solutions that you can just write out. So we’re going to solve this equation. It’s the one that governs the ground state of the harmonic oscillator.

因此，它有很多花哨的词语，但它是一个相当简单的微分方程，并且按照我们将要提出的方法，它可以完美地运行。因此，此解决方案的第一步就是通过将其中一个项放在右侧来重写方程。因此，这是 dy/dx = xy。现在，您可以在这里看到这种类型的方程与前一种类型的差异。

So it has a lot of fancy words associated with it, but it’s a fairly simple differential equation and it works perfectly by the method that we’re going to propose. So the first step in this solution is just to rewrite the equation by putting one of the terms on the right hand side. So this is dy/dx = xy. Now, here is where you see the difference between this type of equation and the previous type.

在上一个方程中，右边只有一个 x 函数。但在这里，变化率取决于 x 和 y。所以我们完全不清楚能否解出这种方程。但有一个非常有效的绝妙技巧。那就是使用乘法。使用我们上次讨论过的微分思想。

In the previous equation, we just had a function of x on the right hand side. But here, the rate of change depends on both x and y. So it’s not clear at all that we can solve this kind of equation. But there is a remarkable trick which works very well in this case. Which is to use multiplication. To use this idea of differential that we talked about last time.

也就是说，我们除以 y 并乘以 dx。现在我们已经分离了方程。我们已经分离了微分。对我们来说重要的是，左边仅用 y 来表示，右边仅用 x 来表示。我们将仔细讨论这一点。

Namely, we divide by y and multiply by dx. So now we’ve separated the equation. We’ve separated out the differentials. And what’s going to be important for us is that the left hand side is expressed solely in terms of y and the right hand side is expressed solely in terms of x. And we’ll go through this in careful detail.

所以现在，如果你已经用微分而不是微分比或变化率来建立方程，那么现在我可以使用莱布尼茨符号并对这些微分求积分。取它们的不定积分。我们知道它们各自是什么。也就是说，左边就是。啊，好吧，这很难。好吧。我有一个保姆，他实际上练了很多跆拳道。

So now, the idea is if you’ve set up the equation in terms of differentials as opposed to ratios of differentials, or rates of change, now I can use Leibniz’s notation and integrate these differentials. Take their antiderivatives. And we know what each of these is. Namely, the left hand side is just. Ah, well, that’s tough. OK. I had an au pair who actually did a lot of Tae Kwan Do.

我保证，她绝对可以在任何一场战斗中打败你们中的任何一个人。好吧。无论如何。

She could definitely defeat any of you in any encounter, I promise. OK. Anyway.

反导数

Antiderivative

那么，我们回过头来。我们要对这个式子求反导数。记住，这个式子的导数是 1/y。现在这里有一点新奇之处。这里我们将变量微分为 x，这里我们将变量微分为 y。所以这里的反导数是 ln y。

So, let’s go back. We want to take the antiderivative of this. So remember, this is the function whose derivative is 1/y. And now there’s a slight novelty here. Here we’re differentiating the variable as x, and here we’re differentiating the variable as y. So the antiderivative here is ln y.

另一边的反导数是 x^2 / 2。它们相差一个常数。所以我们这里有这个关系。现在，故事差不多结束了。我们必须用 x 来表示 y 的指数。所以，e^(ln y) = e^( x^2 / 2) + c。现在我可以将其重写为 y 等于。我将写为 A e^( x^2 / 2)，其中 A = e^c。 

And the antiderivative on the other side is x^2 / 2. And they differ by a constant. So we have this relationship here. Now, that’s almost the end of the story. We have to exponentiate to express y in terms of x. So, e^(ln y) = e^( x^2 / 2) + c. And now I can rewrite that as y is equal to. I’ll write as A e^( x^2 / 2), where A = e^c. 

顺便说一句，我们这里只考虑 y 为正的情况。几分钟后我们将讨论当 y 为负时会发生什么。所以，除了我选择 y 为正之外，这里几乎就是问题的答案。实际上，答案是 y 等于 e^(x^2 / 2) 的任意倍数。任何常数 a；正数、负数或 0。任何常数都可以。我们应该再检查一下以确保无误。

And incidentally, we’re just taking the case y positive here. We’ll talk about what happens when y is negative in a few minutes. So here’s the answer to the question, almost, except for this fact that I picked out y positive. Really, the solution is y is equal to any multiple of e^( x^2 / 2). Any constant a; a positive, negative, or 0. Any constant will do. And we should double check that to make sure.

如果取 y 的 d/dx，结果将是 ad/dx e^( x^2 / 2)。现在根据链式法则，您可以看到这是 a 乘以 x 的因数，即指数对 x 的导数乘以指数。现在您只需重新排列它。这就是 xy。所以它确实经过检验。这些是方程的解。a 无关紧要。它是正数还是负数都无关紧要。

If you take d/dx of y right, that’s going to be a d/dx e^( x^2 / 2). And now by the chain rule, you can see that this is a times the factor of x, that’s the derivative of the exponent, with respect to x, times the exponential. And now you just rearrange that. That’s xy. So it does check. These are solutions to the equation. The a didn’t matter. It didn’t matter whether it was positive or negative.

这个函数被称为正态分布，因此它与量子力学的概率和概率解释非常吻合。这有点像粒子所在的位置。接下来，我想做的就是大致介绍一下这个方法，并指出它何时有效。然后我会做一些评论，以确保您理解处理常数等的技术细节。

This function is known as the normal distribution, so it fits beautifully with a lot of probability and probabilistic interpretation of quantum mechanics. This is sort of where the particle is. So next, what I’d like to do is just go through the method in general and point out when it works. And then I’ll make a few comments just to make sure that you understand the technicalities of dealing with constants and so forth.

首先，这是一般的变量分离法。它是这样工作的。当你面对形式为 f(x) g(y) 的微分方程时，它就会起作用。这就是我们遇到的情况。我来举例说明。只是为了提醒你。这是我们的方程。它就是这种形式。函数 f(x) 是 x，函数 g(y) 就是 y。现在，该方法的工作方式就是这个分离步骤。

So, first of all, the general method of separation of variables. And here’s when it works. It works when you’re faced with a differential equation of the form f(x) g(y). That’s the situation that we had. And I’ll just illustrate that. Just to remind you here. Here’s our equation. It’s in that form. And the function f(x) is x, and the function g(y) is just y. And now, the way the method works is, this separation step.

从这里到这里，这是关键的一步。这是唯一一个在概念上值得注意的一步，这一切都与莱布尼茨修正了他的符号有关，这样它就可以完美地工作。这涉及到取 y，所以除以 g(y)，乘以 dx，这很舒服，因为它感觉就像普通的算术，即使这些是微分。然后，我们只需进行反微分。

From here to here, this is the key step. This is the only conceptually remarkable step, which all has to do with the fact that Leibniz fixed his notations up so that this works perfectly. And so that involves taking the y, so dividing by g(y), and multiplying by dx, it’s comfortable because it feels like ordinary arithmetic, even though these are differentials. And then, we just antidifferentiate.

因此，我们有一个函数 H，它是 dy / g(y) 的积分，还有另一个函数 F。请注意，它们是完全不同变量的函数。f(x) dx 的积分。现在，在我们的例子中，我们做到了这一点。我们进行了这种反微分，这个函数变成了 ln y，这个函数变成了 x^2 / 2。然后我们写出关系。

So we have a function, H, which is the integral of dy / g(y), and we have another function which is F. Note they are functions of completely different variables here. Integral of f(x) dx. Now, in our example we did that. We carried out this antidifferentiation, and this function turned out to be ln y, and this function turned out to be x^2 / 2. And then we write the relationship.

也就是说，如果它们都是同一事物的反导数，那么它们之间必须相差一个常数。或者换句话说，H(y) 必须等于 F(x) + c。其中 c 是常数。现在，请注意，这种方程就是我们所说的隐式方程。它不是直接的 y 公式。它隐式地定义了 y。这就是这里最上面的一行。这就是隐式方程。

Which is that if these are both antiderivatives of the same thing, then they have to differ by a constant. Or, in other words, H(y) has to equal to F(x) + c. Where c is constant. Now, notice that this kind of equation is what we call an implicit equation. It’s not quite a formula for y, directly. It defines y implicitly. That’s that top line up here. That’s the implicit equation.

为了使它成为一个明确的方程，也就是下面的方程，我必须做的是取逆。所以我把它写成 y = H^( 1)(F(x) + c)。现在，在现实生活中，微积分部分通常相当简单。而进行逆运算可能会相当混乱。所以有时我们只是把它留在隐式形式中。但有时把它写成最终形式也会令人满意。

In order to make it an explicit equation, which is what is underneath, what I have to do is take the inverse. So I write it as y = H^( 1)(F(x) + c). Now, in real life the calculus part is often pretty easy. And it can be quite messy to do the inverse operation. So sometimes we just leave it alone in the implicit form. But it’s also satisfying, sometimes, to write it in the final form here.

现在我必须先给你们一些评论。对于那些来得晚的人，这些评论都会在网上发布。

Now I’ve got to give you a few little pieces of commentary before. For those of you walked in a little bit late, this will all be on the Web.

评论

Commentary

这只是几条评论。如果您愿意，可以发表一些评论。第一条评论是，我可以写出 y 的绝对值的自然对数等于 x^2 / 2 + c。我们上次了解到，反导数也适用于负值。

So just a few pieces of commentary. So if you like, some remarks. The first remark is that I could have written natural log of absolute y is equal to x^2 / 2 + c. We learned last time that the antiderivative works also for the negative values.

因此，当 y 不等于 0 时，这将起作用。正值和负值均适用。您可以看到，这将捕获其余大部分解决方案。也就是说，|y| 将等于 A e^( x^2 / 2)，理由与之前相同。然后，​​这将意味着 y 等于 A e^( x^2 / 2)，这实际上就是我们得到的结果。因为，事实上，我并没有为此烦恼。

So this would work for y not equal to 0. Both for positive and negative values. And you can see that would have captured most of the rest of the solution. Namely, |y| would be equal to A e^( x^2 / 2), by the same reasoning as before. And then that would mean that y was plus or minus A e^( x^2 / 2), which is really just what we got. Because, in fact, I didn’t bother with this.

因为实际上在大多数情况下。顺便说一下，这次我之所以要仔细地讲解，是因为您将会经常遇到这种情况。指数函数总是会出现。因此，您需要完全轻松地处理它。所以这次我得到了正 A，而负 A 可以这样处理，或者我可以把它扔进去。

Because actually in most. and the reason why I’m going through this, by the way, carefully this time, is that you’re going to be faced with this very frequently. The exponential function comes up all the time. And so, therefore, you want to be completely comfortable dealing with it. So this time I had the positive A, while the negative A fits in either this way, or I can throw it in.

因为我知道这样做会成功。但当然，我再次检查以确保万无一失。现在，这仍然遗漏了一个值。所以，这仍然遗漏了。所以，如果你愿意的话，我现在得到的是 a 等于加或减大写 A。大写 A 为正数。但这仍然遗漏了一个情况。

Because I know that’s going to work that way. But of course, I double checked to be confident. Now, this still leaves out one value. So, this still leaves out. So, if you like, what I have here now is a is equal to plus or minus capital A. The capital A one being the positive one. But this still leaves out one case.

即 y = 0。这是一个极其无聊的解法，但仍然是该问题的一个解法。如果在这里将 0 代入 y，则得到 0。如果在这里将 0 代入 y，则得到这两个边相等。0 = 0。这不是一个非常有趣的答案。但它仍然是一个答案。因此 y = 0 被忽略了。好吧，我们错过该解法并不奇怪。

Which is y = 0. Which is an extremely boring solution, but nevertheless a solution to this problem. If you plug in 0 here for y, you get 0. If you plug in 0 here for y, you get that these two sides are equal. 0 = 0. Not a very interesting answer to the question. But it’s still an answer. And so y = 0 is left out. Well, that’s not so surprising that we missed that solution.

因为在执行这些操作的过程中，我除以了 y。我在这里就是这么做的。所以，这就是发生的事情。如果你要进行各种非线性操作，特别是如果你要除以某个数，如果它恰好是 0，你就会错过那个解决方案。你可能会遇到那个解决方案的问题。但我们必须忍受这一点，因为我们想要取得进步。

Because in the process of carrying out these operations, I divided by y. I did that right here. So, that’s what happens. If you’re going to do various non linear operations, in particular, if you’re going to divide by something, if it happens to be 0 you’re going to miss that solution. You might have problems with that solution. But we have to live with that because we want to get ahead.

我们想要得到各种解决方案的公式。所以这是我想说的第一点。现在，第二点几乎与我刚才讨论的内容有关。我正在删除它。这就是以下内容。我也可以写成 ln y + c_1 = x^2 / 2 + c_2。其中 c_1 和 c_2 是不同的常数。

And we want to get the formulas for various solutions. So that’s the first remark that I wanted to make. And now, the second one is almost related to what I was just discussing right here. That I’m erasing. And that’s the following. I could have also written ln y + c_1 = x^2 / 2 + c_2. Where c_1 and c_2 are different constants.

当我面对这种反微分时，我上次教过你，你需要一个任意常数。这里那里，在两个位置。所以我完全可以把它写下来。但请注意，我可以将其重写为 ln y = x^2 / 2 + c_2 c_1。我可以减去。然后，如果我将这两个东西组合在一起并将它们命名为 c，我就会得到一个不同的常数。

When I’m faced with this antidifferentiation, I just taught you last time, that you want to have an arbitrary constant. Here and there, in both slots. So I perfectly well could have written this down. But notice that I can rewrite this as ln y = x^2 / 2 + c_2 c_1. I can subtract. And then, if I just combine these two guys together and name them c, I have a different constant.

换句话说，在这里使用两个任意常数是多余的，因为它们总是可以合并成一个。所以两个常数是多余的。总是可以合并的。所以我们永远不要用第一种方法。这只是额外的写作，浪费时间。还有另一个微妙的评论，你只有在做了几个这个方向的问题后才会真正意识到这一点。

In other words, it’s superfluous and redundant to have two arbitrary constants here, because they can always be combined into one. So two constants are superfluous. Can always be combined. So we just never do it this first way. It’s just extra writing, it’s a waste of time. There’s one other subtle remark, which you won’t actually appreciate until you’ve done several problems in this direction.

也就是说，在这个问题的第一个解中，常数在这里看起来是加性的。但是当我进行这种非线性指数运算时，它现在变成了乘性常数。所以，一般来说，问题中某处有一个自由常数。但它并不总是一个加性常数。只有在你取反导数的第一步时，它才是一个加性常数。

Which is that the constant appears additive here, in this first solution to the problem. But when I do this nonlinear operation of exponentiation, it now becomes multiplicative constant. And so, in general, there’s a free constant somewhere in the problem. But it’s not always an additive constant. It’s only an additive constant right at the first step when you take the antiderivative.

然后，当你进行所有其他非线性运算时，它可以变成任何东西。所以你应该总是期望它是比加法常数稍微有趣一点的东西。尽管有时它仍然是加法常数。

And then after that, when you do all your other nonlinear operations, it can turn into anything at all. So you should always expect it to be something slightly more interesting than an additive constant. Although occasionally it stays an additive constant.

示例 1 通过分离

Example 1 via separation

我最后想说的一点是回到最初的问题。也就是这里。示例 1。我想解决它，尽管这很简单。

The last little bit of commentary that I want to make just goes back to the original problem here. Which is right here. The example 1. And I want to solve it, even though this is simpleminded.

但是示例 1 通过分离。这样你就能看见我们的变量。这样你就能看见它的作用。情况是这样的。分离只是意味着你把 dx 放在另一边。所以这是 dy = f(x) dx。然后我们积分。dy 的反导数就是 y。所以这就是问题的解。它就是我们之前写的；只是一种有趣的符号。

But Example 1 via separation. So that you see our variables. So that you see what it does. The situation is this. And the separation just means you put the dx on the other side. So this is dy = f(x) dx. And then we integrate. And the antiderivative of dy is just y. So this is the solution to the problem. And it’s just what we wrote before; it’s just a funny notation.

它和不定积分是一样的。好的，现在我们要讨论一个更棘手的问题。一个更棘手的例子。我们还需要一两个例子来练习一下这种方法。到目前为止，大家还满意吗？问题。学生：教授：那么，问题是，我们如何处理这种歧义。

And it comes to the same thing as the antiderivative. OK, so now we’re going to go on to a trickier problem. A trickier example. We need one or two more just to get some practice with this method. Everybody happy so far? Question. STUDENT: PROFESSOR: So, the question is, how do we deal with this ambiguity.

通用解决方案

The general solution

我正在非常非常简短地总结我所听到的内容。嗯，你知道，有时 a > 0，有时 a < 0，有时则不然。

I’m summarizing very, very, briefly what I heard. Well, you know, sometimes a > 0, sometimes a < 0, sometimes it’s not.

所以这个家伙有个名字。这就是所谓的通解。换句话说，整个解决方案系列就是问题的答案。现在，可能是你获得了额外的信息。如果你获得了额外的信息，那可能是，这在此类问题中非常典型，你有函数的变化率，这就是我们给出的。

So there’s a name for this guy. Which is that this is what’s called the general solution. In other words, the whole family of solutions is the answer to the question. Now, it could be that you’re given extra information. If you’re given extra information, that might be, and this is very typical in such problems, you have the rate of change of the function, which is what we’ve given.

但你可能也知道它的起始位置。比如说，它从 3 开始。现在，如果你有额外的信息，那么你就可以准确地确定它是哪个函数。如果你这样做，如果你代入 3，你会看到 a 乘以 e^( 0^2 / 2) 等于 3。所以 a = 3。答案是 y = 3e^( x^2 / 2)。

But you might also have the place where it starts. Which would be, say, it starts at 3. Now, if you have that extra piece of information, then you can nail down exactly which function it is. If you do that, if you plug in 3, you see that a times e^( 0^2 / 2) is equal to 3. So a = 3. And the answer is y = 3e^( x^2 / 2).

同样，如果它是负数，如果它一开始是负数，它就会保持为负数。例如，如果它一开始是 0，它就会保持为 0，这个特定的函数就是如此。所以你的问题的答案是你如何处理歧义。答案是你只需说出解决方案是什么。解决方案不是一个函数，而是一组函数。它是一个列表，你必须有一个所谓的参数。

And similarly, if it’s negative, if it starts out negative, it’ll stay negative. For instance. If it starts out 0, it’ll stay 0, this particular function here. So the answer to your question is how you deal with the ambiguity. The answer is that you simply say what the solution is. And the solution is not one function, it’s a family of functions. It’s a list and you have to have what’s known as a parameter.

如果你告诉我更多关于函数的信息，这个参数就会被确定下来。不是变化率，而是函数值的一些信息。学生：教授：。通用解决方案是这个解决方案。学生：教授：我在这里向你展示，你可以得到大部分通用解决方案。有一件事被遗漏了，即 a = 0 的情况。换句话说，我不会采用这种方法。

And that parameter gets nailed down if you tell me more information about the function. Not the rate of change, but something about the values of the function. STUDENT: PROFESSOR:. The general solution is this solution. STUDENT: PROFESSOR: And I’m showing you here that you could get to most of the general solution. There’s one thing that’s left out, namely the case a = 0. So, in other words, I would not go through this method.

我只会使用这个，它更简单。但我必须明白，我并没有通过这种方式得到所有的解决方案。我需要把所有其余的解决方案都考虑进去。所以在你的脑海里，你必须始终记住这样的东西。这样你就可以生成所有的解决方案。这很有启发性，对吧？

I would only use this, which is simpler. But then I have to understand that I haven’t gotten all of the solutions this way. I’m going to need to throw in all the rest of the solutions. So in the back of your head, you always have to have something like this in mind. So that you can generate all the solutions. This is very suggestive, right?

事实证明，限制 A > 0 是多余的，是不必要的。但是，我们只有通过进一步思考和检查才能得到这一点。另一个问题？在这里。学生：教授：。微分方程的目的是解决它们。就像代数方程一样。通常，微分方程会告诉你一些关于加速度和速度之间平衡的信息。如果你有一个下落的物体，它可能会有阻力。它告诉你一些事情。

The restriction, it turns that the restriction A > 0 is superfluous, is unnecessary. But that, we only get by further thought and by checking. Another question? Over here. STUDENT: PROFESSOR:. The aim of differential equations is to solve them. Just as with algebraic equations. Usually, differential equations are telling you something about the balance between an acceleration and a velocity. If you have a falling object, it might have a resistance. It’s telling you something.

因此，实际上，有时在应用问题中，制定描述这种情况的微分方程非常重要。为了看到那是正确的东西，你必须解决它，看看它是否适合你得到的数据。学生：教授：。问题是，你能解出 x 而不是 y 吗？答案是，当然可以。那和……是一样的。所以那将是我们要正式寻找的函数的反函数。

So, actually, sometimes in applied problems, formulating what differential equation describe this situation is very important. In order to see that’s the right thing, you have to have solved it to see that it fits the data that you’re getting. STUDENT: PROFESSOR:. The question is, can you solve for x instead of y. The answer is, sure. That’s the same thing as. so that would be the inverse function of the function that we’re officially looking for.

但是，是的，这是合法的。换句话说，我们经常被困在隐式公式中，有时我们被困在公式 x 是 y 的函数，而 y 是 x 的函数。函数的指定方式可能很复杂。正如您将在下一个示例中看到的那样，将 y 视为 x 的函数并不一定是最好的思考方式。

But yeah, it’s legal. In other words, oftentimes we’re stuck with just the implicit, some implicit formula and sometimes we’re stuck with a formula x is a function of y versus y is a function of x. The way in which the function is specified is something that can be complicated. As you’ll see in the next example, it’s not necessarily the best thing to think about a function. y as a function of x.

嗯，第四个例子。好的，我们继续做下一个例子。

Well, in the fourth example. Alright, we’re going to go on and do our next example here.

几何问题

Geometry problem

所以第三个例子将被视为一种几何问题。我将画出它的图。假设你有一条具有以下属性的曲线。

So the third example is going to be taken as a kind of geometry problem. I’ll draw a picture of it. Suppose you have a curve with the following property.

如果你在曲线上取一个点，然后取射线，从原点到曲线取射线，那么，这不是我想要的。我想我会想要更陡峭的。因为我坚持认为切线的斜率应该是从原点发出的射线的两倍。换句话说，切线的斜率等于从原点发出的射线斜率的两倍。

If you take a point on the curve, and you take the ray, you take the ray from the origin to the curve, well, that’s not going to be one that I want. I think I’m going to want something which is steeper. Because what I’m going to insist is that the tangent line be twice as steep as the ray from the origin. So, in other words, slope of tangent line equals twice slope of ray from origin.

因此，这条橙色线的斜率是粉色线斜率的两倍。现在，这类几何问题可以用微分方程非常简洁地写出来。也就是说，它只是以下内容。dy / dx，即切线的斜率，等于，记住这条射线的斜率是多少，如果这个点。我需要一个符号。此时是（x，y），它是曲线上的一个点。

So the slope of this orange line is twice the slope of the pink line. Now, these kinds of geometric problems can be written very succinctly with differential equations. Namely, it’s just the following. dy / dx, that’s the slope of the tangent line, is equal to, well remember what the slope of this ray is, if this point. I need a notation. At this point is (x, y) which is a point on the curve.

那么这条粉线的斜率是多少？学生：教授：y/x。如果是它的两倍，那么就有方程。好的，现在我们只有一种方法来解决这些方程。让我们使用它。它表示分离变量。所以我在这里写 dy / y，等于 2 dx / x。这是基本的分离。这是我们将始终使用的程序。

So the slope of this pink line is what? STUDENT: PROFESSOR: y/x. So if it’s twice it, there’s the equation. OK, now, we only have one method for solving these equations. So let’s use it. It says to separate variables. So I write dy / y here, is equal to 2 dx / x. That’s the basic separation. That’s the procedure that we’re always going to use.

现在，如果我对它进行积分，我会发现右边是 y 的对数。左边是 y 的对数。抱歉，左边是 y 的对数。右边是 x 的对数的两倍，加上一个常数。让我们看看这个例子会发生什么。

And now if I integrate that, I find that on the right hand side I have the logarithm of y. And on the left hand. Sorry, on the left hand side I have the logarithm of y. On the right hand side, I have twice the logarithm of x, plus a constant. So let’s see what happens to this example.

这是一个隐式方程，当然，我们有正负号的问题，我以后再考虑这个问题。所以，我们来求指数，看看会发生什么。我们得到 e^(ln y) = e^(2 ln x + c)。所以，再说一遍，左边是 y。

This is an implicit equation, and of course we have the problems of the plus or minus signs, which I’m not going to worry about until later. So let’s exponentiate and see what happens. We get e^(ln y) = e^(2 ln x + c). So, again, this is y on the left hand side.

在右边，如果你仔细想一想，它就是 (e^(ln x))^2。也就是 x^2。所以这是 x^2，然后是 e^c。所以这是这里的另一个 A 因子。A = e^c。所以答案是，好吧，我来画图。我要像以前一样作弊。我们跳过了 y 为负的情况。到目前为止，我们实际上只做了 y 为正的情况。

And on the right hand side, if you think about it for a second, it’s (e^(ln x))^2. Which is x^2. So this is x^2, and then there’s an e^c. So that’s another one of these A factors here. A = e^c. So the answer is, well, I’ll draw the picture. And I’m going to cheat as I did before. We skipped the case y negative. We really only did the case y positive, so far.

但如果你仔细想一想，我们马上就会检查一下，你会得到所有这些抛物线。所以解决方案就是这个函数族。它们可以向下弯曲。也可以向上弯曲。所以这些就是这个方程的解。

But if you think about it for a second, and we’ll check it in a second, you’re going to get all of these parabolas here. So the solution is this family of functions. And they can be bending down. As well as up. So these are the solutions to this equation.

这些曲线中的每一条都具有这样的特性：如果你在曲线上选取一个点，切线的斜率是射线到原点的斜率的两倍。如果你愿意，通解的公式是 y = ax^2，a 是任意常数。问题？学生：教授：是的。所以首先，有两种方法可以解决这个问题。一种是检查它，确保它是正确的。

Every single one of these curves has the property that if you pick a point on it, the tangent line has twice the slope of the ray to the origin. And the formula, if you like, of the general solution is y = ax^2, a is any constant. Question? STUDENT: PROFESSOR: Yeah. So again so first of all, so there are two approaches to this. One is to check it, and make sure that it’s right.

当一个公式适用于某些值族时，有时它也会适用于其他值族。但另一个方法是认识到这些事情通常会以这种方式发挥作用。因为在这个论点中，我允许绝对值。这对我来说是完全合法的。我可以在这里输入绝对值。在这种情况下，我会得到这个的绝对值等于那个。

When a formula works for some family of values, sometimes it works for others. But another one is to realize that these things will usually work out this way. Because in this argument here, I allow the absolute value. And that would have been a perfectly legal thing for me to do. I could have put in absolute values here. In which case, I would’ve gotten that the absolute value of this was equal to that.

现在您看到我已经介绍了正负情况。所以这是同一个想法。这意味着 y 等于 Ax^2 或 Ax^2，具体取决于您选择哪个符号。因此，这允许我处理上面的曲线和下面的曲线。因为这里的反导数确实是这个函数。它的定义是 y 为负。所以让我们再检查一下。

And now you see I’ve covered the plus and minus cases. So it’s that same idea. This implies that y is equal to either Ax^2 or Ax^2, depending on which sign you pick. So that allows me for the curves above and curves below. Because it’s really true that the antiderivative here is this function. It’s defined for y negative. So let’s just double check.

在这种情况下，情况是这样的，我们有 y = ax^2，我们想计算 dy/dx 以确保它满足我开始时的方程。我在这里看到的是 2ax。现在我要以一种暗示的方式写出来。我要把它写成 2ax^2 / x。果然，这是 2y / x。a 是否是无关紧要。

In this case, what’s happening, we have y = ax^2 and we want to compute dy/dx to make sure that it satisfies the equation that I started out with. And what I see here is that this is 2ax. And now I’m going to write this in a suggestive way. I’m going to write it as 2ax^2 / x. And, sure enough, this is 2y / x. It does not matter whether a.

它适用于正数、负数、a 等于 0。没问题。同样，我们没有通过这种方法发现 a = 0 的情况。这并不奇怪，因为我们除以 y。关于这个例子，还有一件事需要注意。所以还有另一个警告。我必须告诉你。

It works for a positive, a negative, a equals 0. It’s OK. Again, we didn’t pick up by this method the a = 0 case. And that’s not surprising because we divided by y. There’s another thing to watch out about, about this example. So there’s another warning. Which I have to give you.

这是一个微妙之处，你肯定不会详细了解，除非你上了更高级别的常微分方程课程，但我现在想警告你。也就是说，如果你看这个方程，你需要注意它在 x = 0 处是未定义的。它在 x = 0 处是未定义的。我们还除以 x，而 x 也是一个问题。

And this is a subtlety which you definitely won’t get to in any detail until you get to a higher level ordinary differential equations course, but I do want to warn you about it right now. Which is that if you look at the equation, you need to watch out that it’s undefined at x = 0. It’s undefined at x = 0. We also divided by x, and x is also a problem.

现在，这实际上会产生一个重要的后果。奇怪的是，知道这里的值和知道变化率并不能指定这个函数。这很糟糕。它违反了我们的一个直觉。问题在于没有指定变化率。

Now, that actually has an important consequence. Which is that, strangely, knowing the value here and knowing the rate of change doesn’t specify this function. This is bad. And it violates one of our pieces of intuition. And what’s going wrong is that the rate of change was not specified.

在 x = 0 处，它是未定义的。所以这里有一个问题，事实上，如果你仔细想想这个函数在做什么，它可能从一个分支进入，然后从另一个完全不同的分支离开。它实际上不必遵循 x = 0 处的任何规则。所以你应该把这些东西看作是从原点发出的射线。原点是整个几何问题中的一个特殊点。

It’s undefined at x = 0. So there’s a problem here, and in fact if you think carefully about what this function is doing, it could come in on one branch and leave on a completely different branch. It doesn’t really have to obey any rule across x = 0. So you should really be thinking of these things as rays emanating from the origin. The origin was a special point in the whole geometric problem.

而不是完全的抛物线。但这是一个非常微妙的观点。我不指望你能对此发表任何意见。但我只想警告你，当 x = 0 时，这个微分方程确实存在问题。现在，让我说说我们的下一个问题。下一个例子。只是另一个几何问题。这是示例 4。我将使用我们已经得到的示例。

Rather than as being complete parabolas. But that’s a very subtle point. I don’t expect you to be able to say anything about it. But I just want to warn you that it really is true that when x = 0 there’s a problem for this differential equation. So now, let me say our next problem. Next example. Just another geometry question. So here’s Example 4. I’m just going to use the example that we’ve already got.

因为这里只剩下这么多时间了。第四个例子是取垂直于抛物线的曲线。这是另一个几何问题。通过指定曲线垂直于这些抛物线，我告诉你它们的斜率是多少。让我们想想。新的方程是什么？新的微分方程如下。斜率等于切线斜率的负倒数。

Because there’s only so much time left here. The fourth example is to take the curves perpendicular to the parabolas. This is another geometry problem. And by specifying that the curves are perpendicular to these parabolas, I’m telling you what their slope is. So let’s think about that. What’s the new equation? The new diff. eq. is the following. It’s that the slope is equal to the negative reciprocal of the slope of the tangent line.

抛物线的切线。这就是方程。其实很容易写下来，因为它是 1 除以 2 y/x。这就是抛物线的斜率。2y/x。让我们重写它。现在，这是。x 进入分子，所以它是 x/(2y)。现在我要解决这个问题。好吧，再说一遍，只有一种方法。那就是我们要分离变量。

Of tangent to the parabola. So that’s the equation. That’s actually fairly easy to write down, because it’s 1 divided by 2 y/x. That’s the slope of the parabola. 2y/x. So let’s rewrite that. Now, this is. the x goes in the numerator, so it’s x/(2y). And now I want to solve this one. Well, again, there’s only one technique. Which is we’re going to separate variables.

我们在这里分离微分，这样我们得到 2y dy = x dx。这只是看看我得到的方程，它就在这里。dy/dx = x/(2y)，然后交叉相乘得到这个。现在我可以取反导数。这是 y^2。这里的反导数是 x^2 / 2 + c。所以，解是 x^2 / 2 + y^2 等于某个 c，某个常数 c。 

And we separate the differentials here, so we get 2y dy = x dx. That’s just looking at the equation that I have, which is right over here. dy/dx = x/(2y), and cross multiplying to get this. And now I can take the antiderivative. This is y^2. And the antiderivative over here is x^2 / 2 + c. And so, the solutions are x^2 / 2 + y^2 is equal to some c, some constant c. 

现在，这一次，事情不再一样了。你不能指望它们总是以同样的方式运作。我声称这一定是真的。但不幸的是，我不能坚持每个 c 都会起作用。正如你在这里看到的，只有正数 c 才能在这里起作用。所以情况是这里发生了一些略有不同的事情。你必须接受这一点。有时并非所有常数都会起作用。

Now, this time, things don’t work the same. And you can’t expect them always to work the same. I claimed that this must be true. But unfortunately I cannot insist that every c will work. As you can see here, only the positive numbers c can work here. So the picture is that something slightly different happened here. And you have to live with this. Is that sometimes not all the constants will work.

因为问题不仅仅是反微分。而这里的答案更少而不是更多。在另一种情况下，我们必须添加一些答案，在这里我们必须删除它们。其中一些没有任何意义。我们能得到的唯一答案是这种形式的答案，其中这是某个半径的平方。好吧，也许我不应该称之为半径。

Because there’s more to the problem than just the antidifferentiation. And here there are fewer answers rather than more answers. In the other case we had to add in some answers, here we have to take them away. Some of them don’t make any sense. And the only ones we can get are the ones which are of this form, where this is, say, some radius squared. Well maybe I shouldn’t call it a radius.

我将其称为参数 a^2。这些当然是椭圆。您可以看到椭圆的长度是 2a 的平方根，半轴（垂直半轴）是 a。这就是我们得到的椭圆。我在上一个图表上画了它，我认为它在这里有些启发性。椭圆有点像鸡蛋。它们的长度比高度略长。

I’ll just call it a parameter, a^2. And these are of course ellipses. And you can see that the ellipses, the length here is the square root of 2a and the semi axis, vertical semi axis, is a. So this is the kind of ellipse that we’ve got. And I draw it on the previous diagram, I think it’s somewhat suggestive here. There, ellipses are kind of eggs. They’re a little bit longer than they are high.

它们像这样。如果我画得非常正确，它们应该成直角。在所有这些地方。好的，最后一点。同样，你必须非常小心这些解决方案。所以这里也有一个警告。让我们看一下。这是方程的隐式解。这个解告诉我们形状是什么。

And they go like this. And if I drew them pretty much right, they should be making right angles. At all of these places. OK, last little bit here. Again, you’ve got to be very careful with these solutions. And so there’s a warning here too. So let’s take a look at the. This is the implicit solution to the equation. And this is the one that tells us what the shape is.

但是我们也可以得到显式解。如果我求出显式解，那么 y 等于 (a^2 x^2 / 2) 的平方根加上，或者 y 等于 (a^2 x^2 / 2) 的平方根减去。这些就是显式解。现在，我们注意到一些我们之前应该注意到的事情。那就是椭圆不是函数。

But we can also have the explicit solution. And if I solve for the explicit solution, it’s y is equal to either plus square root of (a^2 x^2 / 2), or y is equal to minus the square root of (a^2 x^2 / 2). These are the explicit solutions. And now, we notice something that we should have noticed before. Which is that an ellipse is not a function.

如果你愿意的话，只有上半部分可以给出这个方程的解。或者下半部分可以给出方程的解。所以这边的这个是上半部分。这边的这个是下半部分。还有一件有趣的事情。我们在 y = 0 处有一个问题。y = 0 是 x = 2a 的平方根的地方。

It’s only the top half, if you like, that’s giving you a solution to this equation. Or maybe the bottom half that’s giving it the solution to the equation. So the one over here, this one is the top halves. And this one over here is the bottom halves. And there’s something else that’s interesting. Which is that we have a problem at y = 0. y = 0 is where x = square root of 2a.

这时我们就到了这个终点。接下来发生的事情是，解会转一圈然后停止。它有一个垂直斜率。垂直斜率。解停止了。但实际上，这并不是那么不合理。毕竟，看看这个公式。这里的分母是 ay。当 y = 0 时，斜率应该是无穷大。所以这个方程只是给出了它在几何上和直观上应该给出的东西。在那个阶段。

That’s when we get to this end here. And what happens is the solution comes around and it stops. It has a vertical slope. Vertical slope. And the solution stops. But really, that’s not so unreasonable. After all, look at the formula. There was a y in the denominator here. When y = 0, the slope should be infinite. And so this equation is just giving us what it geometrically and intuitively should be giving us. At that stage.

这就是常微分方程的介绍。同样，只有一种技巧。我们还没有结束，我们还有整整四分钟的时间，我们要复习一下。现在，幸运的是，这次复习很短。幸运的是，我把考试中要讲的内容发给了你。这就是打印出来的内容，但讨论内容有整整两页。

So that is the introduction to ordinary differential equations. Again, there’s only one technique which is. We’re not done yet, we have a whole four minutes left and we’re going to review. Now, so fortunately, this review is very short. Fortunately for you, I handed out to you exactly what you’re going to be covering on the test. And it’s what’s printed here but there’s a whole two pages of discussion.

我想在这里给你们非常明确的指示。这通常是本课程最难的考试。人们通常表现很糟糕。我会尽量让考试变得简单一点，从而避免这种情况。现在我们要做的就是。我会告诉你们考试中会出现哪些类型的问题。就是这六道题。它们也写在你的试卷上，也就是你的讲义上。

And I want to give you very, very clear cut instructions here. This is usually the hardest test of this course. People usually do terribly on it. And I’m going to try to stop that by making it a little bit easier. And now here’s what we’re going to do. I’m telling you exactly what type of problems are going to be on the test. These are these six. It’s also written on your sheet, your handout.

这也只是去年考试中问的问题。你应该去看看去年的考试，看看它们是什么类型的问题。我真的会问同样的问题，或者说是同一类型的问题。不是同样的问题。这就是考试中会出现的情况。让我告诉你一件事，这就是这堂课的主题。

It’s also just what was asked on last year’s test. You should go and you should look at last year’s test and see what types of problems they are. I really, really, am going to ask the same questions, or the same type of questions. Not the same questions. So that’s what’s going to happen on the test. And let me just tell you, say one thing, which is the main theme of the class.

我会开始讨论。之后我们会有时间回答一个问题。本单元的主题很简单。关于导数（有时可能是二阶导数）的信息告诉我们有关 f 本身的信息。这正是我们在这里用常微分方程所做的。这也是我们在开始做近似时所做的。

And I will open up. We’ll have time for one question after that. The main theme of this unit is simply the following. That information about derivative and sometimes maybe the second derivative, tells us information about f itself. And that’s just what were doing here with ordinary differential equations. And that was what we were doing way at the beginning when we did approximations.

简介

Intro

第 3 单元 整合

Unit 3 Integration

教授：我们现在开始学习第三单元。我们从第三单元开始。这是积分的入门。它基本上是微分之后微积分的后半部分。

PROFESSOR: So we’re going on to the third unit here. So we’re getting started with Unit 3. And this is our intro to integration. It’s basically the second half of calculus after differentiation.

今天我要讲的是所谓的定积分。实际上，看起来我们是不是漏掉了一堆头顶上的灯？

Today what I’ll talk about is what are known as definite integrals. Actually, it looks like, are we missing a bunch of overhead lights?

定积分

Definite Integrals

这有什么原因吗？嗯。让我们看看。啊。好的。好的，现在更清楚了。好的。因此，定积分的概念可以用多种方式来呈现。但我将与课程中其余部分的演示保持一致。

Is there a reason for that? Hmm. Let’s see. Aah. All right. OK, that’s a little brighter now. All right. So the idea of definite integrals can be presented in a number of ways. But I will be consistent with the rest of the presentation in the course.

我们将从几何角度开始。几何角度是，我们要解决的问题是求曲线下的面积。另一个可以采用的角度，我们将在本课结束时提到，是累积和的概念。所以请记住，这里有很多事情要做。

We’re going to start with the geometric point of view. And the geometric point of view is, the problem we want to solve is to find the area under a curve. The other point of view that one can take, and we’ll mention that at the end of this lecture, is the idea of a cumulative sum. So keep that in mind that there’s a lot going on here.

对于积分的含义，有很多不同的解释。现在，让我们在这里画一幅图。我将从 a 处开始，到 b 处结束。这里有一条曲线。我想在这里找到这个区域。当然，为了做到这一点，我需要更多信息，而不仅仅是从哪里开始和在哪里结束。我还需要底部和顶部。

And there are many different interpretations of what the integral is. Now, so let’s draw a picture here. I’ll start at a place a and end at a place b. And I have some curve here. And what I have in mind is to find this area here. And, of course, in order to do that, I need more information than just where we start and where we end. I also need the bottom and the top.

按照惯例，底部是 x 轴，顶部是我们指定的曲线，即 y = f(x)。我们对此有一个符号，这是使用微积分表示的符号，而不是一些几何符号。这就是以下表达式。它被称为积分，但现在它将具有所谓的极限。它将从 a 开始并结束于 b。

By convention, the bottom is the x axis and the top is the curve that we’ve specified, which is y = f(x). And we have a notation for this, which is the notation using calculus for this as opposed to some geometric notation. And that’s the following expression. It’s called an integral, but now it’s going to have what are known as limits on it. It will start at a and end at b.

我们把函数写成 f(x) dx。这就是所谓的定积分。它在几何上被解释为曲线下的面积。这组符号和我们之前所用的不定积分的唯一区别在于，之前我们没有指定它的起点和终点。现在，为了理解如何处理这个家伙，我将非常抽象地描述我们所做的。

And we write in the function f(x) dx. So this is what’s known as a definite integral. And it’s interpreted geometrically as the area under the curve. The only difference between this collection of symbols and what we had before with indefinite integrals is that before we didn’t specify where it started and where it ended. Now, in order to understand what to do with this guy, I’m going to just describe very abstractly what we do.

然后详细地执行一个例子。因此，要计算这个面积，我们首先要遵循三个步骤。首先，我们要将其分成矩形。不幸的是，由于不可能将弯曲区域分成矩形，所以我们要作弊。所以它们只是“矩形”。它们几乎是矩形。我们要做的第二件事是将面积相加。

And then carry out one example in detail. So, to compute this area, we’re going to follow initially three steps. First of all, we’re going to divide into rectangles. And unfortunately, because it’s impossible to divide a curvy region into rectangles, we’re going to cheat. So they’re only quote unquote rectangles. They’re almost rectangles. And the second thing we’re going to do is to add up the areas.

我们要做的第三件事是纠正这个问题，我们实际上并没有找到正确的答案。我们遗漏了一些部分，或者选择了一些额外的部分。我们纠正这个问题的方法是取矩形变薄时的极限。无限薄，非常薄。从图形上看，它看起来像这样。我们有 a 和 b，我们有我们的人，这是我们的曲线。

And the third thing we’re going to do is to rectify this problem that we didn’t actually hit the answer on the nose. That we were missing some pieces or were choosing some extra bits. And the way we’ll rectify that is by taking the limit as the rectangles get thin. Infinitesimally thin, very thin. Pictorially, again, that looks like this. We have a and our b, and we have our guy here, this is our curve.

我要把它切开。首先我要把 x 轴切成小块。然后我要把这里的东西切开。我要决定一些矩形，也许是一些阶梯图案。像这样。现在，我不太在意。在某些情况下，矩形会超出范围；在某些情况下，它们在下面。所以我添加的新区域是错误的。它与曲线下方的面积不太一样。

And I’m going to chop it up. First I’m going to chop up the x axis into little increments. And then I’m going to chop things up here. And I’ll decide on some rectangle, maybe some staircase pattern here. Like this. Now, I don’t care so much. In some cases the rectangles overshoot; in some cases they’re underneath. So the new area that I’m adding up is off. It’s not quite the same as the area under the curve.

就是这个区域。但它包括了这些额外的部分。然后这里缺少了这个小东西。那里的这一小块是缺失的。而且，正如我所说，这里的这些小块，这里的这一小块是额外的。这就是为什么我们实际上没有将区域划分为矩形。我们只是取矩形。

It’s this region here. But it includes these extra bits here. And then it’s missing this little guy here. This little bit there is missing. And, as I say, these little pieces up here, this a little bit up here is extra. So that’s why we’re not really dividing up the region into rectangles. We’re just taking rectangles.

然后这个想法是，随着这些变得越来越薄，我们错过的那些微小的量将变为 0。它们将变得可以忽略不计。您已经可以看到，这是一个很薄的区域，所以我们没有错过太多。随着这些变得越来越薄，问题就消失了，我们在极限中得到了答案。所以这是我们的第一个例子。

And then the idea is that as these get thinner and thinner, the little itty bitty amounts that we miss by are going to 0. And they’re going to be negligible. Already, you can see it’s kind of a thin piece of area, so we’re not missing by much. And as these get thinner and thinner, the problem goes away and we get the answer on the nose in the limit. So here’s our first example.

我将取第一条有趣的曲线，即 f(x) = x^2。我不想做任何比一个例子更复杂的事情，因为这是一个真正的工作，我们将要经历的。为了让事情变得更容易，我将从 a = 0 开始。但为了看到模式是什么，我将允许 b 任意。让我们画出图表并开始分解。

I’ll take the first interesting curve, which is f(x) = x^2. I don’t want to do anything more complicated than one example, because this is a real labor here, what we’re going to go through. And to make things easier for myself, I’m going to start at a = 0. But in order to see what the pattern is, I’m going to allow b to be arbitrary. Let’s draw the graph and start breaking things up.

这是抛物线，这是我们想要的一段，它会停止在这个地方，b，这里。第一步是把它分成 n 段。这意味着，从图形上讲，我只会标记前三段。也许会有很多。然后我会在这里画一些矩形，我会选择从右边开始画矩形。

So here’s the parabola, and there’s this piece that we want, which is going to stop at this place, b, here. And the first step is to divide into n pieces. That means, well, graphically, I’ll just mark the first three. And maybe there are going to be many of them. And then I’ll draw some rectangles here, and I’m going to choose to make the rectangles all the way from the right.

也就是说，我会在这里制作这个楼梯图案，就像这样。这是我的选择。我可以选择我想要的任何级别，我会选择正确的端点作为楼梯的形状。所以我对每个矩形都进行了超调。

That is, I’ll make us this staircase pattern here, like this. That’s my choice. I get to choose whatever level I want, and I’m going to choose the right ends as the shape of the staircase. So I’m overshooting with each rectangle.

面积公式

Area Formulas

现在我必须写下这些面积的公式。现在，矩形有一个很大的优势。这就是起点。那就是很容易找到它们的面积。

And now I have to write down formulas for what these areas are. Now, there’s one big advantage that rectangles have. And this is the starting place. Which is that it’s easy to find their areas.

你只需要知道底边和高，然后相乘，就能得到面积。这就是我们从矩形开始的原因。在这种情况下，我假设这些距离都是相等的，间隔相等。我会一直这样做。所以间隔、底边、底边长度总是 b/n。所有间隔都相等。所以这就是底边长度。接下来，我需要高。

All you need to know is the base and the height, and you multiply, and you get the area. That’s the reason why we can get started with rectangles. And in this case, these distances, I’m assuming that they’re all equal, equally spaced, intervals. And I’ll always be doing that. And so the spacing, the bases, the base length, is always b/n. All equal intervals. So that’s the base length. And next, I need the heights.

为了跟踪高度，我将在这里画一个小表格，上面有 x 和 f(x)，然后插入几个值，看看模式是什么。这里 0 之后的第一位是 b/n。所以这是 b/n，即 x 值。f(x) 值是那里的高度。我计算 f(x)，f(x) 是 x^2。即 (b/n)^2。类似地，下一个是 2b/n。 

And in order to keep track of the heights, I’m going to draw a little table here, with x and f(x), and plug in a few values just to see what the pattern is.
