If we chop things up into more rectangles, we’ll get much better numerical approximations. And if we use simpleminded expressions with integrals, we’ll be able to figure out any bound we could get using the mean value theorem. So that’s not the relevance of the mean value theorem.

几分钟后，我会向你们解释我们为什么讨论这个。好的，在我们继续之前还有什么问题吗？是的。学生：教授：我知道 c 的范围是从 0 到 4，我应该在这里说出来。这对于这个定理是正确的。中值定理有一个额外的陈述，我错过了。

I’ll explain to you why we talked about it, even, in a few minutes. OK, are there any questions before we go on? Yeah. STUDENT: PROFESSOR: I knew that the range of c was from 0 to 4, I should have said that right here. This is true for this theorem. The mean value theorem comes with an extra statement, which I missed.

也就是说，这是 0 到 4 之间的某个 c。所以我知道范围在 0 到 4 之间。之所以它在 0 到 4 之间，是因为这是均值定理的一部分。我们从 0 开始，以 4 结束。所以 c 必须介于两者之间。这是均值定理的一部分。学生：教授：。

Which is that this is for some c between 0 and 4. So I know the range is between 0 and 4. The reason why it’s between 0 and 4 is that ’s part of the mean value theorem. We started at 0, we ended at 4. So the c has to be somewhere in between. That’s part of the mean value theorem. STUDENT: PROFESSOR:.

问题是，您是否排除了任何大于 4 且小于 0 的值。是的，绝对排除。关键在于，为了弄清楚 F 在 0 到 4 之间如何变化，大写的 F 变化，您只需要注意介于两者之间的值。您不必注意函数在 0 以下或 4 以上时做什么。这些事情完全无关紧要。

The question is, do you exclude any values that are above 4 and below 0. Yes, absolutely. The point is that in order to figure out how F changes, capital F changes, between 0 and 4, you need only pay attention to the values in between. You don’t have to pay any attention to what the function is doing below 0 or above 4. Those things are strictly irrelevant.

学生：教授：是的，我的意思是它严格介于这两个数字之间。我必须了解最低和最高数字是多少。学生：教授：它接近那个数字，所以。好的。

STUDENT: PROFESSOR: Yeah, I mean it’s strictly in between these two numbers. I have to understand what the lowest and the highest one is. STUDENT: PROFESSOR: It’s approaching that, so. OK.

现在，我们要讨论的下一件事是，既然上面有那个 1，即微积分基本定理 1，我需要讨论版本 2。这是微积分基本定理版本 2。我将从函数小 f 开始，并假设它是连续的。然后我将定义一个新函数，该函数被定义为定积分。

So now, the next thing that we’re going to talk about is, since I’ve got that 1 up there, that Fundamental Theorem of Calculus 1, I need to talk about version 2. So here is the Fundamental Theorem of Calculus version 2. I’m going to start out with a function little f, and I’m going to assume that it’s continuous. And then I’m going to define a new function, which is defined as a definite integral.

G(x) 是 f(t)dt 从 a 到 x 的积分。现在，我想在这里强调一下，因为这是我第一次写这样的东西，这是一个相当复杂的小工具。它起着非常基本、非常根本的作用，但很简单，但它仍然有点复杂。

G ( x ) is the integral from a to x of f ( t ) dt. Now, I want to emphasize here because it’s the first time that I’m writing something like this, that this is a fairly complicated gadget. It plays a very basic and very fundamental, but simple role but it nevertheless is a little complicated.

这里发生的事情是，我现在将上限称为 x，变量 t 介于 a 和 x 之间，并且当我计算积分时，a 和 x 是固定的。t 就是所谓的虚拟变量。它是积分变量。你会看到很多人会把这个 x 和这个 t 混在一起。如果你这样做，你会在这门课上感到困惑，可能完全困惑。

What’s happening here is that the upper limit I’ve now called x, and the variable t is ranging between a and x, and that the a and the x are fixed when I calculate the integral. And the t is what’s called the dummy variable. It’s the variable of integration. You’ll see a lot of people who will mix this x with this t. And if you do that, you will get confused, potentially hopelessly confused, in this class.

在 18.02 中，如果你这样做，你会完全迷失。所以不要这样做。不要把这两个人混为一谈。实际上，教科书中的许多人都这样做，而且相当粗心。尤其是在老式教科书中。但不要这样做。所以这里有这个 G(x)。现在，请记住，这个 G(x) 确实有意义。

In 18.02 you will be completely lost if you do that. So don’t do it. Don’t mix these two guys up. It’s actually done by many people in textbooks, and it’s fairly careless. Especially in old fashioned textbooks. But don’t do it. So here we have this G ( x). Now, remember, this G ( x) really does make sense.

如果你给我一个 a，再给我一个 x，我就能算出它是什么，因为我能算出黎曼和。所以我当然也需要知道这个函数是什么。但无论如何，我们有一个数值程序来算出函数 g 是什么。现在，正如这个神秘的字母 x 所暗示的那样，我实际上要改变 x。

If you give me an a, and you give me an x, I can figure out what this is, because I can figure out the Riemann sum. So of course I need to know what the function is, too. But anyway, we have a numerical procedure for figuring out what the function g is. Now, as is suggested by this mysterious letter x being in the place where it is, I’m actually going to vary x.

所以结论是，如果这是真的，而这只是一个括号，不是定理的一部分。它只是表示符号的含义。那么 G' = f。让我首先从微分方程的角度解释一下这个定理的意义。G ( x) 解微分方程 y' = f ( x)。

So the conclusion is that if this is true, and this is just a parenthesism not part of the theorem. It’s just an indication of what the notation means. Then G’ = f. Let me first explain what the significance of this theorem is, from the point of view of differential equations. G ( x) solves the differential equation y’ = f ( x).

因此 y' = f，如果我在这里得到 x，则代入 x，条件是 y ( a) = 0。因此它解决了这对条件。变化率和初始位置在这里指定。因为当你从 a 积分到 a 时，你总是得到 0。这个定理说你总是可以解这个方程。当我们做微分方程时，我已经说过了。

So y’ = f, you put the x in if I got it here, with the condition y ( a) = 0. So it solves this pair of conditions here. The rate of change, and the initial position is specified here. Because when you integrate from a to a, you get 0 always. And what this theorem says is you can always solve that equation. When we did differential equations, I said that already.

我说过，我们会认为这些问题总是可以解决的。好吧，原因如下。我们有一个数值程序来计算这类问题。我们总能解出这个方程。这个公式是一个相当复杂的工具，但到目前为止只与黎曼和有关。好了，现在。我们只举一个例子。不幸的是，这不是一个复杂的例子，也许还不足以说服你为什么会关心这个问题。但无论如何，它非常重要。

I said we’ll treat these as always solved. Well, here’s the reason. We have a numerical procedure for computing things like this. We could always solve this equation. And the formula is a fairly complicated gadget, but so far just associated with Riemann sums. Alright, now. Let’s just do one example. Unfortunately, not a complicated example and maybe not persuasive as to why you would care about this just yet. But nevertheless very important.

因为这是一道测验题，除非练习过，否则每个人都会做错。所以，从 1 到 x 的积分是 dt / t ^2。让我们来试试这个。我声称，这是这个定理的一个例子。现在，这个问题考验你理解问题含义的能力。因为它有很多符号。它有积分和微分。

Because this is the quiz question which everybody gets wrong until they practice it. So the integral from, say 1 to x of dt / t ^2. Let’s try this one here. So here’s an example of this theorem, I claim. Now, this is a question which challenges your ability to understand what the question means. Because it’s got a lot of symbols. It’s got the integration and it’s got the differentiation.

然而，这实际上是一个复述练习。你看着它，然后写下答案。原因是，根据定义，这里的这个函数是这里定理中形式为 G ( x) 的函数。所以这是 G ( x)。根据定义，我们说 G' ( x) = f(x)。那么，f ( x) 是什么？看看这里。这就是所谓的被积函数。

However, what it really is an exercise in recopying. You look at it and you write down the answer. And the reason is that, by definition, this function in here is a function of the form G ( x) of the theorem over here. So this is the G ( x). And by definition, we said that G’ ( x) = f(x). Well, what’s the f ( x)? Look inside here. It’s what’s called the integrand.

这是 f ( t ) dt 从 0 到 x 的积分，对吧？其中 f ( t ) = 1 / t^2。所以你的能力受到了挑战。你必须取 1 / t ^2，然后代入字母 x，而不是 t。然后写下来。正如我所说，这是一个重新复制那里内容的练习。所以这很容易做到，对吧？

This is the integral from 0 to x of f ( t ) dt, right? Where f ( t) = 1 / t^2. So your ability is challenged. You have to take that 1 / t ^2 and you have to plug in the letter x, instead of t for it. And then write it down. As I say, this is an exercise in recopying what’s there. So this is quite easy to do, right?

我的意思是，你只要看一下然后把它写下来。但尽管如此，它看起来还是一个很长很复杂的物体。能不能解释一下？学生：教授：所以问题是，我为什么要积分。学生：教授：我为什么不积分？啊。这个问题问得很好。我为什么不积分。我之所以不积分，是因为我不需要积分。就像你取某个东西的导数时，你取它的反导数，然后你就可以回到原来的东西了。

I mean, you just look and you write it down. But nevertheless, it looks like a long, elaborate object here. Pardon me? STUDENT: PROFESSOR: So the question was, why did I integrate. STUDENT: PROFESSOR: Why did I not integrate? Ah. Very good question. Why did I not integrate. The reason why I didn’t integrate is I didn’t need to. Just as when you take the sorry, the derivative of something, you take the antiderivative, you get back to the thing.

因此，在这种情况下，我们取某个数的反导数，然后进行微分。所以我们最终又回到了开始的地方。我们从 f (t) 开始，以 f 结束。小 f。因此，你先积分，然后微分。然后你又回到了原点。现在，这个版本和另一个版本之间的唯一区别是，在这种情况下，当你微分和积分时，你可能会偏离一个常数。

So, in this case, we’re taking the antiderivative of something and we’re differentiating. So we end back in the same place where we started. We started with f ( t), we’re ending with f. Little f. So you integrate, and then differentiate. And you get back to the same place. Now, the only difference between this and the other version is, in this case when you differentiate and integrate you could be off by a constant.

这就是那个移位，为什么这个移位有两个部分。但这里从来没有多余的部分。这里没有 + c。当你积分和微分时，你会消除常数。因为常数的导数是 0。所以无论常数隐藏在 g 中是什么，你都会得到相同的结果。所以这是基本思想。

That’s what that shift, why there are two pieces to this one. But there’s never an extra piece here. There’s no + c here. When you integrate and differentiate, you kill whatever the constant is. Because the derivative of a constant is 0. So no matter what the constant is hiding inside of g, you’re getting the same result. So this is the basic idea.

现在，我只想再次检查一下，使用这里的微积分基本定理 1。让我们实际评估一下积分。现在我要按照你的建议去做，我只是要检查它是否正确。不，不是，因为我要再次检查它是否一致。这样肯定会比较慢，我们不想一直这样做，但我们不妨检查一下。

Now, I just want to double check it, using the Fundamental Theorem of Calculus 1 here. So let’s actually evaluate the integral. So now I’m going to do what you’ve suggested, which is I’m just going to check whether it’s true. No, no I am because I’m going just double check that it’s consistent. It certainly is slower this way, and we’re not going to want to do this all the time, but we might as well check one.

这就是我们的积分。我们知道怎么做。不，我需要做。这是 t ^ 1，在 1 和 x 处求值。同样，这里有一些潜意识的东西需要你思考。记住，它的 t 介于 1 和 t = x 之间。这就是为什么这个字母 t 必须与 x 不同的一个重要原因。因为这里是 1，那里是 x。

So this is our integral. And we know how to do it. No, I need to do it. And this is t ^ 1, evaluated at 1 and x. Again, there’s something subliminally here for you to think about. Which is that, remember, its t is ranging between 1 and t = x. And this is one of the big reasons why this letter t has to be different from x. Because here it’s 1 and there it’s x.

它不是 x。所以你不能在这里放 x。再说一遍，这是 t = 1，这是 t = x。现在如果我把它代入，我会得到什么？我得到 1 / x，然后我得到 ( 1)。所以，让我去掉那里的小 t。这样读起来更容易一些。现在让我们检查一下。它是 d / dx。所以这就是 G ( x) 。

It’s not x. So you can’t put an x here. Again, this is t = 1 and this is t = x over there. And now if I plug that in, I get what? I get 1 / x, and then I get ( 1). So this is, let me get rid of those little t’s there. This is a little easier to read. And so now let’s check it. It’s d / dx. So here’s what G ( x) is.

G (x) = 1 1 / x。这就是 G(x)。如果我对其进行微分，我会得到 + 1 / x ^2。就是这样。你会看到常数被冲走了。所以现在，我的工作来了。我的工作是证明这些定理。我从来没有为你证明过它们。所以，我要证明微积分基本定理。但我要先做 2。

G ( x) = 1 1 / x. That’s what G( x) is. And if I differentiate that, I get + 1 / x ^2. That’s it. You see the constant washed away. So now, here’s my job. My job is to prove these theorems. I never did prove them for you. So, I’m going to prove the Fundamental Theorem of Calculus. But I’m going to do 2 first.

然后我要进行 1。这只需要一块黑板。这并不难。证明是通过图片。并且，使用曲线下面积的解释。所以如果这是 a 的值，这是函数 y 等于 f 的 x 的图形。然后我要画三条垂直线。其中一条将在 x 处。

And then I’m going to do 1. And it’s just going to take me just one blackboard. It’s not that hard. The proof is by picture. And, using the interpretation as area under the curve. So if here’s the value of a, and this is the graph of the function y equals f of x. Then I want to draw three vertical lines. One of them is going to be at x.

其中一个位于 x + delta x。所以这里我有从 0 到 x 的区间，接下来我有从 x 到 delta x 大于 0 的区间。现在我得到的是这部分的面积。所以这个面积有一个名字。它被称为 G ( x )。

And one of them is going to be at x + delta x. So here I have the interval from 0 to x, and next I have the interval from x to delta x more than that. And now the pieces that I’ve got are the area of this part. So this has area which has a name. It’s called G ( x ).

根据定义，G(x) 位于基本定理的正上方，是该函数从 a 到 x 的积分。因此它是曲线下的面积。因此该面积就是 G(x)。现在，这里的另一部分，我声称这是 delta G。这是 G 的变化。

By definition, G( x ), which is sitting right over here in the fundamental theorem, is the integral from a to x of this function. So it’s the area under the curve. So that area is G ( x ). Now this other chunk here, I claim that this is delta G. This is the change in G.

G(x) 的值是整个业务的面积，一直到 x + delta x 第一部分 G(x)。所以这是剩下的部分。这是面积的增量。现在我要在这里进行一个相当标准的估算。这实际上是一个矩形。

It’s the value of G ( x ) that is the area of the whole business all the way up to x + delta x the first part, G ( x ). So it’s what’s left over. It’s the incremental amount of area there. And now I am going to carry out a pretty standard estimation here. This is practically a rectangle.

它有一个底边 delta x，所以我们需要算出它的高度。这就是 delta G，它大约是底边乘以高度。但高度是多少呢？嗯，高度可能是这个线段或这个线段或介于两者之间的某个值。但它们都差不多。所以我只把第一个点的值填进去。那是左边的端点。

And it’s got a base of delta x, and so we need to figure out what its height is. This is delta G, and it’s approximately its base times its height. But what is the height? Well, the height is maybe either this segment or this segment or something in between. But they’re all about the same. So I’m just going to put in the value at the first point. That’s the left end there.

这就是这里的高度，即 f ( x )。所以这是 f ( x )，因此我实际上用那个矩形来近似它。现在，如果我除以 delta x 并取极限，当 delta G / delta x 趋于 0 时，它将等于 f ( x )。这就是我利用 f 是连续的事实的地方。

So that’s this height here, is f ( x ). So this is f (x), and so really I approximate it by that rectangle there. And now if I divide and take the limit, as delta x goes to 0 of delta G / delta x, it’s going to equal f ( x ). And this is where I’m using the fact that f is continuous.

因为我需要附近的值与极限中的值相似。好的，到此结束。这是证明的结束，所以我会在这里放一个漂亮的小 qed。所以，我们已经完成了微积分基本定理 2，现在我们准备学习微积分基本定理 1。所以，现在我仍然把它放在黑板上提醒你们。

Because I need the values nearby to be similar to the value in the limit. OK, that’s the end. This the end of the proof, so I’ll put a nice little q.e.d. here. So we’ve done Fundamental Theorem of Calculus 2, and now we’re ready for Fundamental Theorem of Calculus 1. So now I still have it on the blackboard to remind you.

它说导数的积分是函数，至少是函数在两个位置的值之间的差。所以我们的起点是这个属性 F' = f。这是起点，这是假设。现在，不幸的是，为了使用微积分基本定理 2，我必须假设一些额外的内容，即我将假设 f 是连续的。

It says that the integral of the derivative is the function, at least the difference between the values of the function at two places. So the place where we start is with this property that F’ = f. That’s the starting, that’s the hypothesis. Now, unfortunately, I’m going to have to assume something extra in order to use the Fundamental Theorem of Calculus 2, which is I’m going to assume that f is continuous.

这其实不是必需的，但这只是一个很小的技术点，我将忽略它。所以我们将从 F' = f 开始。然后我要去别的地方。我将定义一个新函数 G (x)，它是 f (t) dt 从 a 到 x 的积分。这就是我们需要黎曼求和的所有工作的地方。

That’s not really necessary, but that’s just a very minor technical point, which I’m just going to ignore. So we’re going to start with F’ = f. And then I’m going to go somewhere else. I’m going to define a new function, G (x), which is the integral from a to x of f ( t ) dt. This is where we needed all of the labor of Riemann’s sums.

因为否则我们就无法理解这到底意味着什么。所以这句话背后隐藏着一个事实，那就是我们确实有一个数字。我们有这样的函数公式。所以有一个函数 g (x)，一旦你为我生成一个小的 f，我就可以为你生成一个大写的 G 函数。

Because otherwise we don’t have a way of making sense out of what this even means. So hiding behind this one sentence is the fact that we actually have a number. We have a formula for such functions. So there is a function g (x) which, once you’ve produced a little f for me, I can cook up a function capital G for you.

现在，我们要应用我们已经检查过的微积分基本定理 2。那么它说了什么？它说 G' = f。所以现在我们处于以下情况。我们知道 F' ( x ) = G' ( x)。这就是我们目前得到的。现在我们还有最后一步来获得 F 和 G 之间的良好联系。

Now, we’re going to apply this Fundamental Theorem of Calculus 2, the one that we’ve already checked. So what does it say? It says that G’ = f. And so now we’re in the following situation. We know that F’ ( x ) = G’ ( x). That’s what we’ve got so far. And now we have one last step to get a good connection between F and G.

也就是说，我们可以得出 F ( x ) = G ( x ) + c 的结论。现在，这一小步可能看起来无害，但我提醒你，这是需要中值定理的地方。所以为了不骗你，我们实际上告诉你所有微积分的基础是什么。

Which is that we can conclude that F ( x ) = G ( x) + c. Now, this little step may seem innocuous but I remind you that this is the spot that requires the mean value theorem. So in order not too lie to you, we actually tell you what the underpinnings of all of calculus are.

它们是这样的：如果你愿意的话，如果两个函数有相同的导数，它们之间相差一个常数。或者如果一个函数的导数为 0，它本身就是一个常数。现在，这是所需的基本步骤，所需的底层步骤。不幸的是，没有任何证明比使用中值定理更简单。

And they’re this: the fact, if you like, that if two functions have the same derivative, they differ by a constant. Or that if a function has derivative 0, it’s a constant itself. Now, that is the fundamental step that’s needed, the underlying step that’s needed. And, unfortunately, there aren’t any proofs of it that are less complicated than using the mean value theorem.

这就是为什么我们要讨论一下中值定理，因为我们不想就真正发生的事情向你撒谎。是的。学生：教授：问题是我怎么从这里到这里来的。答案是，如果 G' 是小 f，而且我们还知道 F' 是小 f，那么 F' 就是 G'。好的。还有其他问题吗？好的，我们快完成了。

And so that’s why we talk a little bit about the mean value theorem, because we don’t want to lie to you about what’s really going on. Yes. STUDENT: PROFESSOR:. The question is how did I get from here, to here. And the answer is that if G’ is little f, and we also know that F’ is little f, then F’ is G’. OK. Other questions? Alright, so we’re almost done.

我只需要在这里计算一下算术。所以我从 F(b) F ( a) 开始。这等于 (G ( b) + c) (G ( a) + c)。然后我取消 c。所以我这里有 G(b) G(a)。现在我只需要检查它们每个是什么。所以记住这里 G 的定义。G ( b) 就是我们想要的。f(x) dx 从 a 到 b 的积分。

I just have to work out the arithmetic here. So I start with F(b) F ( a). And that’s equal to (G ( b) + c) (G (a) + c). And then I cancel the c’s. So I have here G(b) G(a). And now I just have to check what each of these is. So Remember the definition of G here. G ( b) is just what we want. The integral from a to b of f(x) dx.

好吧，我把它叫做 f ( t) dt，现在它和 f(x) dx 一样，因为我的极限是 b，而且我可以使用 x 作为虚拟变量。现在我声明另一个是 0。因为它是从 a 到 a 的积分。这个是从 a 到 a 的积分。它给了我们 0。所以这只是这个 0，这就是结局。就是这样。

Well I called it f ( t) dt, that’s the same as f(x) dx now, because I have the limit being b and I’m allowed to use x as the dummy variable. Now the other one, I claim, is 0. Because it’s the integral from a to a. This one is the integral from a to a. Which gives us 0. So this is just this 0, and that’s the end. That’s it.

我从 F(b) F(a) 开始，得到了积分。问题？学生：教授：我如何从 F(b) F(a) 得到 (G(b) + c) (G(a) + c)，这就是问题所在。学生：教授：哦，对不起，这是一个等号。对不起，第二条线没有画出来。好的，等于。因为我们正在为 f(x) 代入它的公式。是的。学生：教授：这一步？还是这一步？那里是学生：教授：对。

I started with F( b) F( a), I got to the integral. Question? STUDENT: PROFESSOR: How did I get from F ( b) F (a), is (G ( b) + c) (G( a) + c), that’s the question. STUDENT: PROFESSOR: Oh, sorry this is an equals sign. Sorry, the second line didn’t draw. OK, equals. Because we’re plugging in for f (x) the formula for it. Yes. STUDENT: PROFESSOR: This step here? Or this one? there’s STUDENT: PROFESSOR: Right.

所以这是个好问题。但答案是，这就是我们想要得到的陈述。这就是微积分 1 的基本定理，我们还不知道。所以我们试图证明它，这就是为什么我们没有，我们不能假设它。好的，所以，在我们继续讨论其他内容之前，让我先注意到我们例子中的这一点。在上面的例子中，我们得到的是以下内容。

So that was a good question. But the answer is that’s the statement that we’re aiming for. That’s the Fundamental Theorem of Calculus 1, which we don’t know yet. So we’re trying to prove it, and that’s why we haven’t, we can’t assume it. OK, so let me just notice that in the example that we had, before we go on to something else here. In the example above, what we had was the following thing.

假设我们有 F ( x ) = 1 / x。因此 F' (x) = 1 / x ^2。假设有 G ( x) = 1 (1 / x)。您可以看到，无论哪种方式，如果您从 1 积分到 2，假设我们得到的是 dt / t ^2，您将得到 1 / t，1 到 2，或者，如果您愿意，1 (1 / t)，1 到 2。因此，这是 F 版本，这是 G 版本。这就是这个通用证明中的结果。好吧。

We had, say, F ( x ) = 1 / x. So F’ (x) = 1 / x ^2. And, say, G ( x) = 1 (1 / x). And you can see that either way you do that, if you integrate from 1 to 2, let’s say, which is what we had over there, dt / t ^2, you’re going to get either 1 / t, 1 to 2 or, if you like, 1 (1 / t), 1 to 2. So this is the F version, this is the G version. And that’s what plays itself out here, in this general proof. Alright.

现在我想回到今天的主题，即使用小写 f 来理解大写 F。换句话说，使用 f 的导数来理解大写 F。我想通过一些更复杂的例子来说明这一点。所以我想我只是把它删掉了，但我们只取了 1 / t ^2 的反导数。这样所有的幂就很容易计算了。

So now I want to go back to the theme for today, which is using little f to understand capital F. In other words, using the derivative of f to understand capital F. And I want to illustrate it by some more complicated examples. So I guess I just erased it, but we just took the antiderivative of 1 / t ^2. And there’s all of the powers work easily.

但有一个问题比较棘手，那就是 1 / x 的幂。我们来考虑微分方程 L' (x) = 1 / x。假设初始值为 L (1) = 0。解，所以微积分基本定理 2 告诉我们解就是这个函数。L(x) 等于从 1 到 x 的积分，dt / t。这就是我们解决所有此类方程的方法。我们只需积分，取定积分。

But one, and the tricky one is the power 1 / x. So let’s consider the differential equation L’ ( x) = 1 / x. And say, with the initial value L (1) = 0. The solution, so the Fundamental Theorem of Calculus 2 tells us the solution is this function here. L( x) equals the integral from 1 to x, dt / t. That’s how we solve all such equations. We just integrate, take the definite integral.

我从 1 开始，因为我坚持 L(1) 为 0。所以这就是问题的解。现在有趣的是，我们从一个多项式开始。或者我们从一个有理数开始，多项式的比值；即 1 / t 或 1 / x。我们得到的函数实际上是所谓的超越函数。它不是代数函数。是的，问题。学生：教授：。

And I’m starting at 1 because I insisted that L( 1 ) be 0. So that’s the solution to the problem. And now the thing that’s interesting here is that we started from a polynomial. Or we started from a rational, a ratio of polynomials; that is, 1 / t or 1 / x. And we get to a function which is actually what’s known as a transcendental function. It’s not an algebraic function. Yeah, question. STUDENT: PROFESSOR:.

问题是为什么这个等于那个。答案是，这是出于同样的原因。它和这个是相同的原因。就是 1 被抵消了。我们取某个数在 2 处的值减去在 1 处的值。2 处的值减去在 1 处的值。在一种情况下你会得到 1，在另一种情况下你会得到 1。

The question is why is this equal to that. And the answer is, it’s for the same reason that this is equal to that. It’s the same reason as this. It’s that the 1’s cancel. We’re taken the value of something at 2 minus the value at 1. The value at 2 minus the value at 1. And you’ll get a 1 in the one case, and you get a 1 in the other case.

减去它们，它们会相互抵消。结果为 0。这两个值实际上相等。这不是一个在某处求值的函数，而是在 2 处求值的函数与在 1 处求值的值之间的差值。每当你像这样减去两个值时，常数就会消失。学生：教授：没错。如果我在这里输入 2，如果我在这里输入 c，结果会是一样的。它只是消失了。

And you subtract them and they will cancel. They’ll give you 0. These two things really are equal. This is not a function evaluated at one place, it’s the difference between the function evaluated at 2 and the value at 1. And whenever you subtract two things like that, constants drop out. STUDENT: PROFESSOR: That’s right. If I put 2, here if I put c here, it would have been the same. It would just have dropped out.

它不在那里。而这正是这里的算术。无论你取哪个不定积分都没关系。当你取差值时，c 会取消。你最终总是会得到相同的答案。这正是我写下它的原因，这样你就会看到这一点。无论你选哪一个都没关系。所以，我们还有几分钟的时间。这实际上是，所以让我回去。

It’s not there. And that’s exactly this arithmetic right here. It doesn’t matter which antiderivative you take. When you take the differences, the c’s will cancel. You always get the same answer in the end. That’s exactly why I wrote this down, so that you would see that. It doesn’t matter which one you do. So, we still have a couple of minutes left here. This is actually, so let me go back.

这是 1 / x 的反导数，其值为 1 位于 0 处。现在，我们隐约知道了这个函数是什么。我们知道这个函数是对数函数。但这实际上是推导对数所有公式的更好方法。这是一种更快、更有效的方法。我们不得不通过非常费力的过程来完成它。这将使我们能够非常轻松地完成它。

So here’s the antiderivative of 1 / x, with value 1 at 0. Now, in disguise, we know what this function is. We know this function is the logarithm function. But this is actually a better way of deriving all of the formulas for the logarithm. This is a much quicker and more efficient way of doing it. We had to do it by very laborious processes. This will allow us to do it very easily.

所以，下次我会这么做。但现在我不会这么做，我要向你们指出，我们也可以得到真正新的函数。好吧，有各种各样的新函数。所以这是这种类型的第一个例子，例如，解方程 y' = e ^ x^2，假设 y( 0 ) = 0。

And so, I’m going to do that next time. But rather than do that now, I’m going to point out to you that we can also get truly new functions. OK, so there are all kinds of new functions. So this is the first example of this kind would be, for example, to solve the equation y’ = e ^ x^2 with y( 0 ) = 0, let’s say.

现在，这个问题的答案是一个函数，我可以用基本定理把它写下来。它是 e ^ t^2 dt 从 0 到 x 的积分。这是一个非常著名的函数。这个形状被称为钟形曲线。它是概率中经常出现的东西。这个形状是 e ^ x^2。我们的函数在几何上就是曲线下的面积。这是 F (x)。

Now, the solution to that is a function which again I can write down by the fundamental theorem. It’s the integral from 0 to x of e ^ t^2 dt. This is a very famous function. This shape here is known as the bell curve. And it’s the thing that comes up in probability all the time. This shape e ^ x^2. And our function is geometrically just the area under the curve here. This is F (x).

如果这个地方是 x。所以我有一个几何定义，我有一种通过黎曼和构造它的方法。我这里有一个函数。但 F ( x ) 的奇怪之处在于，F ( x ) 不能用你以前见过的任何函数来表示。所以对数、指数、三角函数都不能。这是一个全新的函数。

If this place is x. So I have a geometric definition, I have a way of constructing what it is by Riemann’s sums. And I have a function here. But the curious thing about F ( x ) is that F ( x ) cannot be expressed in terms of any function you’ve seen previously. So logs, exponentials, trig functions, cannot be. It’s a totally new function.

尽管如此，我们还是可以从这个函数中得到我们想要的任何信息。这是一个完全可以接受的函数，对我们来说非常有用。就像任何其他函数一样。就像 ln 一样。这与以下类似。如果你拿圆来说，古希腊人已经明白，如果你有一个半径为 1 的圆，那么它的面积就是 pi。

Nevertheless, we’ll be able to get any possible piece of information we would want to, out of this function. It’s perfectly acceptable function, it will work just great for us. Just like any other function. Just like the ln. And what this is analogous to is the following kind of thing. If you take the circle, the ancient Greeks, if you like, already understood that if you have a circle of radius 1, then its area is pi.

这就是所谓的新数的几何构造。它超出了你可能预期的范围。圆周率这个数字的奇怪之处在于它不是有理系数代数方程的根。它被称为超越数。也就是说，它完全超出了代数的范围。事实上，对数函数被称为超越函数，因为它完全超出了代数的范围。

So that’s a geometric construction of what you could call a new number. Which is outside of the realm of what you might expect. And the weird thing about this number pi is that it is not the root of an algebraic equation with rational coefficients. It’s what’s called transcendental. Meaning, it’s just completely outside of the realm of algebra. And, indeed, the logarithm function is called a transcendental function, because it’s completely out of the realm of algebra.

只有在微积分中你才能想出这种东西。因此，这些类型的函数将可以访问这里大量的新函数，它们都是科学和工程中的重要工具。所以，下次再见。

It’s only in calculus that you come up with this kind of thing. So these kinds of functions will have access to a huge class of new functions here, all of which are important tools in science and engineering. So, see you next time.

Lec 21 | MIT 18.01 单变量微积分，2007 年秋季

Lec 21 | MIT 18.01 Single Variable Calculus, Fall 2007

16 年前 (2009 年 8 月 13 日) — 50:17 https://youtube.com/watch?v=_JXPe2J069c

16 years ago (Aug 13, 2009) — 50:17 https://youtube.com/watch?v=_JXPe2J069c

简介

Intro

以下内容根据 Creative Commons 许可提供。您的支持将帮助 MIT OpenCourseWare 继续免费提供高质量的教育资源。要捐款或查看数百门 MIT 课程的其他材料，请访问 MIT OpenCourseWare，网址为 ocw.mit.edu。

The following content is provided under a Creative Commons license. Your support will help MIT OpenCourseWare continue to offer high quality educational resources for free. To make a donation, or to view additional materials from hundreds of MIT courses, visit MIT OpenCourseWare at ocw.mit.edu.

更正

Correction

教授：上次有一个更正。很抱歉，我在告诉你平均值是什么时忘记了一个非常重要的因素。

PROFESSOR: One correction from last time. Sorry to say, I forgot a very important factor when I was telling you what an average value is.

如果你不把这个因子算进去，那么这道考试题的分数就只减半。所以，如果我不把这个因子算进去，我也会得到一半的分数。所以请记住，你必须在这里除以 n，当然，当你对 0 到 n 进行积分时，黎曼和就是这里的分子。如果我在那边除以 n，那么我必须在另一边除以 n。

If you don’t put in that factor, it’s only half off on the exam problem that will be given on this. So I would have gotten half off for missing out on this factor, too. So remember you have to divide by n here, certainly when you’re integrating over 0 to n, the Riemann sum is the numerator here. And if I divide by n on that side, I’ve got to divide by n on the other side.

这是为了说明我们在这里除以总数的想法。我们将更详细地讨论平均值。不过今天不讨论。所以这与平均值有关。我想我们会在几天后详细讨论它。现在，今天我想继续。

This was meant to illustrate this idea that we’re dividing by the total here. And we are going to be talking about average value in more detail. Not today, though. So this has to do with average value. And we’ll discuss it in considerable detail in a couple of days, I guess. Now, today I want to continue.

基本定理

Fundamental Theorem

我没有时间完成对微积分基本定理 2 的讨论。无论如何，把它写在黑板上两遍非常重要，因为你想至少看两遍。而且还要看很多遍。所以我们提醒你，微积分基本定理的第二版是这样说的。它说积分的导数会把函数返回给你。所以这是定理。

I didn’t have time to finish my discussion of the Fundamental Theorem of Calculus 2. And anyway it’s very important to write it down on the board twice, because you want to see it at least twice. And many more times as well. So let’s just remind you, the second version of the Fundamental Theorem of Calculus says the following. It says that the derivative of an integral gives you the function back again. So here’s the theorem.

今天我想用它的方式，我上次就开启了这个讨论。但我们没有深入讨论。这是你们的问题集上的内容，还有其他几个例子。我们可以用它来解微分方程。具体来说，例如，我们可以用这个公式解方程 y' = 1 / x。即使用积分。

And the way I’d like to use it today, I started this discussion last time. But we didn’t get into it. And this is something that’s on your problem set along with several other examples. Is that we can use this to solve differential equations. And in particular, for example, we can solve the equation y’ = 1 / x with this formula. Namely, using an integral.

L ( x ) 是 dt / t 从 1 到 x 的积分。函数 f ( t ) 就是 1 / t。现在，这个公式可以作为推导对数函数所有属性的起点。所以我们现在要做的就是将其作为对数的定义。

L ( x ) is the integral from 1 to x of dt / t. The function f ( t ) is just 1 / t. Now, that formula can be taken to be the starting place for the derivation of all the properties of the logarithm function. So what we’re going to do right now is we’re going to take this to be the definition of the logarithm.

如果我们这样做，那么我认为我们可以像以前一样轻松地读出对数的性质。我现在就来说明这一点。还有其他几个例子，其中出现了一些不太熟悉的函数。这个函数在理论上是我们知道的。这个函数的第一个性质是已经给出的。也就是说，它的导数是 1 / x。

And if we do that, then I claim that we can read off the properties of the logarithm just about as easily as we could before. And so I’ll illustrate that now. And there are a few other examples of this where somewhat more unfamiliar functions come up. This one is one that in theory we know something about. The first property of this function is the one that’s already given. Namely, its derivative is 1 / x.

仅从导数为 1 / x 这一事实中，我们就获得了很多信息。除了导数之外，我们还需要确定函数的一个值。因为它实际上不是由这个方程指定的，而是由这个方程指定的一个常数。但是当我们在这个地方 L ( 1 ) 求值时，我们就能确定这个常数。

And we get a lot of information just out of the fact that its derivative is 1 / x. The other thing that we need in order to nail down the function, besides its derivative, is one value of the function. Because it’s really not specified by this equation, only specified up to a constant by this equation. But we nail down that constant when we evaluate it at this one place, L ( 1).

特性

Properties

这样我们就得到了 dt / t 从 1 到 1 的积分，也就是 0。所有这些定积分都是这样的。如果你在它们的起始位置对它们求值，结果将为 0。这两个属性共同唯一地指定了这个函数 L (x)。现在，下一步是尝试思考它的属性是什么。

And there we’re getting the integral from 1 to 1 of dt / t, which is 0. And that’s the case with all these definite integrals. If you evaluate them at their starting places, the value will be 0. And together these two properties specify this function L (x), uniquely. Now, the next step is to try to think about what its properties are.

解决这个问题的第一种方法，也是我们一直采用的方法，可能是绘制函数图，以便对它有个了解。所以我要取二阶导数。现在，请注意，当你有一个函数作为积分给出时，它的一阶导数很容易计算。然后它的二阶导数，嗯，你必须对得到的结果进行微分。所以它可能很容易，也可能不容易。

And the first approach to that, and this is the approach that we always take, is to maybe graph the function, to get a feeling for it. And so I’m going to take the second derivative. Now, notice that when you have a function which is given as an integral, its first derivative is really easy to compute. And then its second derivative, well, you have to differentiate whatever you get. So it may or may not be easy.

但无论如何，当我从一个函数开始求二阶导数时，情况就困难得多。这里相对容易。这些是我要使用的属性。我不会用到太多其他属性。从定性上讲，我们可以得出的结论是，首先，从这个，例如，我们看到这个东西在每个地方都是凹的。

But anyway, it’s a lot harder in the case when I start with a function to get to the second derivative. Here it’s relatively easy. And these are the properties that I’m going to use. I won’t really use very much more about it than that. And qualitatively, the conclusions that we can draw from this are, first of all, from this, for example we see that this thing is concave down every place.

然后开始画图，因为我看到这里有一个值，即 L(1) = 0，我要代入斜率的值。所以 L' (1)，我知道是 1/1，这是从这个等式中读出的，所以是 1。现在我准备画出曲线的至少一部分。这是图的草图。

And then to get started with the graph, since I see I have a value here, which is L( 1) = 0, I’m going to throw in the value of the slope. So L’ ( 1), which I know is 1 of 1, that’s reading off from this equation here, so that’s 1. And now I’m ready to sketch at least a part of the curve. So here’s a sketch of the graph.

这是点 (1,0)；即 x = 1，y = 0。我知道，切线的斜率为 1。曲线向下凹。所以它看起来会像这样。顺便说一句，它也在增加。这是一个重要的特性，它严格增加。这是因为 L' (x) 为正。因此，我们可以从中得到以下重要定义。同样，这也是从这个定义反向推导的。

Here’s the point (1,0); that is, x = 1, y = 0. And the tangent line, I know, has slope 1. And the curve is concave down. So it’s going to look something like this. Incidentally, it’s also increasing. And that’s an important property, it’s strictly increasing. That’s because L’ ( x) is positive. And so, we can get from this the following important definition. Which, again, is working backwards from this definition.

我们可以回到之前讨论的对数问题。也就是说，如果我取这里的水平，即 y = 1，那么它会在某个地方与轴相交。他的要点就是我们要定义为 e 的东西。

We can get to where we started with a log in our previous discussion. Namely, if I take the level here, which is y = 1, then that crosses the axis someplace. And his point is what we’re going to define as e.

因此，e 的定义是它是满足 L (e) = 1 的值。同样，确实存在一个这样的位置，只是因为 L' 是正数，所以 L 是递增的。不，我只想向你们强调一下这个图的另一个特点。还有一件事我不会去检查，而这通常是你们在看图时会检查的。

So the definition of e is that it’s the value such that L ( e) = 1. And again, the fact that there’s exactly one such place just comes from the fact that this L’ is positive, so that L is increasing. No, there’s just one other feature of this graph that I’m going to emphasize to you. There’s one other thing which I’m not going to check, which you would ordinarily do with graphs.

一旦它开始增加，就没有临界点了，所以唯一有趣的事情就是 n。事实证明，当你下降到 0 时，极限是负无穷。当你向右移动时，它就是正无穷。它确实会变得任意高；它不会趋于平稳。但我不会在这里讨论这个问题。

Once it’s increasing there are no critical points, so the only other interesting thing is the n’s. And it turns out that the limit as you go down to 0 is minus infinity. As you go over to the right here it’s plus infinity. It does get arbitrarily high; it doesn’t level off. But I’m not going to discuss that here.

相反，我只想评论一下图表的一个定性特征，也就是 1 左边的部分低于 0。所以我只想评论一下，为什么当 x < 1 时 L (x) 为负。也许我没有空间写这个，所以我就在这里写 x < 1。我想给你两个理由。再次说明，我们只是从最基本的原则出发。

Instead, I’m going to just remark on one qualitative feature of the graph, which is this remark that the part which is to the left of 1 is below 0. So I just want to remark, why is L (x) negative for x < 1. Maybe I don’t have room for that, so I’ll just put in here x < 1. I want to give you two reasons. Again, we’re only working from very first principles here.

就是 L' = 1 / x 的性质，以及 L (1) = 0。所以我们的第一个理由是，嗯，我刚才说过了。L ( 1) = 0。而且 L 是递增的。如果你反过来读，如果它在这里达到 0，那么它在达到 0 之前一定是负数。所以这是看出 L ( x) 为负数的一种方式。还有第二种看待它的方式，同样重要。

Just that the property that L’ = 1 / x, and L (1) = 0. So our first reason is that, well, I just said it. L ( 1) = 0. And L is increasing. And if you read that backwards, if it gets up to 0 here, it must have been negative before 0. So this is one way of seeing that L ( x) is negative. There’s a second way of seeing it, which is equally important.

它只与积分操作有关。这里我将从 L (x) 及其定义开始。它是从 1 到 x dt / t 的积分。现在我将反转积分顺序。根据我们对积分性质的定义，这与从 x 到 1 的积分（带负号 dt / t）相同。现在，我可以说这个量是负数。

And it has to do with just manipulation of integrals. Here I’m going to start out with L (x), and its definition. Which is the integral from 1 to x dt / t. And now I’m going to reverse the order of integration. This is the same, by our definition of our properties of integrals, as the integral from x to 1 with a minus sign dt / t. Now, I can tell that this quantity is negative.

我之所以能说出这些，是因为这里的这块，这片，是正数。这部分是正数。这部分是正数，因为 x < 1。所以下限小于上限，所以是这样解释的。绿色框中的东西被解释为面积。它是一个面积。所以负数是正数，减去正数是负数。

And the reason that I can tell is that this chunk of it here, this piece of it, is a positive number. This part is positive. And this part is positive because x < 1. So the lower limit is less than the upper limit, and so this is interpreted. The thing in the green box is interpreted as an area. It’s an area. And so negative a positive quantity is negative, minus a positive quantity’s negative.

因此，这两种解释都非常好。这只是为了说明我们可以做什么。现在，还有一种积分运算，可以让我们得到 ln 最奇特的属性。这是我要做的最后一个。你的家庭作业也有类似的内容。所以我要证明，正如我所说，这就是对数最奇特的属性。

So both of these work perfectly well as interpretations. And it’s just to illustrate what we can do. Now, there’s one more manipulation of integrals that gives us the fanciest property of the ln. And that’s the last one that I’m going to do. And you have a similar thing on your homework. So I’m going to prove that this is, as I say, the fanciest property of the log.

顺便说一下，在你的家庭作业中，你要检查 L(1/x) = L(x)。但我们会做这个。我们的想法只是代入公式，看看它给出什么。在左边，我有 1 到 ab，dt/t。这就是 L(ab)。那么这肯定等于左边。然后我现在要把它分成两部分。

On your homework, by the way, you’re going to check that L( 1 / x) = L ( x). But we’ll do this one. The idea is just to plug in the formula and see what it gives. On the left hand side, I have 1 to ab, dt / t. That’s L ( ab). And then that’s certainly equal to the left hand side. And then I’m going to now split this into two pieces.

再次强调，这是积分的一个性质。如果你有一个从一个地方到另一个地方的积分，你可以把它分解成几个部分。所以我将从 1 开始，然后转到 a。然后我将继续从 a 到 ab。这就是我们的问题。我们还没有证明这一点。嗯，这个实际上是正确的。

Again, this is a property of integrals. That if you have an integral from one place to another, you can break it up into pieces. So I’m going to start at 1 but then go to a. And then I’m going to continue from a to ab. So this is the question that we have. We haven’t proved this. Well, this one is actually true.

如果我们希望这是真的，根据定义我们知道 L (ab) 是这样的。我们知道，我们可以看到，L(a) 是这样的。所以这个问题归结起来就是，我们想知道这两个东西是否相等。我们想知道 L (b) 是那里的另一个积分。所以让我们检查一下。我要重写积分。

If we want this to be true, we know by definition L ( ab) is this. We know, we can see it, that L(a) is this. So the question that this boils down to is, we want to know that these two things are equal. We want to know that L ( b) is that other integral there. So let’s check it. I’m going to rewrite the integral.

这是从 dt / t 的下限 a 到上限 ab 的积分。现在，为了再次说明积分的性质，我们将要使用的关键性质是变量变换。这是一种比例积分，其中所有元素都乘以一个因子 a，从我们想要得到的 L (b) 量开始。

It’s the integral from sorry, from lower limit a to upper limit ab of dt / t. And now, again, to illustrate properties of integrals, the key property here that we’re going to have to use is change of variables. This is a kind of a scaled integral where everything is multiplied by a factor of a from what we want to get to this L ( b) quantity.

因此，这意味着我们写下 t = a u。这就是我们的技巧。如果我使用新变量 u，那么 t 的变化，dt，就是 adu。因此，我可以将其写为等于积分，让我们看看，dt = adu。而 t = au。所以我现在用 代替了被积函数。

And so this suggests that we write down t = a u. That’s going to be our trick. And if I use that new variable u, then the change in t, dt, is adu. And as a result, I can write this as equal to an integral from, let’s see, dt = adu. And t = au. So I’ve now substituted in for the integrand.

但除此之外，对于定积分，我们还必须检查极限。极限如下。当 t = a 时，这是下限。我们来看看。t = a u。这意味着 u 等于什么？它是 1。因为 a * 1 = a。所以如果 t = a，这是当且仅当。

But on top of this, with definite integrals, we also have to check the limits. And the limits work out as follows. When t = a, that’s the lower limit. Let’s just take a look. t = a u. So that means that u is equal to, what? It’s 1. Because a * 1 = a. So if t = a, this is if and only if.

所以这个下限，其实是 t = a 时，变成了 u = 1 时。同样，当 t = ab 时，u = b。所以这里的上限是 b。现在，如果你注意到，我们要取消这两个因素。现在我们认识到，这与 L(b) 的定义完全相同。因为 L(x) 就在盒子里。

So this lower limit, which really in disguise was where t = a, becomes where u = 1. And similarly, when t = ab, u = b. So the upper limit here is b. And now, if you notice, we’re just going to cancel these two factors here. And now we recognize that this is just the same as the definition of L ( b). Because L ( x) is over here in the box.

我在这里使用字母 t 是无关紧要的；字母 u 也同样适用。所以这只是 L (b)。这就是我们想要展示的。这是一个例子，你的家庭作业中有一个，有点类似。现在，我要讨论的最后一个这种类型的例子，我上次已经提到过了。

And the fact that I use the letter t there is irrelevant; it works equally well with the letter u. So this is just L (b). Which is what we wanted to show. So that’s an example, and you have one in your homework, which is a little similar. Now, the last example, that I’m going to discuss of this type, I already mentioned last time.

函数 F ( x) 是 e ^ t^2 dt 从 0 到 x 的积分。这个函数更加奇特，因为与对数不同，它是一个新函数。它实际上不是任何可以用我们已知的函数来表达的函数。对于这些新函数，方法总是思考它们的属性是什么。

Which is the function F ( x), which is the integral from 0 to x of e ^ t^2 dt. This one is even more exotic because unlike the logarithm it’s a new function. It really is not any function that you can express in terms of the functions that we know already. And the approach, always, to these new functions is to think of what their properties are.

我们思考函数以便理解它们的方式可能是绘制它们。所以我要做的和这里完全相同的事情。那么，我能从中得到什么呢？嗯，我马上就能算出导数是什么。我从基本定理中读出它。就是这样。我还可以算出起始位置的值。

And the way we think of functions in order to understand them is to maybe sketch them. And so I’m going to do exactly the same thing I did over here. So, what is it that I can get out of this? Well, immediately I can figure out what the derivative is. I read it off from the fundamental theorem. It’s this. I also can figure out the value at the starting place.

在这种情况下，起始位置是 0。值是 0。我应该检查二阶导数，计算起来也不难。二阶导数是 2x e ^ x^2。现在我可以看到这个函数在增加，因为这个导数是正的，它总是在增加。当 x 为正时，它会向下凹，当 x 为负时，它会向上凹。

In this case, the starting place is 0. And the value is 0. And I should check the second derivative, which is also not so difficult to compute. The second derivative is 2x e ^ x^2. And so now I can see that this function is increasing, because this derivative is positive, it’s always increasing. And it’s going to be concave down when x is positive and concave up when x is negative.

因为这里有一个减号，所以符号为负。当 x 为正时，它小于 0，当 x 为负时，它大于 0。也许为了开始，我会提醒你 F(0)，0。F' (0) 也是正确的，它直接来自 F' (0) = e ^ 0^2，即 1。这意味着切线的斜率再次为 1。我们经常用函数来做这个。

Because there’s a minus sign here, so the sign is negative. This is less than 0 when x is positive and greater than 0 when x is negative. And maybe to get started I’ll remind you F( 0), 0. It’s also true that F’ ( 0), that just comes right out of this, F’ ( 0) = e ^ 0^2 which is 1. That means the tangent line again has slope 1. We do this a lot with functions.

我们将它们标准化，使它们的切线斜率在方便的位置为 1。所以这是斜率为 1 的切线。我们知道这个东西向右凹，向左凹。所以它看起来会像这样。有一个拐点。对吧？

We normalize them so that their slopes of their tangent lines are 1 at convenient spots. So here’s the tangent line of slope 1. We know this thing is concave down to the right and concave up to the left. And so it’s going to look something like this. With an inflection point. Right?

现在，在我们继续之前，我想再说一句，再对这个函数说一句，或者再说两句。真的，你想尽可能地了解这个图。所以还有几个特性。其中一个非常有用，因为它可以减少你一半的工作量。那就是这个函数是 i 的性质。即 F(x) = F(x)。

Now, I want to say one more, make one more remark about this function, or maybe two more remarks about this function, before we go on. Really, you want to know this graph as well as possible. And so there are just a couple more features. And one is enormously helpful because it cuts in half all of the work that you have. and that is the property that turns out that this function is i. Namely, F( x) = F(x).

这就是所谓的奇函数。现在，它之所以是奇函数，是因为它是偶数的反导数。这里的这个函数是偶函数。我们把它固定下来，所以它在 0 处为 0。另一种解释方法，让我在下面向你展示，如下。当我们看它的导数时，它的导数当然是函数 e ^ x。

That’s what’s known as an odd function. Now, the reason why it’s odd is that it’s the antiderivative of something that’s even. This function in here is even. And we nailed it down so that it was 0 at 0. Another way of interpreting that, and let me show it to you underneath, is the following. When we look at its derivative, its derivative, course, is the function e ^ x.

抱歉，e ^ x ^2。这就是这里的形状。你可以看到斜率为 0，但非常接近 0，但这里是正值。这是最陡峭的点。这是这里的最高点。然后它又趋于平稳；斜率下降，始终为正值。

Sorry, e ^ x ^2. So that’s this shape here. And you can see the slope is 0, but fairly close to 0, but positive along here. It’s getting, this is its steepest point. This is the highest point here. And then it’s leveling off again; the slope is going down, always positive.

这是 F' = e ^ x^2 的图形。现在，上面的函数的解释是，这里的值是从 0 到 x 的面积。所以这是面积 F(x)。也许我会给它上色，稍微装饰一下。所以这里的面积就是 F ( x)。现在，我想利用这种对称性向你们展示这个奇怪的性质。

This is the graph of F’ = e ^ x^2. Now, the interpretation of the function that’s up above is that the value here is the area from 0 to x. So this is area F(x). Maybe I’ll color it in, decorate it a little bit. So this area here is F ( x). Now, I want to show you this odd property, by using this symmetry.

这里的图是均匀的，换句话说，后面的和前面的完全一样。但现在出现了反转。因为我们从 0 开始向前跟踪面积。这是正数。如果我们向后走，就会被算成负数。所以如果我们回到 x，我们会得到和那边的绿色斑块完全一样的结果。我们会得到这里的红色斑块。但它会被算成负数。

The graph here is even, so in other words, what’s back here is exactly the same as what’s forward. But now there’s a reversal. Because we’re keeping track of the area starting from 0 going forward. That’s positive. If we go backwards, it’s counted negatively. So if we went backwards to x, we’d get exactly the same as that green patch over there. We’d get a red patch over here. But it would be counted negatively.

这就是奇数的性质。你也可以直接通过积分性质来检查它。这就像这里的过程一样。所以它完全类似于检查那边的这个公式。这就是我想对此提出的评论之一。如果我们知道这是奇数，为什么这会为我们节省大量时间？

And that’s the property that it’s odd. You can also check this by properties of integrals directly. That would be just like this process here. So it’s completely analogous to checking this formula over there. So that’s one of the comments I wanted to make about this. And why does this save us a lot of time, if we know this is odd?

好吧，我们知道这个分支的形状正好是这个分支形状的反面，或者说是它的反射。我们要做的是将它翻转到轴下，然后以那种方式反射它。这就是 F(x) 图形的对称性。现在，我想提到的最后一个属性是端点的情况。在端点处有一个渐近线，这里有一个极限。

Well, we know that the shape of this branch is exactly the reverse, or the reflection, if you like, of the shape of this one. What we want to do is flip it under the axis and then reflect it over that way. And that’s the symmetry property of the graph of F(x). Now, the last property that I want to mention is what’s happening with the ends. And at the end there’s an asymptote, there’s a limit here.

所以这是一条渐近线。下面也是一样，正是因为奇数特征，所以它正好是负数。这里是相反的值。你可能会问自己，这到底是什么级别。现在，这个级别是一个非常重要的量。它在这里被解释为整个无限延伸下的面积。它一直延伸到无穷大。所以，让我们看看。你认为它是什么？

So this is an asymptote. And the same thing down here, which will be exactly because of the odd feature, this’ll be exactly negative. The opposite value over here. And you might ask yourself, what level is this, exactly. Now, that level turns out to be a very important quantity. It’s interpreted down here as the area under this whole infinite stretch. It’s all the way out to infinity. So, let’s see. What do you think it is?

你们全都一无所知。好吧，也许不是所有人都这样，你们只是不敢说。所以这很明显。它是 π/2 的平方根。这就在你嘴边，不是吗？学生：啊，是的。教授：是的，所以这实际上非常不明显，但它是一个非常重要的量。而且令人惊讶的是，这个数字接近这个数字。这是人们多年来一直担心的事情，直到真正确定下来。

You’re all clueless. Well, maybe not all of you, you’re just afraid to say. So it’s obvious. It’s the square root of pi/2. That was right on the tip of your tongue, wasn’t it? STUDENT: Ah, yes. PROFESSOR: Right, so this is actually very un obvious, but it’s a very important quantity. And it’s an amazing fact that this thing approaches this number. And it’s something that people worried about for many years before actually nailing down.

所以我刚才在这里声明的是，当 x 趋近于无穷大时，F (x) 的极限 = pi / 2 的平方根。同样，如果你把它推到负无穷大，你会得到负 pi/2 的平方根。出于这个原因，人们引入了一个新函数，因为他们喜欢数字 1。这个函数是 erf，即误差函数的缩写。

And so what I just claimed here is that the limit as x approaches infinity of F ( x) = the square root of pi / 2. And similarly, if you do it to minus infinity, you’ll get minus square root of pi/2. And for this reason, people introduce a new function because they like the number 1. This function is erf, short for error function.

它是 2/π 平方根乘以从 0 到 x 的积分，e ^ t ^2 dt。换句话说，它只是我们原来的，我们之前的函数乘以 2/π 平方根。这个函数经常被制成表格。你会在互联网上随处看到它，这是一个非常重要的函数。

And it’s 2 / the square root of pi times the integral from 0 to x, e ^ t ^2 dt. In other words, it’s just our original, our previous function multiplied by 2 / the square root of pi. And that’s the function which gets tabulated quite a lot. You’ll see it on the internet everywhere, and it’s a very important function.

还有其他标准化方法可供使用，其他标准化方法的讨论都包含在您的问题中。这是其中之一，另一个标准化方法包含在您的练习中。标准正态分布。

There are other normalizations that are used, and the discussions of the other normalizations are in your problems. This is one of them, and another one is in your exercises. The standard normal distribution.

功能

Functions

像这样的函数有很多，只要有积分这个工具，我们就能得到这些新函数。我再写一两个，这样你就能看明白它们的种类了。

There are tons of functions like this, which are new functions that we can get at once we have the tool of integrals. And I’ll write down just one or two more, just so that you’ll see the variety.

这是所谓的菲涅尔积分。在下周的习题中，我们将做另一个菲涅尔积分，我们将研究这个。这些函数不能用基本术语来表达。本周的家庭作业就是这个。这个函数出现在傅里叶分析中。我只想告诉你另一个这样的函数。

Here’s one which is called a Fresnel integral. On your problem set next week, we’ll do the other Fresnel integral, we’ll look at this one. These functions cannot be expressed in elementary terms. The one on your homework for this week was this one. This one comes up in Fourier analysis. And I’m going to just tell you maybe one more such function.

有一个函数叫做 Li(x)，是 x 的对数积分，就是这个。对数的倒数，自然对数。这个函数的意义在于 Li(x) 近似等于小于 x 的素数的数量。事实上，如果你能使它尽可能精确，你将名垂千古，因为这被称为黎曼假设。这个近似值到底有多接近。

There’s a function which is called Li ( x), logarithmic integral of x, which is this guy. The reciprocal of the logarithm, the natural log. And the significance of this one is that Li ( x) is approximately equal to the number of primes < x. And, in fact, if you can make this as precise as possible, you’ll be famous for millennia, because this is known as the Riemann hypothesis. Exactly how closely this approximation occurs.

但这是一个难题，早在一个世纪前，素数定理就建立了这种联系，这对数学的发展至关重要。是的，问题。学生：教授：这是你应该理解的东西吗？这是个好问题。我喜欢这个问题。答案是，就是这样，所以我们从这里开始讨论。让我给你解释一下。

But it’s a hard problem, and already a century ago the prime number theorem, which established this connection was extremely important to progress in math. Yeah, question. STUDENT: PROFESSOR: Is this stuff you’re supposed to understand. That’s a good question. I love that question. The answer is, this is, so we launched off into something here. And let me just explain it to you.

我将更详细地讨论这个特定函数，因为它与正态分布相关。我将让你们熟悉它。我在这里做的纯粹是文化方面的。好吧，在这个小组讨论之后，我做的纯粹是文化方面的。只是说世界上还有很多其他的野兽。

I’m going to be talking a fair amount more about this particular function, because it’s associated to the normal distribution. And I’m going to let you get familiar with it. What I’m doing here is purely cultural. Well, after this panel, what I’m doing is purely cultural. Just saying there’s a lot of other beasts out there in the world.

其中之一叫做 C 函数，所以我们对其中的一两个函数会非常熟悉。但实际上有几十个这样的函数。对于这些函数，你唯一需要做的就是理解导数、二阶导数，并跟踪函数的作用。绘制草图的方式与使用其他工具的方式相同。

And one of them is called C of So we’ll have a just a very passing familiarity with one or two of these functions. But there are literally dozens and dozens of them. The only thing that you’ll need to do with such functions is things like understanding the derivative, the second derivative, and tracking what the function does. Sketching the same way you did with any other tool.

所以我们要用这些函数来做这种事情。我必须引导你们。如果我想问你关于这些函数的问题，我必须告诉你我到底想问什么。是的，另一个问题。学生：教授：是的，我问了。我把这些叫做菲涅尔积分。这个家伙的名字叫菲涅尔。它只是以一个人的名字命名的。

So we’re going to do this type of thing with these functions. And I’ll have to lead you through. If I wanted to ask you a question about one of these functions, I have to tell you exactly what I’m aiming for. Yeah, another question. STUDENT: PROFESSOR: Yeah, I did. I called these guys Fresnel integrals. The guy’s name is Fresnel. It’s just named after a person.

但是，这个，李对数积分，不是以人名命名的。对数不是某人的名字。所以，你看，事实上这也会在问题集中提到，但我不指望你能记住这些名字。特别是，你肯定不想试着去记住。是的，另一个问题。学生：教授：问题是，我们会证明这个极限吗？答案是肯定的，如果我们有时间的话。

But, and this one, Li’s logarithmic integral, it’s not named after a person. Logarithm is not somebody’s name. So look, in fact this will be mentioned also on a problem set, but I don’t expect you to remember these names. In particular, that you definitely don’t want to try to remember. Yes, another question. 大约一周后。我们现在不做。这需要我们做很多工作。好的。我现在要换年份，我要换个话题。我们要回到更标准的事情上，这只与设置积分有关。

It’ll be in about a week or so. We’re not going to do it now. It takes us quite a bit of work to do it. OK. I’m going to change years now, I’m going to shift gears. And we’re going to go back to a more standard thing which has to do with just setting up integrals.

这与理解积分的作用有关，它们在累积和、评估事物方面发挥着作用。这与第一基本定理更密切相关。也就是说，我们今天讨论了积分如何成为函数公式。或微分方程的解。我们将回过头来讨论积分作为问题的答案，而不是。

And this has to do with understanding where integrals play a role, and they play a role in cumulative sums, in evaluating things. This is much more closely associated with the first Fundamental Theorem. That is, we’ll take, today we were talking about how integrals are formulas for functions. Or solutions to differential equations. We’re going to go back and talk about integrals as being the answer to a question as opposed to.

曲线之间的区域

Areas between curves

我们现在所做的。

what we’ve done now.

换句话说，第一个例子，或者说现在的大多数例子，都取自几何学。稍后我们将讨论概率。第一个主题是曲线之间的面积。这就是想法。

So in other words, and the first example, or most of the examples for now, are going to be taken from geometry. Later on we’ll get to probability. And the first topic is just areas between curves. Here’s the idea.

如果你有几条曲线看起来像这样，也可能像这样，你想从 a 处开始，到 b 处结束，那么你可以像我们对黎曼和所做的那样将其切分。然后取一个看起来像这样的块。我要写出该块的厚度。好吧，让我们给这些东西命名。

If you have a couple of curves that look like this and maybe like this, and you want to start at a place a and you want to end at a place b, then you can chop it up the same way we did with Riemann sums. And take a chunk that looks like this. And I’m going to write the thickness of that chunk. Well, let’s give these things names.

假设顶部曲线为 f(x)，底部曲线为 g (x)。那么厚度就是 dx。这就是厚度。那么高度是多少呢？高度就是顶部值和底部值之间的差值。所以这里我们有 (f (x) g (x)) dx。如果你愿意的话，这就是底边乘以 whoops，倒着来。这是高度，这是矩形的底边。

Let’s say the top curve is f(x), and the bottom curve is g ( x). And then this thickness is going to be dx. That’s the thickness. And what is the height? Well, the height is the difference between the top value and the bottom value. So here we have (f ( x) g ( x)) dx. This is, if you like, base times whoops, backwards. This is height, and this is the base of the rectangle.

这些是近似正确的。但当然，只有在极限情况下，当这是一个无穷小时，它才完全正确。为了得到整个面积，我必须把这些加起来。所以我要从 a 到 b 积分。这就是把它们加起来，把它们加起来。这就是我的面积。这就是这里的故事。现在，让我说两件事。

And these are approximately correct. But of course, only in limit when this is an infinitesimal, is it exactly right. In order to get the whole area, I have add these guys up. So I’m going to integrate from a to b. That’s summing them, that’s adding them up. And that’s going to be my area. So that’s the story here. Now, let me just say two things about this.

首先，在我们开始讨论更复杂问题的细节之前，先从非常抽象的层面谈谈。首先，从现在开始，几天内我将要讨论的每个问题都涉及以下目标。我想确定要积分的东西。这被称为被积函数。我想确定所谓的极限。

First of all, on a very abstract level before we get started with details of more complicated problems. The first one is that every problem that I’m going to be talking about from now on for, several days, involves the following collection of, the following goals. I want to identify something to integrate. That’s called an integrand. And I want to identify what are known as the limits.

整个游戏就是要弄清楚这里的 a、b 和这个量是多少。不管它是什么。一旦我们有了这些，我们就可以计算积分了。我们有数值程序，或者可能有分析程序，但无论如何我们都可以得到积分。这里的目标是设置它们。为了设置它们，你必须知道这三件事。

The whole game is simply to figure out what a, b, and this quantity is here. Whatever it is. And the minute we have that, we can calculate the integral if we like. We have numerical procedures or maybe we have analytic procedures, but anyway we can get at the integral. The goal here is to set them up. And in order to set them up, you must know these three things.

下限、上限和我们要积分的数。如果你忽略其中之一，就会出现以下情况。我问你这个区域的面积是多少。如果我忽略了这一端，我怎么可能知道呢？我甚至不知道它从哪里开始，所以如果我还没有确定左边是什么，我怎么能知道这个区域是什么呢？我不能忽略底部。

The lower limit, the upper limit, and what we’re integrating. If you leave one of these out, it’s like the following thing. I ask you what the area of this region is. If I left out this end, how could I possibly know? I don’t even know where it starts, so how can I figure out what this area is if I haven’t identified what the left side is. I can’t leave out the bottom.

它就在这里，在这个公式里。因为我需要知道它在哪里。我需要知道它的顶部，我需要知道这一边。这些是图形的四个边。如果我不把它们纳入信息中，我就什么也得不到。所以我需要知道一切。我需要确切地知道这些东西，才能得到面积公式。

It’s sitting here, in this formula. Because I need to know where it is. And I need to know the top and I need to know this side. Those are the four sides of the figure. If I don’t incorporate them into the information, I’ll never get anything out. So I need to know everything. And I need to know exactly those things, in order to have a formula for the area.

现在，当在实践中执行时，就像我们现在在第一个例子中所做的那样，它比看起来更复杂。所以这是我们的第一个例子：求出 x = y ^2 和 y = x 2 之间的面积。这是我们的第一个例子。让我确保我选择了我想要的例子。是的。现在，弄清楚这些事情的第一步是。你必须画一幅画。

Now, when this gets carried out in practice, as we will do now in our first example, it’s more complicated than it looks. So here’s our first example: Find the area between x = y ^2 and y = x 2. This is our first example. Let me make sure that I chose the example that I wanted to. Yeah. Now, there’s a first step in figuring these things out. And this is that you must draw a picture.

如果你不画图，你永远也搞不清楚这个区域是什么，因为你永远搞不清楚这些曲线之间是什么。第一条曲线 y = x ^2 是一条抛物线。但 x 是 y 的函数。它指向这个方向。所以这是这条抛物线。那就是 y = x^2。哎呀，x = y ^2。第二条曲线是一条线，一条斜率为 1 的直线，起始于 (x = 2, y = 0)。

If you don’t draw a picture you’ll never figure out what this area is, because you’ll never figure out what’s what between these curves. The first curve, y = x ^2, is a parabola. But x is a function of y. It’s pointing this way. So it’s this parabola here. That’s y = x^2. Whoops, x = y ^2. The second curve is a line, a straight line of slope 1, starting at (x = 2, y = 0).

它经过这里，这里是 2 倍，斜率为 1，所以它就是这样。这里的这个形状就是我们所说的曲线之间的区域。现在我们知道了它是什么，我们对我们的目标有了更好的了解。如果你还没有画出来，你就没有希望了。现在，我将描述两种到达这里区域的方法。

It goes through this place here, which is 2 over and has slope 1, so it does this. And this shape in here is what we mean by the area between the curves. Now that we see what it is, we have a better idea of what our goal is. If you haven’t drawn it, you have no hope. Now, I’m going to describe two ways of getting at this area here.

第一个是受我刚才描述的形状启发的。也就是说，我将以一种直接的方式使用它。我将把事物切成这些垂直部分，就像我刚才做的那样。现在，这就是难点所在。难点在于，这里的上部曲线有一个公式，但下部曲线从抛物线的一部分转变为直线的一部分。

And the first one is motivated by the shape that I just described right here. Namely, I’m going to use it in a straightforward way. I’m going to chop things up into these vertical pieces just as I did right there. Now, here’s the difficulty with that. The difficulty is that the upper curve here has one formula but the lower curve shifts from being a part of the parabola to being a part of the straight line.

这意味着下函数有两个不同的公式。而解决这一问题的唯一方法是将其分成两半。将其分成两半。我必须在这里将其分开。所以我们必须将其分成两部分，然后求出一半和另一半的积分。问题？学生：教授：所以，你比我领先一步。

That means that there are two different formulas for the lower function. And the only way to accommodate that is to separate this up into two halves. Separate it out into two halves. I’m going to have to divide it right here. So we must break it into two pieces and find the integral of one half and the other half. Question? STUDENT: PROFESSOR: So, you’re one step ahead of me.

我们还必须确保区分抛物线的顶部分支和底部分支，我们即将这样做。现在，为了区分正在发生的事情，我实际上必须在这里使用多种颜色。我们会这样做。首先是顶部，它是橙色的。那是顶部。我称之为顶部。然后是底部，它有两半。

We’ll also have to be sure to distinguish between the top branch and the bottom branch of the parabola, which we’re about to do. Now, in order to distinguish what’s going on I actually have to use multi colors here. And so we will do that. First there’s the top part, which is orange. That’s the top part. I’ll call it top. And then there’s the bottom part, which has two halves.

它们是粉色的，我猜这是蓝色的。好吧，现在让我们看看发生了什么。为了开始，我必须弄清楚最重要的两点。好吧，我声称，实际上我必须弄清楚三点。我必须弄清楚这个点在哪里。这个点在哪里，那个点在哪里。

They are pink, and I guess this is blue. Alright, so now let’s see what’s happening. The most important two points that I have to figure out in order to get started here. Well, really I’m going to have to figure out three points, I claim. I’m going to have to figure out where this point is. Where this point is, and where that point is.

如果我知道这三个点在哪里，那么我就有可能知道从哪里开始，从哪里结束等等。另一个问题。学生：教授：你能说说吗？学生：教授：问题是，我们为什么需要分割区域。我认为为了进一步回答这个问题，我必须深入研究该方法的细节，然后你就会明白哪里有必要。

If I know where these three points are, then I have a chance of knowing where to start, where to end, and so forth. Another question. STUDENT: PROFESSOR: Could you speak up? STUDENT: PROFESSOR:. The question is, why do we need to split up the area. And I think in order to answer that question further, I’m going to have to go into the details of the method, and then you’ll see where it’s necessary.

所以第一步是我要弄清楚这三个点是什么。这个比较简单；它是点 (0,0)。这里下面的这个点和这里上面的这个点是两条曲线的交点。我可以通过以下方程识别它们。我需要看到这些曲线相交的位置。

So the first step is that I’m going to figure out what these three points are. This one is kind of easy; it’s the point (0,0). This point down here and this point up here are intersections of the two curves. I can identify them by the following equation. I need to see where these curves intersect.

那么，如果我代入 x = y^2，我得到 y = y^2 2。然后我可以解这个二次方程。y ^2 y 2 = 0。所以 (y 2)( y + 1) = 0。这告诉我 y = 2 或 y = 1。所以我发现 y = 1。这意味着下面这个点有第二个条目 1。它的第一个条目，它的 x 值，我可以从这里的这个公式或其他公式中得到。

At what, well, if I plug in x = y^2, I get y = y^2 2. And then I can solve this quadratic equation. y ^2 y 2 = 0. So (y 2)( y + 1) = 0. And this is telling me that y = 2 or y = 1. So I’ve found y = 1. That means this point down here has second entry 1. Its first entry, its x value, I can get from this formula here or the other formula.

我必须求平方，1^2 = 1。这就是这个点的公式。另一个点有第二个元素 2。同样，根据他的公式 y = x^2，我必须求 y 的平方才能得到 x，所以这是 4。现在，我声称我有足够的数据可以开始了。但也许我会再确定一件事。我需要顶部、左下角和右下角。

I have to square, this 1 ^2 = 1. So that’s the formula for this point. And the other point has second entry 2. And, again, with his formula y = x ^2, I have to square y to get x, so this is 4. Now, I claim I have enough data to get started. But maybe I’ll identify one more thing. I need the top, the bottom left, and the bottom right.

顶部是 x = y ^2 这个分支的公式，它位于正 y 区域。即 y = x 的平方根。底部曲线是抛物线的一部分，也就是左下角，是 y = 负 x 的平方根。这是平方根的另一个分支。这正是你之前问的。我们必须区分这两个。

The top is the formula for this branch of x = y ^2, which is in the positive y region. And that is y = the square root of x. The bottom curve, part of the parabola, so this is the bottom left, is y = minus square root x. That’s the other branch of the square root. And this is exactly what you were asking before. And this is, we have to distinguish between these two.

关键是，这些公式确实不同，它们并不相同。

And the point is, these formulas really are different. They’re not the same.

右下块

Bottom right chunk

现在，最后一点是右下角的部分，也就是粉色部分。右下角。这是直线的公式。即 y = x 2。现在我准备求面积了。它将分为两部分。这是左侧部分加上右侧部分。

Now, the last bit is the bottom right chunk here, which is this pink part. Bottom right. And that one is the formula for the line. And that’s y = x 2. Now I’m ready to find the area. It’s going to be in two chunks. This is the left part, plus the right part.

左边部分，我想把它设置为一个积分，我希望有一个 dx，这里我想设置一个积分，我希望它是 dx。我需要弄清楚 x 的范围。所以，首先我要做的是，让我们给自己留出更多的空间。为了安全起见。好的，这是右边的部分。所以这里我们有 dx。

And the left part, and I want to set it up as an integral, I want there to be a dx and here I want to set up an integral and I want it to be dx. I need to figure out what the range of x is. So, first I’m going to well, let’s leave ourselves a little more room than that. Just to be safe. OK, here’s the right. So here we have our dx.

现在，我需要找出起点和终点。所以起点是最左边的地方。最左边的地方是这里。那里 x = 0。

Now, I need to figure out the starting place and the ending place. So the starting place is the leftmost place. The leftmost place is over here. And x = 0 there.

左上角和左下角

Top and bottom left

所以我们要从这条垂直线移动到绿线。就在这里。这是从 0 到 1。橙色曲线和蓝色曲线之间的差异就是我所说的左上角和左下角，就在那里。

So we’re going to travel from this vertical line to the green line. Over here. And that’s from 0 to 1. And the difference between the orange curve and the blue curve is what I call top and bottom left, over there.

所以这是 x 的平方根减去 x 的平方根。再说一遍，这就是我所说的顶部，这是底部。但只有左边。我声称这给了我这个图的左半部分，即这个图的左侧部分。现在我要处理图的右侧部分。我从 1 开始。下限是 1。我一直到这里。这是最后一点。

So that is square root of x minus square root of x. Again, this is what I call top, and this was bottom. But only the left. I claim that’s giving me the left half of this, the left section of this diagram. Now I’m going to do the right section of the diagram. I start at 1. The lower limit is 1. And I go all the way to this point here. Which is the last bit.

那就是 x = 4。这里的上限是 4。

And that’s going to be x = 4. The upper limit here is 4.

底部

Bottom

现在我必须再次计算顶部和底部之间的差值。顶部又是 x 的平方根。但底部已经改变。底部现在是数量 (x 2)。请不要忘记括号。会有减号和取消。现在，这几乎是问题的结束。其余都是例行公事。

And now I have to take the difference between the top and the bottom again. The top is square root of x all over again. But the bottom has changed. The bottom is now the quantity (x 2). Please don’t forget your parenthesis. There’s going to be minus signs and cancellations. Now, this is almost the end of the problem. The rest of it is routine.

我们只需要评估这些积分。

We would just have to evaluate these integrals.

艰难之路

Hard Way

幸运的是，我将免除您的这些麻烦。我们不会费心去做。这是最简单的部分。我们不会去做。但我将向您展示，使用这个积分，还有这个面积计算，有一种更快的方法。现在。当您看到它有多长时，您就会看到更快捷的方法。

And, fortunately, I’m going to spare you that. We’re not going to bother to do it. That’s the easy part. We’re not going to do it. But I’m going to show you that there’s a much quicker way with this integral. And with this area calculation. Right now. The quicker way is what you see when you see how long this is.

你会看到，还有另一种设备，原理上与此类似，但 x 和 y 的角色互换了。我将在这里画出另一种设备，以示意。不，也许我会把它画在这块黑板上。所以，方法 2，如果你愿意的话，这是方法 1，我们应该称其为困难方法。方法 2 在这种情况下更好，即使用水平切片。

And you see that there’s another device that you can use that looks similar in principle to this, but reverses the roles of x and y. And the other device, which I’ll draw over here, schematically. No, maybe I’ll draw it on this blackboard here. So, Method 2, if you like, this was Method 1, and we should call it the hard way. Method 2, which is better in this case, is to use horizontal slices.

让我画出这幅图，至少是示意图。这是我们之前画的图。现在，我不再垂直切分，而是水平切分。像这样。现在，维度有不同的名称。但原理是相似的。宽度，我们现在称为 dy。因为它是 y 的变化。而这里的距离，从左端到右端，我们必须弄清楚这些东西的公式是什么。

Let me draw the picture, at least schematically. Here’s our picture that we had before. And now instead of slicing it vertically, I’m going to slice it horizontally. Like this. Now, the dimensions have different names. But the principle is similar. The width, we now call dy. Because it’s the change in y. And this distance here, from the left end to the right end, we have to figure out what the formulas for those things are.

所以在左边，也许我会再次用颜色编码来绘制它们。所以这是左边。哦，橙色应该是右边，我想。所以我们开始吧。所以左边是绿色。是 x = y ^2。右边是橙色，是 y = x 2。现在为了使用它，结果就是我们要把 x 写成，我们要反转角色。

So on the left, maybe I’ll draw them color coded again. So here’s a left. And, whoops, orange is right, I guess. So here we go. So we have the left, which is this green. Is x = y ^2. And the right, which is orange, is y = x 2. And now in order to use this, it’s going to turn out that we want to write x as, we want to reverse roles.

因此，我们要将其写为 x 是 y 的函数。因此，我们将以这种形式使用它。现在我要为您设置积分。这次，面积等于 dy 变量中的积分。它的起始位置在这里下方。它的结束位置在那里上方。这是 y 的最低值，这是 y 的最高值。我们已经计算了这些东西。

So we want to write this as x is a function of y. So we’ll use it in this form. And now I want to set up the integral for you. This time, the area is equal to an integral in the dy variable. And its starting place is down here. And it’s ending place is up there. This is the lowest value of y, and this is the top value of y. And we’ve already computed those things.

y 的最低级别是 1。所以这是 y = 1。这个最高值是 y = 2。所以这是从 1 到 2。现在的差异是这里的距离，最右边的点和最左边的点之间的距离。这是两个维度。所以再说一次，它是一个矩形，但它的水平很长，垂直很短。它们是什么？这是右边和左边之间的差异。

The lowest level of y is 1. So this is y = 1. And this top value is y = 2. So this goes from 1 to 2. And now the difference is this distance here, the distance between the rightmost point and the leftmost point. Those are the two dimensions. So again, it’s a rectangle but its horizontal is long and its vertical is very short. And what are they? It’s the difference between the right and the left.

右边是 (y + 2)，右边是 y ^2。所以这是公式。 学生： 教授：问题是什么？为什么是右减左？这非常重要。为什么是右减左？这实际上是我要说的重点。就是这个。y + 2，也就是右边，大于 y ^2，也就是左边。所以这意味着 y + 2 y ^2 是正数。

The right hand is (y + 2), and the right hand is y ^2. So this is the formula. STUDENT: PROFESSOR: What was the question? Why is it right minus left? That’s very important. Why is it right minus left? And that’s actually the point that I was about to make. Which is this. That y + 2, which is the right, is bigger than y ^2, which is the left. So that means that y + 2 y ^2 is positive.

如果你反过来算，你得到的总是负数，而且你得到的总是错误的答案。所以这是用右边减去左边得到的一个正数。

If you do it backwards, you’ll always get a negative number and you’ll always get the wrong answer. So this is the right hand end minus the left hand end gives you a positive number.

交叉点

Crossover Points

实际上，你的位置并不明显。顺便说一句，还有另一个双重检查。当你查看这个数量时，你会看到两端收缩。这正是交叉点。

And it’s not obvious, actually, where you are. There’s another double check, by the way. When you look at this quantity, you see that the ends pinch. And that’s exactly the crossover points.

也就是说，当 y = 1 时，y + 2 y ^2 = 0。而当 y = 2 时，y + 2 y ^2 = 0。这并非偶然，这正是我们挑选的形状的几何形状。

That is, when y = 1, y + 2 y ^2 = 0. And when y = 2, y + 2 y ^2 = 0. And that’s not an accident, that’s exactly the geometry of the shape that we picked out there.

不可缺少的

Integral

这就是技巧。现在，这是一个更常规的积分。我不会执行它，我只会做最后一步。

So this is the technique. Now, this is a much more routine integral. I’m not going to carry it out, I’ll just do one last step.

也就是说，这是 (y ^2 / 2) + 2y (y ^3 / 3)，在 1 和 2 处求值。如果你算出来，就是 9/2。今天就到此为止。明天我们会做更多的体积，包括三维在内的更多东西。

Which is that this is (y ^2 / 2) + 2y (y ^3 / 3), evaluated at 1 and 2. Which, if you work it out, is 9/2. So we’re done for today. And tomorrow we’ll do more volumes, more things including three dimensions.

Lec 22 | MIT 18.01 单变量微积分，2007 年秋季

Lec 22 | MIT 18.01 Single Variable Calculus, Fall 2007

16 年前 (2009 年 8 月 19 日) — 49:58 https://youtube.com/watch?v=ShGBRUx2ub8

16 years ago (Aug 19, 2009) — 49:58 https://youtube.com/watch?v=ShGBRUx2ub8

以下内容根据 Creative Commons 许可提供。您的支持将帮助 MIT OpenCourseWare 继续免费提供高质量的教育资源。要捐款或查看数百门 MIT 课程的其他材料，请访问 MIT OpenCourseWare，网址为 ocw.mit.edu 教授：今天，我将继续讨论积分的设置。我们将通过切片来处理体积。通过切片。幸运的是，这是午饭后。

The following content is provided under a Creative Commons license. Your support will help MIT OpenCourseWare continue to offer high quality educational resources for free. To make a donation, or to view additional materials from hundreds of MIT courses, visit MIT OpenCourseWare at ocw.mit.edu PROFESSOR: Today, I’m going to continue the idea of setting up integrals. And what we’ll deal with is volumes by slices. By slicing. And it’s lucky that this is after lunch.

对于你们中的某些人来说，可能早餐后会这样，因为介绍这个主题的典型方式是用食物类比。有很多种切食物的方法。我们会给出更多的例子，而不仅仅是这个。但是，假设你有，好吧，假设你有一条面包。这就是我们的面包，我希望它看起来有点像一条面包。

Maybe it’s after breakfast for some of you, because there’s the typical way of introducing this subject is with a food analogy. There’s a lot of ways of slicing up food. And we’ll give a few more examples than just this one. But, suppose you have, well, suppose you have a loaf of bread here. So here’s our loaf of bread, and I hope that looks a little bit like a loaf of bread.

它应该放在厨房柜台上，准备被吃掉。为了弄清楚面包有多少，一种方法是把它切成片。现在，你可能知道面包经常这样切片。甚至有机器可以做到这一点。有了这个设置，我将用一些更丰富多彩的装饰来绘制切片。这是我们的红色面包片。

It’s supposed to be sitting on the kitchen counter ready to be eaten. And in order to figure out how much bread there is there, one way of doing it is to cut it into slices. Now, you probably know that bread is often sliced like this. There are even machines to do it. And with this setup here, I’ll draw the slice with a little bit of a more colorful decoration. So here’s our red slice of bread.

它像这样绕了一圈。然后又回到后面。这就是我们的面包片。我想要计算的是它的体积。首先，是面包的厚度。也就是这个维度，厚度就是这里的这个维度 dx。我要给出的唯一另一个维度，因为目前这是一个非常定性的分析，我称之为面积。

It’s coming around like this. And it comes back down behind. So here’s our bread slice. And what I’d like to figure out is its volume. So first of all, there’s the thickness of the bread. Which is this dimension, the thickness is this dimension dx here. And the only other dimension that I’m going to give, because this is a very qualitative analysis for now, is what I’ll call the area.

这就是切片表面的面积。因此，一片切片的面积，我将用 delta V 表示，这是体积的一块，大约等于面积乘以 x 的变化量。在极限情况下，这将是这样的。切片的面积可能有所不同。面包中间某处可能会有一个小洞。也许一侧会变小一点。

And that’s the area on the face of the slice. And so the area of one slice, which I’ll denote by delta V, that’s a chunk of volume, is approximately the area times the change in x. And in the limit, that’s going to be something like this. And maybe the areas of the slices vary. There might be a little hole in the middle of the bread somewhere. Maybe it gets a little small on one side.

因此，它可能会随着 x 的变化而变化。通过相加，可以得到整个体积。所以，如果你愿意，这是一个切片。这是总和。你应该以一种直观的方式将其视为类似于黎曼和，其中你将单独取每个切片。它看起来就像这样。好吧，这只是一种表面的、直观的观察方式。

So it might change as x changes. And the whole volume you get by adding up. So if you like, this is one slice. And this is the sum. And you should think of it in a sort of intuitive way as being analogous to the Riemann sum, where you would take each slice individually. And that would look like this. Alright, so that’s just a superficial and intuitive way of looking at it.

现在，我们只讨论一种系统切片。它已经在你的问题集上，你有一个某个区域切片的例子。但我们只系统地讨论一种叫做旋转体的东西。这里的想法是这样的。假设你有一些形状，一些图形，可能看起来像这样。现在我要旋转它。这是 x 轴，这是 y 轴。

Now, we’re only going to talk about one kind of systematic slice. It’s already on your problem set, you had an example of a slice of some region. But we’re only going to talk systematically about something called solids of revolution. The idea here is this. Suppose you have some shape, some graph, which maybe looks like this. And now I’m going to revolve it. This is the x axis and this is the y axis.

在这种情况下，我将绕 x 轴旋转它。如果这样做，那么得到的形状可能像这样。如果我能稍微画一下。它可能是一个足球。所以这就是你拿起这块圆盘并绕它旋转时得到的形状。如果你在下面复制了这个，它仍然是同一个区域。

In this case, I’m going to revolve it around the x axis. If you do that, then the shape that you get is maybe like this. If I can draw it a little bit. It’s maybe a football. So that’s the shape that you get if you take this piece of disk and you revolve it around. If you had made this copy underneath, it still would have been the same region.

所以我们只关注轴上方的部分。这就是基本思想。现在，我将应用切片法来计算这些区域的体积，并给出一个通用公式。然后将其应用于具体案例。我想切下这个足球的一小片，也许足球不太合适，也许我们应该回到一条面包。

So we only pay attention to what’s above the axis here. So that’s the basic idea. Now, I’m going to apply the method of slices to figure out the volume of such regions and give you a general formula. And then apply it in a specific case. I want to take one little slice of this football, maybe a football wouldn’t work too well, maybe we should go back to a loaf of bread.

无论如何，关键在于你永远不需要真正绘制 3D 图像。3D 图像很糟糕。它们很难处理。而且很难用它们进行可视化。我们处理旋转体的原因之一是我们没有那么多可视化问题。所以我们只处理这个。然后你必须从二维横截面想象三维图像是什么样子。

Anyway, the key point is that you never really have to draw a 3 D picture. And 3 D pictures are awful. They’re very hard to deal with. And it’s hard to visualize with them. And one of the reasons why we’re dealing with solids of revolution is that we don’t have as many visualization problems. So we’re only going to deal with this. And then you have to imagine from the two dimensional cross section what the three dimensional picture looks like.

因此，我们将对三维图像进行一些练习。但最终，您应该习惯于绘制二维图。为了描绘三维情况。因为绘制起来要困难得多。第一步是考虑这里的这个切片是什么。同样，它的宽度为 dx。我们将考虑它在三维图像上的样子。

So we’ll do a little bit of an exercise with the three dimensional picture. But ultimately, you should be used to, getting used to, drawing 2 D diagrams always. To depict the three dimensional situation. Since it’s much harder to draw. The first step is to consider what this slice is over here. And again it’s going to have width dx. And we’re going to consider what it looks like over on the 3 D picture.

所以它一开始大致是这样的。但接下来我们要把它扫一扫。我们绕着 x 轴旋转，所以它是这样旋转的。如果你把它想象成一个铰链，在 x 轴的下方，它就会向下摆动，然后飞回来。摆动。这样就画出了这里的某个东西。我要这样画。

So it starts out being more or less like this. But then we’re going to sweep it around. We’re revolving around the x axis, so it’s spinning around this way. And if you take this and think of it as being on a hinge, which is down on the x axis, it’s going to swing down and swoop around and come back. Swing around. And that traces out something over here. Which I’m going to draw this way.

它描绘出一个圆盘。所以对我来说画起来很难，我不会太努力。也许我把它画得更像一个轮子，看起来像一个轮子。但无论如何，它就是这个小平盘。所以我描述的计算体积的方法称为圆盘法。这将是我们的第一种方法。

It traces out a disk. So it’s hard for me to draw, and I’m not going to try too hard. Maybe I drew it more like a wheel, looking like a wheel. But anyway, it’s this little flat disk here. And so the method that I’m describing for figuring out the volume is called the method of disks. This is going to be our first method.

现在我要在这里应用我之前在黑板上提到的推理。也就是说，我需要得到这个块的体积。我要得到这个块的体积的方法是计算出它的厚度和面积，也就是它的横截面积。这并不难。如果这个高度，那么这个高度就是我们通常所说的 y。y 通常是 x 的函数，它是变化的。

Now I’m going to apply the reasoning that I have up on the previous blackboard here. Namely, I need to get the volume of this chunk. And the way I’m going to get the volume of this chunk is by figuring out its thickness and its area, its cross sectional area. And that’s not too difficult to do. If this height, so this height is what we usually call y. And y is usually a function of x, it’s varying.

这个特定的距离是 y。那么面的面积就很容易计算了。因为它是一个圆，或者说是一个圆盘，半径是这个。所以它的面积是 pi y^2。所以，如果你愿意的话，这就是其中一个维度。然后厚度是 dx。所以增量体积是这个。所以这是圆盘法。这是被积函数。现在，这个公式有一个特别之处。

And this particular distance is y. Then the area of the face is easy to calculate. Because it’s a circle, or a disk if you like, with this radius. So its area is pi y^2. So that’s, if you like, one of the dimensions. And then the thickness is dx. So the incremental volume is this. So this is the method of disks. And this is the integrand. Now, there’s one peculiar thing about this formula.

这个公式还有更多奇特之处。但有一点你应该马上注意到。那就是我对 x 求积分。我还没有告诉你 y 是什么。好吧，这取决于我使用的函数 y = f(x)。所以我们最终必须将其代入。如果我们真的要计算某个东西，我们就必须弄清楚。

And there are more peculiar things about this formula. But there’s one peculiar thing that you should notice immediately. Which is that I’m integrating with respect to x. And I haven’t yet told you what y is. Well, that will depend on what function y = f(x) I use. So we have to plug that in eventually. If we’re actually going to calculate something, we’re going to have to figure that out.

还有一点非常重要，那就是为了得到一个定积分，这是我之前没有提到的，我们必须弄清楚图片的起点和终点。这是我们上次在 2D 图片中处理过的问题。让我们来处理一个例子。我们将从橄榄球换成足球。我要取一个圆，我们假设它的半径为 a。

There’s another very important point which is that in order to get a definite integral, something I haven’t mentioned, we’re going to have to figure out where we’re starting and we’re ending the picture. Which is something we dealt with last time in 2 D pictures. So let’s deal with an example. And we’ll switch over from a football to a soccer ball. I’m going to take a circle, and we’ll say it has radius a.

所以这是 0，这是 a。我把它放在这个特定位置是有原因的。你可以用很多不同的方法做到这一点，但我选择这个方法是为了让你的家庭作业中的某项练习更容易。因为我现在正在为你做一半。感谢它，是的。我相信尤其是今天它很受欢迎。所以再说一次，这个公式与跟踪这里的这些片段有关。

So this is 0 and this is a. And I’m putting it in this particular spot for a reason. You can do this in lots of different ways, but I’m picking this one to make a certain exercise on your homework easier for you. Because I’m doing half of it for you right now. Appreciate it, yeah. I’m sure especially today it’s appreciated. So again, the formula has to do with keeping track of these slices here.

我们正在扫过物体。所以我们讨论的整个区域是半径为 a 的球的体积。这就是我们的目标，找出半径为 a 的球的体积。好吧，我再说一遍，物体扫过，从黑板出来，绕着 x 轴旋转。所以设置如下。它总是相同的。这是我们的公式。

And we’re sweeping things around. So the full region that we’re talking about is the volume of the ball of radius a. That’s what our goal is, to figure out what the volume of the ball of radius a is. Alright, again as I say, the thing sweeps around.coming out of the blackboard, spinning around on this x axis. So the setup is the following. It’s always the same. Here’s our formula.

我们需要弄清楚这个公式是怎么回事。所以我们需要解出 y 作为 x 的函数。为了做到这一点，我们要做的就是写下圆的方程。这是圆。它以 (a, 0) 为中心，所以这就是它的公式。

And we need to figure out what’s going on with that formula. And so we need to solve for y as a function of x. And in order to do that, what we’re going to do is just write down the equation for the circle. This is the circle. It’s centered at (a, 0), so that’s its formula.

现在有一件好事，那就是我们真的不需要它来找到 y 的公式，我们只需要找到 y 平方的公式。所以我们只需解 y^2 即可，而不必解二次方程或任何其他东西。取平方根，这很好。这是 a^2 (x^2 2ax + a^2)。a^2 取消。这两个项取消。

And now there’s one nice thing, which is that we really didn’t need it to find the formula for y, we only needed to find the formula for y squared. So let’s just solve for y^2 and we won’t have to solve a quadratic or anything. Take a square root, that’s nice. This is a^2 (x^2 2ax + a^2). The a^2’s cancel. These two terms cancel.

因此，这里的公式是 2ax x^2。好了，这就是所谓的被积函数。好吧，除了这里的 pi 这个因数。因此，体积的答案将是 pi 的积分乘以这个被积函数，(2ax x^2) dx。这与此完全一样。但现在还有极限的问题。这是一个完全独立的问题，我们也必须解决它。
