And so the formula here is 2ax x^2. Alright now, that is what’s known as the integrand. Well, except for this factor of pi here. And so the answer for the volume is going to be the integral of pi times this integrand, (2ax x^2) dx. And that’s just the same thing as this. But now there’s also the issue of the limits. Which is a completely separate problem, which we also have to solve.

x 的范围是从最左边的点到最右边的点。所以 x 会变化，从 0 开始，一直到这里的最大值。2a。现在我有一个完全指定的积分。同样，这是上次的主题，整个目标是让我们自己得到一个完整的公式，其中包含一个被积函数和极限。然后我们就可以计算了。

The range of x is, from this leftmost point to the rightmost point. So x varies, starts at 0, and it goes all the way up to what, what’s the top value here. 2a. And so now I have a completely specified integral. Again, and this was the theme last time, the whole goal is to get ourselves to a complete formula for something with an integrand and limits. And then we’ll be able to calculate.

现在，我们已经顺利解决了这个问题。所以让我们把它做完吧。我们的体积是，如果我取它的反导数，那就是 pi ax^2，它的导数是 2ax，减去 x^3 / 3。这就是它的导数是 x^2 的东西。在 0 和 2a 处求值。这等于 pi 乘以 2^2，让我们看看。2^2 = 4。所以这是 4a^3 8a^3 / 3，对吗？

Now, we have clear sailing to the end of the problem. So let’s just finish it off. We have the volume is, if I take the antiderivative of that, that’s pi ax^2, whose derivative is 2ax, minus x^3 / 3. That’s the thing whose derivative is x^2. Evaluated at 0 and 2a. And that is equal to pi times, let’s see. 2^2 = 4. So this is 4a^3 8a^3 / 3, right?

总而言之，就是，让我们看看，(12/3 8/3) pi a^3。这可能是一个熟悉的公式，4/3 pi a^3。所以它起作用了，我们做对了。让我指出这个公式的其他几点。第一点是从这个角度来看，我们实际上完成的不仅仅是找到球的体积。

And so all told, that is, let’s see, (12/3 8/3) pi a^3. Which is maybe a familiar formula, 4/3 pi a^3. So it worked, we got it right. Let me just point out a couple of other things about this formula. The first one is that from this point of view, we’ve actually accomplished more then just finding the volume of the ball.

我们还找到了一堆中间区域的体积，我可以用这种方式画出它们的示意图。如果我把这个东西切开，这部分是这里的 x，那么这里的不定积分，这里的这个区域，也许我会用这里的这个区域来填充，我将其称为 V(x)，就是球体部分的体积。球体宽度为 x 的部分的体积。

We’ve also found the volume of a bunch of intermediate regions, which I can draw schematically this way. If I chop this thing, and this portion is x here, then the antiderivative here, this region here, which maybe I’ll fill in with this region here, which I’m going to call V(x), is the volume of the portion of the sphere. Volume of portion of width x of the ball.

嗯，它的公式是体积等于 pi (ax ^2 x^3 / 3)。就是这样。所以我们得到了一些实际上包含更多信息的东西。例如，如果你代入 x = a，这并不奇怪，这是一个好主意，因为它可以检查我们是否真的得到了正确的公式。所以如果你愿意，你可以称之为双重检查。

And, well, the formula for it is that it’s the volume equals pi (ax ^2 x^3 / 3). That’s it. So we’ve got something which is actually a lot more information. For instance, if you plug in x = a, not surprisingly, and this is a good idea to do because it checks that we’ve actually got a correct formula here. So if you like you can call this a double check.

如果你检查 V(a)，这应该是半个球的体积。也就是一半。如果我走到这里，只走到 a，那正好是球的一半。最好是一半，让我们看看。在这种情况下，V(a) 是 pi，然后我得到 (a^3 a^3 / 3)。结果是 pi 乘以总计 2/3 a^3，这确实是一半。

If you check V(a), this should be the volume of a half ball. That’s halfway. If I go over here and I only go up to a, that’s exactly half of the ball. That had better be half, so let’s just see. V(a) in this case is pi, and then I have (a^3 a^3 / 3). And that turns out to be pi times a total of 2/3 a^3, which is indeed half.

现在，在你的问题集上，你要看的是这个完整的公式。这部分。它适用于解决现实生活中的问题。这是一个今年夏天和秋天在附近几所大学出现的问题，当时人们试图弄清楚一个众所周知的现象。

Now, on your problem set, what you’re going to want to look at is this full formula here. Of this chunk. And what it’s going to be good for is a real life problem. That is, a problem that really came up over the summer, and this fall, at a couple of universities near here, where people were trying to figure out a phenomenon which is well known.

也就是说，如果流体中有一堆粒子，这些粒子的尺寸可能为 1 微米。也就是说，半径为 1 微米。然后还有一堆其他小粒子，它们要小得多。可能是 10 纳米。然后会发生这样的情况：这些粒子，大粒子，喜欢互相拥抱。它们喜欢聚集在一起，它们非常友好。性格友好。那么，这该如何解释呢？

Namely, if you have a bunch of particles in a fluid, and maybe the size of these things is 1 micron. That is, the radius is 1 micron. And then you have a bunch of other little particles, which are a lot smaller. Maybe 10 nanometers. Then what happens is that the particles, the big particles, like to hug each other. They like to clump together, they’re very nice. Friendly characters. So what’s the explanation for this?

解释是，它们实际上并不像看上去那么友好。实际上，小家伙们会推搡它们。并将它们推到一起。小家伙们的肘部很尖，它们会推搡它们。不喜欢它们在身边，所以会将它们推到一起。但实际上还有另一种可能性。那就是它们也会粘在容器的侧面。

The explanation is that actually they are not quite as friendly as they might seem. What’s really happening is that the little guys are shoving them around. And pushing them together. And they have sharp elbows, the little ones and they’re pushing them. Don’t like them to be around and they’re pushing them together. But there’s actually another possibility. Which is that they also will stick to the sides of the container.

所以这里实际上发生了两件事。如果你想定量地了解这种情况发生的程度，那就与这些东西占用了多少空间有关。所以问题是围绕一个球体的带与围绕另一个球体的带之间存在某种重叠。这个重叠区域就是你必须计算的。你必须计算出这里的情况。

So there are two things that actually happen here. And if you want to get a quantitative handle on how much of this happens, it has to do with how much space these things take up. And so the issue is some kind of overlap between a band around one sphere and a band around the other sphere. And this overlap region is what you have to calculate. You have to calculate what’s in here.

你可以用这个公式来做。这并不难。所以，如果你把它切成两半，就会得到两个这样的家伙。然后你就可以解决这个问题了。问题是，它们更喜欢哪一个。它们是喜欢互相接触，还是喜欢接触墙壁。它们都聚集在墙上吗？

And you can do that using this formula here. It’s not even difficult. So this is, if you cut it in half, turns out to be two of these guys. And then you’re on your way to figuring out this problem. And the question is, which do they prefer. Do they prefer to touch each other, or do they prefer to touch the wall. Do they all cluster to the wall.

所以你实际上可以在解决方案中看到它们的作用。问题是，它们在多大程度上更喜欢一种配置而不是另一种配置。所以这是一个真实的、活生生的问题，它确实出现了。今年才出现。而且经常出现。这是我们第一次计算解决的。所以现在我把这个称为方法 1。对于旋转体，这被称为圆盘方法。

So you can actually see this in solutions, what they do. And the question is, to what extent do they prefer one configuration to the other. So that’s a real, live problem, which really comes up. Came up just this year. And frequently comes up. Which is solved by our first calculation. So now I have, I called this Method 1. For solids of revolution, which is called the method of disks.

现在我需要告诉您另一种标准方法。即所谓的壳法。这是我们的第二种方法。我将用一个假日主题的示例来说明这种方法。这应该是女巫的大锅。哎呀，女巫，女巫，好吧。也许不止一个女巫有这个大锅。所以这是这个形状。我们要算出这里面有多少液体。我要画出它。

And now I need to tell you about the other standard method. Which is called the method of shells. So this is our second method. I’m going to illustrate this one with a holiday themed example here. This is supposed to be a witches’ cauldron. Whoops, witch, witches, well. Maybe more than one witch will have this cauldron here. So here’s this shape. And we’re going to figure out how much liquid is in here. I’m going to plot this.

也许我应该把它放低一点。我要把它做成抛物线。这是 y = x^2。我要把顶部高度设为 y = a。这就是我的情况。我想算出这里有多少液体。现在，我以这种形式提出这个问题的原因当然是为了让你们习惯这些东西。

Maybe I’ll put this down just a bit lower here. And I’m going to make it a parabola. This is y = x^2. And I’m going to make the top height be y = a. So here’s my situation. And I want to figure out how much liquid is in here. Now, the reason why I presented the problem in this form, of course, is really to get you used to these things.

我想让你们熟悉的第一件新事物是，现在我们不仅可以绕 x 轴旋转，还可以绕 y 轴旋转。所以这个要绕 y 轴旋转。这就是结果。如果你旋转抛物线，就会得到这种形状，这种立体形状。现在，我将使用与之前相同的切片方法。

And the first new thing that I want you to get used to is the idea that now we can also revolve around the y axis, not just the x axis. So this one is going to be revolved around the y axis. And that’s what happens. If you spin the parabola around, you get this kind of shape, this kind of solid shape here. Now, I’m going to use the same kind of slicing that I did before.

但它看起来完全不同。也就是说，我会再次用红色画它。我要在这里切一小块。现在我想想象一下如果它绕 y 轴旋转会发生什么。这次它不是圆盘。实际上，如果我以另一种方式旋转它，它上面就会有一个洞。这也是可能的。这实际上与圆盘的方法相同。

But it’s going to look totally different. Namely, I’ll draw it in red again. I’m going to take a little slice over here. And now I want to imagine what happens if it gets revolved around the y axis. This time it’s not a disk. Actually, if I revolve this around the other way, it would have had a hole in it. Which is also possible to do. That’s practically the same as the method of disks.

你们也许会在复习中讨论这个问题。无论如何，我们将以这种方式来旋转它。所以，我需要再次扫过它，像这样摆动它。然后我会画出形状。它将以圆圈的形式扫过，也许它会有一点厚度。这就是人们所说的壳。这就是所谓的方法壳。

You’ll maybe discuss that in recitation. Anyway, we’re going to revolve it around this way. So again, I need to sweep it around, swing it around like this. And I’ll draw the shape. It’s going to sweep around in a circle and maybe it’ll have a little bit of thickness to it. And this is the thing that people call a shell. This is the so called shell of the method.

我可能称它为圆柱体，另一种思考方式是，你可以把它包起来，就像这样。这就是你看到的圆柱体。非常薄，对吧？非常薄。现在，我之所以用这张纸作为例子，是因为我必须计算出这个东西的体积。它的厚度，像往常一样，等于 dx。

I would maybe call it a cylinder, and another way of thinking about it is that you can maybe wrap up a piece of paper. Like this. There it is, there’s a cylinder you can see. Very thin, right? Very thin. Now, the reason why I used the piece of paper as an example of this is that I’m going to have to figure out the volume of this thing. Its thickness, as usual, is equal to dx.

它的高度是多少？实际上我必须使用图表才能看到。顶部的值是 a，底部的值是我们所说的 y。所以高度等于，对不起，a y。现在，这又是一个非常危险的事情。我在讲座的第一天就指出了这一点。字母 y 代表很多不同的东西。

Its height is what? Well, actually I have to use the diagram to see that. The top value is a, and the bottom value is what we call y. So the height is equal to, I’m sorry, a y. Now, again this is an incredibly risky thing here. And I’ve done this before I pointed this out on the very first day of lecture. The letter y represents a lot of different things.

而当我称它为 y 时，我指的是 y = x^2。换句话说，就是那条有趣的曲线。我指的不是 y = a，而是另一部分。一般来说，你可能会认为它等于 y_(top) y_(bottom)。所以，当然，这涉及到两个 y。是伪装的。但我们有一个简写，以及我们称之为的那种无趣的 y。

And in disguise, when I call this y, I mean y = x^2. In other words, the interesting curve. I don’t mean y = a, which is the other part. In general, you might think of it as being equal to y_(top) y_(bottom). So there are, of course, two y’s involved. In disguise. But we have a shorthand, and the sort of uninteresting one we call by its.

我们直接求值，将有趣的部分作为符号 y 保留。现在，为了解决这个问题，我要做的最后一件事就是计算周长。这样做的原因是，如果我把这个东西想象成这个管子或这张纸，为了计算出这里有多少东西，我所要做的就是展开它。

We just evaluate immediately, and the interesting one we leave as the symbol y. Now, the last bit that I have to do, I claim, in order to figure this out, is the circumference. And the reason for that is that if I think of this thing as like this tube, or piece of paper here, in order to figure out how much stuff there is here, all I have to do is unfold it.

它的尺寸，这里的纸张总量，无论是像这样卷起来还是展开，都是相同的。如果我把它打开，它看起来像什么？嗯，它看起来像一块板？对，它看起来就像一块这样的板。同样，厚度是 dx。高度是 y。现在我们可以看到这里的长度是整个周长。它是周长。

Its size, the whole quantity of paper here is the same whether it’s rolled up like this or whether it’s stretched out. So if I unwrap it, it looks like what? Well, it looks like kind of a slab? Right, it looks like just a slab like this. And again, the thickness is dx. The height is a y. And now we can see that the length here is all the way around. It’s the circumference.

所以这就是我展开它时的周长。为了计算出周长，我需要计算出半径。所以半径在这个图上就在那里。这是半径。距离是 x。所以这里的长度是 x。所以这个周长是 2 pi x。这个高度仍然是 ay。对不起。厚度仍然是 dx。

So this is going to be the circumference when I unwrap it. And in order to figure out the circumference, I need to figure out the radius. So the radius is, on this diagram, is right over there. This is the radius. And that distance is x. So this length here is x. And so this circumference is 2 pi x. And this height is still ay. a y, sorry. And the thickness is still dx.

所以总的来说，我们只需将这些数字相乘即可得到总体积。换句话说，dV 等于 (2 pi x) 维度、(8 y) 维度和 dx 维度的乘积。顺便说一句，维度分析在这些问题中非常有用和重要。你可以看到有三个长度相乘。所以我们最终会得到一个体积。立方体。

So in total, we’re just going to multiply these numbers together to get the total volume. We have, in other words, dV is equal to the product of the (2 pi x) dimension, the (8 y) dimension, and the dx dimension. Incidentally, dimensional analysis is very useful and important in these problems. You can see that there are three lengths being multiplied together. So we’ll get a volume in end. Something cubic.

我们以后还会再讨论这个问题，因为有时这是一个相当微妙的问题。所以这是公式，让我们稍微简化一下。我们有 2 pi x 乘以 2，记住，首先我必须代入，否则我将永远无法积分。然后我将其重写为 2 pi (ax x^2，哎呀，x^3) dx。最好不要弄错。

And we will be coming back to that, because it’s a quite subtle issue sometimes. So here’s the formula, and let’s simplify it a little bit. We have 2 pi x times, remember, first I have to substitute, otherwise I’m never going to be able to integrate. And then I rewrite that as 2 pi (ax x^2, whoops, x^3) dx. Better not get that wrong.

现在，最后一点，为了弄清楚总体积，我最好小心，那就是极限。所以体积将是这个量 2 pi (ax x^3) dx 的积分。现在我必须注意极限是什么。现在，你必须小心。x 可能是。你必须始终回到 2 D 图。

And now the last little bit here, that I had better be careful about in order to figure out what the total volume is, is the limits. So the volume is going to be the integral of this quantity 2 pi (ax x^3) dx. And now I have to pay attention to what the limits are. Now, here you have to be careful. x is possibly the. You have to always go back to the 2 D diagram.

我立即就去算了，但关键就在于此。一切都从此图上读出。当你拿着这个家伙四处扫视时，你会处理好左边的一切。所以我们只需要计算右边的数。我们不必计算这里的任何东西。因为当我们四处扫视时，它就被处理好了。

I went to it immediately, but that’s the whole point. Is that everything gets read off from this diagram here. When you take this guy and you sweep it around, you take care of everything that’s to the left. So we only have to count what’s to the right. We don’t have to count anything over here. Because it’s taken care of when we sweep around.

所以起始点是 x = 0。这就是我们的起点。而终点是 x 的最远、最右边的点。就在这里。你必须注意它在哪里。在 y 变量中，它位于 y = a。但在 x 变量中，我们可以看到它是什么？它是 a 的平方根。

So the starting place is going to be x = 0. That’s where we start. And where we end is the farthest, rightmost spot for x. Which is down here. You’ve got to watch out about where that is. In the y variable, it’s up at y = a. But in the x variable, we can see that it’s what? It’s the square root of a.

因此，这些极限就是你要把所有注意力集中在被积函数上并使其正确的地方。然后你就会失去动力，不去注意极限。它们同样重要。如果极限不正确，你就不可能得到正确的答案。所以这是从 0 到 a 的平方根的积分。

So these limits, this is where you’re going to focus all your attention on the integrand and getting it just right. And then you’re going to lose your steam and not pay attention to the limits. They’re equally important. You’ve no hope of getting the right answer without getting the limits right. So this is the integral from 0 to square root of a.

再次强调，这只是因为 y = a 且 y = x^2 意味着 x = 平方根 a。这就是上限。现在，我们准备执行此操作，计算此积分。因此我们得到 2。抱歉，我们得到 2 pi ax，即 pi ax^2。也许我会保留 2。2 pi ax^2 是此 ax^2 / 2 的反导数，然后是这里的 x^4 / 4，在 0 和 a 的平方根处求值。

Again, that’s just because y = a and y = x^2 implies x = square root a. That’s that upper limit there. And now, we’re ready to carry out this, to evaluate this integral. So we get 2. sorry, we get 2 pi ax, that’s pi ax^2. Maybe I’ll leave the 2’s in there. 2 pi ax^2 is the antiderivative of this ax^2 / 2, and then here x^4 / 4, evaluated at 0 and square root of a.

最后，让我们看看，那是多少。那是 2 pi (a^2 / 2 a^2 / 4)。总共是 1/4，对吧，2 pi a^2 / 4。也就是 pi/2 a^2。是的，问题。学生：教授：对。所以问题是，为什么我只从中间积分到这一端，而不是从这里一直积分到负 a 的平方根，一直到正端。

And finally, let’s see, what is that. That’s 2 pi (a^2 / 2 a^2 / 4). Which is a total of 1/4, right, 2 pi a^2 / 4. Which is pi/2 a^2. Yes, question. STUDENT: PROFESSOR: Right. So the question is, why did I integrate only from the middle to this end, instead of all the way from over here, minus square root of a, all the way to the plus end.

原因是你必须观察旋转时发生了什么。当我扫过这个红色物体时，我计算了它左右两侧的面积。换句话说，如果我只旋转它的右半部分，就会覆盖左半部分。因此，如果我从负平方根开始计算面积，我会重复两次。我会将所需的面积翻倍。

And the reason is that you have to look at what’s happening with the rotation. This red guy, when I swept it around, I counted the stuff to the right and the left. So in other words, if I just rotate the right half of this, I’m covering the left half. So if I counted the stuff from minus square root of a, I would be doing it twice. I would be doubling what I need.

所以太多了。另一种说法是，如果我想取整个区域，如果我只旋转 180 度，只有 pi，如果我把两半都取下来，那就会填满整个区域。然后，我可以使用 pi x 而不是圆周，而不是 2 pi x。但这样我就会得到两倍的面积。所以有两种看待它的方式。

So it’s too much. Another way of saying it is if I wanted to take the whole region, if I rotate it around only 180 degrees, only pi, that would fill up the whole region, if I did both halves. And then instead of a circumference, instead of a 2 pi x, I could use a pi x. But then I would have double what I had. So there are two ways of looking at it.

实际上，对于足球的情况也是如此。当我拿着足球时，我没有计算底部。因为当我绕 x 轴旋转它时，顶部就足够了，我可以忽略下半部分。是的，另一个问题。学生：教授：哦，好问题。问题是，你什么时候知道，你怎么知道什么时候将矩形设为垂直或水平。到目前为止，我们只做了垂直矩形。

The same goes, actually, for the football case. When I have that football, I didn’t count the bottom part. Because when I swung it around the x axis, the top part sufficed and I could ignore the bottom half. Yeah, another question. STUDENT: PROFESSOR: Ooh, good question. The question is, when do you know, how do you know when to take the rectangle to be vertical or horizontal. So far we’ve only done vertical rectangles.

我马上要举一个水平的例子。关于何时做这个问题的答案是这样的。你总是可以同时设置两种方式。一种方式可能很难计算，另一种方式可能更容易计算。昨天，我们做了，或者，抱歉，是最后一次。是的，我想是昨天。我们做了。水平和垂直的特性完全不同。

And I’m going to do a horizontal example in a second. And the answer to the question of when you do it is this. You can always set it up both ways. One way may be a difficult calculation and one way may be an easier calculation. Yesterday, we did it or, sorry, the last time. Yeah, I guess it was yesterday. We did it with. and the horizontal and the vertical were quite different in character.

其中一个问题非常复杂，而另一个问题稍微简单一些。所以通常一个问题会比另一个问题简单。偶尔，其中一个问题是不可能的，而另一个问题却是可能的。换句话说，难度的差异可能非常大。所以你事先并不知道这一点。是的，另一个问题。学生：教授：问题是，当你旋转这个绿色区域时，我们是否找到了体积。

One of them was really a mess, and one of them was a little easier. So very often, one will be easier than the other. Every once in a while, one of them is impossible and the other one is possible. In other words, the difference in difficulty can be extreme. So you don’t know that in advance. Yeah, another question. STUDENT: PROFESSOR:. The question is, did we just find the volume when you rotate this green region around.

或者，我们旋转整个区域时是否找到了体积。换句话说，只旋转右半部分或右半部分和左半部分。答案是两者兼而有之。你得到的区域是相同的。无论你旋转时取右半部分还是取两者并旋转，你总是会得到这个大锅。所以这两个问题的答案都是一样的，就是这个。是的。

Or, did we find the volume when we rotate this whole region. In other words, just the right half or the right and the left half. The answer is both. The region that you get is the same. You always get this cauldron, whether you take this right half when you rotate it around or you take both and you rotate it around. So the answer to both of those questions is the same and it’s this. Yes.

学生：教授：所以如果你把它们都旋转一圈，而你只想覆盖一次，那么你只需要旋转一半。只能旋转 180 度。这是真的。但你可以旋转任意多次。你仍然覆盖着同一个东西。一遍又一遍。让我们继续。

STUDENT: PROFESSOR: So that if you rotated them both around and you only wanted to cover things once, you would rotate halfway around. Only by 180 degrees. That’s true. But you can rotate around as many times as you want. You’re still covering the same thing. Over and over and over and over again. So let’s go on.

我有一个非常微妙的观点需要与你讨论，以便继续下一个应用。所以这是我的，我也想谈谈水平横截面。让我们继续。所以现在我要向你指出的第一件事是，我希望你注意单位。这个问题有点可疑。

I have a very subtle point that I need to discuss with you in order to go on to the next application. So here’s my, and I do want to get to the point of horizontal cross sections as well. So let’s continue here. So the first thing that I want to point out to you now is, I want you to beware of units. There’s something a little fishy in this problem.

答案的特征可以概括为：答案有点不太清楚。也就是说，它看起来像是 a^2，对吧？我们知道 a 是单位数，我们应该得到立方单位。所以这个问题有点棘手。所以我现在想说明一下这个悖论。假设 a = 100 厘米。假设单位是厘米。

And it can be summarized in the character of the answer, which is just a little bit not clear. Namely, it looks like it’s a^2, right? And we know that a is in units and we should’ve gotten cubic units. So there’s something a little bit tricky about this question. And so I want to illustrate the paradox right now. So, suppose that a = 100 centimeters. And suppose the units are centimeters.

那么体积的公式是 pi/2 100^2。我们必须采用的单位是立方厘米。尽管你有点想把厘米平方。但这不是这个问题所说的。好的，这就是我们遇到的情况。

Then the formula for the volume is pi/2 100^2. and the units we must take are centimeters cubed. Despite the fact that you kind of want to square the centimeters. But that’s not what this problem says. OK, so this is the situation that we’ve got.

现在，如果你算出这个数字，算出这个大锅的体积，你会发现它是 pi / 2 乘以 10^4，也就是 10 * 1,000 立方厘米。这些单位也被称为升。所以这大约是 10 pi / 2 升，也就是大约 16 升。这就是在这个单位选择下大锅里的容量。

Now, if you work out what this is, to figure out what the volume of this cauldron is, what you find is that it’s pi / 2 times, well, 10^4 is 10 * 1,000 centimeters cubed. And those are otherwise known as liters. So this is approximately 10 pi / 2 liters, which is about 16 liters. And so that’s how much was in the cauldron under this choice of units.

现在，我要再次选择单位。我们将进行比较。假设单位是 1 米。看起来应该相同，但如果我计算体积，它将是 pi / 2，即 1^2 乘以米的立方。这就是公式告诉我们要做的。

Now, I’m going to make another choice of units now. And we’re going to make a comparison. Suppose that the units are 1 meter. Looks like it should be the same, but if I calculate the volume, it’s going to be pi / 2, and 1^2 times meters cubed. That’s what the formula tells us to do.

如果你算出来，那就是 pi / 2 (100 cm)^3。使用这个单位符号，我们确实需要对厘米进行立方，对 100 进行立方。所以我们得到 pi / 2。这里我们得到 10 ^ 6 cm^3。结果是 pi / 2 * 1000 升。或者换句话说，大约 1600 升。所以我想请你首先思考一下这个问题。这是一个悖论。

And if you calculate that out, that’s pi / 2 (100 cm)^3. And with this unit notation we really do want to cube the centimeters and cube the 100. So we get pi / 2. And here we get 10 ^ 6 cm^3. And that comes out to pi / 2 * 1000 liters. Or, in other words, about 1600 liters. So I’d like to ask you first to contemplate this. And this is a paradox.

这是一个严重的悖论。如果你真的想应用问题，你实际上必须理解你的答案意味着什么。那么你认为这到底是怎么回事？是的。学生：教授：是的。学生：教授：对。所以问题是，这两种情况怎么可能有意义。在这两种情况下我该如何处理单位。所以现在我要向你们解释答案。因为这确实很令人费解。

And this is a serious paradox. If you really want to apply problems, you actually have to understand what your answers mean. So what do you think is going on here? Yeah. STUDENT: PROFESSOR: Yes. STUDENT: PROFESSOR: Right. So the question is, how could either of these make sense. How am I dealing with the units in either case. So now I’m going to explain to you the answer. Because this is really quite puzzling.

但它有一个解决方案。这个问题的答案是两个答案都是正确的。在两种情况下，这都是正确的推理。问题是你必须用两种不同的方式来解释方程 y = x^2。两种方式。让我解释一下它们是什么。例如，你可以以厘米为单位取 y = x^2。所以 y = x ^2 以厘米为单位。在这种情况下，图片如下所示。

But it has a resolution. The answer to this question is that both answers are correct. This is correct reasoning in both cases. What’s the matter is that you have to interpret the equation y = x^2 in two different ways. Two ways. So let me explain what they are. For instance, you can take y = x^2 in centimeters. So y = x ^2 in centimeters. In which case, the picture looks like the following.

A = 100 厘米。这里的距离，也就是 x 值，是 10。这是 10 厘米。这就是关系的含义。所以，如果你愿意的话，大锅的顶部，这里的距离是 20 厘米。这实际上是按比例画的，画得很糟糕。这个东西实际上非常非常深。它非常细长。所以这幅图完全不是按比例画的。

A = 100 centimeters. And this distance here, which is the x value, this is 10. This is 10 centimeters. And that’s what the relationship means. So the top of the cauldron, if you like, this distance here is 20 centimeters. This is actually very badly drawn to scale. It’s actually very, very, deep, this thing. It’s a rather skinny, deep one. So this is very much not to scale, this picture.

另一张图片，另一张图片以米为单位解释 y = x^2。实际上，这更像我所想的。我想到的是这里的大桶。这里的距离是 1 米，然后 1 的平方根是 1。所以这里的距离也是 1 米。顶部是 2 米。现在，它没那么疯狂。

The other picture, the other picture is interpreting y = x^2 in meters. And that’s more like what I had in mind, actually. I had in mind this big vat here. And this distance here is 1 meter, and then the square root of 1 is 1. So this distance here is also 1 meter. And the top is 2 meters. Now, it’s not that crazy.

事实上，很容易检查，从规模上看，这是相当合理的。这个东西里面有 16 升。而这个东西里面有 1600 升。所以当你处理这些应用问题时，你实际上必须知道你的符号是什么意思。如果你真的要做一些实际的后果，你必须知道单位是什么意思。

And in fact it’s easy to check that, it’s pretty reasonable in terms of scale. That this thing has 16 liters in it. And this guy has 1600 liters in it. So you actually have to know what your symbols mean when you’re dealing with these kinds of applied problems. And if you’re ever really going to do some real consequences, you have to know what the units mean.

方程 y = x^2 的问题在于它违反了缩放规则。是的。学生：教授：是的。学生：教授：不是。学生：教授：好的，所以问题是公式 V = pi / 2 a^2 是否正确。这是问题的正确答案。但它的单位不一致。

And the problem with the equation y = x^2 is that it’s the one that violated scaling rules. Yeah. STUDENT: PROFESSOR: Yeah. STUDENT: PROFESSOR: No. STUDENT: PROFESSOR: OK, so the question is whether the formula V = pi / 2 a^2. This is the correct answer to the problem. But it is not consistent in units.

如果你代入一个等于某个厘米数、某个毫米数、某个英寸数等等的数，每次你都会得到不同的答案。而且它们都是不一致的。换句话说，这个公式违反了缩放比例。学生：教授：如果你正确地研究了每一步，你会发现这些是一致且正确的陈述，我在黑板上写的就是这些。这在一个单位中是有意义的，没有意义。

If you plug in a equals some number of centimeters, some number of millimeters, some number of inches and so on, every single time you’ll get a different answer. And they’re all inconsistent. In other words, this formula violates scaling. STUDENT: PROFESSOR: If you study each step correctly, you will discover that these are the consistent and correct statements, what I’m writing on the blackboard. And this makes sense in a unit less sense.

但是如果你真的把单位放在它们上面，其中一个，它们都是正确的。其中一个描述了这种情况，另一个描述了这种情况。把它想象成 1 米然后求米的立方是错误的。这将是一个会给你带来麻烦的错误。这个 1 只是少了一个单位，然后米的立方被转换了。所以我鼓励你自己研究一下。

But then if you actually stick units on them, one of them, they both are correct. And one of them describes this situation and one of them describes this situation. And it’s a mistake to think of this as being 1 meter and cubing the meters. That will be an error that will cause you problems. This 1 is just unit less, and then the meters cubed got converted. So I encourage you to study this on your own.

现在我要介绍下一个问题。下次我们得解决这个问题。但我之所以把所有时间都花在单位上，是因为否则当我进行下一个计算时，你不可能相信我。因为我们试图从一个真正的问题中得到一个真正的答案。我将在厘米和米之间进行来回转换。

So now I’m going to introduce the next problem. We’ll have to solve it next time. But the reason why I spent all the time on units is that otherwise it would be impossible for you to believe me when I do this next calculation. Because we’re trying to get a real answer out of a real question. And I’m going to make conversions between centimeters and meters back and forth.

我们必须保持一致才能得到正确的答案。所以有理由说明这个陷阱。所以这第二件我想做的事情是把女巫大锅里的水煮沸。这绝对适合这个季节，因为我们快要到万圣节了。下次我们会彻底解决这个问题。现在，我要向问题中引入另一个特征。

And we have to get it consistent in order to have the right answer. So there was a reason for illustrating this pitfall. So this second, the next thing that I’d like to do, is I’d like to boil the water in the witches’ cauldron. This is definitely seasonally appropriate, since we’re approaching Halloween. And we’ll work it out fully next time. Now, I’m going to introduce another feature into the problem.

这是我现在想让你理解的。我们明天会把一切都安排好，但现在我需要你理解我们将得到的新的主要思想。我要给这个问题添加一个新的物理特征，那就是当你在煮水时，当女巫们在煮水时，水壶里每一层水的温度都是不一样的。

And this is the one that I want you to understand now. We’ll set it all up tomorrow, but right now I need you to understand what the new main idea that we’re going to get. There is the new physical feature that I’m going to add to this problem is that if when you’re boiling, when the witches are boiling this water, the temperature of the water is not the same at each level in the kettle.

壶底，也就是加热的地方，温度最高。所以壶底的温度会是 100 度。也就是说，壶会完全沸腾。100 摄氏度。壶顶的温度会是 70 度。没错，外面很冷。事实上，外面是 0 度。我想，这是所有巫师工作的温度。不管怎样，她们在煮东西。

At the bottom of the kettle, where you’re heating it up, it’s at its highest temperature. So at the bottom it’s going to be, say, 100 degrees. That is, it’s going to be totally boiling. 100 degrees Celsius. And at the top, it’s going to be, say, 70 degrees. Right, it’s very cold outside. In fact, it’s 0 degrees outside. Which is the temperature at which all witches operate, I think. Anyway, so they’re boiling their stuff.

我们要问的问题是，它们需要多少热量才能做到这一点。现在，物体从 0 摄氏度开始。我们要把它加热到这里的这个温度配置。但它从这里的 100 度上升到这里 70 度。所以温度在高度上是变化的。

And the question that we’re going to ask is how much heat, how much heat, do they need to do it. Now, the thing starts out at 0 degrees Celsius. And we’re going to heat it up to this temperature configuration here. But it’s rising from 100 down here to 70 up here. So the temperature is varying in height.

为了简单起见，我将温度公式设为顶部 70，底部 100。所以它将是 100 30y。我们在这里将级别设为 1。抱歉，是 30。我说的是 3。我写的是 3，但我的意思是 30。所以这就是我们的情况。

And for simplicity I’m going to make the formula for the temperature be 70 at the top and 100 at the bottom. So it’s going to be 100 30y. We’ll let the level be 1, here. Sorry, 30. I said 3. I wrote 3, but I meant 30. So this is the situation that we have.

现在，这个问题的重点是我们要计算出总温度，也就是加热这个物体需要添加的总热量。也就是温度乘以体积。但有些地方比其他地方更重要。这些地方会更热，但这里的水较少。这里比较宽，所以这里的水更多。所以这个问题中有很多不同的东西。

Now, the point about this problem is we’re going to figure out the total temperature, the total amount of heat that you need to add in order to heat this thing up. That’s going to be temperature times volume. But some places will count more than others. These will be hotter, but there’s less water down here. This is wider up here, so there’s more water up here. So there are various things that are varying in this problem.

现在，让它工作的唯一方法是水平切割而不是垂直切割。因为水平面上的温度是恒定的。所以我们可以很容易地计算出加热一层（水平层）需要多少热量。当我们绕 y 轴旋转这个物体时，它就是哪种形状。它是一个圆盘。所以实际上这个问题会比较简单。

Now, the only way to set up so that it works is to chop things up horizontally instead of vertically. Because it’s on the horizontal levels that the temperature is constant. So we’ll have an easy calculation for how much it takes to heat up a layer, a horizontal layer. When we rotate this guy around the y axis, that is which kind of shape. It’s a disk. So actually this one’s going to be an easier problem.

这将是一个磁盘问题，而不是外壳问题。但我们必须根据 dy 变化来解决问题。换句话说，积分将与 dy 有关。所以我们下次再做。我们将计算出烧开水壶需要多少热量。

It’s going to be a disk problem, not a shell problem. But we’re going to have to work things out with respect to the dy variation. In other words, the integral will be with respect to dy. So we will do that next time. We’ll figure out how much heat it takes to boil the kettle.

Lec 23 | MIT 18.01 单变量微积分，2007 年秋季

Lec 23 | MIT 18.01 Single Variable Calculus, Fall 2007

16 年前 (2009 年 8 月 19 日) — 48:36 https://youtube.com/watch?v=R9a_NHXrBcg

16 years ago (Aug 19, 2009) — 48:36 https://youtube.com/watch?v=R9a_NHXrBcg

简介

Intro

以下内容根据 Creative Commons 许可提供。您的支持将帮助 MIT OpenCourseWare 继续免费提供高质量的教育资源。要捐款或查看数百门 MIT 课程的其他材料，请访问 MIT OpenCourseWare，网址为 ocw.mit.edu。

The following content is provided under a Creative Commons license. Your support will help MIT OpenCourseWare continue to offer high quality educational resources for free. To make a donation, or to view additional materials from hundreds of MIT courses, visit MIT OpenCourseWare at ocw.mit.edu.

平均值

Average Value

教授：今天我们先不讨论烧开水，而是讨论积分的另一种应用，然后我们再讨论中间的女巫大锅。

PROFESSOR: Today we’re going to hold off just a little bit on boiling water. And talk about another application of integrals, and we’ll get to the witches’ cauldron in the middle.

今天我想从平均值开始。这是我之前提到过的内容，黑板上有一个印刷错误，所以我想确保我们的定义是正确的。推理也是正确的。这是积分最重要的应用之一，也是最重要的例子之一。如果你取一组数字的平均值，它看起来就像这样。

The that I’d like to start with today is average value. This is something that I mentioned a little bit earlier, and there was a misprint on the board, so I want to make sure that we have the definitions straight. And also the reasoning straight. This is one of the most important applications of integrals, one of the most important examples. If you take the average of a bunch of numbers, that looks like this.

我们可以将其视为对函数进行采样。就像我们对黎曼和所做的那样。我上周说过，这趋向于这里的表达式，称为连续平均值。所以这个是连续平均值。或者只是 f 的平均值。我想解释一下，只是为了确保我们都在同一页上。

And we can view this as sampling a function. As we would with Riemann’s sum. And what I said last week was that this tends to this expression here, which is called the continuous average. So this guy is the continuous average. Or just the average of f. And I want to explain that, just to make sure that we’re all on the same page.

一般来说，如果你有一个函数，并且想要解释它的积分，我们的第一个解释是它类似于曲线下的面积。但平均值是另一种合理的解释。

In general, if you have a function and you want to interpret the integral, our first interpretation was that it’s something like the area under the curve. But average value is another reasonable interpretation.

也就是说，如果你取等间距的点，从 x0、x1、x2 开始，一直到 xn，也就是左边的点 b，然后我们有值 y1，它 = f (x1)，y2，它 = f (x2)，一直到 yn，它 = f (xn)。同样，我们这里讨论的间距是 ba / n。所以记住这个间距，这就是我们要画的连接。

Namely, if you take equally spaced points here, starting with x0, x1, x2, all the way up to xn, which is the left point b, and then we have values y1, which = f ( x1), y2, which = f ( x2), all the way up to yn, which = f ( xn). And again, the spacing here that we’re talking about is b a / n. So remember that spacing, that’s going to be the connection that we’ll draw.

那么黎曼和就是 y1 到 yn，即 (y1 yn) delta x 的和。这就是当 delta x 趋向于 0 时趋向于积分的原因。如果我想写出这个极限属性，也就是这里的正上方，那么唯一的视角变化就是我想除以间隔的长度。b a。所以我将在这里除以 b a。

Then the Riemann sum is y1 through yn, the sum of (y1 yn) delta x. And that’s what tends, as delta x goes to 0, to the integral. The only change in point of view if I want to write this limiting property, which is right above here, the only change between here and here is that I want to divide by the length of the interval. b a. So I will divide by b a here.

然后在这里除以 ba。然后我要检查一下这个数字实际上是多少。Delta x / ba，这个因子是什么？好吧，如果我们在这里看看 delta x 是什么，如果除以 ba，它就是 1 / n。所以因子 delta x / ba = 1 / n。这就是我在这里输入的，y1 到 yn / n 的总和。 

And divide by b a over here. And then I’ll just check what this thing actually is. Delta x / b a, what is that factor? Well, if we look over here to what delta x is, if you divide by b a, it’s 1 / n. So the factor delta x / b a = 1 / n. That’s what I put over here, the sum of y1 through yn / n. 

当它趋向于 0 时，它与 n 趋向于无穷大相同。它们是相同的。平均值和积分密切相关。唯一的区别是我们用间隔长度除以它。

And as this tends to 0, it’s the same as n going to infinity. Those are the same things. The average value and the integral are very closely related. There’s only this difference that we’re dividing by the length of the interval.

例子

Example

我想举一个非常简单的例子，但后面会用到。所以让我们以常数为例。

I want to give an example which is an incredibly simpleminded one, but it’ll come into play later on. So let’s take the example of a constant.

我希望这能让你对我刚刚写的内容稍微不那么困惑。同时也让你觉得这是应该的简单和合理的。如果我检查这个常数的平均值是多少，它是由这个相对复杂的公式给出的。也就是说，我必须对函数 c 进行积分。好吧，它只是常数 c。 

And this is, I hope, will make you slightly less confused about what I just wrote. As well as making you think that this is as simpleminded and reasonable as it should be. If I check what the average value of this constant is, it’s given by this relatively complicated formula here. That is, I have to integrate the function c. Well, it’s just the constant c. 

不管你如何做，作为一个不定积分，我把它想象成一个矩形，你会得到的答案是这里的 c。所以把它算出来。答案是 c。所以 c = c 的平均值（最好是平均值的情况）解释了分母。解释了那里的 1 / ba。这完全是经过计算的，因此常数的平均值就是它应该有的值。

And however you do this, as an antiderivative I was thinking of it as a rectangle, the answer that you’re going to get is c here. So work that out. The answer is c. And so the fact that the average of c = c, which had better be the case for averages, explains the denominator. Explains the 1 / b a there. That’s cooked up exactly so that the average of a constant is what it’s supposed to be.

否则，我们得到的是错误的归一化因子。我们显然得到了一堆无稽之谈。顺便说一句，这也解释了我写下的第一个公式中的 1 / n。之所以将其称为平均值，或者说它是正确的原因之一，是如果你对 y 取相同的常数 c，n 次，如果你将其除以 n，就会得到 c。 

Otherwise we have the wrong normalizing factor. We’ve clearly got a piece of nonsense on our hands. And incidentally, it also explains the 1 / n in the very first formula that I wrote down. The reason why this is called the average, or one reason why it’s the right thing, is that if you took the same constant c, for y all the way across there n times, if you divide it by n, you get back c. 

这就是我们所说的平均值，这就是 n 存在的原因。这是一个简单的例子。现在，我们将要给出的所有例子都不会太复杂。但它们会变得越来越复杂。第二个例子是半圆上某个点的平均高度。也许我会先在这里画一张半圆的图。

That’s what we mean by average value and that’s why the n is there. So that was an easy example. Now none of the examples that we are going to give are going to be all that complicated. But they will get sort of steadily more sophisticated. The second example is going to be the average height of a point on a semicircle. And maybe I’ll draw a picture of the semicircle first here.

我们将其设为标准圆，即单位圆。所以也许我应该称其为单位半圆。这是负 1 点，这是点 1。我们在这里选择一个点，然后取这里的典型或平均高度。对 dx 积分。因此，对 dx 进行连续积分。那么，那是什么呢？

And we’ll just make it the standard circle, the unit circle. So maybe I should have called it a unit semicircle. This is the point negative 1, this is the point 1. And we’re picking a point over here and we’re going to take the typical, or the average, height here. Integrating with respect to dx. So sort of continuously with respect to dx. Well, what is that?

嗯，根据规则，它是 1 / ba 乘以对不起，它在盒子里。1 / ba，从 a 到 b 的间隔，f ( x) dx。那是 1 / + 1 ( 1)。从 1 到 1 的积分，1 x ^2 的平方根 dx。对，因为高度是 y =，所以这是 y = 1 x^2 的平方根。评估它并不像看起来那么困难。

Well, according to the rule, it’s 1 / b a times sorry, it’s up here in the box. 1 / b a, the interval from a to b, f ( x) dx. That’s 1 / + 1 ( 1). The integral from 1 to 1, square root of 1 x ^2 dx. Right, because the height is y =,this is y = the square root of 1 x^2. And to evaluate this is not as difficult as it seems.

这是这个量的 1/2，我们可以将其解释为面积。它是半圆的面积。所以这是半圆的面积，我们知道它是圆面积的一半。所以它是 pi / 2。所以答案，这里的平均身高，是 pi/ 4。现在，在课程的后面，实际上不是在这个单元中，我们将能够计算它的不定积分。

This is 1/2 times this quantity here, which we can interpret as an area. It’s the area of the semicircle. So this is the area of the semicircle, which we know to be half the area of the circle. So it’s pi / 2. And so the answer, here the average height, is pi/ 4. Now, later in the class and actually not in this unit, we’ll actually be able to calculate the antiderivative of this.

换句话说，我们可以用分析方法计算出来。现在我们只知道这个值为 pi / 2 的几何原因。我们将在第四单元中用到许多积分技术时这样做。这是一个例子。结果是，这个的平均高度是 pi / 4。现在，我要给出的下一个例子会造成一点混乱。

So in other words, we’ll be able to calculate this analytically. For right now we just have the geometric reason why the value of this is pi / 2. And we’ll do that in the fourth unit when we do a lot of techniques of integration. So here’s an example. Turns out, the average height of this is pi / 4. Now, the next example that I want to give introduces a little bit of confusion.

我不会完全解决这个困惑，但我会试着让你习惯它。我将再次取平均高度。但现在，关于弧长。通常表示为 theta。现在，这引出了平均值的一个极其重要的特征。那就是你必须指定平均值所针对的变量。答案将根据变量而不同。

And I’m not going to resolve this confusion completely, but I’m going to try to get you used to it. I’m going to take the average height again. But now, with respect to arc length. Which is usually denoted theta. Now, this brings up an extremely important feature of averages. Which is that you have to specify the variable with respect to which the average is taking place. And the answer will be different depending on the variable.

所以它不会一样。哇，这里拼不出单词长度。就像上次的 witches 的复数一样。我们会努力解决这个问题。我们会修复所有的，我认为这是一个古老的盖尔语单词。Lengh。现在，让我向你展示这里的情况并不完全一样。如果我将这个小间隔 dx 移到右端，情况会特别夸张。

So it’s not going to be the same. Wow, can’t spell the word length here. Just like the plural of witches the last time. We’ll work on that. We’ll fix all of our, that’s an ancient Gaelic word, I think. Lengh. So now, let me show you that it’s not quite the same here. It’s especially exaggerated if maybe I shift this little interval dx over to the right hand end.

你可以看到与之对应的那一小部分，也就是 d θ 部分，其长度与 dx 部分不同。事实上，当你往下看时，这些 dx 长度的非常短的部分有更长的 θ 长度部分。因此，当我们对 θ 进行平均时，我们取的平均值将更加强调低值。它们将更加夸张。

And you can see that the little portion that corresponds to it, which is the d theta piece, has a different length from the dx piece. And indeed, as you come down here, these very short portions of dx length have much longer portions of theta length. So that the average that we’re taking when we do it with respect to theta, is going to emphasize the low values more. They’re going to be more exaggerated.

并且平均值应该低于我们这里得到的平均值。所以我们应该期望一个不同的数字。它不会是 pi / 4，而是其他数字。无论它是什么，它都应该小于 pi / 4。

And the average should be lower than the average that we got here. So we should expect a different number. And it’s not going to be pi / 4, it’s going to be something else. Whatever it is, it should be smaller than pi / 4.

不可缺少的

Integral

现在，让我们设置积分。积分遵循相同的规则。它只是间隔长度上的 1 乘以函数间隔上的积分。

Now, let’s set up the integral. The integral follows the same rule. It’s just 1 over the length of the interval times the integral over the interval of the function.

这就是积分，但是现在 theta 的范围在哪里？这次，theta 从 0 到 pi。所以积分是从 0 到 pi。我们除以 pi。积分要求我们知道高度的公式。也就是 sin theta。当然，就 theta 而言。它与 x^2 的平方根相同，但它以 theta 表示。所以就是这样。这是我们的平均值。

That’s the integral, but now where does theta range? This time, theta goes from 0 to pi. So the integral is from 0 to pi. And the thing we divide by is pi. And the integration requires us to know the formula for the height. Which is sin theta. In terms of theta, of course. It’s the same as square root of x^2, but it’s expressed in terms of theta. So it’s this. And here’s our average.

我把它贴在这里。这就是高度的公式。让我们来算一下。这个，我们有一个优势，就是能够算出来，因为我们知道 sin theta 的反导数。它与 pi 的这个因子有关，即 cos theta。所以，那是 1 / pi ( cos pi)，对不起。(cos pi cos) 0。也就是 1 / pi ( 2)，也就是 2 / pi。

I’ll put this up here. So that’s the formula for the height. So let’s work it out. This one, we have the advantage of being able to work out because we know the antiderivative of sin theta. It happens with this factor of pi, it’s cos theta. And so, that’s 1 / pi ( cos pi), sorry. (cos pi cos) 0. Which is 1 / pi ( 2), which is 2 / pi.

果然，如果你检查一下，就会发现 2 / pi < pi / 4，因为 pi^2 > 8。是的，问题。学生：教授：。

And sure enough, if you check it, you’ll see that 2 / pi < pi / 4, because pi^2 > 8. Yeah, question. STUDENT: PROFESSOR:.

问题

Question

问题是，我如何得到 sin theta。答案是，在这个图上，如果 theta 是在这里，那么这个高度就是这个，这是角度 theta，那么高度就是正弦。好的。另一个问题。学生：教授：。

The question is how do I get sin theta. And the answer is, on this diagram, if theta is over here then this height is this, and this is the angle theta, then the height is the sine. OK. Another question. STUDENT: PROFESSOR:.

问题是，第一个是什么，第一个是半圆上一个点的高度平均值，而这个是相对于 x 的。所以这表明，除非你解释了底层平均变量是什么，否则很难说出某个东西的平均值是什么。学生：教授：下一个问题是你应该如何解释这个值。也就是说，这个计算结果是什么？

The question is, what is the first one, the first one is an average of height, of a point on a semicircle and this one is with respect to x. So what this reveals is that it’s ambiguous to say what the average value of something is, unless you’ve explained what the underlying averaging variable is. STUDENT: PROFESSOR:. The next question is how should you interpret this value. That is, what came out of this calculation?

答案只是嵌入在计算本身中。所以这里有一个思考方式，它预示着我们的下一个主题。即概率。也就是说，假设你在这个间隔中随机挑选了一个数字。以相等的可能性，一个地方和另一个地方。然后你看到那个上方的高度是多少。这将是对第一个平均值的解释。

And the answer is only sort of embedded in this calculation itself. So here’s a way of thinking of it which is anticipating our next subject. Which is probability. Which is, suppose you picked a number at random in this interval. With equal likelihood, one place and another. And then you saw what height was above that. That would be the interpretation of this first average value.

第二个问题是，我在这个圆上随机选取一个点。同样有可能，根据圆的长度，在这个圆上选取任何可能的点。然后我问这个点的高度是多少。这些只是不同的东西。另一个问题。学生：教授：cos pi，不应该是 0 吗？不。cos of，是 1。cos pi = 1。余弦，对不起。不，cos 0 = 1。cos pi = 1。所以它们抵消了。也就是说，它们不抵消。

And the second one is, I picked something at random on this circle. And equally likely, any possible point on this circle according to its length. And then I ask what the height of that point is. And those are just different things. Another question. STUDENT: PROFESSOR: Cos pi, shouldn’t it be 0? No. cos of, it’s 1. Cos pi = 1. Cosine, sorry. No, cos 0 = 1. cos pi = 1. And so they cancel. That is, they don’t cancel.

是 1 1，即 = 2。关键点。是的。学生：教授：好的，让我重复一遍。所以问题是重复我预先猜测的推理，这可能是弧长平均值与水平距离平均值之间的关系。这与之前绘制此图的方式有关。

It’s 1 1, which = 2. Key point. Yeah. STUDENT: PROFESSOR: All right, let me repeat. So the question was to repeat the reasoning by which I guessed in advance that probably this was going to be the relationship between the average value with respect to arc length versus the average value with respect to this horizontal distance. And it had to do with the previous way this diagram was drawn.

这是将 dx 中的间隔与 theta 中的间隔进行比较。theta 中的一小部分。当你接近顶部时，它们几乎相同。也就是说，它或多或少是平衡的。这里有点弯曲，有点不同。但在这里它变得非常夸张。d theta 长度比 dx 长度长得多。

Which is comparing an interval in dx with an interval in theta. A little section in theta. And when you’re near the top, they’re nearly this same. That is, it’s more or less balanced. It’s a little curved here, a little different. But here it becomes very exaggerated. The d theta lengths are much longer than the dx lengths.

这意味着，相对于这些部分，变量 θ 赋予圆的这些部分的重要性更大。而如果您将 dx 的这一部分与这一部分进行比较，它们会赋予这两个相等长度的权重。但在这里，就 θ 而言，这部分相对较短，而这部分则大得多。因此，正如我所说，θ 变量更强调半圆的下半部分。

Which means that importance given by the theta of variable to these parts of the circle is larger, relative to these parts. Whereas if you look at this section versus this section for the dx, they give equal weights to these two equal lengths. But here, with respect to theta, this is relatively short and this is much larger. So, as I say, the theta variable’s emphasizing the lower parts of the semicircle more.

这是因为这个长度较短，而那个长度较长。而这两个长度相同。这是相对权重的平衡行为。我要用不同的方式再说一遍，也许这样会更好。下部对 theta 更重要。学生：教授：所以问题是，但它不应该因为长度较长而具有更大的值吗？从不取平均值。无论长度是多少，我们总是在除法。

That’s because this length is shorter and this length is longer. Whereas these two are the same. It’s a balancing act of the relative weights. I’m going to say that again in a different way, and maybe this will. The lower part is more important for theta. STUDENT: PROFESSOR: So the question is, but shouldn’t it have a bigger value because it’s a longer length. Never with averages. Whatever the length is, we’re always dividing.

我们总是用总数来补偿。我们有从 0 到 pi 的积分，但我们要除以 pi。这里我们有从 1 到 1 的积分，但我们要除以 2。所以我们每次除以的东西都不一样。这非常非常重要。常数的平均值是同一个常数，无论我们除以哪一个。所以如果它是常数，我们总是会补偿长度。

We’re always compensating by the total. We have the integral from 0 to pi, but we’re dividing by pi. Here we had the integral from 1 to 1, but we’re dividing by 2. So we divide by something different each time. And this is very, very important. It’s that the average of a constant is that same constant regardless of which one we did. So if it were a constant, we would always compensate for the length.

所以长度永远不重要。如果它是从 0 到 1,000,000 的积分，或者 100，比如说 1/100 cdx，它是一样的。它总是那样，无论它有多长都无关紧要。因为我们进行了补偿。这就是积分和平均值之间的真正区别，我们用总数除以它。

So the length never matters. If it’s the integral from 0 to 1,000,000, or 100, let’s say, 1/100 cdx, it’s just the same. It’s always that, it doesn’t matter how long it is. Because we compensate. That’s really the difference between an integral and an average, is that we’re dividing by the total.

加权平均值

Weighted Average

现在我想介绍另一个概念，这实际上就是我刚才写下的这两个例子的基础。

Now I want to introduce another notion, which is actually what’s underlying these two examples that I just wrote down.

这是你最应该在思想中强调的一点。因为它更加灵活，也更符合现实生活中的问题。因此，加权平均值的概念如下。你取某个函数的积分，比如从 a 到 b。但现在你要乘以权重。然后你必须除以总数。总数会是多少？

And this is by far the one which you should emphasize the most in your thoughts. Because it is much more flexible, and is much more typical of real life problems. So the idea of a weighted average is the following. You take the integral, say from a to b, of some function. But now you multiply by a weight. And you have to divide by the total. And what’s the total going to be?

它是从 a 到 b 的总权重的积分。现在，为什么这是正确的概念？我将用两种方式向你们解释。第一种是我在黑板上写的非常简单的东西，带有常数。我们想要的是 c 的平均值是 c。否则，作为平均值，这毫无意义。现在，让我们看看这里的定义。

It’s the integral from a to b of this total weighting that we have. Now, why is this the correct notion? I’m going to explain it to you in two ways. The first is this very simpleminded thing that I wrote on the board there, with the constants. What we want is the average value of c to be c. Otherwise this makes no sense as an average. Now, let’s just look at this definition here.

看看这是正确的。如果你求 c 的积分，从 a 到 b，w ( x) dx，然后除以从 a 到 b 的积分，w ( x) dx，不出所料，c 会被排除。它是一个常数。所以这是 c 乘以 a 到 b 的积分，w ( x) dx，再除以同一个数。这就是我们选择它的原因。我们选择它是为了让这些数可以抵消。这样就会得到 c。 

And see that’s correct. If you integrate c, from a to b, w ( x) dx, and you divide by the integral from a to b, w ( x) dx, not surprisingly, the c factors out. It’s a constant. So this is c times the integral a to b, w (x), dx, divided by the same thing. And that’s why we picked it. We picked it so that these things would cancel. And this would give c. 

在前一种情况下，这个属性解释了分母。在这里，它再次解释了分母。让我再给你一个解释。这可能是一个真实生活中的假装真实生活的例子。你有一只股票，一年前你以 10 美元的价格买入。然后六个月后你又以 20 美元的价格买了一些。然后你又以 30 美元的价格买了一些。现在，你的股票的平均价格是多少？

So in the previous case, this property explains the denominator. And again over here, it explains the denominator. And let me just give you one more explanation. Which is maybe a real life pretend real life example. You have a stock which you bought for $10 one year. And then six months later you brought some more for $20. And then you bought some more for $30. Now, what’s the average price of your stock?

嗯，这取决于你买了多少股。如果你第一次买了这么多股，第二次买了这么多股，第三次买了这么多股，这就是你花费的总金额。平均价格是总价格除以总股数。这是连续平均过程的离散模拟。

Well, it depends on how many shares you bought. If you bought this many shares the first time, and this many shares the second time, and this many shares the third time, this is the total amount that you spent. And the average price is the total price divided by the total number of shares. And this is the discrete analog of this continuous averaging process here.

现在函数 f，所以我用 w 表示权重，现在函数 f 的值是 10、20 和 30。权重是不同购买的相对重要性。所以再说一遍，这些 wi 是权重。还有另一个问题。在观众席上，某个时候。是的，在这里。学生：教授：非常非常好的观点。所以在这个分子中，声明是，在这个例子中，我们分解了 c。 

The function f now, so I use w for weight, the function f now is the function whose values are 10,20 and 30. And the weightings are the relative importance of the different purchases. So again, these wi’s are weights. There was another question. Out in the audience, at some point. Over here, yes. STUDENT: PROFESSOR: Very, very good point. So in this numerator here, the statement is, in this example, we factored out c. 

但在这里我们不能分解出 f (x)。这非常重要，也是关键所在。换句话说，加权平均值非常有趣，通常你必须做两个不同的积分才能算出来。当这是 c 时，这是一个非常无聊的积分。事实上，因为它是一个平均值，你甚至不需要计算。

But here we cannot factor out f ( x). That’s extremely important and that is the whole point. So, in other words, the weighted average is very interesting you have to do two different integrals to figure it out in general. When it happens that this is c, it’s an extremely boring integral. Which in fact because, it’s an average, you don’t even have to calculate at all.

将它分解并取消这些数字，而不必费心计算这两个数字。因此，这些巨大的数字就被取消了。因此，分解出这些数字是常数的一个非常特殊的属性。这是我们第一次讨论，现在我将通过这个例子回到女巫大锅的加热，我们将使用平均值来说明我们在该上下文中获得的积分。

Factor it out and cancel these things and never bother to calculate these two numbers. So these massive numbers just cancel. So it’s a very special property of a constant, that it factors out. That was our first discussion, and now with this example I’m going to go back to the heating up of the witches’ cauldron and we’ll use average value to illustrate the integral that we get in that context as well.

女巫大锅

Witches Cauldron

我提醒你一下，我们看看吧。

I remind you, let’s see.

女巫大锅的情况是这样的。首先重要的是，这里有一个大锅。这个大锅高 1 米，宽 2 米。它是一个旋转抛物线。里面大约有 1600 升。

The situation with the witches’ cauldron was this. The first important thing is that there were, so this is the big cauldron here. This is the one whose height is 1 meter and whose width is 2 meters. And it’s a parabola of revolution here. And it had about approximately 1600 liters in it.

这条曲线是 y = x^2。我上次描述的情况是初始温度为 T = 0 摄氏度。最终温度不是恒定温度，而是我们从底部加热。底部比顶部热。最终温度由公式 T = 100 乘以高度 y 得出。

And this curve was y = x^2. And the situation that I described at the end of last time was that the initial temperature was T = 0 degrees Celsius. And the final temperature, instead of being a constant temperature, we were heating this guy up from the bottom. And it was hotter on the bottom than on the top. And the final temperature was given by the formula T = 100 30 times the height y.

所以当 y = 0 时，底部的温度为 100。顶部的温度为 T = 70 度。好的，这是温度的最终配置。问题是我们需要多少能量。所以，这里的第一个观察结果是，这也是给出这个例子的原因，重要的是要意识到你想在这种情况下使用磁盘方法。

So at y = 0, at the bottom, it’s 100. And at the top, T = 70 degrees. OK, so this is the final configuration for the temperature. And the question was how much energy do we need. So, the first observation here, and this is the reason for giving this example, is that it’s important to realize that you want to use the method of disks in this case.

原因在于，你不应该首先考虑圆盘，所以这与之无关。但你应该考虑的是水平面。我们必须使用水平面，因为 T 在水平面上是恒定的。它在垂直面上不是恒定的。如果我们像上次一样用壳来计算它的体积，那么 T 就会沿着壳变化。

The reason, so it doesn’t have to do with, you shouldn’t think of the disks first. But what you should think of is the horizontal. We must use horizontals because T is constant on horizontals. It’s not constant on verticals. If we set things up with shells, as we did last time, to compute the volume of this, then T will vary along the shell.

我们仍然会有一个平均问题，一个沿垂直部分的积分问题。但是如果我们这样做，T 在整个层面上都是常数。因此，计算任何给定层面的贡献时不再需要微积分。所以 t 在水平面上是常数。实际上，从表面上看，这是我们在这里使用的相同技巧。我们可以从积分中分解出常数。

And we will still have an averaging problem, an integral problem along the vertical portion. But if we do it this way, T is constant on this whole level here. And so there’s no more calculus involved in calculating what the contribution is of any given level. So t is constant on horizontals. Actually, in disguise, this is that same trick that we have here. We can factor constants out of integrals.

你可以把它看作一个积分，但关键是它比积分更基本。现在我必须为你设置它。为了做到这一点，我需要记住这个方程是什么。即 y = x ^2。总能量的公式将是体积乘以度数。这将等于我们这里需要的能量。

You could view it as an integral, but the point is that it’s more elementary than that. Now I have to set it up for you. And in order to do that, I need to remember what the equation is. Which is y = x ^2. And the formula for the total amount of energy is going to be volume times the number of degrees. That’s going to be equal to the energy that we need here.

让我们把它加起来。它是从 0 到 1 的积分，这是相对于 y 的。所以 y 层从 0 到 1。这个顶层的 y = 1，这个底层的 y = 0。我们得到的圆盘，也就是这里的点 (x, y)，被旋转了。它的半径是 x。

And so let’s add it up. It’s the integral from 0 to 1, and this is with respect to y. So the y level goes from 0 to 1. This top level’s y = 1, this bottom level’s y = 0. And the disk that we get, this is the point (x, y) here, is rotated around. And its radius is x.

因此厚度是 dy，圆盘面积是 pi x^2。我们要平均的是 T。好吧，我们还没有平均，我们只是在积分。我们只是把总数加起来。现在我要代入各种值。我要得到的是 T，再次，= 100 30y。这个半径是测量到这个末端的。所以 x^2 = y。

So the thickness is dy, and the area of the disk is pi x^2. And the thing that we’re averaging is T. Well, we’re not yet averaging, we’re just integrating it. We’re just adding up the total. Now I’m just going to plug in the various values for this. And what I’m going to get is T, again, = 100 30y. And this radius is measured up to this very end. So x^2 = y.

所以这是 pi y dy。这是我们能够求值的积分。是的，问题。学生：教授：好的。

So this is pi y dy. And this is the integral that we’ll be able to evaluate. Yeah, question. STUDENT: PROFESSOR: All right.

最终计算

Final Calculation

好吧，我们来做一下。让我们在这里完成计算。让我们看看。这等于，等于什么。好吧，我把它放在这里。

Well, let’s carry this out. Let’s finish off the calculation here. Let’s see. This is equal to, what does it equal to. Well, I’ll put it over here.

它等于 50 pi y ^2，对吧，因为这是 100 pi y，然后是 30，这是 100 pi y 30 pi y ^2，我必须取它的不定积分。所以我得到 50 pi y ^2，然后我得到 10 pi y ^3。在 0 和 1 处求值。这就是 40 pi。现在，我上次花了大量时间专注于单位。

It’s equal to 50 pi y ^2 right, because this is 100 pi y, and then there’s a 30, this is 100 pi y 30 pi y ^2, and I have to take the antiderivative of that. So I get 50 pi y ^2, and I get 10 pi y ^3. Evaluate it at 0 and 1. And that is 40 pi. Now, I spent a tremendous amount of time last time focusing on units.

因为我想告诉你们如何从中得出一个实际的数字。这里有一个微妙的点，我上次指出过，这与将米改为厘米有关。我声称我处理得正确。所以，我们这里的答案是度数，即摄氏度乘以立方米。这些是正确的单位。现在，我可以将其翻译成摄氏度，以 C 开头。

Because I want to tell you how to get a realistic number out of this. And there’s a subtle point here that I pointed out last time that had to do with changing meters to centimeters. I claim that I’ve treated those correctly. So, what we have here is that the answer is in degrees, that is Celsius, times cubic meters. These are the correct units. And now, I can translate this into Celsius is spelled with a C.

这很有趣。摄氏度。我可以将其转换为您更熟悉的单位。那么让我们试试 40 pi deg * m ^3，然后计算转换系数。首先，每度一卡路里乘以一毫升。这是一个转换。然后让我们看看。我必须从厘米转换，所以我这里有 (100 cm / m)^ 3。所以这是我需要的两个转换系数。

That’s interesting. Celsius. I can translate this into units that you’re more familiar with. So let’s try 40 pi deg * m ^3, and then do the conversion factors. First of all there’s one calorie per degree times a milliliter. That’s one conversion. And then let’s see. I’m going to have to translate from centimeters so I have here (100 cm / m)^ 3. So these are the two conversion factors that I need.

因此，我得到 40 pi（10 ^ 6），也就是 100^3。这是卡路里。那么这是多少？好吧，也许用 40 pi * 1,000 千卡来表示会更好一些，因为这些是您在食物营养标签上实际看到的。所以这个数字大约是 125 左右。让我们看看，这样对吗？让我们确保这些数字是正确的。

And so, I get 40 pi ( 10 ^ 6), that’s 100^3. And this is in calories. So how much is this? Well, it’s a little better, maybe, to do it in 40 pi * 1,000 kilocalories, because these are the ones that you actually see on your nutrition labels of foods. And so this number is around 125 or so. Let’s see, is that about right? Let’s make sure I’ve got these numbers right.

是的，这大约是 125.40 pi。所以一块糖果，这是万圣节的例子，所以。一块糖果大约有 250 千卡热量。所以这是半块糖果。所以我们问题的答案是需要 500 块糖果才能加热这个东西。好的，这就是我们的例子。现在，是的。问题。学生：教授：积分给了我们什么？这个积分是，积分代表了以下内容。

Yeah, this is about 125.40 pi. And so one candy bar, this is a Halloween example, so. One candy bar is about 250 kilocalories. So this is half a candy bar. So the answer to our question is that it takes 500 candy bars to heat up this thing. OK, so that’s our example. Now, yeah. Question. STUDENT: PROFESSOR: What does the integral give us? This integral is, the integral represents the following things.

所以问题是，这个积分能给我们什么。所以这是积分。这是重写后的结果，以便计算。这个积分给我们的是以下结果。你必须想象以下想法。这里有一小块水。你要把它从 0 度一直升到目标温度。

So the question is, what does this integral give us. So here’s the integral. Here it is, rewritten so that it can be calculated. And what this integral is giving us is the following thing. You have to imagine the following idea. You’ve got a little chunk of water in here. And you’re going to raise is from 0 degrees all the way up to whatever the target temperature is.

因此，如果你愿意的话，那一小毫升水必须从 0 升到某个数字，该数字与高度有关。该数字介于 70 到 100 度之间。而它正上方的水也必须升到某个温度，尽管温度略有不同。

And so that little milliliter of water, if you like, has to be raised from 0 to some number which is a function of the height. It’s something between 70 and 100 degrees. And the one right above it also has to be raised to a temperature, although a slightly different temperature.

我们用积分做的是把所有这些度数加起来，卡路里代表需要多少卡路里，一卡路里代表将 1 毫升水升高 1 度需要多少卡路里。一立方厘米水。这就是卡路里的定义。我们把它们加起来。换句话说，每个立方体都代表一个东西。

And what we’re doing with the integral is we’re adding up all of those degrees and the calorie represents how much it takes, one calorie represents how much it takes to raise by 1 degree 1 milliliter of water. One cubic centimeter of water. That’s the definition of a calorie. And we’re adding it up. So in other words, each of these cubes is one thing.

现在我们必须把这个大东西加起来，这个大东西有 1600 升。我们有很多不同的小立方体。这就是我们所做的。当我们把它们都放在一起时。这就是积分为我们所做的。其他问题。

And now we have to add it up over this massive thing, which is 1600 liters. And we have a lot of different little cubes. And that’s what we did. When we glommed them all together. That’s what the integral is doing for us. Other questions.

加权平均值

Weighted Averages

现在，在继续之前，我想将其与加权平均值联系起来。因为这就是我首先进行加权平均值的原因。我还将计算平均最终温度。

Now I want to connect this with weighted averages before we go on. Because that was the reason why I did weighted averages first. I’m going to compute also the average final temperature.

所以，最后，因为这很有趣，平均起始温度很无聊，它是 0。平均最终温度是，个别温度不同。这里的答案是 T pi y dy 从 0 到 1 的积分除以 pi y dy 从 0 到 1 的积分。

So, final because this is the interesting one, the average starting temperature’s very boring, it’s 0. The average final temperature is, individually the temperatures are different. And the answer here is it’s the integral from 0 to 1 of T pi y dy divided by the integral from 0 to 1 of pi y dy.

所以这就是总温度，适当地加权到该温度下所涉及的水的体积，除以总水体积。我们计算了这两个数字。分子中的数字是我们所说的 40 pi。分母中的数字，实际上这比我们上次用贝壳做的要简单，你只要看一下它，就会发现它是三角形下的面积。

So this is the total temperature, weighted appropriately to the volume of water that’s involved at that temperature, divided by the total volume of water. And we computed these two numbers. The number in the numerator is what we call 40 pi. And the number in the denominator, actually this is easier than what we did last time with shells you can just look at this and see that it’s the area under a triangle.

是 pi / 2。所以答案是 80 度。这是平均温度。注意，这是加权平均值。这里的权重根据高度而不同。权重因子是 pi y。这就是权重因子。这并不奇怪。当 y 较小时，这里的体积较小。

It’s pi / 2. And so the answer here is 80 degrees. This is the average temperature. Note that this is a weighted average. The weighting here is different according to the height. The weighting factor is pi y. That’s the weighting factor. And that’s not surprising. When y is small, there’s less volume down here.

上面的体积更重要，因为大锅顶部的水比底部的水多。如果将其与普通平均值进行比较，将最高温度加上最低温度，除以 2，结果将是 100 + 70 / 2。结果为 85 度。这个数字更大。为什么？因为较冷的水在顶部。

Up above, those are more important volumes, because there’s more water up at the top of the cauldron than there is down at the bottom of the cauldron. If you compare this to the ordinary average, if you take the maximum temperature plus the minimum temperature, divided by 2, that would be 100 + 70 / 2. You would get 85 degrees. And that’s bigger. Why? Because the cooler water is on top.

实际平均值，即正确的加权平均值，低于这个假平均值。在这种情况下，这不是真正的平均值。好吧，所以权重是越靠近顶部，数值就越大。现在我要再举一个加权平均值的例子。这个例子也非常值得一看。这是另一个在解释积分时非常重要的例子。这是一个非常非常简单的函数 f 的例子。 

And the actual average, the correct weighted average, is lower than this fake average. Which is not the true average in this context. All right so the weighting is that the thing is getting fatter near the top. So now I’m going to do another example of weighted average. And this example is also very much worth your while. It’s the other incredibly important one in interpreting integrals. And it’s a very, very simple example of a function, f. 

权重会有所不同，但函数 f 会是一种非常特殊的类型。也就是说，函数 f 实际上是一个常数。但不完全是。它在一个区间上是常数，在其余区间上是 0。所以我们现在要计算这些加权平均值。这个主题称为概率。在概率中，我们所做的就是，所以我在这里只举几个例子。

The weightings will be different, but the functions, f, will be of a very particular kind. Namely, the function f will be practically a constant. But not quite. It’s going to be a constant on one interval, and then 0 on the rest. So we’ll do those weighted averages now. And this subject is called probability. In probability, what we do, so I’m just going to give some examples here.

我将随机选取一个点放在引号中。在 y < x < 1 x ^2 区域内。这就是这里的形状。好吧，我们现在就在这里画出来。所以，在这里的某个地方。某个点，(x, y)。然后我需要告诉你，根据这个随机的真正含义。如果你愿意的话，这与面积成比例。所以这个部分内的面积。

I’m going to pick a point to in quotation marks at random. In the region y < x < 1 x ^2. That’s this shape here. Well, let’s draw it right down here. For now. So, somewhere in here. Some point, (x, y). And then I need to tell you, according to what this random really means. This is proportional to area, if you like. So area inside of this section.

那么我们现在要回答的问题是，x > 1/2 的概率是多少，通常称为概率。让我告诉你这里发生了什么。概率中的事情总是如此。所以，首先，我们给它起了一个名字。这叫做 P ( x > 1/2)。这就是我们在这里用符号表示它的名字。

And then the question that we’re going to answer right now is, what is the chance that, it’s usually called probability, that x > 1/2. Let me show you what’s going on here. And this is always the case with things in probability. So, first of all, we have a name for this. This is called P ( x > 1/2). And so that’s what it’s called in our notation here.

它的意思是，概率总是等于部分/整体。它是一个像那边那样的比率。哪个是部分，哪个是整体。好吧，在这张图片中，整体是整个抛物线。部分是截面 x > 1/2。它只是这两个面积的比率。让我们把它写下来。

And what it is, is the probability is always equal to the part / the whole. It’s a ratio just like the one over there. And which is the part and which is the whole. Well, in this picture, the whole is the whole parabola. And the part is the section x > 1/2. And it’s just the ratio of those two areas. Let’s write that down.

这是 (1 x ^2) dx 从 1/2 到 1 的积分，除以 (1 x ^2 ) dx 从 1 到 1 的积分。同样，这里的加权因子是 1 x^2。这里再具体一点，起点 a = 1，终点 b = + 1。所以这是 P(x < 1/2)。如果你算出来，结果是 5/18，我们不会这么做。是的。

That’s the integral from 1/2 to 1 of (1 x ^2) dx, divided by the integral from 1 to 1, (1 x ^2 ) dx. And again, the weighting factor here is 1 x^2. And to be a little bit more specific here, the starting point a = 1 and the endpoint b = + 1. So this is P(x < 1/2). And if you work it out, it turns out to be 5/18, we won’t do it. Yeah.

学生：教授：我们试图用概率来做什么。所以我不能重复你的问题。但我可以试着说，因为它有点太复杂了。但它不正确，好吧。我们假设有两种可能发生的情况。或者，让我们这样说。让我们把它当作一场赌博。有人在这里随机选择一个点。我们试图找出你获胜的几率。

STUDENT: PROFESSOR: What we’re trying to do with probability. So I can’t repeat your question. But I can try say, because it was a little bit too complicated. But it was not correct, OK. What we’re taking is, we have two possible things that could happen. Either, let’s put it this way. Let’s make it a gamble. Somebody picks a point in here at random. And we’re trying to figure out what your chances are of winning.

换句话说，就是人们在这里选某样东西的几率与在那里选某样东西的几率。有趣的是，你获胜的几率是多少。答案是 1 的某个分数。为了算出答案，我必须算出这里的总面积。与从 1 到 1，从头到尾的整个面积之和相比。

In other words, the chances the person picks something in here versus something in there. And the interesting thing is, so what percent of the time do you win. The answer is it’s some fraction of 1. And in order to figure that out, I have to figure out the total area here. Versus the total of the entire, all the way from 1 to 1, the beginning to the end.

所以在分子中我放成功，在分母中我放所有可能性。这样，对吧？学生：教授：这就是这个的解释。所以也许我不明白你的问题。学生：教授：啊，为什么 1 x ^2 是加权因子。这与你如何计算曲线下的面积有关。

So in the numerator, I put success, and in the denominator I put all possibilities. So that, right? STUDENT: PROFESSOR: And that’s the interpretation of this. So maybe I didn’t understand your question. STUDENT: PROFESSOR: Ah, why is 1 x ^2 the weighting factor. That has to do with how you compute areas under curves.

这里的曲线是 y = 1 x ^2。因此，为了计算 1/2 和 1 之间的面积，我必须积分。这就是对它的解释。这是曲线下的面积。这个积分。分母是整个曲线下的面积。好的，是的。另一个问题。学生：教授：啊。哎呀。这应该是和这里的问题一样。谢谢。

The curve here is y = 1 x ^2. And so, in order to calculate how much area is between 1/2 and 1, I have to integrate. That’s the interpretation of this. This is the area under that curve. This integral. And the denominator’s the area under the whole thing. OK, yeah. Another question. STUDENT: PROFESSOR: Ah. Yikes. It was supposed to be the same question as over here. Thank you.

学生：教授：这与加权因子有关。这是加权因子。嗯，从这些地方相对于那些地方的概率的角度来看，这是相对重要性。也就是说，这是一个加权因子，因为它告诉我，从某种意义上说，这个数字 5/18，实际上这让我认为这个数字可能是错误的。好吧，我让你算出来。

STUDENT: PROFESSOR: This has something to do with weighting factors. Here’s the weight factor. Well, it’s the relative importance from the point of view of this probability of these places versus those. That is, so this is a weighting factor because it’s telling me that in some sense this number 5/18, actually that makes me think that this number is probably wrong. Well, I’ll let you calculate it out.

看起来它应该小于这里的 1/4，因为这是总距离的 1/4，这里比中间的要少一点。所以实际上它可能应该小于 1/4，答案。学生：教授：。曲线的方程是 1 x^2。它之所以是加权因子，是因为我们正在解释，问题与曲线下的面积有关。

It looks like it should be less than 1/4 here, because this is 1/4 of the total distance and there’s a little less in here than there is in the middle. So in fact it probably should be less than 1/4, the answer. STUDENT: PROFESSOR:. The equation of the curve is 1 x^2. The reason why it’s the weighting factor is that we’re interpreting, the question has to do with the area under that curve.

因此，这向我们展示了多少部分是相对重要的，多少部分不是。也就是说，这些部分是相对重要的，而这些部分则不那么重要。根据面积。因为我们已经说过，面积是我们做出选择的方式。所以我没有足够的时间来告诉你们我的下一个例子。相反，我只会告诉你们一般公式是什么。我们下次再做我们的例子。

And so, this is showing us how much is relatively important versus how much is not. This is, these parts are relatively important, these parts are less important. According to area. Because we’ve said that area is the way we’re making the choice. So I don’t have quite enough time to tell you about my next example. Instead, I’m just going to tell you what the general formula is. And we’ll do our example next time.

我来告诉你它是什么。这是概率的一般公式。我们假设我们有一个总范围，可能从 a 到 b，我们有一些中间值 x1 和 x2，然后我们将尝试计算我们随机挑选的某个变量出现在 x1 和 x2 之间的概率。根据定义，我们称它是一个积分。

I’ll tell you what it’s going to be. So here’s the general formula for probability here. We’re going to imagine that we have a total range which is maybe going from a to b, and we have some intermediate values x1 and x2, and then we’re going to try to compute the probability that some variable that we picked at random occurs between x1 and x2. And by definition, we’re saying that it’s an integral.

它是权重 dx 从 x1 到 x2 的积分，除以权重从 a 到 b 的积分。所以，再说一遍，这是部分除以整体。它与我们之前的加权平均值之间的关系是，函数 f (x) 是一种奇怪的函数。它是 0 和 1。如果你愿意的话，它就是这个加权因子的图片。

It’s the integral from x1 to x2 of the weight dx, divided by the integral all the way from a to b. Of the weight. So, again, this is the part divided by the whole. And the relationship between this and the weighted average that we had earlier was that the function f ( x) is kind of a strange function. It’s 0 and 1. It’s just the picture, if you like, is that you have this weighting factor.

它从 a 到 b。但在两者之间，我们有我们感兴趣的部分。即 x1 和 x2 之间。它是这个内部部分与我们感兴趣的整体之间的比率。明天我将尝试举一个现实的例子。我会告诉你们它是什么，但我们明天再讨论。

And it’s going from a to b. But then in between there, we have the part that we’re interested in. Which is between x1 and x2. And it’s the ratio of this inner part to the whole thing that we’re interested in. Tomorrow I’m going to try to do a realistic example. And I’m going to tell you what it is, but we’ll take it up tomorrow.

我告诉过你那是明天的事，但我们还有一分钟的时间，所以我要告诉你问题是什么。所以这将是一个射击练习问题。你这里有一个靶子，你正在向这个靶子投掷飞镖。所以你正在向这个靶子投掷飞镖。有人站在飞镖靶旁边。你的弟弟就站在飞镖靶旁边。

I told you it was going to be tomorrow, but we still have a whole minute, so I’m going to tell you what the problem is. So this is going to be a target practice problem. You have a target here and you’re throwing darts at this target. And so you’re throwing darts at this target. And somebody is standing next to the dartboard. Your little brother is standing next to the dartboard here.

问题是，你打弟弟的可能性有多大。所以，让我们拭目以待。你会知道你是否喜欢这样。实际上，我就是那个弟弟。所以，我不知道你想走哪条路。我们走哪条路吧。下次我们就知道了。

And the question is, how likely you are to hit your little brother. So this will, let’s see. You’ll see whether you like that or not. Actually, I was the little brother. So, I don’t know which way you want to go. We’ll go either way. We’ll find out next time.

Lec 24 | MIT 18.01 单变量微积分，2007 年秋季

Lec 24 | MIT 18.01 Single Variable Calculus, Fall 2007

16 年前 (2009 年 8 月 19 日) — 50:30 https://youtube.com/watch?v=jBkXbAgMj6s

16 years ago (Aug 19, 2009) — 50:30 https://youtube.com/watch?v=jBkXbAgMj6s

简介

Intro

以下内容根据 Creative Commons 许可提供。您的支持将帮助 MIT OpenCourseWare 继续免费提供高质量的教育资源。要捐款或查看数百门 MIT 课程的其他材料，请访问 MIT OpenCourseWare，网址为 ocw.mit.edu。教授：今天我想先纠正一下我上次犯的一个错误。这是错误的术语。

The following content is provided under a Creative Commons license. Your support will help MIT OpenCourseWare continue to offer high quality educational resources for free. To make a donation or to view additional materials from hundreds of MIT courses, visit MIT OpenCourseWare at ocw.mit.edu. PROFESSOR: Today I want to get started by correcting a mistake that I made last time. And this was mistaken terminology.

我说过，当我们在这个糖果棒示例中计算时，我们计算的是能量而不是热量。但实际上两者都是。它们是同一种东西。事实上，能量、热量和功在物理学中都是同一种东西。我愚蠢地认为热量的直观感觉与温度是一样的。

I said that what we were computing, when we computed in this candy bar example, was energy and not heat. But it’s both. They’re the same thing. And in fact, energy, heat and work are all the same thing in physics. I was foolishly considering the much more what am I trying to say the intuitive feeling of heat as just being the same as temperature.

但在物理学中，热量通常以卡路里来衡量，能量可以用很多单位来衡量。可能是千瓦时或尔格，这些都是各种单位。功可以用英尺磅之类的单位来衡量。也就是说，将某个重量举起一段距离。以及你必须施加的力的大小。这些都有相互转换。它们都是相同的量，只是单位不同。好吧，这些是相同的量。单位不同。

But in physics, usually heat is measured in calories and energy can be in lots of things. Maybe kilowatt hours or ergs, these are various of the units. And work would be in things like foot pounds. That is, lifting some weight some distance. And the amount of force you have to apply. And these all have conversions between them. They’re all the same quantity, in different units. OK, so these are the same quantity. Different units.

今天我们讲的物理知识就这么多了。抱歉。上次我讲的、今天要讲的就是这个飞镖靶的例子。我们有一个飞镖靶，它是某种靶子。有一个人，你的弟弟，站在那里。有人在扔飞镖。问题是，他被击中的可能性有多大。

So that’s about as much physics as we’ll do for today. And sorry about that. Now, the example that I was starting to discuss last time and that I’m going to carry out today was this dartboard example. We have a dartboard, which is some kind of target. And we have a person, your little brother, who’s standing over there. And somebody is throwing darts. And the question is, how likely is he to be hit.

所以我想向你们描述一下我们如何将这个问题变成一个数学问题。是的。学生：教授：我们正在讨论的是什么主题。我们正在讨论一个例子。这是一个飞镖靶的例子。它与概率有关。好的。那么这个人，你的弟弟，被飞镖击中的概率是多少。

So I want to describe to you how we’re going to make this problem into a math problem. Yep. STUDENT: PROFESSOR: What topic is this that we’re going over. We’re going over an example. Which is a dartboard example. And it has to do with probability. OK. So what is the probability that this guy, your little brother, gets hit by a dart.

现在，我们必须对这个问题做出一些假设，以便将其变成一个数学问题。我会尽量让这些假设非常现实。因此，第一个假设是命中次数与某个常数乘以 e^(r^2) 成正比。因此，这实际上是一种正态分布。这是钟形曲线。但它是半径的函数。

Now, we have to put some assumptions into this problem in order to make it a math problem. And I’m really going to try to make them pretty realistic assumptions. So the first assumption is that the number of hits is proportional to some constant times e^( r^2). So that’s actually a kind of a normal distribution. That’s the bell curve. But as a function of the radius.

这就是我要在这个问题中做出的假设。概率问题就是部分与整体的比例问题。所以部分是这个小家伙站着的地方。整体是飞镖可能击中的所有可能位置。可能是整个黑板或更远，这取决于你认为这个大孩子的瞄准能力有多好。

So this is the assumption that I’m going to make in this problem. And a problem in probability is a problem of the ratio of the part to the whole. So the part is where this little guy is standing. And the whole is all the possible places where the dart might hit. Which is maybe the whole blackboard or extending beyond, depending on how good an aim you think that this older child has.

所以，如果你愿意，这部分是。我们从简单开始。我的意思是，这不会扫过整个区域。但我们会讨论一些部分。像这样。这是半径 r_1，另一个半径是更长的半径 r_2。我们首先要跟踪的部分是周围的一切。这不是很好居中，但它应该是两个同心圆。

So, if you like, the part is. We’ll start simply. I mean, this doesn’t sweep all the way around. But we’re going to talk about some section. Like this. Where this is some radius r_1, and this other radius is some longer radius, r_2. And the part that we’ll first keep track of is everything around there. That’s not very well centered, but it’s supposed to be two concentric circles.

也许我应该稍微修改一下，这样读起来会更容易一些。我们开始吧。这里我有半径 r_1，这里我有半径 r_2。然后中间的区域就是我们要尝试跟踪的。所以我声称我们能够得到。所以这就是我所说的开始的部分。

Maybe I should fix that a bit so that it’s a little bit easier to read here. So here we go. So here I have radius r_1, and here I have radius r_2. And then the region in between is what we’re going to try to keep track of. So I claim that we’ll be able to get. So this is what I’m calling the part, to start out with.

然后我们取其中一部分来得到人站立的位置。现在，我想从侧面看 e^(r^2)。我们正在讨论的函数。再说一遍，这是钟形曲线。它看起来有点像这样。这是顶部值，现在是 r 轴。这是向上的，或者至少是向上的。

And then we’ll take a section of it to get the place where the person is standing. Now, I want to take a side view of e^( r^2). The function that we’re talking about. Again, that’s the bell curve. And it sort of looks like this. This is the top value, this is now the r axis. And this is up, or at least.

所以你应该这样想：这里的水平线是飞镖靶的平面。垂直线测量的是飞镖在这里堆积的可能性。所以如果是滚落的球或其他东西，它们中的许多会堆积在这里。堆积在更远的地方的飞镖会少得多。

So you should think of this in terms of the fact that the horizontal here is the plane of the dartboard. And the vertical is measuring how likely it is that there will be darts piling up here. So if they were balls tumbling down or something else falling on, many of them would pile up here. Many fewer of them would be piling up farther away.

我们跟踪的块是 r_1 和 r_2 之间的块。这是此处的对应区域。为了计算这部分，我们必须计算旋转体积。扫过一圈。因为实际上，从外表上看，这是一个环。这是侧视图，它实际上是一个环。因为我们在这里绕着这个轴旋转它。所以我们试图找出这个环的总体积。

And the chunk that we’re keeping track of is the chunk between r_1 and r_2. That’s the corresponding region here. And in order to calculate this part, we have to calculate this volume of revolution. Sweeping around. Because really, in disguise, this is a ring. This is a side view, it’s really a ring. Because we’re rotating it around this axis here. So we’re trying to figure out what the total volume of that ring is.

这就是我们的权重，即命中发生在这一部分或这一环中的可能性，而不是发生在其他部分。为了设置它，我提醒你，我们将使用壳法。这实际上是唯一可行的方法。我们想要在 r_1 和 r_2 之间进行积分。这里的范围是。因为如果你愿意的话，这是一个旋转体。

And that’s going to be our weighting, our likelihood for whether the hits are occurring in this section, or in this ring, versus the rest. To set this up, I remind you we’re going to use the method of shells. That’s really the only one that’s going to work here. And we want to integrate between r_1 and r_2. And the range here is that. Because this is, if you like, a solid of revolution.

因此，变量 r 与我们过去所说的 x 相同。它介于 r_1 和 r_2 之间，然后我们对其进行扫描。一小块的周长，因此，在这里的固定距离 r 处，周长将是 2 pi r。因此 2 pi r 是周长。然后高度是绿色茎的高度。那是 e^(r^2)。

So the variable r is the same as what we used to call x. And it’s ranging between r_1 and r_2, and then we’re sweeping it around. And the circumference of a little piece, so at a fixed distance r here, the circumference is going to be 2 pi r. So 2 pi r is the circumference. And then the height is the height of that green stem there. That’s e^( r^2).

然后我们乘以厚度，也就是 dr。所以绿色的厚度是 dr。这个小绿人的高度是 e^(r^2)，当我们扫过圆圈时，周长是半径的 2 pi 倍。问题。学生：教授：所以问题是，为什么我们感兴趣的不是这个粉红色区域。原因是对我这句话的意思的解释。

And then we’re multiplying by the thickness, which is dr. So the thickness of the green is dr. The height of this little green guy is e^( r^2), and the circumference is 2 pi times the radius, when we sweep the circle around. Question. 也就是说，假设你想象一下，问题是，左边是什么意思。对吗？这就是你要问的问题吗？当我试图理解飞镖命中的分布时，我应该想象我的飞镖。而且通常有些地方会有很多洞。其他地方的洞比较少。我试图弄清楚这些标记的整体分布。

That is, suppose you imagine, the question is, what does this left hand side mean. That right? Is that the question that’s you’re asking? When I try to understand what the distribution of dartboard hits is, I should imagine my dartboard. And very often there’ll be a whole bunch of holes in some places. And fewer holes else. I’m trying to figure out what the whole distribution of those marks is.

所以有些地方命中率会更高，而有些地方命中率会更低。所以我想测量的是命中率的平均数。所以这确实会是一些。这个比例常数是模棱两可的，因为它取决于你尝试的次数。如果你投掷一千次，命中率会更高。如果你只投掷一百次，命中率就会更低。

And so some places will have more hits on them and some places will have fewer hits on them. And so what I want to measure is, on average, the number of hits. So this would really be some. This constant of proportionality is ambiguous because it depends on how many times you try. If you throw a thousand times, it’ll be much more densely packed. And if you have only a hundred times it’ll be fewer.

这就是常数的作用所在。但假设你尝试了一定次数，比如说一千次，中间会堆积更多。距离越远，中间的堆积就会越来越少。假设这个人的目标是合理的。这就是我们要说的。所以我们在思考。这个人总是瞄准中心。

So that’s where this constant comes in. But given that you have a certain number of times that you tried, say, a thousand times, there will be a whole bunch more piled in the middle. And fewer and fewer as you get farther away. Assuming that the person’s aim is reasonable. So that’s what we’re saying. So we’re thinking in terms of. The person’s always aiming for the center.

所以最有可能的是，这个人会击中中心。但另一方面，这个人是会犯错的，所以这个人可能会错过。所以，当你走得越远，这种可能性就越小。我们只是计算这个被击中了多少次，这个被击中了多少次等等。与面积成比例。学生：教授：是的。r_1 和 r_2 是任意的。我们将进行一般计算。

So it’s most likely that the person will hit the center. But on the other hand, it’s a fallible person, so the person may miss. And so it’s less and less likely as you go farther out. And we’re just counting how many times this gets hit, how many time this and so on. In proportion to the area. STUDENT: PROFESSOR: Yeah. r_1 and r_2 are arbitrary. 我们将计算击中任何可能波段的可能性。现在我想保留它们为字母。r_1 和 r_2。因为我想尝试各种不同的可能性。学生：教授：再说一遍，为什么我们必须采用体积？这就是我们之前讨论的问题。它是一个体积，因为它是每单位面积的命中次数。
