所以，讨论完设置后，这是一个相当标准的设置。哦，还有一个问题。是的。学生：教授：是的。那么问题是，为什么这是现实的。为什么这里的函数选择，e^(r^2)，是飞镖的现实函数选择。所以我可以用一个类比来回答这个问题。当人们问自己德国的 V 2 火箭在哪里击中伦敦时，他们使用了这个模型。

So, having discussed the setup, this is a pretty standard setup. Oh, one more question. Yes. STUDENT: PROFESSOR: Yeah. So the question is, why is this a realistic. Why is this choice of function here, e^( r^2), a realistic choice of function for the darts. So I can answer this with an analogy. When people were asking themselves where the V 2 rockets from Germany hit London, they used this model.

事实证明，这个预测是最准确的。所以这让你觉得这是真的。问题是，这让人们看起来像是大师。也就是说，他们击中中心的次数比击中其他地方的次数要多。但这实际上有点欺骗性。模式（即最有可能的位置）和平均发生的情况是有区别的。

It turned out to be the one which was the most accurate. So that gives you an idea that this is actually real. The question, this makes it look like people are masters. That is, that they’ll all hit in the center more often than elsewhere. But that’s actually somewhat deceptive. There’s a difference between the mode, that is, the most likely spot, and what happens on average.

换句话说，最有可能的点是中心。但这里的面积很小，事实上击中那里的可能性很小。就在这里。事实上，你更有可能在这里。所以如果你把音量加起来，你会发现大部分音量都来自这里。事实上，人们很少击中中心附近。

So in other words, the single most likely spot is the center. But there’s rather little area in here, and in fact the likelihood of hitting that is some little tiny bit. In here. In fact, you’re much more likely to be out here. So if you take the total of the volume, you’ll see that much of the volume is contributed from out here. And in fact, the person hits rather rarely near the center.

所以这不是一件荒谬的事情。如果你这样想，有人瞄准了中心，但有一些随机的东西让他偏离了目标，那么他可能会偏左或偏右，或者他们甚至可能很幸运，所有这些错误都会自行抵消，碰巧击中了中心附近。是的，另一个问题。

So this is not a ridiculous thing to do. If you think of it in terms of somebody’s aiming at the center but there’s some random thing which is throwing the person off, then there is likely to be to left or to the right, or they might even get lucky and all those errors cancel themselves and they happen to hit pretty much near the center. Yeah, another question.

学生：教授：小弟弟是如何发挥作用的？小弟弟将按以下方式发挥作用。我提前告诉你。事实是，小弟弟不会愚蠢到站在目标前面。我知道。他站在距离目标半径大约两倍的地方。所以，我们将在这里用某个扇区来近似位置。

STUDENT: PROFESSOR: How does the little brother come into play? The little brother is going to come into play as follows. I’ll tell you in advance. 这只是其中一块东西。我们只需掰下一块。这就是我们要捕捉的方式。所以关键是，目标在这里。但有可能投掷飞镖的七岁孩子实际上没有击中目标。这种情况实际上经常发生。那么，这回答了你的问题吗？好的。我们现在准备好这样做了吗？还有一个问题。

Which is just going to be some chunk of one of these things. We’ll just break off a piece of it. And that’s how we’re going to capture. So the point is, the target is here. But there is the possibility that the seven year old who’s throwing the darts actually missed the target. That actually happens a lot. So, does that answer your question? Alright. 学生：教授：我在这里给你这个属性。我告诉你。这就是所谓的数学模型，当你给别人这样的东西时。事实上，这需要进一步的证明。这是一个有趣的问题。是的。学生：教授：我现在就把它给你。这确实需要证明。在某些情况下，它是合理的。但是，好吧。所以无论如何，这是我们的部分。

STUDENT: PROFESSOR: I’m giving you this property here. I’m telling you that. This is what’s called a mathematical model, when you give somebody something like this. In fact, that requires further justification. It’s an interesting issue. Yeah. STUDENT: PROFESSOR: I’m giving it to you for now. And it’s something which really has to be justified. In certain circumstances it is justified. But, OK. So anyway, here’s our part.

现在，这是我们要估计其重要性、相对重要性的大块。现在，我们可以通过代换或猜测来计算它的反导数。它就是 pi e^( r^2)。如果你对它进行微分，你会得到 2r，这会抵消这里的负号。所以你会得到 2pi re^( r^2)。这就是反导数。

This is going to be our chunk, for now, that we’re going to estimate the importance, the relative importance, of. And now, this is something whose antiderivative we can just do by substitution or by guessing. It’s just pi e^( r^2). If you differentiate that, you get a 2r, which cancels the minus sign here. So you get 2pi r e^( r^2). So that’s the antiderivative.

我们在 r_1 和 r_2 处求值。因此，减号将反转。答案将是 pi 乘以 e^(r_1^2)，这是底部的，减去 e (r_2 2)，这是顶部的。所以这就是我们这部分给出的结果。更技术性地说，如果你想乘以 c，那就是 c 乘以这个。我马上就会说。好的，现在我要开始工作了。

And we’re evaluating it at r_1 and r_2. So with the minus sign that’s going to get reversed. The answer is going to be pi times e^( r_1^2), that’s the bottom one, minus e(r_22), that’s the top. So this is what our part gives us. And, more technically, if you wanted to multiply through by c, it would be c times this. I’ll say that in just a second. OK, now I want to work.

因此，如果您愿意，部分等于，我甚至可以称之为 c pi，乘以 e^(r_1^2) e^(r_2^2)。如果我把这个因子放进去，它实际上就是这个数。所以现在我们对于尝试了多少次没有偏见了。无论是一千次还是一百万次尝试。现在，这类建模问题最重要的第二个特征是，总是存在某种理想化。

So, if you like, the part is equal to, maybe even I’ll call it c pi, times e^( r_1^2) e^( r_2^2). That’s what it really is if I put in this factor. So now there’s no prejudice as to how many attempts we make. Whether it was a thousand attempts or a million attempts at the target. Now, the most important second feature here of these kinds of modeling problems is, there is always some kind of idealization.

接下来我想和大家讨论的是整体的解释。也就是说，所有可能性的集合是什么。在这种情况下，我要说的是，思考整体的合理方式是 r 可以从 0 一直到无穷大。现在，你可能不喜欢这个。

And the next thing that I want to discuss with you is the interpretation of the whole. That is, what’s the family of all possibilities. And in this case, what I’m going to claim is that the reasonable way to think of the whole is it’s that r can range all the way from 0 to infinity. Now, you may not like this.

但这些可能是我最喜欢的数字，我最喜欢的数字是 1。所以无穷大是一个非常有用的概念。当然，在飞镖的背景下，它是无稽之谈。因为如果你想想地下室的墙壁，孩子可能会错过目标，他可能会撞到墙上。他可能不会撞到右边的墙壁，无论如何他肯定不会撞到那边。

But these are maybe my first and third favorite number, my second favorite number being 1. So infinity is a really useful concept. Of course, it’s nonsense in the context of the darts. Because if you think of the basement wall where the kid might miss a target, he’d probably hit the wall. He’s probably not going to hit one of the walls to the right, and anyway he’s certainly not going to hit over there.

因此，将命中可能性一直推到无穷大，这有点人为。另一方面，由于这种指数下降，这条曲线的形状使得实际尾端在这里很小。这是可以忽略不计的。关键是，实际上，如果你一直推到无穷大，这个值是最容易计算的值。

So there’s something artificial about sending the possibility of hits all the way out to infinity. On the other hand, the shape of this curve is such that the real tail ends here, because of this exponential decrease, are tiny. And that’s negligible. And the point is that actually the value, if you go all the way out to infinity, is the easiest value to calculate.

因此，通过这样做，我理想化了问题，但实际上我让数字更清晰地呈现出来。这在数学中一直都是这样做的。这就是我们从差异到微分、微分和无穷小时所做的。所以我们喜欢这样。因为它使事情变得更容易，而不是因为它使事情变得更难。所以我们只是假装整体从 0 到无穷大。现在让我们看看它是什么。

So by doing this, I’m idealizing the problem but I’m actually making the numbers come out much more cleanly. And this is just always done in mathematics. That’s what we did when we went from differences to differentials, to differentiation and infinitesimals. So we like that. Because it makes things easier, not because it makes things harder. So we’re just going to pretend the whole is from 0 to infinity. And now let’s just see what it is.

它是 c pi 乘以，起始位置是 e^( 0^2)。这是 r_1，对，这是 r_1 所起的作用，r_2 是这个值。减去 e^( infinity^2)。这是可以忽略的小数，0。所以这只是 c pi。因为这个数字是 1，另一个数字是 0。这只是 (1 0)，在括号里。现在我可以从这两个数字告诉你概率是多少。

It’s c pi times, the starting place is e^( 0^2). That’s r_1, right, this is the role that r_1 plays is this, and the r_2 is this value. Minus e^( infinity^2). Which is that negligibly small number, 0. So this is just c pi. Because this number is 1, and this other number is 0. This is just (1 0), in the parentheses there. And now I can tell you from these two numbers what the probability is.

我们落在半径介于 r_1 和 r_2 之间的目标上的概率，也就是这里的圆环，是部分与整体的比率。在本例中，它只是抵消了 c pi。所以它是 e^( r_1^2) e^( r_2^2)。这是概率的公式。所以 c 抵消了，pi 也抵消了。一切都消失了。现在，让我再次强调一下这个公式的工作原理。

The probability that we landed on the target in a radius between r_1 and r_2, so that’s this annulus here, is the ratio of the part to the whole. Which in this case just cancels the c pi. So it’s e^( r_1^2) e^( r_2^2). There’s the formula for the probability. So the c canceled and the pi canceled. It’s all gone. Now, again, let me just emphasize the way this formula is supposed to work.

这里所有可能性的总概率应该设置为 1。这是 1 的某个分数。如果你愿意，也可以用百分比表示。是的。学生：教授：这个给出了。问题是，这不就是给出了环的概率吗？这给出了环的概率，但这是一个非常非常宽的环。这是一个从 0 开始的环，内部什么都没有。

The total probability of every possibility here is supposed to be set up to be 1. This is some fraction of 1. If you like, it’s a percent. Yes. STUDENT: PROFESSOR: This one is giving. The question is, doesn’t this just give the probability of the ring? This gives you the probability of the ring, but this is a very, very wide ring. This is a ring starting with 0, nothing, on the inside.

然后一路向外。这就是一切。所以这对应于一切。这对应于一个环。现在，让我们看看。我想从这里去哪里。所以为了在这里取得进展，我仍然必须再给你一条信息。这又应该是现实的。当我三岁的时候，我哥哥的朋友拉尔夫七岁，我经常看着他扔飞镖。

And then going all the way out. So that’s everything. So this corresponds to everything. This corresponds to a ring. So now, let’s see. Where do I want to go from here. So in order to make progress here, I still have to give you one more piece of information. And this is, again, supposed to be realistic. When I was three years old and my brother’s friend Ralph was seven, I watched him throwing darts a lot.

我想说的是，对于拉尔夫来说，不管怎样，对于七岁的拉尔夫来说，他后来做得更好了。但七岁的拉尔夫击中目标的概率约为 1/2。对吧？所以他击中目标的概率约为一半。而其他时候，地下室的墙壁上有水泥，情况就没那么糟糕了。只是弹开了。

And I would say that for Ralph, so for Ralph, at age seven, anyway, later on he got a little better at it. But Ralph at age seven, the probability that he hit the target was about 1/2. Right? So he hit the target about half the time. And the other times, there was cement on the walls of the basement, it wasn’t that bad. Just bounced off.

这也意味着随着时间的推移，点会变得稍微钝一些。所以当他们击中时，危险性会降低一些。好吧。现在，我想做额外的假设。a 是目标的半径。现在，我想做的另一个现实假设是这个小孩站在哪里。

That also meant that the points got a little blunter as time went on. So it was a little less dangerous when they hit. Alright. So now, so here’s the extra assumption that I want to make. So a is going to be the radius of the target. Now, the other realistic assumption that I want to make is where this little kid would be standing.

现在，在这里，我想非常具体地进行计算。我们假设目标在这里。而孩子站在中间。所以我们只做一部分。这是 3 点到 5 点之间。他还有更多，但位置较低，可能可以忽略不计。所以这一部分是我们想要看到的部分。

And now, here, I want to get very specific and just do the computation in one case. We’re going to imagine the target is here. And the kid is standing, say, between. So we’ll just do a section of this. This is between 3 o’clock and 5 o’clock. There’s more of him, but it’s lower down and maybe negligible here. So this section is the part, the chunk that we want to see about.

这是 a，然后这里的距离是 2a。然后这里的最长距离是 3a。所以最长距离是 3a。换句话说，我的意思是，如果你站得太近，拉尔夫打弟弟的概率大约是 1/6。对吧？因为 2/12 = 1/6。1/6 的概率是我们介于 a 和 3a 之间。这就是我们要找的数字。另一个问题。学生：教授：。

And this is a, and then this distance here is 2a. And then the longest distance here is 3a. So the longest distance is 3a. So in other words, what I’m saying is that the probability, if you’re standing too close, the chance Ralph hits younger brother is about 1/6. Right? Because 2/12 = 1/6.1/6 of the probability that we’re between a and 3a. That’s the number that we’re looking for. Another question. STUDENT: PROFESSOR:.

2/12 来自于我们假设的事实。所以我们在这里做了一个非常非常大胆的假设。我们假设这个人类，他实际上站着。地板就在这儿下面。也许他没有那么高。但无论如何，他实际上比这要大一点。他靠近目标的部分覆盖了这里的这个区域，在半径 2a 和 3a 之间。

The 2/12 came from the fact that we assumed. So we made a very, very bold assumption here. We assumed that this human being, who is actually standing. The floor is about down here. Maybe he wasn’t that tall. But anyway, so he’s really a little bigger than this. That the part of him that was close to the target covered about this section here, between radius 2a and 3a.

正如你所看到的，实际上从计算中可以看出，由于可能性下降得非常快，所以无论他站在外面是什么，都无关紧要。所以我们只担心最接近目标的部分。学生：教授：为什么它不在 12 点之内？因为我把它做成了一个时钟。我把它做成了从 3 点到 5 点，所以它是时钟 12 个小时中的 2 个小时。

As you’ll see, actually from the computation, because the likelihood drops off pretty quickly, whatever of him was standing outside there wouldn’t have mattered anyway. So we’re just worried about the part that’s closest to the target here. STUDENT: PROFESSOR: Why is it out of 12? Because I made it a clock. And I made it from 3 o’clock to 5 o’clock, so it’s 2 of the 12 hours of a clock.

这只是我制作一个您可以看到部分的方法。现在，这就是我们要计算的内容。为了解决这个问题，我还需要另一个项目。这里。所以也许我会给自己留一点空间。我必须弄清楚我们的信息给了我们什么。也就是说，概率，抱歉，这个概率是 1/2。让我们记住这是什么。

It’s just a way of me making a section that you can visibly see. So now, so here’s what we’re trying to calculate. And in order to figure this out, I need one more item. here. So maybe I’ll leave myself a little bit of room. I have to figure out something about what our information gave us. Which is that the probability, sorry, this probability was 1/2. So let’s remember what this is.

这将是 e^( 0^2) e^( a^2)。这就是这个概率。它等于 1/2。所以这意味着 1 e^( a^2)。= 1/2。这意味着 e^( a^2) = 1/2。我不会计算 a，这是我想要使用的有关 a 的信息部分。这就是我要使用的。现在我要计算这里的另一个概率。所以上面的概率是这个。这将与 e^( (2a)^2) e^( (3a)^2) 相同。

This is going to be e^( 0^2) e^( a^2). That’s what’s this probability is. And that’s equal to 1/2. So that means that 1 e^( a^2). = 1/2. Which means that e^( a^2) = 1/2. I’m not going to calculate a, this is the part about the information about a that I want to use. That’s what I’ll use. And now I’m going to calculate this other probability here. So the probability right up there is this. And that’s going to be the same as e^( (2a)^2) e^( (3a)^2).

这就是我们计算的结果。现在我想使用一些指数算术。这是 (e^( a 2)) 2。因为它实际上是 (2a)^2 是 4。数量是 4a^2，然后我取出该指数。减去 e^( a^2) 的 9 次方，即 3^2。因此结果是 (1/2)^4 (1/2)^9。大约是 1/16。这是可以忽略不计的。这部分在这里。

That’s what we calculated. And now I want to use some of the arithmetic of exponents. This is (e^( a2))2. Because it’s really (2a)^2 is 4. the quantity is 4a^2, and then I bring that exponent out. Minus e^( a^2) to the 9th power, that’s 3^2. And so this comes out to be (1/2)^4 (1/2)^9. Which is approximately 1/16. This is negligible. This part here.

这就是为什么这些尾巴，当你向无穷远处看时，其实并不那么重要。所以这是一个小得多的数字。所以整个乐队的概率是 1/16。现在我可以回答这里的问题了。这大约是 1/6 * 1/16。大约是 1/100，或者大约 1%。所以如果我站在那里尝试 100 次，那么我被击中的几率就相当高。这就是计算结果。

And this is actually why these tails, as you go out to infinity, don’t really matter that much. So this is a much smaller number. So the probability of the whole band is 1/16. And now I can answer the question up here. This is approximately 1/6 * 1/16. Which is about 1/100, or about 1%. So if I stood there for 100 attempts, then my chances of getting hit were pretty high. So that’s the computation.

这是概率问题的一个典型例子。让我再和我们之前做过的事情做一点联系。这与加权平均值或权重积分有关。但这个问题涉及的权重是 w(r) 等于。所以让我们看看在所有这些积分中发生了什么。在所有积分中发生的事情是，我们这里有这个因子，2 pi r。

That’s a typical example of a problem in probability. And let me just make one more connection with what we did before. This is connected to weighted averages or integrals over weights. But the weight that’s involved in this problem was w(r) is equal to. So let’s just look at what happened in all of those integrals. What happened in all the integrals was, we had this factor here, 2 pi r.

如果我把这个 c 也算进去，它实际上是 2 pi cre^(r^2)。这是我们使用的权重。事物的相对重要性。现在，这与我们一开始使用的 e^(r^2) 不一样。因为这是一维直方图。这与壳法有关，壳法给了我们额外的 r 因子。

And if I include this c, it was really 2 pi c r e^( r^2). This was the weight that we were using. The relative importance of things. Now, this is not the same as the e^( r^2) that we started out with. Because this is the one dimensional histogram. And that has to do with the method of shells that gave us that extra factor of r here.

所以这也与开头的问题有关，这个问题与这个悖论有关，看起来中间这些位置最有可能。但这是图 e^(r^2)。如果你真的看看这个图，你会看到当 r 趋向 0 时，它也会趋向 0。这是一张不同的图。实际上，这就是实际发生的情况。

So that also connects with the question at the beginning, which had to do with this paradox, that it looks like these places in the middle are the most likely. But that’s the plot e^( r^2). If you actually look at this plot here, you see that as r goes to 0, it’s going to 0. This is a different graph here. And actually, so this is what’s happening really.

就你有多大可能进入距离目标中心一定距离内而言。再说一遍，我们研究的不是曲线下的面积。而是旋转的体积。我们现在要换个话题。好，还有一个问题。是的。学生：教授：是的，这应该是 w(r) 的图。学生：教授：那么，问题是，中心的重要性难道不是最大的吗？

In terms of how likely it is that you’ll get within a certain distance of the center of the target. Again, it’s not the area under that curve that we’re doing. It’s that volume of revolution. We’re going to change subjects now. OK, one more question. Yes. STUDENT: PROFESSOR: Yeah, that’s supposed to be the graph of w(r). STUDENT: PROFESSOR: Well, so, the question is, wouldn’t the importance of the center be greatest?

问题在于你使用哪个变量。根据纯半径，答案是否定的。事实证明，半径中有些带比其他带更重要，更容易命中。这实际上与目标的中心或核心非常小有关。因此更难击中。而外围的整个带面积更大。击中该带的方法有很多种。

It’s a question of which variable you’re using. According to pure radius, it’s not. It turns out that there are some bands in radius which are more important, more likely for hits than others. It really has to do with the fact that the center, or the core, of the target is really tiny. So it’s harder to hit. Whereas a whole band around the outside has a lot more area. Many, many ways to hit that band.

所以这是一个更大的领域。所以这两个东西之间存在竞争。所以我们要继续。现在我想谈谈另一种加权平均值。这些加权平均值将简单得多。

So it’s a much larger area. So there’s a competition there between those two things. So we’re going to move on. And I want to talk now about a different kind of weighted average. These weighted averages are going to be much simpler.

数值积分

Numerical Integration

它们出现在所谓的数值积分中。数值积分的方法有很多种。它们很重要，因为很多积分没有公式。

And they come up in what’s called numerical integration. There are many, many methods of integrating numerically. And they’re important because many, many integrals don’t have formulas.

所以你必须用计算器或机器来计算它们。我们已经做过的第一种是黎曼和。它们被证明是极其低效的。它们很糟糕。我要描述的下一条规则是一点改进。它被称为梯形规则。这个规则比黎曼和合理得多。不幸的是，它实际上也很糟糕。还有另一条规则，只是一条稍微棘手的规则。

And so you have to compute them with a calculator or a machine. So the first type that we’ve already done are Riemann sums. They turned out to be incredibly inefficient. They’re lousy. The next rule that I’m going to describe is a little improvement. It’s called the trapezoidal rule. And this one is much more reasonable than the Riemann sum. Unfortunately, it’s actually also pretty lousy. There’s another rule which is just a slightly trickier rule.

它的存在确实很神奇。它被称为辛普森规则。这个规则实际上非常好。它很聪明。那么让我们从这些开始吧。我首先要提醒你什么是黎曼和。所以这是一次很好的回顾，因为你需要知道这三个。你会希望看到它们并行排列。所以这是设置。好的，我们开始吧。

And it’s actually amazing that it exists. And it’s called Simpson’s Rule. And this one is actually pretty good. It’s clever. So let’s get started with these. And the way I’ll get started is by reminding you what the Riemann sum is. So this is a good review, because you need to know all three of these. And you’re going to want to see them all laid out in parallel. So here’s the setup. OK, so here we go.

我们有图，有函数，它从 a 开始，到 b 结束。可能一直延续，但我们只关注这个区间。这是一个函数 y = f(x)。我们在做黎曼和时会把它分开。所以这是 1，这是黎曼和。我们从 a 开始，也就是我们称为 x_0 的点，然后我们走一段距离。

We have our graph, we have our function, it starts out at a, it ends up at b. Maybe goes on, but we’re only paying attention to this interval. This is a function y = f(x). And we split it up when we do Riemann sums. So this is 1, this is Riemann sums. We start out with a, which is a point we call x_0, and then we go a certain distance.

我们一直到 b。我们用这些 delta x 细分这个东西。这些是步长。所以我们有这些大小为 delta x 的小步长。与这些 x 值相对应，我们有 y 值。y_0 = f(x_0)，这是 a 上方的点。然后 y_1 = f(x_1)，这是 x_1 上方的点。依此类推，一直到 y_n，也就是 f(x_n)。

We go all the way over to b. And we subdivide this thing with these delta x’s. Which are the step sizes. So we have these little steps of size delta x. Corresponding to these x values, we have y values. y_0 = f(x_0), that’s the point above a. Then y_1 = f(x_1), that’s the point above x_1. And so forth, all the way up to y_n, which is f(x_n).

为了计算面积，你确实需要了解一些函数知识。你需要能够计算它。这就是我们所做的。我们在这里计算了 n + 1 个点。枚举 0 到 n。这些数字就是我们将要得到积分的所有近似值。因此，我们想以某种方式对这些数字求平均值。这就是我们的目标。

In order to figure out the area, you really need to know something about the function. You need to be able to evaluate it. So that’s what we’ve done. We’ve evaluated here at n + 1 points. Enumerated 0 through n. And those are the numbers out of which we’re going to get all of our approximations to the integral. So somehow we want average these numbers. So here’s our goal.

黎曼和

Riemann Sum

我们的目标是求平均值，或者说加法，我在这里用的平均数非常宽泛。但我要说的是把这些数字相加以得到一个近似值。求平均值或把 y 相加。得到积分的近似值。我们知道这是曲线下的面积。所以这就是黎曼和。它是以下的东西。你取 y_0 加 y_1 加。直到 y_(n 1)。然后乘以 delta x。就是这样。

Our goal is to average, or add, I’m using average very loosely here. But I was going to say add up these numbers to get an approximation. To average or add the y’s. To get an approximation to the integral. Which we know is the area under the curve. So here’s what the Riemann sum is. It’s the following thing. You take y_0 plus y_1 plus. up to y_(n 1). And you multiply by delta x. That’s it.

现在，这个是左端点的。所以是左手边的和。还有一个右端点。也就是说，如果你从右端点开始。它将从 y_1 到 y_n。好的，所以这个是右手边的。右黎曼和。这两个是我们之前做的。现在我要向你们描述接下来的两个。它们有类似的模式。

Now, this one is the one with left endpoints. So the left hand sum. There’s also a right one. Which is, if you start at the right hand ends. And that will go from y_1 to y_n. OK, so this one is the right hand. Right Riemann sum. Those are the two that we did before. Now I’m going to describe to you the next two. They have a similar pattern to them.

梯形法则

trapezoidal rule

带有梯形的需要一张图片。

And the one with trapezoids requires a picture.

这是一个形状。这是一堆值。我们正在尝试估计这些块的大小。现在，我们不再做一些愚蠢的事情，即在矩形中绘制水平线，而是做一些更聪明的事情。即绘制对角线的直线。您会发现其中许多实际上可能与我在那里绘制的非常接近。尽管如果它们是弯曲的，它们会稍微偏离一点。

Here’s a shape. And here’s a bunch of values. And we’re trying to estimate the size of these chunks. And now, instead of doing something stupid, which is to draw horizontal lines in rectangles, we’re going to do something slightly more clever. Which is to draw straight lines that are diagonal. You see that many of them actually coincide probably pretty closely with what I drew there. Although if they’re curved, they miss by a little bit.

这叫做梯形法则。因为如果你选择其中一个形状，比如说这是 y_2，这是 y_3，如果你选择其中一个形状，这个高度是 y_2，这个高度是 y_3，这个底边是 delta x。这是一个梯形。既然这是一个梯形，我就能算出它的面积。我得到了什么？我得到了底边乘以平均高度。

So this is called the trapezoidal rule. Because if you pick one of these shapes, say this is y_2 and this is y_3, if you pick one of these shapes, this height here is y_2, and this height is y_3, and this base is delta x. This is a trapezoid. So this being a trapezoid, I can figure out its area. And what do I get? I get the base times the average height.

如果你想想，如果你算出当你在顶部做一条直线时会发生什么，就像这样，你会得到这个平均值。所以这是梯形的平均高度。现在我要加起来。我要把它们全部加起来得到梯形法则的公式。

If you think about if, you work out what happens when you do something with a straight line on top, like that, you’ll get this average. So this is the average height of the trapezoid. And now I want to add up. I want to add them all up to get my formula for the trapezoidal rule.

梯形法则公式

trapezoidal rule formula

那我该怎么办？我有第一个的 delta x 倍。

So what do I do? I have delta x times the first one.

也就是 (y_0 + y_1) / 2。这是第一个梯形。下一个梯形是 (y_1 + y_2) / 2。如此循环下去。最后，得到 (y_(n 2) + y_(n 1)) / 2。最后，得到 (y_(n 1) + y_n) / 2。这是一个很长的公式。我们马上就要简化它了。这等于多少？

Which is (y_0 + y_1) / 2. That’s the first trapezoid. The next one is (y_1 + y_2) / 2. And this keeps on going. And at the end, I have (y_(n 2) + y_(n 1)) / 2. And then last of all, I have (y_(n 1) + y_n) / 2. That’s a very long formula here. We’re going to simplify it quite a bit in just a second. What’s this equal to?

好吧，请注意，我一开始得到的是 y_0 / 2。现在，y_1 被提及了两次。每次都是 1/2 的因数。所以我们在这里得到了一个完整的 y_1。所有中间项也是如此。您将得到 y_2 并一直到 y_(n 1)。但是，最后一个是不匹配的。

Well, notice that I get y_0 / 2 to start out with. And now, y_1 got mentioned twice. Each time with a factor of 1/2. So we get a whole y_1 in here. And the same thing is going to be true of all the middle terms. You’re going to get y_2 and all the way up to y_(n 1). But then, the last one is unmatched.

Y_n 只有 1/2，只算 1/2。这就是所谓的梯形规则。现在，我想将它与黎曼和进行比较，黎曼和就在左边。这是左边的，这是右边的。如果取左边和右边的平均值，也就是这个的一半加上那个的一半，就会有重叠。y_1 到 y_n 的内容都列在了两者中。

Y_n is only 1/2, only counts 1/2. So here is what’s known as the trapezoidal rule. Now, I’d like to compare it for you to the Riemann sums, which are sitting just to the left here. Here’s the left one, and here’s the right one. If you take the average of the left and the right, that is, a half of this plus a half of that, there’s an overlap. The y_1 through y_n things are listed in both.

但是 y_0 只算作 1/2，y_n 也只算作 1/2。所以，这就是两个黎曼和之间的对称折衷。这实际上等于左黎曼和加上右黎曼和除以 2。这是它们的平均值。现在，这将会很棒，而且看起来确实更接近。但实际上它并不像看起来那么令人印象深刻。

But the y_0 only gets counted 1/2 and the y_n only gets counted 1/2. So what this is, is this is the symmetric compromise between the two Riemann sums. This is actually equal to the left Riemann sum plus the right Riemann sum divided by 2. It’s the average of them. Now, this would be great and it does look like it’s closer. But actually it’s not as impressive as it looks.

如果你真的在实践中这样做，它并不是很有效。虽然它比黎曼和好得多，但仍然不够好。所以现在我需要向你描述更花哨的规则。

If you actually do it in practice, it’s not very efficient. Although it’s way better than a Riemann sum, it’s still not good enough. So now I need to describe to you the fancier rule.

辛普森规则公式

Simpsons rule formula

这被称为辛普森规则。所以，如果你愿意的话，这就是方法 3。这个想法还是把事物分成块。但现在它总是需要 n 为偶数。

Which is known as Simpson’s Rule. And so, this is, if you like, 3, Method 3. The idea is again to divide things into chunks. But now it always needs n to be even.

换句话说，我们要处理的不只是一个盒子，而是成对的盒子。这是 delta x，这里又是 delta x。我们要研究这部分的面积。所以我只关注这部分。让我们在这里重现它。这是 delta x，这是 delta x。当然还有各种高度。

In other words, we’re going to deal not with just one box, we’re going to deal with pairs of boxes. Here’s delta x, and here’s delta x again. And we’re going to study the area of this piece here. So let me focus just on that part. Let’s reproduce it over here. And here’s the delta x, here’s delta x. And of course there are various heights.

从 y_0 开始，这是 y_2，中间部分是 y_1。现在，我们要使用的近似曲线是抛物线。

This starts out at y_0, this is y_2, and this middle segment is y_1. Now, the approximating curve that we’re going to use is a parabola.

近似曲线

Approximating curve

也就是说，我们要通过这三个点拟合一条抛物线。然后我们将用它作为近似面积。现在，它看起来不像。这看起来好像没算对。但实际上，大多数函数大多会向一个方向摆动。它们不会切换。它们没有拐点。

That is, we’re going to fit a parabola through these three points. And then we’re going to use that as the approximating area. Now, it doesn’t look like. This looks like it misses. But actually, most functions mostly wiggle either one way or the other. They don’t switch. They don’t have inflection points.

所以，在这个规模上，这很糟糕。但是当我们达到较小的规模时，这变得非常棒。作为近似值。现在，我需要告诉您算术是什么。为了节省时间，实际公式是什么取决于您的问题集。

So, this is a lousy, at this scale. But when we get to a smaller scale, this becomes really fantastic. As an approximation. Now, I need to tell you what the arithmetic is. And in order to save time, it’s on your problem set what the actual formula is.

抛物线公式

Parabola formula

但我要告诉你如何思考这个问题。我希望你按照以下方式思考这个问题。

But I’m going to tell you how to think about it. I want you to think about it as follows.

因此，抛物线下方的面积将是底边乘以某种平均高度。这里的底边，您已经看到了。它是 2 delta x。底边是 2 delta x。现在，平均高度很奇怪。您必须根据这三个数字 y_0、y_1 和 y_2 计算出抛物线的平均高度。结果是以下公式。

So the area under the parabola is going to be a base times some kind of average height. And the base here, you can already see. It’s 2 delta x. The base is 2 delta x. Now, the average height is weird. You have to work out what it is for a parabola, depending on those three numbers, y_0, y_1, and y_2. And it turns out to be the following formula.

它必须是一个平均值，但它是一个有趣的加权平均值。所以，如果你愿意的话，这就是笑点。它们就是有趣的加权平均值。这个非常简单，只涉及三个数字。但它仍然很有趣。它如下。结果是 (y_0 + 4y_1 + y_2) / 6。为什么除以 6？嗯，它应该是一个平均值。

It has to be an average, but it’s an interesting weighted average. So this was the punchline, if you like. Is that they are such things as interesting weighted averages. This one’s very simple, it just involves three numbers. But it’s still interesting. It’s the following. It turns out to be (y_0 + 4y_1 + y_2) / 6. Why divided by 6? Well, it’s supposed to be an average.

所以总数是 1 + 4 + 1。分母是 6。所以它更强调中间而不是两边。这就是抛物线的情况。所以这是你家庭作业上的计算。现在我们可以把它们放在一起得到完整的辛普森规则公式。我会把它贴在这里。

So the total is 1 + 4 + 1 of these things. And 6 is in the denominator. So it emphasizes the middle more than the sides. And that’s what happens with a parabola. So this is a computation which is on your homework. And now we can put this together for the full Simpson’s Rule formula. Which I’ll put up over here.

我们有 2 个 delta x，我们将其除以 6。然后我们得到 (y_0 + 4y_1 + y_2) / 6 加。这是第一个块。现在，第二个块（也许我会把它放在这里）开始。

We have here 2 delta x, and we divide by 6. And then we have (y_0 + 4y_1 + y_2) / 6 plus. That’s the first chunk. Now, the second chunk, maybe I’ll just put it in here, starts.

这是 x_2。这是 x_0。它一直到 x_4。所以 x_2、x_3、x_4。所以下一个涉及索引 2、3 和 4。所以这是 (y_2 + 4y_3 + y_4) / 6。哦，哦，哦，哦，不。我想我会去掉这些 6。我有太多的 6。好吧。让我们在这里把它们去掉。让我们把它们拿出来。把它们放在这里。谢谢。

This is x_2. This is x_0. And it goes all the way to x_4. So x_2, x_3, x_4. So the next one involves the indices 2,3 and 4. So this is (y_2 + 4y_3 + y_4) / 6. Oh, oh, oh, oh, no. I think I’ll get rid of these 6’s. I have too many 6’s. Alright. Let’s get rid of them here. Let’s take them out. Put them out here. Thank you.

一直到最后，也就是 y_(n 2) 加 2y_(n 1)。抱歉，加 4y_(n 1) 加 y_n。我本来要除以 6，但你救了我。所以这里是所有的块。现在，这个模式是什么？结果是以下。这是 1,4.1，加上 1,4.1，加上 1,4.1。你把它们加起来。

All the way to the end, which is y_(n 2) plus 2y_(n 1). sorry, plus 4y_(n 1) plus y_n. I was about to divide by 6, but you saved me. So here are all the chunks. Now, what does this pattern come out to be? This comes out to be the following. This is 1,4.1, added to 1,4.1 added to 1,4.1. You add them up.

你得到 1、4，然后重复，所以你得到 2 和 4，以及 2、4 和 1。所以模式是从最远端的 1 开始。然后是 4。然后它在中间交替出现 2 和 4。

You get 1,4, and then there’s a repeat, so you get a 2 and a 4, and a 2 and a 4 and a 1. So the pattern is that it starts out with 1’s on the far ends. And then 4’s next in. And then it alternates 2’s and 4’s in between.

因此，辛普森规则的完整模式是 delta x / 3，现在我成功地用这个 6 抵消了这个 2，并得出了那个因数 2。然后这里我有 y0 + 4 y1 + 2 y2 + 4 y3 + 它继续进行，继续进行，继续进行。最后是 2 y_(n 2) + 4 y_(n 1) + y_n。所以再次，1 和 4 开始。

So the full pattern of Simpson’s Rule is delta x / 3, I have now succeeded in canceling this 2 with this 6 and getting out that factor of 2. And then here I have y0 + 4 y1 + 2 y2 + 4 y3 + It keeps on going and keeps on going and keeps on going. And in the end it’s 2 y_(n 2) + 4 y_(n 1) + y_n. So again, 1 and a 4 to start.

4 和 1 结束。然后在中间交替出现 2 和 4。这个奇怪的加权平均值要好得多。下次我会向你展示。

4 and a 1 to end. And then alternating 2’s and 4’s in the middle. And this weird weighted average is way better. As I will show you next time.

Lec 25 | MIT 18.01 单变量微积分，2007 年秋季

Lec 25 | MIT 18.01 Single Variable Calculus, Fall 2007

16 年前 (2009 年 8 月 19 日) — 49:19 https://youtube.com/watch?v=zUEuKrxgHws

16 years ago (Aug 19, 2009) — 49:19 https://youtube.com/watch?v=zUEuKrxgHws

简介

Intro

以下内容根据 Creative Commons 许可提供。您的支持将帮助 MIT OpenCourseWare 继续免费提供高质量的教育资源。要捐款或查看数百门 MIT 课程的其他材料，请访问 MIT OpenCourseWare，网址为 ocw.mit.edu。教授：现在，今天我需要开始完成我上次所做的事情。即讨论数值方法。我只想举一个例子。

The following content is provided under a Creative Commons license. Your support will help MIT OpenCourseWare continue to offer high quality educational resources for free. To make a donation, or to view additional materials from hundreds of MIT courses, visit MIT OpenCourseWare at ocw.mit.edu. PROFESSOR: Now, today I need to get started by finishing up what I did last time. Namely, talking about numerical methods. And I want to just carry out one example.

然后我想补充一点。然后我们再来讨论一下整个单位。

And then I want to fill in one loose end. And then we’ll talk about the unit overall.

数值积分

Numerical Integration

上次我们讨论了数值积分。我将用最简单的例子来说明这一点。我们将研究 dx / x 从 1 到 2 的积分。

We were talking, last time, about numerical integration. I’m going to illustrate this just with the simplest example that I can. We’re going to look at the integral from 1 to 2 of dx / x.

我们已经非常清楚，它是 x 在 1 和 2 之间的对数，即 ln 2 ln 1。也就是 ln 2。现在，如果你把它输入计算器，你会得到类似这样的结果。我希望我把它保存在这里。是的。它大约是 0.693147。这比我们在这里讨论的要多。无论如何，这就是这个数字的大小。

Which we know perfectly well already is the log of x evaluated between 1 and 2, which is ln 2 ln 1. Which is just ln 2. Now, if you punch that into your calculator, you’re going to get something like this. I hope I saved it here. Yeah. It’s about 0.693147. That’s more digits than we’re going to get in our discussion here. Anyway, that’s about how big this number is.

数值积分方法将为您提供与函数本身一样高的精度。当然，有些函数我们可能更难近似。但是函数 1 / x，我们非常清楚该怎么做，因为我们知道如何除法。因此，由于我们在这里积分的函数是 1 / x，因此得到一些算术结果不会太难。

And the numerical integration methods will give you about as much accuracy as you can get on the function itself. And, of course, some functions we may have more trouble approximating. But the function 1 / x, we know pretty well how to do, because we know how to divide. So since the function that we’re integrating here is 1 / x, it’s going to be not too difficult to get some arithmetic.

尽管如此，我还是会用最简单的方式来做这件事。也就是说，只用两个间隔。

Nevertheless, I’m going to do this in the simplest possible case. Namely, just with two intervals.

梯形法则

trapezoidal rule

现在，你真的不能指望事情在两个区间内就能如此顺利地运转。这对你的函数来说是一个非常荒谬的近似。当你有两个区间时，这意味着你正在查看这个双曲线的图形。这里有 1，这里有 2，还有 3/2。你实际上只跟踪这三个点的值。

Now, you really can’t expect things to work so well with two intervals. That’s a pretty ridiculous approximation to your function. When you have two intervals, that means you’re looking at the graph of this hyperbola. And you have 1 here, and you have 2 here and you have 3/2. And you’re really only keeping track of the values at these three spots.

因此，仅通过了解三个位置的值就可以估算面积的想法有点牵强。但我们无论如何都要尝试一下。现在，梯形法则是以下公式。它是 delta x（第一个值的 1/2 + 第二个值的 1/2 + 第三个值的 1/2）。

So the idea that you can approximate the area just by knowing the values of three places is a little bit of a stretch of the imagination. But we’re going to try it anyway. Now, the trapezoidal rule is the following formula. It’s delta x (1/2 the first value + the second value + 1/2 the third value).

在这种情况下，模式是 1/2,1.1,1.1,1.1/2。在这种情况下，delta x = 1/2，因为这个间隔的长度为 1。ba，对。我们在这里指出这一点。这里，b = 2。a = 1。ba = 1。数字 n 是 2。因此，delta x，即 (ba) / n，是 1/2。所以这就是我们得到的。让我们看看这个数字是多少。它是此处值的 1/2。

In this case, the pattern is 1/2,1.1,1.1,1.1/2. And in this case, delta x = 1/2 because this interval’s of length 1. The b a, right. Let’s just point that out here. Here, b = 2. a = 1. b a = 1. And the number n is 2. And so, delta x, which is (b a) / n, is 1/2. So here’s what we get. And let’s just see what this number is. It’s 1/2 of the value at here.

好吧，让我们检查一下这些值是什么。这个值是 1，这里的这个值是 2/3，最后一个值是 1/2。因为函数当然是 y = 1 / x。这就是我们得到的三个值。

Well, so let’s just check what these values are. This value is 1, this value over here is 2/3, and the last value is 1/2. Because the function, of course, was y = 1 / x. And those were the three values that we have.

所以 y_0，这个是 y_0，这个是 y_1，这个是 y_2。现在，我们有 1/2.1 + 2/3 + 1/2 * 1/2。现在，在考试中，我不指望你将像这样的一长串数字相加。当你有两个数字时，我希望你把它们相加（如果它们合理的话），或者减去它们。就像我们取不定积分时所做的那样。

So y_0, this one is y_0, this one is y_1, and this one is y_2. Now, here we have 1/2.1 + 2/3 + 1/2 * 1/2. Now, on an exam, I don’t expect you to add up long messes of numbers like this. When you have two numbers, I expect you to add them up if they’re reasonable, or subtract them. Just as we do when we take antiderivatives.

例如，我不希望你把这种形式的积分答案留给你。我希望你至少把它简化到这里。当然，我也不指望你知道数值近似值。但我当然希望你能做到这一点。另一方面，当算术变得有点长时，你可以放松一点。

Like, for example, I don’t want you to leave the answer to an integration like this in this form. I want you to simplify it at least down to here. And I of course don’t expect you to know the numerical approximation. But I certainly expect you to be able to do that. On the other hand, when the arithmetic gets a little bit long, you can relax a little bit.

但我确实用计算器算过。如果我没记错的话，它大约是 0.96。它相差很大。所以记住它是多少。它是你得到这些直线时得到的结果。那里有一些额外的小碎片。现在，不要太相信它，但关键是它相差很大。

But I did carry this out on my calculator. Unless I’m mistaken, it’s about 0.96. It’s pretty far off. So remember what it was. It’s what you get when you get these straight lines. And there are these little extra pieces of junk there. Now, don’t trust that too much, but the point is that it’s far off.

辛普森规则

Simpsons rule

现在，让我们来看看辛普森规则。我认为辛普森规则出奇地准确。

So now, let’s take a look at Simpson’s Rule. And I claim that Simpson’s Rule is surprisingly accurate.

在这种情况下，实际上，甚至比它应有的还要多一点。公式是 (delta x / 3) (y_0 + 4 y_1 + y_2)。因此模式是 1,4.1，或 1,4，然后它交替使用 2 和 4，直到最后为 4,1。如果我现在插入数字，我得到的是 1/6，因为 delta x 再次 = 1/2。

In this case, really, even a little more than it deserves to be. The formula is (delta x / 3) (y_0 + 4 y_1 + y_2). So the pattern is 1,4.1, or 1,4 and then it alternates 2’s and 4’s until 4,1 at the very end. And if I just plug in the numbers now, what I get is 1/6, because delta x = 1/2 again.

y_0 的值为 1。y_1 的值为 2/3。y_2 的值为 1/2。所以这是本例中的估算值。我仔细计算了一下。结果是 0.69444。如果你仔细想想，这其实相当令人印象深刻。考虑到对数。现在，辛普森规则的一般情况是这样的。如果你。

And the value for y_0 was 1. And the value for y_1 was 2/3. And the value for y_2 was 1/2. So here’s the estimate in this case. And this one I did carry out carefully. And it came out to 0.69444. Which is actually pretty impressive, if you think about it. Given what the logarithm is. Now, what’s going on with Simpson’s Rule in general is this. If you.

辛普森减去准确答案的绝对值大约为 (delta x)^4。这确实是它的行为方式。这意味着，如果 delta x 约为 1/10，那么如果我们将其分成 10 个区间，而我们没有这样做，但如果我们将其分成 10 个区间，那么您可以预期 delta x。误差约为 10^(4)。换句话说，这里的精度为四位数。

Simpson’s minus the exact answer, in absolute value, is approximately of the size of (delta x)^4. That’s really the way it behaves. Which means that if delta x is about 1/10, so if we had divided this up into 10 intervals, which we didn’t, but if we’d divided it up into 10 intervals, then you could expect that delta x. the error would be about 10^( 4). In other words, four digits of accuracy here for this thing.

但是，对此的确切分析，更仔细的分析，都在教科书中。我不会这么做。但我只想指出，这是一种有效的方法。它确实能给你一个易于管理的四位数。你甚至可以手工完成。辛普森规则非常方便。而其他规则在给出相当准确的答案方面并没有那么令人印象深刻。

But the exact analysis of this, a more careful analysis of this, is in your textbook. And I’m not going to do it. But I just want to point out that it is an effective method. It really does give you nice four digit with manageable. you could even really do it by hand. It’s so convenient, the Simpson’s Rule. Whereas the other rules aren’t really that impressive as far as giving fairly accurate answers.

最后要说的是，原因是辛普森规则与抛物线相匹配。不知何故，抛物线更好地遵循了这条曲线。它给出了精确的答案。所以我要提一下这一点。辛普森规则是使用所有 2 次多项式的精确答案推导出来的。换句话说，就是抛物线。所有的抛物线。但甚至是所有低次的抛物线。所以直线可以，常数也可以。

The last little remark to make is that the reason is that Simpson’s Rule is matching a parabola. And somehow the parabola follows this curve better. It’s giving the exact answer. So I’ll mention this. Simpson’s Rule is derived using the exact answer for all degree 2 polynomials. In other words, parabolas. All parabolas. But even all the ones of lower degree. So straight lines would work, and constants would work as well.

而其他的则只适用于直线。梯形法则只适用于直线。但有一个奇怪的意外。事实证明它也适用于三次方程。一旦你得到公式，它就适用于三次方程。所以它对三次方程也是精确的。这就是四阶有效性的解释。我要指出的最后一点是，我在那里说的话非常模糊。

Whereas the other ones only work for, say, straight lines. The trapezoidal rule only works for straight lines. But there is a weird accident. It turns out that it also works for cubics. Once you get the formulas, it works for cubics. So it’s also exact for cubics. And that’s what explains the fourth order validity. The last thing that I want to point out is that this is extremely vague, what I said there.

你应该对此稍微谨慎一点。你需要注意 x 接近 0 时 1/x 的情况。如果函数是奇异函数，那么一切都将不成立。而且那里有很大面积。而且如果导数出错，你也会有麻烦。你真的需要函数漂亮而平滑，才能使辛普森规则发挥作用。这是值得注意的。

And you should be a little bit cautious about it. You need to watch out for 1/x for x near 0. All bets are off if the function is singular. And there’s a lot of area under there. And it’s also true that if the derivative messes up, you’re in trouble too. You really need for the function to be nice and smooth in order for Simpson’s Rule to work. This is wath out.

这确实是一个值得注意的问题，但我们会尽力而为。注意。当 x 接近 0 时，要小心。那么这个东西就不起作用了。这个东西实际上取决于导数的界限。但我对此会相对含糊。我并不是想在这里给你一个错误分析。

That’s a real wath out, but we’ll try to. Watch out. Watch out for whenever x near 0. Then this thing doesn’t work. This thing really depends on bounds on derivatives. But I’m going to be relatively vague about that. I’m not attempting to give you an error analysis here.

记忆装置

Memorization device

好的，那么如果你在考试中这样做，你如何记住这个奇怪的数字模式？

OK, so if you were doing this on an exam, how do you remember this strange pattern of numbers?

我想向你推荐的一件事是，作为一种记忆方法，我们称之为助记符，用于记住你正在做的事情，就是提醒自己最简单的情况会发生什么。即 f(x) = 1。这似乎很谦虚，但如果它没有给你 f(x) = 1 的确切答案，那么你得到的权重就是错误的。

The one thing that I want to recommend to you is, as a way of remembering it, so the one mnemonic device, we’ll call it a mnemonic device here, for remembering what it is that you’re doing, is to remind yourself of what happens for the simplest possible case. Which is f(x) = 1. It seems very modest, but if it doesn’t give you the exact answer for f(x) = 1, you’ve got the wrong weightings.

这里，如果你看看第一个公式 y_0 / 2 + y_1 + 发生了什么，好吧，我们一直到 y_(n 1) + y_n / 2。如果你看看这个公式，这就是梯形法则。如果你看看这个案例，那么你得到的结果是，这等于 delta x 乘以多少？好吧，所有这些都是 1。中间有多少个？

And here, if you check out what happens in the first formula here, y_0 / 2 + y_1 +., well, we’ll go all the way to y_(n 1) + y_n / 2. If you check that formula out here, this is the trapezoidal rule. If you check it out for this case, then what you get is that this is equal to delta x times what? Well, all of these are 1’s. And how many are there in the middle?

中间有 n 1 个。所以是 1/2 + n 1 + 1/2。在尾端。所以总和是 delta x n。我提醒你 delta x = b a / n。所以，delta x，这个东西，等于 b a。这正是应该的。我们刚刚计算的是这个积分的近似值。

There are n 1 of them in the middle. So it’s 1/2 + n 1 + 1/2. At the tail end. So all told it’s delta x n. And I remind you that delta x = b a / n. So, delta x, this thing, is equal to b a. And that’s just as it should be. What we just calculated is an approximation to this integral here.

这只是底面为 ba、高为 1 的矩形的面积。当然是 b a。所以这是检查你在这里得到的加权平均值是否正确。你对所有内容都赋予了正确的权重。你可以用辛普森规则做同样的事情。并匹配这些数量。房间里有人问了一个问题。不，好的。

Which is just the area of the rectangle of base b a and height 1. Which of course is b a. So this is the check that you got your weighted average correct here. You’ve put the correct weightings on everything. And you can do this same thing with Simpson’s Rule. And match up those quantities. There was a question in the room at some point. No, OK.

现在，我要为你做的下一件事是我留下的悬而未决的问题。也就是说，我要计算那个神秘的常数 π/2 的平方根。这确实是微积分中最著名的计算之一。这是一个非常非常聪明的技巧。我当然不指望你能想出这个技巧。我当然不会指望我自己。但这是一个重要的计算。而且它非常有用。

So now, the next thing I want to do for you is the loose end which I left hanging. Namely, I want to compute that mysterious constant square root of pi / 2. This is really one of the most famous computations in calculus. And it’s a very, very clever trick. I certainly don’t expect you to come up with this trick. I certainly wouldn’t have myself. But it’s an important thing to calculate. And it’s just very useful.

所以我来告诉你们。这正是我们在这个单元中要处理的主题；即切片。或者说加起来。所以第一步，也就是我们已经做过的事情，就是找到这条曲线下的体积。这条钟形曲线，e^(r^2)。但绕着一个轴旋转。绕着这个轴旋转。绕着这个方向。所以我们算出来了。这是一个相对较短的计算。

So I’m going to tell you about it. And it’s just on the subject that we’re dealing with in this unit; namely, slicing. Or adding up. So the first step, which is just something that we already did, was that we found the volume under this curve. This bell shaped curve, e^( r^2). But rotated around an axis. Rotated around this axis. Around this way. So we figured that out. And that was a relatively short computation.

我只是想提醒你，它是按壳进行的。我们对从 0 到无穷大的整个范围进行积分。我们有 2 pi r 2 pi re^( r^2) dr。所以这又是壳的周长。这是壳的高度，这是壳的厚度。周长、高度、厚度。所以我们在这里取一小块并扫描它。然后加起来。然后这个不定积分就是 pi。pi e^( r^2)，在 0 和无穷大处求值。我们上次算出来了。这是 pi。它是 pi (1 0)。也就是 pi。所以结论是 V = pi。我们已经知道了。现在，我们要处理的问题不是体积问题，而是面积问题。这看起来完全不同。当然答案也会不同。但让我们开始吧。

I’m just going to remind you, it goes by shells. We integrate the whole range from 0 to infinity. And we have 2 pi r 2 pi r e^( r^2) dr. So this again is the circumference of the shell. This is the height of the shell, and this is the thickness of the shell. Circumference, height, thickness. So we’re just taking a little piece here and sweeping it around. And then adding up. And then this antiderivative is pi. pi e^( r^2), evaluated at 0 and infinity. And we worked this out last time. This is pi. It’s pi (1 0). Which is pi. So the conclusion is that V = pi. We already know that. Now, the problem that we want to deal with now is the problem not of a volume, but an area. And this looks quite different. And of course the answer is going to be different. But let’s do it.

这就是这里的问号。我要从负无穷到无穷画一个。我会把它与我们在本单元前面讨论过的内容联系起来，几分钟后我会向你们展示我们将要遵循的程序。这是数量，现在，它被解释为这个钟形曲线下的面积。这次，Q 实际上是面积。

So this is this question mark here. And I’m going to do the one from minus infinity to infinity. And I’ll relate it to what we talked about earlier in this unit, in just a couple of minutes when I show you the procedure that we’re going to follow. So here’s the quantity and now, what this is interpreted as is the area under this bell curve. This time, Q is really an area.

现在，结果会是这样的。这就是诀窍。我们将以不同的方式计算 V。您将在一秒钟内看到它的布局。我们将通过切片来计算 V。我们将像切面包一样将其切成薄片。我们将在这里解决同样的问题。

Now, what’s going to turn out to happen, is this. This is the trick. We’re going to compute V in a different way. And you’ll see it laid out in just a second. We will compute V by slices. We’re going to slice it like a piece of bread here. We’re going to solve for that same thing here.

然后，令人惊奇的是，我们将发现 V = Q^2。这就是结果。这就是我们想要的计算结果。因为实际上我们已经知道 V 是多少。我们不想把这个等式往前读。我们想反过来读。我们想说 Q^2 = V，我们已经知道它是 pi。

And then, amazingly, what’s going to happen is that we will discover that V = Q^2. That’s going to be what’s going to come out. And that’s the end of the computation that we want. Because actually we already know what V is. We don’t want to read this equation forward. We want to read it the other way. We want to say Q^2 = V, which we already know is pi.

因此 Q 等于 π 的平方根。我还没有展示这一点，这是很奇怪的部分。我要把它放在一个小盒子里，这样我们就知道这是我们需要检查的。我们需要在这里检查这个事实。我们还没有这样做。现在，让我把它和我们几天前做的事情联系起来。

And so Q is equal to the square root of pi. I haven’t shown this yet, this is the weird part. And I’m going to put it in a little box so that we know that this is what we need to check. We need to check this fact here. We haven’t done that yet. Now, let me connect this with what we did a few days ago.

我称之为数学除了你们已经知道的功能之外的重要功能之一。

With what I called one of the important functions of mathematics besides the ones you already know.

渐近线

The Asymptote

因此，我们所面对的和所讨论的函数就是这个。然后，我们对无穷大处的值感兴趣。我们对此感兴趣。如果你画出它的图，并画出相同的钟形曲线，那就是一半以下的面积。

And so the function that we were faced with, and that we discussed, was this one. And then, we were interested in the value at infinity. We were interested in this. Which, if you draw a picture of it, and you draw the same bell curve, that’s the area under half. of it.

这是从 0 开始到无穷大的面积。这是一半以下的面积。所以这块是无穷大的 F。现在我希望这部分连接不是故意花哨。这里的想法是 Q = 2 F（无穷大）。这个数字在这里。所以 F（无穷大）等于 pi 除以 2 的平方根，如果我们相信我们在上一节中所说的。

That’s the area starting from 0 and going to infinity. That’s the area under half. So this chunk is F of infinity. And now I hope that this part of the connection is not meant to be fancy. The idea here is that Q = 2 F(infinity). This number here. And so F(infinity) is equal to the square root of pi over 2, if we believe what we said on the last panel.

这就是我在黑板上画的图。也就是说，F 的图看起来像这样。这里有一条渐近线，也就是极限 F(x) 趋向于 pi/2 的平方根，当 x 趋向无穷大时。这就是极限值。也就是无穷大的 F。所以这就是渐近线。

And that was the thing that I drew a picture of on the board. Namely, the graph of F looked like this. And there was this asymptote, which was the limit F(x) tends to square root of pi over 2, as x goes to infinity. That was that limiting value. Which is F of infinity. So this is the asymptote.

现在我已经解释了我们之前声称的（这很神秘）和我们现在实际上能够检查的内容之间的联系。具体来说，通过进行此计算。

And now I’ve explained the connection between what we claimed before, which was quite mysterious, and what we’re actually going to be able to check now. Concretely, by making this computation.

切片

Slices

那么你究竟如何才能得到这样的结果呢？那个橙色盒子里是什么？V = Q^2。同样，这里的技巧是使用切片。我将为你绘制一个 3D 图片来可视化切片。让我们这样做。

So how in the world can you get something like this. What’s in that orange box there, that V = Q^2. Again, the technique is to use slices here. And I’m going to have to draw you a 3 D picture to visualize the slice. Let’s do that.

我现在要画三根轴，因为我们现在处于三维空间中，我想让你们想象 x 轴从黑板出来，y 轴是水平的，还有一个新的轴，我称之为 z 轴，它是向上的。所以这里发生的事情就是我在思考这个。如果你愿意的话，这是某种侧视图。

I’m going to draw three axes now, because we’re now going to be in three dimensional space, and I want you to imagine the x axis as coming out of the blackboard, the y axis is horizontal, and there’s a new axis, which I’ll call the z axis, which is going up. So what’s happening here is that I’m thinking of this. This is, if you like, some kind of side view.

这是我稍微向上倾斜的视图。现在，分布，或者你可以想象平面上的这个目标，最有可能击中的地方在中间，而它逐渐消失。随着我们往下走。现在，我想画一张这张图。我要画一张 e^(r^2) 的图。它基本上是一个驼峰。所以我要取第一个。

And this is a view where I’ve tilted things a little bit up to the top. Now, the distribution, or you could think of this target in the plane, where the most likely places to hit were in the middle and it died off. As we went down. Now, I want to draw a picture of this graph. I’m going to draw a picture of e^( r^2). And it’s basically a hump. So I’m going to take the first.

沿 y = 0 的切片。y = 0 的切片。我声称它像这样向上。然后又向下。让我把它涂黑，这样你就能看到这是什么样的切片。这应该是沿着这里的垂直平面。它从黑板出来，朝你飞来。这就是一个切片。

The slice along y = 0. The y = 0 slice. And I claim that goes up like this. And then comes back down. Let me shade this in, so that you can see what kind of a slice this is. This is supposed to be along this vertical plane here. Which is coming out of the blackboard and coming towards you. And that’s a slice.

现在，我要再画一个切片，这样你就能看清楚发生了什么。我要在另一个地方画一个切片。沿着这里。这将是 y = b。另一个层次。现在我要向你展示发生了什么。发生的事情是，驼峰会稍微平缓一些。所以凸起会稍微低一点。它看起来会有点一样。

Now, I’m going to draw one more slice so that you can see what’s happening. I’m going to draw a slice at another place. Along here. This will be y = b. Some other level. And now I’m going to show you what happens. What happens is that the hump dies down a little bit. So the bump is just a little bit lower. And it’s going to look a little bit the same way.

但它会稍微小一点。所以这里还有另一个切片。就像那样。我想给这些切片命名。我将其称为 A(b)。即 b 切片的面积。在表面下。好吗？是的，问题。学生：教授：是的，固体。是的。我们试图通过切片计算出这里的体积，也就是我们开始的体积。所以我首先要考虑。

But it’s just going to be a bit smaller. So there’s another slice here. Like that. And I want to give a name to these slices. I’m going to call this A(b). That is, the area of the b slice. Under the surface. OK? Yes, question. STUDENT: PROFESSOR: Yeah, the solid. Yeah. We’re trying to figure out this volume here, which is the one we started out with, by slices. So first I have to think of.

我要进行视觉想象。这里我甚至没有进行视觉想象。我取了一个横截面，然后思考如何旋转它，而实际上不是在三维空间中旋转。但现在我要进行另一种切片。我要取同样的凸起，即三维物体。我要将其放在平面上。看起来像这样。然后这里就是一个凸起。这是一个驼峰。

I’m going to visualize. So here I didn’t even visualize. I took a cross section and I thought about how to spin it around without actually doing that in three dimensional space. But now I’m going to take a different kind of slice. I’m going to take that same bump, which is a three dimensional object. I’m going to lay it down on a plane. Which looks like this. And then it’s a bump here. It’s a hump.

现在我要试着用各种平面来切割它。学生：教授：正如你刚才建议的那样，定义凸起的一种方法是取这条曲线，然后绕着 z 轴旋转。换句话说，你把这个作为旋转轴，然后旋转它。没错。所以这表明，当你往下走的时候，山峰会以同样的方式下降。

And now I’m going to try to slice it by various planes. STUDENT: PROFESSOR: So one way of defining the bump, as you just suggested, is you take this curve and you rotate it around this z axis. So in other words, you make this the axis of rotation, you spin it around. That’s correct. So that shows you that the peaks as you go down here are going to descend the same way.

但我不想画那些线。我想想象平行切片是什么。因为我不想得到交叉切片。我希望所有切片都平行于同一物体。学生：教授：好的。这不是特别容易想象的。

But I don’t want to draw those lines. I want to imagine what the parallel slices are. Because I don’t want to get cross slices. I want all slices parallel to the same thing. STUDENT: PROFESSOR: OK. This is not particularly easy to visualize.

切片体积

Volume by Slice

现在，这是切片体积的公式。切片体积的公式是将切片的面积相加。就是这样做的。取每一片。

Now, here’s the formula for volume by slices. The formula for volume by slices is that you add up the areas of the slices. That’s how you do it. You take each slice.

你加上横截面积，然后取一点厚度，dy，然后把它们全部加起来。因为这延伸到整个平面，所以我们必须从负无穷到正无穷。这是切片体积的公式。现在我们的目标，为了进行这个计算，我们只需要让 y 等于某个 b。

You add the cross sectional area, and then you take a little thickness, dy, and then you add all of them up. Because this is extending over the whole plane, we’re going to have to go all the way from minus infinity to plus infinity. And this is the formula for volumes by slicing. And now our goal, in order to do this calculation, we’re going to just fix y is equal to some b.

我们只需固定其中一个切片。然后计算 A(b)。这就是使此过程成功所需的操作。这是此方法唯一有效的地方。但这一点很重要。为了使其有效，我必须再次从不同的角度绘制图表。我将绘制顶视图。

We’re just going to fix one of these slices. And we’re going to calculate A(b). That’s what we need to do in order to make this procedure succeed. This is the only place where this method works. But it’s an important one. In order to make it work, I’m going to have to again draw the plot from a different point of view. I’m going to do the top view.

所以我要俯视这里的 xy 平面。这是 x 方向，这是 y 方向。然后我要再次绘制我的切片。我的切片在这里。在 y = b 处。所以我们就在它的正上方。它从某种凸起处向上。这里，中间稍高，两侧向下。现在，高度的公式是这样的。

So I want to look down on this x y plane here. This is the x direction, and here’s the y direction. And then again I want to draw my slice. My slice is here. At y = b. So we’re just right on top of it. And it’s coming up at some kind of bump. Here, with a little higher in the middle and going down on the sides. Now, the formula for the height is this.

如果我在这里取一个距离 r，那么凸起高度的公式就是 e^(r^2)。我会把它存储在这里。e^(r^2) 是此处的高度。如果到原点的距离是 r。这始终是正确的。至于 b 和 x，我们可以通过这个直角三角形算出。这个高度是 b，这个距离是 x。所以 r^2 = b^2 + x^2。问题。学生：教授：。

If I take a distance r here, the formula for the height of the bump is e^( r^2). I’ll store that over here. e^( r^2) is the height at this place. If this distance to the origin is r. That’s true all the way around. And in terms of b and x, we can figure out that by this right triangle. This height is b, and this distance is x. So r^2 = b^2 + x^2. Question. STUDENT: PROFESSOR:.

问题是，这是 xy 平面吗？所以答案是，在这里我巧妙地使用了字母 r。我避免使用 y 和 z 或其他任何东西。在这里，这是距离 r。而您喜欢，这是 z，向上。这就是思考它的方式。这样所有的字母都是一致的。所以我只是避免给它命名。这很好，这正是重点。好吧。

The question is, is that the x y plane. So the answer is that over here I cleverly used the letter r. I avoided using y’s and z’s or anything. And over here, this is the distance r. And you like, this is z, going up. That’s the way to think of it. So that all of the letters are consistent. So I just avoided giving it a name. That’s good, that’s exactly the point. Alright.

现在，我声称我有一个 r^2 公式。所以我可以把它写下来。这个 e^( b^2 + x^2)。但现在我要使用指数规则。也就是说，这等于 e^( b^2) 乘以 e^( x^2)。这将是我们使用此处处理的特定函数的主要方式。令人惊讶的是，这真的是主要步骤。所以现在我要计算 A(b) 是多少。

So now, I claim I have a formula for r^2. And so I can write this down. This e^( b^2 + x^2). But now I’m going to use the rule of exponents. Which is that this is the same as e^( b^2) times e^( x^2). And that’s going to be the main way in which we use the particular function that we’re dealing with here. That’s really the main step, amazingly. So now I get to compute what A(b) is.

A(b) 是曲线下的面积。所以，让我把它写在这里，A(b) 是这条曲线下的面积。它是一些常数时间。所以如果你想象，把这个东西称为 c。在某条曲线下，ce^(x^2)。其中 c 等于 e^(b^2)。这就是我们的切片。事实上，它看起来像其中之一。它看起来像其中一个凸起。下面是它的公式。

A(b) is the area under a curve. So it’s going to be, let me write it over here, A(b) is the area under this curve here. Which is some constant times. so if you imagine, call this thing the name c. Under some curve, ce^( x^2). Where the c is equal to e^( b^2). That’s what our slice is. In fact, it looks like one of those. It looks like one of those bumps. Here’s its formula again.

这是 e^( b^2) e^( x^2) dx 从负无穷到无穷的积分。我们刚刚复制了我上面的东西。这是每个 x 值的高度，b 固定。现在，我们这里有很多步骤。但每个步骤都很简单。第一个就是指数定律。我们可以将两者拆分为乘积。现在我要进一步拆分。

It’s the integral from minus infinity to infinity of e^( b^2) e^( x^2) dx. We just recopied what I had up there. And this is the height at each value of x, with b fixed. And now, so we have a lot of steps here. But each of them is very elementary. The first one was just that law of exponents. That we could split the two into products. Now I’m going to make that splitting even further.

这是一个常数。它不随 x 变化。所以我要把它从积分中分解出来。这是 e^( b^2) 乘以从负无穷到无穷的 e^( x^2) dx 的积分。这看起来可能很吓人，但实际上这只是积分的性质。所有积分都有这种性质。你总是可以分解出一个常数。现在出现了一件了不起的事情。

This is a constant. It’s not varying with x. So I’m going to factor it out of the integral. This is e^( b^2) times the integral from minus infinity to infinity of e^( x^2) dx. So this might look frightening, but actually it’s just the property of an integral. All integrals have this kind of property. You can always factor out a constant. And now here comes the remarkable thing.

这是 e^( b^2) 乘以一个我们现在熟悉的数字。这个数字是什么？这就是我们要找的。这是我们的未知数 Q。所以我计算了 A(b)，现在我准备解决这个问题。A(b) = e^( b^2) Q。Q 是我们还不知道的奇怪数字。它是什么。所以现在我要计算整个体积。

This is e^( b^2) times a number which is now familiar to us. What is this number? This is what we’re looking for. This is our unknown, Q. So I’ve computed A(b), and now I’m ready to finish the problem off. A(b) = e^( b^2) Q. Q is that strange number which we don’t know yet. What it is. So now I’m going to compute the whole volume.

记住，整个体积就在那里，从负无穷到无穷，A(y) dy。现在我要代入我们为 A 找到的公式。现在我对每个 b 都这样做，所以我对所有 b 都这样做。所以我有从负无穷到无穷的积分。这里我有 e^( y^2)。我用 y 替换了 b。现在我有 Q。我有 dy。

The whole volume, remember, it’s over there, it’s minus infinity to infinity, A(y) dy. And now I’m just going to plug in the formula that we’ve found for A. Now I’m doing this for each b, so I’m doing it varying over all b’s. So I have the integral from minus infinity to infinity. And here I have e^( y^2). I’ve replaced b by y. And now I have Q. And I have dy.

我刚刚将我之前的内容复制到切片公式中。现在，我要再次使用这个技巧，将常数分解出来。这是一个常数。它不依赖于 y。对于所有 y 来说，它都是一样的，只是会分解出来。所以这等于 Q 乘以从负无穷到无穷的积分，e^( y^2) dy。现在，瞧，这里有这个表达式。

I just recopied what I had over there into the formula for slicing. And now, I’m going to do this trick of factoring out the constant a second time. This is a constant. It doesn’t depend on y. It’s the same for all y, it just will factor out. So this is the same as Q times the integral from minus infinity to infinity, e^( y^2) dy. And now, lo and behold, this expression here.

当然，请注意我是如何定义 Q 的。让我们仔细回到 Q 的定义处。这是 Q。这个 t 是一个虚拟变量。我怎么称呼它并不重要。我可以称它为 x，我可以称它为 u，我可以称它为 v。在这种情况下，我给了它两个不同的名字。在这个阶段，我称它为 x。在这个阶段，我称它为 y。但它是同一个变量。

Of course, notice how I defined Q. Let’s go back carefully to where Q is defined. Here’s Q. This t is a dummy variable. It doesn’t matter what I call it. I can call it x, I can call it u, I can call it v. In this case, I’ve given it two different names. At this stage, I called it x. And at this stage I’m calling it y. But it’s the same variable.

所以这一小块就是 Q，总共有两个，因为 Q^2 是总数。这就是论证的结束。这真是一个奇迹。学生：教授：好问题。问题是，等一下。当 y 改变时，x 不会改变吗？那么这将不是一个常数。这就是我们在整个课程中使用字母 x 和 y 的方式。

And so this little chunk is Q and altogether I have two of them, for Q^2 being the total. And that’s the end of the argument. It’s a real miracle. STUDENT: PROFESSOR: Great question. The question is, wait a minute. As y changes, doesn’t x change. And so then this wouldn’t be a constant. So that’s the way in which we’ve used the letters x and y in this whole course.

当你达到 18.02 时，你几乎再也不会这样做了。y 和 x 总是不同的变量。而且它们不必相互依赖。现在，让我向你展示 x 和 y 在这幅图上的位置。我们有一个完整的 xy 平面，在这里我固定 y = b，y 没有变化。而 x 在变化。换句话说，除非我固定它，否则 x 和 y 之间没有关系。

When you get to 18.02, you’ll almost never do that. Always y and x will be different variables. And they won’t have to depend on each other. Now, let me show you where on this picture the x and the y are. We’ve got a whole x y plane, and here I’m fixing y = b, y isn’t varying. Whereas x is changing. So, in other words, I don’t have a relationship between x and y, unless I fix it.

在这种情况下，我决定 y 是常数。对于所有 x。在这里，我进行了计算。我有一个 Q，它只是一个数字。无论我取哪个 b，都无关紧要。无论哪个 y 等于 b。当然，我将名称改为 b，这样你就不会感到那么不舒服。但事实上，这个 b 一直都是 y。

In this case I’ve decided that y is going to be constant. For all x. Over here, I made a computation. And I have a Q, which is just a single number. No matter which b I took, it didn’t matter which. No matter which y equals b. Of course, I changed the name to b so it wouldn’t be so jarring to you. But in fact this b was y all along.

只是 x 完全独立于 y 而变化。我可以固定 y 而改变 x，也可以固定 x 而改变 y。所以这是字母的不同用法。与你习惯的用法不同。碰巧 y 不是 x 的函数。在这种情况下。是的。学生：教授：是的。学生：教授：问题是，因为我绕着 z 轴旋转，所以 x 的变化不是和 y 的变化一样大吗？

It’s just that the x varied completely independently of the y. I could fix the y and vary the x, I could fix the x and vary the y. So it’s a different use of the letters. From what you’re used to. It happens that y is not a function of x. In this case. Yes. STUDENT: PROFESSOR: Yes. STUDENT: PROFESSOR:. The question is, because I’m rotating around the z axis, doesn’t x change exactly as much as y does.

实际情况是，x 和 y 是对称变量。它们可以平等对待。但如果我决定对 y 固定、x 变化的情况进行切片，那么它们当然现在就分开了，我对 x 和 y 分别扮演不同的角色。或者，如果我以另一种方式切片，我会得到相同的答案。我只是会颠倒 x 和 y 的角色。

What happens is that x and y are symmetric variables. They can be treated equally. But if I decide to take slices with respect to y being fixed and x varying, then of course they’re now separated, and I have a separate role for the x and a separate role for the y. Or if I’d sliced it the other way, I would have gotten the same answer. I just would have reversed the roles of x and y.

所以发生的事情是，在这幅图中，x 和 y 处于平等地位，我本可以以另一种方式切割。我会得到相同的答案。这或多或少就是你问题的答案。好的。

So what’s happening is that x and y are on equal footing with each other in this picture, and I could’ve sliced the other way. I would have gotten the same answer. That’s more or less the answer to your question. OK.

考试题目

Exam Questions

现在我给你一份复习表，我想简要地介绍一下考试的内容。这份考试问题清单就是考试的内容。

Now I have given you a review sheet, and I want to run through, briefly, what’s going to be on the exam. And this list of exam questions is what’s going to be on the exam.

有，抱歉，显示不正确。所以，考试题目，但现在我只想向你展示它们是什么。考试中有五道题目。它们与你去年的题目完全相似。所以你应该看看那份试卷。它值得一看。你会在这张表的描述中看到，我所描述的就是那份试卷的内容。

There are, sorry this is not displayed correctly. So, exam questions, but now I’m just going to show you what they are. There are five questions on the exam. They are completely parallel to what you got last year. So you should look at that test. It’s worth looking at. And you’ll see in the descriptions on this sheet that what I’m describing is what’s on that test.

那么接下来会发生什么呢？这也发布在网上，你需要使用微积分基本定理计算一些定积分。进行数值近似。会用到黎曼定理、梯形定理和辛普森定理。计算面积和体积。然后是其他一些累计和。要么是平均值，要么是概率，要么是工作量。然后画出一个以这种形式给出的函数作为积分。

So what’s going to happen is and this is also posted on the Web is that you’ll be expected to calculate some definite integrals using the fundamental theorem of calculus. Do a numerical approximation. There’ll be a Riemann, a trapezoidal rule and a Simpson’s Rule. Calculate areas and volumes. And then some other cumulative sum. Either an average value or probability or perhaps work. And sketch a function which is given in this form as an integral.

这些都是问题，从去年考试的例子中，你会看到完全相同的风格。它们确实非常相似。是的，问题。学生：教授：好的，好问题。那么问题是，对于黎曼和，上和下、右和左有什么区别？

So those are the questions, and you’ll see by the example of last year’s exam exactly the style. They’re really going to be very similar. Yes, question. STUDENT: PROFESSOR: OK, good question. So the question is, for Riemann sums, what’s the difference between upper and lower, and right and left?

黎曼和

Riemann Sum

所以这里我们有一个黎曼和。

So here we have a Riemann sum.

我要给你一张图，可能是这个函数 y = 1 / x，也就是我们之前讨论过的那个函数。如果你把函数 y = 1 / x 分解成几部分，不管有多少部分，我们假设有四部分。那么下黎曼和就是下面的楼梯。

And I’m going to give you a picture which is, maybe this function y = 1 / x, which was the one that we were discussing earlier. If you take the function y = 1 / x and you break it up into pieces here, however it doesn’t matter how many pieces, let’s just say there are four of them. Then the lower Riemann sum is the staircase which fits underneath.

这是下部和的图片。它总是较小。在递减函数的情况下，它会是，所以如果你愿意，因为 1 / x 减少，下部和等于右部和。你可以在这张图片上直观地看到这一点。你要选择的值将是矩形的右端。上部和是左边的。

So this one is a picture of the lower sum. It’s always less. And in the case of a decreasing function, it’s going to be, so since if you like, since 1 / x decreases, the lower sum equals the right sum. You can see that visually on this picture. The values you’re going to select are going to be the right ends of the rectangles. The upper sum is the left one.

现在，如果函数上下摆动，那么你必须选择合适的一侧。或者，如果在中间达到最大值，那么它可能是一个中间点。是的，另一个问题。学生：教授：正确。如果函数是递增的，那么下和就是左和。所以它正好反转了这里的内容。所以这是递减的，下和是右和。递增的，下和是左和。学生：教授：是的。

Now, if the function wiggles up and down, then you have to pick whichever side is appropriate. Or maybe it’ll be a point in the middle, if the maximum is achieved in the middle. Yeah, another question. STUDENT: PROFESSOR: Correct. If the function is increasing, then the lower sum is the left sum. So it just exactly reverses what’s here. So this is decreasing, lower sum is right hand sum. Increasing, lower sum is left hand sum. STUDENT: PROFESSOR: Yes.

学生：教授：好问题。假设你在最后一个问题中遇到了这样的函数。一般来说，这些都是最棘手的问题。问题是，你如何才能确定渐近线，甚至确定是否存在渐近线。答案是，你无法确定。当它趋向无穷大时，跟踪正在发生的事情将非常棘手。

STUDENT: PROFESSOR: Good question. Suppose you’re faced with a function like this in this last problem. Which, generally, these are the trickiest problems. And the question is, how are you ever going to be able to decide on an asymptote, even whether there is an asymptote. And the answer is, you’re not. It’s going to be pretty tricky to get keep track of what’s happening as it goes to infinity.

我们在作业中举了一个例子，其中 是振荡的，并且非常不清楚发生了什么。你必须对此进行非常长时间的分析。所以事实上，现在不用担心这个。在课程的最后，我们将讨论一下这些渐近线。实际上，第一个问题是它们是否存在。这甚至是一件大事。

We had an example on the homework where is was oscillating and it’s very unclear what’s going on. You have to do a very long analysis for that. So in fact, just don’t worry about that now. At the very end of the class, we’ll talk a little bit about these asymptotes. And really, the first issue is whether they exist or not. And that’s even something.

这是一个严肃的问题，我们将在本课程的最后解决。学生：教授：没错。不会太复杂。还有其他问题吗？我们还有整整五分钟的时间，如果没有人有问题，我可以举一个例子。是的。学生：教授：问题是，呃，我会告诉你使用哪一个吗？学生：教授：当我告诉你数值近似值时，你会在考试中看到。

That’s a serious question which we’ll address at the very end of this course. STUDENT: PROFESSOR: That’s right. It’s not going to be anything that complicated. Other questions? We we still have a five whole minutes, and I have an example to give, if nobody has a question. Yeah. STUDENT: PROFESSOR:. The question, uh, will I tell you which one of what to use? STUDENT: PROFESSOR: When I tell you the numeric approximation is, you’ll see on the exam.

你的模拟考试。我会问你这三个问题。我会问你黎曼和、梯形法则和辛普森法则。我保证这三个问题都会在考试中出现。我保证那张试卷上的每一个问题都会在考试中出现。你会在考试中看到它。它与那里的内容完全平行。

The practice exam that you have. I will ask you for all three. I will ask you for the Riemann sum, the trapezoidal rule, and the Simpson’s rule. I’m guaranteeing you they’ll all three be on the exam. I’m guaranteeing that every single thing which is on that piece of paper is on the exam. And you’ll see it on the exam that you’ve got. It’s exactly parallel to what’s there.

学生：教授：那么对于面积和体积，问题是我会告诉你使用哪种方法吗？让我们来讨论一下。

STUDENT: PROFESSOR: So with areas and volume, the question is will I tell you which method to use. So let’s discuss that.

卷

Volumes

因此，对于面积和体积，基本上都是如此。所以对于面积来说，这总是正确的。对于旋转的体积来说，也是如此。顺便说一句，你应该读一下这张表。我并没有说完这里的所有内容。但你应该读一读。因为它们都是相关的。

So with areas and volumes, there’s basically. So this is always true with areas. And it’s true with volumes of revolution. By the way you should read this sheet. Not everything that’s on here have I said. But you should read it. Because it’s all relevant.

因此，对于旋转体积，你总是可以回到某个二维图。所以总会有一些二维图。二维图总是与这些问题相关。我的意思是，这么难的东西在考试中真的太难了，对吧？我的意思是，我不会在考试中问你这么复杂的东西。因为这涉及到三维可视化。

So with volumes of revolution, you always work your way back to some 2 D diagram. So there’s some 2 D diagram which is always. two dimensional diagram, which is always connected with these problems. I mean, something this hard is really just too hard to do on an exam, right? I mean, I’m not going to ask you something this complicated on the exam. Because this involves a three dimensional visualization.

但是一旦你降到 2 D，你应该能够处理它。现在，在你得到 2 D 图之后的主要问题是什么？主要问题是，你想对 dx 还是 dy 进行积分？答案是，这取决于具体情况。

But once you’re down to 2 D, you’re supposed to be able to handle it. Now, what’s the main issue after you’ve got your 2 D diagram? The main issue is, do you want to integrate with respect to dx or dy? And the answer is that it will depend.

如果有一种会给你带来极大的困难，而且我觉得你无法躲避它，那么我可能会给你一个提示，说你最好使用炮弹，或者你最好使用圆盘或垫圈或类似的东西。但如果我觉得你已经足够成熟，能够弄清楚是哪一个，因为其中一个太荒谬了，你会在考虑之后立即说算了。

And if there’s one that’s going to cause you incredible difficulty, and I feel that you’re not able to dodge it, then I might give you a hint and say you’d better use shells, or you’d better use disks or washers or something like that. But if I feel that you’re grown up enough to figure out which one it is, because one of them is so ridiculous you say forget it, immediately, after thinking about it.

那我就不告诉你是哪一个了。因为换言之，我不想让你浪费时间。但我愿意浪费你一两分钟的时间在徒劳无功的事情上。让我给你举个例子。假设你正在看 0 和 xx^3 之间的曲线 y。所以这是某种块状。就像这样。

Then I won’t tell you which one. Because I figure, in other words, I don’t want you to waste your time. But I’m willing to waste a minute or two of your time on a wild goose chase. So let me give you an example of this. Suppose you’re looking at the curve y between 0 and x x^3. So this is some kind of lump. Like this.

它从 0 到 1，因为右边在 0 处是 0，在这里是 1。这是某种东西。有两种可能性。其中一种是做壳。然后，这应该绕 y 轴旋转。在这种情况下。实际上，这同样适用于面积问题。所以我在做一个稍微复杂一点的问题。

It goes from 0 to 1, because the right hand side is 0 at 0 and 1 here. It’s some kind of thing. And there are these two possibilities. One of them is to do shells. And then, so this is supposed to be rotated around the y axis. In this case. And the same would apply, actually, to the area problem. So I’m doing a slightly more complicated problem.

但是你可以求出下面的面积，等等。好的。所以我们可以对这个 dx 求积分，或者对这个 dy 求积分。这表明我决定这个厚度为 dx，然后对 dx 求积分。这就是我所做的选择。现在，我做出选择的那一刻，我就知道这些是壳。因为它们以这种方式扫过，这使它们成为壳。圆柱形壳。

But you could ask for the area underneath this, and so forth. OK. So we can integrate this dx, or we can integrate this dy. This indicates that I’m deciding that this is going to be of thickness dx, and I’m integrating dx. So that’s a choice that I’m making. Now, the minute I made that choice I know that these are shells. Because they sweep around this way and that makes them shells. Cylindrical shells.

如果我这样做，设置是这样的。它是 2 pi x (xx^3) dx。现在，我声称当你到达这一点时，你已经知道你赢了。因为这是一个容易计算的积分。所以你在这里完成了。你很高兴。现在，如果你碰巧说，哦，天哪，我讨厌这样做。我想做一些聪明的事情，你可以尝试用这种方式切割。让我们这样做。

And if I do that, the setup is this. It’s 2 pi x (x x^3) dx. Now, I claim that when you get to this point, you already know you’ve won. Because this is an easy integral to calculate. So you’re done here. You’re happy. Now, if you happened to say, oh gee, I hate to do this. I want to do something clever, you could try to do it with cutting this way. Let’s do this.

这就是 dy 厚度。然后当你扫过它时，你得到我们所说的垫圈。这实际上只是两个圆盘之间的差异。所以这里的形状是这个东西绕着这个轴摆动。它看起来像这样。所以这将是半径的差异。那么这个公式是什么呢？

And this would be the dy thickness. And then when you sweep this around, you get what we call a washer. Which is really just the difference of two disks. So the shape here is this thing swung around this axis. And it looks like this. So it’s going to be the difference of radii. So what’s the formula for this?

这是 pi 乘以右端（我将其称为 x_2）和左端（我将其称为 x_1）的积分。所以这是 pi (x_2^2 x_1^2) dy。现在，在这个阶段，你已经认为这比其他方法更复杂。所以你已经放弃了它。但我将更进一步研究这个问题，看看到底发生了什么。

It’s some integral of pi times the right end, which I’ll call x_2, and here the left end, which I’ll call x_1. So this is pi (x_2^2 x_1^2) dy. Now, already at this stage, you think to yourself this is more complicated than the other method. So you’ve already abandoned it. But I’m just going to go one step further into this one to see what it is that’s happening.

如果你试图找出 x_1 和 x_2 的值，这相当于用 y 来解 x_1 和 x_2。这就是下面的等式。x_1 和 x_2 解这个方程。曲线 x x^3 等于 y。现在，看看这个方程。这就是方程 x^3。对不起，我想是 x^3 x + y。让我们看看。是的，没错，等于 0。这是一个三次方程。虽然有一个公式可以解释这个。

If you try to figure out what these values x_1 and x_2 are, that corresponds to solving for x_1 and x_2 in terms of y. So that’s the following equation. x_1 and x_2 solve the equation that. the curve, x x^3 is equal y. Now, look at this equation. That’s the equation x^3. sorry, x^3 x + y, I guess. Let’s see. Yeah, that’s right, is equal to 0. This is a cubic equation. Although there is a formula for this.

你从未学过这个方程的公式。因此，你永远无法得到 x_2 和 x_1 作为 y 函数的公式。你永远无法计算这个公式。这不仅仅是一条死胡同，它就像崩溃、燃烧，你知道，自毁。所以可能会有这样的事情，所以换个方式吧。祝大家好运。

You’ve never been taught the formula for this equation. So therefore, you will never, ever be able to get a formula for x_2 and x_1 as a function of y. And you’ll never be able to compute this one. This is more than just a dead end, it’s like crash, burn, and, you know, self destruct. So there may be such a thing, so do the other way. Good luck, folks.

Lec 27 | MIT 18.01 单变量微积分，2007 年秋季

Lec 27 | MIT 18.01 Single Variable Calculus, Fall 2007

15 年前 (2009 年 9 月 10 日) — 46:45 https://youtube.com/watch?v=Bv9kVDcj7yo

15 years ago (Sep 10, 2009) — 46:45 https://youtube.com/watch?v=Bv9kVDcj7yo

介绍

Introduction

以下内容根据 Creative Commons 许可提供。您的支持将帮助 MIT OpenCourseWare 继续免费提供高质量的教育资源。要捐款或查看数百门 MIT 课程的其他材料，请访问 MIT OpenCourseWare，网址为 ocw.mit.edu。教授：好吧，因为我们今天的主题是三角积分和代换，所以杰里森教授今天请来了他的代课老师。那就是我。米勒教授。

The following content is provided under a Creative Commons license. Your support will help MIT OpenCourseWare continue to offer high quality educational resources for free. To make a donation, or to view additional materials from hundreds of MIT courses, visit MIT OpenCourseWare at ocw.mit.edu. PROFESSOR: Well, because our subject today is trig integrals and substitutions, Professor Jerison called in his substitute teacher for today. That’s me. Professor Miller.

我将尝试向你们介绍三角代换和三角积分。明天我还会在这里做更多相同的事情。

And I’m going to try to tell you about trig substitutions and trig integrals. And I’ll be here tomorrow to do more of the same, as well.

三角函数

Trigonometry

这是关于三角学的，我要做的第一件事就是提醒大家一些关于三角学的基本知识。如果我有一个圆，三角学就是以半径 1 为圆心，以原点为圆心的圆。

So, this is about trigonometry, and maybe first thing I’ll do is remind you of some basic things about trigonometry. So, if I have a circle, trigonometry is all based on the circle of radius 1 and centered at the origin.

因此，如果这是从 x 轴向上的 θ 角，那么该点的坐标就是余弦 θ 和正弦 θ。这样就立即引出了一些三角恒等式，你们非常熟悉。但我要把它们放在这里，因为我们今天会反复使用它们。

And so if this is an angle of theta, up from the x axis, then the coordinates of this point are cosine theta and sine theta. And so that leads right away to some trig identities, which you know very well. But I’m going to put them up here because we’ll use them over and over again today.

记住，sin^2 theta 的约定暗指 (sin theta)^2。在 theta 的正弦上写一个括号，然后说你将其平方，这样更合理。但世界上每个人都把 2 放在 sin 的上方，所以我也会这样做。

Remember the convention sin^2 theta secretly means (sin theta)^2. It would be more sensible to write a parenthesis around the sine of theta and then say you square that. But everybody in the world puts the 2 up there over the sin, and so I’ll do that too.

半角公式

Half Angle Formula

因为圆的半径为 1，所以结论成立。但还有其他一些恒等式，我想你们还记得。我会把它们写在这里。

So that follows just because the circle has radius 1. But then there are some other identities too, which I think you remember. I’ll write them down here.

Cos(2theta)，有一个双角度公式，即 cos(2theta) = cos^2(theta) sin^2(theta)。还有 sin(2theta) 的双角度公式。还记得它说的是什么吗？2 sin(theta) cos(theta)。我将使用这些三角恒等式，我将以略有不同的方式使用它们。因此，我想多关注一下这个公式，并找到一种不同的写法。所以这实际上是半角度公式。

Cos(2theta), there’s this double angle formula that says cos(2theta) = cos^2(theta) sin^2(theta). And there’s also the double angle formula for the sin(2theta). Remember what that says? 2 sin(theta) cos(theta). I’m going to use these trig identities and I’m going to use them in a slightly different way. And so I’d like to pay a little more attention to this one and get a different way of writing this one out. So this is actually the half angle formula.

也就是说，我将尝试用 cos(2theta) 来表示 cos(theta)。所以，如果我知道 cos(2theta)，我想尝试用它来表示 cos theta。好吧，我将从 cos(2theta) 开始，然后尝试一下。好的。好吧，我们知道这是什么，它是 cos^2(theta) sin^2(theta)。但我们也知道 sin^2(theta) 用余弦表示是什么。所以我可以从这张图片中消除 sin^2。

And that says, I’m going to try to express the cos(theta) in terms of the cos(2theta). So if I know the cos(2theta), I want to try to express the cos theta in terms of it. Well, I’ll start with a cos(2theta) and play with that. OK. Well, we know what this is, it’s cos^2(theta) sin^2(theta). But we also know what the sin^2(theta) is in terms of the cosine. So I can eliminate the sin^2 from this picture.

所以这等于 cos^2(theta) 减去 1 cos^2(theta)。我把 sin^2 换算成 cos^2 的结果代入，这就是 2 cos^2(theta) 1。这是 cos^2，它有一个加号。因为有两个减号。还有一个之前就有的减号，所以总共有两个。我想找出余弦是什么。或者说，cos^2 是什么。让我们来解决这个问题。

So this is equal to cos^2(theta) minus the quantity 1 cos^2(theta). I put in what sin^2 is in terms of cos^2 And so that’s 2 cos^2(theta) 1. There’s this cos^2, which gets a plus sign. Because of these two minus signs. And there’s the one that was there before, so altogether there are two of them. I want to isolate what cosine is. Or rather, what cos^2 is. So let’s solve for that.

所以我把 1 放在另一边。我得到 1 + cos(2theta)。然后，我要除以这个 2，这样这个分母就变成 2。所以有些人称之为半角公式。对我们来说，它实际上是一种消除正弦和余弦幂的方法。我在这里放入 2theta，从而去掉了这个平方。我们会用到它。

So I’ll put the 1 on the other side. And I get 1 + cos(2theta). And then, I want to divide by this 2, and so that puts a 2 in this denominator here. So some people call that the half angle formula. What it really is for us is it’s a way of eliminating powers from sines and cosines. I’ve gotten rid of this square at the expense of putting in a 2theta here. We’ll use that.

同样，同样的计算表明 sin^2(theta) = (1 cos(2theta)) / 2。同样的余弦，在那个公式中也是如此，但它有一个减号。对于 sin^2。好的。这就是我对三角恒等式的小小回顾，我们将在本讲课中用到它。我想谈谈三角恒等式。三角积分，我相信你已经知道一些三角积分了。比如，好吧，让我先写出微分形式。

And, similarly, same calculation shows that sin^2(theta) = (1 cos(2theta)) / 2. Same cosine, in that formula also, but it has a minus sign. For the sin^2. OK. so that’s my little review of trig identities that we’ll make use of as this lecture goes on. I want to talk about trig identity. trig integrals, and you know some trig integrals, I’m sure, already. Like, well, let me write the differential form first.

你知道 d sin theta，或者我可以说 d sin x，是 sin x 乘以 dx 的导数，对吧。sin x 的导数是 cos x，dx。所以如果我在这里对两边积分，它的积分形式是 cos x dx 的积分。是 sin x 加一个常数。同样，d cos x = sin x dx。

You know that d sin theta, or maybe I’ll say d sin x, is, let’s see, that’s the derivative of sin x times dx, right. The derivative of sin x is cos x, dx. And so if I integrate both sides here, the integral form of this is the integral of cos x dx. Is sin x plus a constant. And in the same way, d cos x = sin x dx.

没错，余弦的导数是负正弦。当我对它进行积分时，我发现 sin x dx 的积分是 cos x + c。这就是我们的起点。今天的游戏，在讲座的前半部分，是使用那些基本的积分公式，并巧妙地使用三角恒等式来计算涉及三角函数的更复杂的公式。

Right, the derivative of the cosine is minus sine. And when I integrate that, I find the integral of sin x dx is cos x + c. So that’s our starting point. And the game today, for the first half of the lecture, is to use that basic. just those basic integration formulas, together with clever use of trig identities in order to compute more complicated formulas involving trig functions.

因此，第一件事、第一个主题是思考形式为 sin^n (x) cos^n (x) dx 的积分。

So the first thing, the first topic, is to think about integrals of the form sin^n (x) cos^n (x) dx.

积分

Integrals

在这里，我想到 m 和 n 是非负整数。所以让我们试着把它们积分。我很快就会向你展示它们的一些应用。再往后看，像这样的积分出现在傅里叶级数和数学中的许多其他学科中。事实证明，能够做到这些非常重要。

Where here I have in mind m and n are non negative integers. So let’s try to integrate these. I’ll show you some applications of these pretty soon. Looking down the road a little bit, integrals like this show up in Fourier series and many other subjects in mathematics. It turns out they’re quite important to be able to do.

这就是我们现在这么做的原因。

So that’s why we’re doing them now.

简易案例

Easy case

好吧，这里有两种情况需要考虑。当你对类似的东西进行积分时。有一种简单的情况，我们先来做一下。最简单的情况是至少有一个指数是奇数。这是最简单的情况。例如，假设我想要积分，那么，让我们以 m = 1 为例。所以我要积分 sin^n (x) cos x dx。我取。

Well, so there are two cases to think about here. When you’re integrating things like this. There’s the easy case, and let’s do that one first. The easy case is when at least one exponent is odd. That’s the easy case. So, for example, suppose that I wanted to integrate, well, let’s take the case m = 1. So I’m integrating sin^n (x) cos x dx. I’m taking.

哦，我可以做这个。让我们看看这是否是我想要的。是的。我感到困惑的是，我本想让它有不同的幂。你当时是这么想的。那么让我们来做 m = 1 的情况。所以我试图做的积分是正弦乘以余弦的任何幂。好吧，这里有个窍门。

Oh, I could do that one. Let’s see if that’s what I want to take. Yeah. My confusion is that I meant to have this a different power. You were thinking that. So let’s do this case when m = 1. So the integral I’m trying to do is any power of the sine times the cosine. Well, here’s the trick.

认识到，使用上面的公式，将 cos x dx 视为我们已经在黑板上写的东西。因此，利用它的方法是进行替换。替换将是 u = sin x。原因如下。然后，我试图做的这个积分是 u^n 的积分，这已经是一个简化了。

Recognize, use this formula up at the top there to see cos x dx as something that we already have on the blackboard. So, the way to exploit that is to make a substitution. And substitution is going to be u = sin x. And here’s why. Then this integral that I’m trying to do is the integral of u^n, that’s already a simplification.

替代

Substitution

然后就是 cos x dx。

And then there’s that cos x dx.

当你进行替换时，你必须把表达式中的所有内容都替换为涉及我引入的这个新变量的内容。所以我最好去掉 cos x dx，用 du 或 u 来重写它。我可以这样做，因为根据该公式，du 是 cos x dx。让我把它放在一个框里。这就是我们的替换。
