现在，这是来自 B3 的部分。这是来自 B3 的部分。这是来自 C3 的部分。这是来自 C3 的部分。我们仍然需要把这个部分拿出来。所以一旦我们找到了这些数字，C3 乘以这个数字就是正确答案。那么我们怎么做呢？这个如何积分？学生：三角代换？教授：三角代换。

Now, this was the piece that came from B3. This is the one that came from B3. And this is the one that’s coming from C3. This is coming from C3. We still need to get this one out there. So C3 times that will be the correct answer, once we’ve found these numbers. So how do we do this? How’s this one integrated? STUDENT: Trig substitution? PROFESSOR: Trig substitution.

因此，这里的三角代换是 x = 2 tan u。或者 2 tan theta。当你这样做时，会有一些简化。好吧，我不会称之为简化。这只是微分公式。dx = 2 sec^2 u du。

So the trig substitution here is x = 2 tan u. Or 2 tan theta. And when you do that, there are a couple of simplifications. Well, I wouldn’t call this a simplification. This is just the differentiation formula. dx = 2 sec^2 u du.

然后你必须代入，你利用了这样一个事实：当你代入 tan^2,4 tan ^2 + 4 时，你会得到 sec ^2。所以总的来说，这个东西是 2 sec^2 u du。然后分母中有一个 (4 sec^2 u) ^3。所以这就是当你在这里改变变量时发生的情况。现在看，这一直在继续。这不是问题的结束。因为这会简化成什么？

And then you have to plug in, and you’re using the fact that when you plug in the tan^2,4 tan ^2 + 4, you’ll get a sec ^2. So altogether, this thing is, 2 sec^2 u du. And then there’s a (4 sec^2 u) ^3, in the denominator. So that’s what happens when you change variables here. And now look, this keeps on going. This is not the end of the problem. Because what does that simplify to?

也就是说，让我们看看，它是 2/64，sec^6 和 sec^2 的积分。它与 cos^4 相同。现在，你做了一个三角代换，但你仍然有一个三角积分。现在，三角积分有一个方法。当它是偶数幂时，你必须使用双角公式。这就是这里的公式。你还没有完成。你必须把这个东西平方。

That is, let’s see, it’s 2/64, the integral of sec^6 and sec^2. That’s the same as cos^4. And now, you did a trig substitution but you still have a trig integral. The trig integral now, there’s a method for this. The method for this is when it’s an even power, you have to use the double angle formula. So that’s this guy here. And you’re still not done. You have to square this thing out.

然后你仍然会得到 cos^2 2u。它会一直持续下去。所以这个事情会持续很长时间。但我甚至不会结束这个，我只是想向你展示。重点是，我们不会向你展示如何解决任何复杂的问题。我们只是向你展示所有的小成分。

And then you’ll still get a cos^2 2u. And it keeps on going. So this thing goes on for a long time. But I’m not even going to finish this, but I just want to show you. The point is, we’re not showing you how to do any complicated problem. We’re just showing you all the little ingredients.

你必须把它们串在一起，经过一个漫长的过程才能得到这些问题的最终答案。所以它总是有效的，但可能很慢。顺便说一句，甚至还有另一件可怕的事情发生。那就是，如果你处理这个家伙，有什么技巧呢？这是你在过去几天学到的另一个技巧。完成正方形。所以，结果，你必须这样重写它。

And you have to string them together a long, long, long process to get to the final answer of one of these questions. So it always works, but maybe slowly. By the way, there’s even another horrible thing that happens. Which is, if you handle this guy here, what’s the technique. This is another technique that you learned, supposedly within the last few days.completing the square. So this, it turns out, you have to rewrite it this way.

然后，求值将以 的形式表示，我要跳到结尾。结果将以这个的形式表示。这就是最终会出现在公式中的内容。不仅如此，如果你还处理涉及 x 的那些，你还需要处理这里的分母的 ln 之类的东西。所以所有这些都会涉及。

And then the evaluation is going to be expressed in terms of, I’m going to jump to the end. It’s going to turn out to be expressed in terms of this. That’s what will eventually show up in the formula. And not only that, but if you deal with ones involving x as well, you’ll also need to deal with something like ln of this denominator here. So all of these things will be involved.

所以现在，我要告诉你们的最后一句话就是：这件事非常复杂。我们当然不会要求你们这么做。但你们应该意识到，在这种复杂程度下，我们绝对无法解决这个问题。我们之所以无法解决这个问题，是因为最终的公式是这样的。

So now, the last message that I have for you is just this. This thing is very complicated. We’re certainly never going to ask you to do it. But you should just be aware that this level of complexity, we are absolutely stuck with in this problem. And the reason why we’re stuck with it is that this is what the formulas look like in the end.

如果答案是这样的，公式就必须这么复杂。如果你对它进行微分，你就会得到多项式，多项式的比值。如果你对它进行微分，你就会得到多项式的比值。这些都是你对这些有理函数求反导数时得到的东西。所以我们只能被这些家伙困住了。所以不要让它影响你太多。我的意思是，它不是那么糟糕。

If the answers look like this, the formulas have to be this complicated. If you differentiate this, you get your polynomial, your ratio of polynomials. If you differentiate this, you get some ratio of polynomials. These are the things that come up when you take antiderivatives of those rational functions. So we’re just stuck with these guys. And so don’t let it get to you too much. I mean, it’s not so bad.

事实上，有计算机程序可以随时帮你完成这些。你只要不被它们吓到就行了。它们就像其他函数一样。好了，以上就是关于部分分数的一般性评论。现在我们要转到最后一个技巧。这是让你熟悉函数的又一个技术性技巧。这个技巧称为分部积分。

In fact, there are computer programs that will do this for you anytime you want. And you just have to be not intimidated by them. They’re like other functions. OK, that’s it for the general comments on partial fractions. Now we’re going to change subjects to our last technique. This is one more technical thing to get you familiar with functions. And this technique is called integration by parts.

请不要因为它的名字听起来像部分分数就认为它们是同一件事。它们是完全不同的。它们不一样。所以这个叫做分部积分。现在，与前一种情况不同，我无法向你证明线性代数总是有效的。我声称它有效，但我无法证明这一点。这是一个复杂的定理，我无法在这门课上讲解。

Please, just because its name sort of sounds like partial fractions, don’t think it’s the same thing. It’s totally different. It’s not the same. So this one is called integration by parts. Now, unlike the previous case, where I couldn’t actually justify to you that the linear algebra always works. I claimed it worked, but I wasn’t able to prove it. That’s a complicated theorem which I’m not able to do in this class.

在这里，我可以向你们解释分部积分是怎么回事。如果你愿意的话，它只是微积分的基本定理，加上乘积公式。有点解开并反向阅读。它的工作原理如下。如果你取两个函数的乘积并对其进行微分，那么我们知道乘积规则表明这是 u' v + uv'。现在我要按以下方式重新排列。

Here I can explain to you what’s going on with integration by parts. It’s just the fundamental theorem of calculus, if you like, coupled with the product formula. Sort of unwound and read in reverse. And here’s how that works. If you take the product of two functions and you differentiate them, then we know that the product rule says that this is u’ v + uv’. And now I’m just going to rearrange in the following way.

我要解 uv'。也就是这里的这个项。那么这个项是什么？它是另一个项，(uv)'。减去另一部分。所以我重写了这个等式。现在我要对它进行积分。这是公式。左边的积分等于右边的积分。当我对导数进行积分时，我得到的是函数本身。这是基本定理。就是这样。

I’m going to solve for uv’. That is, this term here. So what is this term? It’s this other term, (uv)’. Minus the other piece. So I just rewrote this equation. And now I’m going to integrate it. So here’s the formula. The integral of the left hand side is equal to the integral of the right hand side. Well when I integrate a derivative, of I get back the function itself. That’s the fundamental theorem. So this it.

抱歉，我漏掉了 dx，这很重要。我很抱歉。我们把它放进去。这是分部积分公式。我将再写一次，并加上极限。当你有定积分时，它也是这样写的。只是同样的公式，写了两次。好了，现在我将通过几个例子向你展示它是如何工作的。我必须让你了解一下它是如何工作的。

Sorry, I missed the dx, which is important. I apologize. Let’s put that in there. So this is the integration by parts formula. I’m going to write it one more time with the limits stuck in. It’s also written this way, when you have a definite integral. Just the same formula, written twice. Alright, now I’m going to show you how it works on a few examples. And I have to give you a flavor for how it works.

但随着我们经验的增加，这个数字会越来越大。我要举的第一个例子表面上看起来很难解。即 ln x dx 的积分。现在，看起来我们对此无能为力。我们不知道解决方案是什么。但是，我认为如果我们将其拟合成这种形式，我们可以相对轻松地找出积分。

But it’ll grow as we get more and more experience. The first example that I’m going to take is one that looks intractable on the face of it. Which is the integral of ln x dx. Now, it looks like there’s sort of nothing we can do with this. And we don’t know what the solution is. However, I claim that if we fit it into this form, we can figure out what the integral is relatively easily.

通过一些小小的消去魔法，它就发生了。这个想法如下。如果我认为这个函数是 u，那么在积分形式的另一边会出现函数 u'，所以，如果你愿意的话，u = ln x。所以 u' = 1 / x。现在，1 / x 是一个比 ln x 更易于管理的函数。我们使用的是当我们区分函数时，它会变得更好。

By some little magic of cancellation it happens. The idea is the following. If I consider this function to be u, then what’s going to appear on the other side in the integrated form is the function u’which is so, if you like, u = ln x. So u’ = 1 / x. Now, 1 / x is a more manageable function than ln x. What we’re using is that when we differentiate the function, it’s getting nicer.

这对我们来说越来越容易处理了。然而，为了使它符合这个模式，我需要一个函数 v。那么我到底要在这里为 v 放什么呢？答案是，嗯，dx 几乎是正确的答案。答案原来是 x。原因是这使得 v' = 1。它使 v' = 1。所以这意味着这是 u，但它也是 uv'。

It’s getting more tractable for us. In order for this to fit into this pattern, however, I need a function v. So what in the world am I going to put here for v? The answer is, well, dx is almost the right answer. The answer turns out to be x. And the reason is that makes v’ = 1. It makes v’ = 1. So that means that this is u, but it’s also uv’.

左边就是这个。所以它既是 u 又是 uv'。所以这就是设置。现在我要做的就是读出公式的内容。它说的是，这等于 u v。所以 u 是这个，v 是那个。所以它是 x ln x，减去，所以再次说明，这是 uv。除了另一个顺序，vu。

Which was what I had on the left hand side. So it’s both u and uv’. So this is the setup. And now all I’m going to do is read off what the formula says. What it says is, this is equal to u v. So u is this and v is that. So it’s x ln x, minus, so that again, this is uv. Except in the other order, vu.

然后我要积分，我要积分什么？u'v。所以看那里。u'v 带一个减号。u'=1/x，v=x。所以是 1/x，也就是 u'。这是 x，也就是 v，dx。现在，这个很容易积分。因为 (1/x) x = 1。1 dx 的积分是 x + c，如果你愿意的话。

And then I’m integrating, and what do I have to integrate? u ’ v. So look up there. u’ v with a minus sign here. u’ = 1 / x, and v = x. So it’s 1 / x, that’s u’. And here is x, that’s v, dx. Now, that one is easy to integrate. Because (1/x) x = 1. And the integral of 1 dx is x + c, if you like.

所以 1 的不定积分是 x。这就是我们的答案。我们的答案是 x ln xx + c。我将再举两个稍微复杂一点的例子。然后，实际上，最重要的是让自己习惯这种方法。没有一种方法可以做到这一点。熟能生巧。所以我们再举几个例子。并说明它们。

So the antiderivative of 1 is x. And so here’s our answer. Our answer is that this is x ln x x + c. I’m going to do two more slightly more complicated examples. And then really, the main thing is to get yourself used to this method. And there’s no one way of doing that. Just practice makes perfect. And so we’ll just do a few more examples. And illustrate them.

我要使用的第二个例子是 (ln x) ^2 dx 的积分。这稍微有点难办。也就是说，我要让 u 等于 (ln x)^2。同样，v = 到 x。所以这里是匹配的。也就是说，v' = 1。所以这是 u v'。所以这个东西就是 u v'。然后我们看看会发生什么。

The second example that I’m going to use is the integral of (ln x) ^2 dx. And this is just slightly more recalcitrant. Namely, I’m going to let u be (ln x)^2. And again, v = to x. So that matches up here. That is, v’ = 1. So this is u v’. So this thing is u v’. And then we’ll just see what happens.

现在，我们得到的游戏是，当我对对数平方求导时，我会得到一些更简单的东西。这不会让我们赢得整个战斗，但它会让我们开始。所以我们在这里得到 u'。这就是 2 ln x ( 1 / x)。应用链式法则。

Now, the game that we get is that when I differentiate the logarithm squared, I’m going to get something simpler. It’s not going to win us the whole battle, but it will get us started. So here we get u’. And that’s 2 ln x ( 1 / x). Applying the chain rule.

所以公式是 x (ln x)^2，减去 u' v 的积分，对，这就是我要放在这里的。所以 u' = 2 ln x ( 1 / x)，v = x。现在，你注意到这里发生了一些有趣的事情。让我稍微划定一下界限。让你看看我在这里做什么。所以请注意，这是相同的积分。

And so the formula is that this is x (ln x)^2, minus the integral of, well it’s u’ v, right, that’s what I have to put over here. So u’ = 2 ln x ( 1 / x), and v = x. And so now, you notice something interesting happening here. So let me just demarcate this a little bit. And let you see what it is that I’m doing here. So notice, this is the same integral.

所以这里我们有 x (ln x) ^2。我们已经解决了那部分。但现在请注意，1 / x 和 x 相消。所以我们回到前一种情况。我们并没有完全获胜，但实际上我们将其归结为这个积分。归结为 ln x 的积分，我们已经知道了。所以在这里，我可以把它抄下来。这是 2 (x ln xx)，然后我必须加上一个常数 c。 

So here we have x (ln x) ^2. We’ve already solve that part. But now know notice that the 1 / x and the x cancel. So we’re back to the previous case. We didn’t win all the way, but actually we reduced ourselves to this integral. To the integral of ln x, which we already know. So here, I can copy that down. That’s 2 (x ln x x), and then I have to throw in a constant, c. 

这就是问题的全部。就是这样。这个部分是我从示例 1 中得到的。现在，这说明了一个比分部积分稍微复杂一点的原理。这是一种一般原理，我将其称为示例 3，它被称为简化公式。

And that’s the end of the problem here. That’s it. So this piece, I got from Example 1. Now, this illustrates a principle which is a little bit more complicated than just the one of integration by parts. Which is a sort of a general principle which I’ll call my Example 3, which is something which is called a reduction formula.

简化公式是指我们应用一些规则，用其他东西来计算这些积分之一的情况。这稍微简单一点。最终我们会到达终点，但可能需要从起点开始 n 步。所以例子是 l(nx^ n) dx。

A reduction formula is a case where we apply some rule and we figure out one of these integrals in terms of something else. Which is a little bit simpler. And eventually we’ll get down to the end, but it may take us n steps from the beginning. So the example is l(n x^ n) dx.

并且声称如果我按照示例 2 中的方式进行操作，那么对于这种情况，我将得到一个更简单的公式，其中涉及 n 的 1 次方。这样我就可以一路回到最终答案。所以这就是发生的事情。我们将 u 取为 ln x^n。这与之前的讨论相同，v = x。然后 u' 是 nl(nx) ^ n 1.1 / x)。

And the claim is that if I do what I did in Example 2, to this case, I’ll get a simpler one which will involve the n 1st power. And that way I can get all the way back down to the final answer. So here’s what happens. We take u as ln x^ n. This is the same discussion as before, v = x. And then u’ is n l(n x) ^ n 1.1 / x).

并且 v' 为 1。因此设置类似。我们这里有 x (ln x)^n 减去积分。有 n 次，结果是 (ln x)^n 1。然后是 1 / x 和 x，它们相互抵消。因此我将抽象地解释一下，只是为了向你展示这里发生了什么。

And v’ is 1. And so the setup is similar. We have here x ( ln x)^ n minus the integral. And there’s n times, it turns out to be (ln x)^ n 1. And then there’s a 1 / x and an x, which cancel. So I’m going to explain this also abstractly a little bit just to show you what’s happening here.

如果你使用符号 Fn (x) 是 (ln x)^n dx 的积分，我们在这里忘记常数。那么我们这里的关系是 Fn (x) = n ln，对不起，x (ln x)^ n。这是这里的第一项。减去前一项的 n 倍。这是这里的一项。这个想法是，最终我们可以得到下式。

If you use the notation Fn (x) is the integral of (ln x)^n dx, and we’re going to forget the constant here. Then the relationship that we have here is that Fn (x) = n ln, I’m sorry, x (ln x)^ n. That’s the first term over here. Minus n times the preceding one. This one here. And the idea is that eventually we can get down.

如果我们从第 n 个开始，我们有一个包含的公式，因此简化到第 n 个。然后我们可以简化到第 n 个，依此类推。直到我们简化到 1，第一个 1。然后我们甚至可以简化到第 0 个。所以这就是简化公式的想法。

If we start with the nth one, we have a formula that includes, so the reduction is to the n 1st. Then we can reduce to the n 2nd, and so on. Until we reduce to the 1, the first 1. And then in fact we can even go down to the 0th one. So this is the idea of a reduction formula.

让我在示例 1 和示例 2 的上下文中准确说明这一点。因此，第一步是求第一个值。如果您愿意，也可以这样算，即 (ln x)^0 dx。这很简单，就是 x。然后是 F1 (x) = x ln x F0 (x)。现在，这就是应用此规则。因此，让我将其放在这里的一个框中。这是归纳法。这是规则。

And let me illustrate it exactly in the context of Examples 1 and 2. So the first step would be to evaluate the first one. Which is, if you like, (ln x)^ 0 dx. That’s very easy, that’s x. And then F1 ( x) = x ln x F0 (x). Now, that’s applying this rule. So let me just put it in a box here. This is the method of induction. Here’s the rule.

我将其应用于 n = 1。我在这里代入 n = 1。所以这里，我有 x ln x ^ 1 1 ( F0 ( x)。这就是我在这里右边放的。这将为我生成我想要的公式，即 x ln x x。这就是这道题的答案。

And I’m applying it for n = 1. I plugged in n = 1 here. So here, I have x ln x ^ 1 1 ( F0 ( x). And that’s what I put right here, on the right hand side. And that’s going to generate for me the formula that I want, which is x ln x x. That’s the answer to this problem over here.

这是示例 1。请注意，我删除了常数，因为我可以在最后添加它们。所以我在这里加上括号，(+ c)。这就是问题结束时会发生的情况。下一步，即示例 1，现在示例 2 的工作方式大致相同。我只是总结一下我在这里黑板上所做的事情。同样的事情，但符号要紧凑得多。

This was Example 1. Notice I dropped the constants because I can add them in at the end. So I’ll put in parentheses here, (+ c). That’s what would happen at the end of the problem. The next step, so that was Example 1, and now Example 2 works more or less the same way. I’m just summarizing what I did on that blackboard right up here. The same thing, but in much more compact notation.

如果我取 F2 ( x)，它将等于 x (ln x)^2 2 F1 ( x)。同样，这是 n = 2 的框。如果我将其代入，我得到的是 x (ln x) ^2 乘以这里的这个值。就是这里。x ln x x。如果您愿意，+ c。所以我将 c 去掉。这就是一般的约简公式的工作原理。

If I take F2 ( x), that’s going to be equal to x (ln x)^2 2 F1 ( x). Again, this is box for n = 2. And if I plug it in, what I’m getting here is x (ln x) ^2 twice this stuff here. Which is right here. x ln x x. If you like, + c. So I’ll leave the c off. So this is how reduction formulas work in general.

我要再举一个简化公式的例子。我想我们应该把这个称为示例 4。让我们把它想象成正弦。不，不，让我们更想象。让我们把它变成 e^x。所以这也适用于余弦 x 和正弦 x。同样的事情。我应该提到，在你的家庭作业中，你必须对 x 的余弦进行同样的操作。

I’m going to give you one more example of a reduction formula. So I guess we have to call this Example 4. Let’s be fancy, let’s make it the sine. No no, no, let’s be fancier still. Let’s make it e^ x. So this would also work for cosine x and sine x. The same sort of thing. And I should mention that on your homework, you have to do it for cosine of x.

我临时决定改变主意。我不会做余弦，因为你得在作业中算出余弦。在以后的作业中你甚至会做这个例子。所以没关系。你需要练习。好的，那么这次我该怎么做呢。这又是一个简化公式。这里的技巧是选择 u 作为这里的函数。

I decided to change my mind on the spur of the moment. I’m not going to do it for cosine because you have to work it out on your homework for cosine. In a later homework you’ll even do this case. So it’s fine. You need the practice. OK, so how am I going to do it this time. This is again, a reduction formula. And the trick here is to pick u to be this function here.

原因如下。因此，选择哪个函数是 u，哪个函数是 v 非常重要。如果你要应用分部积分，这是你唯一要做的决定。当我选择这个函数作为 u 时，我的优势是 u' 更简单。它怎么会更简单呢？它更简单，因为它低了一级。所以这对我们来说是进步。

And the reason is the following. So it’s very important to pick which function is the u and which function is the v. That’s the only decision you have to make if you’re going to apply integration by parts. When I pick this function as the u, the advantage that I have is that u’ is simpler. How is it simpler? It’s simpler because it’s one degree down. So that’s making progress for us.

另一方面，这个函数就是我要用来表示 v 的函数。如果我对它求导，如果我反过来求导，我就会得到相同程度的复杂度。对 e^x 求导只会返回 e ^ x。所以这很无聊。它不会在这个过程中取得任何进展。

On the other hand, this function here is going to be what I’ll use for v. And if I differentiated that, if I did it the other way around and I differentiated that, I would just get the same level of complexity. Differentiating e^x just gives you back e ^ x. So that’s boring. It doesn’t make any progress in this process.

因此，我将改为让 v = e ^ x，抱歉，这是 v '。将其改为 v' = e ^ x。然后 v = e ^x。至少当我这样倒退时，结果不会更糟。所以现在，我有 u 和 v '，现在我得到了 (x ^ n)( e ^ x)。这又是 u，这是 v。

And so I’m going to instead let v = e ^ x and, sorry this is v ‘. Make it v’ = e ^ x. And then v = e ^x. At least it isn’t any worse when I went backwards like that. So now, I have u and v ’and now I get (x ^ n)( e ^ x). This again is u, and this is v.

因此 v = tv '，这有点令人困惑。但这是我们称之为 v ' 的那个。这是 v。现在减去积分，我这里有 nx ^ n 1。我这里有 e ^ x。所以这是 u'，这是 v dx。所以这个递归是一个新的递归。让我在这里总结一下。

So it happens that v = t v ’ so it’s a little confusing here. But this is the one we’re calling v ‘. And here’s v. And now minus the integral and I have here nx ^ n 1. And I have here e ^ x. So this is u’ and this is v dx. So this recurrence is a new recurrence. And let me summarize it here.

它表示 Gn (x) 应该是 (x ^ n)( e ^ x) dx 的积分。再次，我删除了 c。然后简化公式是 Gn (x) = 此处的表达式，(x ^ n)( e ^ x) n Gn 1 (x)。因此这是我们的简化公式。为了说明这一点，如果我取 G0 (x)，如果你仔细想一想，就会发现这里什么都没有。

It’s saying that Gn ( x) should be the integral of (x ^ n)( e ^ x) dx. Again, I’m dropping the c. And then the reduction formula is that Gn (x) = this expression here, (x ^ n)( e ^ x) n Gn 1 (x). So here’s our reduction formula. And to illustrate this, if I take G0 (x), if you think about it for a second that’s just, there’s nothing here.

e ^ x 的反导数，也就是 e ^ x，这是真正的基础。同样，一如既往，0 是我最喜欢的数字。不是 1。如果可能的话，我总是从最简单的开始。现在，应用此公式，G1 将等于 xe ^ x G0 ( x)。这正好，因为 n 是 1，而 n 1 是 0。所以这只是 xe ^ xe^ x。

The antiderivative of e ^ x, that’s going to be e ^ x, that getting started at the real basement here. Again, as always, 0 is my favorite number. Not 1. I always start with the easiest one, if possible. And now G1, applying this formula, is going to be equal to x e ^ x G0 ( x). Which is just right, because n is 1 and n 1 is 0. And so that’s just x e ^ x e^ x.

所以这是表达以下事实的一种非常非常奇特的方式。我会把它放在另一个板上。即 xe^x dx = xe^xx + c 的积分。是的，问题。学生：教授：。问题是，为什么这是真的。为什么这个陈述是正确的。为什么 G 0 = e^x。我在脑子里想了想。

So this is a very, very fancy way of saying the following fact. I’ll put it over on this other board. Which is that the integral of x e^ x dx = x e^ x x + c. Yeah, question. STUDENT: PROFESSOR:. The question is, why is this true. Why is this statement true. Why is G 0 = e^ x. I did that in my head.

我做的是，我首先写下 G0 的公式。即 G0 等于 e^x dx 的积分。因为里面有一个 x 的 0 次方，也就是 1。然后我知道 e^x 的反导数。它是 e^x。学生：教授：你怎么知道这种方法什么时候有效？答案只能通过经验。你必须多加练习。

What I did was, I first wrote down the formula for G0. Which was G0 is equal to the integral of e^ x dx. Because there’s an x to the 0 power in there, which is just 1. And then I know the antiderivative of e ^ x. It’s e ^x. STUDENT: PROFESSOR: How do you know when this method will work? The answer is only by experience. You must get practice doing this.

如果你看看教科书，你会看到一些提示。我想说的另一个提示是，如果你发现你的表达式中有一个因子，当你区分它时，它会变得更容易。而当你对另一半进行反区分时，它不会变得更糟，那么这种方法就有机会提供帮助。而且没有普遍的东西。

If you look in your textbook, you’ll see hints as to what to do. The other hint that I want to say is that if you find that you have one factor in your expression which when you differentiate it, it gets easier. And when you antidifferentiate the other half, it doesn’t get any worse, then that’s when this method has a chance of helping. And there is there’s no general thing.

但问题是，如果你用 x^n (e^x)，x^n 余弦 x，尤其是正弦 x，这些都是它起作用的例子。这是 ln 的幂。我在这里再给你一个例子。所以这是 G1 (x)，对吧。我稍后再给你一个例子。是的。学生：教授：谢谢。这里有一个错误。这很糟糕。

The thing is, though, if you it with x^ n (e^ x), x ^ n cosine x, especially on sine x, those are examples where it works. This power of the ln. I’ll give you er one more example here. So this was G1 ( x), right. I’ll give you one more example in a second. Yeah. STUDENT: PROFESSOR: Thank you. There’s a mistake here. That’s bad.

我在脑海里想着下面的公式。这是我们刚刚做过的另一个公式。这些是分部积分法可以得到的公式类型。还有另一种得到这些公式的方法，我不会对此发表任何评论。这叫做提前猜测。你提前猜出形式是什么，然后对其进行区分并检查。

I was thinking in the back of my head of the following formula. Which is another one which we’ve just done. So these are the types of formulas that you can get out of integration by parts. There’s also another way of getting these, which I’m not going to say anything about. Which is called advance guessing. You guess in advance what the form is, you differentiate it and you check.

在许多情况下，这也确实有效。我想给你们举个例子。因为这些公式有点枯燥。所以我想给你们至少一个应用。我们几乎完成了这些公式的概念。现在我们要回到能够处理比以前更多的积分。

That does work too, with many of these cases. I want to give you an illustration. Just because you these formulas are somewhat dry. So I want to give you just at least one application. We’re almost done with the idea of these formulas. And we’re going to get back now to being able to handle lots more integrals than we could before.

令人满意的是，现在我们可以得到数字，而不必受困于少数几种技术。现在我们拥有了任何人都拥有的所有积分技术。因此，我们几乎可以做任何我们想做的事情。所以，如果您愿意，这里有一个应用程序，它说明了分部积分如何有用。我们将在这里找到指数酒杯的体积。

And what’s satisfying is that now we can get numbers out instead of being stuck and hamstrung with only a few techniques. Now we have all of the techniques of integration that anybody has. And so we can do pretty much anything we want that’s possible to do. So here’s, if you like, an application that illustrates how integration by parts can be helpful. And we’re going to find the volume of an exponential wine glass here.

再说一次，不要在家里尝试这个，但是。让我们看看。这将是这个漂亮的家伙。我想。好的，那它会是什么。这个图将是 y = e^x。然后我们将围绕 y 轴旋转它。这里的这个水平是高度 y = 1。顶部，假设是 y = e。

Again, don’t try this at home, but. So let’s see. It’s going to be this beautiful guy here. I think. OK, so what’s it going to be. This graph is going to be y = e^ x. Then we’re going to rotate it around the y axis. And this level here is the height y = 1. And the top, let’s say, is y = e.

因此，这里的水平线向下是 x = 1。现在，有两种方法可以解决这个问题。所以有两种方法。这也是一个很好的复习，因为当然，我们在上一个单元中已经做过了。这两种方法是水平和垂直切片。这是我们可以做到的两种方法。现在，如果我们这样做，那么让我们从水平开始。这就是这里的形状。

So that the horizontal here, coming down, is x = 1. Now, there are two ways to set up this problem. And so there are two methods. And this is also a good review because, of course, we did this in the last unit. The two methods are horizontal and vertical slices. Those are the two ways we can do this. Now, if we do it with, so let’s start out with the horizontal ones. That’s this shape here.

我们就这样。水平切片表示这里的这一小块厚度为 dy。然后我们要把它绕一圈。这样它就会变成一个圆盘。这就是圆盘法。这里的距离是多少？嗯，这个地方是 x。

And we’re going like that. And the horizontal slices mean that this little bit here is a thickness dy. And then we’re going to wrap that around. So this is going to become a disk. This is the method of disks. And what’s this distance here? Well, this place is x.

因此圆盘的面积为 pi x ^2。我们要把圆盘的厚度相加，然后从 1 到 e 求积分。这就是我们的体积。现在，在计算这个积分之前，我们还有最后一件事要做。那就是我们需要知道曲线上的关系，即 y = e ^ x。这意味着 x = ln y。

And so the disk has area pi x ^2. And we’re going to add up the thickness of the disks and we’re going to integrate from 1 to e. So here’s our volume. And now we have one last little item of business before we can evaluate this integral. And that is that we need to know the relationship here on the curve, that y = e ^ x. So that means x = ln y.

为了计算这个积分，我们必须正确地计算 x 作为 y 的函数。这就是 (ln y)^2 乘以 pi、dy 从 1 到 e 的积分。现在您看到，这是一个我们已经计算过的积分。事实上，它就在这里。只是用变量 x 代替了变量 y。所以我们已经得到的答案是这里的 F2 ( y)。

And in order to evaluate this integral, we have to evaluate x correctly as a function of y. So that’s the integral from 1 to e of (ln y)^2, times pi, dy. So now you see that this is an integral that we did calculate already. And in fact, it’s sitting right here. Except with the variable x instead of the variable y. So the answer, which we already had, is this F2 ( y) here.

所以也许我会这样写。所以这是 1 和 e 之间的 F2 (y)。现在让我们弄清楚它是什么。它写在那里。它是 y (ln y) ^2 2(y ln yy)。整个东西在 1e 处求值。也就是说，如果我在这里插入 e，我会得到 e。但那里有一个 pi 因子，抱歉。我漏掉了 pi 因子。所以这里有一个 e。

So maybe I’ll write it that way. So this is F2 (y) between 1 and e. And now let’s figure out what it is. It’s written over there. It’s y (ln y) ^2 2(y ln y y). The whole thing evaluated at 1e. And that is, if I plug in e here, I get e. Except there’s a factor of pi there, sorry. Missed the pi factor. So there’s an e here.

然后我减去，在 1 处这是 e e。所以它取消了。什么都没有剩下。然后在 1 处，我得到 ln 1 是 0，ln 1 是 0，只剩下一个项，即 2。所以是 2。这就是答案。现在我们要将它与如果我们以另一种方式执行时发生的结果进行比较。那么垂直是什么？通过垂直切片，我们得到壳。这开始于 x 变量。

And then I subtract off, well, at 1 this is e e. So it cancels. There’s nothing left. And then at 1, I get ln 1 is 0, ln 1 is 0, there’s only one term left, which is 2. So it’s 2. That’s the answer. Now we get to compare that with what happens if we do it the other way. So what’s the vertical? So by vertical slicing, we get shells. And that starts, that’s in the x variable.

它从 0 开始，到 1 结束，就是 dx。那么壳是什么呢？如果我能再画一遍，壳的起始值是 e。底值是，我需要一点空间。底值是 y。然后我们有 2 pi x 是圆周，我们绕着 dx 扫描。所以这是我们的新体积。用不同的方式表达。

It starts at 0 and ends at 1 and it’s dx. And what are the shells? Well, the shells are, if I can draw the picture again, they start, the top value is e. And the bottom value is, I need a little bit of room for this. The bottom value is y. And then we have 2 pi x is the circumference, as we sweep it around dx. So here’s our new volume. Expressed in this different way.

现在我要代入这个公式。它是 ee ^ x 从 0 到 1 的积分。这是 y 的公式。2 pi x dx。你看到的是，你得到了 2 pi ex dx 从 0 到 1 的积分。这很简单，对吧？这只是 2 pi e ( 1/2)。这只是三角形的面积。如果我将 2 pi e 分解出来。

So now I’m going to plug in what this is. It’s the integral from 0 to 1 of e e ^ x. That’s the formula for y. 2 pi x dx. And what you see is that you get the integral from 0 to 1 of 2 pi e x dx. That’s easy, right? That’s just 2 pi e ( 1/2). This one is just the area of a triangle. If I factor out the 2 pi e.

然后另一部分是 2 pi xe^ x dx 的积分。从 0 到 1。学生：教授：你是在问我这里是否需要 x ^2 吗？我只是计算了积分。我只是用几何方法计算。我说，这是三角形的面积。我没有对其进行反微分和计算，我只是告诉你这个数字。因为它是一个定积分。

And then the other piece is the integral of 2 pi x e^ x dx. From 0 to 1. STUDENT: PROFESSOR: Are you asking me whether I need an x ^2 here? I just evaluated the integral. I just did it geometrically. I said, this is the area of a triangle. I didn’t antidifferentiate and evaluate it, I just told you the number. Because it’s a definite integral.

现在，我可以从这里读出这个。在它上面，这是 G1。所以这等于，让我们在这里检查一下。所以这是 pi e，对，2 pi G1 ( x)，在 0 和 1 处求值。所以让我们确保它和我们之前得到的一样。它是 pi e 2 pi 乘以 g1。所以它是 xe ^ xe^ x。所以在 x = 1 时，它被取消了。

So now, this one here, I can read off from right up here. Above it, this is G1. So this is equal to, let’s check it out here. So this is pi e, right, 2 pi G1 ( x), evaluated at 0 and 1. So let’s make sure that it’s the same as what we had before. It’s pi e 2 pi times here’s g1. So it’s x e ^ x e^ x. So at x = 1, that cancels.

但在底端，它是 e^0。所以这里是 1。对吗？对。所以它是 pi e 2。是一样的。问题。学生：教授：从这里到这里，是这个问题吗？学生：教授：所以这里的步骤只是分配律。这是 e 2 pi x，这是这个项。其他项，减号在外面。2 pi 我已经分解出来了。

But at the bottom end, it’s e^ 0. So it’s 1 here. Is that right? Yep. So it’s pi e 2. It’s the same. Question. STUDENT: PROFESSOR: From here to here, is that the question? STUDENT: PROFESSOR: So the step here is just the distributive law. This is e 2 pi x, that’s this term. And the other terms, the minus sign is outside. The 2 pi I factored out.

x 和 e ^x 保留在积分符号内。谢谢。更正一下，上次少了一个减号。当我从 0 积分到 1 xe^ x dx 时，我得到了 axe^ xe^x。在 0 和 1 处求值。这等于 + 1。我少了这个减号。它出现的地方是这个酒杯示例中。

And the x and the e ^x stayed inside the integral sign. Thank you. The correction is that there was a missing minus sign, last time. When I integrated from 0 to 1 x e^ x dx, I had a x e^ x e^x. Evaluated at 0 and 1. And that’s equal to + 1. I was missing this minus sign. The place where it came in was in this wineglass example.

我们有 2 pi xee ^x dx 的积分。这是 2 pi e x dx 的积分，从 0 到 1，2 pi，xe^x dx 从 0 到 1 的积分。然后我算出来，它是 pi e。然后这个是 2 pi，我记下来的是 1。但那里应该有一个额外的减号。所以就是这样。最终答案是正确的，但这个减号不见了。就在那里。所以就在那里。

We had the integral of 2 pi x e e ^x dx. And that was 2 pi e integral of x dx, from 0 to 1, 2 pi, integral from 0 to 1 of x e^x dx. And then I worked this out and it was pi e. And then this one was 2 pi, and what I wrote down was 1. But there should have been an extra minus sign there. So it’s this. The final answer was correct, but this minus sign was missing. Right there. So just, right there.

Lec 31 | MIT 18.01 单变量微积分，2007 年秋季

Lec 31 | MIT 18.01 Single Variable Calculus, Fall 2007

15 年前 (2009 年 9 月 10 日) — 45:25 https://youtube.com/watch?v=TpWQlKHPyJ4

15 years ago (Sep 10, 2009) — 45:25 https://youtube.com/watch?v=TpWQlKHPyJ4

麻省理工学院开放课程

MIT OpenCourseWare

以下内容根据 Creative Commons 许可提供。您的支持将帮助 MIT OpenCourseWare 继续免费提供高质量的教育资源。要捐款或查看数百门 MIT 课程的其他材料，请访问 MIT OpenCourseWare，网址为 ocw.mit.edu。

The following content is provided under a Creative Commons license. Your support will help MIT OpenCourseWare continue to offer high quality educational resources for free. To make a donation or to view additional materials from hundreds of MIT courses, visit MIT OpenCourseWare at ocw.mit.edu.

介绍

Introduction

教授：好的。今天我们从积分公式和积分方法转到几何学。

PROFESSOR: OK. Now, today we get to move on from integral formulas and methods of integration back to some geometry.

这或多或少会引出你在多元微积分中会用到的工具。今天我们要做的第一件事是讨论弧长。

And this is more or less going to lead into the kinds of tools you’ll be using in multivariable calculus. The first thing that we’re going to do today is discuss arc length.

弧长

Arc Lengths

像我们曾经研究过的所有累积总数一样，这个总数也有故事情节和相关的图片，其中涉及到划分事物。

Like all of the cumulative sums that we’ve worked on, this one has a storyline and the picture associated to it, which involves dividing things up.

如果你有一条道路，并且沿路有里程标记，像这样，一直到，比如说，这里的 sn，那么沿路的长度就由这个参数 s 来描述。也就是弧长。

If you have a roadway, if you like, and you have mileage markers along the road, like this, all the way up to, say, sn here, then the length along the road is described by this parameter, s. Which is arc length.

如果我们看这样的图，如果这是最后一个点 b，这是第一个点 a，那么你可以认为在 x1、x2、x3 等上方有若干点。就像我们用黎曼和的方法一样。然后我们要近似的方法是取这些点之间的直线。

And if we look at a graph of this sort of thing, if this is the last point b, and this is the first point a, then you can think in terms of having points above x1, x2, x3, etc. The same as we did with Riemann sums. And then the way that we’re going to approximate this is by taking the straight lines between each of these points.

随着物体变得越来越小，直线将非常接近曲线。这就是主要思想。所以我只描述其中的一小部分。就像这样。一条直线，这是曲面。曲面上的距离就是我所说的 delta s，即两者之间的长度变化，所以如果我这样描述的话，这将是 s2 s1。

As things get smaller and smaller, the straight line is going to be fairly close to the curve. And that’s the main idea. So let me just depict one little chunk of this. Which is like this. One straight line, and here’s the curved surface there. And the distance along the curved surface is what I’m calling delta s, the change in the length between, so this would be s2 s1 if I depicted that one.

因此，这就是 delta s，假设 s。si si 1，那里有一些增量。然后我可以算出橙色部分的长度。因为水平距离是 delta x。垂直距离是 delta y。因此公式是斜边是 delta x ^2 + delta y ^2。平方根。delta s 大约是这个数。所以我们说 delta s ^2 大约是这个数。

So this would be delta s is, say s. si si 1, some increment there. And then I can figure out what the length of the orange segment is. Because the horizontal distance is delta x. And the vertical distance is delta y. And so the formula is that the hypotenuse is delta x ^2 + delta y ^2. Square root. And delta s is approximately that. So what we’re saying is that delta s ^2 is approximately this.

这就是斜边。平方。它非常接近曲线的长度。微积分的整个概念都是无穷小，这是完全正确的。这就是极限中会发生的情况。这是计算弧长的基础。我将在下一块板上重写该公式。但我将以更习惯的方式写出来。我们以前做过一定次数。

So this is the hypotenuse. Squared. And it’s very close to the length of the curve. And the whole idea of calculus is in the infinitesimal, this is exactly correct. So that’s what’s going to happen in the limit. And that is the basis for calculating arc length. I’m going to rewrite that formula on the next board. But I’m going to write it in the more customary fashion. We’ve done this before, a certain amount.

但我只想在这里强调一下，因为这个笔迹有点奇怪。这个 ds 实际上是一回事。我真正想说的是把它括起来。它是一回事。它不是 d * s，而是 ds。它是一回事。然后我们把它平方。但无论出于什么原因，人们已经养成了省略括号的习惯。所以你只能忍受这一点。

But I just want to emphasize it here because this handwriting is a little bit peculiar. This ds is really all one thing. What I really mean is to put the parenthesis around it. It’s one thing. It’s not d * s, it’s ds. It’s one thing. And we square it. But for whatever reason people have gotten into the habit of omitting the parentheses. So you’re just going to have to live with that.

并且要意识到这不是 d of s ^2 或类似的东西。同样，这是一个数字，这是一个数字。无穷小。所以这就是这个想法在我们的符号中的写法。这是我们第一次处理无穷小的平方。所以它只是有点不同。但我们要做的第一件事就是取平方根。

And realize that this is not d of s ^2 or anything like that. And similarly, this is a single number, and this is a single number. Infinitesimal. So that’s just the way that this idea here gets written in our notation. And this is the first time we’re dealing with squares of infinitesimals. So it’s just a little different. But immediately the first thing we’re going to do is take the square root.

如果我取平方根，那就是 dx^2 + dy^2 的平方根。这是我始终记住的这个公式的形式。让我们把它变成一些华丽的形式。但是，你还可以从中得出大约 4、5.6 种其他形式，它们都意味着同样的事情。所以，正如我所说，这就是我记得的方式。但还有其他思考方式。

If I take the square root, that’s the square root of dx ^2 + dy ^2. And this is the form in which I always remember this formula. Let’s put it in some brightly decorated form. But there are about 4,5.6 other forms that you’ll derive from this, which all mean the same thing. So this is, as I say, the way I remember it. But there are other ways of thinking of it.

让我们写下其中几个。第一个是你可以分解出 dx。所以看起来像这样。1 + (dy / dx)^2。然后我分解出 dx。所以这是一个变体。这是我们现在在实践中将在我们的例子中实际使用的那个。

And let’s just write a couple of them down. The first one is that you can factor out the dx. So that looks like this. 1 + (dy / dx)^2. And then I factored out the dx. So this is a variant. And this is the one which actually we’ll be using in practice right now on our examples.

因此结论是弧长，如果你愿意的话，可以将其称为总 sn s0，如果你愿意的话，它将等于从 a 到 b 的 1 + (dy / dx)^2 dx 的平方根的积分。在实践中，它也经常非正式地写成这样。积分 ds。因此，这个小变量 s 的变化，这就是你在许多教科书中看到的符号。

So the conclusion is that the arc length, which if you like is this total sn s0, if you like, is going to be equal to the integral from a to b of the square root of 1 + (dy / dx)^2 dx. In practice, it’s also very often written informally as this. The integral ds. So the change in this little variable s, and this is what you’ll see notationally in many textbooks.

这是一种写法，当然，第二种写法实际上是一样的，即 1 的平方根 + f ' ( x^2) dx。混合一点牛顿符号。这是 y = f (x)。所以这是弧长的公式。

So that’s one way of writing it, and of course the second way of writing it which is practically the same thing is square root of 1 + f ’ ( x^2) dx. Mixing in a little bit of Newton’s notation. And this is with y = f (x). So this is the formula for arc length.

问题

Question

正如我所说，我记得是这样。但你必须推导出它的各种变体。

And as I say, I remember it this way. But you’re going to have to derive various variants of it.

你必须使用一些算术才能得到各种公式。稍后还会有更多。是的，问题。学生：教授：好的，问题是，f'（x）^2 = f''（x）。答案是否定的。让我们看看它是什么。

And you’ll have to use some arithmetic to get to various formulas. And there will be more later. Yeah, question. STUDENT: PROFESSOR: OK, the question is, is f ’ (x)^2 = f ’’ (x). And the answer is no. And let’s just see what it is.

例如，如果 f ( x) = x ^2（几分钟后会出现一个例子），则 f ' (x) = 2x 且 f ' ( x )^2 = (2x)，即 4x ^2。而 f '' ( x) 等于，如果我再微分一次，它等于 2。因此它们的意思不是相同的。这里是相同的。

So, for example, if f ( x) = x ^2, which is an example which will come up in a few minutes, then f ’ (x) = 2x and f ’ ( x )^2 = (2x), which is 4x ^2. Whereas f ’’ ( x) is equal to, if I differentiate this another time, it’s equal to 2. So they don’t mean the same thing. The same thing over here.

你可以看到这个 dy / dx，这是 y 相对于 x 的变化率。量平方。换句话说，这个东西应该和那个意思一样。是的。另一个问题。学生：教授：所以问题是，你有点紧张，因为我没有说明这些限制。事实上，我是故意这样做的，因为我不想具体说明发生了什么。

You can see this dy / dx, this is the rate of change of y with respect to x. The quantity squared. So in other words, this thing is supposed to mean the same as that. Yeah. Another question. STUDENT: PROFESSOR: So the question is, you got a little nervous because I left out these limits. And indeed, I did that on purpose because I didn’t want to specify what was going on.

实际上，如果你用 ds 来写，你必须把它写成从 s0 开始到 sn 结束，这样才能与变量 s 保持一致。但是，当然，如果你用另一个变量来写，你就把那个变量放进去。所以这就是我们改变变量时所做的，对吧？对于这些限制，我们有很多不同的选择。这就是我们使用哪个变量的线索。学生：教授：正确。

Really, if you wrote it in terms of ds, you’d have to write it as starting at s0 and ending at sn to be consistent with the variable s. But of course, if you write it in terms of another variable, you put that variable in. So this is what we do when we change variables, right? We have many different choices for these limits. And this is the clue as to which variable we use. STUDENT: PROFESSOR: Correct.

S0 和 sn 与 a 和 b 不是一回事。事实上，这是 xn。而 x0 在这边。这就是 a 和 b。但 s0 和 sn 是道路上的里程标记。它们与跟踪 x 轴上发生的事情不同。因此，当我们测量弧长时，请记住它是沿曲线路径的里程。

S0 and sn are not the same thing as a and b. In fact, this is xn. And this x0, over here. That’s what a and b are. But s0 and sn are mileage markers on the road. They’re not the same thing as keeping track of what’s happening on the x axis. So when we measure arc length, remember it’s mileage along the curved path.

例子

Example

现在，我需要给你举一些例子。

So now, I need to give you some examples.

我的第一个例子非常基础。但我希望它能提供一些观点。所以我举个例子 y = mx，这是一个线性函数，一条直线。然后 y ' = m，所以 ds 将是 1 + (y ') ^2 dx 的平方根。也就是 1 + m ^2 dx 的平方根。

And my first example is going to be really basic. But I hope that it helps to give some perspective here. So I’m going to take the example y = m x, which is a linear function, a straight line. And then y ’ would = m, and so ds is going to be the square root of 1 + (y ’) ^2 dx. Which is the square root of 1 + m ^2 dx.

现在，如果我们从，我不知道，比如说 0 到 10，那么长度就是从 0 到 10 的 1 + m ^2 dx 的平方根的积分。当然，这只是 1 + m ^2 的 10 平方根。这并不奇怪。这是一个常数。

And now, the length, say, if we go from, I don’t know, let’s say 0 to 10, let’s say. Of the graph is going to be the integral from 0 to 10 of the square root of 1 + m ^2 dx. Which of course is just 10 square root of 1 + m ^2. Not very surprising. This is a constant.

它只是分解出来，dx 从 0 到 10 的积分是 10。我们画一张图。这是斜率为 m 的东西。它会趋向于 10。所以水平方向是 10。垂直方向是 10 m。这些就是它的尺寸。

It just factors out and the integral from 0 to 10 of dx is 10. Let’s just draw a picture of this. This is something which has slope m here. And it’s going to 10. So this horizontal is 10. And the vertical is 10 m. Those are the dimensions of this.

毕达哥拉斯定理说斜边，毫不奇怪，我们用橙色画出来，提醒自己它和我们刚才看到的是同一种橙色，这里的这个长度是 10^2 + (10m)^2 的平方根。这就是斜边的公式。它和这个完全一样。也许你会说，这很明显。但我想表达的观点是这样的。

And the Pythagorean theorem says that the hypotenuse, not surprisingly, let’s draw it in here in orange to remind ourselves that it was the same type of orange that we had over there, this length here is the square root of 10 ^2 + (10m)^2. That’s the formula for the hypotenuse. And that’s exactly the same as this. Maybe you’re saying duh, this is obvious. But the point that I’m trying to make is this.

如果你能找出线性函数的这些公式，微积分就会告诉你如何对每个函数进行计算。微积分的理念是，这个简单的计算，你完全不需要任何微积分，所有的工具，微分、极限和积分的符号，都会让你能够对任何曲线进行计算。因为我们可以把事物分解成这些无穷小的碎片。

If you can figure out these formulas for linear functions, calculus tells you how to do it for every function. The idea of calculus is that this easy calculation here, which you can do without any calculus at all, all of the tools, the notations of differentials and limits and integrals, is going to make you be able to do it for any curve. Because we can break things up into these little infinitesimal bits.

这就是我们在这里设置积分的所有方法的整个想法。这是这些积分的要点。现在，让我们做一些更有趣的事情。我们的下一个例子是圆，所以 y = 1 x ^2 的平方根。如果你愿意，这是一个半圆的图形。也许我们会这样设置它。这样半圆就会像这样旋转。

This is the whole idea of all of the methods that we had to set up integrals here. This is the main point of these integrals. Now, so let’s do something slightly more interesting. Our next example is going to be the circle, so y = square root of 1 x ^2. If you like, that’s the graph of a semicircle. And maybe we’ll set it up here this way. So that the semicircle goes around like this.

我们从 x = 0 开始。然后我们转到 a。然后我们取圆的这一小块。所以，如果你愿意的话，就到这里。这是我要测量长度的圆的一部分。现在，我们知道了那个长度。它被称为弧长。我要给它起个名字，我在这里把它叫做 alpha。所以 alpha 是沿着圆的弧长。

And well start it here at x = 0. And we’ll go over to a. And we’ll take this little piece of the circle. So down to here. If you like. So here’s the portion of the circle that I’m going to measure the length of. Now, we know that length. It’s called arc length. And I’m going to give it a name, I’m going to call it alpha here. So alpha’s the arc length along the circle.

现在，让我们来算一下它是什么。首先，为了做到这一点，我必须算出 y ' 是多少。或者，如果你愿意的话，dy / dx。现在，这是我们做过很多次的计算。我会做得稍微快一点。但你记得它给你分母的平方根。然后你得到平方根内的导数。也就是 2x。

Now, let’s figure out what it is. First, in order to do this, I have to figure out what y ’ is. Or, if you like, dy / dx. Now, that’s a calculation that we’ve done a number of times. And I’m going to do it slightly faster. But you remember it gives you a square root in the denominator. And then you have the derivative of what’s inside the square root. Which is 2x.

但是还有 1/2，因为实际上它实际上是 (1 x 2) 2 1/2。我们已经做过很多次这个计算了，所以我就不完整地讲解了。我想让你们想想它是什么。结果这里是 x，因为 1/2 和 2 相消。现在我们要积分的是这个弧长元素，也就是 ds。

But then there’s also 1/2, because in disguise it’s really (1 x 2)2 1/2. So we’ve done this calculation enough times that I’m not going to carry it out completely. I want you to think about what it is. It turns out to x up here, because the 1/2 and the 2 cancel. And now the thing that we have to integrate is this arc length element, as it’s called. ds.

这将是 1 + (y ') ^2 dx 的平方根。所以我必须进行计算，这里有些复杂的计算。即 1 + ( x / 1 x ^2 的平方根) ^2。因此，我必须弄清楚这里的平方根符号下是什么，才能进行此计算。现在让我们开始吧。

And that’s going to be the square root of 1 + (y ’) ^2 dx. And so I’m going to have to carry out the calculation, some messy calculation here. Which is that this is 1 + ( x / square root of 1 x ^2) ^2. So I have to figure out what’s under the square root sign over here in order to carry out this calculation. Now let’s do that.

这是 1 + x ^2 / 1 x ^2。简化后就是这个结果。然后它等于除以一个公分母，(1 x ^2)。1 x ^2 + x^2。现在有一点简化了。因为 2x ^2 被抵消了。我们得到 1 / 1 x^2。所以现在我可以通过实际计算出弧长来完成计算。

This is 1 + x ^2 / 1 x ^2. That’s what this simplifies to. And then that’s equal to, over a common denominator, (1 x ^2). 1 x ^2 + x^2. And there is a little bit of simplification now. Because the 2x ^2’s cancel. And we get 1 / 1 x^2. So now I get to finish off the calculation by actually figuring out what the arc length is.

弧长

Arc Length

那它是什么？

And what is it?

嗯，这个 alpha 等于 ds 从 0 到 a 的积分。嗯，它将是我这里得到的平方根。这是一个平方数，这就是平方根符号下面的值。这是 1 + (y ') ^2。必须对其取平方根。所以我得到的是 dx / 1 x ^2 的平方根。现在，我们认识到了这一点。

Well, this alpha is equal to the integral from 0 to a of ds. Well, it’s going to be the square root of what I have here. This was a square, this is just what was underneath the square root sign. This is 1 + (y ’) ^2. Have to take the square root of that. So what I get here is dx / the square root of 1 x ^2. And now, we recognize this.

我们知道这个的反导数。这是反正弦。在 0 和 a 处求值。这只给出了 a 的反正弦，因为 0 的反正弦 = 0。所以 alpha = a 的反正弦。这是正弦 alpha = a 的一种非常奇特的说法。这是这里的等效语句。这里发生的事情比表面上看起来要深刻一些。

The antiderivative of this is something that we know. This is the inverse sine. Evaluated at 0 and a. Which is just giving us the inverse sine of a, because the inverse sine of 0 = 0. So alpha = the inverse sine of a. That’s a very fancy way of saying that sine alpha = a. That’s the equivalent statement here. And what’s going on here is something that’s just a little deeper than it looks.

就是这个。我们刚刚弄清楚了这里发生的事情的几何解释。也就是说，我们沿着这个弧走了一段距离 alpha。现在记住这里的半径是 1。这里的水平距离是 a。这里的距离是 a。所以这个几何解释是这个角度是 alpha 弧度。正弦 alpha = a。

Which is this. We’ve just figured out a geometric interpretation of what’s going on here. That is, that we went a distance alpha along this arc. And now remember that the radius here is 1. And this horizontal distance here is a. This distance here is a. And so the geometric interpretation of this is that this angle is alpha radians. And sine alpha = a.

因此，这与我们之前的定义一致，我们之前对弧度的几何定义。但这实际上是你对弧度的第一个真正定义。我们从来没有告诉过你弧度是沿着这条曲线的弧长。这是你第一次推导它。这是你第一次看到它被正确地完成。此外，这是你第一次看到正弦函数的正确定义。

So this is consistent with our definition previously, our previous geometric definition of radians. But this is really your first true definition of radians. We never actually, people told you that radians were the arc length along this curve. This is the first time you’re deriving it. This is the first time you’re seeing it correctly done. And furthermore, this is the first time you’re seeing a correct definition of the sine function.

记住，我们有一种疯狂的方法，我们定义了指数函数，然后我们又用另一种方法将 ln 函数定义为积分。然后我们根据它来定义指数。嗯，这是同一种事情。这里真正发生的事情是，如果你想知道弧度是多少，你必须计算这个数字。

Remember we had this crazy way, we defined the exponential function, then we had another way of defining the ln function as an integral. Then we defined the exponential in terms of it. Well, this is the same sort of thing. What’s really happening here is that if you want to know what radians are, you have to calculate this number.

如果你已经计算出这个数字，那么根据定义，如果正弦是其阿尔法弧度量给你 a 的东西，那么它一定是 a 的正弦倒数。因此，首先要定义的是反正弦。接下来要定义的是正弦。当你从第一原理开始时，基础方法实际上是这样运作的。这个弧长是第一原理之一。

If you’ve calculated this number then by definition if sine is the thing whose alpha radian amount gives you a, then it must be that this is sine inverse of a. And so the first thing that gets defined is the arc sine. And the next thing that gets defined is the sine afterwards. This is the way the foundational approach actually works when you start from first principles. This arc length being one of the first principles.

所以现在我们有一个坚实的三角函数基础。这就是建立这种联系。当然，它与你已经知道的一切一致，所以你不必在这里做任何过渡性思考。只是这是第一次严格地做到这一点。因为你现在只有弧长。

So now we have a solid foundation for trig functions. And this is giving that connection. Of course, it’s consistent with everything you already knew, so you don’t have to make any transitional thinking here. It’s just that this is the first time it’s being done rigorously. Because you only now have arc length.

抛物线长度

Parabola Length

正如我所说，这些是您可能已经知道的例子。也许我们会举一个我们不太了解的例子。

So these are examples, as I say, that maybe you already know. And maybe we’ll do one that we don’t know quite as well.

让我们来计算抛物线的长度。这是示例 3。现在，这就是我之前建议我们做的。所以这是函数 y = x ^2。y ' = 2x。所以 ds = 1 + (2x) ^2 dx 的平方根。现在我可以弄清楚抛物线的一部分是什么了。

Let’s find the length of a parabola. This is Example 3. Now, that was what I was suggesting we were going to do earlier. So this is the function y = x ^2. y ’ = 2x. And so ds = the square root of 1 + (2x) ^2 dx. And now I can figure out what a piece of a parabola is.

所以我将从 0 开始画出一条到 a 的抛物线。这就是块。然后它的弧长，即这条曲线在 0 和 a 之间的长度，就是从 0 到 a 的 1 平方根 + 4x ^2 dx 的积分。好的，现在如果您愿意，这就是问题的答案。但是，如果答案是积分，如果可以求值，人们会讨厌看答案。

So I’ll draw the piece of parabola up to a, let’s say, starting from 0. So that’s the chunk. And then its arc length, between 0 and a of this curve, is the integral from 0 to a of square root of 1 + 4x ^2 dx. OK, now if you like, this is the answer to the question. But people hate looking at answers when they’re integrals if they can be evaluated.

因此，我们之所以要经历所有这些繁琐的计算过程，原因之一就是要向你展示，我们实际上可以更明确地评估这些函数。这并没有多大帮助，但有一个明确的计算方法。所以记住你会怎么做。所以这只是一点复习。我们在积分技术中做了什么。第一步是什么？代换。

So one of the reasons why we went through all this rigamarole of calculating these things is to show you that we can actually evaluate a bunch of these functions here more explicitly. It doesn’t help a lot, but there is an explicit calculation of this. So remember how you would do this. So this is just a little bit of review. What we did in techniques of integration. The first step is what? A substitution.

这是一个三角代换。它是什么？学生：教授：所以 x 等于某个 tan theta。我声称它是 1/2 tan，我将其称为 u。因为几天后我将用 theta 表示其他东西。好吗？所以这是代换。然后当然 dx = 1/2 sec ^2 u du，等等。那么如果你这样做会发生什么？

It’s a trig substitution. And what is it? STUDENT: PROFESSOR: So x equals something tan theta. I claim that it’s 1/2 tan, and I’m going to call it u. Because I’m going to use theta for something else in a couple of days. OK? So this is the substitution. And then of course dx = 1/2 sec ^2 u du,etc. So what happens if you do this?

我会写下答案，但我不会去执行。因为每个答案都很可怕。但我想我算出来了。让我们看看我是否幸运。哦，是的。我想这就是答案。它是 1/4 ln 2x + 1 的平方根 + 4x ^2 + 1/2 x ( 1 的平方根 + 4x ^2 )。在 a 和 0 处求值。所以，真恶心。我的意思是，你知道。

I’ll write down the answer, but I’m not going to carry this out. Because every one of these is horrendous. But I think I worked it out. Let’s see if I’m lucky. Oh yeah. I think this is what it is. It’s a 1/4 ln 2x + square root of 1 + 4x ^2 + 1/2 x ( square root of 1 + 4x ^2). Evaluated at a and 0. So yick. I mean, you know.

学生：教授：我为什么把它设为 1/2？因为当你求导时，结果会是这样的。所以问题是，为什么那里会有 1/2？如果你求导时不带 1/2，你会得到这个项，看起来它正好正确。但是如果你求导这个，你会得到另一个结果。它们全部混合在一起。结果发现还有更多。

STUDENT: PROFESSOR: Why I did I make it 1/2? Because it turns out that when you differentiate. So the question is, why there 1/2 there? If you differentiate it without the 1/2, you get this term and it looks like it’s going to be just right. But then if you differentiate this one you get another thing. And it all mixes together. And it turns out that there’s more.

所以结果是 1/2。对其进行微分并检查。所以这只是一个非常长的计算。它需要十五分钟左右的时间。但关键是，你确实知道如何从原则上做这些事情。学生：教授：哦，他谈论的是这个 1/2，而不是这个疯狂的 1/2。抱歉。学生：教授：是的，好的。很抱歉。谢谢你的帮助。

So it turns out that it’s 1/2. Differentiate it and check. So this just an incredibly long calculation. It would take fifteen minutes or something like that. But the point is, you do know in principle how to do these things. STUDENT: PROFESSOR: Oh, he was talking about this 1/2, not this crazy 1/2 here. Sorry. STUDENT: PROFESSOR: Yeah, OK. So sorry about that. Thank you for helping.

这里 1/2 这个因数的出现是因为当你对 x 求平方时，你得不到 tan^2。当你对 2x 求平方时，你会得到 4x^2，这与这个东西完全匹配。这就是为什么你需要这个因数。是的。另一个问题，在后面。学生：教授：问题是，当你进行这种替换时，从 0 到 a 的极限不会改变吗？答案是，绝对会。

This factor of 1/2 here comes about because when you square x, you don’t get tan ^2. When you square 2x, you get 4x ^2 and that matches perfectly with this thing. And that’s why you need this factor here. Yeah. Another question, way in the back. STUDENT: PROFESSOR:. The question is, when you do this substitution, doesn’t the limit from 0 to a change. And the answer is, absolutely yes.

u 的极限与 a 的极限不同。但是，如果我将其转换回 x 变量（我在此底部公式中已完成此操作），即 x = 0 和 x = a，它会回到原始变量中的极限。因此，如果我在原始变量中写入内容，我就会得到原始极限。如果我使用 u 变量，则必须更改极限。

The limits in terms of u are not the same as the limits in terms of a. But if I then translate back to the x variables, which I’ve done here in this bottom formula, of x = 0 and x = a, it goes back to those in the original variables. So if I write things in the original variables, I have the original limits. If I use the u variables, I would have to change limits.

但我没有进行积分，因为我不想。所以我把它带回到 x 公式。其他问题。好的，现在我们准备在这里稍微进入三维空间。我们将讨论表面积。您将在多变量微积分中大量使用表面积。这是非常有趣的事情之一。请记住，当事情变得复杂时，最简单的事情是最重要的。

But I’m not carrying out the integration, because I don’t want to. So I brought it back to the x formula. Other questions. OK, so now we’re ready to launch into three space a little bit here. We’re going to talk about surface area. You’re going to be doing a lot with surface area in multivariable calculus. It’s one of the really fun things. And just remember, when it gets complicated, that the simplest things are the most important.

简单来说，如果你能处理线性函数，你就能理解其余的一切。因此，会有一些复杂的东西，但实际上只涉及平面上发生的事情。

And the simple things are, if you can handle things for linear functions, you know all the rest. So there’s going to be some complicated stuff but it’ll really only involve what’s happening on planes.

旋转表面

Surface of Rotation

那么让我们从表面积开始。我想举的例子，这是我们唯一的例子，就是旋转表面。只要我们有抛物线，我们就会使用它。

So let’s start with surface area. And the example that I’d like to give, this is the only type of example that we’ll have, is the surface of rotation. And as long as we have our parabola there, we’ll use that one.

因此，我们有 y = x ^2，绕 x 轴旋转。让我们看看它是什么样子。它是抛物线，就像那样。然后它绕 x 轴旋转。所以是这种带有小圆圈的形状。它是某种喇叭形状，对吧？这就是我们所看到的形状。现在，再说一遍，它是表面。它只是喇叭的金属，而不是内部。

So we have y = x ^2, rotated around the x axis. So let’s take a look at what this looks like. It’s the parabola, which is going like that. And then it’s being spun around the x axis. So some kind of shape like this with little circles. It’s some kind of trumpet shape, right? And that’s the shape that we’re. Now, again, it’s the surface. It’s just the metal of the trumpet, not the insides.

表面积元素

Surface Area Element

现在，计算面积公式的原理与我们计算旋转曲面的原理并没有什么不同。但这只需要一点思考和想象力。我们这里有一小段弧长。我们要绕着这个轴旋转它。现在，如果这是一段水平的弧长，那么它会像贝壳一样旋转。它只是一个表面。

Now, the principle for figuring out what the formula for area is, is not that different from what we did for surfaces of revolution. But it just requires a little bit of thought and imagination. We have a little chunk of arc length along here. And we’re going to spin that around this axis. Now, if this were a horizontal piece of arc length, then it would spin around just like a shell. It would just be a surface.

但是如果它倾斜了，那么表面积就会增加，与倾斜的量成正比。所以它与你旋转的线段的长度成正比。所以总数将是 ds，这是这里的一个因素。也许我会把它写在第二个。这是其中一个维度。然后另一个维度是周长。也就是 2 pi，在本例中是 y。所以这就是计算的结束。

But if it’s tilted, if it’s tilted, then there’s more surface area proportional to the amount that it’s tilted. So it’s proportional to the length of the segment that you spin around. So the total is going to be ds, that’s one of the factors here. Maybe I’ll write that second. That’s one of the dimensions. And then the other dimension is the circumference. Which is 2 pi, in this case y. So that’s the end of the calculation.

这是表面积的面积元素。现在，当您读到 18.02 时，甚至可能在此之前，您还会看到一些人在表示曲面时使用 d S 来表示这个面积元素。这有点令人困惑，因为我们这里有一个小写的 s。我们现在不打算使用它。但小写的 s 通常是弧长。大写的 s 通常是表面积。所以。

This is the area element of surface area. Now, when you get to 18.02, and maybe even before that, you’ll also see some people referring to this area element when it’s a curvy surface like this with a notation d S. That’s a little confusing because we have a lower case s here. We’re not going to use it right now. But the lower case s is usually arc length. The upper case s is usually surface area. So.

也用于 dA。面积元素。因为这是一个曲面面积元素。让我们来看一下这个例子。在这个例子中，等于 x ^2，那么情况是，我们的表面积等于从 0 到 a 的积分，如果这些是我们想要选择的极限。2 pi x ^2，对吗？

Also used for dA. The area element. Because this is a curved area element. So let’s figure out this example. So in the example, is equal to x ^2 then the situation is, we have the surface area is equal to the integral from, I don’t know, 0 to a if those are the limits that we wanted to choose. Of 2 pi x ^2, right?

因为 y = x ^2（1 + 4x ^2 的平方根）dx。记住，我们从前面的例子中得到了这个。这是前面的 ds。当然，这是 2 pi y。现在，这个积分的计算有点长。我将省略它。但我只想指出，它是从相同的替换中得出的。即 x = 1/2 tan u。适用于这个积分。

Because y = x ^2 ( the square root of 1 + 4x ^2) dx. Remember we had this from our previous example. This was ds from previous. And this, of course, is 2 pi y. Now again, the calculation of this integral is kind of long. And I’m going to omit it. But let me just point out that it follows from the same substitution. Namely, x = 1/2 tan u. Is going to work for this integral.

这有点乱。这里有一个 tan^2 和 sec^2。还有另一个正割等等。所以这是这些三角积分之一，需要一段时间才能完成。所以它会逐渐消失。原因是这里更重要的是方法。以及积分的设置。

It’s kind of a mess. There’s a tan ^2 here and the sec ^2. There’s another secant and so on. So it’s one of these trig integrals that then takes a while to do. So that just is going to trail off into nothing. And the reason is that what’s important here is more the method. And the setup of the integrals.

实际上，在实际计算中，你可以进入一个程序，插入类似这样的程序，然后你就会立即得到答案。所以我们真正想要的只是让你有足够的控制力，知道这是一个可控的积分。并且知道如果你插入它，你就会得到答案。

The actual computation, in fact, you could go to a program and you could plug in something like this and you would spit out an answer immediately. So really what we just want is for you to have enough control to see that it’s an integral that’s a manageable one. And also to know that if you plugged it in, you would get an answer.

但是，当我真正进行计算时，我想要做的是得到一个你能记住的答案。这是一个很好的答案。这就是球体表面积的例子。所以它类似于这里的 2。也许我应该记住这里的这个结果。弧长元素由此给出。所以我们先把它留到第二步。

When I actually do carry out a calculation, though, what I want to do is to do something that has an answer that you can remember. And that’s a nice answer. So that turns out to be the example of the surface area of a sphere. So it’s analogous to this 2 here. And maybe I should remember this result here. Which was that the arc length element was given by this. So we’ll save that for a second.

现在我们来计算一下表面积。如果你愿意，这是另一个例子。球体的表面积。这是一个很好的例子，而且正如我所说，它有一个很好的答案。所以值得一试。

So we’re going to do this surface area now. So if you like, this is another example. The surface area of a sphere. This is a good example, and one, as I say, that has a really nice answer. So it’s worth doing.

首先，我不会像示例 2 中那样设置它。相反，我将采用一般球体，因为我想观察半径的依赖性。所以这里是半径。它将是半径 a。现在，如果我执行与之前相同的计算，如果你仔细想一想，你会得到这个结果。

So first of all, I’m not going to set it up quite the way I did in Example 2. Instead, I’m going to take the general sphere, because I’d like to watch the dependence on the radius. So here this is going to be the radius. It’s going to be radius a. And now, if I carry out the same calculations as before, if you think about it for a second, you’re going to get this result.

然后，上面的其余算术运算，也就是 a = 1，将得出 ds = 什么？好吧，也许我会直接执行它。因为这样总是很好。所以我们有 1 + x ^2 / a ^2 x ^2。即 1 + (y ') ^2。现在我把它放在一个公分母上。

And then, the rest of the arithmetic, which is sitting up there in the case, a = 1, will give us that ds = what? Well, maybe I’ll just carry it out. Because that’s always nice. So we have 1 + x ^2 / a ^2 x ^2. That’s 1 + (y ’) ^2. And now I put this over a common denominator.

我得到了 ^2 x ^2。分子中有一个 ^2 x ^2 + x^2。因此发生相同的抵消。但现在我们在分子中得到了一个 ^2。因此现在我可以设置 ds。这就是发生的事情。球体截面的面积，让我们看看。我们将从某个起始位置 x1 开始，并在某个位置 x2 结束。那么它看起来像什么？

And I get a ^2 x ^2. And I have in the numerator a ^2 x ^2 + x^2. So the same cancellation occurs. But now we get an a ^2 in the numerator. So now I can set up the ds. And so here’s what happens. The area of a section of the sphere, so let’s see. We’re going to start at some starting place x1, and end at some place x2. So what does that look like?

这是球体。我们从 x1 处开始。我们结束于 x2 处。如果你愿意的话，我们可以在这里截取一部分。这个球体的截面。所以面积等于这个。它会是多少？好吧，我这里有 2 pi y。我会把它写出来，暂时就把它留作 y。然后我有 ds。

Here’s the sphere. And we’re starting at a place x1. And we’re ending at a place x2. And we’re taking more or less the slice here, if you like. The section of this sphere. So the area’s going to equal this. And what is it going to be? Well, so I have here 2 pi y. I’ll write it out, just leave it as y for now. And then I have ds.

所以当你绕 x 轴旋转时，公式总是这样的。然后我会代入这些东西。所以 2 pi，y 的公式是平方根 a ^2 x ^2。ds 的公式，嗯，它是这个乘以 dx 的平方根。所以它是 a ^2 / a ^2 x ^2 dx 的平方根。所以这部分是 ds。这部分是 y。

So that’s always what the formula is when you’re revolving around the x axis. And then I’ll plug in for those things. So 2 pi, the formula for y is square root a ^2 x ^2. And the formula for ds, well, it’s the square root of this times dx. So it’s the square root of a ^2 / a ^2 x ^2 dx. So this part is ds. And this part is y.

现在，我声称我们有一个不错的消去。a 的平方根 ^2 = a。然后还有另一个不错的消去。如你所见。现在，我们得到的是从 x1 到 x2 的积分，即 2 pi a dx，这是你能想象到的最简单的积分。它只是一个常数的积分。所以它是 2 pi a ( x2 x1)。让我们通过几个例子来检查一下。

And now, I claim we have a nice cancellation that takes place. Square root of a ^2 = a. And then there’s another good cancellation. As you can see. Now, what we get here is the integral from x1 to x2, of 2 pi a dx, which is about the easiest integral you can imagine. It’s just the integral of a constant. So it’s 2 pi a ( x2 x1). Let’s check this in a couple of examples.

然后看看它在几何上说了什么。所以这说明了什么，所以当你有这样一个好的公式时，你应该总是检查特殊情况，至少。但实际上，任何事情都要检查，以确保你得到了正确的答案。例如，如果你取半球。所以你取这个球体的 1/2。所以这将是从 0 开始，对不起。并以 a 结束。

And then see what it’s saying geometrically, a little bit. So what this is saying, so special cases that you should always check when you have a nice formula like this, at least. But really with anything in order to make sure that you’ve got the right answer. If you take, for example, the hemisphere. So you take 1/2 of this sphere. So that would be starting at 0, sorry. And ending at a.

这就是从 0 到 a 的积分。因此，x1 = 0。x2 = a。您将得到的是一个半球。面积是 (2 pi a ) a。或者换句话说，2 pi a ^2。如果您取整个球体，即从 x1 = a 和 x2 = a 开始，您将得到 (2 pi a) ( a ( a))。也就是 4 pi a ^2。这就是全部。

So that’s the integral from 0 to a. So this is the case x1 = 0. x2 = a. And what you’re going to get is a hemisphere. And the area is (2 pi a ) a. Or in other words, 2 pi a ^2. And if you take the whole sphere, that’s starting at x1 = a, and x2 = a, you’re getting (2 pi a) ( a ( a)). Which is 4 pi a ^2. That’s the whole thing.

是的，问题。学生：教授：问题是，是否可以绕 y 轴旋转？答案是可以的。绕 y 轴旋转是合法的。如果你使用垂直切片，就像我们在这里做的那样，也就是说，它们有点像切片的尖端，这是一个不同的想法。但无论如何，它使用 dx 作为积分变量的积分。

Yeah, question. STUDENT: PROFESSOR:. The question is, would it be possible to rotate around the y axis? And the answer is yes. It’s legal to rotate around the y axis. And there is, if you use vertical slices as we did here, that is, well they’re sort of tips of slices, it’s a different idea. But anyway, it’s using dx as the integral of the variable of integration.

所以我们要检查每一小块，每一小条这种类型。如果我们在这里使用 dx，我们会得到这个。如果你以另一种方式旋转同样的事情，并使用 dy 作为变量，你会得到完全相同的答案。而且这将是相同的计算。因为它们是平行的。所以你是的。学生：教授：你能用贝壳做服务区吗？嗯，贝壳形状。简短的回答是不完全是。

So we’re checking each little piece, each little strip of that type. If we use dx here, we get this. If you did the same thing rotated the other way, and use dy as the variable, you get exactly the same answer. And it would be the same calculation. Because they’re parallel. So you’re, yep. STUDENT: PROFESSOR: Can you do service area with shells? Well, ah shell shape. The short answer is not quite.

壳形是一个垂直壳，它本身就是三维的，而且有厚度。不过这只是一个术语问题。当我们在这里进行旋转时，这个厚度就是这个 dx。然后还有另外两个维度。如果我们有一个曲面，就没有其他维度可以形成壳了。但基本上，你可以把东西切成任何你可以实际测量的部分。

The shell shape is a vertical shell which is itself already three dimensional, and it has a thickness. So this is just a matter of terminology, though. This thickness is this dx, when we do this rotation here. And then there are two other dimensions. If we have a curved surface, there’s no other dimension left to form a shell. But basically, you can chop things up into any bits that you can actually measure.

你可以算出面积是多少。这是重点。现在，我说我们要开始，我们刚刚进入三维空间。现在我想继续讨论其他类似空间的现象。但我们要这样做。

That you can figure out what the area is. That’s the main point. Now, I said we were going to, we’ve just launched into three dimensional space. And I want to now move on to other space like phenomena. But we’re going to do this.

为1802年做准备

Preparation for 1802

所以这也是为 18.02 做准备，在 18.02 中你将做大量的这方面的工作。我们现在要讨论参数方程。实际上只是参数曲线。

So this is also a preparation for 18.02, where you’ll be doing this a tremendous amount. We’re going to talk now about parametric equations. Really just parametric curves.

所以你现在会看到这个，我们会解释几次，我们会考虑极坐标。这些都是为考虑更多变量以及以不同于以往的方式思考做准备。所以我想让你的大脑做好准备，在这里进行转变。这是向多变量思维转变的开始。我们将考虑这样的曲线。

So you’re going to see this now and we’re going to interpret it a couple of times, and we’re going to think about polar coordinates. These are all preparation for thinking in more variables, and thinking in a different way than you’ve been thinking before. So I want you to prepare your brain to make a transition here. This is the beginning of the transition to multivariable thinking. We’re going to consider curves like this.

用 x 表示 t 的函数，用 y 表示 t 的函数。字母 t 称为参数。在这种情况下，你应该把它想象成时间，最简单的想象方式就是把它想象成时间。这就是所谓的轨迹。所以这也被称为轨迹。它的位置，比如说，在时间 0，就是这里的这个位置。

Which are described with x being a function of t and y being a function of t. And this letter t is called the parameter. In this case you should think of it, the easiest way to think of it is as time. And what you have is what’s called a trajectory. So this is also called a trajectory. And its location, let’s say, at time 0, is this location here.

对于 (0, y ( 0))，这是平面上的一个点。然后在这里，例如，可能是 (x ( 1), y (1))。我在这里画了箭头，表示我们要从这个地方到那个地方。这些是较晚的时间。t = 1 比 t = 0 晚。所以这只是一种非常随意的方式，只是我们使用这些符号的方式。

Of (0, y ( 0)), that’s a point in the plane. And then over here, for instance, maybe it’s (x ( 1), y (1)). And I drew arrows along here to indicate that we’re going from this place over to that place. These are later times. t = 1 is a later time than t = 0. So that’s just a very casual, it’s just the way we use these notations.

现在让我给你举第一个例子，即 x = a cost t，y = a sin t。首先要弄清楚的是这是一条什么样的曲线。要做到这一点，我们要弄清楚它在直角坐标中满足什么方程。因此，要弄清楚这是一条什么样的曲线，我们认识到如果我们求平方并相加。

Now let me give you the first example, which is x = a cos t, y = a sin t. And the first thing to figure out is what kind of curve this is. And to do that, we want to figure out what equation it satisfies in rectangular coordinates. So to figure out what curve this is, we recognize that if we square and add.

因此，我们将 x ^2 添加到 y^2，我们将得到一个非常漂亮和干净的结果。我们将得到 a^2 cos ^2 t + a ^2 sin ^2 t。是的，没错，好的。这只是 a ^2 (cos^2 + sin ^2)，或者换句话说是 a^2。瞧，我们得到的是一个圆圈。然后我们知道它现在是什么形状。

So we add x ^2 to y^2, we’re going to get something very nice and clean. We’re going to get a^2 cos ^2 t + a ^2 sin ^2 t. Yeah that’s right, OK. Which is just a ^2 (cos^2 + sin ^2), or in other words a^2. So lo and behold, what we have is a circle. And then we know what shape this is now.

我想要跟踪的另一件事是我们在圆上行进的方向。因为这个参数不仅仅是形状。还有我们在什么时间在哪里。这可以想象成行星的轨迹。所以在这里，我必须通过绘制图片并弄清楚会发生什么来做到这一点。

And the other thing I’d like to keep track of is which direction we’re going on the circle. Because there’s more to this parameter then just the shape. There’s also where we are at what time. This would be, think of it like the trajectory of a planet. So here, I have to do this by plotting the picture and figuring out what happens.

因此，在 t = 0 时，我们有 (x, y) 等于，代入这里 (a cos 0, a sin 0)。也就是 a * 1 + a * 0，所以 a0。这就是这里。这就是点 (a, 0)。我们知道它是半径为 a 的圆。所以我们知道曲线会以某种方式像这样绕一圈。

So at t = 0, we have (x, y) is equal to, plug in here (a cos 0, a sin 0). Which is just a * 1 + a * 0, so a0. And that’s here. That’s the point (a, 0). We know that it’s the circle of radius a. So we know that the curve is going to go around like this somehow.

让我们看看在 t = pi / 2 时会发生什么。因此，在那个点，我们有 (x,y) = ( a cos pi / 2, a sin pi / 2)。也就是 (0, a)，因为 pi / 2 的正弦 = 1。所以这就是这里。所以这就是在 t = 0 时发生的事情。这就是在 t = pi / 2 时发生的事情。轨迹显然是朝这个方向发展的。

So let’s see what happens at t = pi / 2. So at that point, we have (x,y) = ( a cos pi / 2, a sin pi / 2). Which is (0, a), because sine of pi / 2 = 1. So that’s up here. So this is what happens at t = 0. This is what happens at t = pi / 2. And the trajectory clearly goes this way.

事实上，结果是 t = pi，等等。它在 t = 2 pi 时重复。所以我们的另一个特征，即定性特征，是它是逆时针的。不，最后一点是弧长。跟踪弧长。下次我们会这样做。

In fact, this turns out to be t = pi, etc. And it repeats at t = 2 pi. So the other feature that we have, which is qualitative feature, is that it’s counterclockwise. No the last little bit is going to be the arc length. Keeping track of the arc length. And we’ll do that next time.

Lec 32 | MIT 18.01 单变量微积分，2007 年秋季

Lec 32 | MIT 18.01 Single Variable Calculus, Fall 2007

15 年前 (2009 年 9 月 10 日) — 49:23 https://youtube.com/watch?v=XRkgBWbWvg4

15 years ago (Sep 10, 2009) — 49:23 https://youtube.com/watch?v=XRkgBWbWvg4
