The following content is provided under a Creative Commons license. Your support will help MIT OpenCourseWare continue to offer high quality educational resources for free. To make a donation or to view additional materials from hundreds of MIT courses, visit MIT OpenCourseWare at ocw.mit.edu. PROFESSOR: Today we’re going to continue our discussion of parametric curves. I have to tell you about arc length. And let me remind me where we left off last time. This is parametric curves, continued.

上次，我们讨论了圆的参数化表示。或者圆的参数化表示之一。就是这里的这个。首先我们注意到，正如我们所说，这确实参数化了圆。这满足圆的方程。它是逆时针描绘的。图片看起来是这样的。这是圆。

Last time, we talked about the parametric representation for the circle. Or one of the parametric representations for the circle. Which was this one here. And first we noted that this does parameterize, as we say, the circle. That satisfies the equation for the circle. And it’s traced counterclockwise. The picture looks like this. Here’s the circle.

它从 t = 0 开始，到 t = pi / 2 时到达这里。现在我要和大家讨论一下弧长。以这种参数形式。结果通常应该与这个圆的弧长相同。我们从这个基本的微分关系开始。

And it starts out here at t = 0 and it gets up to here at time t = pi / 2. So now I have to talk to you about arc length. In this parametric form. And the results should be the same as arc length around this circle ordinarily. And we start out with this basic differential relationship.

Ds^2 是 dx^2 + dy^2。然后我要取平方根，除以 dt，因此 s 相对于 t 的变化率将是平方根。好吧，也许我会不除法就写出来。只写成 ds。所以这将是 (dx/dt)^2 + (dy/dt)^2, dt。所以这就是你从这个等式中正式得到的结果。如果你取它的平方根，然后除以 dt 平方。

Ds^2 is dx^2 + dy^2. And then I’m going to take the square root, divide by dt, so the rate of change with respect to t of s is going to be the square root. Well, maybe I’ll write it without dividing. Just write it as ds. So this would be (dx/dt)^2 + (dy/dt)^2, dt. So this is what you get formally from this equation. If you take its square roots and you divide by dt squared in the.

在平方根内，在外面乘以 dt，这样它们就抵消了。这就是两者之间的正式联系。几分钟后，我们将再说几句话，说明如何严格理解这一点。好吧，这就是无穷小的公式集，弧长的微分。为了弄清楚，我必须对 x 求 t 的微分。记住 x 在这里。

Inside the square root, and you multiply by dt outside, so that those cancel. And this is the formal connection between the two. We’ll be saying just a few more words in a few minutes about how to make sense of that rigorously. Alright so that’s the set of formulas for the infinitesimal, the differential of arc length. And so to figure it out, I have to differentiate x with respect to t. And remember x is up here.

它由 a cost t 定义，因此其导数是 a sin t。类似地，dy/dt = a cost t。因此我可以代入它。我得到弧长元素，即 ( a sin t)^2 + (a cos t)^2, dt 的平方根。它就变成了 a^2, dt 或 a dt 的平方根。现在，我正要除以 t。现在让我来做这件事。

It’s defined by a cos t, so its derivative is a sin t. And similarly, dy/dt = a cos t. And so I can plug this in. And I get the arc length element, which is the square root of ( a sin t)^2 + (a cos t)^2, dt. Which just becomes the square root of a^2, dt, or a dt. Now, I was about to divide by t. Let me do that now.

我们也可以写出弧长相对于 t 的变化率。在本例中，这就是 a。这被解释为粒子绕行的速度。所以，不仅，让我交换一下这两个家伙，我们不仅知道方向是逆时针，而且我们还有速度，如果你愿意的话，它是均匀的。它是恒定速度。速率是 a。所以这就是 ds/dt。绕行。

We can also write the rate of change of arc length with respect to t. And that’s a, in this case. And this gets interpreted as the speed of the particle going around. So not only, let me trade these two guys, not only do we have the direction is counterclockwise, but we also have that the speed is, if you like, it’s uniform. It’s constant speed. And the rate is a. So that’s ds/dt. Travelling around.

这意味着我们可以调整速度。我只想指出一点。标准的东西，你必须习惯，这是一个标准的演示，你到处都会看到。在你的物理课和其他数学课上，如果你想改变速度，那么一个新的速度就会围绕这个，如果我这样设置方程式。现在我在同一个圆上画线。

And that means that we can play around with the speed. And I just want to point out. So the standard thing, what you’ll have to get used to, and this is a standard presentation, you’ll see this everywhere. In your physics classes and your other math classes, if you want to change the speed, so a new speed going around this would be, if I set up the equations this way. Now I’m tracing around the same circle.

但如果你算出来，速度最终会变成，会有一个额外的因子 k。所以它会是 ak。这就是我们要算出的速度。假设 k 为正，a 为正。所以我们制定了这些约定。我们使用的常数是正的。现在，这是第一个也是最基本的例子。一个不断出现的例子。

But the speed is going to turn out to be, if you figure it out, there’ll be an extra factor of k. So it’ll be ak. That’s what we’ll work out to be the speed. Provided k is positive and a is positive. So we’re making these conventions. The constants that we’re using are positive. Now, that’s the first and most basic example. The one that comes up constantly.

现在，让我就我想说的那些关于符号的评论。我们在这里处理这些平方微分已经有一段时间了，我只是想更仔细地关注一下这些操作。什么是允许的，什么是不允许的。什么是合理的，什么是不合理的。

Now, let me just make those comments about notation that I wanted to make. And we’ve been treating these squared differentials here for a little while and I just want to pay attention a little bit more carefully to these manipulations. And what’s allowed and what’s not. And what’s justified and what’s not.

因此，这个公式的基础是我们进行的近似计算，即 (delta s)^2 等于 (delta x)^2 + (delta y)^2。这就是我们之前证明弧长公式的方法。让我向你们展示一下，我上面的公式，即参数形式的弧长基本公式，与另一个公式一样。现在我要做得更严格一些。

So the basis for this was this approximate calculation that we had, that (delta s)^2 was (delta x)^2 + (delta y)^2. This is how we justified the arc length formula before. And let me just show you that the formula that I have up here, this basic formula for arc length in the parametric form, follows just as the other one did. And now I’m going to do it slightly more rigorously.

我在求无穷小量的极限之前，实际上是在变相地做除法。所以我实际上做的就是这样做。除以这个，很抱歉，这仍然近似相等。所以我不是除以 0 或无穷小量。我是除以非零值。这里我有 ((delta x)/(delta t))^2 + ((delta y)/(delta t))^2，然后在极限中，我有 ds/dt 等于这个的平方根。

I do the division really in disguise before I take the limit of the infinitesimal. So all I’m really doing is I’m doing this. Dividing through by this, and sorry this is still approximately equal. So I’m not dividing by something that’s 0 or infinitesimal. I’m dividing by something nonzero. And here I have ((delta x)/(delta t))^2 + ((delta y)/(delta t))^2 And then in the limit, I have ds/dt is equal to the square root of this guy.

或者，如果你愿意，也可以是它的平方。所以，用接近于 0 的数除，然后在趋近于 0 时取极限是合法的。这就是导数的真正含义。我们在这里得到一个极限。当分母趋近于 0 时。因为分子也趋近于 0。所以这就是符号。

Or, if you like, the square of it, so. So it’s legal to divide by something that’s almost 0 and then take the limit as we go to 0. This is really what derivatives are all about. That we get a limit here. As the denominator goes to 0. Because the numerator’s going to 0 too. So that’s the notation.

现在我想提醒你们，也许只是一点点，关于符号的误用，如果你愿意的话。我们绝对不会这样做。这个由平方得出的表达式，你永远不应该把它写成这样。这样，把它写在黑板上，但要很快，永远不要。好的。不要那样做。我们使用这些平方微分，但我们在这里不使用这些比率。但还有另一个地方有点令人困惑。

And now I want to warn you, maybe just a little bit, about misuses, if you like, of the notation. We don’t do absolutely everything this way. This expression that came up with the squares, you should never write it as this. This, put it on the board but very quickly, never. OK. Don’t do that. We use these square differentials, but we don’t do it with these ratios here. But there was another place which is slightly confusing.

它看起来非常相似，我们确实在分母中使用了微分的平方。我只想指出，它是不同的。它是不一样的。而且没问题。这就是这个。这个东西。这是一个二阶导数，它是别的东西。它在分母中有一个 dt^2。所以它看起来相当相似。但这代表的是 d/dt 平方的数量。

It looks very similar, where we did use the square of the differential in a denominator. And I just want to point out to you that it’s different. It’s not the same. And it is OK. And that was this one. This thing here. This is a second derivative, it’s something else. And it’s got a dt^2 in the denominator. So it looks rather similar. But what this represents is the quantity d/dt squared.

你可以看到平方出现了。然后对两个表达式求平方。然后这里还有一个 x。所以这是合法的。这些是我们确实使用的符号。我们甚至可以计算它。它具有非常好的含义。它与 x 的导数关于 t 的导数相同，我们已经知道它是负正弦。抱歉，我想是 sin t。不是这个例子，而是前一个例子。

And you can see the squares came in. And squared the two expressions. And then there’s also an x over here. So that’s legal. Those are notations that we do use. And we can even calculate this. It has a perfectly good meaning. It’s the same as the derivative with respect to t of the derivative of x, which we already know was minus sine. sorry, a sin t, I guess. Not this example, but the previous one.

上图。所以导数是这样的，所以我可以再微分一次。然后我得到了一个 cost t。所以这是一个完全合法的操作。里面的一切都说得通。只是不要使用它。还有一件非常不幸的事情，就是 2 在正弦波中会爬到奇怪的位置。你有正弦平方。它会在这里，它会因为一些奇怪的原因出现在这里。

Up here. So the derivative is this and so I can differentiate a second time. And I get a cos t. So that’s a perfectly legal operation. Everything in there makes sense. Just don’t use that. There’s another really unfortunate thing, right which is that the 2 creeps in funny places with sines. You have sine squared. It would be out here, it comes up here for some strange reason.

这只是因为排版师很懒，或者数学排版史上的某个人决定让 2 迁移。这就像把 2 放在这里一样。数学中存在不一致，对吧。我们并不完美，人们只是开发了这些符号。所以我们必须接受它们。人们接受的那些惯例。我想给你的下一个例子略有不同。它将是一个非恒定速度参数化。

This is just because typographers are lazy or somebody somewhere in the history of mathematical typography decided to let the 2 migrate. It would be like putting the 2 over here. There’s inconsistency in mathematics, right. We’re not perfect and people just develop these notations. So we have to live with them. The ones that people accept as conventions. The next example that I want to give you is just slightly different. It’ll be a non constant speed parameterization.

这里 x = 2 sin t。y 表示为 cost t。让我们来看一下这个公式的作用。现在，这是我要经常问你的一项技能。它是几项技能之一。你必须将它与某种矩形方程联系起来。x 和 y 的方程。今天我们会做一定数量的此类练习。在另一个上下文中。

Here x = 2 sin t. And y is, say, cos t. And let’s keep track of what this one does. Now, this is a skill which I’m going to ask you about quite a bit. And it’s one of several skills. You’ll have to connect this with some kind of rectangular equation. An equation for x and y. And we’ll be doing a certain amount of this today. In another context.

就在这里，为了看到这个模式，我们知道我们要使用的关系是 sin^2 + cos^2 = 1。所以实际上这里正确的做法是取 1/4 x^2 + y^2。结果将是 sin^2 t + cos^2 t。等于 1。所以这就是方程。这是这个参数曲线的矩形方程。这描述了一个椭圆。

Right here, to see the pattern, we know that the relationship we’re going to want to use is that sin^2 + cos^2 = 1. So in fact the right thing to do here is to take 1/4 x^2 + y^2. And that’s going to turn out to be sin^2 t + cos^2 t. Which is 1. So there’s the equation. Here’s the rectangular equation for this parametric curve. And this describes an ellipse.

这不是我们能在这里获得的唯一信息。我们能获得的其他信息是定性信息，包括我们从哪里开始、我们要去哪里、方向。我认为，它从 t = 0 开始。当 t = 0 时，这是 (2 sin 0, cos 0)，对吗？(2 sin 0, cos 0) 等于点 (0,1)。所以它从这里开始。在 (0,1)。

That’s not the only information that we can get here. The other information that we can get is this qualitative information of where we start, where we’re going, the direction. It starts out, I claim, at t = 0. That’s when t = 0, this is (2 sin 0, cos 0), right? (2 sin 0, cos 0) is equal to the point (0,1). So it starts up here. At (0,1).

接下来是下一个小点，所以这肯定是你想做的一件事。t = pi/2 可能是下一个容易绘制的点。这将是 (2 sin(pi/2), cos(pi/2))。这就是 (2,0)。所以它在这里的某个地方。这是 (2,0)。我们知道它沿着椭圆行进。我们知道短轴是 1，长轴是 2，所以它就是这样。

And then the next little place, so this is one thing that certainly you want to do. t = pi/2 is maybe the next easy point to plot. And that’s going to be (2 sin(pi/2), cos(pi/2)). And that’s just (2,0). And so that’s over here somewhere. This is (2,0). And we know it travels along the ellipse. And we know the minor axis is 1, and the major axis is 2, so it’s doing this.

这就是 t = 0 时发生的情况。这就是 t = pi/2 时的情况。它会一直绕下去，直到椭圆的其余部分。这是方向。所以这个方向恰好是顺时针方向。好的，现在让我们跟踪它的速度。让我们跟踪速度，还有弧长。所以速度是这里导数的平方根。

So this is what happens at t = 0. This is where we are at t = pi/2. And it continues all the way around, etc. To the rest of the ellipse. This is the direction. So this one happens to be clockwise. Alright, now let’s keep track of its speed. Let’s keep track of the speed, and also the arc length. So the speed is the square root of the derivatives here.

那将是 (2 cos t)^2 + (sin t)^2。弧长是多少？好吧，如果我们想绕一圈，我们需要知道总共需要 2 pi。所以从 0 到 2 pi。然后我们必须积分 ds，也就是这个表达式，或者 ds/dt, dt。所以这是 4 cos^2 t + sin^2 t, dt 的平方根。

That would be (2 cos t)^2 + (sin t)^2. And the arc length is what? Well, if we want to go all the way around, we need to know that takes a total of 2 pi. So 0 to 2 pi. And then we have to integrate ds, which is this expression, or ds/dt, dt. So that’s the square root of 4 cos^2 t + sin^2 t, dt.

坏消息是，这不是一个初等积分。换句话说，无论你花多长时间试图找出如何对这个表达式进行反微分，无论你尝试多少次替换，你都会失败。这是坏消息。好消息是，这不是一个初等积分。这不是一个初等积分。这意味着这是一个问题的答案。而不是你必须努力解决的问题。

The bad news, if you like, is that this is not an elementary integral. In other words, no matter how long you try to figure out how to antidifferentiate this expression, no matter how many substitutions you try, you will fail. That’s the bad news. The good news is this is not an elementary integral. It’s not an elementary integral. Which means that this is the answer to a question. Not something that you have to work on.

所以如果有人问你这个弧长，你就在这里停下。这就是答案，所以它实际上比看起来要好。我们会尽力的。我的意思是，我不指望你已经知道所有不可能的积分是什么。哪些很难，哪些很容易。所以当你面对这些问题时，我们会试着指导你。决定并不容易。我会给你一些线索，但是。

So if somebody asks you for this arc length, you stop here. That’s the answer, so it’s actually better than it looks. And we’ll try to. I mean, I don’t expect you to know already what all of the integrals are that are impossible. And which ones are hard and which ones are easy. So we’ll try to coach you through when you face these things. It’s not so easy to decide. I’ll give you a few clues, but.

好的。这是弧长。现在，我想继续讨论我们做的最后一件事。我们上次做的最后一类事情。也就是表面积。是的，问题。学生：教授：。这个问题，这是一个好问题。问题是，当你画椭圆时，你没有考虑到 t 是什么。答案是，这是伪装的。

OK. So this is the arc length. Now, I want to move on to the last thing that we did. Last type of thing that we did last time. Which is the surface area. And yeah, question. STUDENT: PROFESSOR:. The question, this is a good question. The question is, when you draw the ellipse, do you not take into account what t is. The answer is that this is in disguise.

这里发生的事情是，我们在平面上绘制实际发生的事情时遇到了麻烦。换句话说，这有点麻烦。关键是我们有两个 t 函数，而不是一个。x(t) 和 y(t)。所以如果我在平面上绘制事物，我可以做一件事。换句话说，这里要说明的要点是，我们讨论的不是 y 是 x 的函数的情况。

What’s going on here is we have a trouble with plotting in the plane what’s really happening. So in other words, it’s kind of in trouble. So the point is that we have two functions of t, not one. x(t) and y(t). So one thing that I can do if I plot things in the plane. In other words, the main point to make here is that we’re not talking about the situation y is a function of x.

我们现在已脱离了那个境界。在我们的思想中，我们处于宇宙的另一个部分。你应该放弃这个观点。所以这个描述不是 y 作为 x 的函数。嗯，这很明显，因为这里有两个值，而不是一个。所以我们遇到了麻烦。我们有那个背景参数，这正是我们使用它的原因。这个参数 t。

We’re out of that realm now. We’re somewhere in a different part of the universe in our thought. And you should drop this point of view. So this depiction is not y as a function of x. Well, that’s obvious because there are two values here, as opposed to one. So we’re in trouble with that. And we have that background parameter, and that’s exactly why we’re using it. This parameter t.

这样我们就可以描绘出整个曲线。把它当作一个整体来处理。既然我无法真正画出来，而且地图上也没有 t，那么你应该把它想象成时间，并且有某种轨迹在四处移动。然后我标记了几个地方。

So that we can depict the entire curve. And deal with it as one thing. So since I can’t really draw it, and since t is nowhere on the map, you should sort of imagine it as time, and there’s some kind of trajectory which is travelling around. And then I just labelled a couple of the places.

如果有人要求你画出这个图形，那么，我会在一秒钟内告诉你你需要这幅图的确切位置。它现在就会出现在表面积中。但除此之外，如果没有人要求你这样做，你甚至不必在这里写下 t = 0 和 t = pi / 2。因为没有人要求你这样做。另一个问题。

If somebody asked you to draw a picture of this, well, I’ll tell you exactly where you need the picture in just one second, alright. It’s going to come up right now in surface area. But otherwise, if nobody asks you to, you don’t even have to put down t = 0 and t = pi / 2 here. Because nobody demanded it of you. Another question.

学生：教授：所以，另一个非常好的问题与这幅图完全相关。那么我们将如何使用这幅图，我们将如何使用 t 的概念。问题是，为什么这是从 t = 0 到 t = 2 pi？这确实使用了此图上的 t 信息。重点是，我们确实知道 t 从这里开始。

STUDENT: PROFESSOR: So, another very good question which is exactly connected to this picture. So how is it that we’re going to use the picture, and how is it we’re going to use the notion of the t. The question was, why is this from t = 0 to t = 2 pi? That does use the t information on this diagram. the point is, we do know that t starts here.

这是 pi / 2，这是 pi，这是 3 pi / 2，这是 2 pi。当你绕一圈后，它会回到原点。这些是周期为 2 pi 的周期函数。它们会在 2 pi 处精确回到原点。这就是为什么我们知道为了绕一圈，我们需要从 0 到 2 pi。

This is pi / 2, this is pi, this is 3 pi / 2, and this is 2 pi. When you go all the way around once, it’s going to come back to itself. These are periodic functions of period 2 pi. And they come back to themselves exactly at 2 pi. And so that’s why we know in order to get around once, we need to go from 0 to 2 pi.

现在，同样的事情也适用于表面积。这就是问题所在，即计算表面积时我们需要什么范围的 t。学生：教授：在问题中，你可能会被问到参数曲线的矩形方程是什么？所以应该是 1/4 x^2 + y^2 = 1。然后你可能会被问到，画出它。

那么你如何对 dx 进行积分？教授：好的，问题是我们如何对 x 进行积分？所以这个问题可以追溯到上次。弧长是多少。所以。我必须结合我们今天所学的内容来回答这个问题。所以这是一个微妙的问题。但我希望你意识到这实际上是一个重要的概念步骤。

So how are you just integrating with respect to dx? PROFESSOR: OK, the question is how are we just integrating with respect to x? So this is a question which goes back to last time. And what is it with arc length. So. I’m going to have to answer that question in connection with what we did today. So this is a subtle question. But I want you to realize that this is actually an important conceptual step here.

所以，嘘，大家听好了。如果你要表示一维物体，即空间中的曲线。或者二维物体。当你要跟踪弧长时，你必须有一个关于某个变量的积分。但那个变量你可以选择。现在我们开始讨论各种变量的选择，你可以用这些变量来表示某个东西。

So shhh, everybody, listen. If you’re representing one dimensional objects, which are curves, maybe, in space. Or in two dimensions. When you’re keeping track of arc length, you’re going to have to have an integral which is with respect to some variable. But that variable, you get to pick. And we’re launching now into this variety of choices of variables with respect to which you can represent something.

现在，用圆来表示相对于变量 x 的事物有一些缺点。因为圆上有两个点。另一方面，你实际上可以用半个圆来表示。所以你可以用这种方法算出弧长。然后你可以把它设置为积分 dx。但你也可以把它设置为相对于任何你想要的参数的积分。

Now, there are some disadvantages on the circle to representing things with respect to the variable x. Because there are two points on the circle here. On the other hand, you actually can succeed with half the circle. So you can figure out the arc length that way. And then you can set it up as an integral dx. But you can also set it up as an integral with respect to any parameter you want.

均匀参数也许是最简单的一个。这个也许是最简单的一个。现在这个观点很奇怪，我也会在讲座的后面提到这一点，那就是字母 x 和 y。正如我所说，你应该放弃 y 是 x 的函数这一概念。这就是我们现在要抛弃的东西。

And the uniform parameter is perhaps the easiest one. This one is perhaps the easiest one. And so now the thing that’s strange about this perspective and I’m going to make this point later in the lecture as well is that the letters x and y. As I say, you should drop this notion that y is a function of x. This is what we’re throwing away at this point.

我们的想法是，你可以用任何你想要的坐标来描述事物。你只需要说出每一个相对于其他坐标是什么。这里的 x 和 y 是我们在笛卡尔坐标系中的位置。它们不是。在这种情况下，它们是其他变量的函数。其他变量。所以它们都是函数。所以字母 x 和 y 对你来说只是改变了。它们意味着不同的东西。

What we’re thinking of is, you can describe things in terms of any coordinate you want. You just have to say what each one is in terms of the others. And these x and y over here are where we are in the Cartesian coordinate system. They’re not. And in this case they’re functions of some other variable. Some other variable. So they’re each functions. So the letters x and y just changed on you. They mean something different.

X 不再是变量。它是函数。对吧？你必须习惯这一点。那是因为我们用完了字母。我们有点想按照我们想要的方式使用它们。稍后我会再多说一些。现在我想做这个表面积的例子。我将只取椭圆体的表面积。

X is no longer the variable. It’s the function. Right? You’re going to have to get used to that. That’s because we run out of letters. And we kind of want to use all of them the way we want. I’ll say some more about that later. So now I want to do this surface area example. I’m going to just take the surface area of the ellipsoid.

绕 y 轴旋转前面的例子（即示例 2）形成的椭圆体表面。因此，我们要在这里为您设置表面面积积分。现在，我提醒您，面积元素如下所示。如果您绕 y 轴旋转，则意味着您将以这种方式旋转，并且会有一些曲线。在本例中，它是椭圆的这一部分。

The surface of the ellipsoid formed by revolving this previous example, which was Example 2. Around the y axis. So we want to set up that surface area integral here for you. Now, I remind you that the area element looks like this. If you’re revolving around the y axis, that means you’re going around this way and you have some curve. In this case it’s this piece of an ellipse.

如果你把它扫一圈，你就会得到一个所谓的椭圆体。这里有一小块，你要把它绕起来。除了这个 ds，也就是这里的弧长部分，你需要的重要东西是到轴的距离。这就是这里的水平距离。我会用另一种颜色画出来。现在这个水平距离有一个名字了。这也是这个坐标系的优点。t 是别的东西。

If you sweep it around you’re going to get what’s called an ellipsoid. And there’s a little chunk here, that you’re wrapping around. And the important thing you need besides this ds, this arc length piece over here, is the distance to the axis. So that’s this horizontal distance here. I’ll draw it in another color. And that horizontal distance now has a name. And this is, again, the virtue of this coordinate system. The t is something else.

这个有名字。这个距离有名字。这个距离叫做 x。它甚至有一个公式。它的公式是 2 sin t。就 t 而言。所以这里积分的完整公式是，当我旋转这个东西时，我必须取圆周长。还有这个小弧长元素。所以我这里有 2 pi 乘以 2 sin t。这是这里的 x 变量。

This has a name. This distance has a name. This distance is called x. And it even has a formula. Its formula is 2 sin t. In terms of t. So the full formula up for the integral here is, I have to take the circumference when I spin this thing around. And this little arc length element. So I have here 2 pi times 2 sin t. That’s the x variable here.

然后我这里有 ds，有点乱。所以不幸的是我没有足够的空间。提前计划。4 的平方根 cos^2 t + sin^2 t，就是这个，dt。好吧，我想我把它挤在那里了。这就是弧长，我从上面的这个板上复制过来的。那是 ds 部分。这是包括 dt 在内的整个东西。除了一件事之外，这就是答案。

And then I have here ds, which is kind of a mess. So unfortunately I don’t quite have room for it. Plan ahead. Square root of 4 cos^2 t + sin^2 t, is that what it was, dt. Alright, I guess I squeezed it in there. So that was the arc length, which I re copied from this board above. That was the ds piece. It’s this whole thing including the dt. That’s the answer except for one thing.

我们还需要什么？我们不仅需要被积函数，这是积分的一半。积分的另一半是极限。我们需要特定的极限。否则我们就得不到可以得出的数字。所以我们现在必须考虑极限是什么。也许有人能看出来。这与这里的椭圆图有关。

What else do we need? We don’t just need the integrand, this is half of setting up an integral. The other half of setting up an integral is the limits. We need specific limits here. Otherwise we don’t have a number that we can get out. So we now have to think about what the limits are. And maybe somebody can see. It has something to do with this diagram of the ellipse over here.

有人能猜出是什么吗？0 到 pi。好吧，这很快。就是这样。因为我们从顶部走到底部，但我们不想继续走。我们不想从 0 走到 2 pi，因为那会重复我们旋转时得到的结果。

Can somebody guess what it is? 0 to pi. Well, that was quick. That’s it. Because we go from the top to the bottom, but we don’t want to continue around. We don’t want to go from 0 to 2 pi, because that would be duplicating what we’re going to get when we spin around.

我们知道我们从 0 开始。这很有趣，因为当你改变变量来考虑 y 变量时，它会下降，它会朝相反的方向发展。但无论如何，我们想要的只是其中的一部分。这就是这个设置。现在我声称这实际上是一个可行的积分。然而，它很长。我不会给你讲太多，我只会告诉你如何开始。

And we know that we start at 0. It’s interesting because it descends when you change variables to think of it in terms of the y variable it’s going the opposite way. But anyway, just one piece of this is what we want. So that’s this setup. And now I claim that this is actually a doable integral. However, it’s long. I’m going to spare you, I’ll just tell you how you would get started.

你可以使用代换 u = cost t。然后 du 将是 sin t dt。但不幸的是，还有更多。还有另一个三角代换，使用余弦的其他倍数等等。所以它一直在继续。如果你想自己检查，你可以。有一个逆三角代换，它与这个不兼容。但它可以做到。计算。用初等术语来说。是的，另一个问题。

You would use the substitution u = cos t. And then the du is going to be sin t dt. But then, unfortunately, there’s a lot more. There’s another trig substitution with some other multiple of the cosine and so forth. So it goes on and on. If you want to check it yourself, you can. There’s an inverse trig substitution which isn’t compatible with this one. But it can be done. Calculated. In elementary terms. Yeah, another question.

学生：教授：所以，如果你在考试中遇到这个问题，我将不得不指导你。要么我必须告诉你不要评估它，要么你必须非常努力。或者这是第一步，然后下一步是继续。或者其他什么。我必须给你一些提示。因为它很长。对于考试来说，这太长了，特别是这个。好的。

STUDENT: PROFESSOR: So, if you get this on an exam, I’m going to have to coach you through it. Either I’m going to have to tell you don’t evaluate it or, you’re going to have to work really hard. Or here’s the first step, and then the next step is, keep on going. Or something. I’ll have to give you some cues. Because it’s quite long. This is way too long for an exam, this particular one. OK.

对于一个习题集来说，它并不算太长。如果我把它作为习题集交给你，我就会在这里停下。只是为了让你了解一下它的数量级。而我昨天做的一个习题，我甚至不会把它作为习题集交给你，因为它太长了。所以现在，我们的下一个任务是转向极坐标。

It’s not too long for a problem set. This is where I would leave you off if I were giving it to you on a problem set. Just to give you an idea of the order of magnitude. Whereas one of the ones that I did yesterday, I wouldn’t even give you on a problem set, it was so long. So now, our next job is to move on to polar coordinates.

现在，极坐标涉及圆的几何形状。正如我所说，我们真的很喜欢圆。我们非常圆。就像我喜欢 0 一样，研究所的其他人也喜欢圆。所以我们现在就这样做。我们现在要讨论的是极坐标。它的设置方式如下。这是一种描述平面上点的方式。

Now, polar coordinates involve the geometry of circles. As I said, we really love circles here. We’re very round. Just as I love 0, the rest of the Institute loves circles. So we’re going to do that right now. What we’re going to talk about now is polar coordinates. Which are set up in the following way. It’s a way of describing the points in the plane.

这是平面上的一个点，这就是我们通常所认为的 xy 轴。现在这个点将由不同的坐标对、不同的数字对来描述。即到原点的距离。这里的第二个参数，第二个数字，是角度 theta。它是从原点发出的射线与水平轴的夹角。这就是语言中的意思。

Here is a point in a plane, and here’s what we think of as the usual x y axes. And now this point is going to be described by a different pair of coordinates, different pair of numbers. Namely, the distance to the origin. And the second parameter here, second number here, is this angle theta. Which is the angle of ray from origin with the horizontal axis. So that’s what it is in language.

你应该把这个放在引号里，因为它不是完全匹配的。从几何学上来说，你应该一直考虑这一点，但技术细节涉及直接处理公式。第一个公式是 x 的公式。这是基本公式，这两个是基本公式。即 x = r cos theta。第二个公式是 y 的公式，即 r sin theta。所以这些是极坐标的明确定义。

And you should put this in quotation marks, because it’s not a perfect match. This is geometrically what you should always think of, but the technical details involve dealing directly with formulas. The first formula is the formula for x. And this is the fundamental, these two are the fundamental ones. Namely, x = r cos theta. The second formula is the formula for y, which is r sin theta. So these are the unambiguous definitions of polar coordinates.

就是这样。这也是其他所有几乎正确的陈述几乎都遵循的东西。但这是你应该永远相信的。这是明确的陈述。所以让我给你举一个例子，它接近一个好的公式，而且肯定有用。也就是说，你可以把 r 看作是 x^2 + y^2 的平方根。这很容易推导，它是到原点的距离。

This is it. And this is the thing from which all other almost correct statements almost follow. But this is the one you should trust always. This is the unambiguous statement. So let me give you an example something that’s close to being a good formula and is certainly useful in its way. Namely, you can think of r as being the square root of x^2 + y^2. That’s easy enough to derive, it’s the distance to the origin.

这很明显。你也可以推导出 theta 的公式，它是 y/x 的反正切。但是，我要提醒你，这些公式有点模棱两可。有点模棱两可。换句话说，你不能盲目地应用它们。你实际上必须看一张图片才能正确理解它们。特别是，这里的 r 可以是正数或负数。

That’s pretty obvious. And the formula for theta, which you can also derive, which is that it’s the inverse tangent of y/x. However, let me just warn you that these formulas are slightly ambiguous. So somewhat ambiguous. In other words, you can’t just apply them blindly. You actually have to look at a picture in order to get them right. In particular, r could be plus or minus here.

而当你取反正切时，两者之间存在歧义，它与 (y)/(x) 的反正切相同。所以这些减号会给你的生活带来麻烦。如果你不注意图表，你就不会从这些公式中得到完全明确的答案。另一方面，上面方框中的公式总是有效的。所以当人们提到极坐标时，他们总是指极坐标。

And when you take the inverse tangent, there’s an ambiguity between, it’s the same as the inverse tangent of ( y)/( x). So these minus signs are a plague on your existence. And you’re not going to get a completely unambiguous answer out of these formulas without paying attention to the diagram. On the other hand, the formula up in the box there always works. So when people mean polar coordinates, they always mean that.

然后他们有惯例，有时会将事情与下一个板上的公式相匹配。让我先在这里举几个例子。但也许首先我应该画出两个坐标系。所以我们习惯的坐标系是直角坐标系。也许我会在这里用橙色和绿色画出来。

And then they have conventions, which sometimes match things up with the formulas over on this next board. Let me give you various examples here first. But maybe first I should I should draw the two coordinate systems. So the coordinate system that we’re used to is the rectangular coordinate system. And maybe I’ll draw it in orange and green here.

这些是坐标线 y = 0, y = 1, y = 2。这就是坐标系的工作原理。这里是坐标系的其余部分。这就是我们现在思考 x 和 y 的方式。我们不再将 y 视为 x 的函数，不再将 x 视为 y 的函数，而是将 x 视为平面上某个位置的标签。

So these are the coordinate lines y = 0, y = 1, y = 2. That’s how the coordinate system works. And over here we have the rest of the coordinate system. And this is the way we’re thinking of x and y now. We’re no longer thinking of y as a function of x and x as a function of y, we’re thinking of x as a label of a place in a plane.

y 是平面中某个位置的标签。因此，这里我们有 x = 0、x = 1、x = 2 等。这里是 x = 1。等等。这就是直角坐标系的样子。现在我应该画出我们的另一个坐标系。就是这里的这个。嗯，差不多了。还有这里的这些。有点像靶心或目标操作。

And y as a label of a place in a plane. So here we have x = 0, x = 1, x = 2, etc. Here’s x = 1. So forth. So that’s what the rectangular coordinate system looks like. And now I should draw the other coordinate system that we have. Which is this guy here. Well, close enough. And these guys here. Kind of this bulls eye or target operation.

这个是，比如说，theta = pi/2。这是 theta = 0。这是 theta = pi/4。例如，我刚刚在这个图表上为你标记了三条射线。它有点像雷达屏幕。然后用粉色表示，这可能是 r = 2，半径为 2。里面是 r = 1。所以这是平面的不同坐标系。

And this one is, say, theta = pi/2. This is theta = 0. This is theta = pi/4. For instance, so I’ve just labeled for you three of the rays on this diagram. It’s kind of like a radar screen. And then in pink, this is maybe r = 2, the radius 2. And inside is r = 1. So it’s a different coordinate system for the plane.

再次强调，字母 r 表示测量我们与原点的距离。theta 表示角度，即我们在哪条射线上。它们只是两个不同的变量。这是一种非常不同的坐标系。好的，我们的主要工作就是习惯它。就目前而言。您将在 18.02 中大量使用它。它在物理学中非常有用。我们的工作只是开始使用它。

And again, the letter r represents measuring how far we are from the origin. The theta represents something about the angle, which ray we’re on. And they’re just two different variables. And this is a very different kind of coordinate system. OK so, our main job is just to get used to this. For now. You will be using this a lot in 18.02. It’s very useful in physics. And our job is just to get started with it.

那么，我们来试试几个例子。很多例子。我们从很慢的开始。如果你有 (x, y) = (1, 1)，那就是平面上的一个点。我可以画出那个点。它就在这里，对吧？这是 1，这是 1，这是我的点，(1, 1)。我可以找出它在极坐标中的代表。所以在极坐标中，这里实际上有很多选择。

And so, let’s try a few examples here. Tons of examples. We’ll start out very slow. If you have (x, y) = (1, 1), that’s a point in the plane. I can draw that point. It’s down here, right? This is 1 and this is 1, and here’s my point, (1, 1). I can figure out what the representative is of this in polar coordinates. So in polar coordinates, there are actually a bunch of choices here.

首先，我告诉你一个选择。如果我从水平角度开始，我绕一圈，就是这里的射线。我们再用绿色画一遍。好吧，我实际上把它标记为 pi/4，但另一种看待它的方式是它是这里的这个角度。所以这将是 r = 2 的平方根。Theta = 7pi/4。所以这是角度和距离的一种可能性。

First of all, I’ll tell you one choice. If I start with the angle horizontally, I wrap all the way around, that would be to this ray here. Let’s do it in green again. Alright, I labeled it actually as pi/4, but another way of looking at it is that it’s this angle here. So that would be r = square root of 2. Theta = 7pi/4. So that’s one possibility of the angle and the distance.

我知道距离是 2 的平方根，这并不难。另一种看待它的方式是我用负角标记它时所建议的方式。那就是 r = 2 的平方根，theta = pi/4。这些都是合法的。这些都是完全合法的代表。这就是我说这里的这些表示有些模棱两可的意思。

I know the distance is a square root of 2, that’s not hard. Another way of looking at it is the way which was suggested when I labeled this with a negative angle. And that would be r = square root of 2, theta = pi/4. And these are both legal. These are perfectly legal representatives. And that’s what I meant by saying that these representations over here are somewhat ambiguous.

这个问题的答案不止一个，即极坐标表示是什么。第三种可能性更冒险，但也是合法的，即 r 等于负 2 的平方根。Theta = 3pi/4。现在，这相当于绕到这里。我们指向 3/4 pi 方向。但然后是负 2 的平方根距离。我们向后走。所以我们落在同一个地方。所以这也是合法的。是的。

There’s more than one answer to this question, of what the polar representation is. A third possibility, which is even more dicey but also legal, is r equals minus square root of 2. Theta = 3pi/4. Now, what that corresponds to doing is going around to here. We’re pointing out 3/4 pi direction. But then going negative square root of 2 distance. We’re going backwards. So we’re landing in the same place. So this is also legal. Yeah.

学生：教授：问题是，半径不是必须为正数吗，因为它们代表到原点的距离？答案是，我在这里对你撒了谎。我说的这些话都是错的，除了这一点。这是极坐标的规则。所以它可能是距离的正数或负数，总是这样。我尽量不骗你太多，但我确实成功了。

STUDENT: PROFESSOR:. The question is, don’t the radiuses have to be positive because they represent a distance to the origin? The answer is I lied to you here. All of these things that I said are wrong, except for this. Which is the rule for what polar coordinates mean. So it’s maybe plus or minus the distance, is what it is always. I try not to lie to you too much, but I do succeed.

现在，让我们在这里多练习一下。有一些简单的例子，我会很快讲解一下。r = a，我们已经知道这是一个圆。3 西塔等于一个常数是一条射线。然而，这涉及到一个隐含的假设，我想向你们指出这一点。所以这是例子 3。西塔等于一个常数是一条射线。但这隐含地假设 0 <= r < 无穷大。

Now, let’s do a little bit more practice here. There are some easy examples, which I will run through very quickly. r = a, we already know this is a circle. And the 3 theta equals a constant is a ray. However, this involves an implicit assumption, which I want to point out to you. So this is Example 3. Theta’s equal to a constant is a ray. But this implicitly assumes 0 <= r < infinity.

如果您真的想允许负无穷 < r < 无穷，那么您将得到一条线。给出整条线。它给出了后面的所有内容。因此，您沿着某条射线向外走，沿着该射线向后走，然后您就会得到通过原点的整条线，双向走。如果您也允许 r 趋向负无穷。所以这是典型的惯例，所以这里是典型的惯例。

If you really wanted to allow minus infinity < r < infinity in this example, you would get a line. Gives the whole line. It gives everything behind. So you go out on some ray, you go backwards on that ray and you get the whole line through the origin, both ways. If you allow r going to minus infinity as well. So the typical conventions, so here are the typical conventions.

你会发现人们甚至没有告诉你就假设了这一点。所以你需要小心。典型的惯例当然是这个，这是一件好事。几乎总是这样，虽然不是总是这样。大多数时候。然后你可能会有从负 pi 到 pi 的 theta，换句话说，围绕 0 对称。或者，另一个非常流行的选择是这个。

And you will see people assume this without even telling you. So you need to watch out for it. The typical conventions are certainly this one, which is a nice thing to do. Pretty much all the time, although not all the time. Most of the time. And then you might have theta ranging from minus pi to pi, so in other words symmetric around 0. Or, another very popular choice is this one.

Theta >= 0 且严格小于 2pi。因此，这些是选择所有这些变量的两个典型范围。但并非总是如此。您会发现它并不一致。正如我所说，我们的工作是习惯这一点。我需要研究一些稍微复杂一点的例子。其中一些我将在下周二给您。但让我们再做几个。

Theta’s >= 0 and strictly less than 2pi. So these are the two typical ranges in which all of these variables are chosen. But not always. You’ll find that it’s not consistent. As I said, our job is to get used to this. And I need to work up to some slightly more complicated examples. Some of which I’ll give you on next Tuesday. But let’s do a few more.

所以，我猜这是示例 4。示例 4，我将取 y = 1。这在直角坐标中非常简单。但有趣的是，您可能想在极坐标中处理它。如果您这样做，那么这就是您进行平移的方式。但这种平移并不那么糟糕。您要做的就是，插入 y = r sin(theta)。这就是您要做的。

So, I guess this is Example 4. Example 4, I’m going to take y = 1. That’s awfully simple in rectangular coordinates. But interestingly, you might conceivably want to deal with it in polar coordinates. If you do, so here’s how you make the translation. But this translation is not so terrible. What you do is, you plug in y = r sin(theta). That’s all you have to do.

所以它将等于 1。这将给出我们的极坐标方程。极坐标方程是 r = 1 / sin(theta)。就是这样。让我们画一张图。这是 y = 1 的线图。现在我们看到，如果我们从这里取出射线，它们会以不同的长度与线相撞。

And so that’s going to be equal to 1. And that’s going to give us our polar equation. The polar equation is r = 1 / sin(theta). There it is. And let’s draw a picture of it. So here’s a picture of the line y = 1. And now we see that if we take our rays going out from here, they collide with the line at various lengths.

因此，如果你取一个角度，即 theta，那么就会有一个与之对应的距离 r，并且你会恰好在一个点上击中它。对于每个 theta，你都会有一个不同的半径。并且它是一个可变半径。它由以下公式给出。因此，要描绘出这条线，你实际上必须意识到还有一件事。那就是 theta 的可能范围。

So if you take an angle, theta, here there’ll be a distance r corresponding to that and you’ll hit this in exactly one spot. For each theta you’ll have a different radius. And it’s a variable radius. It’s given by this formula here. And so to trace this line out, you actually have to realize that there’s one more thing involved. Which is the possible range of theta.

同样，当你进行积分时，你需要知道积分的极限。所以你需要知道这一点。这里的范围从 theta = 0 开始，也就是无穷大的时候。这时分母为 0。它一直到 pi。旋转半圈。所以这里的范围是 0 < theta < pi。是的，问题。学生：教授：。

Again, when you’re doing integrations you’re going to need to know those limits of integration. So you’re going to need to know this. The range here goes from theta = 0, that’s sort of when it’s out at infinity. That’s when the denominator is 0 here. And it goes all the way to pi. Swing around just one half turn. So the range here is 0 < theta < pi. Yeah, question. STUDENT: PROFESSOR:.

问题是，将 r 表示为 theta 函数是否很常见，反之亦然，或者这是否重要？答案是，出于本课程的目的，我们几乎总是会以这种形式编写内容。r 作为 theta 函数。您可以做任何您想做的事情。这正是我们在本课程中要专门做的事情。

The question is, is it typical to express r as a function of theta, or vice versa, or does it matter? The answer is that for the purposes of this course, we’re almost always going to be writing things in this form. r as a function of theta. And you can do whatever you want. This turns out to be what we’ll be doing in this course, exclusively.

当我们讨论其他例子时，你会看到，当你考虑观察一颗行星或类似的东西时，这是传统的做法。你看到角度，然后猜测它离我们有多远。但这不是必须的。对于我们的例子来说，公式通常这样更简单。因为它通常是 theta 的三角函数。而另一种方式，它将是一个反三角函数。

As you’ll see when we get to other examples, it’s the traditional sort of thing to do when you’re thinking about observing a planet or something like that. You see the angle, and then you guess far away it is. But it’s not necessary. The formulas are often easier this way. For the examples that we have. Because it’s usually a trig function of theta. Whereas the other way, it would be an inverse trig function.

所以这是一个比较丑陋的表达。正如你所看到的。真正的原因是我们选择了这个更容易处理的东西。现在让我给你一个稍微复杂一点的相同类型的例子。我们使用捷径。这是一个标准的例子。它经常出现。所以这是一个偏离中心的圆。

So it’s an uglier expression. As you can see. The real reason is that we choose this thing that’s easier to deal with. So now let me give you a slightly more complicated example of the same type. Where we use a shortcut. This is a standard example. And it comes up a lot. And so this is an off center circle.

圆确实很容易描述，但如果圆心在圆的边缘，就不一定了。所以这是另一个问题。我们以半径为 a 的圆为例。这是点 (a, 0)，这是 (2a, 0)。实际上，如果你知道这两个数字，你就能记住这个计算的结果。

A circle is really easy to describe, but not necessarily if the center is on the rim of the circle. So that’s a different problem. And let’s do this with a circle of radius a. So this is the point (a, 0) and this is (2a, 0). And actually, if you know these two numbers, you’ll be able to remember the result of this calculation.

你会做五六次，最后你会在 18.02 期间记住它，那时你会非常需要它。所以这是一个标准计算。所以起点是矩形方程。我们将转到极坐标表示。矩形表示是 (xa)^2 + y^2 = a^2。所以这是一个以 (a, 0) 为中心、半径为 a 的圆。

Which you’ll do about five or six times and then finally you’ll memorize it during 18.02 when you will need it a lot. So this is a standard calculation here. So the starting place is the rectangular equation. And we’re going to pass to the polar representation. The rectangular representation is (x a)^2 + y^2 = a^2. So this is a circle centered at (a, 0) of radius a.

现在，如果您愿意，可以采用较慢的方法来代入 x = r cos(theta)，y = r sin(theta)。我在第一步中就是这么做的。这种方法效果很好。但我要做得更快。因为我可以提前知道它将如何工作。我要将其展开。现在我看到 a^2 被取消了。

And now, if you like, the slow way of doing this would be to plug in x = r cos(theta), y = r sin(theta). The way I did in this first step. And that works perfectly well. But I’m going to do it more quickly than that. Because I can sort of see in advance how it’s going to work. I’m just going to expand this out. And now I see the a^2’s cancel.

不仅如此，x^2 + y^2 = r^2。所以这变成了 r^2。即 x^2 + y^2 2ax = 0。r 来自于 r^2 = x^2 + y^2。所以我用快速方法做这件事。正如我所说，您可以通过代入来完成。r 等于。既然我已经简化了它，我将使用那个程序。我要代入。

And not only that, but x^2 + y^2 = r^2. So this becomes r^2. That’s x^2 + y^2 2ax = 0. The r came from the fact that r^2 = x^2 + y^2. So I’m doing this the rapid way. You can do it by plugging in, as I said. r equals. So now that I’ve simplified it, I am going to use that procedure. I’m going to plug in.

所以这里我有 r^2 2ar cos(theta) = 0。我只需代入 x。正如我所说，我一开始就可以这样做。我只是先简化一下。现在，这与 r^2 = 2ar cos(theta) 相同。我们快完成了。这个等式有一个无聊的部分，即 r = 0。然后，如果我除以 r，这就是等式的有趣部分。就是这个。

So here I have r^2 2ar cos(theta) = 0. I just plugged in for x. As I said, I could have done that at the beginning. I just simplified first. And now, this is the same thing as r^2 = 2ar cos(theta). And we’re almost done. There’s a boring part of this equation, which is r = 0. And then there’s, if I divide by r, there’s the interesting part of the equation. Which is this.

所以这是或 r = 0。这已经包含在那个等式中了。所以我可以除以 r，因为在 r = 0 的情况下，无论如何这都是表示出来的。问题。学生：教授：r = 0 只是一种情况。也就是说，它是这两个的并集。它是两者。两者都有可能。所以 r = 0 是它上面的一个点。这就是全部。所以我们可以忽略它。

So this is or r = 0. Which is already included in that equation anyway. So I’m allowed to divide by r because in the case of r = 0, this is represented anyway. Question. STUDENT: PROFESSOR: r = 0 is just one case. That is, it’s the union of these two. It’s both. Both are possible. So r = 0 is one point on it. And this is all of it. So we can just ignore this.

现在我想说一件更重要的事情。你需要了解这个的范围。等一下，我们要算出这个范围。这个范围非常重要，因为否则你将永远无法使用这里的表示法进行积分。所以这是表示法。但请注意，当 theta = 0 时，我们在这里是 2a。这是一致的，这实际上就是你记住这里的这个因子 2a 的方式。

So now I want to say one more important thing. You need to understand the range of this. So wait a second and we’re going to figure out the range here. The range is very important, because otherwise you’ll never be able to integrate using this representation here. So this is the representation. But notice when theta = 0, we’re out here at 2a. That’s consistent, and that’s actually how you remember this factor 2a here.

因为如果你还记得这张图片，以及当 theta = 0 时你落在哪里。这就是 theta = 0 的部分。但现在当我像这样向上倾斜时，你会看到当我们到达垂直时，我们就完成了。圆。它变得越来越短，在 theta = pi/2 时，我们在 0 处。因为那是 cos(pi/2) = 0。所以它像这样向上摆动。

Because if you remember this picture and where you land when theta = 0. So that’s the theta = 0 part. But now as I tip up like this, you see that when we get to vertical, we’re done. With the circle. It’s gotten shorter and shorter and shorter, and at theta = pi/2, we’re down at 0. Because that’s cos(pi/2) = 0. So it swings up like this.

然后它上升到 pi/2。同样，我们像这样向下摆动。然后我们就完成了。所以范围是 pi/2 < theta < pi/2。或者，如果你想加入 r = 0 的情况，你可以加入这个，如果你愿意的话，这是在两端重复的。所以这是这个圆的范围。让我们看看。下次我们将在极坐标中计算面积。

And it gets up to pi/2. Similarly, we swing down like this. And then we’re done. So the range is pi/2 < theta < pi/2. Or, if you want to throw in the r = 0 case, you can throw in this, this is repeating, if you like, at the ends. So this is the range of this circle. And let’s see. Next time we’ll figure out area in polar coordinates.

Lec 33 | MIT 18.01 单变量微积分，2007 年秋季

Lec 33 | MIT 18.01 Single Variable Calculus, Fall 2007

15 年前 (2009 年 9 月 10 日) — 49:07 https://youtube.com/watch?v=BGE3wb7H2PA

15 years ago (Sep 10, 2009) — 49:07 https://youtube.com/watch?v=BGE3wb7H2PA

以下内容根据 Creative Commons 许可提供。您的支持将帮助 MIT OpenCourseWare 继续免费提供高质量的教育资源。要捐款或查看数百门 MIT 课程的其他材料，请访问 MIT OpenCourseWare，网址为 ocw.mit.edu。教授：再次欢迎回来。今天的主题是我们上次所做内容的延续。关于极坐标，我们还有一些工作要做和思考。

The following content is provided under a Creative Commons license. Your support will help MIT OpenCourseWare continue to offer high quality educational resources for free. To make a donation, or to view additional materials from hundreds of MIT courses, visit MIT OpenCourseWare at ocw.mit.edu. PROFESSOR: So again, welcome back. And today’s topic is a continuation of what we did last time. We still have a little bit of work and thinking to do concerning polar coordinates.

所以我们要讨论极坐标。我今天的第一项工作是讨论一下面积。这是我们上次没有提到的。既然我们都从感恩节回来了，我们当然可以用饼来讨论它。这是极坐标中面积的基本概念。这是我们的饼，这是饼的一片。

So we’re going to talk about polar coordinates. And my first job today is to talk a little bit about area. That’s something we didn’t mention last time. And since we’re all back from Thanksgiving, we can certainly talk about it in terms of a pie. Which is the basic idea for area in polar coordinates. Here’s our pie, and here’s a slice of the pie.

切片上有一段弧长，我将其称为 delta theta。切片中阴影部分的面积，我将其称为 delta A。假设半径为 a。小 a。所以这是一个半径为 a 的饼。这就是我们的图片。现在，很容易算出饼的面积是多少。总面积当然是 pi a^2。我们知道。

The slice has a piece of arc length on it, which I’m going to call delta theta. And the area of that shaded in slice, I’m going to call delta A. And let’s suppose that the radius is a. Little a. So this is a pie of radius a. That’s our picture. Now, it’s pretty easy to figure out what the area that slice of pie is. The total area is, of course, pi a^2. We know that.

要得到这个分数 delta A，我们只需取弧占总周长的百分比。这就是 (delta theta) / 这是面积的分数。抱歉，是总周长的分数，即边缘的总长度。然后我们将其乘以 pi a^2。这样就得到了总面积。

And to get this fraction, delta A, all we have to do is take the percentage of the arc of the total circumference. That’s (delta theta) / This is the fraction of area. sorry, fraction of the total circumference, the total length around the rim. And then we multiply that by pi a^2. And that’s giving us the total area.

如果你算出来，delta A 等于，π 抵消，我们有 1/2 a^2 delta theta。这是基本公式。现在我们需要讨论一个变量饼。那将是一个带有波浪形外壳的饼。它像这样旋转。所以 r = r(theta)。

And if you work that out, that’s delta A is equal to, the pi’s cancel and we have 1/2 a^2 delta theta. So here’s the basic formula. And now what we need to do is to talk about a variable pie here. That would be a pie with a kind of a wavy crust. Which is coming around like this. So r = r(theta).

距离中心的距离会随着我们所在的位置和我们射出的角度而变化。现在我想在这里将其细分为小块。现在，加总面积的想法是，将扫出的这块的总面积分成小块，这些小块的面积几乎很容易计算。也就是说，我们要做的就是取，我将这样标记它。

The distance from the center is varying with the place where we are, the angle where we’re shooting out. And now I want to subdivide that into little chunks here. Now, the idea for adding up the area, the total area of this piece that’s swept out, is to break it up into little slices whose areas are almost easy to calculate. Namely, what we’re going to do is to take, and I’m going to label it this way.

我要画出这些小圆弧。我要延伸到这个圆弧的尽头。然后我要画出这里的每个圆弧。这是一条圆弧。然后这是另一条圆弧。这是另一条圆弧。在这种情况下，它正好在鼻子上。现在，在这两种情况下，我试图为您绘制的图形基本上是这样的。我有一些扇形。

I’m going to take these little circular arcs, which go. So I’m going to extend past where this goes. And then I’m going to take each circular arc here. So here’s a circular arc. And then here’s another circular arc. And here’s another circular arc. It’s just right on the nose in that case. Now, in these two cases, so basically the picture that I’m trying to draw for you is this. I have some sector.

然后我画了一些圆弧。也许需要多一点。有一点额外的区域，我在这个区域犯了一个错误。这是一点额外的区域。也许要用另一种方式来画。我在这个区域上画得有点短。假设在这个区域上我正好在鼻子上。我有与表面曲线相同的弧。

And then I have some circular arc. And maybe it takes a little extra. There’s a little extra area, I’m making an error in the area. This is a little extra area. And maybe to draw it the other way. I’m a little short on this one. And let’s say on this one I’m right on the nose. I have the same arc as the curve of the surface.

现在这有点像我们在黎曼和中使用的阶跃函数。它们实际上是相同的。最终，如果我们在这里取非常非常窄的切片，我们所遗漏的这一小段东西将变得可以忽略不计。它会越来越接近曲线本身。因此，该区域在极限处将趋向于 0。所以我们不必担心它。近似关系就在这里。

Now this is a little bit like the step functions that we used in Riemann sums. It’s practically the same. Eventually, this little band of stuff that we’re missing by, if we take very, very narrow little slices here, is going to be negligible. It’ll get closer and closer to the curve itself. So that area will tend to 0 in the limit. So we don’t have to worry about it. And the approximate relationship is sitting here.

现在这个距离就是 r。所以这个半径就是 r。这就是 delta theta。所以在近似情况下，我们得到的是 delta A 大约是 1/2 r^2 delta theta。这实际上和我们这里得到的是一样的。只是 r 替换了那里的常数。这近似正确，因为 r 是变化的。然后在极限下，我们有微分的精确公式。就是这个。

Where this distance now is r. So this radius is r. And this is this delta theta. And so in the approximate case, what we have is that delta A is approximately 1/2 r^2 delta theta. Which is practically the same thing we had here. Except that r is replacing the constant there. And it’s approximately true, because r is varying. And then in the limit, we have the exact formula for the differential. Which is this one.

这是面积的主要公式。如果你愿意，那么总面积就是从某个起点到某个终点的积分，即 1/2 r^2 d theta。现在，这只在我们所处的情况下有用。也就是说。这是另一个重要的公式。这只在 r 是 theta 的函数时才有用。当这是区域呈现给我们的方式时。

So this is the main formula for area. And if you like, the total area then is going to be the integral from some starting place to some end place of 1/2 r^2 d theta. Now, this is only useful in the situation that we’re in. Namely. So this is the other important formula. And this is only useful when r is a function of theta. When this is the way in which the region is presented to us.

这就是设置。这就是我们的主要公式。让我们举个例子。我要举的例子是我们上次结束时或接近上次结束时举的例子。也就是这里的公式。r = 2a cos(theta)。记住，这与 (xa)^2 + y^2 = a^2 相同。这就是我们上次做的。我们将这个矩形表示与极坐标表示联系起来。

So that’s the setup. And that’s our main formula. Let’s do what example. The example that I’m going to take is the one that we did at the end of last time, or near the end of last time. Which was this formula here. r = 2a cos(theta). Remember, that was the same as (x a)^2 + y^2 = a^2. So this is what we did last time. We connected this rectangular representation to that polar representation.

图片上是一个圆。这是点 (2a, 0)。让我们算出面积是多少。首先，我们必须算出当我们扫过面积时，我们必须意识到我们只从 pi/2 到 pi/2。这是我们可以从图片中得到的。如果你意识到余弦在这个范围内是正的，你也可以直接从这个公式中得到它。

And the picture is of a circle. Where this is the point (2a, 0). So let’s figure out what the area is. Well, first of all, we have to figure out when we sweep out the area, we have to realize that we only go from pi/2 to pi/2. So that’s something we can get from the picture. You can also get it directly from this formula if you realize that cosine is positive in this range here.

在两端，它是 0。所以这个东西在这些两端包围了一个区域。所以在两端，正或负 pi/2 的余弦等于 0。如果你愿意的话，这就是把它像小袋子一样收起来的原因。所以面积现在将是 pi/2 到 1/2 乘以 r 平方的 pi/2 的积分，即 (2a cos(theta))^2, d theta。问题。

And at the ends, it’s 0. So the thing encloses a region at these ends. So at the ends, cosine of plus or minus pi/2 is equal to 0. That’s what cinches this up like a little sack, if you like. So the area is now going to be the integral from pi/2 to pi/2 of 1/2 times the square of r, that’s (2a cos(theta))^2, d theta. Question.

学生：教授：问题是，我怎么从图片上知道我从 pi/2 走到 pi/2。我用整个身体来做这件事。我说，我在这里指向下方。那是 pi/2。我向上扫，那是 0。我一直到这里。那是 pi/2。这就是我做事的方式。说实话，这确实是我做事的方式。现在，如果你是一台机器，你实际上不能看。

STUDENT: PROFESSOR: How do I know from looking at the picture that I’m going from pi/2 to pi/2, is the question. I do it with my whole body. I say, here I am pointing down. That’s pi/2. I sweep up, that’s 0. And I get all the way up to here. that’s pi/2. So that’s the way I do it. That’s really the way I do it, I’m being honest. Now if you’re a machine, you can’t actually look.

而且你没有身体，所以你无法指向你的手臂。那么你就必须按照公式来做。而且你必须实际使用类似这里的公式。事实上，这就是环收紧的地方。这就是半径变为 0 的地方。在 pi/2。所以你需要知道这一点才能理解范围。另一个问题。

And you don’t have a body, so you can’t point your arms. Then you would have to go by the formulas. And you’d have to actually use something like this formula here. The fact that this is where the loop cinches up. This is where the radius comes into 0. At pi/2. So you need to know that in order to understand the range. Another question.

学生：教授：那么当我们做这些的时候，我们是不是应该猜测它会是一个循环？我可能会给你一些线索，让你知道发生了什么。因为弄清楚这些事情非常困难。有时它会被一条曲线和另一条曲线所限制，我会说它是这两条曲线之间的那个东西。这就是我能做的事情。在这里，你真的应该提前知道这一点。

STUDENT: PROFESSOR: So when we’re doing these, should we just guess that it’s going to be a loop? I’m probably going to give you some clues as to what’s going on. Because it’s very hard to figure these things out. Sometimes it’ll be bounded by one curve and another curve, and I’ll say it’s the thing in between those two curves. That’s the kind of thing that I could do. Here, you really should know this one in advance.

这是迄今为止最典型的情况。或者说，无论如何，这是典型情况之一。我将再举几个例子。不要太激动。你会以某种方式想象它。我将给你一些例子，以便稍后帮助你理解。情况是这样的。这是我的积分。现在我们面临三角积分。我们必须记住如何做。现在，这里的三角积分。

This is by far the most. or this is one of the typical cases, anyway. I’m going to give you a couple more examples. Don’t get too worked up over this. You will somehow be able to visualize it. I’ll give you some examples to help you out with it later. So here’s the situation. Here’s my integral. And now we’re faced with a trig integral. Which we have to remember how to do. Now, the trig integral here.

首先让我分解常数。这是 4a^2 / 2，所以它是从 pi/2 到 cos^2(theta) d theta 的 pi/2 的 2a^2 积分。现在你必须记住你现在应该做什么。所以想想，如果你还没有做过，这是你需要做的练习。这个三角积分由双角公式处理。碰巧的是，我将在复习表上给你这些公式。

So first let me factor out the constants. This is 4a^2 / 2, so it’s 2a^2 integral from pi/2 to pi/2 of cos^2(theta) d theta. And now you have to remember what you’re supposed to do at this point. So think, if you haven’t done it yet, this is practice you need to do. This trig integral is handled by a double angle formula. As it happens, I’m going to be giving you these formulas on the review sheet.

你会看到它们写在复习表上。至少以某种形式。例如，有一个公式，这也会出现在考试中。这是这里要使用的正确公式。它是 + (1 + cos(2theta)) / 2 d theta。这就是你用来代入余弦平方以求积分的公式。这可以作为对三角积分的一点复习。现在，这很容易。

You’ll see they’re written on the review sheet. At least in some form. So for example, there’s a formula, and this will be on the exam, too. So this is the correct formula to use here. Is that this is + (1 + cos(2theta)) / 2 d theta. So that’s the substitution that you use for the cosine squared in order to integrate it. That serves as a little review of trig integrals. And now, this is quite easy.

现在这个积分很简单。为什么简单呢？因为它是常数 cos(2theta) 的反导数，它的反导数你应该能够写下来。所以 1 的反导数是 theta。当它是 2 theta 时，余弦的反导数是正弦的 1/2。这就是 a^2 a^2 (pi/2 ( pi/2))。

This integral now is easy. Why is it easy? Well, because it’s the antiderivative of a constant, cos(2theta), its antiderivative you’re supposed to be able to write down. So the antiderivative of 1 is theta. And the antiderivative of the cosine is 1/2 the sine when it’s 2 theta. And that is a ^2 a^2 (pi/2 ( pi/2)).

并且符号消失，因为它们都是 0。所以总而言之，我们得到了 pi a^2，这肯定是我们希望得到的。它是圆的面积。另一个问题？学生：教授：。问题是，我不确定你问的是哪个问题。我把手臂绕着 (0,0) 转动。这个点，也就是我们讨论的点，(0,0)，是一个关键点。我想你可以说我把肘部伸到了那里。

And the signs go away because they’re both 0. So all told we get pi a^2, which is certainly what we would like it to be. It’s the area of the circle. Another question? STUDENT: PROFESSOR:. The question, so I’m not sure which question you’re asking. I pivoted my arm around (0,0). This point, this is the point we’re talking about, (0,0), is a key point. It’s where I guess you could say I stuck my elbow there.

现在，原因是它是 r = 0 的地方。所以从这个问题的角度来看，它或多或少是宇宙的中心。所以它是参考点，如果你愿意的话，当你这样做时，它有点像雷达屏幕。一切都以原点为中心，你从那里获取射线。并看到它们要去哪里。

Now, the reason is that it’s the place where r = 0. So it’s more or less the center of the universe from the point of view of this problem. So it’s the reference point and if you like, when you’re doing this, it’s a little bit like a radar screen. Everything is centered at the origin and you’re taking rays coming out from it. And seeing where they’re going to go.

例如，这是 theta = 0 射线，这是 theta = pi/4 射线。这是 theta = pi/2 射线。事实上，如果我的肘部正好位于此处的中心，那么我指向的是各个方向。这就是我这样做时所想的。顺便说一句，您始终可以从原始公式 x = r cos(theta)，y = r sin(theta) 中得到这些公式。

So for example, this is the theta = 0 ray, this is the theta = pi/4 ray. This the theta = pi/2 ray. And indeed, if my elbow is right at this center here, I’m pointing in those various directions. So that’s what I had in mind when I did that. You can always get these formulas, by the way, from the original business, x = r cos(theta), y = r sin(theta).

但是拥有几何图形也是很有用的。换句话说，如果你是一台机器，你就必须依赖这些公式。并使用这些公式来绘制图形。总是这样。现在，在绘图方面，我想稍微扩展一下你的大脑。所以我们需要多练习一下绘图。在极坐标中。所以，我想问你的第一个问题是，在这个 theta 范围之外会发生什么？

But it’s useful to have the geometric picture as well. In other words, if you were a machine you’d have to rely on these formulas. And plot things using these. Always. Now, in terms of plotting I want to expand your brain a little bit. So we need just a little bit more practice with plotting. In polar coordinates. And so, the first question that I want to ask you is, what happens outside of this range of theta?

换句话说，如果 theta 超出 pi/2 会发生什么情况？有人能看出在这种情况下公式会发生什么情况吗？那么现在我要看的，让我们回到它。我要看的是这里的公式。但是用这里的肘部类比，我像这样被扫过。但现在我要指向这边。我要指向那边。我的手在这里朝西北方向。

In other words, what happens if theta’s beyond pi/2? Can somebody see what’s happening to the formulas in that case? So what I’m looking at now, let’s go back to it. What I’m looking at is this formula here. But to use the elbow analogy here, I’m swept around like this. But now I’m going to point this way. I’m going to point out over there. My hand is up here in the northwest direction.

那么会发生什么？有人想告诉我吗？ 学生： 教授：它绕着自己转。没错。发生的事情是，当 r 穿过这个垂直线 r = 0 时，当它穿过这里时，它会变为负值。所以虽然我的 theta 指向这个方向，但物体会向后移动。还有另一个线索。这非常重要。它向后移动了多远？

So what’s going to happen? Somebody want to tell me? STUDENT: PROFESSOR: It goes around itself. That’s right. What happens is that when r crosses this vertical, r = 0, when it crosses over here it goes negative. So although my theta is pointing me this way, the thing is going to go backwards. And there’s another clue. Which is very important. How far backwards is it going?

其实，你不需要知道任何东西，只要知道这个方程式，你就能明白它必须在同一个圆上。所以当我指向这个方向时，物体会指向那边的这个点。所以，它会绕一圈。然后当我指向这个方向时，它会再绕一圈。它只是继续绕着同一个圆转。所以这里是空的。

Well, you don’t actually need to know anything but this equation here, to understand that it has to be on the same circle. So when I’m pointing this way, the things points backwards to this point over there. So what happens is, it goes around once. And then when I point out this way, it sweeps around a second time. It just keeps on going around the same circle. So over here it’s empty.

因为它指向另一个方向，并且沿着相同的曲线扫描。第二次。现在，如果你愚蠢地将范围从 0 积分到 2pi 或更大的范围，那么你只会将面积翻倍。因为你会扫描两次。所以这就是你会犯的错误。有时你会将事物视为负数和正数。但因为这里有一个平方数，所以它总是一个正数。

Because it’s pointing the other way and it’s sweeping around the same curve. A second time. Now, if you were foolish enough to integrate, say, from 0 to 2pi or some wider range, what would happen is you would just double the area. Because you would have swept it out twice. So that’s the mistake that you’ll make. Sometimes you’ll count things as negative and positive. But because there’s a square here, it’s always a positive quantity.

如果你走得太远，你就会一直数多。这就是发生的事情。同样，它扫过同一个区域。这是因为这两个方程实际上是等价的。只是这个方程扫了两次。而这个方程没有说明它是如何扫过的。是的，另一个问题。学生：如果你从 0 到 pi，这个方程不也适用吗？

And you’ll always over count if you go too far. So that’s what happens. Again, it sweeps out the same region. That’s because these two equations really are equivalent to each other. It’s just that this one sweeps it out twice. And this one doesn’t say how it’s sweeping it out. Yeah, another question. STUDENT: Doesn’t this equation also work if you just go from 0 to pi?

教授：如果你只是从 0 到 pi，积分还能成立吗？答案是肯定的。不过，那是一个非常奇怪的物体。让我给你展示一下那是什么。如果你从 0 开始到 2pi。那么我会在这里说明一下。你在 0 和 pi/2 之间扫出的第一件事就是这里的这部分。它被扫出了。

PROFESSOR: Does the integration work if you just go from 0 to pi? The answer is yes. That’s a very weird object, though. Let me just show you what that is. If you started from 0 to 2pi. So I’ll illustrate it on here. The first thing that you swept out between 0 and pi/2 is this part here. That was swept out.

然后，当你绕着下一个象限走时，你实际上是在扫过这里的底面。所以实际上，你得到了它，因为你在一个象限上得到了一半，在另一个象限上得到了另一半。所以它实际上给了你正确的答案。结果证明这是可以的。这是一种分割圆的有点奇怪的方法。但这是合法的。但当然，这是这个特定图形的意外。

And then, when you’re going around this next quadrant here, you’re actually sweeping out this underside here. So actually, you’re getting it because you’re getting half of it on one half, and getting the other half on the other quadrant. So it’s actually giving you the right answer. That turns out to be OK. It’s a little weird way to chop up a circle. But it’s legal. But of course, that’s an accident of this particular figure.

你不能指望这种情况会发生。最好将它与图形完全对齐。所以不要经常这样做。你可能会遇到麻烦。所以我将用这些图片给你几个练习的例子。也许我会把这一张删掉。这是另一个最喜欢的。这是另一个最喜欢的。

You can’t count on that happening. It’s much better to line it up exactly with what the figure does. So don’t do that too often. You might run into troubles. So I’m going to give you a couple more examples of practice with these pictures. And maybe I’m going to get rid of this one up here. So here’s another favorite. Here’s another favorite.

如果您愿意，这就是示例 2。我想我们上面已经有了示例 1。现在我们实际上不会再尝试做任何面积示例了。面积示例其实很简单。它实际上只是弄清楚图片是什么样子。所以这是绘图示例。所以这个示例很有趣。这是 r = sin(2theta)。你的家庭作业上就有类似这样的内容。

So this, if you like, is Example 2. I guess we had an Example 1 up there. And now we’re really not going to try to do any more area examples. The area examples are actually straightforward. It’s really just figuring out what the picture looks like. So this is examples of drawings. So this one is one that’s kind of fun to do. This is r = sin(2theta). Something like this is on your homework.

因此这里发生的事情如下。这里发生的事情是，在 theta = 0 处，这是第一个位置。所以我们只在这里绘制几个位置。我不会绘制很多位置。Theta = 0，我得到 r 为 1。哎呀，我得到 r 为 0。抱歉。然后是 pi/4，我得到 sin(pi/2)，我在这里得到 1。为此。然后再次，在 pi/2 处我得到 sin(pi)，它又回到了 0。

And so what happens here is the following. What happens here is that at theta = 0, that’s the first place. So let’s just plot a few places here. I’m not going to plot very many. Theta = 0, I get r is 1. Whoops, I get r is 0. Sorry. And then pi/4, that’s where I get sin(pi/2), I get 1 here. For this. And then again, at pi/2 I get sin(pi), which is back at 0 again.

所以是的。另外要说的是，这里的中间是正数。中间。所以它的作用是，它从 0 开始，然后向外延伸到这里的半径 1。然后它又回来了。所以它做了类似的事情。它出去，然后又回来了。现在由于正弦函数的对称性，这几乎就是你需要知道的全部内容。

So it’s. And the other thing to say is in between here it’s positive. In between. So what it does is, it starts out at 0 and it goes out to the radius 1 over here. And then it comes back. So it does something like this. It goes out, and it comes back. Now because of the symmetries of the sine function, this is pretty much all you need to know.

它在所有象限中都做了类似的事情。但为了了解它在做什么，你最好看着我画它。因为顺序对于理解它在做什么非常重要。它与这里的圆圈的奇怪现象类似。所以看我画这个家伙。我会用红色画它，因为它通常有一个名字。所以它在这里。它做这个事情。然后它做这个。

It does something similar in all of the quadrants. But in order to see what it’s doing, it’s useful for you to watch me draw it. Because the order is very important for understanding what it’s doing. It’s similar to this weird business with the circle here. So watch me draw this guy. I’ll draw it in red because it usually has a name. So here it is. It does this thing. And then it does this.

然后它这样做。然后它这样做。所以它被称为四叶玫瑰。我把它画成粉红色，因为它有点像这里的玫瑰。所以它从这里开始。这是第 1 步。这是范围 0 < theta < pi/4。它在这里完成了这部分。然后它在这里变成了 2。所以我应该把它们画成白色，因为用红色很难看清。

And then it does this. And then it does that. So it’s called a four leaf rose. I drew it in pink because it’s kind of a rose here. So it started out over here. This is Step 1. And this is the range 0 < theta < pi/4. It did this part here. And then it went 2 here. So I should draw these in white, because they’re harder to read in red.

但现在看看它做了什么。它没有转直角。它转得很平稳。它绕了这里一圈，然后又转了下来。这是 3。回到这里，那是 4。然后在这里，那是 5。回到这里，那是 6。然后绕到这里，那是 7。然后转下来，那是 8。然后回到起点，再次绕了一圈。

But now look at what it did. It did not make a right angle turn. It was nice and smooth. It went around here and then it went down here. This is 3. Back here, that’s 4. And then over here, that’s 5. Back up here, that’s 6. And then around here, that’s 7. And down here, that’s 8. And then back where it started and goes around again.

这是因为它在穿过原点时实际上会切换符号。当它第一次经过这个象限时，它实际上会追踪其正后方的东西。所以这有点有趣。从这个小小的公式中，您可以得到这个漂亮的图表。无论如何，正如我所说，这是我的最爱。

And this is because actually it’s switching sign when it crosses the origin. When it was over in this quadrant the first time, it actually was tracing what’s directly behind it. So this is kind of amusing. From this little tiny formula you get this pretty diagram here. Anyway that’s, as I say, an old favorite.

在这里，如果你想要计算一片叶子的面积，你必须确保你明白它是整体的一小部分。好的，现在我还有最后一个绘画示例想和你们讨论。它涉及另一项我们还没有充分练习过的技能。所以我要这样做。这也是练习的准备。但我们要在考试后做。

And here if you want to do the area of one leaf, you’ve got to make sure you understand that it’s a small piece of the whole. OK, now I have one last drawing example that I want to discuss with you. And it involves another skill that we haven’t quite gotten enough practice with. So I’m going to do that one. And it’s also preparation for an exercise. But one that we’re going to do after the test.

这是我最后一个例子。我们将在这里讨论这个函数会发生什么。抱歉，这不太清楚，是吧。这是一个余弦。r = r = 1/(1 + 2cos(theta))。现在，我要做的第一件事就是花点时间绘制几个点。这是 theta 的值，这是 r 的值，我们将看看会发生什么。我们将尝试弄清楚它在做什么。

So here’s my last example. We’re going to discuss what happens with this function here. Sorry, that’s not legible, is it. That’s a cosine. r = r = 1/(1 + 2cos(theta)). Now, the first thing I want to do is just take our time a little bit and plot a few points. So here’s the values of theta and here are the values of r, and we’ll see what happens. And we’ll try to figure out what it’s doing.

当 theta = 0 时，余弦为 1。所以 r = 1/3。分母是 1 + 2，所以是 1/3。如果是 theta。我会尽量简单，我们不会做太多。我会做 pi/2，这是余弦的一个简单值。

When theta = 0, cosine is 1. So r = 1/3. The denominator is 1 + 2, so it’s 1/3. If theta. I’m going to make it easy, we’re not going to do so many. I’m going to do pi/2, that’s an easy value of the cosine.

即 cos(pi/2) = 0。因此 r 的值 = 1。现在我要返回并计算 pi/2。pi/2，余弦再次为 0。r = 1。所以现在我想绘制这些点，看看这里的表达式是怎么回事。第一个是直角坐标。我要在这里写直角坐标，而不是极坐标。

That’s cos(pi/2) = 0. So that value of r = 1. And now I’m going to back up and do pi/2. pi/2, again, cosine is 0. And r = 1. So now I’d like to just plot those points anyway, and see what’s going on with this expression here. The first one is a rectangular. I’m going to write the rectangular coordinates here, not the polar coordinates.

这里的直角坐标在水平方向向外延伸 1/3，所以是 (1/3,0)。极坐标是 (1/3,0)，但直角坐标也是这样。在这里​​，在 pi/2 处，距离是 1。所以这是 xy 坐标中的点 (0,1)。然后在这里，在 pi/2 处，它是 (0, 1)。让我强调一下。如果你能转动手臂并思考，你应该能够形象地想到这一点。

The rectangular coordinates here are 1/3 out at the horizontal, so it’s (1/3,0). The polar coordinates is (1/3,0), but the rectangular coordinate is also that. And over here, at pi/2, the distance is 1. So this is the point (0,1) in x y coordinates. And then down here at, pi/2, it’s (0, 1). Let me just emphasize. You should be able to think of this visually if you can crank your arm around and think it.

或者如果你是右撇子，你会向那边弯曲，不会。无论如何。或者你必须使用。但这也适用于以下公式 x = r cos(theta)，y = r sin(theta)。请注意，在这种情况下，r 为 1，但余弦为 0。因此，你代入 theta = pi/2。并且 r = 1。瞧，你在这里得到 0。

Or if you’re right handed you’ll bend that way, no. Anyway. Or you’ll have to use. But this also works using this formulas x = r cos(theta), y = r sin(theta). Notice that in this case, r was 1 but the cosine was 0. So you plug in theta = pi/2. And r = 1. And lo and behold, you get 0 here.

这里得到 1，这里得到 1。所以这是 1。这是一个例子。我纯粹是视觉上或某种有机地做到了这一点。但你也可以通过插入数字来实现。现在，在中间，分母是正数。它是介于两者之间的一个数。它会像这样扫过某个东西。这就是介于两者之间的情况。

And here you get 1 here you get 1. So this is 1. So this is an example. I did it purely visually or sort of organically. But you can also do it by plugging in the numbers. Now in between, the denominator is positive. And it’s something in between. It’s going to sweep around something like this. That’s what happens in between.

随着 theta 从 pi/2 增加到 pi/2。现在这个特定函数发生了一些有趣的事情，我们注意到分母在某个地方是 0。也就是说，如果我解 2 cos(theta) = 1，那么分母在那里将为 0。这就是 cos(theta) = 1/2，所以 theta 等于，结果是，加上或减去 2pi/3。这些就是这里的值。所以当我们在这里的某个地方，在这些方向，什么都没有。

As theta increases from pi/2 to pi/2. And now something interesting happens with this particular function, which is that we notice that the denominator is 0 at a certain place. Namely, if I solve 2 cos(theta) = 1, then the denominator is going to be 0 there. That’s cos(theta) = 1/2, so theta is equal to, it turns out, plus or minus 2pi/3. Those are the values here. So when we’re out here somewhere, in these directions, there’s nothing.

它会无限延伸。这些方向。好吧，这就是我们不用做任何分析工作就能从这个图中得出的结论。这是我想解释的另一小部分。也就是说，从极坐标倒退到直角坐标。这是我们还没有做过的一件事。所以让我们这样做。那么矩形方程是什么？

It’s going infinitely far out. Those ways. OK that’s about as much as we’ll be able to figure out of this diagram without doing some analytic work. And that’s the other little piece that I want to explain. Namely, going backwards from polar coordinates to rectangular coordinates. Which is one thing that we haven’t done. So let’s do that. So what is the rectangular equation?

这意味着 (x, y) 方程中的 r = 1 / (1 + 2cos(theta))。让我们看看它是什么。好吧，首先我要清除这里的分母。这是 r + 2r cos(theta) = 1。现在我要将其重写为 r = 1 2r cos(theta)。这样做的原因是，稍后我会向你解释原因。这是 1 2x。现在我要对这个进行平方。

That means the (x, y) equation for this r = 1 / (1 + 2cos(theta)). And let’s see what it is. Well, first I’m going to clear the denominator here. This is r + 2r cos(theta) = 1. And now I’m going to rewrite it as r = 1 2r cos(theta). And the reason for that is that in a minute I’ll explain to you why. This is 1 2x. And this guy, I’m going to square now.

我要让 r^2 = (1 2x)^2。现在，有了 r^2，我就可以代入 x^2 + y^2。所以这是标准做法。基本上，当你遇到这样的等式时，你要做的就是试着解出来。而且，在有 1 / (a + b cos(theta)) 或 sin(theta) 的情况下，你总会得到像这样的二次表达式。

I’m going to make this r^2 = (1 2x)^2. And now, with an r^2, I can plug in x^2 + y^2. So this is a standard thing to do. And it’s basically what you’re going to do any time you’re faced with an equation like this. Is try to work it out. And, in these situations where you have 1 / (a + b cos(theta)), or sin(theta), you’ll always come out with some quadratic expression like this.

现在，我要合并项。所以这里我有 3x^2 + y^2，并将所有项放在左边。这就是这个。我们认识到，嗯，你应该认识到，这就是所谓的双曲线。如果符号相同，它就是椭圆。如果符号相反，它就是双曲线。在两者之间，如果二次项的系数之一是 0，它就是抛物线。

Now, I’m going to combine terms. So here I have 3x^2 + y^2, and put everything on the left side. So that’s this. And we recognize, well you’re supposed to recognize, that this is what’s known as a hyperbola. If the signs are the same, it’s an ellipse. If the signs are opposite it’s a hyperbola. And in between, if one of the coefficients on the quadratic is 0, it’s a parabola.

现在我们看到我们在那里画的图实际上会有一个渐近线，它会是一条双曲线。现在，让我问你们最后一个我想问的令人费解的问题。那就是，会发生什么。现在我想我用的是右臂。但我的肘部在这里的原点。如果我越过这个分母为负的范围，会发生什么。

So now we see that the picture that we drew there is actually, turns out it’s going to have asymptotes, it’s going to be a hyperbola. So now, let me ask you the last little mind bending question that I want to ask. Which is, what happens. So now I’m using my right arm, I guess. But my elbow’s at the origin here. What happens if I pass outside, to the range where this denominator is negative.

它越过 0 就变成负数了。它在这里扫出了一些东西。它扫出了相同的曲线吗？有人知道它在做什么吗？是的。学生：教授：是的，没错。很好的回答。它是双曲线的另一个分支。所以实际发生的事情是伪装的，双曲线的另一个分支被这个东西的另一部分扫了出去。现在，这与这些代数方程一致。

It crossed 0 and it went to negative. It’s sweeping out something over here. Is it sweeping out the same curve? Anybody have any idea what it’s doing? Yeah. STUDENT: PROFESSOR: Yeah, exactly. Good answer. It’s the other branch of the hyperbola. So what’s actually happening is in disguise, there’s another branch of the hyperbola which is being swept up by the other piece of this thing. Now, that is consistent with these algebraic equations.

我在这里得到的代数方程没有说明我得到的是双曲线的哪一条分支。它实际上有两个分支。而曲线实际上是伪装的，捕捉到了它们两个。我现在想在这里与面积的基本公式建立联系。因为这是一个非常漂亮的联系。我也想将这种联系与这个例子联系起来。您可能知道，双曲线是彗星的轨迹。

The algebraic equation that I got here doesn’t say which branch of the hyperbola I’ve got. It’s actually got two branches. And the curve really was, in disguise, capturing both of them. I want to make the connection now with the basic formula for area here. Because this is a really beautiful connection. And I want to make that connection in connection also with this example. The hyperbolas, as you probably know, are the trajectories of comets.

如果你把这里的 2 换成 1/2，那么得到的椭圆就是行星或小行星的轨迹。但实际上，在物理上还有更重要的事情。这种双曲线的特殊表示很特别。当你得到椭圆时会发生什么。在这种情况下，r = 0 是双曲线的焦点。

And ellipses, which is what you would get if maybe you put 1/2 here instead of a 2, would be the trajectories of planets or asteroids. But there’s actually something much more important, physically that goes on. That’s special about this particular representation of the hyperbola. And what happens when you get the ellipses as well. Which is that in this case, r = 0 is the focus of the hyperbola.

这意味着它实际上是太阳所在的位置。所以如果你想让重心位于图片的中心，这就是正确的表示。其他的也差不多。我的意思是，你根本无法从这里的代数方程中看出这一点。所以这条双曲线将是某颗彗星经过的轨迹。这里的这个公式实际上是天文学中一个相当核心的公式。

And what that means is that it’s actually the place where the sun is. So this is the right representation, if you want the center of gravity in the center of your picture. And pretty much any other. I mean, you can’t tell that at all from the algebraic equations here. So this hyperbola is going to be the trajectory of some comet going by here. And this formula here is actually a rather central formula in astronomy.

也就是说，有一条定律叫做开普勒定律。它说扫过的面积变化率是恒定的。面积变化率是相对于重心，相对于太阳。所以在相等的面积中，这就是面积的大小。所以这告诉你，当彗星像这样绕太阳旋转时，它的速度会发生变化。它的速度会根据一个非常具体的规则变化。也就是这里的这个。

Namely, there’s something called Kepler’s Law. Which says that the rate of change of area which is swept out is constant. The rate of change of area relative to the center of mass, relative to the sun. So in equal areas, this is amount of area. So this tells you now that when a comet goes around the sun like this, its speed varies. And it’s speed varies according to a very specific rule. Namely, this one here.

开普勒观察到了这条规则。但是如果你有这个联系，我们还会发现其他东西。我们还知道 dA/dt = 1/2 r^2 d theta / dt。这就是这里的公式，正式除以 t。这是关于这个时间参数的变化率，也就是真正的时间。真实的物理时间。这意味着，这里的这个量是恒定的。

And this rule was observed by Kepler. But if you have this connection here, we also have something else. We also know that dA/dt = 1/2 r^2 d theta / dt. So that’s this formula here, formally dividing by t. That’s the rate of change with respect to this time parameter, which is the honest to goodness time. Real physical time. And that means, this quantity here is constant.

这是物理学家们的一个关键见解，在开普勒进行物理观察很久之后，他们意识到他已经成功进行了最好的物理实验，因为它是一个无摩擦的装置。外太空没有空气。什么都没有发生。这就是现在所谓的角动量守恒。这是角动量的表达式。

And this is one of the key insights that physicists had, long after Kepler made his physical observations, they realized that he had managed to get the best physics experiment of all, because it’s a frictionless setup. Outer space, there’s no air. Nothing is going on. This is what’s known nowadays as conservation of angular momentum. This is the expression for angular momentum.

事实证明，开普勒所观察到的正是我们在现实生活中经常看到的情况。也就是说，当你开始旋转某个物体时，它会继续以大致相同的速度旋转。或者，如果你是一名滑冰运动员，把自己挤得更紧一些，你就可以旋转得更快。有一条精确的定量规则可以做到这一点。这就是这里的极坐标公式。所以这是一件很棒的事情。

And what Kepler was observing, it turns out, is what we see all the time in real life. Which is when you start something spinning around it continues to spin at roughly the same rate. Or, if you’re an ice skater and you get yourself scrunched together a little bit more, you can spin faster. And there’s an exact quantitative rule that does that. And it’s exactly this polar formula here. So that’s a neat thing.

考试结束后，我们会做一些关于变化率的练习。以上就是概括性的内容，以及当你学习更多物理知识时将要遇到的问题。现在我们需要谈谈考试。首先，让我告诉你考试的主题是什么。它们与去年的考试相同。你可以看一下。让我们看看。

And we will do a little exercise on this rate of change after the exam. So that’s it for generalities and a little pep talk on what’s coming up to you when you learn a little more physics. Right now we need to talk about the exam. So first of all, let me tell you what the topics are. They’re the same as last year’s test. Which you can take a look at. And let’s see.

那么我们做了什么？本单元的主要主题之一是积分技术。我们将测试三种技术。一种是三角代换。一种是分部积分。一种是部分分式。所以这些占了考试的一半以上。考试的另一半是参数曲线。弧长。这些都是相互关联的。还有旋转曲面面积。这些是我们唯一能处理的类型。

So what did we do? One of the main topics of this unit were techniques of integration. And there are three, which we will test. One is trig substitution. One is integration by parts. And one is partial fractions. So that’s more than half of the exam, right there. The other half of the exam is parametric curves. Arc length. These are all interrelated. And area of surfaces of revolution. Those are the only kind that we can handle.

就像我们考旋转曲面的体积一样。然后是最后一个主题，即极坐标。以及极坐标中的面积，包括面积。就是这样。这就是考试的内容，有六个问题。它们非常相似。嗯，它们实际上并没有那么相似。但它们与去年的有些相似。我想说考试很相似。也许稍微难一点。我们拭目以待。我们拭目以待。是的。学生：教授：。

Just as we did with volume of surfaces of revolution. And then there’s a final topic, which is polar coordinates. And area in polar coordinates, including area. That’s it. That’s what’s on the test, there are six problems. They’re very similar. Well, they’re not actually that similar. But they’re somewhat similar to last year’s. I’d say the test is similar. Maybe a tiny bit more difficult. We’ll see. We’ll see. Yeah. STUDENT: PROFESSOR:.

问题是，我们没有在极坐标系中计算弧长，对吧？答案是没有。我们没有在极坐标系中计算弧长。当我给你布置练习时，我会问你，如果你知道彗星在这里的速度，彗星在那里的速度是多少。我们必须知道弧长。但我们不会在这次考试中做这个。其他问题。

The question was, we didn’t do arc length in polar coordinates, did we? And the answer is no, we did not. We did not do arc length in polar coordinates. When I give you an exercise, I’m going to ask you about, if you know the speed of a comet here, what’s the speed of the comet there. And we’ll have to know about arc length for that. But we’re not doing it on this exam. Other questions.

学生：教授：问题是，我是否希望你知道 r 等于。那么让我们看看我是否能提出这个问题。它与这朵四叶玫瑰有关。所以问题是，假设我给你一个看起来像这样的东西。我是否希望你能知道它是什么。我认为答案，公平的答案是，如果它这么复杂，我只有两种可能性。

STUDENT: PROFESSOR:. The question is, will I expect you to know r equals. so let’s see if I can formulate this question. It’s related to this four leaf rose here. So the question is, suppose I gave you something that looked like this. Would I expect you to be able to know what it is. I think the answer, the fair answer to give you, is if it’s this complicated, I only have two possibilities.

我可以给你很长时间来勾勒出这个轮廓。想想它的作用。或者我可以告诉你它恰好是一朵三叶玫瑰。然后你就知道它的作用了。它没有六片叶子。因为一些奇怪的事情，与重复有关。但奇数和偶数的工作原理不同。

I can give you a long time to sketch this out. And think about what it does. Or I can tell you that it happens to be a three leaf rose. And then you have some clue as to what it’s doing. It doesn’t have six. Because of some weird thing, having to do with repetitions. But the odds and evens work differently.

所以，事实上，如果它要这么复杂，我必须告诉你图景是什么样的。同样，这是一个重要的观点，当我们谈到积分技巧时，对于任何积分，我不会告诉你在那些简单的积分上应该使用这三种技巧中的哪一种。

So, in fact I would have to tell you what the picture looks like, if it’s going to be this complicated. Similarly, so this is an important point to make, when we come to techniques of integration, any integral that you have, I’m not going to tell you which of these three techniques to use on the ones which are straightforward integrals.

但如果我认为你会被一个积分难住，我要么给你提示，告诉你怎么做。要么告诉你不要做。如果我告诉你不要做，就不要尝试。这可能是不可能的。即使可能，也会花很长时间。比如一个小时。所以，除非我告诉你，否则不要做。

But if it’s an integral that I think you’re going to get stuck on, either I’m going to give you a hint, tell you how to do it. Or I’m going to tell you, don’t do it. If I tell you don’t do it, don’t try to do it. It may be impossible. And even if it’s possible, it’s going to be very long. Like an hour. So don’t do it unless I tell you to.

另一方面，本单元后半部分中的所有设置都涉及以某种方式设置某些内容。它们基本上是三个问题。一个是被积函数是什么。一个是下限是什么，上限是什么。它们只是三个东西，三个输入，用于设置积分。所有积分，这将是它们的设置。然后第二步是评估。

On the other hand, all of these setups in this second half of this unit, they involve somehow setting something up. And they’re basically three issues. One is what the integrand is. One is what the lower limit is, what is the upper limit. They’re just three things, three inputs, to setting up an integral. All integrals, this is going to be the setup for all of them. And then the second step is evaluating.

这确实是我们在上半部分所做的。不幸的是，我们没有无限多的技术，而且确实有一些积分无法计算，有些积分太长。所以我们会尽量避免这些。我并不是想给你那些无可救药的长积分。好吧，其他问题。是的。学生：教授：问题是，百分比会一样吗？答案是，不会。我会准确告诉你。

Which really is what we did in the first half here. And, unfortunately, we don’t have infinitely many techniques and indeed there’s some integrals that can’t be evaluated and some that are too long. So we’ll just try to avoid those. I’m not trying to give you ones which are hopelessly long. Alright, other questions. Yes. STUDENT: PROFESSOR:. The question is, will the percentages be the same. And the answer is, no. I’ll tell you exactly.

这是 55 分。除非我更改分值。这是 55，这是 45。结果就是这样。你会想知道我在这里写下的所有内容。你肯定会想知道，例如，旋转曲面。如何设置它们。是的。我看到了另一个问题。是的。

This is 55 points. Unless I change the point values. This is 55, and this is 45. That’s what it came out to be. You are going to want to know about all of the things that I’ve written down here. You’re definitely going to want to know, for example, surfaces of revolution. How to set those up. Yes. there was another question I saw. Yes.

学生：教授：如果你有一个部分分数，比如 (x+2)^2，可能还有 x，也可能还有 x+1，你想知道这里的分母会发生什么？那么，你将需要为它的每个度数取一个系数。所以总的来说，设置将是这样的。x 加 1。x+1 加 1。这就是设置。所以你需要。

STUDENT: PROFESSOR: So if you have a partial fraction with something like (x+2)^2 and maybe an x and maybe an x+1, and you’re interested in what happens with this denominator here? So what’s going to happen is, you’re going to need a coefficient for each degree of this. So altogether, the setup is going to be this. Plus one for x. And one for x+1. This is the setup. So you need.

学生：教授：如果我把这个改成 3，那么我需要，我想我必须把它称为 E，(x+2)^3。我需要这个。现在，它变得越来越难。重复根越多，重复因子越多，就越难。因为您可以通过掩盖方法挑选出来的只是这里的顶部。还有这两个。所以您可以得到 C、D 和 E。

STUDENT: PROFESSOR: So if I change this to being a 3 here, then I need, I guess I’ll have to call it E, (x+2)^3. I need that. Now, it gets harder and harder. The more repeated roots there are, the more repeated factors there are, the harder it is. Because the ones you can pick off by the cover up method are, is just the top one here. And these two. So C, D, and E you can get.
