但是 B 和 A 你必须通过代入或其他更复杂的代数运算来计算。因此，这些较低的项越多，你的情况就越糟。学生：教授：问题是，这个 x^3 + 21 是否会影响此设置。答案几乎是否定的。也就是说，完全不会。这是完全相同的设置。但是，有一件事。

But B and A you’re going to have to do by either plugging in or some other, more elaborate, algebra. So the more of these lower terms there are, the worse off you are. STUDENT: PROFESSOR:. The question is, does this x^3 + 21 affect this setup. And the answer is almost no. That is, not at all. It’s the same setup exactly. But, there’s one thing.

如果次数太多，那么你必须先用长除法把它降下来。我给你举个这种练习的例子。除非还有更多问题。是的。学生：教授：你必须知道如何做简化公式吗？任何像简化公式这样有点不寻常的事情，我都必须指导你去做。

If the degree gets too big, then you’ve got to use long division first to knock it down. I’ll give you an example of this type of practice. Unless there are more question. Yes. STUDENT: PROFESSOR: Are you going to have to know how to do reduction formulas? Anything that’s a little out of the ordinary like a reduction formula, I will have to coach you to do.

换句话说，在那种情况下，你必须能够按照指示去做。如果我告诉你，你面临的是这种情况，那么就进行分部积分。然后这样做，就可以得到简化公式。学生：教授：是的。好的，所以这个问题与部分分式方法有关。如果你有二次方程会发生什么。所以，例如，如果是这样，这个就太恶心了。

So, in other words, what you’ll have to be able to do in that situation is follow directions. If I tell you OK, you’re faced with this, then do an integration by parts. And do that, then get the reduction formula. STUDENT: PROFESSOR: Yeah. OK, so the question had do with the partial fractions method. And what happens if you have a quadratic. So, for instance, if it were this, this one’s too disgusting.

我打算用其中两个来做。因此 x 和 x+1 的部分是相同的。但现在这里有线性因子。(Ax + B) / (x^2 + 2)。A. 也许我会称它们为 1，A_2 x + (A_2 x + B_2) / (x^2 + 2)^2 + C / x + D / (x+1)。这就是它的工作原理。

I’m going to just do it with two of them. So the parts with x and x+1 are the same. But now you have linear factors here. (Ax + B) / (x^2 + 2). And A. maybe I’ll call them 1, and A_2 x + (A_2 x + B_2) / (x^2 + 2)^2 + C / x + D / (x+1). This is the way it works.

好的，为了让大家更生动，我将再举一个积分技术的简单例子。让我们看看。这是一个有点棘手的例子。这比我在考试中给你的要棘手一点。但原理是一样的，我可能会在期末考试中这样做。假设你面对这个积分。你要怎么做？分部积分，太棒了。

OK, I’m going to give you one more quick example of an integration technique just to liven things up. Let’s see. So here’s a somewhat tricky example. This is just a little trickier than I would give you on a test. But it’s the same principle, and I may do this on a final exam. So suppose you’re faced with this integral. What are you going to do? Integration by parts, great.

没错，这是因为这个家伙需要被区分，需要变得更简单。所以这意味着我希望这个是 u，我希望这个是 v'。我想使用分部积分。然后 u ' = 1 / (1+x^2)，v = x^2 / 2。所以答案现在是 x^2 / x^2/2 tan^( 1) x 减去这个家伙的积分。

That’s right, that’s because this guy is begging to be differentiated, to be made simpler. So that means that I want this one to be u, and I want this one to be v’. And I want to use integration by parts. And then u ’ = 1 / (1+x^2), and v = x^2 / 2. So the answer is now, x^2 / x^2/2 tan^( 1) x minus the integral of this guy.

也就是 x^2 / 2。然后我有 1 / (1 + x^2) dx。现在，你还没完成。你仍然处于有点热的水中。无论如何，你处于温水中。那么你现在要做什么呢？你面对的是这个积分，我会把它放在下一个板上。它比另一个简单得多，但正如我所说，你还没有完全脱离困境。

Which is going to be x^2 / 2. And then I have 1 / (1 + x^2) dx. Now, you are not done at this point. You’re still in slightly hot water. You’re in tepid water, anyway. So what is it that you have to do here? You’re faced with this integral, which I’ll put on the next board. It’s a lot simpler than the other one, but as I say you’re not quite out of the woods.

你面对的是 1/2 的积分。1/2 x^2 / (1 + x^2) dx。dx。学生：教授：有趣的是，三角代换实际上会起作用。但这不是我想要你做的。我希望你，是的，继续。学生：教授：在分子上加 1 并减 1。所以现在，这是正确答案。这是分子和分母相等的情况。所以你必须使用长除法。

You’re faced with the integral of 1/2. 1/2 x^2 / (1 + x^2) dx. dx. STUDENT: PROFESSOR: Trig substitution actually, interestingly, will work. But that wasn’t what I wanted you to do. I wanted you to, yeah, go ahead. STUDENT: PROFESSOR: Add and subtract 1 to the numerator. So now, that’s the correct answer. This is the case where the numerator and the denominator are tied. And so you have to use long division.

但捷径是观察长除法的结果与此相同。然后注意到这是 1 1 / (1 + x^2)。所以在这种情况下，这与长除法相同。因为当你除时，它会以 1 为商。所以这个结果是 1 1/(1+x^2) dx 积分的 1/2。也就是 1/2 x 1/2 tan^( 1) x + c。所以这是你在生活中某一天可能会遇到的一个额外步骤。记住这一点。

But a shortcut is just to observe that the result of long division is the same thing as doing this. And then noticing that this is 1 1 / (1 + x^2). So this is the same as long division, in this case. Because when you divide in, it goes in with a quotient of 1. And so this guy turns out to be 1/2 the integral of 1 1/(1+x^2) dx. Which is 1/2 x 1/2 tan^( 1) x + c. So this is one extra step that you may be faced with someday in your life. And just keep that in mind.

Lec 35 | MIT 18.01 单变量微积分，2007 年秋季

Lec 35 | MIT 18.01 Single Variable Calculus, Fall 2007

15 年前 (2009 年 9 月 10 日) — 48:43 https://youtube.com/watch?v=PNTnMH6jsRI

15 years ago (Sep 10, 2009) — 48:43 https://youtube.com/watch?v=PNTnmH6jsRI

以下内容根据 Creative Commons 许可提供。您的支持将帮助 MIT OpenCourseWare 继续免费提供高质量的教育资源。要捐款或查看数百门 MIT 课程的其他材料，请访问 MIT OpenCourseWare，网址为 ocw.mit.edu。教授：所以我们已经讲完了积分技术，这实际上是我们要做的最具技术性的事情。现在我们只需澄清一些有关微积分的零散内容。

The following content is provided under a Creative Commons license. Your support will help MIT OpenCourseWare continue to offer high quality educational resources for free. To make a donation or to view additional materials from hundreds of MIT courses, visit MIT OpenCourseWare at ocw.mit.edu. PROFESSOR: So we’re through with techniques of integration, which is really the most technical thing that we’re going to be doing. And now we’re just clearing up a few loose ends about calculus.

今天我们要讨论的规则将帮助我们处理无穷大。这就是所谓的洛必达规则。这是洛必达规则。这就是我们今天要讲的内容。洛必达规则也称为洛必达规则。它的名字相同，因为在法语中，用抑扬符来省略 s。所以它是同一个东西，即使它里面有一个 s，它仍然发音为 L'Hopital。

And the one we’re going to talk about today will allow us to deal with infinity. And it’s what’s known as L’Hopital’s Rule. Here’s L’Hopital’s Rule. And that’s what we’re going to do today. L’Hopital’s Rule it’s also known as L’Hospital’s Rule. That’s the same name, since the circumflex is what you put in French to omit the s. So it’s the same thing, and it’s still pronounced L’Hopital, even if it’s got an s in it.

好吧，这是你需要知道的第一件事。这种方法的作用是，它是一种计算极限的便捷方法，包括一些新的极限。所以它对旧的极限很方便。会有一些新的极限，例如，当 x 趋于无穷大时，你可以计算 x ln x。你可以，哎呀，这不是一个很有趣的问题，让我们试试 x 从正数趋于 0。

Alright, so that’s the first thing you need to know about it. And what this method does is, it’s a convenient way to calculate limits including some new ones. So it’ll be convenient for the old ones. There are going to be some new ones and, as an example, you can calculate x ln x as x goes to infinity. You could, whoops, that’s not a very interesting one, let’s try x goes to 0 from the positive side.

例如，当 x 趋于无穷大时，你可以计算 xe^x。好吧，也许我应该加上其他一些。也许像当 x 趋于无穷大时，计算 ln x / x。这些是一些例子，事实上，如果你把它们输入计算器，你就能看到它们发生了什么。但如果你想系统地理解它们，最好有洛必达法则这个工具。

And you can calculate, for example, x e^ x, as x goes to infinity. And, well, maybe I should include a few others. Maybe something like ln x / x as x goes to infinity. So these are some examples of things which, in fact, if you plug into your calculator, you can see what’s happening with these. But if you want to understand them systematically, it’s much better to have this tool of L’Hopital’s Rule.

当然，没有基于计算器计算的证明。现在，我们来谈谈这个想法。我将首先用一个例子来说明这个想法。然后我们将使它系统化。然后我们将对其进行概括。我们将对其进行进一步的阐述，因此当它包含这些新的限制时，您必须了解一些小技巧。

And certainly there isn’t a proof just based on a calculation in a calculator. So now here’s the idea. I’ll illustrate the idea first with an example. And then we’ll make it systematic. And then we’re going to generalize it. We’ll make it much more, so when it includes these new limits, there are some little pieces of trickiness that you have to understand.

那么，我们来举一个例子，你可以在这门课的第一个单元中完成。极限是 x 变为 1 的 x ^ 10 1 / x ^2 1。这是我们可以处理的极限。有趣的是，我的意思是，如果你喜欢这个，它就属于我们在课程开始时提到的有趣极限类别。

So, let’s just take an example that you could have done in the very first unit of this class. The limit as x goes to 1 of x ^ 10 1 / x ^2 1. So that’s a limit that we could’ve handled. And the thing that’s interesting, I mean, if you like this is in this category that we mentioned at the beginning of the course of interesting limits.

有趣的是，如果你做了这个愚蠢的事情，即代入 x = 1，在 x = 1 处你将得到 0 / 0。这就是我们所说的不定式。它是什么还不清楚。通过代入，你根本无法得到它。现在，另一方面，有一个技巧可以做到这一点。这是我们在课程开始时做的技巧。

What’s interesting about it is that if you do this silly thing, which is just plug in x = 1, at x = 1 you’re going to get 0 / 0. And that’s what we call an indeterminate form. It’s just unclear what it is. From that plugging, in you just can’t get it. Now, on the other hand, there’s a trick for doing this. And this is the trick that we did at the beginning of the class.

这个想法是，我可以用分子和分母除以 x 1。所以如果我试图取消分子和分母中的隐藏因子 x 1，这个极限是不变的。现在，我们实际上可以执行这些多项式的比率，并通过代数中的长除法来计算它们。这非常非常长。我们想用微积分来做到这一点。我们已经这样做了。我们已经知道这个比率就是所谓的差商。

And the idea is I can divide in the numerator and denominator by x 1. So this limit is unchanged, if I try to cancel the hidden factor x 1 in the numerator and denominator. Now, we can actually carry out these ratios of polynomials and calculate them by long division in algebra. That’s very, very long. We want to do this with calculus. And we already have. We already know that this ratio is what’s called a difference quotient.

然后在极限下，它趋向于这个函数的导数。所以这个想法是，这实际上等于，在极限下，现在我们只研究它的一个部分。

And then in the limit, it tends to the derivative of this function. So the idea is that this is actually equal to, in the limit, now let’s just study one piece of it.

所以，如果我有一个函数 f ( x )，即 x ^ 10 1，并且 1 处的值恰好等于 0，那么我们得到的这个表达式，也就是变相的差商，当 x 趋向于 1 时，趋向于导数，也就是 f' ( 1 )。就是这样。所以我们知道分子趋向于什么，同样，我们也知道分母趋向于什么。

So if I have a function f ( x), which is x ^ 10 1, and the value at 1 happens to be equal to 0, then this expression that we have, which is in disguise, this is in disguise the difference quotient, tends to, as x goes to 1, the derivative, which is f’ ( 1). That’s what it is. So we know what the numerator goes to, and similarly we’ll know what the denominator goes to.

但那是什么呢？嗯，f ' (x) = 10x ^ 9。所以我们知道答案是什么。分子是 10x ^ 9。分母是 2x，这是 x ^2 1 的导数。然后我们必须在 x = 1 处求值。所以结果是 10/2，也就是 5。所以答案是 5。利用我们的技巧和导数知识，使用这个相当聪明的代数技巧，很容易得到答案。

But what is that? Well, f ’ (x) = 10x ^ 9. So we know what the answer is. In the numerator it’s 10x ^ 9. In the denominator, it’s going to be 2x, that’s the derivative of x ^2 1. And then were going to have to evaluate that at x = 1. And so it’s going to be 10/2, which is 5. So the answer is 5. And it’s pretty easy to get from our techniques and knowledge of derivatives, using this rather clever algebraic trick.

除以 x 1 这件事。我现在要做的就是系统地执行这个方法。这将为我们提供所谓的洛必达规则的方法。这是我今天的主题。所以这是想法。假设我们一般考虑当 x 趋向于 f ( x) / g ( x) 的某个数字 a 时的一个极限。假设这是我们无法决定的坏情况。所以它是确定的。

This business of dividing by x 1. What I want to do now is just carry this method out systematically. And that’s going to give us the approach to what’s known as L’Hopital’s Rule. What my main subject for today. So here’s the idea. Suppose we’re considering, in general, a limit as x goes to some number a of f ( x) / g ( x). And suppose it’s the bad case where we can’t decide. So it’s in determinate.

F (a) = g (a) = 0。所以结果是 0 / 0。现在我们要做和这里完全相同的事情。也就是说，我们要除以分子和分母，然后重复这个论点。所以我们这里有 f (x) / x a。还有 g (x) / xa。我还没有改变任何东西。现在我要用这种暗示形式来写。

F ( a) = g ( a) = 0. So it would be 0 / 0. Now we’re just going to do exactly the same thing we did over here. Namely, we’re going to divide a numerator and denominator, and we’re going to repeat that argument. So we have here f ( x) / x a. And g (x) / x a also. I haven’t changed anything yet. And now I’m going to write it in this suggestive form.

也就是说，我要分别取分子和分母的极限。然后我要再移动一次。所以我要取极限，因为 x 在分子中趋向于 a，但我要把它写成 f ( x) f ( a) / x a。这就是我要写分子的方式，而且我必须在这里画一条更长的线。那么为什么我可以这样做呢？

Namely, I’m going to take separately the limit in the numerator and the denominator. And I’m going to make one more shift. So I’m going to take the limit, as x goes to a in the numerator, but I’m going to write it as f ( x) f ( a) / x a. So that’s the way I’m going to write the numerator, and I’ve got to draw a much longer line here. So why am I allowed to do that?

这是因为 f (a) = 0。所以我没有通过减法改变分子。f (a) = 0。我对分母做同样的事情。同样，g (a) = 0，所以这是可以的。瞧，我知道这些极限是什么。这是 f ' (a) / g '(a)。就是这样。这就是技巧，这可以求出极限。这并不难。

That’s because f (a) = 0. So I didn’t change this numerator of the numerator any by subtracting. f ( a) = 0. And I’ll do the same thing to the denominator. Again, g ( a) = 0, so this is OK. And lo and behold, I know what these limits are. This is f ’ (a) / g ’(a). So that’s it. That’s the technique and this evaluates the limit. And it’s not so difficult.

这里的公式非常简单。只要 g' (a) 不为 0，它就有效。是的，问题来了。学生：教授：问题是，有没有更直观的方式来理解这个过程。我认为简短的回答是，还有其他类似的方法。我不认为它们更直观。

The formula’s pretty straightforward here. And it works, provided that g ’ (a) is not 0. Yeah, question. STUDENT: PROFESSOR:. The question is, is there a more intuitive way of understanding this procedure. And I think the short answer is that there are other, similar, ways. I don’t consider them to be more intuitive.

我将提到其中之一，即线性化的概念，这可以追溯到我们在第二单元中学到的内容。我认为，一次性理解所有这些概念非常重要。但我不会声称其中任何一种方法比另一种更直观。但基本上发生的事情是，我们正在研究 f 在 a 处的线性近似。以及 g 在 a 处的线性近似。

I will be mentioning one of them, which is the idea of linearization, which goes back to what we did in Unit 2. I think it’s very important to understand all of these, more or less, at once. But I wouldn’t claim that any of these methods is a more intuitive one than the other. But basically what’s happening is, we’re looking at the linear approximation to f, at a. And the linear approximation to g at a.

这就是事情的根本原因。现在我要为你们阐述洛必达法则，至少是我称之为简易版的，或者，如果你愿意的话，也可以叫它版本 1。这就是洛必达法则。版本 1。它不会和我们刚才做的一模一样。它会好得多。而且更有用。

That’s what underlies this. So now I get to formulate for you L’Hopital’s Rule at least in what I would call the easy version or, if you like, Version 1. So here’s L’Hopital’s Rule. Version 1. It’s not going to be quite the same as what we just did. It’s going to be much, much better. And more useful.

需要解决的是分母不为 0 的问题。现在我们要做的就是。我们要说，极限 ax 趋向于 f(x) / g ( x) 的 a = 极限，因为 x 趋向于 a 趋向于 af '(x) / g' (x)。现在，这看起来实际上与我们之前所说的相同。

And what is going to take care of is this problem that the denominator is not 0. So now here’s what we’re going to do. We’re going to say that it turns out that the limit a x goes to a of f(x) / g ( x) = the limit as x goes to a to a f ‘(x) / g’ (x). Now, that looks practically the same as what we said before.

我必须确保你明白它何时起作用。只要这是这些未定义表达式之一，它就会起作用。换句话说，f (a) = g (a) = 0。所以我们有一个 0 / 0 表达式，不定式。而且，我们还需要另一个假设。右边，右边极限存在。现在，这实际上与我在这里所说的相同。

And I have to make sure that you understand when it works. So it works provided this is one of these undefined expressions. In other words, f ( a) = g ( a) = 0. So we have a 0 / 0 expression, indeterminant. And, also, we need one more assumption. And the right hand side, the right hand limit exists. Now, this is practically the same thing as what I said over here.

也就是说，我取了这两个函数的比值，x ^ 10 1 和 x ^2 1。我取了它们的导数，这就是我在这里做的，对吧。我只是对它们进行微分，然后取了比值。这比商法则简单得多，与商法则完全不同。不要考虑商法则。不要考虑商法则。所以我们分别对分子和分母进行微分。

Namely, I took the ratio of these functions, x ^ 10 1 and x ^2 1. I took their derivatives, which is what I did right here, right. I just differentiated them and I took the ratio. This is way easier than the quotient rule, and is nothing like the quotient rule. Don’t think quotient rule. Don’t think quotient rule. So we differentiate the numerator and denominator separately.

然后我取 x 趋近于 1 时的极限，结果为 5。这就是我在这里所说的。我取这些函数，用这个导数比率替换它们，然后取这里的极限。结果发现，当我对函数进行微分时，它们变得简单多了。我从这个混乱的对象开始，得到了这个更容易计算的对象。

And then I take the limit as x goes to 1 and I get 5. So that’s what I’m claiming over here. I take these functions, I replace them with this ratio of derivatives, and then I take the limit instead, over here. And it turned out that the functions got much simpler when I differentiated them. I started with this messy object and I got this much easier object that I could easily evaluate.

这就是这里发生的大游戏。如果这个极限有意义并且存在，它就会起作用。现在，请注意，我并没有声称 g，即分母，必须非 0。所以这几个例子会对我们有所帮助。所以让我给你举几个例子，然后我们再进一步。现在，这只是版本 1。但首先我们必须了解这个是如何工作的。

So that’s the big game that’s happening here. It works, if this limit makes sense and this limit exists. Now, notice I didn’t claim that g, that the denominator, had to be non 0. So that’s what’s going to help us a little bit in a few examples. So let me give you a couple of examples and then we’ll go further. Now, this is only Version 1. But first we have to understand how this one works.

这是另一个例子。取 x 趋近于 0 时的极限，即 sin 5x / sin 2x。这是我们在课程第一部分讨论过的另一种极限例子。不幸的是，现在我们正在复习。所以这应该会巩固你在那里所做的事情。这将是一个更容易思考的方式。根据洛必达规则，这是步骤。我们将采取这些步骤之一。

So here’s another example. Take the limit as x goes to 0, of sin 5x / sin 2x. This is another kind of example of a limit that we discussed in the first part of the course. Unfortunately, now we’re reviewing stuff. So this should reinforce what you did there. This will be an easier way of thinking about it. So by L’Hopital’s Rule, so here’s the step. We’re going to take one of these steps.

这是当 x 趋近于 1 时，这里导数的极限。所以是 5 cos 5x / 2 cos 2x。那里的极限是 1，但现在是 0。在这种情况下，a 是 0。这是数字 a。谢谢。所以当 x 趋近于 0 时的极限与导数的极限相同。这很容易计算。0 的余弦 = 1，对吧。

This is the limit, as x goes to 1, of the derivatives here. So that’s 5 cos 5x / 2 cos 2x. The limit was 1 over there, but now it’s 0. a is 0 in this case. This is the number a. Thank you. So the limit as x goes to 0 is the same as the limit of the derivatives. And that’s easy to evaluate. Cosine of 0 = 1, right.

这等于 5 (cos (5.0)。这是乘法符号。也许我应该把它写成 0。除以 2 cos 0。但你知道那是 5/2。这就是洛必达方法的工作原理。它非常轻松。我将给你另一个例子，它表明它比我开始使用的方法效果更好一些。

This is equal to 5 (cos (5.0). And that’s a multiplication sign. Maybe I should just write this as 0. Divided by 2 cos 0. But you know that’s 5/2. So this is how L’Hopital’s method works. It’s pretty painless. I’m going to give you another example, which shows that it works a little better than the method that I started out with.

如果我们考虑函数 cos x 1 / x ^2，就会出现这种情况。这有点难处理。同样，这是 x = 0 附近的 0 / 0 之一。当 x 趋向于 0 时，这里会变成不确定形式。现在，根据我们的方法，这相当于，现在我要使用这个小摆动，因为我不想写极限、极限、极限、极限一百万次。

Here’s what happens if we consider the function cos x 1 / x ^2. That was a little harder to deal with. And again, this is one of these 0 / 0 things near x = 0. As x tends to 0, this goes to an indeterminate form here. Now, according to our method, this is equivalent to, now I’m going to use this little wiggle because I don’t want to write limit, limit, limit, limit a million times.

所以我在这里要用一点摆动。所以当 x 趋向于 0 时，它的行为与区分分子和分母相同。所以在分子中，这又是 sin x。在分母中，它将是 2x。现在，请注意，我们还没有获胜。因为这仍然是 0 / 0 类型。

So I’m going to use a little wiggle here. So as x goes to 0, this is going to behave the same way as differentiating numerator and denominator. So again this is going to be sin x in the numerator. In the denominator, it’s going to be 2x. Now, notice that we still haven’t won yet. Because this is still of 0 / 0 type.

当您代入 x = 0 时，您仍然会得到 0。但这不会损害该方法。这不会使该方法失败。这个 0 / 0，我们可以再次应用洛必达法则。当 x 趋向于 0 时，这与再次区分分子和分母是一回事。所以在这里我在分子中得到 cos x，在分母中得到 2。这比区分函数比率要容易得多。

When you plug in x = 0 you still get 0. But that doesn’t damage the method. That doesn’t make the method fail. This 0 / 0, we can apply L’Hopital’s Rule a second time. And as x goes to 0 this is the same thing as, again, differentiating the numerator and denominator. So here I get cos x in the numerator, and I get 2 in the denominator. Again this is way easier than differentiating ratios of functions.

我们只是分别对分子和分母进行微分。现在这就是结局。当 x 趋向于 0 时，这是 cos 0 / 2，也就是 1/2。现在，只有当你最终获胜并得到极限时，这一点才有意义。因为定理说的是，如果其中一个极限存在，那么前一个极限就存在。一旦前一个极限存在，那么前一个极限就存在。

We’re only differentiating the numerator and the denominator separately. And now this is the end. As x goes to 0, this is cos 0 / 2, which is 1/2. Now, the justification for this comes only when you win in the end and get the limit. Because what the theorem says is that if one of these limits exists, then the preceding one exists. And once the preceding one exists, then the one before it exists.

所以，一旦我们知道这个极限存在，就可以反过来算。它适用于前面的极限，然后适用于第一个极限。这里的逻辑结构有点微妙，即如果右侧存在，那么左侧也存在。是的，问题。学生：教授：为什么右侧极限必须存在，难道不是导数必须存在吗？不。分子的导数必须存在。

So once we know that this one exists, that works backwards. It applies to the preceding limit, which then applies to the very first one. And the logical structure here is a little subtle, which is that if the right side exists, then the left side will also exist. Yeah, question. STUDENT: PROFESSOR: Why does the right hand limit have to exist, isn’t it just the derivative that has to exist? No. The derivative of the numerator has to exist.

分母的导数必须存在。这个极限也必须存在。顺便说一句，不必存在的是，我从未说过 f 为 a 的素数必须存在。事实上，这要微妙得多。我并不是说 f ' (a) 存在，因为为了求这个极限，f ' (a) 不必存在。必须发生的是，对于不等于 a 的 x，在附近，这些东西存在。

The derivative of the denominator has to exist. And this limit has to exist. What doesn’t have to exist, by the way, I never said that f prime of a has to exist. In fact, it’s much, much more subtle. I’m not claiming that f ’ (a) exists, because in order to evaluate this limit, f ’ (a) need not exist. What has to happen is that nearby, for x not equal to a, these things exist.

然后极限必须存在。所以没有要求极限存在。事实上，这正是我们在这里评估这些极限时的重点。我们不必在最后评估它。学生：教授：所以你问的问题是，为什么这是定理的假设？换句话说，为什么它有效？嗯，答案是这是一个正确的定理。

And then the limit has to exist. So there’s no requirements that the limits exist. In fact, that’s exactly going to be the point when we evaluate these limits here. Is we don’t have to evaluate it right at the end. STUDENT: PROFESSOR: So the question that you’re asking is, why is this the hypothesis of the theorem? In other words, why does this work? Well, the answer is that this is a theorem that’s true.

如果你放弃这个假设，它就完全是错误的。如果你没有这个假设，你就不能使用这个定理，你会得到错误的答案。我的意思是，很难再进一步表达它了。所以看，在很多情况下，我们会告诉你公式。在很多情况下，当它们是正确的时，它是如此明显，以至于我们不必担心我们说了什么。事实上，这里有一些隐含的东西。

If you drop this hypothesis, it’s totally false. And if you don’t have this hypothesis, you can’t use the theorem and you will get the wrong answer. I mean, it’s hard to express it any further than that. So look, in many cases we tell you formulas. And in many cases it’s so obvious when they’re true that we don’t have to worry about what we say. And indeed, there’s something implicit here.

我说的是，如果我写下这个符号，它就一定意味着这个东西存在。所以这是一个微妙的观点。但我要强调的是，你不需要事先知道这个东西存在。你确实需​​要事先知道这个东西存在。本质上，是的。所以这就是它的发展方向。你不能不让它存在，而仍然让这个陈述为真。好吧，另一个问题。

I’m saying well, you know, if I wrote this symbol down, it must mean that the thing exists. So that’s a subtle point. But what I’m emphasizing is that you don’t need to know in advance that this one exists. You do need to know in advance that one exists. Essentially, yeah. So that’s the direction that it goes. You can’t get away with not having this exist and still have the statement be true. Alright, another question.

谢谢。学生：教授：我有点超前了，但我只想说。在这些情况下，当 x 趋向于 0 和 x 趋向于无穷大时。例如，当 x 趋向于 0 时，对数在 x = 0 时未定义。然而，这个定理适用。我们将能够使用它。在这里，当 x 趋向于无穷大时，这两个
