Well, actually, come to think of it, e^ x, if you like, it’s equal to 0 at infinity. If you want to say that it has a value. But in fact, these expressions don’t necessarily have values. At the ends. And nevertheless, the theorem applies. I mean, it can exist. It’s perfectly OK for it to exist. It’s no problem. It just doesn’t need to exists. It isn’t forced to exist. So here’s a calculation which we just did.

我们对此进行了评估。现在，我想与近似法进行比较。在近似法中，这个示例 2 是正弦函数的示例，我们将使用以下属性。我们将使用 sin u 近似于 u。我们将使用该线性近似。

And we evaluated this. Now, I want to make a comparison with the method of approximation. In the method of approximations, this Example 2, which was the example with the sine function, we would use the following property. We would use sin u is approximately u. We would use that linear approximation.

然后我们得到 sin 5x / sin 2x 近似于 5x / 2x，当然是 5/2。当 u 近似为 0 时，这是正确的，当 x 趋向于 0 时，这当然是正确的，这将是一个有效的极限。

And then what we would have here is that sin 5x / sin 2x is approximately 5x / 2x, which is of course 5/2. And this is true when u is approximately 0, and this is true certainly as x goes to 0, it’s going to be a valid limit.

这与示例 2 非常相似。在示例 3 中，我们设法查看了这个表达式 cos x 1 / x ^2。对于这个表达式，您必须记住 x = 0 附近的余弦函数近似值。那就是 1 x ^2 / 2。这就是近似值，余弦函数的二次近似值。现在，果然，这简化了。

So that’s very similar to Example 2. In Example 3, we managed to look at this expression cos x 1 / x ^2. And for this one, you have to remember the approximation near x = 0 to the cosine function. And that’s 1 x ^2 / 2. So that was the approximation, the quadratic approximation to the cosine function. And now, sure enough, this simplifies.

这变成了 x ^2 / 2 / x ^2，也就是 1/2。所以我们得到了相同的答案，这是件好事。因为这两种方法都是有效的。它们是一致的。你可以看到它们都没有特别长。你可能很难记住这个属性。但事实上，这是你可以很容易推导出来的。而且，事实上，它与余弦的二阶导数有关，就像这里的计算一样。

This becomes x ^2 / 2 / x ^2, which is 1/2. So we get the same answer, which is a good thing. Because both of these methods are valid. They’re consistent. You can see that neither of them is particularly a lot longer. You may have trouble remembering this property. But in fact it’s something that you can easily derive. And, indeed, it’s related to the second derivative of the cosine, as is this calculation here.

它们的数字内容量几乎相同。现在我想向你们解释为什么洛必达法则在某些情况下效果更好。它的真正价值在于处理这些其他更奇特的极限。现在我们要重新执行洛必达法则。我会处理这些函数。但我必须重写它们，但我们就这样做了。所以这是属性。

They’re almost the same amount of numerical content to them. So now what I’d like to do is explain to you why L’Hopital’s Rule works better in some cases. And the real value that it has is in handling these other more exotic limits. So now we’re going to do L’Hopital’s Rule over again. And I’ll handle these functions. But I’ll have to rewrite them, but we’ll just do that. So here’s the property.

f ( x) / g (x) 在 x 趋向于 a 时的极限等于 f ' ( x) / g '(x) 在 x 趋向于 a 时的极限。这就是性质。这也是我们一直使用的性质。非常方便。记住，只要 f ( a) = g (a) = 0，它就是真的。并且右侧存在。

That the limit as x goes to a of f ( x) / g (x) is equal to the limit as x goes to a of f ’ ( x) / g ’(x). That’s the property. And this is what we’ll always be using. Very convenient thing. And remember it was true provided that f ( a) = g (a) = 0. And that the right hand side exists.

但我声称它效果更好，我会删除这些。但我会再次写出它们，向你展示它对这些有效。所以还有其他情况。允许的其他情况是这样的。首先，正如我刚刚删除的内容所示，你可以允许 a 等于正无穷或负无穷。这也是可以的。所以你可以把极限带到宇宙的远端。

But I claim that it works better, and I’ll get rid of these. But I’ll write them again to show you that it works for these. So there are other cases. And the other cases that are allowed are this. First of all, as indicated by what I just erased, you can allow a to be equal to plus or minus infinity. It’s also OK. So you can take the limit going to the far ends of the universe.

左和右都可以。然后你可以做的另一件事是，你可以允许 f (a) 和 g (a) 为正无穷或负无穷。没问题。所以现在，重点是我们不仅可以处理 0 / 0 的情况，还可以处理无穷 / 无穷的情况。这是一个非常强大的工具，与其他情况截然不同。

Both left and right. And then the other thing that you can do is, you can allow f ( a) and g (a) to be plus or minus infinity. Is OK. So now, the point is that we can handle not just the 0 / 0 case, but also the infinity / infinity case. That’s a very powerful tool, and quite different from the other cases.

第三点是，右边不一定非要存在，就普通意义而言。或者，它可以是正无穷或负无穷。这也行得通。这仍然是信息。所以如果我们能看到它去哪里，那我们还是可以的。如果它去到正无穷，如果它去到 0，如果它去到一个有限数，如果它去到负无穷，所有这些都是可以的。

And the third thing is that the right hand side doesn’t really quite have to exist, in the ordinary sense. Or, it could be plus or minus infinity. That’s also OK. That’s still information. So if we can see where it goes, then we’re still good. If it goes to plus infinity, if it goes to 0, if it goes to a finite number, if it goes to minus infinity, all of that will be OK.

如果它剧烈振荡，我们就会迷失方向。我们永远不会遇到这些计算。所以这基本上处理了你可能希望的一切。这是一个非常方便的过程。那么让我来举几个例子。让我们看看，我想我想要做的第一个例子是 x ln x。那么我们要做什么例子呢？例子 3，例子 4 即将出现。

It just if it oscillates wildly that we’ll be lost. And those calculations we’ll never encounter. So this basically handles everything that you could possibly hope for. And it’s a very convenient process. So let me carry out a few examples. And, let’s see, I guess the first one that I wanted to do was x ln x. So what example are we up to. Example 3, so Example 4 is coming up.

例 4，这是我在讲座开始时写的一个，x ln x。这是我们的家庭作业问题。在某些计算的极限中。但是这个，你必须先看看它，想想它在做什么。它是一种不确定的形式，但它看起来有点不对劲。那么为什么它是不确定的形式呢？

Example 4, this is one of the ones that I wrote at the beginning of the lecture, x ln x. This one was on our homework problem. In the limits of some calculation. But so this one, you have to look at it first to think about what it’s doing. It’s an indeterminate form, but it sort of looks like it’s the wrong type. So why is it in an indeterminate form.

这个趋向于 0，这个趋向于负无穷。所以，对不起，这是一个乘积。它是 0 乘以负无穷。所以这是一个不确定的形式，因为我们不知道是 0 获胜还是无穷获胜。这个可能会越来越小，这个可能会越来越大。乘积可能是介于两者之间的任何值。我们只是不知道。

This one goes to 0, and this one goes to minus infinity. So, excuse me, this is a product. It’s 0 times minus infinity. So that’s an indeterminate form, because we don’t know whether the 0 wins or the infinity this could keep getting smaller and smaller and smaller, and this could be getting bigger and bigger. The product could be anything in between. We just don’t know.

所以第一步是把它写成事物的比率，而不是事物的乘积。事实证明，这样做的方法是使用对数作为分子，1 / x 作为分母。所以这是我在这里做出的选择。现在，我刚刚将它转换为负无穷除以无穷类型的极限。

So the first step is to write this as a ratio of things, rather than a product of things. And it turns out that the way to do that is to use the logarithm in the numerator, and the 1 / x in the denominator. So this is a choice that I’m making here. Now, I’ve just converted it to a limit of the type minus infinity divided by infinity.

因为当 x 趋向于 0 时，分子趋向于负无穷，而分母 1/x 趋向于正无穷。同样，这是一场竞赛，但现在这是洛必达规则适用的形式之一。现在我要应用洛必达规则。它说的是我在这里求导。所以我只需求分子和分母的导数。应用洛必达规则很容易。你只需求导，求导。

Because the numerator is going to minus infinity as x goes to 0 plus and the denominator 1 / x is going to plus infinity. Again, there’s a competitions, but now it’s one of the forms to which L’Hopital’s Rule applies. Now I’m just going to apply L’Hopital’s Rule. And what it says is that I differentiate here. So I just differentiate a numerator and denominator. Applying L’Hopital’s Rule is a breeze. You just differentiate, differentiate.

现在它简化了，我们就完成了。这是 x 趋向 0 的极限，加上 x^2 的抵消。这和 x 是一样的。x 因子抵消。所以是 0。答案是 0。所以 x 趋向 0 的速度比 ln n 趋向负无穷大的速度要快。这个 0 是赢家。你无法提前预测到这一点。所以让我们来做我写下的另外两个例子。

And now it just simplifies and we’re done. This is the limit as x goes to 0 plus of, well, the x^2’s cancel. This is the same as just x. x factors cancel. And so that’s 0. The answer is that it’s 0. So x goes to 0 faster then ln n goes to minus infinity. This 0 was the winner. Something you can’t necessarily predict in advance. So let’s do the other two examples that I wrote down.

我将更笼统地介绍它们，因为它们是下一节中你需要了解的最基本的速率属性。下一节是非真积分。而且它们对于物理数学和任何其他类型的东西都非常重要。所以在这里，我们先做这些。让我们看看，我想先做哪一个。

I’m going to do them in slightly more generality, because they’re the most fundamental rate properties that you’re going to need to know for the next section. Which is improper integrals. And also they’re just very important for physical math, and any other kind of thing, basically. So here, let’s just do these. So let’s see, which one do I want to do first.

所以我写下了 xe^2 x 的极限，但我要让它更加通用。我要让它成为任何负幂，其中 p 是某个正常数。现在，这又是函数的乘积，而不是函数的商，而是比率。所以我需要重写它。我要把它写成 x / e ^ p x。

So I wrote down the limit of x e^2 x, but I’m going to make it even more general. I’m going to make it any negative power here, where p is some positive constant. Now again, this is a product of functions, not a quotient, a ratio, of functions. And so I need to rewrite it. I’m going to write it as x / e ^ p x.

现在我要应用，嗯，所以它的形式是无穷大/无穷大。现在它与 x 趋向无穷大时的极限 1/pe^px 相同。那么它会去哪里呢？当 x 趋向无穷大时。现在我们可以决定了。1 保持原样。而当 x 趋向无穷大时，它趋向无穷大。

And now I’m going to apply, well, so it’s of this form infinity / infinity. And now that’s the same as the limit as x goes to infinity of 1 / p e^ px. So where does that go? As x goes to infinity. Now we can decide. The 1 stays where it is. And this, as x goes to infinity, goes to infinity.

所以答案是 0。结论是 x 的增长速度比 e ^ px 慢。当 x 趋于无穷大时。记住，p 当然在这里是正数。它是增加的指数。不是减少的指数。让我们做一个变体。我会用相反的方式。所以我将这个例子称为 5 '。它实际上并没有给我们提供更多信息，但它给你提供了更多的练习。

So the answer is 0. And the conclusion is that x grows more slowly then e ^ px. As x goes to infinity. Remember, p is positive here, of course. It’s the increasing exponentials. Not the decreasing ones. Let’s do a variant of this. I’ll do it the opposite way. So I’m going to call this example 5 ’. It really doesn’t give us any more information, but it gives you just a little bit more practice.

所以，假设我从另一个角度看待问题。e^px 除以 x^100。现在，这又是一个无穷大/无穷大的例子。你可以算出它在做什么。但有两种思考方式。一种是慢速方式，一种是快速方式。慢速方式是将其微分 100 次。是这样的，对吧？一遍又一遍地应用洛必达法则。一直这样。

So suppose I look at things the other way. e^ px divided by, say, x^ 100. Now, this is an infinity / infinity example, again. And you can work out what it’s doing. But there are two ways of thinking about this. There’s the slow way and the fast way. The slow way is to differentiate this 100 times. That is, right? Apply L’Hopital’s Rule over and over and over and over again. All the way.

很明显，你可以这样做，但这有点麻烦。所以这里有一个更聪明的技巧。就是把它改成（当 x 趋于无穷大时 e ^ px / 100 / x 的极限）^ 100。所以如果你这样做，那么我们这里就只需要一个洛必达法则步骤。

It’s clear that you could do it, but it’s kind of a nuisance. So there’s a much cleverer trick here. Which is to change this to (the limit as x goes to infinity of the e ^ px / 100 / x) ^ 100. So if you do that, then we just have one L’Hopital’s Rule step here.

那个是，这和 (x 趋向无穷大，嗯，就是 p / 100 e^ px / 100 / 1) ^ 100 相同。这就是我们的洛必达步骤。当然，那是 (无穷大 / 1 ) ^ 100。也就是无穷大。现在，我再次以略有不同的方式向您展示它也适用于无穷大。所以这是另一种情况。

And that one is that this is the same as (x goes to infinity of, well it’s p / 100 e^ p x / 100 / 1) ^ 100. That’s our L’Hopital’s step. And of course, that’s (infinity / 1 ) ^ 100. Which is infinity. Now, again I did this in a slightly different way to show you that it works with infinity as well. So that was this other case.

右侧可以存在，也可以是正无穷或负无穷。这适用于此极限。因此，适用于原始极限。这里的结论是 e ^ px，p > 0，比 x 的任何幂增长得更快。我选择了 x ^ 100，但显然我选择什么幂并不重要。指数胜过所有幂。

The right hand side can exist, or it can be plus or minus infinity. And that applies to this limit. And therefore, to the original limit. And the conclusion here is that e ^ px, p > 0, grows faster than any power of x. I picked x ^ 100, but obviously it didn’t matter what power I picked. The exponents beat all the powers.

因此，我们还需要处理我在开始时给出的问题。那就是对数。以及它在无穷大处的行为。因此，我也将对它进行一些改动。因此，我们有示例 6，即 ln x，而不是除以 x，我要除以 x^ 1/3。我可以除以 x 的任何正幂，我们只在这里做这个示例。

So we have one more of the ones that I gave at the beginning to take care of. And that one is the logarithm. And its behavior at infinity. So I’ll do a slightly variant on that one, too. So we have Example 6, which is ln x, and instead of dividing by x, I’m going to divide by x^ 1/3. I could divide by any positive power of x, we’ll just do this example here.

所以现在，当 x 趋向无穷大时，其形式为无穷大 / 无穷大。因此，这相当于我分别微分分子和分母时所发生的情况。这就是 1 / x，这里我有 1/3 x ^ 2/3.1 / x，然后是 1/3 x^ 2/3。现在，当尘埃落定，你得到正确的指数时，我们有一个 x^ 1，这是一个 x ^ + 2/3，而 1/3 变成了 3。所以这就是它。这等于 3x ^ 1/3。我们可以确定。它趋向于 0。当 x 趋向无穷大时。

So now this, as x goes to infinity, is of the form infinity / infinity. And so it’s equivalent to what happens when I differentiate numerator and denominator separately. And that’s 1 / x, and here I have 1/3 x ^ 2/3.1 / x, and then 1/3 x^ 2/3. Now, when the dust settles here and you get your exponents right, we have an x^ 1, and this is an x ^ + 2/3, and that’s a 1/3 becomes a 3. So this is what it is. And that’s equal to 3x ^ 1/3. Which we can decide. It goes to 0. As x goes to infinity.

因此结论是，当 x 趋于无穷大时，ln x 的增长速度比 x ^ 1/3 或 x 的任何正幂都要慢。因此，任何 x ^ p，p 为正，都可以。因此，ln 趋于无穷大时真的很慢。它非常非常渐进。是的，问题。学生：教授：问题是，这里需要多少个假设？

And so the conclusion is that ln x grows more slowly as x goes to infinity, than x ^ 1/3 or any positive power of x. So any x ^ p, p positive, will work. So ln is really slow, going to infinity. It’s very, very gradual. Yeah, question. STUDENT: PROFESSOR:. The question is, how many hypotheses do you need here?

所以我这么说，我想你问的是，如果我有这个假设，我也可以有这个假设吗？没关系。我可以将这个假设与这个假设结合起来。我需要一些关于 f (a) 和 g (a) 的信息。我不能对 f(a) 和 g(a) 不做任何假设。换句话说，我必须面对无穷大/无穷大，或者 0/0 的情况。让我们看看。

So I said that, and I think what you were asking is, if I have this hypothesis, can I also have this hypothesis. That’s OK. I can have this hypothesis combined with this one. I need something about f (a) and g ( a). I can’t assume nothing about f(a) and g(a). So in other words, I have to be faced with either an infinity / infinity, or a 0 / 0 situation. So let’s see.

规则适用于 0 / 0 或无穷大 / 无穷大的情况。这是唯一适用的两种情况。a 可以是任何数。包括无穷大。正无穷大或负无穷大。规则适用于这两种情况。换句话说，这就是 f ( a) / g ( a) 的结果。两者之一。事实上，它可以是正数或负数。学生：教授：右边必须是某个数。

A rule applies in the 0 / 0, or infinity / infinity case. These are the only two cases that it applies in. And a can be anything. Including infinity. Plus or minus infinity. The rule applies in these two cases. So in other words, this is what f ( a) / g ( a) is. Either one of these. And in fact, it can be plus or minus. STUDENT: PROFESSOR: And the right hand side has to be something.

它必须是有限的，或者是正无穷或负无穷。所以你需要一些东西。你需要一个特定的 a 值，你需要决定它是否是一个不确定的形式。你需要右手极限存在。这并不难实现。因为当你看右手边时，你会想要计算它。所以你想知道它是什么。所以你永远不会在确认这个假设时遇到问题。好吧。

It has to be either finite or plus or minus infinity. So you need something. You need a specific value of a, you need to decide whether it’s an indeterminate form. And you need the right hand limit to exist. It’s not hard to impose this. Because when you look at the right hand side, you’ll want to be calculating it. So you want to know what it is. So you’ll never have problems confirming this hypothesis. Alright.

我再举一个例子。这个例子稍微有点棘手。它涉及到另一个不定式。它将是 0 ^ 0。所以有很多这样的事情你不知道该怎么做。它们以各种不同的方式出现。最简单的例子是当 x 从上方趋向 0 时 x ^ x 的极限。

Let me give you one more example here. Which is just slightly trickier. Which involves, so here’s another indeterminate form. That’s going to be 0 ^ 0. So there are lots of these things where you just don’t know what to do. And they come out in various different ways. The simplest example of this is the limit as x goes to 0 from above of x ^ x.

为了弄清楚这个发生了什么，我们必须使用一个技巧。这个技巧是，这是一个移动指数。因此，使用底数 e 是合适的。这是我们在第一个单元中做过的事情。因此，由于我们有一个移动指数，我们将使用底数 e。每当您有移动指数时，这都是一个不错的底数。

In order to work out what’s happening with this one, we have to use a trick. And the trick is this is a moving exponent. And so it’s appropriate to use base e. This is something that we did way back in the first unit. So, since we have a moving exponent, we’re going to use base e. That’s the good base to use whenever you have a moving exponent.

因此，将其重写为 x^ x = e ^ x ln x。现在，为了弄清楚发生了什么，我们实际上只需要知道指数发生了什么。请记住，实际上我们已经这样做了。但我将再为您做一次。这是 ln x / (1 / x)。

And so rewrite this as x^ x = e ^ x ln x. And now, in order to figure out what’s happening, we really only have to know what’s going on with the exponent. So remember, actually we already did this. But I’m going to do it once more for you. This is ln x / (1 / x).

当 x 趋向于 0 时，这相当于使用洛必达法则将 x 变为 1 / x，这就是 1 / x ^2，也就是 x 趋向于 0。当 x 趋向于 0 时。因此，我们这里的结果是，这个等价于，嗯，它会趋向于我们这里得到的结果。它是 e ^ 0。这个指数就是我们想要的。

And that’s equivalent, as x goes to 0, to using L’Hopital’s Rule to 1 / x, and this is 1 / x ^2, which is x, which goes to 0. As x goes to 0. And so what we have here is that this one is going to be equivalent to, well, it’s going to tend to what we got over here. It’s e ^ 0. That exponent is what we want.

当 x 趋于 0 时。这就是答案 这个极限恰好是 1。考虑到我们掌握的所有力量，这实际上相对容易做到。现在，让我再举一个例子。假设你试图理解 sin x / x ^2 的极限。如果你应用洛必达规则，当 x 趋于 0 时，你会得到 cos x / 2x。

As x goes to 0. So that’s the answer This limit happens to be 1. That’s actually relatively easy to do, given all of the power that we have at our hands. Now, let me give you one more example. Suppose you’re trying to understand the limit of sin x / x ^2. If you apply L’Hopital’s Rule, as x goes to 0, you’re going to get cos x / 2x.

如果你再次应用洛必达法则，当 x 趋向于 0 时，你会得到 sin x / 2。而当 x 趋向于 0 时，这个值也趋向于 0。另一方面，如果你看一下线性近似法，线性近似表示 sin x 在 0 附近近似为 x。所以应该是 x / x ^2。也就是 1 / x，趋向于无穷大。

And if you apply L’Hopital’s Rule again, as x goes to 0, you’re going to get the sin x / 2. And this, as x goes to 0, goes to 0. On the other hand, if you look at the linear approximation method, linear approximation says that sin x is approximately x near 0. So that should be x / x ^2. Which is 1 / x, which goes to infinity.

当 x 趋向于 0 时，至少从一侧开始，到另一侧为负无穷大。所以这里面有些可疑，对吧？所以这很可疑。或者也许这很可疑，我不知道。所以，告诉我这里出了什么问题。是的。学生：教授：好的。所以这个说法是洛必达规则的第二次应用是错误的。这是正确的。这就是你必须小心的地方，洛必达规则。

As x goes to 0, at least from one side, minus infinity to the other side. So there’s something fishy going on here, right? So this is fishy. Or maybe this is fishy, I don’t know. So, tell me what’s wrong here. Yeah. STUDENT: PROFESSOR: OK. So the claim is that the second application of L’Hopital’s Rule, this one, is wrong. And that’s correct. And this is where you have to watch out, with L’Hopital’s Rule.

这正是你需要注意的地方。你必须应用测试。这里是一个不定式。在我应用规则之前，它是 0 / 0。但为了第二次应用规则，它仍然必须是 0 / 0。但这个不是。这个是 1 / 0。它不再是一个不定式。它实际上是无限的。要么是正数，要么是负数，取决于分母的符号。

This is exactly where you have to watch out. You have to apply the test. Here it’s an indeterminate form. It’s 0 / 0 before I applied the rule. But in order to apply the rule the second time, it still has to be 0 / 0. But this one isn’t. This one is 1 / 0. It’s no longer an indeterminate form. It’s actually infinite. Either plus or minus, depending on the sign of the denominator.

这正是这个答案。所以线性近似是安全的。我们只是错误地应用了洛必达法则。所以这个故事的寓意是，在洛必达法则之前要三思。好吧。现在，让我再说一件事。我需要再说一点，抱歉。所以不要把它当作拐杖。

Which is just what this answer is. So the linear approximation is safe. And we just applied L’Hopital’s Rule wrong. So the moral of the story here is look before you L’Hop. Alright. Now, let me say one more thing. I need to pile it on just a little bit, sorry. So don’t use it as a crutch.

我们不想在住院这么久之后变得如此虚弱，以至于无法使用，对不起。所以请记住，你不应该失去理智。如果你有这样的感觉，那么我们就在这里做这个。假设你试图理解当 x 趋于无穷大时这会产生什么影响。现在，你可以使用洛必达法则五次或四次。并在这里得到答案。

We don’t want to just get ourselves so weak, after being in the hospital for all this time, that we can’t use, I’m sorry. So remember that you shouldn’t have lost your senses. If you have something like this, so we’ll do this one here. Suppose you’re trying to understand what this does as x goes to infinity. Now, you could L’Hopital’s Rule five times, or four times. And get the answer here.

但实际上，你应该意识到主要项就在你面前。你可以做一些代数运算来简化它。也就是说，它与 1 + 2 / x + 1 / x^ 5 相同。然后分母，嗯，让我们看看。它是 x。所以这将是分子和分母都除以 1 / x^ 5。

But really, you should realize that the main terms are sitting there right in front of you. And that there’s some algebra that you can do to simplify this. Namely, it’s the same as 1 + 2 / x + 1 / x^ 5. And then in the denominator, well, let’s see. It’s x. So this would be dividing by 1 / x^ 5 in both numerator and denominator.

这里 1 / x + 2 多了，抱歉我多加了。但没关系。这里是 2 / x^ 5。所以如果你愿意的话，这些就是主要项。它与 1 / 1 / x 相同，与 x 相同，并且趋向无穷大。因为 x 趋向无穷大。或者，如果你愿意的话，更简单一点，x ^ 5 / x^ 4 就是主要项。也就是 x。

And here you have 1 / x + 2 over, sorry I overshot. But that’s OK. 2 / x^ 5 here. So these are the main term, if you like. And it’s the same as 1 / 1 / x, which is the same as x, and it goes to infinity. As x goes to infinity. Or, if you like, much more simply, just x ^ 5 / x^ 4 is the main term. Which is x.

它会趋向无穷大。所以做这种事情时不要忘记基本代数。使用这些东西，不要使用洛必达法则。好的，下次见。

Which goes to infinity. So don’t forget your basic algebra when you’re doing this kind of stuff. Use these things and don’t use L’Hopital’s Rule. OK, see you next time.

Lec 36 | MIT 18.01 单变量微积分，2007 年秋季

Lec 36 | MIT 18.01 Single Variable Calculus, Fall 2007

15 年前 (2009 年 9 月 10 日) — 49:27 https://youtube.com/watch?v=KhwQKE_tld0

15 years ago (Sep 10, 2009) — 49:27 https://youtube.com/watch?v=KhwQKE_tld0

以下内容根据 Creative Commons 许可提供。您的支持将帮助 MIT OpenCourseWare 继续免费提供高质量的教育资源。要捐款或查看数百门 MIT 课程的其他材料，请访问 MIT OpenCourseWare，网址为 ocw.mit.edu。教授：今天我们继续学习最后一个单元。第 5 单元，继续。本单元的非正式名称是处理无限。

The following content is provided under a Creative Commons license. Your support will help MIT OpenCourseWare continue to offer high quality educational resources for free. To make a donation, or to view additional materials from hundreds of MIT courses, visit MIT OpenCourseWare at ocw.mit.edu. PROFESSOR: Now, today we are continuing with this last unit. Unit 5, continued. The informal title of this unit is Dealing With Infinity.

这实际上是我们在讨论极限和积分等问题时要加入的额外内容。今天首先，我想给大家回顾一下洛必达法则。为了保持这里的精神，我们只讨论无穷大/无穷大的情况。上次我的说法略有不同，今天我想再说一遍。只是为了明确假设是什么，结论是什么。

That’s really the extra little piece that we’re putting in to our discussions of things like limits and integrals. To start out with today, I’d like to recall for you, L’Hopital’s Rule. And in keeping with the spirit here, we’re just going to do the infinity / infinity case. I stated this a little differently last time, and I want to state it again today. Just to make clear what the hypotheses are and what the conclusion is.

我们首先提出三个假设。其中两个比较明显。这三个假设是 f (x) 趋向于无穷大，g (x) 趋向于无穷大，这就是无穷大/无穷大的情况。最后一个假设是 f ' (x) / g ' (x) 趋向于极限 L。这一切都是因为 x 趋向于某个 a。某个极限 a。

We start out with, really, three hypotheses. Two of them are kind of obvious. The three hypotheses are that f (x) tends to infinity, g ( x) tends to infinity, that’s what it means to be in this infinity / infinity case. And then the last assumption is that f ’ ( x) / g ’ (x), tends to a limit, L. And this is all as x tends to some a. Some limit a.

然后结论是 f(x) / g(x) 也趋向于 L，因为 x 趋向于 a。现在，情况就是这样。所以有三个极限。但想必这些是显而易见的，而这个正是我们要检查的。给了我们这个极限。所以这就是陈述。

And then the conclusion is that f( x) / g ( x) also tends to L, as x goes to a. Now, so that’s the way it is. So it’s three limits. But presumably these are obvious, and this one is exactly what we were going to check anyway. Gives us this one limit. So that’s the statement.

然后这里还有一点有趣的地方，这与处理无穷大的想法一致，那就是 a 等于正无穷或负无穷，L 等于正无穷或负无穷都是可以的。也就是说，数字大写 L、极限大写 L 和数字 a 也可以是无穷大。

And then the other little interesting point here, which is consistent with this idea of dealing with infinity, is that a equals plus or minus infinity and L equals plus or minus infinity are OK. That is, the numbers capital L, the limit capital L and the number a can also be infinite.

现在，在昨天的复习课上，你们应该讨论了一些关于增长率的问题，这些讨论来自我上次在讲座上讲过的内容，也可能来自你们在复习课上进行的一些更详细的讨论。我将介绍一种比较函数的符号。也就是说，我们说 f ( x) 比 g ( x) 小很多。

Now in recitation yesterday, you should have discussed something about rates of growth, which follow from what I said in lecture last time and also maybe from some more detailed discussions that you had in recitation. And I’m going to introduce a notation to compare functions. Namely, we say that f ( x) is a lot less than g ( x).

所以这意味着极限在趋向无穷大时趋向于 0。当 x 趋向无穷大时，这将是。所以这是一个符号，对我们来说是一个新符号。f 比 g 小很多。它只能渐近地读取。只有在 x 趋向无穷大的极限中才会发生这种情况。在这里，我总是隐含地假设它们是正量。f 和 g 是正数。

So this means that the limit, as it goes to infinity, this tends to 0. As x goes to infinity, this would be. So this is a notation, a new notation for us. f is a lot less than g. And it’s meant to be read only asymptotically. It’s only in the limit as x goes to infinity that this happens. And implicitly here, I’m always assuming that these are positive quantities. f and g are positive.

你在复习中看到的是，你可以对我们知道的所有标准函数进行系统比较。例如，ln 函数趋向无穷大。但比 x 的幂慢得多。比 e^x 慢得多。比 e ^ x ^2 慢得多。所以这个函数很慢。这个函数中等。这个函数很快。这个函数非常快。

What you saw in recitation was that you can make a systematic comparison of all the standard functions that we know about. For example, the ln function goes to infinity. But a lot more slowly than x to a power. A lot more slowly then e^ x. A lot more slowly than, say, e ^ x ^2. So this one is slow. This one is moderate. And this one is fast. And this one is very fast.

趋向无穷大。趋向无穷大，当然这是因为 x 趋向无穷大。它们都趋向无穷大，但速度却大不相同。与此类似，今天我们要讨论的是衰减率，它或多或少与增长率相反。

Going to infinity. Tends to infinity, and this is of course as x goes to infinity. All of them go to infinity, but at quite different rates. And, analogous to this, and today we’re going to be doing this, needing to do this quite a bit, is rates of decay, which are more or less the opposite of rates of growth.

因此，衰减率是事物趋向于 0 的速率。因此，衰减率，为此，我将取这些数字的倒数。因此，1 / ln x 趋向于 0。但速度相当慢。它比 1 / x ^ p 大得多。哦，我没有提到这个指数 p 应该是正数。这是我不言而喻的惯例。我应该告诉你的。

So rates of decay are rates at which things tend to 0. So the rate of decay, and for that I’m just going to take reciprocals of these numbers. So 1 / ln x tends to 0. But rather slowly. It’s much bigger than 1 / x ^ p. Oh, I didn’t mention that this exponent p is meant to be positive. That’s a convention that I’m using without saying. I should’ve told you that.

想想看，x ^ 1/2、x ^ 1、x ^ 2，它们都处于这种中等中间范围内。然后，它们依次趋向于 0，但比 1 / e ^ x（也称为 e^ x）慢得多。然后，这个家伙以令人难以置信的速度趋向于 0。e ^ x ^ 2 消失得非常非常快。所以这是对洛必达规则的回顾。

So think x ^ 1/2, x ^ 1, x ^2, they’re all in this sort of moderate intermediate range. And then that, in turn, goes to 0 but much more slowly then 1 / e ^ x, also known as e^ x. And that, in turn, this guy here goes to 0 incredibly fast. e ^ x ^2 vanishes really, really fast. So this is a review of the L’Hopital’s Rule.

我们上次讲过，它的应用就是增长率，告诉我们这些增长率是多少。今天，我想谈谈不定积分。不定积分，我们在练习中已经见过一两个了。我们简要地提到了它们。我现在要更仔细、更系统地讲解它们。

What we said last time, and the application of it, which is to rates of growth and tells us what these rates of growth are. Today, I want to talk about improper integrals. And improper integrals, we’ve already really seen one or two of them on your exercises. And we mention them a little bit, briefly. I’m just going to go through them more carefully and more systematically now.

我们想要知道这些衰减率到底是怎么回事，以及它们与不定积分的关系。所以我需要你了解像这样的函数范围，当 x 趋于无穷大时，哪些函数适合积分。好吧，让我们从定义开始。

And we want to get just exactly what’s going on with these rates of decay and their relationship with improper integrals. So I need for you to understand on the spectrum of the range of functions like this, which ones are suitable for integration as x goes to infinity. Well, let’s start out with the definition.

根据定义，f(x) dx 从 a 到无穷大的积分是当 n 趋向无穷大时，普通定积分的极限，直到某个固定的有限水平。这就是定义。我们在这里使用了一个词，即我们所说的积分，这是它的术语，如果极限存在，则收敛。如果不存在，则发散。好吧，这些是今天的关键词。

The integral from a to infinity of f(x) dx is, by definition the limit as n goes to infinity of the ordinary definite integral up to some fixed, finite level. That’s the definition. And there’s a word that we use here, which is that we say the integral, so this is terminology for it, converges if the limit exists. And diverges if not. Well, these are the key words for today.

这就是我们要解决的问题。即极限是否存在。换句话说，积分是收敛还是发散。这些概念有一个几何类比，你应该始终在脑海中同时考虑它。我将绘制一个函数图，它从 a 开始。也许它会像这样下降。这是对它的几何解释。

So here’s the issue that we’re going to be addressing. Which is whether the limit exists or not. In other words, whether the integral converges or diverges. These notions have a geometric analog, which you should always be thinking of at the same time in the back of your head. I’ll draw a picture of the function Here it’s starting out at a. And maybe it’s going down like this. And it’s interpreting it geometrically.

这只有在 f 为正时才有效。那么收敛的情况就是面积有限的情况。因此，在这条曲线下，总面积是有限的。另一种情况是总面积是无限的。我认为这两种情况都是可能的。虽然这件事会永远持续下去，但如果你在一个阶段 n 停止它，那么它当然是一个有限的数字。

This would only work if f is positive. Then the convergent case is the case where the area is finite. So the total area is finite under this curve. And the other case is the total area is infinite. I claim that both of these things are possible. Although this thing goes on forever, if you stop it at one stage, n, then of course it’s a finite number.

但随着你越走越远，面积也越来越大。有两种可能。要么当你一直走到无穷大时，你得到的总数加起来是一个有限的总数。要么，也许有无限大。例如，如果它是一条穿过的直线，那么下面的面积显然是无限大的。所以我们需要做一堆例子。

But as you go further and further and further, there’s more and more and more area. And there are two possibilities. Either as you go all the way out here to infinity, the total that you get adds up to a finite total. Or else, maybe there’s infinitely much. For instance, if it’s a straight line going across, there’s clearly infinitely much area underneath. So we need to do a bunch of examples.

这确实是我们今天的主要工作，确保我们确切地知道在所有情况下会发生什么。第一个例子是 e^kxdx 从 0 到无穷大的积分。其中 k 是某个正数。某个正常数。这是迄今为止最基本的定积分。不正确的积分。

And that’s really our main job for the day, and to make sure that we know exactly what to expect in all cases. The first example is the integral from 0 to infinity of e^ kx dx. Where k is going to be some positive number. Some positive constant. This is the most fundamental, by far, of the definite integrals. Improper integrals.

为了处理这个问题，我需要做的是检查从 0 到 n 的积分。e ^ kx dx。由于这是一个容易计算的积分，所以我们就这么做。它是 1 / ke ^ kx，这是反导数。在 0 和 n 处求值。如果我代入这些值，那就是 1 / k，e^ k N。

And in order to handle this, the thing that I need to do is to check the integral from 0 up to n. e ^ kx dx. And since this is an easy integral to evaluate, we’re going to do it. It’s 1 / k e ^ kx, that’s the antiderivative. Evaluated at 0 and n. And that, if I plug in these values, is 1 / k, e^ k N.

减去，如果我在 0 处求值，我会得到 (1/k) e^0。这就是答案。现在我们必须考虑当 n 趋于无穷时会发生什么。因此，当 n 趋于无穷时，第二项保持不变。但第一项是 e 的某个负次方。指数越来越大。这是因为 k 在这里是正数。你一定要注意。

Minus, and if I evaluate it at 0, I get a ( 1 / k) e^ 0. So there’s the answer. And now we have to think about what happens as n goes to infinity. So as n goes to infinity, what’s happening is the second term here stays unchanged. But the first term is e to some negative power. And the exponent is getting larger and larger. That’s because k is positive here. You’ve definitely got to pay attention.

尽管我在这里用一般变量来做这件事，但你也必须注意事物的迹象。否则你总是会得到错误的答案。所以你必须非常仔细地观察。所以，如果你愿意的话，这就是极限中的 e ^ 减去无穷大，也就是 0。所以在极限中，这个东西趋向于 0。这个东西正好等于 1 / k。

Even though I’m doing this with general variables here, you’ve got to pay attention to signs of things. Because otherwise you’ll always get the wrong answer. So you have to pay very close attention here. So this is, if you like, e ^ minus infinity in the limit, which is 0. And so in the limit, this thing tends to 0. And this thing is just equal to 1 / k.

总而言之，答案是 1 / k 就是这样。现在我们要稍微简化一下。每次做这个题时，你都必须经历这个思考过程。但一段时间后，你也会变得足够熟练，可以让它变得不那么混乱。所以让我给你展示一下这个相同计算的简写。也就是说，我把 0 写成无穷大 e ^ kx dx。

And so all told, the answer is 1 / k And that’s it. Now we’re going to abbreviate this a little bit. This thought process, you’re going to have to go through every single time you do this. But after a while you also get good enough at it that you can make it a little bit less cluttered. So let me show you a shorthand for this same calculation. Namely, I write 0 to infinity e ^ kx dx.

这等于 1 / ke ^ kx 0 到无穷大。这很可爱。但是还不够小。所以，我们来了。我们有和以前一样的计算。但现在我们在心里想，这个无穷大是一个非常非常大的数字。我们要把它代入。你可以在脑子里做这件事，也可以不做。你说 1 / ke^无穷大。

And that’s equal to 1 / k e ^ kx 0 to infinity. That was cute. Not small enough, however. So, here we are. We have the same calculation as we had before. But now we’re thinking, really, in our minds that this infinity is some very, very enormous number. And we’re going to plug it in. And you can either do this in your head or not. You say 1 / k e^ infinity.

这里我利用了 k 为正数这一事实。因为 e ^ k 乘以一个大数等于负无穷大。然后这里 + 1 / k ( 1 / k )。让我按照之前的方式写出来。这等于 0 + 1 / k，这就是我们想要的。所以这是相同的计算，只是稍微简化了。是的。问题。学生：教授：好问题。

Here’s where I’ve used the fact that k is positive. Because e ^ k times a large number is minus infinity. And then here + 1 / k ( 1 / k). Let me write it the same way I did before. And that’s just equal to 0 + 1 / k, which is what we want. So this is the same calculation, just slightly abbreviated. Yeah. Question. STUDENT: PROFESSOR: Good question.

问题是，当极限是无穷大时，情况又会怎样？我在这里区分了存在的事物和它的极限是无穷大。每当我讨论极限时，我都会说有限极限，或者在这种情况下，它适用于无限极限。换句话说，当我说存在时，我的意思是存在并且是有限的。

The question is, what about the case when the limit is infinity? I’m distinguishing between something existing and its limit being infinity here. Whenever I make a discussion of limits, I say a finite limit, or in this case, it works for infinite limits. So in other words, when I say exists, I mean exists and is finite.

所以在这里，当我说它收敛并且极限存在时，我的意思是它是一个有限的数字。所以这确实是我在这里说的。总面积是有限的。同样，在这里。不过，我可能会补充说，这个主题还有另一部分。我完全跳过了。这有点微妙。即以下内容。如果 f 改变符号，可能会出现一些抵消和振荡。

So here, when I say that it converges and I say the limit exists, what I mean is that it’s a finite number. And so that’s indeed what I said here. The total area is finite. And, similarly, over here. I might add, however, that there is another part of this subject. Which I’m skipping entirely. Which is a little bit subtle. Which is the following. If f changes sign, there can be some cancellation and oscillation.

然后有时极限存在，但如果你把它全部算成正数，总面积实际上仍然是无限的。我们要避免这种情况。我们只处理这些正数的情况。所以现在不用担心这个。这是下一层复杂性，我们不会在本课中讨论。另一个问题。学生：教授：问题是，这在测试中可以吗？答案是，绝对可以。

And then sometimes the limit exists, but the total area, if you counted it all positively, is actually still infinite. And we’re going to avoid that case. We’re we’re just going to treat these positive cases. So don’t worry about that for now. That’s the next layer of complexity which we’re not addressing in this class. Another question. STUDENT: PROFESSOR:. The question is, would this be OK on tests. The answer is, absolutely yes.

我想鼓励你这样做。如果你能正确思考的话。微妙的一点是，你必须正确地插入无穷大。也就是说，你必须意识到这只有在 k 为正时才有效。这是你插入无穷大的步骤。我让你把这个无穷大作为端点值放在这里。所以事实上这正是主题。这里的主题是处理无穷大。

I want to encourage you to do this. If you can think about it correctly. The subtle point is just, you have to plug in infinity correctly. Namely, you have to realize that this only works if k is positive. This is the step where you’re plugging in infinity. And I’m letting you put this infinity up here as an endpoint value. So in fact that’s exactly the theme. The theme is dealing with infinity here.

我希望你们能够处理这个问题。这是我的目标。 学生： 教授：好的，那么另一个问题是，让我们确定一下，当极限存在时，我说它必须是有限的。这意味着它是有限的，而不是无限的。极限可以是 0。也可以是 1。它可以是任何东西。不一定是正数。其他问题。所以我们有了第一个例子。

And I want you to be able to deal with it. That’s my goal. STUDENT: PROFESSOR: OK, so another question is, so let’s be sure here when the limit exists, I say it has to be finite. That means it’s finite, not infinite. The limit can be 0. It can also be 1. It can be anything. Doesn’t have to be a positive number. Other questions. So we’ve had our first example.

现在我只想在这里添加一个物理解释。这是示例 1，如果你愿意的话。请记住，这是你的问题集上的内容。我们讨论了概率，或者说数量，如果你愿意的话，某种放射性物质中衰变的平均粒子数。比如说，在 0 到某个大写 T 之间的时间内。

And now I just want to add one physical interpretation here. This is Example 1, if you like. And this is something that was on your problem set, remember. That we talked about the probability, or the number, if you like, the number of particles on average that decay in some radioactive substance. Say, in time between 0 and some capital T.

然后，这就是这个积分，从 0 到大写 T，某个总量乘以这里​​的积分。这是人们得到的典型放射性衰变数。现在，在极限下，这是粒子数。如果物质是放射性的，那么在极限下，我们得到这个。它等于粒子总数。这对于规范化和理解非常重要。

And then that would be this integral, 0 to capital T, some total quantity times this integral here. This is the typical kind of radioactive decay number that one gets. Now, in the limit, so this is some number of particles. If the substance is radioactive, then in the limit, we have this. Which is equal to the total number of particles. And that’s something that’s going to be important for normalizing and understanding.

整个物质的量是多少，我们有多少摩尔的这种物质。它是什么。所以这是一个将要出现的数字。现在，我要强调的是，T 趋于无穷大的概念只是一种理想化。我们并不真的相信我们会永远等待这种物质衰变。然而，作为理论家，我们记下了这个数量。我们一直在使用它。

How much does the whole substance, how many moles do we have of this stuff. What is it. And so this is a number that is going to come up. Now, I emphasize that this notion of T going to infinity is just an idealization. We don’t really believe that we’re going to wait forever for this substance to decay. Nevertheless, as theorists, we write down this quantity. And we use it. All the time.

此外，还有其他很好的理由使用它，以及为什么物理学家立即接受它。尽管让时间流逝到很远很远的未来在物理上并不完全现实。原因是，如果你注意到这里的答案，看看这个数字 1 / k 比我在中间阶段得到的数字简单得多。这些都是丑陋的，极限很简单。

Furthermore, there’s other good reasons for using it, and why physicists accept it immediately. Even though it’s not really completely physically realistic ever to let time go very, very far into the future. And the reason is, if you notice this answer here, look at how much simpler this number is, 1 / k, than the numbers that I got in the intermediate stages here. These are all ugly, the limits are simple.

这是我整个学期都在强调的主题。也就是说，无穷小，也就是你做微分时得到的东西，是比较简单的公式。代数公式，也就是在达到极限的过程中得到的东西，是难解的公式。这些是简单的，这些是困难的。所以事实上，无穷大基本上比任何有限数都容易。

And this is a theme that I’ve been trying to emphasize all semester. Namely, that the infinitesimal, the things that you get when you do differentiation, are the easier formulas. The algebraic ones, the things in the process of getting to the limit, are the ugly ones. These are the easy ones, these are the hard ones. So in fact, infinity is basically easier than any finite number.

很多有吸引力的公式都来自这些计算。另一个问题。学生：教授：问题是，答案不应该是 a 吗？好吧，答案是 a / k。这意味着当你设置你的算法，并将其建模为粒子集合时。所以你说它应该是 a。但那是因为你做了一个假设。那就是 a 是粒子的总数。

And a lot of appealing formulas come from those kinds of calculations. Another question. STUDENT: PROFESSOR:. The question is, shouldn’t the answer be a? Well, the answer turns out to be a / k. Which means that when you set up your arithmetic, and you model this to a collection of particles. So you said it should be a. But that’s because you made an assumption. Which was that a was the total number of particles.

但这是错误的，对吧？这是粒子的总数。因此，如果你想要设置它，你需要设置这个数字，使它成为粒子的总数。这就是你建立模型的方式，你做所有的计算，然后你会看到它的结果。这就是为什么你需要做这种计算。好的，所以。

But that’s just false, right? This is the total number of particles. So therefore, if you want to set it up, you want set up so that this number’s the total number of particles. And that’s how you set up a model is, you do all the calculations and you see what it’s coming out to be. And that’s why you need to do this kind of calculation. OK, so.

最重要的是，你不应该对模型做出假设。你必须遵循计算结果。它们不会撒谎。好的，现在。我们进行了计算。还有一个例子，我们在课堂上早些时候讨论过。我只是想再提一下。它可能是除此以外最著名的例子。即 e^ x ^2 dx 从负无穷到无穷的积分。令人惊讶的是，它可以被求值。

The main thing is, you shouldn’t make assumptions about models. You have to follow what the calculations tell you. They’re not lying. OK, so now. We carried this out. There’s one other example which we talked about earlier in the class. And I just wanted to mention it again. It’s probably the most famous after this one. Namely, the integral from minus infinity to infinity of e^ x ^2 dx. Which turns out, amazingly, to be able to be evaluated.

结果是π的平方根。所以这个也很棒。这个常数可以让你计算概率中的各种事物。所以这是概率中的关键数字。它基本上是理解标准差等事物以及概率学科中任何其他事物的关键。

It turns out to be the square root of pi. So this one is also great. This is the constant which allows you to compute all kinds of things in probability. So this is a key number in probability. It basically is the key to understanding things like standard deviation and basically any other thing in the subject of probability.

这也是推动这些民意调查的原因，这些民意调查以 4% 的准确率告诉你人们会这样或那样投票。因此，为了解释所有这些事情，你需要知道这个数字。这个数字直到 18 世纪左右才由一些人用数字计算出来，实际上，这个人名叫 de Moivre，他向经营彩票的各种皇室成员提供服务。

It’s also what’s driving these polls that tell you within 4% accuracy we know that people are going to vote this way or that. So in order to interpret all of those kinds of things, you need to know this number. And this number was only calculated numerically starting in the 1700s or so by people who, actually, by one guy whose name was de Moivre, who was selling his services to various royalty who were running lotteries.

那时他们也经营彩票。他能告诉他们各种游戏的获胜概率。他算出了这个数字。他意识到这就是规律。虽然他不知道这是π的平方根，但他知道得足够准确，他能告诉他们彩票能赚多少钱的正确答案。当然，我们现在也这样做。

In those days they ran lotteries, too. And he was able to tell them what the chances were of the various games. And he worked out this number. He realized that this was the pattern. Although he didn’t know that it was the square root of pi, he knew it to sufficient accuracy that he could tell them the correct answer to how much money their lotteries would make. And of course we do this nowadays, too.

以各种方式。包括稍微合法一点的保险业。现在，我将再举几个例子。其他例子更接近无限和有限之间的界限。这是收敛和发散之间的区别。让我再说一句，为什么我们关心这个非常大的问题，即某物是有限的还是无限的。

In all kinds of ways. Including slightly more legit businesses like insurance. So now, I’m going to give you some more examples. And and the other examples are much more close to the edge between infinite and finite. This distinction between convergence and divergence. And let me just, maybe I’ll say one more word about why we care about this very gross issue of whether something is finite or infinite.

当你谈论类似这里的正态曲线时，有一个问题，那就是你必须走多远才能忽略其余部分。所以我们要忽略这里所谓的尾部。你想知道这是否可以忽略。你想知道它有多小。

When you’re talking about something like this normal curve here, there’s an issue of how far out you have to go before you can ignore the rest. So we’re going to ignore what’s called the tail here. Somehow you want to know that this is negligible. And you want to know how negligible it is.

数学家的工作就是知道你必须考虑哪些有限区域，以及你要仔细计算哪个有限区域。然后，你必须通过一些理论推理来处理其余的问题。你必须知道这些尾部足够小，以至于它们对你的有限计算无关紧要。因此，我们非常关心尾部。

And this is the job of a mathematician, is to know what finite region you have to consider and which one you’re going to carefully calculate numerically. And then the rest, you’re going to have to take care of by some theoretical reasoning. You’re going to have to know that these tails are small enough that they don’t matter in your finite calculation. And so, we care very much about the tails.

因为这是机器唯一不会告诉我们的事情。所以这是我们必须知道的部分。这些尾部也是金融数学中经常讨论的问题。他们非常担心肥尾。也就是说，不太可能发生的事件有时会发生。他们经常因此而受苦。就像他们最近的抵押贷款丑闻一样。

Because they’re the only thing that the machine won’t tell us. So that’s the part that we have to know. And these tails are also something which are discussed all the time in financial mathematics. They’re very worried about fat tails. That is, unlikely events that nevertheless happen sometimes. And they get burned fairly regularly with them. As they have recently, with the mortgage scandal.

所以，这些事情非常严肃，他们确实花了很多时间。当然，除了数学之外，还有很多其他实际问题。但你也必须把数学搞好。所以我们现在要讨论这些肥尾的一些边缘情况。它们要有多肥才会变得无限大并压倒中心凸起。所以我们先讨论一下这个问题。

So, these things are pretty serious and they really are spending a lot of time on them. Of course, there are lots of other practical issues besides just the mathematics. But you’ve got to get the math right, too. So we’re going to now talk about some borderline cases for these fat tails. Just how fat do they have to be before they become infinite and overwhelm the central bump. So we’ll save this for just a second.

我在这里要讨论的是边界情况，我将集中讨论这个中等速率，即 x 的幂。这是我们的下一个例子。我想我们将其称为示例 3。它是从 1 到无穷大的积分 dx / x。这就是幂 p = 1。这原来是一个边界情况。所以值得仔细执行。现在，我将再次采用较慢的方法来执行。

And what I’m saving up here is the borderline case, which I’m going to concentrate on, which is this moderate rate, which is x to powers. Here’s our next example. I guess we’ll call this Example 3. It’s the integral from 1 to infinity dx / x. That’s the power p = 1. And this turns out to be a borderline case. So it’s worth carrying out carefully. Now, again I’m going to do it by the slower method.

而不是使用简写方法。但最终，如果你愿意，你可以用简写方法来完成。我把它分解成一个积分，这个积分的最大值是某个大数 n。我发现它的对数函数是不定积分。所以我得到的是 ln n ln 1，也就是 0。所以这只是 log n。无论如何，当 n 趋向无穷大时，它趋向无穷大。

Rather than the shorthand method. But ultimately, you can do it by the short method if you’d like. I break it up into an integral that goes up to some large number, n. I see that its logarithm function is the antiderivative. And so what I get is ln n ln 1, which is just 0. So this is just log n. In any case, it tends to infinity as n goes to infinity.

因此结论是，由于极限是无限的，所以这个东西会发散。现在，我要系统地对所有 p 幂进行计算，看看会发生什么。我会看看积分。抱歉，我必须从 1 开始。从 1 到无穷大，dx / x ^p，看看这些会发生什么。当我进行这个计算时，你会看到 p = 1 是一条边界。

So the conclusion is, since the limit is infinite, that this thing diverges. Now, I’m going to do this systematically now with all powers p, to see what happens. I’ll look at the integral. Sorry, I’m going to have to start at 1 here. From 1 to infinity, dx / x ^p, and see what happens with these. And you’ll see that p = 1 is a borderline when I do this calculation.

这次我要用一种困难的方式进行计算。但现在你必须思考并注意看我在做什么。首先，我要取反导数。这是 x ^ p，所以是 p + 1 / p + 1。这是函数 1 / x ^ p 的反导数。然后我必须在 1 和无穷大处求值。所以现在，我把它写下来。

This time I’m going to do the calculation the hard way. But now you’re going to have to think and pay attention to see what it is that I’m doing. First of all, I’m going to take the antiderivative. And this is x ^ p, so it’s p + 1 / p + 1. That’s the antiderivative of the function 1 / x ^ p. And then I have to evaluate that at 1 and infinity. So now, I’ll write this down.

但在这里我要特别小心。我会把它写下来。它是 p + 1 / p + 1 的无穷大，所以我在这里代入 1。所以我得到 1 / p + 1。这就是我得到的。同样，你应该想到的是，这个幂是一个非常大的数字。现在，有两种情况。有两种情况。

But I’m going to be particularly careful here. I’ll write it down. It’s infinity to the p + 1 / p + 1 , so I plug in 1 here. So I get 1 / p + 1. So this is what I’m getting. Again, what you should be thinking here is this is a very large number to this power. Now, there are two cases. There are two cases.

它们恰好在 p = 1 处分裂。当 p = 1 时，这个数字为 0。这个指数为 0，实际上这个表达式没有任何意义，因为分母也是 0。但对于所有其他值，分母是有意义的。但实际情况是，当这个指数的正幂无穷大时，它是无穷大的。当它的负幂无穷大时，它是 0。

And they exactly split at p = 1. When p = 1, this number is 0. This exponent is 0, and in fact this expression doesn’t make any sense because the denominator is also 0. But for all of the other values, the denominator makes sense. But what’s going on is that this is infinite when this exponent is infinity to a positive power. And it’s 0 when it’s infinity to a negative power.

所以我要在这里说，你必须回家检查一下。因为这正是我在考试中要问你的。就是这样。这种东西，可能在这里有一个特定的 p 值。当 p < 1 时，这个东西是无限的。

So I’m going to say it here, and you must check this at home. Because this is exactly what I’m going to ask you about on the exam. This is it. This type of thing, maybe with a specific value of p here. When p < 1, this thing is infinite.

另一方面，当 p > 1 时，这个数为 0。所以当 p > 1 时，这个数为 0。它等于 0。所以答案是 1 / p 1。因为这是这个数。减去 1 / p + 1。这是一个有限数。注意，如果 p < 1 的情况下这个数消失了，答案会很奇怪。那么它就是一个负数。

On the other hand, when p > 1, this thing is 0. So when p > 1, this thing is 0. It’s just equal to 0. And so the answer is 1 / p 1. Because that’s this number. Minus the quantity 1 / p + 1. This is a finite number here. Notice that the answer would be weird if this thing went away in the p < 1 case. Then it would be a negative number.

这个问题的答案会很奇怪。事实上情况并非如此。答案是没有意义的。它是无限的。所以让我再把它写下来，在这里。这是对一个特殊情况的测试。这是结论。啊。不，我很抱歉。我想我要把它写在这块板上。

It would be a very strange answer to this question. So, in fact that’s not what happens. What happens is that the answer doesn’t make sense. It’s infinite. So let me just write this down again, under here. This is a test in a particular case. And here’s the conclusion. Ah. No, I’m sorry. I think I was going to write it over on this board here.

因此结论是，如果 p <= 1，则从 1 到无穷大的积分 dx / x^p 发散。如果 p > 1，则收敛。事实上，我们可以实际计算它。它等于 1 / p 1。它甚至有一个漂亮、干净的公式。好吧，现在让我提醒你。所以我没有正确拼写“发散”这个词，对吗？哦不，那是一个 r。我想这是对的。

So the conclusion is that the integral from 1 to infinity dx / x^p diverges if p <= 1. And converges if p > 1. And in fact, we can actually evaluate it. It’s equal to 1 / p 1. It’s got a nice, clean formula even. Alright, now let me remind you. So I didn’t spell the word diverges right, did I? Oh no, that’s an r. I guess that’s right.

如果 p <= 1，则发散。所以实际上，我需要这两个参数，它们位于其上方才能完成此操作。因为当 p = 1 时，第二个参数根本不起作用，因为反导数的公式是错误的。当 p = 1 时，反导数的公式由 ln 函数给出。所以我也必须进行此计算。

Diverges if p <= 1. So really, I needed both of these arguments, which are sitting above it in order to do it. Because the second argument didn’t work at all when p = 1 because the formula for the antiderivative is wrong. The formula for the antiderivative is given by the ln function when p = 1. So I had to do this calculation too.

这是 p > 1 和 p < 1 之间的边界情况。当 p > 1 时，我们得到收敛。我们可以计算积分。当 p < 1 时，我们得到发散，然后我们在那里计算积分。在边界情况下，我们得到了对数。我们也得到了发散。所以它在边缘处失败了。现在，这解决了所有幂的问题。

This is the borderline case, between p > 1 and p < 1. When p > 1, we got convergence. We could calculate the integral. When p < 1, when we got divergence and we calculated the integral over there. And here in the borderline case, we got a logarithm. and we also got divergence. So it failed at the edge. Now, this takes care of all the powers.

现在，人们可以从中推断出许多不同的东西。让我来一一说明。所以这或多或少是你们要做的第二件事。我可能要强调其中的一个方面。我想我们会摆脱这个。但这仍然是我们在这里讨论的问题。这个区域是胖还是瘦。我会提醒你们这一点。所以这是下一个想法。

Now, there are a number of different things that one can deduce from this. And let me carry them out. So this is more or less the second thing that you’ll want to do. And I’m going to emphasize maybe one aspect of it. I guess we’ll get rid of this. But it’s still the issue that we’re discussing here. Is whether this area is fat or thin. I’ll remind you of that. So here’s the next idea.

极限比较。极限比较是当你无法实际计算数字，而还不知道数字是多少时要使用的方法。但你可以将其与你已经了解其收敛性质的事物进行比较。现在，这是陈述。如果函数 f 与函数 g 相似，当 x 趋于无穷大时，函数 f 渐近地与函数 g 相同，我马上会提醒你这是什么意思。

Something called limit comparison. Limit comparison is what you’re going to use when, instead of being able actually to calculate the number, you don’t yet know what the number is. But you can make a comparison to something whose convergence properties you already understand. Now, here’s the statement. If a function, f, is similar to a function, asymptotically the same as a function, g, as x goes to infinity, I’ll remind you what that means in a second.

然后，从某个点开始到 f(x) dx 的无穷远处的积分和另一个积分同时收敛和发散。所以两者，或者，或者抱歉，让我们换个方式试试。或者，两者。要么都收敛，要么都发散。它们的行为方式完全相同。就它们是否无限而言。让我提醒你这个波浪号是什么意思。

Then the integral starting at some point out to infinity of f(x) dx, and the other one, converge and diverge at the same time. So both, either, either sorry, let’s try it the other way. Either, both. Either both converge, or both diverge. They behave exactly the same way. In terms of whether they’re infinite or not. And, let me remind you what this tilde means.

这意味着 f(x) / g(x) 趋向于 1。所以如果你有几个这样的函数，那么它们的行为是相同的。这或多或少是显而易见的。这只是因为距离足够远，如果你愿意的话，这适用于较大的 a。我们不关注会发生什么。它只与尾部有关，一段时间后 f(x) 和 g(x) 就可以相互比较了。

This thing means that f( x) / g ( x) tends to 1. So if you have a couple of functions like that, then their behavior is the same. This is more or less obvious. It’s just because far enough out, this is for large a, if you like. We’re not paying any attention to what happens. It just has to do with the tail, and after a while f ( x) and g(x) are comparable to each other.

所以它们的积分是可以相互比较的。我们在这里举几个例子。如果你取从 0 到无穷大的积分 dx / x ^2 + 10 的平方根，那么我认为 x ^2 + 10 的平方根类似于 x ^2 的平方根，也就是 x。所以这个东西会是这样的。所以现在我要在这里为你做一件事。

So their integrals are comparable to each other. So let’s just do a couple of examples here. If you take the integral from 0 to infinity dx / the square root of x ^2 + 10, then I claim that the square root of x^2 + 10 resembles the square root of x ^2, which is just x. So this thing is going to be like. So now I’m going to have to do one thing to you here.

也就是说，我要将其改为 1。无穷大。dx /x 原因是 x = 0 是无关紧要的。与这个问题无关。这个家伙，是其中的一部分，所以我们将忽略从 0 到 1 的积分部分 dx / x ^2 + 10，这无论如何都是有限的。而且不重要。

Which is, I’m going to change this to 1. To infinity. dx /x And the reason is that this x = 0 is extraneous. Doesn’t have anything to do with what’s going on with this problem. This guy here, the piece of it from, so we’re going to ignore the part integral from 0 to 1 dx / square root of x ^2 + 10, which is finite anyway. And unimportant.

然而不幸的是，dx 的积分在 x = 0 处会有奇点。所以我们无法在那里进行比较。无论如何，这个是无穷大的。所以这是发散。使用我以前所知道的。是的。学生：教授：问题是，我们为什么要从 0 切换到 1？所以我稍后会再多说一点。但我先在这里提醒一下。

Whereas, unfortunately, the integral of dx will have a singularity at x = 0. So we can’t make the comparison there. Anyway, this one is infinite. So this is divergence. Using what I knew from before. Yeah. STUDENT: PROFESSOR:. The question is, why did we switch from 0 to 1? So I’m going to say a little bit more about that later. But let me just make it a warning here.

也就是说，这个家伙是无限的，这是因为其他原因。不相关的原因。我们试图做的比较是当 x 趋于无穷大时与尾部进行比较。所以另一种说法是，我应该在这里和这里各放一个 a，并远离 0。所以，假设 a = 1。如果我让它们都为 1，那就没问题了。如果我让它们都为 2，那就没问题了。

Which is that this guy here is infinite for other reasons. Unrelated reasons. The comparison that we are trying to make is with the tail as x goes to infinity. So another way of saying this is that I should stick an a here and an a here and stay away from 0. So, say a = 1. If I make these both 1, that would be OK. If I make them both 2, that would be OK.

如果我把它们都设为 100，那就没问题了。所以现在就让它保留为 100。这是可以接受的。我希望你远离这里的原点。因为那是另一个不好的地方。只讨论尾巴的情况。所以这是尾巴，我在上面也给它起了不同的名字。这是为了强调这一点。这是极限比较。

If I make them both 100, that would be OK. So let’s leave it as 100 right now. And it’s acceptable. I want you to stay away from the origin here. Because that’s another bad point. And just talk about what’s happening with the tail. So this is a tail, and I also had a different name for it up top. Which is emphasizing this. Which is limit comparison.

我们感兴趣的只是图片最后发生的事情。所以，再说一遍，这是当 x 趋于无穷大时的情况。这就是我们谈论的极限，极限行为。我们试图不去关注 x 较小值时发生的情况。因此，为了保持一致，如果我要将其计算到 100，我会忽略前 100 个值发生的情况。无论如何，这个家伙发散了。

It’s only what’s happening at the very end of the picture that we’re interested in. So again, this is as x goes to infinity. That’s the limit we’re talking about, the limiting behavior. And we’re trying not to pay attention to what’s happening for small values of x. So to be consistent, if I’m going to do it up to 100 I’m ignoring what’s happening up to the first 100 values. In any case, this guy diverged.

让我再举一个例子。这个，你可以计算出来。这个，你可以计算出来，对吧？因为它是二次方的平方根，所以有一个三角代换来计算这个。这种极限比较方法的优点是，无论你是否能计算它都没有区别。你仍然可以相当容易地判断它是有限的还是无限的。让我给你举个例子。

And let me give you another example. This one, you could have computed. This one you could have computed, right? Because it’s a square root of quadratic, so there’s a trig substitution that evaluates this one. The advantage of this limit comparison method is, it makes no difference whether you can compute the thing or not. You can still decide whether it’s finite or infinite, fairly easily. So let me give you an example of that.

这里我们还有另一个例子。我们取积分 dx / x^3 + 3 的平方根。为了便于论述，假设从 0 到无穷大。我们先停下来，假设从 10 到无穷大，随便什么。现在这个对你来说是个问题。我保证，你无法计算它。

So here we have another example. We’ll take the integral dx / square root of x^3 + 3. Let’s say, for the sake of argument. From 0 to infinity. Let’s leave off, let’s make it 10 to infinity, whatever. Now this one is problematic for you. You’re not going to be able to evaluate it, I promise.

因此，另一方面，1/x^3 + 3 的平方根类似于 1/x^3 的平方根，即 1/x^3/2。因此，这个东西将类似于这里的积分。它是收敛的。根据我们的规则。所以这些或多或少是主要成分。让我只提一下另一个积分，也就是我们这里的积分。这个积分。

So on the other hand 1 / the square root of x^3 + 3 is similar to 1 / the square root of x ^3, which is 1 / x ^ 3/2. So this thing is going to resemble this integral here. Which is convergent. According to our rule. So those are the, more or less the main ingredients. Let me just mention one other integral, which was the one that we had over here. This one here.

如果你看一下这个积分，我们当然可以计算它，这样我们就知道面积是有限的。但是你实际执行这个操作的方式是，如果你不知道数字，并且想检查这个积分是否有限，那么你可以进行以下比较。这个并不难。首先，你可以把它写成 e^ x ^2 dx 从 0 到无穷大的积分的两倍。

If you look at this integral, of course we can compute it so we know the area is finite. But the way that you would actually carry this out, if you didn’t know the number and you wanted to check that this integral were finite, then you would make the following comparison. This one is not so difficult. First of all, you would write it as twice the integral from 0 to infinity of e^ x ^2 dx.

这是一个新的例子，我们只是检查收敛性。而不是评估。现在，我要在这里做一个比较，而不是极限比较，我实际上只是做一个普通的比较。那是因为这个东西消失得太快了。它是如此有利，以至于我们只能在它上面放一些东西，我们无法在它下面放一些与它完全平衡的东西。

This is a new example here, and we’re just checking for convergence only. Not evaluation. And now, I’m going to make a comparison here, Rather than a limit, comparison I’m actually just going to make an ordinary comparison. That’s because this thing vanishes so fast. It’s so favorable that we can only put something on top of it, we can’t get something underneath it that exactly balances with it.

换句话说，这个摆动与所涉及的函数有相同的增长率。这个东西消失得非常快。这很棒。对于我们来说，对于这个比较来说太好了。所以我要做的是以下比较。e ^ x ^2 < = e ^ x。至少对于 x >= 1。当 x > = 1 时，x ^2 >= x，因此 x ^2 < x。因此 e^ x^2 小于这个。

In other words, this wiggle was something which had the same growth rate as the function involved. This thing just vanishes incredibly fast. It’s great. It’s too good for us, for this comparison. So instead what I’m going to make is the following comparison. e ^ x ^2 < = e ^ x. At least for x >= 1. When x > = 1, then x ^2 >= x, and so x ^2 < x. And so e^ x^2 is less than this.

这就是所涉及的推理。所以我们这里有两个部分。我们有 2，即 e^x^2 从 0 到 1 的积分。这只是一个有限的部分。然后我们有另一部分，我将用这里的 e^x 替换它。2 乘以 1 到无穷大 e^xdx。所以，如果你愿意的话，这就是积分的普通比较。

So this is the reasoning involved. And so what we have here is two pieces. We have 2, the integral from 0 to 1, of e^ x ^2. That’s just a finite part. And then we have this other part, which I’m going to replace with the e ^ x here. 2 times 1 to infinity e ^ x dx. So this is, if you like, this is ordinary comparison of integrals.

这是我们课程开始时就做过的事情。或者更早，当我们处理积分时。也就是说，如果你有一个更大的被积函数，那么积分也会更大。所以我们替换了积分。我们在 0 到 1 上得到了相同的被积函数。我们有一个更大的被积函数，所以这个是更大的被积函数。我们知道这个是有限的。这是一个收敛积分。

It’s something that we did way at the beginning of the class. Or much earlier on, when we were dealing with integrals. Which is that if you have a larger integrand, then the integral gets larger. So we’ve replaced the integral. We’ve got the same integrand on 0 to 1. And we have a larger integrand on, so this one is larger integrand. And this one we know is finite. This one is a convergent integral.

所以整个事情都是收敛的。但是我们当然用一个更大的东西代替了它。所以我们没有从中得到正确的数字。我们只是表明它是收敛的。所以这些是主要成分。正如我所说，一旦事情变得非常非常快地衰落，它就会相对简单。有很多空间可以表明它是收敛的。现在，这里还有最后一项业务，我必须向你们保证。

So the whole business is convergent. But of course we replaced it by a much larger thing. So we’re not getting the right number out of this. We’re just showing that it converges. So these are the main ingredients. As I say, once the thing gets really, really fast decaying, it’s relatively straightforward. There’s lots of room to show that it converges. Now, there’s one last item of business here which I have to promise you.

我向你保证过，这与处理这里的底部部分有关。所以我必须处理当有奇点时会发生什么。这被称为第二类不定积分。这些例子的思路如下。你可能会有类似这样的情况。或者类似这样的情况。这些都是典型的例子。在实际描述会发生什么之前，我只想提一下。

Which I promised you, which had to do with dealing with this bottom piece here. So I have to deal with what happens when there’s a singularity. This is known as an improper integral of the second type. And the idea of these examples is the following. You might have something like this. Something like this. Or something like this. These are typical sorts of examples. And before actually describing what happens, I just want to mention.

首先，这里的关键点是，你可以计算这些东西。代入 0，它就会起作用，你就会得到正确的答案。所以你会确定，你会弄清楚，事实证明，这个会收敛，这个会发散，这个会发散。这就是最终会发生的情况。然而，我想警告你，你可以欺骗自己。

So first of all, the key point here is you can just calculate these things. And plug in 0 and it works and you’ll get the right answer. So you’ll determine, you’ll figure out, that it turns out that this one will converge, this one will diverge, and this one will diverge. That’s what will turn out to happen. However, I want to warn you that you can fool yourself.

让我给你举一个稍微不同的例子。让我们考虑一下这个积分。从 1 到 1 dx / x ^2 的积分。如果你不假思索地进行这个积分，将会发生什么？你会得到反导数，即 x ^ 1，在 1 和 1 处求值。然后你把它代入。你得到了什么？你得到了 1 (1 ^ 1) ，哦哦。( 1) ^ 1)。这个问题中有很多 1。

And so let me give you a slightly different example. Let’s consider this integral here. The integral from 1 to 1 dx / x ^2. If you carry out this integral without thinking, what will happen is, you’ll get the antiderivative, which is x ^ 1, evaluated at 1 and 1. And you plug it in. And what do you get? You get 1 (1 ^ 1) , uh oh. ( 1) ^ 1). There’s a lot of 1’s in this problem.

好的，所以是 1。这个，如果你把它全部算出来，因为有时我记不清符号，但这次我真的很注意。它是 1，我告诉你它就是 1。所以结果是 2。现在，这太荒谬了。这个函数看起来像这样。它是正数，对吧？1 / x ^2 是正数。1 和 1 之间的区域怎么会变成负数呢？

OK, so that’s 1. And this one, if you work it all out, as I sometimes don’t get the signs right, but this time I really paid attention. It’s 1, I’m telling you that’s what it is. So that comes out to be 2. Now, this is ridiculous. This function here looks like this. It’s positive, right? 1 / x ^2 is positive. How exactly is it that the area between 1 and 1 came out to be a negative number?

不可能。这显然有问题。如果你不注意积分的收敛性，你就会经常遇到这种情况。所以这里发生的事情实际上是这里的面积是无限的。我做的这个计算是无意义的。所以它不起作用。这是错的。因为它是发散的。实际上，当你得到虚数时，你会发现有一种方法可以拯救它。

That can’t be. There was clearly something wrong with this. And this is the kind of thing that you’ll get regularly if you don’t pay attention to convergence of integrals. So what’s going on here is actually that this area in here is infinite. And this calculation that I made is nonsense. So it doesn’t work. This is wrong. Because it’s divergent. Actually, when you get to imaginary numbers, it’ll turn out that there’s a way of rescuing it.

但是，当积分被认为是 2 时，它仍然意味着完全不同的东西。所以。我想让你在这里做什么，所以我认为下次我们必须非常简短地完成它。我们将进行这三个计算，你会看到这两个是发散的，而这个是收敛的。我们下次再这样做。

But, still, it means something totally different when that integral is thought to be at 2. So. What I want you to do here, so I think we’ll have to finish this up very briefly next time. We’ll do these three calculations and you’ll see that these two guys are divergent and this one converges. And we’ll do that next time.

Lec 37 | MIT 18.01 单变量微积分，2007 年秋季

Lec 37 | MIT 18.01 Single Variable Calculus, Fall 2007
