15 years ago (Sep 10, 2009) — 50:12 https://youtube.com/watch?v=MK_0QHbUnIA

以下内容根据 Creative Commons 许可提供。您的支持将帮助 MIT OpenCourseWare 继续免费提供高质量的教育资源。要捐款或查看数百门 MIT 课程的其他材料，请访问 MIT OpenCourseWare，网址为 ocw.mit.edu。教授：今天我们继续讨论不定积分。我还有一些关于它们的内容要告诉您。我们上次最后讨论的是不定积分。

The following content is provided under a Creative Commons license. Your support will help MIT OpenCourseWare continue to offer high quality educational resources for free. To make a donation or to view additional materials from hundreds of MIT courses visit MIT OpenCourseWare at ocw.mit.edu. PROFESSOR: Today we are continuing with improper integrals. I still have a little bit more to tell you about them. What we were discussing at the very end of last time was improper integrals.

现在，这些将是第二类不定积分。第二类是指它们在有限位置有奇点。应该是这样的。如果你愿意的话，这是定义。和奇点在无穷大时我们做的一样。所以如果你有 f(x) 从 0 到 1 的积分。

Now and these are going to be improper integrals of the second kind. By second kind I mean that they have a singularity at a finite place. That would be something like this. So here’s the definition if you like. Same sort of thing as we did when the singularity was at infinity. So if you have the integral from 0 to 1 of f(x).

这与极限是一样的，因为 a 从上面趋向于 0，f(x) dx 从 a 到 1 的积分。这里的想法和我们在无穷大时的想法是一样的。让我画一张图。

This is going to be the same thing as the limit, as a goes to 0 from above, the integral from a to 1 of f(x) dx. And the idea here is the same one that we had at infinity. Let me draw a picture of it.

想象一下一个函数，它像这样下降，这里是点 1。我们不知道封闭的面积是无限的还是有限的，所以我们在某个地方 a 处将其切断。我们让 a 从上面变为 0。所以实际上它是 0+。所以我们从右边开始。我们正在计算这个块的面积。

You have, imagine a function which is coming down like this and here’s the point 1. And we don’t know whether the area enclosed is going to be infinite or finite and so we cut it off at some place a. And we let a go to 0 from above. So really it’s 0+. So we’re coming in from the right here. And we’re counting up the area in this chunk.

我们正在观察它在扩展时是趋向无穷大还是趋向于某个有限的极限。对，这就是例子，这就是定义。就像我们对另一种不定积分所做的那样，我们说它是收敛的，所以这是这里的关键词，如果极限是有限的，那么存在，也许我应该说，如果不是，那么它就会发散。我们只讨论基本的例子。

And we’re seeing as it expands whether it goes to infinity or whether it tends to some finite limit. Right, so this is the example and this is the definition. And just as we did for the other kind of improper integral, we say that this converges so that’s the key word here if the limit is finite, exists maybe I should just say and diverges if not. Let’s just take care of the basic examples.

首先，我上次记下了这一点。我们要计算一下。从 0 到 1 的积分除以 x 的平方根。你几乎注意不到它会趋向无穷大。当 x 趋向 0 时，它也会趋向无穷大。但如果你首先计算它，我们总是把它写成幂。对吧？为了得到计算结果。

First of all I wrote this one down last time. We’re going to evaluate this one. The integral from 0 to 1 of 1 over the square root of x. And this just, you almost don’t notice the fact that it goes to infinity. This goes to infinity as x goes to 0. But if you evaluate it first of all we always write this as a power. Right? To get the evaluation.

然后我甚至不会用 a 替换 0。我只是将它保留为 0。这里的不定积分是 x^(1/2) 乘以 2。然后我在 0 和 1 处求值。我得到 2.2 减 0，也就是 2。好的，所以这个是收敛的。它不仅是收敛的，而且我们还可以求值。

And then I’m not even going to replace the 0 by an a. I’m just going to leave it as 0. The antiderivative here is x^(1/2) times 2. And then I evaluate that at 0 and 1. And I get 2.2 minus 0, which is 2. All right so this one is convergent. And not only is it convergent but we can evaluate it.

第二个例子，虽然不是系统的，但确实给出了我们将要思考的主要例子，就是这个，dx / x。这个给出了不定积分作为对数。在 0 和 1 处求值。现在你必须再次在脑海中思考你实际上在取极限。

The second example, being not systematic but really giving you the principal examples that we’ll be thinking about, is this one here, dx / x. And this one gives you the antiderivative as the logarithm. Evaluated at 0 and 1. And now again you have to have this thought process in your mind that you’re really taking the limit.

但这将是 1 的对数减去 0 的对数。实际上是从上方开始的 0 的对数。没有从下方开始的 0 的对数。这是负无穷大。所以它是 0 减去无穷大，也就是正无穷大。所以这个是发散的。好吧，那么一般是什么呢？

But this is going to be the log of 1 minus the log of 0. Really the log of 0 from above. There is no such thing as the log of 0 from below. And this is minus infinity. So it’s 0 minus infinity, which is plus infinity. And so this one diverges. All right so what’s the general.

所以，一般来说，我们只考虑幂，如果你计算 dx / x^p 从 0 到 1 的这个值。你会发现，当 p 小于 1 时，它是 1/(1 p)。当 p >= 1 时，它会发散。这就是最终结果。如果你进行这种积分，这并不难。好吧，现在我只是想试着帮你记住这一点。

So more or less in general, let’s just, for powers anyway, if you work out this thing for dx / x^p from 0 to 1. What you’re going to find is that it’s 1/(1 p) when p is less than 1. And it diverges for p >= 1. Now that’s the final result. If you carry out this integration it’s not difficult. All right so now I just want to try to help you to remember this.

并思考你应该如何思考它。所以我将用其他几种方式来表达。好吧，只是重复我已经说过的话，但要尽量让它渗透并吸收。为了做到这一点，我必须与我之前处理的那种不恰当积分进行对比。

And to think about how you should think about it. So I’m going to say it in a few more ways. All right just repeat what I’ve said already but try to get it to percolate and absorb itself. And in order to do that I have to make the contrast between the kind of improper integral that I was dealing with before.

这不是 x 在这里趋向 0，而是 x 趋向无穷大，即另一边。让我们进行一下对比。首先，如果我看一下我们现在一直关注的角度。我们刚刚考虑过这样的事情。1 除以 x 的 1/2。这比 1/x 小很多。这比 1/x^2 小很多。这将是另一个例子。

Which was not as x goes to 0 here but as x goes to infinity, the other side. Let’s make this contrast. First of all, if I look at the angle that we have been paying attention to right now. We’ve just considered things like this. 1 over x to the 1/2. Which is a lot smaller than 1/x. Which is a lot smaller than say 1/x^2. Which would be another example.

这是当 x 趋向于 0 时。所以这个是最小的。这个是第二小的。而这个非常大。另一方面，它在无穷大处向相反的方向移动。因为 x 趋向于无穷大。好的，所以试着记住这一点。现在我要在这里把坏人围起来。这个是发散的。这个是发散的。这个是发散的。

This is as x goes to 0. So this one’s the smallest one. This one’s the next smallest one. And this one is very large. On the other hand it goes the other way at infinity. As x tends to infinity. All right so try to keep that in mind. And now I’m going to put a little box around the bad guys here. This one is divergent. And this one is divergent. And this one is divergent.

这个是发散的。交叉点是 1/x。当我们比它小的时候，我们得到的东西是收敛的。当我们在另一个尺度上比它更小时，它就会收敛。好吧，这些家伙是发散的。所以它们与发散积分有关。函数本身只是趋向于。好吧，这些趋向于无穷大，这些趋向于 0。所以我不是在谈论函数本身，而是积分。

And this one is divergent. The crossover point is 1/x. When we get smaller than that, we get to things which are convergent. When we get smaller than it on this other scale, it’s convergent. All right so these guys are divergent. So they’re associated with divergent integrals. The functions themselves are just tending towards. well these tend to infinity, and these tend toward 0. So I’m not talking about the functions themselves but the integrals.

现在我想在这里再画一次，但不够小。我想再画一次。所以我要画一张我这里所画的图。但我要把这两幅图结合起来。例如，这是 y = 1/x 的图。好的。那是 y = 1/x。那幅图非常平衡。它的两端是对称的。

Now I want to draw this again here, not small enough. I want to draw this again. And, so I’m just going to draw a picture of what it is that I have here. But I’m going to combine these two pictures. So here’s the picture for example of y = 1/x. All right. That’s y = 1/x. And that picture is very balanced. It’s symmetric on the two ends.

如果我把它切成两半，那么我得到的就是两个半部分。这个半部分的面积是无限的。这对应于从 1 到无穷大的积分，dx / x 是无穷大。而另一部分，也就是我们上次计算的这个，也就是我们刚刚在示例 2 中计算的那个，具有相同的属性。它是无限的。

If I cut it in half then what I get here is two halves. And this one has infinite area. That corresponds to the integral from 1 to infinity, dx / x being infinite. And the other piece, which this one we calculated last time, this is the one that we just calculated over here at Example 2 has the same property. It’s infinite.

事实上，dx / x 从 0 到 1 的积分是无穷大。对，所以两者都有损失。另一方面，如果我以同样的方式绘制它，但它实际上不是相同的 y = 1 除以 x 的平方根。y = 1 / x^(1/2)。如果我在这里将其减半，那么 x^(1/2) 实际上比这个要大。

And that’s the fact that the integral from 0 to 1 of dx / x is infinite. Right, so both, we lose on both ends. On the other hand if I take something like I’m drawing it the same way but it’s really not the same y = 1 over the square root of x. y = 1 / x^(1/2). And if I cut that in half here then the x^(1/2) is actually bigger than this guy.

所以这部分是无限的。而这边的这部分实际上会给我们一个真实的数字。事实上，这个是有限的。我们刚刚检查了这个数字是多少。它实际上恰好有面积 2。这里发生的事情是，如果你将这张图叠加在另一张图上，你会看到它们交叉。这张图位于顶部。

So this piece is infinite. And this part over here actually is going to give us an honest number. In fact this one is finite. And we just checked what the number is. It actually happens to have area 2. And what’s happening here is if you would superimpose this graph on the other graph what you would see is that they cross. And this one sits on top.

所以如果我画这个，让我们在这里使用另一种颜色，比如说橙色。如果这是橙色，如果我把它放在这里的顶部，它会这样。好的，橙色下面仍然是无限的。所以这两个都是无限的。另一方面，橙色下面是无限的，但绿色下面是有限的。这是一个较小的数量。

So if I drew this one in let’s have another color here, orange let’s say. If this were orange if I set it on top here it would go this way. OK and underneath the orange is still infinite. So both of these are infinite. On here on the other hand underneath the orange is infinite but underneath where the green is finite. That’s a smaller quantity.

无穷大比 2 大很多。2 比无穷大小很多。好吧，这反映在这些比较中。现在，如果您愿意，我想用绿色来表示。这个是好的，这个是好的。好吧，让我在这里用这种反转的图像 y = 1/x^2 重复这个想法。如果我将其切成两半，那么好的部分就是这里的这个结尾。这是有限的。

Infinity is a lot bigger than 2.2 is a lot less than infinity. All right so that’s reflected in these comparisons here. Now if you like if I want to do these in green. This guy is good and this guy is good. Well let me just repeat that idea over here in this sort of reversed picture with y = 1/x^2. If I chop that in half then the good part is this end here. This is finite.

而糟糕的是，这里的这一部分更加奇异。它是无限的。好吧，我刚才试图做的是给你一些几何感和一些内在感。这个家伙，它的尾巴在向无穷远处延伸时要低得多。它比 1/x 小得多。这些家伙捕获了无限大的区域。这个只捕获了有限的区域。

And the bad part is this part of here which is way more singular. And it’s infinite. All right so again what I’ve just tried to do is to give you some geometric sense and also some visceral sense. This guy, its tail as it goes out to infinity is much lower. It’s much smaller than 1/x. And these guys trapped an infinite amount of area. This one traps only a finite amount of area.

好吧，现在我只想给出最后一个例子，它将这两种类型的图片结合起来。它实际上与我之前所说的完全相同，但我……哦，必须把这个也删掉。这是另一个例子：如果你在。让我们来看下面的例子。这有点类似于我上次给出的第一个例子。如果你取一个函数 y = 1/(x 3)^2。然后你考虑它的积分。

All right so now I’m just going to give one last example which combines these two types of pictures. It’s really practically the same as what I’ve said before but I. oh have to erase this one too. So here’s another example: if you’re in. So let’s take the following example. This is somewhat related to the first one that I gave last time. If you take a function y = 1/(x 3)^2. And you think about its integral.

让我们考虑从 0 到无穷大的积分，dx / (x 3)^2。假设你面对这个积分。为了理解它的作用，你必须注意两个可能出错的地方。我们将分成两部分。为了便于讨论，我将把它分成这里最多 5 的部分。然后从 5 到无穷大。好的。

So let’s think about the integral from 0 to infinity, dx / (x 3)^2. And suppose you were faced with this integral. In order to understand what it’s doing you have to pay attention to two places where it can go wrong. We’re going to split into two pieces. I’m going say break it up into this one here up to 5, for the sake of argument. And say from 5 to infinity. All right.

这就是两个块。现在我为什么要把它分成这两部分呢？因为这个函数的情况是它在 3 处像这样上升。所以如果我看看这里的两半。我要再次绘制它们，并用我们选择的颜色来说明它们，我猜是红色和绿色。

So these are the two chunks. Now why did I break it up into those two pieces? Because what’s happening with this function is that it’s going up like this at 3. And so if I look at the two halves here. I’m going to draw them again and I’m going to illustrate them with the colors we’ve chosen, which are I guess red and green.

你会发现，这里与这部分相对应的是无穷大。它是无穷大，因为分母中有一个平方。当 x 趋向 3 时，这非常类似于我们将 3 移到 0。非常类似于这里的 1/x^2。但不是在这种情况下。在另一种情况下，它会趋向无穷大。

What you’ll discover is that this one here, which corresponds to this piece here, is infinite. And it’s infinite because there’s a square in the denominator. And as x goes to 3 this is very much like if we shifted the 3 to 0. Very much like this 1/x^2 here. But not in this context. In the other context where it’s going to infinity.

这和上面图片中的一样，无限部分用红色表示。好的。而这部分是有限的。好的。因此，由于我们有一个无限部分加上一个有限部分，结论是这个东西，嗯，这个东西收敛了。而这个东西发散了。但不幸的是，总数发散了。对，因为它里面有一个无穷大。所以这个东西发散了。

This is the same as at the picture directly above with the infinite part in red. All right. And this part here, this part is finite. All right. So since we have an infinite part plus a finite part the conclusion is that this thing, well this guy converges. And this one diverges. But the total unfortunately diverges. Right, because it’s got one infinity in it. So this thing diverges.

上次我们得到一个疯狂的数字时，也发生了这种情况。如果你对它求积分，你会得到一些负数。如果你草草地写下公式。原因是计算实际上是无意义的。所以你必须意识到，如果你在中间遇到一个奇点，不要忽略它。是的。问题。观众：教授：为什么我们说整个事情都发散了？

And that’s what happened last time when we got a crazy number. If you integrated this you would get some negative number. If you wrote down the formulas carelessly. And the reason is that the calculation actually is nonsense. So you’ve gotta be aware, if you encounter a singularity in the middle, not to ignore it. Yeah. Question. AUDIENCE: PROFESSOR: Why do we say that the whole thing diverges?

我们之所以这么说，是因为整个曲线下的面积是无限的。它是这部分加上这部分的总和。所以总数是无限的。 听众： 教授：我们被困住了。这是一个定义不明确的积分。这是一个应该亮起红色闪烁警告标志的积分。因为你不会通过计算得到正确的答案。你永远得不到答案。同样，你也永远得不到答案。

The reason why we say that is the area under the whole curve is infinite. It’s the sum of this piece plus this piece. And so the total is infinite. AUDIENCE: PROFESSOR: We’re stuck. This is an ill defined integral. It’s one where your red flashing warning sign should be on. Because you’re not going to get the right answer by computing it. You’ll never get an answer. Similarly you’ll never get an answer with this.

你会得到答案。好吗？是的，另一个问题。听众：教授：问题是，如果你稍微看一下积分，你将如何决定你应该去哪里？所以我将口头回答这个问题。虽然你知道，但我在这里给出一个小提示。所以你总是必须检查 x 趋向无穷大和 x 趋向负无穷大，如果它们在那里的话。

And you will get an answer with that. OK? Yeah another question. AUDIENCE: PROFESSOR: So the question is, if you have a little glance at an integral, how are you going to decide where you should be heading? So I’m going to answer that orally. Although you know, but I’ll say one little hint here. So you always have to check x going to infinity and x going to minus infinity, if they’re in there.

你还必须检查任何奇点，比如在这种情况下 x 肯定会趋向于 3。你必须注意所有事物无限的地方。然后你要分别关注每一个地方。并决定在那个特定的地方发生了什么。当它是负幂时。所以记住 dx / x 当 x 趋向于 0 时是不好的。而 dx / x^2 是不好的。

And you also have to check any singularity, like x going to 3 for sure in this case. You have to pay attention to all the places where the thing is infinite. And then you want to focus in on each one separately. And decide what’s going on it at that particular place. When it’s a negative power. So remember dx / x as x goes to 0 is bad. And dx / x^2 is bad.

Dx / x^3 很糟糕。它们全都更糟糕。所以任何这种形式的积分都是糟糕的：n = 1,2.3。这些是红框类型。好的。这意味着我们在部分分数中所做的任何积分，只要有根，分母中就有某个因子。如果你跨越奇点，这些都是发散积分。它们中没有一个跨越奇点是有意义的。对吧？

Dx / x^3 is bad. All of them are even worse. So anything of this form is bad: n = 1,2.3. These are the red box kinds. All right. That means that any of the integrals that we did in partial fractions which had a root, which had a factor of something in the denominator. Those are all divergent integrals if you cross the singularly. Not a single one of them makes sense across the singularity. Right?

如果你有平方根之类的东西，那么你可以修复它们。这方面有一些有趣的例子。例如反正弦函数等等。如果你有一个不适当的积分，这其实没问题。好的。这是我能做的最好的了。这显然是你积累的经验。好的。现在我要继续讲下去了，这差不多是我们最后一个话题了。是的，但还不完全是。

If you have square roots and things like that then you can repair things like that. And there’s some interesting examples of that. Such as with the arcsine function and so forth. Where you have an improper integral which is really OK. All right. So that’s the best I can do. It’s obviously something you get experience with. All right. Now I’m going to move on and this is more or less our last topic. Yay, but not quite.

好吧，我应该说这是我们倒数第二个主题。因为我们还有一堂课。好的。我们的下一个主题是级数。今天我们将以一种具体的方式进行讨论。然后明天我们将讨论所谓的幂级数。让我来告诉你们级数。记住，我们讨论的是无穷大，并且要处理无穷大。所以我们讨论的不是任何旧级数。我们讨论的是无穷级数。

Well, so I should say it’s our penultimate topic. Right because we have one more lecture. All right. So that our next topic is series. Now we’ll do it in a sort of a concrete way today. And then we’ll do what are known as power series tomorrow. So let me tell you about series. Remember we’re talking about infinity and dealing with infinity. So we’re not just talking about any old series. We’re talking about infinite series.

有一种无穷级数可能是最重要的、最有用的级数。那就是几何级数，但我将首先在一个特定的情况下具体介绍它。如果我画出这个和的图。理论上，它会无限延伸。你可以很容易地看到它在数轴上的位置，只需在数轴上标出正在发生的事情。

There is one infinite series which is probably, which is without question the most important and useful series. And that’s the geometric series but I’m going to introduce it concretely first in a particular case. If I draw a picture of this sum. Which in principle goes on forever. You can see that it goes someplace fairly easily by marking out what’s happening on the number line.

第一步将我们从 0 变成 1。然后如果我加上这一半，就得到 3/2。对，所以第一步是 1，第二步是 1/2。现在如果我加上这一四分之一，也就是下一个部分，那么我就会得到一些位置。但我想观察的是，我得到了，我可以从另一个角度来看它。

The first step takes us to 1 from 0. And then if I add this half, I get to 3/2. Right, so the first step was 1 and the second step was 1/2. Now if I add this quarter in, which is the next piece then I get some place here. But what I want to observe is that I got, I can look at it from the other point of view.

我得到，当我移动这个季度时，我已经走到了 2 的一半。我把 2 写成绿色，因为我希望你们认为它是好的那种。对。有数字的那种。而不是红色的那种。我们快到了，而且快到了。所以下一个阶段我们又走到了一半。那是第八个，依此类推。

I got, when I move this quarter I got half way to 2 here. I’m putting 2 in green because I want you to think of it as being the good kind. Right. The kind that has a number. And not one of the red kinds. We’re getting there and we’re almost there. So the next stage we get half way again. That’s the eighth and so forth.

最终我们得到了 2。所以我们写的这个和等于 2。好吧，这有点悖论，因为我们永远得不到 2。这就是芝诺所纠结的悖论。他的结论是，你知道，兔子和野兔。不，兔子和乌龟。对不起，追兔子。不管怎样，兔子追乌龟。他的结论。你知道，我不知道你是否意识到这一点，但他理解这个悖论。

And eventually we get to 2. So this sum we write equals two. All right that’s kind of a paradox because we never get to 2. This is the paradox that Zeno fussed with. And his conclusion, you know, with the rabbit and the hare. No, the rabbit and the tortoise. Sorry hare chasing. anyway, the rabbit chasing the tortoise. His conclusion. you know, I don’t know if you’re aware of this, but he understood this paradox.

他说，你知道它看起来永远也到不了那里，因为它们之间的时间间隔是无限的。你知道乌龟总是落后，总是落后，总是落后，总是落后。因此，乌龟不可能追上去。你知道他的结论是什么吗？时间不存在。这实际上就是他的结论。因为他不理解时间连续的可能性。

And he said you know it doesn’t look like it ever gets there because they’re infinitely many times between the time. you know that the tortoise is always behind, always behind, always behind, always behind. So therefore it’s impossible that the tortoise catches up right. So do you know what his conclusion was? Time does not exist. That was actually literally his conclusion. Because he didn’t understand the possibility of a continuum of time.

因为在乌龟追上之前，发生了无数的事情。这就是原因。我的意思是那是很久以前的事情了，但你知道人们并不相信。他不相信连续体。好吧。无论如何，这是一个小问题。现在，这里的几何级数的一般情况是，我在这里输入一个数字 a 而不是 1/2。所以我们之前得到的是 1 + a + a^2。

Because there were infinitely many things that happened before the tortoise caught up. So that was the reasoning. I mean it’s a long time ago but you know people didn’t. he didn’t believe in continuum. All right. So anyway that’s a small point. Now the general case here of a geometric series is where I put in a number a instead of 1/2 here. So what we had before. So that’s 1 + a + a^2.

虽然不是最通用的，但无论如何我还是会把它写下来。你肯定会想记住极限中的公式是 1/(1 a)。我提醒你，这只有当绝对值严格小于 1 时才有效。换句话说，当 1 严格小于 a 时，它小于 1。这才是我们现在真正要担心的问题。

Isn’t quite the most general but anyway I’ll write this down. And you’re certainly going to want to remember that the formula for this in the limit is 1/(1 a). And I remind you that this only works when the absolute value is strictly less than 1. In other words when 1 is strictly less than a is less than 1. And that’s really the issue that we’re going to want to worry about now.

我们担心的是收敛的概念。当没有收敛时，当有发散时，会出现什么问题。所以在继续之前，让我先说明一下发散。如果我们要理解级数，这就是我们必须避免的。所以这里有一个当 a = 1 时的例子。你得到 1 + 1 + 1 加上等等。这等于 1/(1 1)。也就是 1 除以 0。所以这还不错。

What we’re worrying about is this notion of convergence. And what goes wrong when there isn’t convergence, when there’s a divergence. So let me illustrate the divergences before going on. And this is what we have to avoid if we’re going to understand series. So here’s an example when a = 1. You get 1 + 1 + 1 plus et cetera. And that’s equal to 1/(1 1). Which is 1 over 0. So this is not bad.

这几乎是正确的。对吧？这有点像无穷大等于无穷大。在这里，我们设法得到了几乎正确的结果。但你知道，我们认为这在逻辑上并不完全合理。所以这有点危险。所以我们就说它是发散的。我们去掉了它。所以我们仍然把它写成红色。好吧。坏人在这里。所以这个是发散的。

It’s almost right. Right? It’s sort of infinity equals infinity. At the edge here we managed to get something which is sort of almost right. But you know, it’s, we don’t consider this to be logically to make complete sense. So it’s a little dangerous. And so we just say that it diverges. And we get rid of this. So we’re still putting it in red. All right. The bad guy here. So this one diverges.

同样，如果我取 a 等于 1，我会得到 1 1 + 1 1 + 1。因为公式中的奇数和偶数幂交替符号。它会来回反弹。它永远不会稳定下来。它从 1 开始。然后它下降到 0，然后又回到 1，再下降到 0，再回到 1。它不会稳定下来。它会来回反弹。它会振荡。

Similarly if I take a equals 1, I get 1 1 + 1 1 + 1. Because the odd and the even powers in that formula alternate sign. And this bounces back and forth. It never settles down. It starts at 1. And then it gets down to 0 and then it goes back up to 1, down to 0, back up to 1. It doesn’t settle down. It bounces back and forth. It oscillates.

另一方面，如果你比较右边。右边是什么？它是 1 / (1 ( 1))。也就是 1/2。好的。所以如果你只注意公式，也就是我们在积分时没有过多考虑这一点时所做的，你会得到一个数字，但事实上这是错误的。实际上这是一个有趣的数字。

On the other hand if you compare the right hand side. What’s the right hand side? It’s 1 / (1 ( 1)). Which is 1/2. All right. So if you just paid attention to the formula, which is what we were doing when we integrated without thinking too hard about this, you get a number here but in fact that’s wrong. Actually it’s kind of an interesting number.

它介于两者之间，介于 0 和 1 之间。因此，再次，从某种模糊的意义上讲，这试图成为这个答案。好吧。这还不算太糟，但我们仍要将其放在红色框中。好吧。因为这就是我们所说的发散。所以这两种情况都是发散的。只有当 alpha 时它才真正起作用。

It’s halfway between the two, between 0 and 1. So again there’s some sort of vague sense in which this is trying to be this answer. All right. It’s not so bad but we’re still going to put this in a red box. All right. because this is what we called divergence. So both of these cases are divergent. It only really works when alpha.

当 a 小于 1 时。我要再添加一种情况，只是为了看看数学家们是否对其他情况有点好奇。所以这是 1 + 2 + 2^2 + 2^3 加等等。根据这个公式 1/(1 2)，这应该等于。也就是 1。好吧。现在这个显然是错的，对吧？这个完全是错的。它肯定是发散的。

When a is less than 1. I’m going to add one more case just to see that mathematicians are slightly curious about what goes on in other cases. So this is 1 + 2 + 2^2 + 2^3 plus etc. And that should be equal to according to this formula 1/(1 2). Which is 1. All right. Now this one is clearly wrong, right? This one is totally wrong. It certainly diverges.

左边显然是无限的。右边则完全偏离了。它是 1。另一方面，事实证明数学家们确实有办法理解这些。在数论中有一个奇怪的系统，其中这实际上是正确的。而在这个系统中发生的事情是，你必须抛弃 0 小于 1 的想法。没有负数这样的东西。

The left hand side is obviously infinite. The right hand side is way off. It’s 1. On the other hand it turns out actually that mathematicians have ways of making sense out of these. In number theory there’s a strange system where this is actually true. And what happens in that system is that what you have to throw out is the idea that 0 is less than 1. There is no such thing as negative numbers.

所以这个数是存在的。它是 1 的加法逆元。它具有这个算术性质，但 1 大于 0 的说法没有意义。所以你可以选择，要么它发散，要么你必须抛弃这样的结果。所以这是高等数学中非常奇怪的事情。如果你研究数论，你会发现那里有有趣的东西。好吧。

So this number exists. And it’s the additive inverse of 1. It has this arithmetic property but the statement that this is, that 1 is bigger than 0 does not make sense. So you have your choice, either this diverges or you have to throw out something like this. So that’s a very curious thing in higher mathematics. Which if you get to number theory there’s fun stuff there. All right.

好的，但就我们的目的而言，这些东西都消失了。好的。它们消失了。我们不考虑它们。只有 1 和 1 之间的。好的。现在我想做一些系统化的事情。它或多或少与我现在正在擦除的幂有关。我想告诉你一些边界收敛的级数。

OK but for our purposes these things are all out. All right. They’re gone. We’re not considering them. Only a between 1 and 1. All right. Now I want to do something systematic. And it’s more or less on the lines of the powers that I’m erasing right now. I want to tell you about series which are kind of borderline convergent.

然后，下次我们讨论幂级数时，我们会回到这个非常重要的级数，也是最重要的级数。现在让我们讨论一些级数。呃，一般符号。这将帮助你完成最后一点。这将与我们讨论不定积分时所做的几乎相同。

And then next time when we talk about powers series we’ll come back to this very important series which is the most important one. So now let’s talk about some series. er, general notations. And this will help you with the last bit. This is going to be pretty much the same as what we did for improper integrals.

也就是说，首先我要得到 S_N，它是 a_n，n 等于 0 到大写 N 的总和。这就是我们所说的部分和。然后是完整极限，也就是大写 S，如果你愿意的话。a_n，n 等于 0 到无穷大，就是 N 趋向无穷大时 S_N 的极限。然后我们就有了和之前相同的符号。

Namely, first of all I’m going to have S_N which is the sum of a_n, n equals 0 to capital N. And this is what we’re calling a partial sum. And then the full limit, which is capital S, if you like. a_n, n equals 0 to infinity, is just the limit as N goes to infinity of the S_N’s. And then we have the same kind of notation that we had before.

有两种选择，一种是如果极限存在，那就是绿色的选择。我们说它是收敛的。所以我们说级数是收敛的。另一种情况是极限不存在。我们可以说级数是发散的。问题。听众：教授：问题是我是怎么得出这个结论的？下次我会再讲，但事实上你们当然在高中就见过了。

真正相似的是 1/n 类似于 1/x^2。所以很抱歉我没有。听众：教授：哦，你以为这就是它的定义。这实际上是它们如此接近的原因。那就是黎曼和接近于它。但这并不意味着它们相等。

That’s actually the reason why these things correspond so closely. That is that the Riemann sum is close to this. But that doesn’t mean they’re equal.

黎曼和只有在 delta x 趋于 0 时才有效。我们接下来要建立这两者之间的联系，就是使用黎曼和。我们将使用 delta x = 1 的黎曼和。好吧，这就是两者之间的联系。好吧，完全正确。好吧。

The Riemann sum only works when the delta x goes to 0. The way that we’re going to get a connection between these two, as we will just a second, is with a Riemann sum with. What we’re going to use is a Riemann sum with delta x = 1. All right and then that will be the connection between. All right that’s absolutely right. All right.

因此，为了准确说明您刚刚提出的这个想法，实际上我们将使用它，我们将做同样的事情，但我们将在示例总和 1/n 上进行。因此，这是示例 3，它将是总和 1/n，n 等于 1 到无穷大。我们现在将看到它对应于此处的积分。因此，我们将证明这个东西发散了。

So in order to illustrate exactly this idea that you’ve just come up with, and in fact that we’re going to use, we’ll do the same thing but we’re going to do it on the example sum 1/n. So here’s Example 3 and it’s going to be sum 1/n, n equals 1 to infinity. And what we’re now going to see is that it corresponds to this integral here. And we’re going to show therefore that this thing diverges.

但我们会更仔细地做这件事。我们会详细地做这件事，这样你就能明白这些量之间的对应关系。同样的推理也适用于其他例子。我们开始吧。我要取积分并画出黎曼和的图像。这是 1 级，这是函数 y = 1/x。我要取黎曼和。

But we’re going to do this more carefully. We’re going to do this in some detail so that you see what it is, that the correspondence is between these quantities. And the same sort of reasoning applies to these other examples. So here we go. I’m going to take the integral and draw the picture of the Riemann sum. So here’s the level 1 and here’s the function y = 1/x. And I’m going to take the Riemann sum.

delta x = 1。这将与我拥有的级数紧密相关。但现在我必须决定是要下黎曼和还是上黎曼和。实际上我要检查它们两个，因为它们都很有启发性。首先我们来做上黎曼和。这就是这里的阶梯。所以我们将其称为上黎曼和。让我们检查一下它的级别。

With delta x = 1. And that’s going to be closely connected to the series that I have. But now I have to decide whether I want a lower Riemann sum or an upper Riemann sum. And actually I’m going to check both of them because both of them are illuminating. First we’ll do the upper Riemann’s sum. Now that’s this staircase here. So we’ll call this the upper Riemann’s sum. And let’s check what its levels are.

这不是按比例绘制的。这个级别应该是 1/2。所以如果这是 1，这是 2，那么那个级别应该是 1/2，下一个级别应该是 1/3。这就是黎曼和的工作原理。现在我有以下现象。让我们在第 n 阶段将其切断。这意味着我要去，积分是从 1 到 n，dx / x。

This is not to scale. This level should be 1/2. So if this is 1 and this is 2 and that level was supposed to be 1/2 and this next level should be 1/3. That’s how the Riemann sums are working out. And now I have the following phenomenon. Let’s cut it off at the nth stage. So that means that I’m going, the integral is from 1 to n, dx / x.

而黎曼和比它大。因为面积包围了弯曲区域的面积。这将是第一个盒子的面积，即 1，加上第二个盒子的面积，即 1/2，再加上第三个盒子的面积，即 1/3。一直到最后一个，但最后一个从 N 1 开始。所以它有 1/(N 1)。这里没有 N 个盒子。

And the Riemann sum is something that’s bigger than it. Because the areas are enclosing the area of the curved region. And that’s going to be the area of the first box which is 1, plus the area of the second box which is 1/2, plus the area of the third box which is 1/3. All the way up the last one, but the last one starts at N 1. So it has 1/(N 1). There are not N boxes here.

只有 N 1 个盒子。因为 1 和 N 之间的距离是 N 1。对，所以这是 N 1 个项。但是，如果我使用部分和的符号。即 1 + 1/2 一直加到 1/(n 1.1 + 1/n。换句话说，我去到第 N 个，这是我通常会做的。那么我这里的这个和肯定小于 S_N。因为那里还有一个项。

There are only N 1 boxes. Because the distance between 1 and N is N 1. Right so this is N 1 terms. However, if I use the notation for partial sum. Which is 1 + 1/2 plus all the way up to 1/(n 1.1 + 1/n. In other words I go out to the Nth one which is what I would ordinarily do. Then this sum that I have here certainly is less than S_N. Because there’s one more term there.

所以这里我有一个积分，它位于这个和 S_N 之下。现在这将使我们能够最终证明。所以我要重写它，最终证明和是发散的。为什么会这样？因为这里的这个项我们可以计算。这是在 1 和 n 处求出的 log x。 

And so here I have an integral which is underneath this sum S_N. Now this is going to allow us to prove conclusively that the. So I’m just going to rewrite this, prove conclusively that the sum diverges. Why is that? Because this term here we can calculate. This is log x evaluated at 1 and n. 

这与 log N 减 0 相同。好吧，数量 log N log 1 等于 0。所以我们得到的是 log N 小于 S_N。好吧，很明显这会趋向无穷大。当 N 趋向无穷大时，这个东西也会趋向无穷大。所以我们完成了。好吧，我们已经展示了发散。

Which is the same thing as log N minus 0. All right, the quantity log N log 1 which is 0. And so what we have here is that log N is less than S_N. All right and clearly this goes to infinity right. As N goes to infinity this thing goes to infinity. So we’re done. All right we’ve shown divergence.

现在我要使用下黎曼和的方法是确认我们已经正确捕获了速率。也就是说，我不仅有一个这样的下限，而且还有一个非常相似的上限。所以如果我使用上黎曼。哦，抱歉，再次使用下黎曼和，delta x = 1。然后我得到从 1 到 n 的 dx / x 的积分大于。

Now the way I’m going to use the lower Riemann’s sum is to recognize that we’ve captured the rate appropriately. That is not only do I have a lower bound like this but I have an upper bound which is very similar. So if I use the upper Riemann. oh sorry, lower Riemann sum again with delta x = 1. Then I have that the integral from 1 to n of dx / x is bigger than.

那么如果把它们放在下面，那么项是什么呢？如果我把它们放在下面，那么第一个项就少了。也就是说，盒子的高度是一半。它将是这个下部。所以我少了第一个项。所以它将是 1/2 + 1/3 加。好的，它会继续下去。但现在最后一个不是 1/(N 1)，而是 1 除以 N。

Well what are the terms going to be if fit them underneath? If I fit them underneath I’m missing the first term. That is the box is going to be half height. It’s going to be this lower piece. So I’m missing this first term. So it’ll be a 1/2 + 1/3 plus. All right, it will keep on going. But now the last one instead of being 1/(N 1), it’s going to be 1 over N.

这又是 N 1 项的总和。这是下黎曼和。现在我们可以认识到，这恰好等于。好吧，我把它放在这里。这恰好等于 S_N 减 1，减去第一项。所以我们错过了第一项，但我们得到了其余的项。所以如果我把它放到另一边，记住这是 log N。好的。

This is again a total of the N 1 terms. This is the lower Riemann sum. And now we can recognize that this is exactly equal to. well so I’ll put it over here. this is exactly equal to S_N minus 1, minus the first term. So we missed the first term but we got all the rest of them. So if I put this to the other side remember this is log N. All right.

如果我把它放到另一边，我就得到了这个边界的另一边。如果我把它反转，S_N 小于 log N + 1。所以我把它困在了另一边。这里我有下限。所以我要把它们结合起来。总而言之，我这里有这个对应关系。它是 log N 的大小被困在两者之间。

If I put this to the other side I have the other side of this bound. I have that S S_N is less than, if I reverse it, log N + 1. And so I’ve trapped it on the other side. And here I have the lower bound. So I’m going to combine those together. So all told I have this correspondence here. It is the size of log N is trapped between the.

抱歉，S_N 的大小相对难以计算和准确理解，介于 log N 和 log N + 1 之间。是的，问题。听众：教授：这一步是你关心的。所以这一步是一个几何论证，与这一步类似。好吧，这是同一类型的论证。

Sorry, the size of S_N, which is relatively hard to calculate and understand exactly, is trapped between log N and log N + 1. Yeah question. AUDIENCE: PROFESSOR: This step here is the step that you’re concerned about. So this step is a geometric argument which is analogous to this step. All right it’s the same type of argument.

在这种情况下，矩形位于顶部，因此右侧表示的面积小于此侧表示的面积。除了矩形位于下方外，情况相同。因此矩形面积之和小于曲线下方的面积。好的。所以我现在捕获了这个量。

And in this case it’s that the rectangles are on top and so the area represented on the right hand side is less than the area represented on this side. And this is the same type of thing except that the rectangles are underneath. So the sum of the areas of the rectangles is less than the area under the curve. All right. So I’ve now trapped this quantity.

现在我要陈述这种一般结果。这就是所谓的积分比较。这是一般情况下的双箭头对应，对于非常一般的情况来说。实际上，它适用的情况甚至更多。但这是一个很好的例子，很方便。现在这被称为积分比较。它带有假设，但它遵循我刚才给出的相同论证。

And I’m now going to state the sort of general results. So here’s what’s known as integral comparison. It’s this double arrow correspondence in the general case, for a very general case. There are actually even more cases where it works. But this is a good case and convenient. Now this is called integral comparison. And it comes with hypotheses but it follows the same argument that I just gave.

如果 f(x) 递减且为正，则和 f(n)，n 等于 1 到无穷大，减去 f(x) dx 从 1 到无穷大的积分小于 f(1)。这基本上就是我们所展示的。我们展示了 S_N 和 log N 之间的差异最多为 1。好的。现在如果它们都是。并且和和积分一起收敛或发散。也就是说它们要么都收敛，要么都发散。

If f(x) is decreasing and it’s positive, then the sum f(n), n equals 1 to infinity, minus the integral from 1 to infinity of f(x) dx is less than f(1). That’s basically what we showed. We showed that the difference between S_N and log N was at most 1. All right. Now if both of them are. And the sum and the integral converge or diverge together. That is they either both converge or both diverge.

这是我们喜欢的测试类型，因为这样我们就可以把这里的收敛问题转换为另一边的收敛问题。现在我提醒你，计算这些数字非常困难。而这些数字更容易计算。我们的目标是将事情简化为更简单的事情。在这种情况下，求和，无限求和比无限积分难得多。好吧，这就是积分比较。

This is the type of test that we like because then we can just convert the question of convergence over here to this question of convergence over on the other side. Now I remind you that it’s incredibly hard to calculate these numbers. Whereas these numbers are easier to calculate. Our goal is to reduce things to simpler things. And in this case sums, infinite sums are much harder than infinite integrals. All right so that’s the integral comparison.

现在我还有最后一点需要告诉你们的关于比较的内容。这非常类似于我们对积分所做的。这就是所谓的极限比较。极限比较表示以下内容：如果 f(n) 与 g(n) 相似，回想一下，这意味着当 n 趋向无穷大时，f(n) / g(n) 趋向于 1，并且我们处于正值情况。所以我们就说 g(n) 是正值。然后。

And now I have one last bit on comparisons that I need to tell you about. And this is very much like what we did with integrals. Which is a so called limit comparison. The limit comparison says the following: if f(n) is similar to g(n) recall that means f(n) / g(n) tends to 1 as n goes to infinity and we’re in the positive case. So let’s just say g(n) is positive. Then.

那甚至都不是。那么，求和 f(n)，求和 g(n) 或者两者。与上面相同，要么两者收敛，要么两者发散。好吧。这只是说，如果它们在尾部表现相同，这才是我们真正关心的，那么它们就有类似的行为，类似的收敛特性。让我给你举几个例子。这里有一个例子：如果你把 1 除以 n^2 + 1，平方根。

That doesn’t even, well. then sum f(n), sum g(n) either both. same thing as above, either both converge or both diverge. All right. This is just saying that if they behave the same way in the tail, which is all we really care about, then they have similar behavior, similar convergence properties. And let me give you a couple examples. So here’s one example: if you take the sum 1 over n^2 + 1, square root.

这将被更简单的公式取代。这是这里的主要术语。它是 1 除以 n^2 的平方根，我们将其识别为和 1/n，它是发散的。所以这个人是红人之一。在红队。现在我们有另一个例子。

This is going to be replaced by something simpler. Which is the main term here. Which is 1 over square root of n^2, which we recognize as sum 1/n, which diverges. So this guy is one of the red guys. On the red team. Now we have another example.

也就是说，假设 n 的平方根，我不知道，五次方减 n^2。现在，如果你有一个分母为负的数，你必须注意分母是否有意义。它不是 0。所以我们要小心，从 n = 2 开始。在这种情况下，第一项，我不喜欢 1/0 作为我的级数的项。

Which is let’s say the square root of n, I don’t know, to the fifth minus n^2. Now if you have something where it’s negative in the denominator you kind of do have to watch out that denominator makes sense. It isn’t 0. So we’re going to be careful and start this at n = 2. In which case, the first term, I don’t like 1/0 as a term in my series.

所以我会稍微小心一点。正如我所说，我在这里有点懒。例如，我可以从 0 开始。好的。所以这是图片。现在我只需用它的主要项替换它，即 1 除以 n^5，平方根。它是总和 1/n^(5/2)，它会收敛。好的。幂大于 1.1 是这些东西的除法器，它只是错过了。这个收敛了。

So I’m just going to be a little careful about how. as I said I was kind of lazy here. I could have started this one at 0 for instance. All right. So here’s the picture. Now this I just replace by its main term which is 1 over n^5, square root. Which is sum 1/n^(5/2), which converges. All right. The power is bigger than 1.1 is the divider for these things and it just misses. This one converges.

好吧，这些就是这些收敛过程的典型使用方式。好吧。我还有一件事要告诉你。这是下次的广告。我这里有一个演示，我会拿来。但你下次会看到这个。所以这是一个问题，你需要在晚上思考，但不要问朋友，你必须自己思考。这就是问题所在。

All right so these are the typical ways in which these convergence processes are used. All right. So I have one more thing for you. Which is an advertisement for next time. And I have this demo here which I will grab. But you will see this next time. So here’s a question for you to think about overnight but don’t ask friends, you have to think about it yourself. So here’s the problem.

这是我孩子离开家时我得到的一些积木。无论如何，四年后你也会遇到这种情况。现在这些是积木。那么，这是我们下次要处理的问题。我要把它建起来，也许我会把它放在这边，因为我想有一些空间可以往这边走。我想把它们堆起来，这样……哦，没用。

Here are some blocks which I acquired when my kids left home. Anyway yeah that’ll happen to you too in about four years. So now here you are, these are blocks. So now here’s the question that we’re going to deal with next time. I’m going to build it, maybe I’ll put it over here because I want to have some room to head this way. I want to stack them up so that. oh didn’t work.

按照以下方式将它们堆叠起来。我希望顶部的完全位于底部的右侧。问题是我能做到吗？我能做到吗？我能建立它吗？让我们看看。我似乎错过了什么。但无论如何，我要做的是尝试构建它，我们将看看下次我们能走多远。

Going to stack them up in the following way. I want to do it so that the top one is completely to the right of the bottom one. That’s the question can I do that? Can I get. Can I build this up? So let’s see here. I just seem to be missing. But anyway what I’m going to do is I’m going to try to build this and we’re going to see how far we can get with this next time.

Lec 38 | MIT 18.01 单变量微积分，2007 年秋季

Lec 38 | MIT 18.01 Single Variable Calculus, Fall 2007

15 年前 (2009 年 9 月 10 日) — 47:31 https://youtube.com/watch?v=wOHrNt9ScYs

15 years ago (Sep 10, 2009) — 47:31 https://youtube.com/watch?v=wOHrNt9ScYs

简介

Intro

以下内容根据 Creative Commons 许可提供。您的支持将帮助 MIT OpenCourseWare 继续免费提供高质量的教育资源。要捐款或查看数百门 MIT 课程的其他材料，请访问 MIT OpenCourseWare，网址为 ocw.mit.edu。

The following content is provided under a Creative Commons license. Your support will help MIT OpenCourseWare continue to offer high quality educational resources for free. To make a donation or to view additional materials for hundreds of MIT courses, visit MIT OpenCourseWare at ocw.mit.edu.

问题

Question

教授：上次我们结束了一个与玩积木有关的问题。这应该能让我们内心深处感受到与系列有关的东西。

PROFESSOR: Last time we left off with a question having to do with playing with blocks. And this is supposed to give us a visceral feel for something anyway, having to do with series.

问题是我是否可以堆叠这些积木，建立一个堆栈，以便。我要在这里尝试一下。我已经失去平衡了，明白吗。问题是我是否可以构建它，以便。让我们画一张图，以便第一个块是这样的。下一个块是这样的。也许下一个块是这样的。请注意，这个块没有可见的支撑方式。

And the question was whether I could stack these blocks, build up a stack so that. I’m going to try here. I’m already off balance here, see. The question is can I build this so that the. let’s draw a picture of it, so that the first block is like this. The next block is like this. And maybe the next block is like this. And notice there is no visible means of support for this block.

它完全位于第一块砖的左边。问题是，它会倒塌吗？或者至少，或者更准确地说，我们最终会问，你知道，我们能走多远？现在，在你回答这个问题之前，有人声称这是一个自然的、物理的问题，它涉及一些重要的答案。不管答案是你能做到还是不能。

It’s completely to the left of the first block. And the question is, will this fall down? Or at least, or more precisely, eventually we’ll ask, you know, how far can we go? Now before you answer this question, the claim is that this is a kind of a natural, physical question, which involves some important answer. No matter whether the answer is you can do it or you can’t.

所以这是一道很好的数学题，无论答案是什么，当你找到答案时，你都会得到一些有趣的东西。因为有两种可能性。要么我们向左走的距离有一个极限，在这种情况下这是一个非常有趣的数字，要么没有限制。你可以走任意远。这也很有趣，也很好奇。

So this is a good kind of math question where no matter what the answer is, when you figure out the answer, you’re going to get something interesting out of it. Because they’re two possibilities. Either there is a limit to how far to the left we can go in which case that’s a very interesting number or else there is no limit. You can go arbitrarily far. And that’s also interesting and curious.

这就是收敛和发散之间的区别，也是我们到目前为止讨论的有关系列的问题。所以我的第一个问题是，你认为我能做到这样吗？这样这个东西就不会倒塌。嗯，你看我这里有大约八个区块。所以你现在可以投票了。有多少人赞成，我可以成功地用三个以上的区块做这种事情。

And that’s the difference between convergence and divergence, the thing that we were talking about up to now concerning series. So my first question is, do you think that I can get it so that this thing doesn’t fall down with. well you see I have about eight blocks here or so. So you can vote now. How many in favor that I can succeed in doing this sort of thing with maybe more than three blocks.

有多少人赞成？好吧，有人投了两次票。这很好。我喜欢这样。反对呢？所以这真的接近平局。好吧。但我认为反对的人数略多一些。我不知道。你们这些坐在后面的人也许能看出来。无论如何，票数相当接近。好吧。所以现在我要走了。因为这是现实生活中的事情，我会尝试去做。好吗？好吗。

How many in favor? All right somebody is voting twice. That’s good. I like that. How about opposed? So that was really close to a tie. All right. But I think the there was slightly more opposed. I don’t know. You guys who are in the back maybe could tell. Anyway it was pretty close. All right. So now I’m going. because this is a real life thing, I’m going to try to do it. All right? All right.

现在我要告诉你诀窍是什么。诀窍就是倒着来。大多数人玩积木时，都会决定从下往上搭。对吧？但我们要从上往下搭，从上往下。这样我们就能在每个阶段都做到最好。

So now I’m going to tell you what the trick is. The trick is to do it backwards. When most people are playing with blocks, they decide to build it from the bottom up. Right? But we’re going to build it from the top down, from the top down. And that’s going to make it possible for us to do the optimal thing at each stage.

所以当我从上往下建造它时，我能做的最好的事情就是，它会掉下来。我需要把它放在一半。这是我能做的最好的事情。所以我要把最上面的那个建成那样。我要把它尽可能地放在左边。然后我要把下一个放在尽可能左边的地方。

So when I build it from the top down, the best I can do is well, it’ll fall off. I need to have it you know, halfway across. That’s the best I can do. So the top one I’m going to build like that. I’m going to take it as far to the left as I can. And then I’m going to put the next one down as far to the left as I can.

然后下一个尽可能靠左。那个有点太远了。然后我要尽可能靠左做下一个。然后我要做下一个，好吧，让我们先把它排成尽可能靠左的样子。好吗？然后下一个尽可能靠左。好的。

And then the next one as far to the left as I can. That was a little too far. And then I’m going to do the next one as far to the left as I can. And then I’m going to do the next one well let’s line it up first as far to the left as I can. OK? And then the next one as far to the left as I can. All right.

现在，你们这些站在这条线上的人可以看到，好吧，我成功了。好吧，这已经超出了极限。好吗？所以这是可以做到的。好的。好的。所以现在我们知道我们可以走得更远，我们可以让它溢出。所以现在的问题是，我能走多远？好的。你认为我能到这里吗？我能走到这里的尽头吗？

Now those of you who are in this line can see, all right, I succeeded. All right, that’s over the edge. All right? So it can be done. All right. All right. So now we know that we can get farther than you know, we can make it overflow. So the question now is, how far can I get? OK. Do you think I can get to here? Can I get to the end over here?

那么有多少人认为我能走到这里？有多少人认为我能走到这里？嗯，你知道，记住，我要用到的不只是我手头的这一个积木。我没有，对吧？显然我在想，其实我家里还有一些积木。但是，好吧。我们不会这么做。但无论如何，你认为我能走到这里吗？有多少人说可以？

So how many people think I can get this far over to here? How many people think I can get this far? Well you know, remember, I’m going to have to use more than just this one more block that I’ve got. I don’t, right? Obviously I’m thinking, actually I do have some more blocks at home. But, OK. We’re not going to. But anyway, do you think I can get over to here? How many people say yes?

有多少人说不？说不的人比说是的人多。好吧。所以也许停止点是介于两者之间的某个神秘数字。好吗？好吧。现在我们要进行算术运算。我们要弄清楚这个问题会发生什么。好吗？让我们开始吧。

And how many people say no? More people said no then yes. All right. So maybe the stopping place is some mysterious number in between here. All right? Well OK. So now we’re going to do the arithmetic. And we’re going to figure out what happens with this problem. OK? So let’s do it.

解决方案

Solution

好的，现在我们再来谈谈这个想法，我们将从顶部，顶部块开始。

All right, so now again the idea is, the idea is we’re going to start with the top, the top block.

我们将该块称为 1 号。然后，如果愿意的话，最右边的块可以放在其下方，正好是中间。好吧，这是我能做的最好的工作。现在，为了让我的单位更容易计算，我决定将块的长度称为 2。好吗？

We’ll call that block number one. And then the farthest, if you like, to the right that you can put a block underneath it, is exactly halfway. All right, well, that’s the best job I can do. Now in order to make my units work out easily, I’m going to decide to call the length of the block 2. All right?

这意味着如果我从位置 0 开始，那么我所在的第一个位置应该是中间位置。也就是 1。好的，所以这个过程的第一步是向右移动 1。或者，如果你愿意，如果我要向上移动，也就是你在现实生活中实际上必须做的，那么就是向左移动 1。好的，现在是下一个。

And that means if I start at location 0, then the first place where I am is supposed to be halfway. And that will be 1. OK so the first step in the process is 1 more to the right. Or if you like, if I were building up which is what you would actually have to do in real life it would be 1 to the left. OK now the next one.

现在，这就是你开始计算的方法。下一个方法基于物理原理。也就是说，我能把下一个木块放在下面的最远距离就是这两个木块的重心，也就是这里的正中间。也就是说，这个木块的四分之一和那个木块的四分之一相互平衡。对吧？所以我只能做到这个程度了。

Now here is the way that you start figuring out the arithmetic. The next one is based on a physical principle. Which is that the farthest I can stick this next block underneath is what’s called the center of mass of these two, which is exactly halfway here. That is, there’s a quarter of this guy, and a quarter of that guy balancing each other. Right? So that’s as far as I can go.

如果我走得更远，它就会倒下。所以这是我能做到的绝对最远。所以下一个方块将在这里。2 的四分之一是 1/2。所以这里是 3/2。好的，所以我们去了 1。我们去了这里的 3/2。然后我最终会继续这样做。好的，所以我们要弄清楚这个堆栈会发生什么。问题？

If I go farther than that, it’ll fall over. So that’s the absolute farthest I can do. So the next block is going to be over here. And a quarter of 2 is 1/2. So this is 3/2 here. All right so we went to 1. We went to 3/2 here. And then I’m going to keep on going with this eventually. All right so we’re going to figure out what happens with this stack. Question?

听众：你怎么知道这是最佳的优化方法？ 教授：问题是我怎么知道这是最佳的优化方法？我无法回答这个问题。但我可以告诉你，如果我从顶部开始像这样，然后下一个像这样，那么这是最佳方法。对，因为我在每个阶段都尽最大努力。

AUDIENCE: How do you know that this is the best way to optimize? PROFESSOR:. The question is how do I know that this is the best way to optimize? I can’t answer that question. But I can tell you that it’s the best way if I start with a top like this, and the next one like this. Right, because I’m doing the farthest possible at each stage.

这在计算机科学中其实有个名字，叫做贪婪算法。我试图在每个阶段都做到最好。从底部开始的贪婪算法是一种非常糟糕的策略。因为当你这样做时，你会以这种方式堆叠它，它几乎会倒塌。然后下次你什么也做不了。所以从底部开始的贪婪算法很糟糕。

That actually has a name in computer science, that’s called the greedy algorithm. I’m trying to do the best possible at each stage. The greedy algorithm starting from the bottom is an extremely bad strategy. Because when you do that, you stack it this way, and it almost falls over. And then the next time you can’t do anything. So the greedy algorithm is terrible from the bottom.

这是从顶部开始的贪婪算法，结果比从底部开始的贪婪算法好得多。但我当然不会讨论是否还有其他非常聪明的策略，让我可以左右摇摆并使其上升。我不会回答这个问题。好吗？事实证明这是你能做的最好的事情。但这还不清楚。

This is the greedy algorithm starting from the top, and it turns out to do much better then the greedy algorithm starting from the bottom. But of course I’m not addressing whether there might not be some other incredibly clever strategy where I wiggle around and make it go up. I’m not addressing that question. All right? It turns out this is the best you can do. But that’s not clear.

好了，现在我们有了这个东西。现在我必须弄清楚算术模式是什么，这样我才能弄清楚我用这些形状做了什么。

All right so now, here we have this thing. And now I have to figure out what the arithmetic pattern is, so that I can figure out what I was doing with those shapes.

思想实验

Thought Experiment

让我们来做个思维实验。好吗？现在我想为你想象的思维实验是，你有一堆积木，这是前 N 个积木。好吗？

So let’s figure out a thought experiment here. All right? Now the thought experiment I want to imagine for you is, you’ve got a stack of a bunch of blocks, and this is the first N blocks. All right?

现在我们要在它下面放一个。我们要找出这 N 个块的重心，我将其称为 C sub N。好的。这就是我要放置下一个块的地方。我会在这里用不同的颜色来表示。这是新的。下一个块。下一个块是第 (N+1) 个块。

And now we’re going to put one underneath it. And what we’re going to figure out is the center of mass of those N blocks, which I’m going to call C sub N. OK. And that’s the place where I’m going to put this very next block. I’ll put it in a different color here. Here’s the new. the next block over. And the next block over is the (N+1)st block.

现在我想让你思考一下这里发生了什么。如果前 N 个块的重心是这个数字，这个新的块，它的长度是 2。它的重心比我们之前的重心向右移动 1 个。换句话说，我在这个 N 个块的配置中添加了一个块，这个块被移动了。

And now I want you to think about what’s going on here. If the center of mass of the first N blocks is this number, this new one, it’s of length 2. And its center of mass is 1 further to the right than the center of mass that we had before. So in other words, I’ve added to this configuration of N blocks one more block, which is shifted.

其重心不与这个重心对齐，而是实际上更靠右。所以这是这个新块的新重心。

Whose center mass is not lined up with the center of mass of this, but actually over farther to the right. All right so the new center of mass of this new block.

这是我想要观察的额外信息，即这个物体的质心位于 C_N + 1。它比 C_N + 1 大 1 个单位，因为总长度是 2。因此，根据我的单位，中间就是 C_N + 1。现在，这将使我能够找出新的质心。

And this is the extra piece of information that I want to observe, is that this thing has a center of mass at C_N + 1. It’s 1 unit over because this total length is 2. So right in the middle there is 1 over, according to my units. All right now this is going to make it possible for me to figure out what the new center of mass is.

所以 C_(N+1) 是 N+1 个块的质心。现在这实际上只是水平变量，对吧？我没有跟踪质心。实际上这个东西很难建造，因为质心也在上升。它越来越高。但我只跟踪它的左右特征。所以这是它的 x 坐标。好的，现在这就是想法。

So C_(N+1) is the center of mass of N+1 blocks. Now this is really only in the horizontal variable, right? I’m not keeping track of the center of mass. Actually this thing is hard to build because the center of mass is also rising. It’s getting higher and higher. But I’m only keeping track of its left right characteristic. So this is the x coordinate of it. All right so now here’s the idea.

我将白色方块（N 个）与粉色方块（底部的那个）组合在一起。白色方块有 N 个，粉色方块有 1 个。因此，为了得到整体的重心，我必须对两者取加权平均值。

I’m combining the white ones, the N blocks, with the pink one, which is the one on the bottom. And there are N of the white ones. And there’s 1 of the pink one. And so in order to get the center of mass of the whole, I have to take the weighted average of the two.

这是 N*C_N 加上粉色块重心的 1 倍，也就是 C_N + 1。然后我必须除以 N + 1（如果它是 N + 1 块的加权平均值）。这将为我提供第 (N+1) 阶段配置的新重心。现在我只需进行算术运算并找出它是什么。

That’s N*C_N plus 1 times the center of mass of the pink one, which is C_N + 1. And then I have to divide if it’s the weighted average of the total of N + 1 blocks by N + 1. This is going to give me the new center of mass of my configuration at the (N+1)st stage. And now I can just do the arithmetic and figure out what this is.

两个 C_N 合并。我得到 (N+1)C_N + 1，除以 N+1。如果我将这两个值合并并进行抵消，就会得到这个递归公式，C_(N+1) 等于 C_N 加。还有一点额外的东西。这两个抵消。这给了我 C_N。但是我还有 1/(N+1)。好吧，这就是我通过添加一个块可以在重心处获得的增益。

And the two C_Ns combine. I get (N+1)C_N + 1, divided by N+1. And if I combine these two things and do the cancellation, that gives me this recurrence formula, C_(N+1) is equal to C_N plus. There’s a little extra. These two cancel. That gives me the C_N. But then I also have 1/(N+1). Well that’s how much gain I can get in the center of mass by adding one more block.

这就是我可以移动的距离，这取决于我们如何思考，向左或向右，取决于我们构建它们的方向。好的，现在我要计算公式了。首先是 C_1，它是第一个块的中心。我把它的左端放在 0 处；第一个块的中心在 1 处。这意味着 C_1 是 1。好吗？根据这个公式，C_2 是 C_2。

That’s how much I can shift things over, depending on how we’re thinking of things, to the left or the right, depending on which direction we’re building them. All right, so now I’m going to work out the formulas. First of all C_1, that was the center of the first block. I put its left end at 0; the center of the first block is at 1. That means that C_1 is 1. OK? C_2 according to this formula.

实际上我已经算出来了，我们来检查一下。C_2 是 C_1 + 1/2。好的，这就是 N = 1 的情况。所以这是 1 + 1/2。这就是我们已经做的。这是 3/2 的数字。现在下一个是 C_2 + 1/3。这又是公式。结果是 1 + 1/2 + 1/3。现在您可以看到模式是什么。C_N。

And actually I’ve worked it out, we’ll check it in a. C_2 is C_1 + 1/2. All right, so that’s the case N = 1. So this is 1 + 1/2. That’s what we already did. That’s the 3/2 number. Now the next one is C_2 + 1/3. That’s the formula again. And so that comes out to be 1 + 1/2 + 1/3. And now you can see what the pattern is. C_N.

如果您继续往下算，C_N 将是 1 + 1/2 + 1/3 + 1/4，加上 1/N。所以现在我希望您再次投票。您认为我可以吗？现在我们有了公式，您认为我可以到这里吗？有多少人认为我可以到这里？有多少人认为我不能到这里？仍然有很多人认为我不能到这里。

If you just keep on going here, C_N is going to be 1 + 1/2 + 1/3 + 1/4. plus 1/N. So now I would like you to vote again. Do you think I can. Now that we have the formula, do you think I can get over to here? How many people think I can get over to here? How many people think I can’t get over to here? There’s still a lot of people who do.

所以它仍然几乎是 50/50。这太神奇了。好吧，我们几分钟后再讨论这个问题。现在让我告诉你发生了什么。这个 C_N 当然与我们上次所说的 S_N 相同。请记住，我们实际上估计了这个家伙的大小。这与所谓的谐波级数有关。

So it’s still almost 50/50. That’s amazing. Well so we’ll address that in a few minutes. So now let me tell you what’s going on. This C_N of course, is the same as what we called last time S_N. And remember that we actually estimated the size of this guy. This is related to what’s called the harmonic series.

我们证明了 log N 小于 S_N，小于 S_N + 1。好吗？现在我要请大家注意红色部分，这是这个估计值的差异部分，暂时就是这个。只是说这个东西在增长。

And what we showed was that log N is less than S_N, which is less than S_N + 1. All right? Now I’m going to call your attention to the red part, which is the divergence part of this estimate, which is this one for the time being, all right. Just saying that this thing is growing.

这句话的意思是，当 N 趋向无穷大时，log N 也趋向无穷大，所以这意味着 S_N 趋向无穷大，因为这里的不等式。它大于 log N。所以如果 N 足够大，我们就可以得到我们想要的结果。好吗？所以我可以到这里。至少你们中的一半，至少是投票的人。我不知道。

And what this is saying is that as N goes to infinity, log N goes to infinity, So that means that S_N goes to infinity, because of this inequality here. It’s bigger than log N. And so if N is big enough, we can get as far as we like. All right? So I can get to here. And at least half of you, at least the ones who voted, that was. I don’t know.

我们这里有法定人数，但我不确定。我们双方肯定都没有多数。无论如何，这件事确实会无限延续。所以原则上，如果我有足够的区块，我就可以把它带到这儿。好的，这就是在这种情况下分歧的含义。另一方面，我想和你讨论一下。

We have a quorum here, but I’m not sure. We certainly didn’t have a majority on either side. Anyway this thing does go to infinity. So in principle, if I had enough blocks, I could get it over to here. All right, and that’s the meaning of divergence in this case. On the other hand, I want to discuss with you.

我之所以使用这个例子，是想和大家讨论一下这里的另一个不等式是怎么回事，以及它的意义。也就是说，我们需要很多数字 N，很多块，才能达到一定的水平。换句话说，我不能只用八个或九个块来做到这一点。

And the reason why I use this example, is I want to discuss with you also what’s going on with this other inequality here, and what its significance is. Which is that it’s going to take us a lot of numbers N, a lot of blocks, to get up to a certain level. In other words, I can’t do it with just eight blocks or nine blocks.

为了到达这里，我必须使用其中的很多。所以让我们看看有多少。所以我仔细计算了一下。让我们看看我得到了什么。所以为了穿过实验台，好吧。这段距离，我已经秘密完成了。但实际上我甚至没有足够的东西可以给你们看。但是，嗯，1、2.3、4.5、6 和 1/2。我想这些就足够了。所以是 6.5。

In order to get over here, I’d have to use quite a few of them. So let’s just see how many it is. So I worked this out carefully. And let’s see what I got. So to get across the lab tables, all right. This distance here, I already did this secretly. But I don’t actually even have enough of these to show you. But, well 1,2.3,4.5,6, and 1/2. I guess that’s enough. So it’s 6 and a half.

所以有 13 个这样的积木，就是两张实验桌。好的。所以有 13 个积木，相当于 26 个单位。好的，这就是我需要的距离。第一个已经是 2 了。所以实际上是 26 减 2，也就是 24。这就是我需要的。好的。所以粗略地说，我需要 log N 等于 24，才能到达那么远。

So it’s two lab tables is 13 of these blocks. All right. So there are 13 blocks, which is equal to 26 units. OK, that’s how far to get across I need. And the first one is already 2. So it’s really 26 minus 2, which is 24. Which that’s what I need. OK. So I need log N to be equal to 24, roughly speaking, in order to get that far.

让我们看看它有多大。好吧。我想我算出来了。让我们看看。这意味着 N 等于 e^24。如果你意识到这些块高 3 厘米。好的，让我们看看这里需要多少块。这有点多。让我们看看，它是 3 厘米乘以 e^24，大约是 8*10^8 米。好的。这是到月球距离的两倍。

So let’s just see how big that is. All right. I think I worked this out. So let’s see. That means that N is equal to e^24. and if you realize that these blocks are 3 centimeters high. OK let’s see how many that we would need here. That’s kind of a lot. Let’s see, it’s 3 centimeters times e^24, which is about 8*10^8 meters. OK. And that is twice the distance to the moon.

好吧，也许我可以做到。但我需要很多积木。对吧？所以这在这里不太合理。所以那些投反对票的人实际上只对了一半。事实上，如果你想把它放到那边的墙上，也就是 30 英尺高的墙上，高度大约是可观测宇宙的直径。这有点长。

So OK, so I could do it maybe. But I would need a lot of blocks. Right? So that’s not very plausible here, all right. So those of you who voted against this were actually sort of half right. And in fact, if you wanted to get it to the wall over there, which is over 30 feet, the height would be about the diameter of the observable universe. That’s kind of a long way.

关于这个形状，我还想指出一点。那就是，如果你向左或向右倾斜，如果你把头像这样，当然你必须侧身才能看到它，这条曲线就是对数曲线的形状。

There’s one other thing that I wanted to point out to you about this shape here. Which is that if you lean to the left, right, if you put your head like this of course you have to be on your side to look at it this curve is the shape of a logarithmic curve.

换句话说，如果你把垂直线看作 x 轴，水平线是垂直线，是向上的方向，那么这个东西的增长速度非常非常非常慢。如果你把 x 轴一直送到月球上，图表仍然没有传到实验室桌子上。它只到达了一半。如果你沿着这条路走到月球的两倍距离，它最终就到达了那里。

So in other words, if you think of the vertical as the x axis, and the horizontal that way is the vertical, is the up direction, then this thing is growing very, very, very, very slowly. If you send the x axis all the way up to the moon, the graph still hasn’t gotten across the lab tables here. It’s only partway there. If you go twice the distance to the moon up that way, it’s gotten finally to that end.

好吧，这就是对数增长的速度。它增长得非常非常慢。如果你从另一个角度看，如果你倒立，你会看到一条指数曲线。所以你对这些函数的增长特性有所了解。幸运的是，这些函数保护我们免受如果世界上没有指数级的小尾巴就会发生的各种事情的影响。

All right so that’s how slowly the logarithm grows. It grows very, very slowly. And if you look at it another way, if you stand on your head, you can see an exponential curve. So you get some sense as to the growth properties of these functions. And fortunately these are protecting us from all kinds of stuff that would happen if there weren’t exponentially small tails in the world.

你知道，我可以穿过这堵墙，虽然我并不想这么做。好的，现在这是我们最后一个例子。重要的数字，不幸的是我们没有发现另一个重要的数字。没有一个惊人的数字停止它。我们再次发现的只是无穷大的一些性质。所以无穷大仍然是一个好数字。

Like you know, I could walk through this wall which I wouldn’t like doing. OK, now so this is our last example. And the important number, unfortunately we didn’t discover another important number. There wasn’t an amazing number place where this stopped. All we discovered again is some property of infinity. So infinity is still a nice number.

这里的主题是，无限不仅仅是一种东西，它还有一个特点，那就是增长率。你不应该只认为无限只有一个阶。无限有很多不同的阶。其中一些阶的含义与其他阶不同。好吧，这就是我想要的主题，并且只是有一个无限的直观例子。

And the theme here is just that infinity isn’t just one thing, it has a character which is a rate of growth. And you shouldn’t just think of there being one order of infinity. There are lots of different orders. And some of them have different meaning from others. All right so that’s the theme I wanted to do, and just have a visceral example of infinity.

现在，我们要继续讨论其他一些技巧。这是我们的最后一个主题。我们要讨论的是所谓的幂级数。我们已经看过第一个幂级数了。我要提醒你们这一点。

Now, we’re going to move on now to some other kinds of techniques. And this is going to be our last subject. What we’re going to talk about is what are known as power series. And we’ve already seen our first power series. And I’m going to remind you of that.

几何系列

Geometric Series

这是我们讨论的幂级数。这是我们的第一个级数。

Here we are with power series. Our first series was this one.

我们上次提到，当 x 小于 1 时，它等于 1/(1 x)。这个被称为几何级数。上次你没有使用字母 x，我用的是字母 a。但这被称为几何级数。现在我要向你们展示为什么这是正确的一个原因，为什么这个公式成立。这只是这些东西首次被引入时所做的一种操作。

And we mentioned last time that it was equal to 1/(1 x), for x less than 1. Well this one is known as the geometric series. You didn’t use the letter x last time, I used the letter a. But this is known as the geometric series. Now I’m going to show you one reason why this is true, why the formula holds. And it’s just the kind of manipulation that was done when these things were first introduced.

以下是证明的想法。假设这个和等于某个数字 S，也就是这里所有这些数字的总和。我要做的第一件事就是乘以 x。好的，如果我乘以 x。让我们想想。我在左边和右边都乘以 x。

And here’s the idea of a proof. So suppose that this sum is equal to some number S, which is the sum of all of these numbers here. The first thing that I’m going to do is I’m going to multiply by x. OK, so if I multiply by x. Let’s think about that. I multiply by x on both the left and the right hand side.

然后在左边，我得到 x + x^2 + x^3 加，等等。在右边，我得到 S x。现在我要将两个方程相减，一个减另一个。这会产生非常非常大的抵消。这里的整个尾部都被抵消了。剩下的只有 1。所以当我减去时，我在左边得到 1。

Then on the left side, I get x + x^2 + x^3 plus, and so forth. And on the right side, I get S x. And now I’m going to subtract the two equations, one from the other. And there’s a very, very substantial cancellation. This whole tail here gets canceled off. And the only thing that’s left is the 1. So when I subtract, I get 1 on the left hand side.

在右边，我得到了 SS x。对吧？现在可以将其重写为 S(1 x)。所以我得到了公式。这是 1/(1 x) = S。好吧。现在这个推理有一个缺陷。它不完整。这个推理基本上是正确的。但它是不完整的，因为它要求 S 存在。

And on the right hand side, I get S S x. All right? And now that can be rewritten as S(1 x). And so I’ve got my formula here. This is 1/(1 x) = S. All right. Now this reasoning has one flaw. It’s not complete. And this reasoning is basically correct. But it’s incomplete because it requires that S exists.

例如，在 x = 1 的情况下，它没有任何意义。因此，例如在 x = 1 的情况下，我们有 1 + 1 + 1 加上等等，等于我们所说的 S。然后当我们乘以 1 时，我们得到 1 + 1 + 1 加上。等于 S*1。现在您看到减法给我们无穷大减无穷大等于无穷大减无穷大。

For example, it doesn’t make any sense in the case x = 1. So for example in the case x = 1, we have 1 + 1 + 1 plus et cetera, equals whatever we call S. And then when we multiply through by 1, we get 1 + 1 + 1 plus. equals S*1. And now you see that the subtraction gives us infinity minus infinity is equal to infinity minus infinity.

这就是这个论点的真实情况。所以这完全是胡说八道。我的意思是它没有给我们任何有意义的东西。所以这个论点很棒。它给了我们正确的答案，但并非总是如此。当级数收敛时，它才会给我们答案，也就是正确的答案。这就是我们关心收敛的原因。因为我们希望允许这样的操作。

That’s what’s really going on in the argument in this context. So it’s just nonsense. I mean it doesn’t give us anything meaningful. So this argument, it’s great. And it gives us the right answer, but not always. And the times when it gives us the answer, the correct answer, is when the series is convergent. And that’s why we care about convergence. Because we want manipulations like this to be allowed.

所以好的情况，就是我们上次描述的红色情况。那是坏的情况。但我们想要的是好的情况，即收敛的情况。也就是 x 小于 1 的情况。所以这是收敛的情况。

So the good case, this is the red case that we were describing last time. That’s the bad case. But what we want is the good case, the convergent case. And that is the case when x is less than 1. So this is the convergent case.

动力系列

Power Series

是的。好的，所以它们需要更详细地检查到底发生了什么。但我只想泛泛地谈谈如何识别收敛。

Yep. OK, so they’re much more detailed things to check exactly what’s going on. But I’m going to just say general words about how you recognize convergence.

然后我们就不用担心收敛了，因为它的效果非常好。当幂级数收敛时，总是很容易诊断。好吧，这是一般设置。一般设置是，我们不只是系数总是 1，而是这里的任何数字，点，点，点。我们用求和符号来缩写它。这是总和 a_n x^n，n 等于 0 到无穷大。

And then we’re not going to worry about. so much about convergence, because it works very, very well. And it’s always easy to diagnose when there’s convergence with a power series. All right so here’s the general setup. The general setup is that we have not just the coefficients 1 all the time, but any numbers here, dot, dot, dot. And we abbreviate that with the summation notation. This is the sum a_n x^n, n equals 0 to infinity.

这就是所谓的幂级数。幸运的是，幂级数收敛有一个非常简单的规则。它如下。有一个神奇的数字 R，它取决于这些数字，使得。这个东西被称为收敛半径。在我们遇到的问题中，它是这里的数字 1。这个东西适用于小于 1 的 x。在我们的例子中，它可能是小于 R 的 x。

And that’s what’s known as a power series. Fortunately there is a very simple rule about how power series converge. And it’s the following. There’s a magic number R which depends on these numbers here such that. And this thing is known as a radius of convergence. In the problem that we had, it’s this number 1 here. This thing works for x less than 1. In our case, it’s maybe x less than R.

所以这是某个对称区间，对吧？这相当于减去 R 小于 x 小于 R，因此这里就是收敛点。好的，级数收敛的地方。收敛。然后有一个区域，在这个区域，你给出的每一个计算都会给你无意义的结果。所以 x 大于 R 是 a_n x^n 发散的和。而 x 等于 R 是非常微妙的，边缘的，我们不会用到。

So that’s some symmetric interval, right? That’s the same as minus R less than x less than R, and so where there’s convergence. OK, where the series converges. Converges. And then there’s the region where every computation that you give will give you nonsense. So x greater than R is the sum a_n x^n diverges. And x equals R is very delicate, borderline, and will not be used by us.

好的，我们将停留在收敛半径内。现在，您可以按照以下方式识别这一点。总是发生的是，这些数字以指数级的速度趋向于 0，对于 R 中的 x 来说，速度很快，而对于大于 R 的 x 来说，甚至根本不趋向于 0。好吧，所以这完全显而易见。

OK, we’re going to stick inside the radius of convergence. Now the way you’ll be able to recognize this, is the following. What always happens is that these numbers tend to 0 exponentially fast, fast for x in R, and doesn’t even tend to 0 at all for x greater than R. All right so it’ll be totally obvious.

当你看这个级数时，当 x 小于 R 时，数字会变得越来越小，小于 1。当 x 大于 1 时，数字会越来越大。级数不可能收敛。所以所有幂级数都是这种情况。会有一个截止点。它会是一个特定的数字。

When you look at this series here, what’s happening when x less than R is that the numbers are getting smaller and smaller, less than 1. When x is bigger than 1, the numbers are getting bigger and bigger. There’s no chance that the series converges. So that’s going to be the case with all power series. There’s going to be a cutoff. And it’ll be one particular number.

而低于这个范围，显然你会收敛，并且你可以进行计算。高于这个范围，每个公式都是错误的，没有意义。所以这是非常干净的事情。有一个非常微妙的界限，但我们不会在本课中讨论它。它实际上不用于幂级数的直接研究。听众：你怎么知道数字何时呈指数级下降，而只是。

And below that it’ll be obvious that you have convergence, and you’ll be able to do computations. And above that every formula will be wrong and won’t make sense. So it’s a very clean thing. There is this very subtle borderline, but we’re not going to discuss that in this class. And it’s actually not used in direct studies of power series. AUDIENCE: How can you tell when the numbers are declining exponentially fast, whereas just.

换句话说就是 1/x 教授：好的，那么问题是我为什么能在这里告诉你这个词？为什么我能告诉你它不仅会趋向于 0，而且还会以指数级的速度增长？我告诉你额外的信息。我告诉你它总是以指数级的速度增长。你可以识别它。换句话说，你会看到它。而且它每次都会发生。我只是向你保证它就是这样运作的。

In other words 1/x PROFESSOR: OK so, the question is why was I able to tell you this word here? Why was I able to tell you not only is it going to 0, but it’s going exponentially fast? I’m telling you extra information. I’m telling you it always goes exponentially fast. You can identify it. In other words, you’ll see it. And it will happen every single time. I’m just promising you that it works that way.

而这实际上是出于同样的原因，因为这些是幂。而这里发生的事情是，这些 a_n 接近幂。好吗？

And it’s really for the same reason that it works that way here, that these are powers. And what’s going on over here is there are, it’s close to powers, with these a_n’s. All right?

收敛半径

Radius of Convergence

许多教科书都对收敛半径进行了长篇讨论。但实际上，对于这个目的来说，这没有必要，对吧？是吗？听众：你如何找到 R？教授：问题是你如何找到 R？

There’s a long discussion of radius of convergence in many textbooks. But really it’s not necessary, all right, for this purpose? Yeah? AUDIENCE: How do you find R? PROFESSOR:. The question was how do you find R?

是的，我刚才说过，教科书中对如何找到收敛半径进行了很长的讨论。但我们不会在这里讨论这个问题。这对你来说也没有必要。因为在任何给定的级数中，R 是什么都是显而易见的。它总是 1 或无穷大。它总是适用于所有 x，或者也许它会在某个点停止。

Yes, so I just said, there’s a long discussion for how you find the radius of convergence in textbooks. But we will not be discussing that here. And it won’t be necessary for you. Because it will be obvious in any given series what the R is. It will always either 1 or infinity. It will always work for all x, or maybe it’ll stop at some point.

但是它在哪里结束会非常清楚，就像几何级数一样。好吗？好的，现在我需要给你们提供基本事实，并给你们几个例子。那么我们为什么要看这些级数呢？答案是，我们看这些级数是因为它们所起的作用与这个等式正好相反。也就是说

But it’ll be very clear where it stops, as it is for the geometric series. All right? OK, so now I need to give you the basic facts, and give you a few examples. So why are we looking at these series? Well the answer is we’re looking at these series because the role that they play is exactly the reverse of this equation here. That is

这是我在整个课程中一直试图强调的主题，你可以从两个方向来理解等式。通常，两者都很有趣。你可以想，我不知道这个值是什么。这是一种评估方法。换句话说，右边是左边的公式。或者你可以把左边看作是右边的公式。

And this is a theme which I have tried to emphasize throughout this course you can read equalities in two directions. Both are interesting, typically. You can think, I don’t know what the value of this is. Here’s a way of evaluating. And in other words, the right side is a formula for the left side. Or you can think of the left side as being a formula for the right side.

级数的概念是它们足够灵活，可以表示我们在本课程中遇到的所有函数。这个工具非常类似于十进制扩展，它允许您表示数字，例如 2 的平方根。现在我们将表示所有数字，所有我们知道的函数：e^x、反正切、正弦、余弦。

And the idea of series is that they’re flexible enough to represent all of the functions that we’ve encountered in this course. This is the tool which is very much like the decimal expansion which allows you to represent numbers like the square root of 2. Now we’re going to be representing all the numbers, all the functions that we know: e^x, arctangent, sine, cosine.

所有这些功能都变得非常灵活，完全可用，并且可以直接用于计算。这就是这个工具的用途。它就像十进制扩展一样，让你可以处理所有实数。

All of those functions become completely flexible, and completely available to us, and computationally available to us directly. So that’s what this is a tool for. And it’s just like decimal expansions giving you handle on all real numbers.

收敛规则

Rules for Convergence

它的工作原理如下。收敛幂级数的规则与多项式一样。对幂级数进行的所有操作本质上与多项式相同。

So here’s how it works. The rules for convergent power series are just like polynomials. All of the manipulations that you do for power series are essentially the same as for polynomials.

那么我们用多项式做什么呢？我们把它们相加。我们把它们相乘。我们做代换。对吧？我们用一个函数取另一个函数。我们把它们相除。好的。这些都不是令人惊讶的运算。我们也可以用幂级数来做这些运算。对微积分来说，真正有趣的是最后两个。我们对它们进行微分，然后对它们进行积分。

So what kinds of things do we do with polynomials? We add them. We multiply them together. We do substitutions. Right? We take one function of another function. We divide them. OK. And these are all really not very surprising operations. And we will be able to do them with power series too. The ones that are interesting, really interesting for calculus, are the last two. We differentiate them, and we integrate them.

所有这些运算我们也能对幂级数进行。

And all of these operations we’ll be able to do for power series as well.

亮点

High Points

现在让我们来解释一下这个的要点。主要是微分和积分部分。所以如果我取像这样的级数等等，它的导数公式就像多项式一样。这就是我刚才说的，它就像多项式一样。

So now let’s explain the high points of this. Which is mainly just the differentiation and the integration part. So if I take a series like this and so forth, the formula for its derivative is just like polynomials. That’s what I just said, it’s just like polynomials.

因此常数的导数为 0。该项的导数为 a_1。这个是加 2 a_2 x 2 x。这个是 3 a_3 x^2，等等。这就是公式。同样，如果我积分，那么就会有一个未知常数，我会把它放在最前面而不是最后面。这相当于要被消除的 a_0 项。那个 a_0 项突然变成了 a_0 x。

So the derivative of the constant is 0. The derivative of this term is a_1. This one is plus 2 a_2 x 2 x. This one is 3 a_3 x^2, et cetera. That’s the formula. Similarly if I integrate, well there’s an unknown constant which I’m going to put first rather than last. Which corresponds sort of to the a_0 term which is going to get wiped out. That a_0 term suddenly becomes a_0 x.

下一项的反导数是 a_1 x^2 / 2。下一项是 a_2 x^3 / 3，等等。是的，问题来了？听众：这是级数还是多项式？教授：这是级数还是多项式？好问题。如果它无限延伸，它就是多项式。如果它无限延伸，那么它就是级数。它们看起来几乎一样，多项式和级数。这里有一个小点，小点，小点。

And the anti derivative of this next term is a_1 x^2 / 2. And the next term is a_2 x^3 / 3, and so forth. Yeah, question? AUDIENCE: Is that a series or a polynomial? PROFESSOR: Is this a series or a polynomial? Good question. It’s a polynomial if it ends. If it goes on infinitely far, then it’s a series. They look practically the same, polynomials and series. There’s this little dot, dot, dot here.

这是级数还是多项式？这是相同的规则。如果它在有限的阶段停止，这个就停在有限的阶段。如果它永远继续下去，它就永远继续下去。听众：所以我认为级数加起来是有限的数字。你能在级数中加 x 的项吗？教授：这是一个有趣的问题。所以刚才问的问题是，我认为级数加起来是有限的数字。

Is this a series or a polynomial? It’s the same rule. If it stops at a finite stage, this one stops at a finite stage. If it goes on forever, it goes on forever. AUDIENCE: So I thought that the series add up finite numbers. You can add up terms of x in series? PROFESSOR: So an interesting question. So the question that was just asked is I thought that a series added up finite numbers.

你能把 x 加起来吗？你就是这么说的，对吧？好的，现在请注意，我通过将这个评论开头的字母 a 改为字母 x 来让你明白这一点。这是一个系列。对于 x 的每个单独值，它都是一个数字。

You could add up x? That was what you said, right? OK now notice that I pulled that off on you by changing the letter a to the letter x at the very beginning of this commentary here. This is a series. For each individual value of x, it’s a number.

换句话说，如果我在这里代入 x = 1/2，我要将 1 + 1/2 + 1/4 + 1/8 相加，我会得到一个数字 2。然后我在这里代入一个数字，我会得到一个数字。另一方面，我可以对 x 的每个值都这样做。所以这个解释是它是 x 的一个函数。同样，这也是 x 的一个函数。

So in other words, if I plug in here x = 1/2, I’m going to add 1 + 1/2 + 1/4 + 1/8, and I’ll get a number which is 2. And I’ll plug in a number over here, and I’ll get a number. On the other hand, I can do this for each value of x. So the interpretation of this is that it’s a function of x. And similarly this is a function of x.

当你将可能的值 x 代入 1 和 1 之间时，它就会起作用。所以实际上没有区别，只是我无意中告诉你了。这些是 x 的函数。幂级数的概念是，你将系数放在级数上，然后允许自己灵活地将幂放在这。这正是我们正在做的。

It works when you plug in the possible values x between 1 and 1. So there’s really no distinction there, it’s just I slipped it passed you. These are functions of x. And the notion of a power series is this idea that you put coefficients on a series, but then you allow yourself the flexibility to stick powers here. And that’s exactly what we’re doing.

好吧，还有其他类型的级数，你可以在这里添加其他有趣的函数，比如正弦和余弦。人们研究的级数还有很多。这些是最简单的。所有这些例子对于表示函数都非常有用。但我们只在这里举这个例子。好的，这里有两条规则。

OK there are other kinds of series where you stick other interesting functions in here like sines and cosines. There are lots of other series that people study. And these are the simplest ones. And all those examples are extremely helpful for representing functions. But we’re only going to do this example here. All right, so here are the two rules.

泰勒公式

Taylors Formula

现在这里只剩下一个复杂因素了，我必须先向你们解释，然后再给出一堆例子来说明这种方法的效果非常好。最后我要向你们解释一个叫泰勒公式的东西。泰勒公式就是从我们习惯的函数表示形式到这些系数形式的表示形式。

And now there’s only one other complication here which I have to explain to you before giving you a bunch of examples to show you that this works extremely well. And the last thing that I have to do for you is explain to you something called Taylor’s formula. Taylor’s formula is the way you get from the representations that we’re used to of functions, to a representation in the form of these coefficients.

当我给出函数 e^x 时，它看起来不像多项式。我们必须找出它是哪一个，如果它要落入我们的类别中。这是公式。我马上向你解释它是如何工作的。所以公式是 f(x)。有一个关于 f 的导数的公式。 

When I gave you the function e^x, it didn’t look like a polynomial. And we have to figure out which of these guys it is, if it’s going to fall into our category here. And here’s the formula. I’ll explain to you how it works in a second. So the formula is f(x) turns out. There’s a formula in terms of the derivatives of f. 

也就是说，你微分 n 次，在 0 处求值，除以 n 阶乘，再乘以 x^n。这就是泰勒公式。它告诉你泰勒级数是什么。接下来几分钟，我们一半的工作就是举例说明。但让我先向你解释一下为什么必须这样做。

Namely, you differentiate n times, and you evaluate it at 0, and you divide by n factorial, and multiply by x^n. So here’s Taylor’s formula. This tells you what the Taylor series is. Now about half of our job for the next few minutes is going to be to give examples of this. But let me just explain to you why this has to be.

如果你在这里选出这个数字，这就是 a_​​n，这里的魔法数字 a_n。让我们来说明一下。如果 f(x) 恰好是 a_0 + a_1 x + a_2 x^2 + a_3 x^3 加上点、点、点。现在我微分它，对吧？我得到了 1 + 2 a_2 x + 3 a_3 x。如果我再微分一次，我得到 2 a_2 加 3。对不起，是 3 2 a_3 x 加点、点、点。

If you pick out this number here, this is the a_n, the magic number a_n here. So let’s just illustrate it. If f(x) happens to be a_0 + a_1 x + a_2 x^2 + a_3 x^3 plus dot, dot, dot. And now I differentiate it, right? I get a 1 + 2 a_2 x + 3 a_3 x. If I differentiate it another time, I get 2 a_2 plus 3. sorry, 32a_3 x plus dot, dot, dot.

现在第三次，我得到了 3 2 a_3 加上等等。所以下一个项实际上是伪装的，4 3*2 x a。抱歉，是 a_4 x。如果我跟踪那里的第四项，这就是真正的结果。所以现在这是我的函数。但现在你看，如果我代入 x = 0，我就可以取出第三项。

And now a third time, I get 32 a_3 plus et cetera. So this next term is really in disguise, 43*2 x a. sorry, a_4 x. That’s what really comes down if I kept track of the fourth term there. So now here is my function. But now you see if I plug in x = 0, I can pick off the third term.

F 三重素数 0 等于 3 2 a_3。对，因为当我代入 0 时，其余所有项都为 0。这是公式。所以这里的模式是这样的。实际上，这是 3 2*1 a_3。一般来说，a_n 等于 f，即第 n 个导数，除以 n！

F triple prime of 0 is equal to 32 a_3. Right, because all the rest of those terms, when I plug in 0, are just 0. Here’s the formula. And so the pattern here is this. And what’s really going on here is this is really 32*1 a_3. And in general a_n is equal to f, nth derivative, divided by n!

当然，我提醒你，n！是 n 乘以 n 1 乘以 n 2，一直到 1。现在还有一个更疯狂的惯例，它总是被使用。那就是在 0 处有一个非常奇怪的事情，即 0 的阶乘结果必须设置为 1。好吧，这就是你为了让这个公式成立而做的事情。这就是这个惯例的原因之一。

And of course, n!, I remind you, is n times n 1 times n 2, all the way down to 1. Now there’s one more crazy convention which is always used. Which is that there’s something very strange here down at 0, which is that 0 factorial turns out, has to be set equal to 1. All right, so that’s what you do in order to make this formula work out. And that’s one of the reasons for this convention.

示例

Examples

好的。我的下一个目标是给你们举几个例子。我们来举几个吧。嗯，下次我得让你们看看其中的几个。但我只告诉你们这个，这是迄今为止最令人印象深刻的。如果函数是 f(x) = e^x，那么 e^x 会发生什么情况呢？它的导数也是 e^x。它的二阶导数也是 e^x。

All right. So my next goal is to give you some examples. And let’s do a couple. So here’s, well you know, I’m going to have to let you see a few of them next time. But let me just tell you this one, which is by far the most impressive. So what happens with e^x if the function is f(x) = e^x is that its derivative is also e^x. And its second derivative is also e^x.

一直这样下去。它们都是一样的。这意味着泰勒公式中的这些数字，在分子中。第 n 个导数很容易求值。它只是 e^x。如果我在 x = 0 处求值，我只会得到 1。所以所有这些分子都是 1。所以这里的公式是 n 等于 0 到无穷大的总和，即 1/n！x^n。 

And it just keeps on going that way. They’re all the same. So that means that these numbers in Taylor’s formula, in the numerator. The nth derivative is very easy to evaluate. It’s just e^x. And if I evaluate it at x = 0, I just get 1. So all of those numerators are 1. So the formula here, is the sum n equals 0 to infinity, of 1/n! x^n. 

具体来说，我们现在有一个关于 e 的一次方的诚实公式。也就是 e。如果我代入 x = 1，我得到 1，这是 n = 0 项。加 1，这是 n = 1 项。加 1/2！加 1/3！加 1/4！对吧？所以这是我们关于 e 的第一个诚实公式。而且，这也是计算指数函数的方法。

In particular, we now have an honest formula for e to the first power. Which is just e. Which if I plug it in, x = 1, I get 1, this is the n = 0 term. Plus 1, This is the n = 1 term. Plus 1/2! plus 1/3! plus 1/4! Right? So this is our first honest formula for e. And also, this is how you compute the exponential function.

最后，如果你取一个像 sin x 这样的函数，你会发现我们可以完成我们在课程开始时做的那种奇怪的事情，或者 cos x，我们采用线性和二次近似。现在我们将得到这些函数的完整公式。sin x 等于 xx^3 / 3! + x^5 / 5。x^7 / 7!，等等。

Finally if you take a function like sin x, what you’ll discover is that we can complete the sort of strange business that we did at the beginning of the course or cos x where we took the linear and quadratic approximations. Now we’re going to get complete formulas for these functions. sin x turns out to be equal to x x^3 / 3! + x^5 / 5. x^7 / 7!, et cetera.

而 cos x = 1 x^2 / 2! 相当于这里的 2 加上 x^4 / 4! 减去 x^6 / 6!，再加上等等。现在这些可能感觉很难记住，因为我只是从帽子里抽出来而已。我希望你知道它们。它们实际上是极其相似的公式。这里的指数只是阶乘的集合。正弦是所有具有交替符号的奇数幂。

And cos x = 1 x^2 / 2! that’s the same as this 2 here plus x^4 / 4! minus x^6 / 6!, plus et cetera. Now these may feel like they’re hard to memorize because I’ve just pulled them out of a hat. I do expect you to know them. They’re actually extremely similar formulas. The exponential here just has this collection of factorials. The sine is all the odd powers with alternating signs.

余弦是所有符号交替的偶数幂。所以它们三个都属于同一个家族。所以这实际上会让你更容易记住，而不是更难。就这样，我将把微分练习留到下次再讲。祝大家好运。我会和你们单独谈谈。

And the cosine is all the even powers with alternating signs. So all three of them form part of the same family. So this will actually make it easier for you to remember, rather than harder. And so with that, I’ll leave the practice on differentiation for next time. And good luck, everybody. I’ll talk to you individually.
